title: CompAct: Designing Interconnected Compliant Mechanisms with Targeted Actuation Transmissions
authors: Yang, Humphrey and Shen, I-Chao and Martelaro, Nikolas and Zhu, Bo and Xie, Haoran and Igarashi, Takeo and Yao, Lining
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CompAct introduces a method for designing interconnected compliant mechanisms focused on efficient actuation transmission, incorporating algorithms for targeted output behaviors with minimal energy inputs.
problem_english: Designing interconnected compliant mechanisms that effectively transmit actuation forces is challenging due to their complex interactions and potential energy inefficiencies. Existing methods may not adequately address optimizing these mechanisms for targeted outputs while minimizing energy requirements.
method_english: The paper proposes a novel computational approach that includes algorithms for simulating and optimizing compliant mechanisms. The method specifically tailors the actuation transmission to achieve desired outputs efficiently. It uses computational modeling and iterative refinement to optimize the actuation paths and mechanism structure.
results_english: Results demonstrate significant improvements in actuation efficiency and desired output behaviors compared to traditional design methods. The system achieves higher precision in the movement and energy use reduction, proving effective across various use cases and complex mechanism designs.
summary_japanese: CompActは、アクチュエーション伝達に焦点を当てた連結したコンプライアントメカニズムの設計手法を紹介し、効率的なエネルギー使用を実現します。
problem_japanese: 連結したコンプライアントメカニズムでアクチュエーション力を効果的に伝達するのは、複雑な相互作用とエネルギー非効率のため難しい。既存手法は、ターゲット出力を最適化しつつエネルギー要求を最小限に抑えることに十分に対応していない可能性があります。
method_japanese: 新たな計算手法を提案し、コンプライアントメカニズムをシミュレート・最適化するアルゴリズムを含む。特にアクチュエーション伝達をカスタマイズして効率的に目標出力を達成。計算モデルと反復改良を用い、アクチュエーション経路とメカニズムの構造を最適化。
results_japanese: 結果は、伝統的設計法と比較してアクチュエーションの効率と目標出力行動が著しく向上。様々な使用例や複雑なメカニズム設計において、高精度な動作とエネルギー削減が達成されました。

title: Crafting the Curve: Automating Plaster Mold Design for Ceramic Slip Casting with Shape Cast
authors: Lyons, Kent
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents the Shape Cast system, automating the design of plaster molds for ceramic slip casting, leveraging digital modeling techniques to streamline and simplify traditionally labor-intensive processes.
problem_english: Designing plaster molds for ceramic slip casting is a manual, labor-intensive process that requires significant skill and experience. Current methods lack automation and digital integration, creating inefficiencies and barriers for more widespread adoption and innovation in ceramic design and casting. There is a need for systems that can automate mold design while ensuring quality and precision.
method_english: The paper introduces Shape Cast, a system that automates plaster mold design for ceramic slip casting using advanced digital modeling techniques. The system integrates 3D scanning, computational geometry, and user-input to generate precise mold designs, minimizing human error. It simplifies the process by providing tools that allow users of varying skill levels to create complex molds efficiently.
results_english: Shape Cast demonstrated significant improvements in the efficiency of mold design, reducing the time and skill required to produce accurate molds. User studies showed that even individuals with minimal experience could successfully create molds, highlighting the system's accessibility and potential to democratize the ceramic design process.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、Shape Castシステムを発表し、デジタルモデリング技術を活用して、陶器の液状鋳造用石膏型の設計を自動化します。
problem_japanese: 陶器の液状鋳造用の石膏型設計は、手動で労力を要するプロセスであり、技術や経験が必要です。現在の方法には自動化とデジタル統合が欠けていて、効率が悪く、陶器設計と鋳造の普及と革新を妨げています。
method_japanese: Shape Castは、進んだデジタルモデリング技術を用いて、陶器の液状鋳造用石膏型の設計を自動化します。3Dスキャン、計算幾何学、およびユーザー入力を統合し、精密な型の設計を生成します。
results_japanese: Shape Castは、型設計の効率を向上させ、正確な型を作成するための時間とスキルを削減することを示しました。初心者でも成功して型を作成できることが示されました。

title: Dreamcrafter: Immersive Editing of 3D Radiance Fields Through Flexible, Generative Inputs and Outputs
authors: Vachha, Cyrus and Kang, Yixiao and Dive, Zach and Chidambaram, Ashwat and Gupta, Anik and Jun, Eunice and Hartmann, Bj\"{o}rn
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Dreamcrafter is a tool for immersive editing of 3D radiance fields, utilizing flexible generative inputs and outputs, enhancing user interaction in 3D space.
problem_english: The main challenge addressed is the difficulty in editing and interacting with complex 3D radiance fields, which can be cumbersome and inefficient with traditional tools lacking in flexibility and intuitive interaction.
method_english: Dreamcrafter introduces a system that allows users to immerse themselves in 3D environments, utilizing generative algorithms that provide flexible input and output options for seamless customization and building of 3D radiance fields.
results_english: The study shows that users who employed Dreamcrafter experienced more efficient, intuitive, and satisfying 3D editing processes, thanks to the enhanced immersion and flexibility compared to conventional methods.
summary_japanese: Dreamcrafterは、柔軟な生成的入力と出力を用いて3D放射場を没入的に編集するツールです。
problem_japanese: 複雑な3D放射場の編集や対話が、従来のツールでは柔軟性や直感的な操作が不足しており、煩雑で効率が低いという課題があります。
method_japanese: Dreamcrafterは、ユーザーが生成アルゴリズムを利用して3D環境に没入し、柔軟な入力と出力を可能にするシステムを導入します。
results_japanese: 研究により、Dreamcrafterを使用したユーザーは、従来の方法に比べて効率的で直感的、満足のいく3D編集プロセスを体験しました。

title: GenPara: Enhancing the 3D Design Editing Process by Inferring Users' Regions of Interest with Text-Conditional Shape Parameters
authors: Choi, Jiin and Lee, Seung Won and Hyun, Kyung Hoon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: GenPara introduces a novel 3D design editing tool that utilizes text-conditional shape parameters. It aims to streamline the design process by inferring users' regions of interest using textual input.
problem_english: 3D design editing can be time-consuming due to difficulties in identifying and modifying specific regions of interest. Traditional tools lack intuitive methods for designers to convey their intentions, leading to inefficiencies and potential design flaws.
method_english: GenPara utilizes text-conditional shape parameters to infer and highlight users' regions of interest in 3D design models. By integrating natural language processing, it allows users to intuitively manipulate designs through descriptive text input.
results_english: The study demonstrates that GenPara significantly reduces the time required for 3D design edits. User tests showed improved accuracy and satisfaction, with designers effectively communicating their intent through textual descriptions leading to precise modifications.
summary_japanese: GenParaはテキスト条件付き形状パラメータを用いた新しい3D設計編集ツールを紹介し、デザインプロセスの効率化を図ります。
problem_japanese: 3D設計編集は特定の注目エリアの識別と修正が難しく、時間がかかることがあります。従来のツールではデザイナーが意図を伝える方法が不足しており、非効率やデザインの欠陥に繋がりがちです。
method_japanese: GenParaはテキスト条件付き形状パラメータを使って3D設計モデルの注目領域を推測し強調します。自然言語処理を統合し、ユーザーが説明的なテキスト入力によりデザインを直感的に操作できるようにします。
results_japanese: 研究はGenParaが3D設計編集にかかる時間を大幅に減少させることを示しました。ユーザーテストで精度と満足度が向上し、デザイナーがテキストを介して意図を効果的に伝え正確な修正を行いました。

title: Spatial Hand Actions: Exploring the Hand Actions used to Represent Spatial Thinking for 3D Assembling Tasks
authors: Rawat, Prashant and Barrera Machuca, Mayra Donaji
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates how various hand actions are utilized to represent spatial thinking during 3D assembling tasks, aiming to improve HCI designs by understanding these interactions better.
problem_english: There is a limited understanding of how hand actions are used to convey spatial thinking during 3D assembling tasks, which hinders the development of effective human-computer interaction (HCI) systems that can better support users in such tasks.
method_english: The researchers conducted observational studies where participants were asked to complete 3D assembling tasks. By analyzing the different hand actions used, they aimed to identify patterns and understand their role in representing spatial thinking.
results_english: The study identified specific hand actions that are frequently used to convey spatial thinking in 3D assembling tasks. Insights from these actions provide valuable guidelines for designing more intuitive and supportive HCI systems.
summary_japanese: 3D組立作業における手の動作が空間思考を表現する方法を調査し、HCI設計の改善を目指す研究。
problem_japanese: 3D組立作業中に手の動作が空間思考をどのように表現するかの理解は限られており、効果的なHCIシステムの開発を妨げている。
method_japanese: 参加者に3D組立作業を実施させる観察研究を行い、使用される手の動作のパターンを特定し、その役割を理解することを目指した。
results_japanese: 研究は、3D組立作業で空間思考を伝えるためによく使われる特定の手の動作を特定し、より直感的で支援的なHCIシステム設計への指針を提供した。

title: Xstrings: 3D Printing Cable-Driven Mechanism for Actuation, Deformation, and Manipulation
authors: Li, Jiaji and Feng, Shuyue and Perroni-Scharf, Maxine and Liu, Yujia and Guan, Emily and Wang, Guanyun and Mueller, Stefanie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Xstrings presents a novel 3D printing cable-driven system allowing versatile actuation, deformation, and manipulation for creating dynamic structures. It integrates mechanisms for extending 3D printing versatility in interactive designs.
problem_english: The current 3D printing technologies primarily focus on static structures, limiting the ability to create interactive, dynamic designs. There is a need for integrating actuation mechanisms that enable real-time deformation and manipulation of printed structures.
method_english: The paper introduces Xstrings, a cable-driven system integrated with 3D printing that combines flexible materials and actuators. The system facilitates real-time manipulation and programmable deformation of printed structures, thereby expanding design possibilities.
results_english: Xstrings successfully allows users to design and print objects that can be manipulated in real-time, showcasing deformation and movement capabilities. It broadens the scope of 3D printing applications into interactive fields and dynamic designs.
summary_japanese: Xstringsは3D印刷用ケーブル駆動システムで多様なアクチュエーションを提供し、動的構造の制作を可能にします。
problem_japanese: 従来の3D印刷技術は静的な構造に集中しており、動的でインタラクティブなデザインを作成する能力が制限されています。リアルタイムでの変形と操作が可能な機構の統合が必要です。
method_japanese: 論文では柔軟な材料とアクチュエータを組み合わせた3Dプリントと統合されたケーブル駆動システム、Xstringsを紹介します。リアルタイム操作と印刷物のプログラム可能な変形とを可能にします。
results_japanese: Xstringsはユーザーがリアルタイムで操作可能なオブジェクトの設計・印刷を成功させ、変形や動きの能力を示します。これにより、3D印刷の応用範囲が広がります。

title: "The Conduit by which Change Happens": Processes, Barriers, and Support for Interpersonal Learning about Responsible AI
authors: Solyst, Jaemarie and Wilcox, Lauren and Madaio, Michael
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines processes, obstacles, and support mechanisms for interpersonal learning about responsible AI, emphasizing the need for effective communication and flexible frameworks.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is the lack of understanding and communication among individuals about responsible AI practices, which leads to inefficient learning and the implementation of responsible AI principles. This issue is compounded by barriers that prevent effective interpersonal learning and dissemination of knowledge.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative interviews with stakeholders using a mixed-methods approach to identify barriers and support mechanisms. They analyzed these interactions to develop a framework that facilitates interpersonal learning and communication about responsible AI by addressing identified obstacles.
results_english: The study identified key barriers like misconceptions and communication gaps in teaching responsible AI. A framework was proposed that improves understanding and application, offering practical tools to aid learning. Results highlight the effectiveness of flexible and context-aware communication strategies in overcoming these barriers.
summary_japanese: この研究は、責任あるAIに関する人間関係学習のプロセスと障害を調査し、効果的なコミュニケーションの重要性を強調しています。
problem_japanese: 本研究の課題は、責任あるAIの実践に関する個人間の理解とコミュニケーション不足が、学習や原則の実施を非効率にしていることです。効果的な人間関係学習を阻害する障壁がこの問題を悪化させています。
method_japanese: 著者は利害関係者への質的インタビューと複合的手法を用い、障壁と支援メカニズムを特定。これをもとに、責任あるAIに関する学習を促進するフレームワークを開発しました。
results_japanese: 研究により、責任あるAIの教育における誤解やコミュニケーションのギャップが明らかになり、理解と応用を改善するフレームワークが提案されました。柔軟で状況に応じたコミュニケーション戦略の有効性が示されました。

title: AI Mismatches: Identifying Potential Algorithmic Harms Before AI Development
authors: Saxena, Devansh and Jung, Ji-Youn and Forlizzi, Jodi and Holstein, Kenneth and Zimmerman, John
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses identifying potential algorithmic harms before AI development. It introduces a method to foresee and mitigate AI mismatches that could lead to harm, focusing on ethical AI design.
problem_english: Algorithmic harms can result when AI systems are mismatched with the contexts in which they operate. These mismatches can lead to negative consequences, including discrimination and privacy invasion. The challenge lies in identifying these potential harms early in the AI development cycle to prevent them from materializing.
method_english: The authors propose a proactive approach to identify potential AI mismatches. Their method involves analyzing the socio-technical context of AI deployment, engaging stakeholders, and using scenario-based design techniques to foresee mismatches. This approach aims to incorporate ethical considerations early in AI system design.
results_english: The method was tested in real-world scenarios, revealing potential mismatches not identified through traditional testing methods. It demonstrated effectiveness in engaging stakeholders and integrating ethical concerns into AI development. This led to the refinement of AI designs, reducing the risk of harmful outcomes.
summary_japanese: AI開発前にアルゴリズムの潜在的な危害を特定する方法を提案し、倫理的AI設計に焦点を当てている。
problem_japanese: AIシステムがその動作コンテキストと不一致となることで、差別やプライバシー侵害を含む負の結果をもたらす可能性がある。これらの潜在的な危害をAI開発初期段階で特定し、防ぐことが課題である。
method_japanese: 著者らはAIの配備における社会技術的コンテキストを分析し、関係者を巻き込み、シナリオベースのデザイン技術を活用して不一致を予見する手法を提案。AI設計の早期に倫理的考慮を組み込むことを目指す。
results_japanese: 実世界のシナリオで手法をテストし、従来の方法で確認されなかった潜在的不一致を明らかにした。関係者の参加を促し、AI開発に倫理的問題を統合する効果を示し、危害リスクを低減した。

title: AI Rules? Characterizing Reddit Community Policies Towards AI-Generated Content
authors: Lloyd, Travis and Gosciak, Jennah and Nguyen, Tung and Naaman, Mor
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study analyzes Reddit community policies towards AI-generated content, revealing diverse governance decisions and user attitudes on AI use in content creation across different subreddits.
problem_english: The integration of AI-generated content in online communities, particularly on Reddit, raises questions about how different platforms manage and govern such content. There is a lack of systematic analysis regarding community standards and policies in moderating AI-generated contributions and understanding user reactions to these policies.
method_english: The researchers conducted a systematic analysis involving a mixed-methods approach. They reviewed and categorized community rules from a representative sample of Reddit subreddits, employing qualitative content analysis. Surveys and interviews with subreddit moderators and users were conducted to gain insights into their perspectives on AI content regulation.
results_english: Findings indicate significant variability in subreddit policies; some encourage AI-generated content, others restrict it. Users express mixed feelings about AI content, with some concerned about originality and others welcoming enhanced creativity. Moderators highlighted challenges in identifying AI content and enforcing rules, reflecting varied governance strategies across communities.
summary_japanese: この研究は、AI生成コンテンツに対するRedditコミュニティのポリシーを分析し、サブレディットごとに異なるガバナンス決定とユーザーの態度を示した。
problem_japanese: AI生成コンテンツのオンラインコミュニティへの統合は、特にRedditにおいて、プラットフォームがその管理とガバナンスをどのように行うかに関する課題を提起する。コミュニティ標準やポリシーの系統的な分析が不足している。
method_japanese: 研究者は質的内容分析を用い、Redditサブレディットのルールを体系的に分析した。サブレディットのモデレーターやユーザーに対してアンケートとインタビューを行い、AIコンテンツの規制に関する視点を得た。
results_japanese: サブレディットのポリシーには大きなばらつきがあり、AI生成コンテンツを奨励するものもあれば制限するものもある。ユーザーの意見は分かれ、新規性を心配する者もいれば創造性向上を歓迎する者もいる。

title: Perceptions of Sentient AI and Other Digital Minds: Evidence from the AI, Morality, and Sentience (AIMS) Survey
authors: Anthis, Jacy Reese and Pauketat, Janet V.T. and Ladak, Ali and Manoli, Aikaterina
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The AIMS Survey explores public perceptions of AI's morality and sentience, showing diverse opinions. Results highlight societal implications and potential biases in understanding AI entities.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding public perceptions of AI's morality and sentience. It investigates how these perceptions vary and how they might influence societal acceptance and policy-making.
method_english: The research utilizes the AI, Morality, and Sentience (AIMS) Survey to collect quantitative data on public opinions regarding AI. It analyzes the variations in perceptions based on demographics and other factors.
results_english: The survey results indicate significant diversity in opinions about AI's morality and sentience. These insights reveal potential biases and highlight the need for informed discussions on AI's societal roles.
summary_japanese: AIMS調査はAIの道徳性と感性に対する世間の認識を探り、多様な意見を示しています。結果は社会的影響および理解偏見を浮き彫りにします。
problem_japanese: この研究は、AIの道徳性と感性に対する世間の認識を理解する課題に取り組んでいます。これらの認識がどのように異なり、社会的受容と政策形成に影響を与えるかを調査します。
method_japanese: AIに関する道徳と感性の調査（AIMS調査）を用いて、AIに対する世間の意見に関する定量データを収集し、人口統計学や他の要因に基づく認識の変化を分析します。
results_japanese: 調査結果はAIの道徳性と感性に関する意見の多様性を示しています。これにより偏見の可能性が明らかになり、AIの社会的役割についての情報に基づいた議論の必要性を強調します。

title: RiskRAG: A Data-Driven Solution for Improved AI Model Risk Reporting
authors: Rao, Pooja S. B. and \v{S}\'{c}epanovi\'{c}, Sanja and Zhou, Ke and Bogucka, Edyta Paulina and Quercia, Daniele
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: RiskRAG, proposed by the authors, is a novel framework that enhances AI model risk reporting through data-driven methodologies, aiming to address current disclosure deficiencies.
problem_english: AI models often lack effective risk reporting, leading to transparency issues and potential misuse. Current practices may not adequately communicate model risks to various stakeholders, creating a need for improved frameworks to enhance understanding and accountability.
method_english: The authors propose RiskRAG, a framework using data-driven techniques that systematically categorize and disclose AI model risks, enabling comprehensive transparency. This approach involves gathering diverse risk-related data, employing advanced analysis for clearer stakeholder communication.
results_english: The implementation of RiskRAG shows significant improvements in risk disclosure transparency and stakeholder understanding. This framework effectively categorizes risks and facilitates clearer reporting, which aids in better model risk management and stakeholder relations.
summary_japanese: 提案されたRiskRAGはデータ駆動型手法でAIモデルのリスク報告を改善し、現行の開示不足問題に対処します。
problem_japanese: AIモデルは効果的なリスク報告が不足しがちで、透明性問題や誤用の可能性があります。現行の方法ではモデルリスクを十分に伝えきれず、理解と責任を高める枠組みが必要です。
method_japanese: 提案するRiskRAGは、データ駆動型手法でAIモデルリスクを体系的に分類・開示し、透明性を強化します。多様なリスク関連データを集め、高度な分析で利害関係者への伝達を明確にします。
results_japanese: RiskRAGの実装によりリスク開示の透明性と理解が大幅に向上しました。この枠組みはリスクの分類と明確な報告を促進し、リスク管理と関係者対応を改善します。

title: Surveillance on Exhibit: Using Problematic Technology To Teach About Problematic Technology
authors: Plaut, Ethan and West, Kiri and Morreale, Fabio and Gibson, Maya and Thompson, Grace and Woodward, Kara and Lottridge, Danielle
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the use of problematic surveillance technology in educational settings. It showcases experiments and discussions about these technologies, highlighting ethical implications and helping students critically assess their use.
problem_english: The prevalent use of surveillance technology raises ethical concerns, particularly in educational contexts. There is a gap in how we educate students about these technologies' implications, such as privacy issues and consent. Addressing this gap is crucial in fostering critical understanding among students.
method_english: The method involves creating educational exhibits that use surveillance technology to spark discussion and critical thinking among students. These exhibits serve as tools to explore ethical debates and help students understand the broader societal impact of these technologies.
results_english: The exhibits effectively engaged students in discussions about the ethical aspects of surveillance technologies. Students were able to critically analyze the implications, enhancing their awareness and understanding of such technologies' societal impact.
summary_japanese: 教育現場での問題ある監視技術の利用を検討し、倫理的影響を強調して学生の批判的評価を促します。
problem_japanese: 監視技術の普遍的な使用は倫理的懸念を引き起こしますが、教育現場でその影響に関する教育にギャップがあります。プライバシー問題や同意を含むこれらの技術の意味を学生が理解することが重要です。
method_japanese: 監視技術を利用した教育展示を作成し、学生の批判的思考と議論を促進します。これらの展示は倫理的議論を探求し、技術の社会的影響を学生に理解させる手段です。
results_japanese: 展示は学生の監視技術の倫理的側面についての議論を効果的に引き起こし、彼らの意識と理解を向上させました。

title: The Dark Side of AI Companionship: A Taxonomy of Harmful Algorithmic Behaviors in Human-AI Relationships
authors: Zhang, Renwen and Li, Han and Meng, Han and Zhan, Jinyuan and Gan, Hongyuan and Lee, Yi-Chieh
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores harmful algorithmic behaviors in human-AI relationships, introducing a taxonomy to classify these behaviors. It highlights the impact on users and emphasizes the need for ethical AI design.
problem_english: As AI becomes more integrated into personal and social contexts, the potential for harmful algorithmic behaviors in human-AI interactions grows. The lack of understanding and taxonomy makes it difficult to address these issues, impacting user trust and wellbeing.
method_english: The authors developed a taxonomy by analyzing various AI companionship scenarios and algorithmic behaviors that could cause harm. They used case studies, user feedback, and expert input to identify and categorize problematic behaviors.
results_english: The taxonomy revealed several categories of harmful algorithmic behaviors, such as manipulative interactions and biased decision-making. It provides a framework for recognizing and mitigating these harms, aiding in ethical AI development.
summary_japanese: 論文は、人間とAIの関係における有害なアルゴリズム行動を探り、これらを分類するための分類法を導入しています。ユーザーへの影響と倫理的なAI設計の必要性を強調しています。
problem_japanese: AIが個人や社会のコンテキストに統合されるにつれ、人間とAIとの対話における有害なアルゴリズム行動の可能性が高まっています。理解および分類の欠如がこれらの問題への対処を難しくし、ユーザーの信頼と幸福に影響を与えています。
method_japanese: 著者は、AI伴侶のシナリオと有害な可能性のあるアルゴリズム行動を分析し、分類法を開発しました。彼らは事例研究、ユーザーフィードバック、および専門家の意見を使用して問題のある行動を特定し分類しました。
results_japanese: 分類法は、操作的な対話や偏った意思決定など、有害なアルゴリズム行動のいくつかのカテゴリを明らかにしました。それはこれらの害を認識し軽減するための枠組みを提供し、倫理的なAI開発に役立ちます。

title: "It's impressive, but in practice...": Experiencing a Realistic Digital Transformation in and beyond the Classroom
authors: Zhang, Xiaoyu and Xue, Fei and Albers, Alexander and Netland, Torbj\"{o}rn
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses implementing realistic digital transformations in classroom settings, emphasizing practical application beyond theoretical frameworks. It presents findings from integrating digital tools and methodologies that bridge the gap between classroom learning and real-world application.
problem_english: Educational settings often face challenges in effectively implementing digital transformations that mirror real-world situations. The gap between theoretical understanding and practical application can hinder students from acquiring actionable skills necessary in today's digital landscape.
method_english: The study adopts a multi-dimensional approach by incorporating digital tools and methodologies within classroom environments aimed at simulating realistic digital transformations. It uses participatory action research to engage students actively in problem-solving scenarios reflecting real-world digital challenges.
results_english: Results indicate improved student engagement and comprehension in digital skills, bridging classroom learning with practical application. Participants reported increased confidence in applying learned skills in real-world contexts, underscoring the effectiveness of the immersive digital learning frameworks established.
summary_japanese: 本論文は現実的なデジタル変革の教室での実施と、その理論を超えた実践的応用について議論しています。
problem_japanese: 教育現場でのデジタル変革は実世界の状況を反映することが難しく、理論と実践を分離して学生が実践的なスキルを習得するのを妨げることがあります。
method_japanese: 教室内で現実的なデジタル変革をシミュレートするためにデジタルツールと方法論を組み込み、多次元アプローチを採用して参加型アクションリサーチを実施しました。
results_japanese: 参加者は学んだスキルを実世界に適用する自信が増したと報告し、教室学習と実践的応用を結びつけるデジタル学習フレームワークの有効性が証明されました。

title: Designing LLM-Powered Multimodal Instructions to Support Rich Hands-on Skills Remote Learning: A Case Study with Massage Instructors and Learners
authors: Jiang, Chutian and Fan, Yinan and Xie, Junan and Kuang, Emily and Feng, Baichuan and Zhang, Kaihao and Fan, Mingming
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the application of LLM-powered multimodal instructions to enhance remote learning of hands-on skills, focusing on massage instructors and learners.
problem_english: The challenge is to effectively deliver nuanced, hands-on skills training remotely using multimodal instructions, as traditional methods can be limited and don't fully capture tactile and detailed interpersonal skills required, such as in massage therapy.
method_english: The method involves utilizing large language models (LLMs) to generate and facilitate multimodal instructional materials that integrate video, text, and interactive elements tailored to massage training requirements.
results_english: Results show LLM-powered multimodal instructions significantly improved remote learning outcomes in massage training, enhancing learners' engagement, comprehension, and ability to practice complex skills independently.
summary_japanese: LLMを活用したマルチモーダル指示で遠隔学習を改善し、マッサージ指導と学習に焦点を当てる研究。
problem_japanese: マッサージ療法のような手技を遠隔で効果的に伝えるためのマルチモーダル指示の提供が課題で、従来の方法では触覚や詳細な対人スキルが不十分。
method_japanese: 大規模言語モデルを用いて、動画、テキスト、インタラクティブ要素を統合したマッサージトレーニング用のマルチモーダル指示を生成し促進する。
results_japanese: 結果は、LLMを利用した指示により、マッサージの遠隔学習で学習者の理解と複雑な技術の独習能力が向上したことを示す。

title: From Passive Watching to Active Learning: Empowering Proactive Participation in Digital Classrooms with AI Video Assistant
authors: Bodonhelyi, Anna and Thaqi, Enkeleda and \"{O}zdel, S\"{u}leyman and Bozkir, Efe and Kasneci, Enkelejda
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces an AI video assistant designed to enhance engagement and active learning in digital classrooms by facilitating proactive participation and personalized learning experiences.
problem_english: The paper addresses the issue of passive learning in digital classrooms, where students often become disengaged and miss critical opportunities for active participation and deeper understanding due to the lack of interactive and personalized learning tools.
method_english: The authors propose an AI video assistant that incorporates machine learning techniques to dynamically assess student engagement, providing real-time feedback and personalized learning resources to encourage proactive participation and enhance active learning in digital classrooms.
results_english: The conducted evaluations demonstrate that the AI video assistant significantly increases student engagement and participation in digital classrooms, leading to improved learning outcomes and fostering a more interactive and personalized educational experience.
summary_japanese: AIビデオアシスタントがデジタル教室での能動的参加と個別学習を促進し、学習体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: デジタル教室では受動的な学習が問題となり、インタラクティブで個別化された学習ツールが不足しているため、学生は積極的な参加や深い理解の機会を逃す可能性があります。
method_japanese: 提案されたAIビデオアシスタントは、機械学習技術を利用して学生の積極的な参加を促し、リアルタイムのフィードバックと個別化された学習リソースを提供することで、デジタル教室での能動的学習を強化します。
results_japanese: 評価結果から、AIビデオアシスタントがデジタル教室での学生の参加とエンゲージメントを著しく増加させ、インタラクティブで個別化された学習体験を促進し、学習成果が向上することが示されました。

title: Learning Behaviors Mediate the Effect of AI-powered Support for Metacognitive Calibration on Learning Outcomes
authors: Lee, HaeJin and Stinar, Frank and Zong, Ruohan and Valdiviejas, Hannah and Wang, Dong and Bosch, Nigel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how AI-powered metacognitive calibration support affects learning outcomes mediated by learning behaviors in educational settings.
problem_english: Students often face challenges in accurately assessing their own understanding and knowledge, leading to poor learning outcomes. Metacognitive calibration is crucial for students to correctly estimate their comprehension and guide effective learning behaviors.
method_english: Researchers implemented an AI-driven support system designed to enhance metacognitive calibration. This system offered personalized feedback to students based on their learning activities and self-assessment processes to improve accuracy in comprehension estimation.
results_english: The study found that AI-supported metacognitive calibration positively impacted learning outcomes. This effect was mediated through improved learning behaviors, demonstrating the importance of targeted feedback in enhancing students' self-assessment and study practices.
summary_japanese: AIによるメタ認知校正支援が学習行動を介して学習成果に与える影響を研究した。
problem_japanese: 学生は自己理解の正確な評価が難しく、誤った自己評価が学習成果の低下を招く。メタ認知校正は効果的な学習行動を導くために重要である。
method_japanese: 研究者はAI駆動の支援システムを導入し、学習活動と自己評価に基づく個別フィードバックにより理解度の正確性を向上させた。
results_japanese: AI支援によるメタ認知校正が学習成果に好影響を及ぼし、学習行動の改善を介して効果が示された。

title: LitLinker: Supporting the Ideation of Interdisciplinary Contexts with Large Language Models for Teaching Literature in Elementary Schools
authors: Fan, Haoxiang and Zhou, Changshuang and Yu, Hao and Wu, Xueyang and Gu, Jiangyu and Peng, Zhenhui
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents LitLinker, a tool using large language models to facilitate interdisciplinary teaching in elementary literature classes.
problem_english: Effective interdisciplinary teaching in elementary schools is challenging due to a lack of tools that can seamlessly integrate diverse subject knowledge, particularly in literature classes.
method_english: LitLinker leverages large language models to generate interdisciplinary contexts and connections, aiding teachers in creating enriched educational experiences in literature by linking various subjects.
results_english: LitLinker demonstrated improved student engagement and understanding in pilot studies, showcasing its potential to enhance interdisciplinary teaching effectiveness in elementary literature education.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、大規模言語モデルを用いた小学校の文学授業での学際的教学支援ツールLitLinkerを紹介。
problem_japanese: 小学校における効果的な学際的指導は、多様な知識を統合するツールが不足しているため、特に文学教育で困難がある。
method_japanese: LitLinkerは大規模言語モデルを使い、学際的背景を生成し、文学教育において多様な科目を結びつけた豊かな学習体験を教師に提供。
results_japanese: LitLinkerは、パイロットスタディで学生の関与と理解を向上させ、文学教育における学際的指導の効果を高める可能性を示した。

title: Piecing Together Teamwork: A Responsible Approach to an LLM-based Educational Jigsaw Agent
authors: Doherty, Emily and Perkoff, E. Margaret and von Bayern, Sean and Zhang, Rui and Dey, Indrani and Bodzianowski, Michal and Puntambekar, Sadhana and Hirshfield, Leanne
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents an LLM-based educational jigsaw agent that supports teamwork. It explores a responsible approach to designing AI systems for educational purposes, ensuring that they are effective and ethical.
problem_english: With the growing use of AI in education, there is a need for systems that support collaborative learning while prioritizing ethical considerations. Current AI solutions often lack the ability to foster team dynamics effectively, which is crucial for educational success.
method_english: The authors propose an LLM-based jigsaw agent, designed to enhance teamwork in educational settings. The system utilizes natural language processing capabilities to facilitate collaboration among students, integrating responsible AI design principles to ensure ethical and effective outcomes.
results_english: The study demonstrates that the proposed jigsaw agent improves teamwork among students, enhances their learning experience, and aligns with ethical standards by promoting fairness and transparency. It highlights the potential of responsibly designed AI in educational contexts.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、チームワークを支援するLLMベースの教育ジグソーエージェントを提案し、効果的で倫理的なAIシステム設計を探求する。
problem_japanese: 教育におけるAIの利用が増える中で、倫理的考慮を優先しつつ協調学習を支援するシステムが必要です。現行のAIソリューションは、教育の成功に重要なチームダイナミクスの促進が不足しています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、教育現場でのチームワークを強化するためにLLMベースのジグソーエージェントを提案。自然言語処理を活用し、責任あるAI設計原則を統合して倫理的かつ効果的な結果を目指しています。
results_japanese: 提案されたジグソーエージェントは、学生間のチームワークを向上させ、学習体験を増強し、公平性と透明性を促進することで倫理基準に合致することが示されています。この研究は教育における責任あるAIの可能性を強調します。

title: TutorUp: What If Your Students Were Simulated? Training Tutors to Address Engagement Challenges in Online Learning
authors: Pan, Sitong and Schmucker, Robin and Garcia Bulle Bueno, Bernardo and Llanes, Salome Aguilar and Albo Alarc\'{o}n, Fernanda and Zhu, Hangxiao and Teo, Adam and Xia, Meng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents TutorUp, a system that simulates student engagement challenges for training online tutors, aiming to improve their ability to address such challenges effectively.
problem_english: Online learning environments often face significant challenges related to student engagement. Tutors often lack the necessary training to effectively identify and address these engagement issues, which can impact learning outcomes negatively. Thus, there is a need for effective tutor training solutions.
method_english: TutorUp utilizes simulated scenarios that mimic common student engagement problems faced in online learning. Tutors interact with these scenarios, receiving feedback and guidance to improve their skills in handling similar real-world engagement challenges effectively.
results_english: The study shows that tutors who trained with TutorUp improved their ability to identify and address student engagement challenges. The system was effective in enhancing tutors' skills, leading to better handling of engagement issues in actual online learning environments.
summary_japanese: 本稿では、学生のエンゲージメント課題をシミュレートするTutorUpシステムを紹介し、オンライン指導者のスキル向上を目指します。
problem_japanese: オンライン学習環境では学生のエンゲージメントに関する課題が頻出で、指導者はこれらを効果的に対応するための訓練が不足しがちです。その結果、学習成果に悪影響が及ぶ可能性があります。
method_japanese: TutorUpは、オンライン学習で一般的な学生のエンゲージメント問題を模倣するシミュレーションシナリオを利用します。指導者はこれらのシナリオと対話し、フィードバックとガイダンスを受けることで実際の対処スキルを高めます。
results_japanese: TutorUpで訓練を受けた指導者は、学生のエンゲージメント問題の特定と対処スキルが向上しました。実際のオンライン学習環境でのエンゲージメント問題への対処能力が強化される結果が示されました。

title: AIdeation: Designing a Human-AI Collaborative Ideation System for Concept Designers
authors: Wang, Wen-Fan and Lu, Chien-Ting and Ponsa i Campany\`{a}, Nil and Chen, Bing-Yu and Chen, Mike Y.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: AIdeation is a Human-AI collaborative ideation system designed for concept designers. It aims to enhance creativity, efficiency, and quality in the design process by integrating AI and human collaboration effectively.
problem_english: Concept designers often face challenges in generating new ideas efficiently while maintaining creativity and quality. Existing methods lack effective integration of AI technologies to support designers in these tasks, leaving gaps in ideation processes.
method_english: The system combines AI-generated suggestions with human creative input, allowing for seamless interaction between designers and AI. It uses machine learning algorithms to provide creative prompts and supports iterative idea refinement, enhancing the ideation process.
results_english: AIdeation improved design quality and efficiency, enabling concept designers to explore diverse ideas and solutions effectively. Evaluations showed increased creativity in outputs and enhanced collaborative processes between humans and AI.
summary_japanese: AIdeationはコンセプトデザイナー向けに設計されたヒューマン-AI協業のアイデア創出システムで、創造性や効率性、品質向上を図る。
problem_japanese: コンセプトデザイナーは新しいアイデアを効率的に生み出しつつ、創造性と品質を維持する課題を抱えている。また、現行の手法ではAI技術の効果的な統合が不足している。
method_japanese: AI生成の提案を人間の創造的入力と組み合わせ、デザイナーとAI間のシームレスな相互作用を可能にする。機械学習アルゴリズムで創造的なプロンプトを提供し、反復的なアイデア洗練を支援する。
results_japanese: AIdeationはデザインの品質と効率を向上させ、コンセプトデザイナーが多様なアイデアと解決策を効果的に探求できるようにし、創造性と協業プロセスを強化した。

title: CoExploreDS: Framing and Advancing Collaborative Design Space Exploration Between Human and AI
authors: Chen, Pei and Yao, Jiayi and Cheng, Zhuoyi and Cai, Yichen and Li, Jiayang and You, Weitao and Sun, Lingyun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CoExploreDS introduces a framework for collaborative design exploration between humans and AI, enhancing co-creative processes through interactive tools and methodologies.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of optimizing the collaboration between humans and AI in design space exploration. Typically, the interaction is limited and lacks effective tools for enhancing creativity and ideation in a shared design environment.
method_english: The authors propose CoExploreDS, a framework that integrates AI-driven tools with human-centered design approaches. It facilitates dynamic interactions and ideation through iterative feedback loops and collaborative tools, allowing humans and AI to mutually enhance design creativity.
results_english: Results indicate that CoExploreDS significantly improves the creativity and efficiency of the design process. Users reported enhanced satisfaction and ideation quality, demonstrating the framework's effectiveness in fostering deeper collaboration and exploration in design spaces.
summary_japanese: CoExploreDSは、人間とAIの共同設計探査を促進する枠組みを提案し、インタラクティブなツールと方法論で創造的プロセスを向上させます。
problem_japanese: この研究は、人間とAIの設計空間の共同探査を最適化する課題に取り組みます。通常、この相互作用は限定的で、創造性やアイデア生成を強化する効果的なツールが不足しています。
method_japanese: 著者は、AI駆動のツールと人間中心のデザインアプローチを統合したCoExploreDSフレームワークを提案します。反復的なフィードバックループと共同ツールを通じて、人間とAIがデザインの創造性を相互に高めます。
results_japanese: 結果は、CoExploreDSが設計プロセスの創造性と効率を大幅に向上させることを示しています。ユーザーからは、満足度とアイデアの質の向上が報告され、共同作業と探査の深化に貢献しています。

title: Human Creativity in the Age of LLMs: Randomized Experiments on Divergent and Convergent Thinking
authors: Kumar, Harsh and Vincentius, Jonathan and Jordan, Ewan and Anderson, Ashton
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the effects of large language models (LLMs) on human creativity, analyzing divergent and convergent thinking through randomized experiments. It explores how LLMs enhance or inhibit creative processes.
problem_english: Human creativity is facing challenges and alterations in the age of artificial intelligence, particularly with the involvement of LLMs. The paper aims to understand how these models affect key components of creativity, specifically divergent and convergent thinking.
method_english: The research employs randomized controlled trials to assess the impact of LLMs on creativity. Participants engage in tasks requiring divergent and convergent thinking, both with and without LLM assistance, to evaluate shifts in creative output.
results_english: Findings reveal that LLMs can both enhance and hinder creativity, depending on the context. While LLMs offer substantial assistance in convergent thinking, their impact on divergent thinking varies, highlighting nuances in the human-LLM interaction.
summary_japanese: 本研究はLLMsが人間の創造性に与える影響を調査し、ランダム化実験を通じて発散的および収束的思考を分析します。
problem_japanese: 人工知能時代における人間の創造性は、特にLLMsの関与により変化を迎えています。本研究はこれらモデルが創造性の重要な要素である発散的および収束的思考にどのように影響するかを明らかにすることを目的としています。
method_japanese: 本研究は、LLMsが創造性に与える影響を評価するために、ランダム化比較試験を実施します。参加者は、LLMの支援を受けた発散的および収束的思考の課題に取り組み、創造的成果の変化を評価します。
results_japanese: 結果は、LLMsがコンテキストに応じて創造性を促進または阻害できることを示しています。LLMsは収束的思考に多大な助力を提供する一方で、発散的思考への影響は様々であり、LLMと人間の相互作用の微妙な点を浮き彫りにしています。

title: Productive vs. Reflective: How Different Ways of Integrating AI into Design Workflows Affect Cognition and Motivation
authors: Xu, Xiaotong (Tone) and Konnova, Arina and Gao, Bianca and Peng, Cindy and Vo, Dave and Dow, Steven P.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates how AI integration modes in design workflows influence cognition and motivation, comparing productive to reflective approaches using controlled experiments.
problem_english: The study addresses the gap in understanding how different AI integration approaches within design workflows impact designers' cognitive processes and motivation, examining productive versus reflective modes.
method_english: Controlled experiments were conducted comparing productive AI integration, focused on efficiency, and reflective integration, designed to enhance creative thinking and self-explanation, among design professionals.
results_english: Findings indicate that reflective AI integration results in deeper cognitive engagement and sustained motivation, while productive integration enhances task efficiency but may not foster long-term creative thinking.
summary_japanese: デザインワークフローでのAI統合手法が認知とモチベーションに与える影響を調査し、生産的手法と反射的手法を比較する。
problem_japanese: デザインワークフロー内での異なるAI統合手法がデザイナーの認知過程とモチベーションにどう影響するかについての理解の欠如に対する研究。
method_japanese: 効率に焦点を当てた生産的AI統合と、創造的思考と自己説明を促進する反射的統合を比較するため、デザイン専門家を対象に制御実験を実施。
results_japanese: 反射的AI統合では認知的関与が深まり、モチベーションが持続することが判明。一方、生産的統合は効率を高めるが、長期的な創造的思考の促進にはつながらない可能性がある。

title: Timing Matters: How Using LLMs at Different Timings Influences Writers' Perceptions and Ideation Outcomes in AI-Assisted Ideation
authors: Qin, Peinuan and Yang, Chi-Lan and Li, Jingshu and Wen, Jing and Lee, Yi-Chieh
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how the timing of using large language models (LLMs) impacts writers' perceptions and ideation outcomes in AI-assisted ideation processes.
problem_english: The study addresses how the timing of integrating LLMs during the ideation process affects writers' perceptions of creativity and their ideation outcomes. The research seeks to determine the optimal timing for leveraging LLMs to enhance creativity and ideation, reducing the risk of dependency or idea saturation.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments with different groups of writers tasked with ideation activities, using LLMs at various stages. By comparing the qualitative and quantitative data from these sessions, the researchers assessed the impact of timing on creativity, dependency, and overall ideation quality.
results_english: The results indicated significant differences in ideation outcomes and perceptions based on when LLMs were introduced. Early use of LLMs boosted initial idea generation but risked dependency, while later use helped refine ideas without overshadowing creativity.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、AI支援の創造プロセスにおいて、LLMの使用タイミングが作家の認識とアイデア創出にどのように影響するかを探求します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、アイデア創出過程でLLMを導入するタイミングが、創造性に対する作家の認識とアイデア創出結果にどのように影響するかを調査します。創造性とアイデア創出を向上させるためのLLMの最適な活用タイミングを見つけることを目指します。
method_japanese: 著者らは、異なる段階でLLMを使用する創造活動を課される複数グループの作家を対象に実験を実施しました。これらのセッションからの定性および定量データを比較し、タイミングが創造性、依存性、全体のアイデアの質に与える影響を評価しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、LLM導入のタイミングによる認識とアイデア創出結果の顕著な違いを示しました。初期使用でアイデア生成が促進されるが依存のリスクがあり、後期使用では創造性を損なわずにアイデアを洗練できました。

title: Understanding Screenwriters' Practices, Attitudes, and Future Expectations in Human-AI Co-Creation
authors: Tang, Yuying and Li, Haotian and Lan, Minghe and Ma, Xiaojuan and Qu, Huamin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the practices, attitudes, and future expectations of screenwriters in human-AI co-creation, particularly focusing on how AI tools are currently utilized and perceived in the field of scriptwriting.
problem_english: The problem addressed in this paper is the lack of understanding of current practices and perceptions regarding AI-assisted scriptwriting, particularly how screenwriters integrate AI tools in their creative process, and what expectations they hold for the future of such collaborations.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and surveys among professional screenwriters to gather insights into their experiences with AI in scriptwriting, focusing on the tools used, perceived benefits and challenges, and their expectations for the evolution of human-AI creative partnerships.
results_english: Screenwriters generally see potential in AI tools for enhancing creativity and efficiency in scriptwriting. However, challenges such as maintaining originality and handling AI's limitations persist. Participants expressed cautious optimism about future AI advancements, emphasizing the importance of human oversight and creative control.
summary_japanese: この研究は、脚本家の人間とAIの共同創作における実践や態度、将来の期待を調査し、AIツールの現状利用と認識に焦点を当てた。
problem_japanese: 本論文では、AI支援脚本に関する現在の実践や認識の理解不足、特に脚本家が創作過程でどのようにAIツールを統合し、将来の協働に対する期待を持っているかに対処している。
method_japanese: 著者らはプロの脚本家を対象にインタビューと調査を実施し、スクリプト作成におけるAIの体験、使用ツール、利点と課題、そして人間とAIの創造的パートナーシップの進化への期待を収集した。
results_japanese: 脚本家は、創造性と効率性向上におけるAIツールの潜在力を認識。しかし、独自性の保持やAIの限界への対処という課題が残り、参加者は、人間の監督と創造性の制御の重要性を強調しつつ、AI進化に慎重な楽観を示した。

title: Understanding the Dynamics in Deploying AI-Based Content Creation Support Tools in Broadcasting Systems - Benefits, Challenges, and Directions
authors: Chung, Joon Gi and Hong, Soongi and Choi, Junho and Oh, Changhoon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the implementation dynamics of AI-based content creation tools in broadcasting, examining their benefits, challenges, and potential future directions for effective integration within media environments.
problem_english: The study addresses the complex process of integrating AI-driven content creation tools in broadcasting, identifying issues such as resistance to change, skill gaps, ethical concerns, and the balance between human creativity and AI capabilities, which can hinder effective tool deployment and utilization.
method_english: The researchers conducted a mixed-methods study incorporating qualitative interviews with broadcasting professionals and quantitative surveys to gather insights on experiences and perceptions regarding AI tools, focusing on adapting workflows, addressing skill gaps, and overcoming resistance to technology adoption.
results_english: The findings reveal both the potential and the complexities of using AI in broadcasting. Benefits include efficiency and creativity enhancement, while challenges involve ethical concerns and skill gaps. New strategies are proposed to better align AI integration with existing workflows and address stakeholder reluctance.
summary_japanese: 本研究は放送におけるAIベースのコンテンツ作成ツールの実装動態を探り、その利点、課題、および今後の方向性を考察します。
problem_japanese: 研究では、放送業界へのAI駆動のコンテンツ作成ツールの統合過程を探り、変革への抵抗、スキルギャップ、倫理的懸念、人間の創造性とAI能力のバランスといった課題を明らかにします。
method_japanese: 研究者は、放送業界の専門家への質的インタビューと定量的調査を組み合わせた混合手法を用いて、AIツールに関する経験と認識についての洞察を収集しました。
results_japanese: AIの利用可能性と複雑さが明らかになり、効率向上や創造性拡大の利点と、スキルギャップや倫理問題といった課題が示されました。

title: ARticulate: Interactive Visual Guidance for Demonstrated Rotational Degrees of Freedom in Mobile AR
authors: Tran, Nhan (Nathan) and Yang, Ethan and Davis, Abe
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ARticulate offers an interactive mobile AR tool for visual guidance, focusing on rotational degrees of freedom demonstrated in physical tasks, enhancing user comprehension and performance.
problem_english: Users often struggle with tasks requiring understanding of rotational degrees of freedom in physical objects due to inadequate visual guidance in mobile AR, resulting in poor task performance and comprehension.
method_english: ARticulate utilizes interactive visual cues in mobile AR to guide users on rotational degrees of freedom, employing real-time feedback and precise spatial information to address comprehension challenges during physical task execution.
results_english: ARticulate significantly improves users' understanding and execution of tasks requiring rotational degrees of freedom, showing enhanced task accuracy and completion time compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: ARticulateは、回転自由度に関する視覚的ガイダンスを提供するモバイルARツールで、ユーザーの理解と作業性能を向上させます。
problem_japanese: ユーザーは、モバイルARにおける回転自由度の理解が必要なタスクで視覚的ガイダンスが不足するため、作業の性能や理解が不十分であることが課題です。
method_japanese: ARticulateはモバイルAR内でインタラクティブな視覚的手がかりを用い、リアルタイムフィードバックと正確な空間情報を活用して物理的タスクの理解を助けます。
results_japanese: ARticulateは回転自由度を必要とするタスクの理解と実行を大幅に改善し、従来の方法と比較してタスクの正確さと完了時間が向上しました。

title: CARING-AI: Towards Authoring Context-aware Augmented Reality INstruction through Generative Artificial Intelligence
authors: Shi, Jingyu and Jain, Rahul and Chi, Seunggeun and Doh, Hyungjun and Chi, Hyung-gun and Quinn, Alexander J. and Ramani, Karthik
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CARING-AI explores authoring context-aware AR instructions using generative AI. It enhances instruction creation by utilizing what-if scenarios and smart object interactions in augmented reality environments.
problem_english: Existing methods for authoring AR instructions often lack context-awareness, relying on predefined templates and limited interaction scenarios. This results in less effective guidance for users in dynamic, real-world environments where adaptability and interactivity are crucial.
method_english: The method integrates generative AI with AR technology to create adaptive instructions that respond to contextual changes and user interactions. It uses what-if scenarios to generate more relevant guidance, improving the adaptability and interactivity of instructions in real-time settings.
results_english: The results show that CARING-AI improves AR instruction authoring by producing contextually relevant guidance, enhancing user experience and effectiveness compared to traditional methods. Users found the adaptive nature of instructions reduced task completion time and increased engagement.
summary_japanese: CARING-AIは、生成AIを使ってコンテキスト認識型AR指示の作成を探求し、何が起こるかシナリオとスマートオブジェクトの相互作用を活用して指示作成を強化します。
problem_japanese: 既存のAR指示作成方法は、予定のテンプレートや限られた相互作用シナリオに依存しコンテキスト認識が不足しています。そのため、動的で実際の環境において効果的なガイダンスを提供しづらいです。
method_japanese: 器具AR技術と生成AIを統合し文脈応じて指示を変える手法です。「もし〜ならば」についてのシナリオを駆使し、より適切なガイダンスを生成し、リアルタイムの設定において指示の適応性と相互作用を改善します。
results_japanese: CARING-AIは、従来の方法に比べてコンテキストに適した指示を生成し、ユーザー体験と有効性を向上させました。ユーザーは、指示の適応性がタスク完了時間を短縮し、エンゲージメントを高めると評価しました。

title: DiminishAR: Diminishing Visual Distractions via Holographic AR Displays
authors: Lee, JangHyeon and Kim, Lawrence H.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents DiminishAR, a system utilizing holographic AR displays to reduce visual distractions. It was evaluated through various user tests, demonstrating its efficacy in enhancing focus and attention in dynamic environments.
problem_english: Visual distractions in dynamic environments can significantly hinder focus and efficiency, especially in professional and educational settings. Existing solutions lack adaptability and personalized customization, affecting their effectiveness. Addressing this, there is a growing need for a system that can dynamically minimize distractions without compromising the essential visual information.
method_english: DiminishAR employs holographic augmented reality displays to selectively obscure distracting visual elements in a user’s environment. Leveraging adaptive algorithms, the system personalizes the filtering based on user preferences and contextual factors, ensuring essential visuals remain unobstructed while minimizing disruption effectively.
results_english: User studies highlighted DiminishAR's ability to significantly reduce visual distractions. Participants reported improved focus and task performance. The adaptive nature of the system was praised, as it seamlessly integrated with varying environments while maintaining critical visual information clarity, confirming its practical applicability and user satisfaction.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ホログラフィックARディスプレイを用いて視覚的な気を散らす要素を減少させるDiminishARを提案し、有効性を評価した。
problem_japanese: 動的環境での視覚的な気を散らす要素は集中力や効率に悪影響を与える。既存の解決策は適応性やカスタマイズ性に欠け、その効果が制限されている。柔軟に気を散らす要素を減少させるシステムが求められる。
method_japanese: DiminishARは、ホログラフィックARディスプレイを利用し、ユーザーの環境にある気を散らす視覚要素を選択的に遮蔽する。ユーザーの好みやコンテクストに基づき、適応アルゴリズムを用いて個別にフィルタリングを行う。
results_japanese: ユーザー研究により、DiminishARの視覚的な気を散らす要素削減の有効性が示された。参加者は集中力と業務パフォーマンスの向上を報告し、その適応性と批判情報の保持能力が実用的な有効性を示した。

title: EchoSight: Streamlining Bidirectional Virtual-physical Interaction with In-situ Optical Tethering
authors: Li, Jingyu and Yang, Qingwen and Xu, Kenuo and Zhang, Yang and Xu, Chenren
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: EchoSight introduces a system for seamless bidirectional interaction between virtual and physical spaces using in-situ optical tethering, enhancing user experience.
problem_english: Current systems for virtual-physical interaction often require cumbersome setups and lack intuitive control. Bridging these gaps to streamline interaction and ensure fluid, real-time communication between virtual and physical realms remains a significant challenge.
method_english: EchoSight employs an optical tethering approach, utilizing strategically placed cameras and projectors to create an interactive surface that both projects virtual elements and captures physical inputs, enabling intuitive bi-directional interaction.
results_english: The evaluation of EchoSight demonstrated effective and natural bi-directional interaction with reduced latency and increased user engagement. Users reported enhanced immersion and intuitive control, highlighting its potential for varied applications.
summary_japanese: EchoSightは、現実と仮想の双方向な連携を現場での光学的繋がりを用いて実現し、ユーザー体験を向上するシステムです。
problem_japanese: 現行の仮想-物理相互作用システムは、手間のかかる設定を必要とし、直感的な操作が欠如していることが多い。これを解決し、仮想と物理の領域間でのスムーズな連携を実現することが求められている。
method_japanese: EchoSightは光学的繋がりを用い、カメラとプロジェクターを適所に配置し、仮想要素を投影しつつ物理入力を取得することで、直感的な双方向相互作用を実現します。
results_japanese: EchoSightの評価により、低遅延かつ自然な双方向相互作用が確認され、ユーザー没入感と操作の直感性が向上。多様な応用可能性が示されました。

title: GazeNoter: Co-Piloted AR Note-Taking via Gaze Selection of LLM Suggestions to Match Users' Intentions
authors: Tsai, Hsin-Ruey and Chiu, Shih-Kang and Wang, Bryan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: GazeNoter aids note-taking by using gaze selection to choose AI-generated suggestions, matching user intentions in AR environments.
problem_english: Users face challenges in efficiently taking notes that genuinely reflect their intentions through traditional methods, especially in augmented reality contexts. GazeNoter addresses this by leveraging AI suggestions tailored to match the user's gaze and intention.
method_english: GazeNoter utilizes augmented reality technology where users select AI-generated note suggestions using gaze direction, allowing seamless interaction to ensure notes match users’ real intentions without manual input.
results_english: Experiments demonstrated that GazeNoter significantly improved note-taking efficiency and user satisfaction by aligning AI suggestions with user intentions through gaze, streamlining cognitive load in augmented reality settings.
summary_japanese: GazeNoterはAR環境でのユーザーの意図に合うAI提案選択を視線で行い、効果的なメモ作成を支援。
problem_japanese: 従来の手法では、特に拡張現実環境において、効率的にユーザーの意図を反映したメモを取ることが困難。GazeNoterは、ユーザーの意図に合ったAI提案を視線で選択可能にすることで問題を解決。
method_japanese: GazeNoterはAR技術を用い、ユーザーが視線の方向でAI提案を選択し、手動入力なしで意図に沿ったメモを作成可能にするシステム。
results_japanese: 実験により、GazeNoterは視線を通じて意図に合うAI提案で、拡張現実環境でのメモ作成効率とユーザー満足度を大幅に向上したことが実証された。

title: IEDS: Exploring an Intelli-Embodied Design Space Combining Designer, AR, and GAI to Support Industrial Conceptual Design
authors: Zhang, Hongbo and Chen, Pei and Yang, Jingwen and Wu, Yifei and Jiang, Zhaoqu and Xie, Xuelong and You, Weitao and Sun, Lingyun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: IEDS integrates designers, AR, and GAI for enhanced industrial conceptual design, offering a new design space with immersive, interactive experiences and efficient workflows.
problem_english: Traditional industrial conceptual design processes can be limited by lack of interactive tools and efficiency, often not fully utilizing technological advancements such as augmented reality and generative AI, which can enhance creativity and productivity in design workflows.
method_english: IEDS combines designer input, augmented reality (AR), and generative artificial intelligence (GAI) technologies, creating an interactive design space. It integrates these elements to support designers with real-time visualizations and intelligent suggestions, thereby improving design efficiency and creativity.
results_english: The integration presented in IEDS significantly enhances the design process by providing real-time interactive experiences and intelligent design suggestions, leading to more efficient and innovative outcomes compared to traditional methods. Users reported improved creativity and satisfaction with the design process.
summary_japanese: IEDSはデザイナー、AR、GAIを統合し、より効率的な工業デザインのための新しいデザイン空間を提供。
problem_japanese: 従来の工業用概念設計は、インタラクティブなツールや効率性に欠けることが多く、拡張現実（AR）や生成AIなどの技術進歩を十分に活用していないため、創造性や生産性を向上させる可能性を持っています。
method_japanese: IEDSはデザイナーのインプット、AR、GAI技術を組み合わせ、リアルタイムの視覚化やインテリジェントな提案を通じてデザインの効率性と創造性を向上させるインタラクティブなデザイン空間を構築。
results_japanese: IEDSの統合は、リアルタイムのインタラクティブな体験とインテリジェントなデザイン提案を提供することで、伝統的な方法と比較して効率的で革新的な結果をもたらしました。ユーザーがデザインプロセスに対する創造性と満足度の向上を報告しました。

title: PerspectAR: Addressing Perspective Distortion on Very Large Displays with Adaptive Augmented Reality Overlays
authors: Raza, Muhammad and Ketsoi, Vachiraporn and Malloch, Joseph and Bashbaghi, Saman and Purmehdi, Hakimeh and Reilly, Derek
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PerspectAR addresses perspective distortion on large displays by using adaptive AR overlays, enhancing interaction and visualization efficiency.
problem_english: Large displays often cause perspective distortion due to their size and user's viewing angle. This distortion can lead to challenges in accurately interpreting displayed content, hindering user interaction and efficiency. Addressing this perspective issue is crucial for enhancing the usability and effectiveness of large displays in various settings, particularly in collaborative environments.
method_english: The authors propose an adaptive augmented reality (AR) system, PerspectAR, that employs head-tracking and dynamic overlay adjustments. By utilizing real-time data about user position and gaze, PerspectAR modifies AR overlays to correct perspective distortion. This AR system is designed to integrate seamlessly with existing display technologies and provides an adaptable solution tailored to individual users’ perspectives.
results_english: PerspectAR effectively reduced perspective distortion, improving the accuracy of user interpretations and interactions with large displays. User studies demonstrated significant improvements in task performance and user satisfaction. Participants reported a more natural interaction experience and greater visual clarity. These results indicate that adaptive AR overlays can effectively ameliorate perspective issues on large displays.
summary_japanese: PerspectARは、大型ディスプレイの視点歪みをARオーバーレイで解消し、効率的な操作と視覚化を実現します。
problem_japanese: 大型ディスプレイはそのサイズと使用者の視角により視点の歪みを生じることが多く、表示された内容の正確な理解を妨げ、ユーザーの操作と効率に影響を及ぼします。この視点歪みの問題の解決は、特に協調的な環境において、大型ディスプレイの使いやすさと有効性を向上させるために重要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは、ユーザーの位置と視線に関するリアルタイムデータを利用して、ARオーバーレイを修正するPerspectARという適応型ARシステムを提案しています。このARシステムは既存のディスプレイ技術とシームレスに統合され、個々のユーザーの視点に合わせた適応可能な解決策を提供します。
results_japanese: PerspectARは視点の歪みを効果的に軽減し、大型ディスプレイとのユーザーのインタープリテーションと操作の正確性を向上させました。ユーザー調査では、作業パフォーマンスとユーザーの満足度が大幅に改善されたことが示され、参加者はより自然な操作体験と視覚の明瞭さを報告しました。これらの結果は、適応型ARオーバーレイが大型ディスプレイの視点問題を効果的に改善できることを示しています。

title: "Closer than Real": How Social VR Platform Features Influence Friendship Dynamics
authors: Hide, Misato and Hatada, Yuji and Kuzuoka, Hideaki and Narumi, Takuji
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates how features of social VR platforms impact the dynamics of friendships, revealing that immersive experiences can strengthen bonds more than traditional platforms.
problem_english: The study addresses the lack of understanding regarding how social VR platform features influence friendship dynamics, particularly the difference these features make in comparison to 2D social interactions.
method_english: Researchers conducted a mixed-method study involving qualitative interviews and quantitative analysis of VR platform usage to explore the effects on friendships. Different platform features were assessed for their impact on friendship intimacy and connection.
results_english: The study found that certain VR features, such as spatial presence and shared experiences, can create deeper connections between users, leading to stronger friendships compared to those formed on traditional social media.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、社会的VRプラットフォームの機能が友情の力学にどのように影響するかを調査し、没入体験が従来のプラットフォームよりも絆を強化することを示しています。
problem_japanese: 社会的VRプラットフォームの機能が友情の力学にどのように影響するかについての理解不足、特に2Dの社会的相互作用との比較での違いをアドレスしています。
method_japanese: 研究者は、VRプラットフォーム利用の定性的インタビューと定量分析を組み合わせた研究を行い、友情に対する影響を探りました。異なるプラットフォームの機能が友情の親密さとつながりにどのような影響を与えるかを評価しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、空間的な存在感や共有体験などの特定のVRの特徴がユーザー間の深い繋がりを生み出し、従来のソーシャルメディアで形成される友情よりも強力なものになることを発見しました。

title: Bridging Simulation and Reality: Augmented Virtuality for Mass Casualty Triage Training - From Landscape Analysis to Empirical Insights
authors: Chen, Yang and Fennedy, Katherine and Zhang, Jiayi and Sim, Yong Jie and Zheng, Clement and Yen, Ching Chiuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores augmented virtuality for mass casualty triage training, presenting a landscape analysis and empirical insights to bridge simulation and reality for improved training effectiveness.
problem_english: Traditional mass casualty triage training methods often lack realism and pragmatic effectiveness, hindering trainees from developing requisite skills. This research aims to address these shortcomings by incorporating augmented virtuality as a means to enhance realism and provide trainees with experiential learning opportunities.
method_english: The study employs augmented virtuality, which combines real-world elements with computer-generated environments. A comprehensive landscape analysis is followed by trials where participants engage in immersive virtual triage scenarios to assess the approach's effectiveness in skill development and realism.
results_english: Results demonstrate that augmented virtuality improved training efficacy by enhancing realism and participants' engagement. Empirical insights reveal increased skill acquisition and retention compared to traditional methods, with participants expressing higher confidence in applying learned skills to real situations.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、マスカジュアルティトリアージトレーニングのための拡張仮想性を探求し、シミュレーションと現実を橋渡しするための実証的洞察を提供する。
problem_japanese: 従来のマスカジュアルティトリアージトレーニングはリアリズムと実効性に欠け、参加者が必要なスキルを習得するのを妨げることがある。本研究は拡張仮想性を導入してこれらの欠点を克服し、現実感と経験学習の機会を提供することを目指す。
method_japanese: 拡張仮想性を利用し、実世界の要素とコンピュータ生成環境を融合。包括的なランドスケープ分析後、参加者が没入型仮想トリアージシナリオに参加し、スキル開発とリアリズム向上の効果を評価。
results_japanese: 拡張仮想性によりリアリズムと参加者の関与が向上し、トレーニング効果が増した。従来法よりスキル習得・保持が増し、現実適用への自信も高まったことが確認された。

title: Modeling Locomotion with Body Angular Movements in Virtual Reality
authors: Mai, Zijun and Gao, BoYu and Tu, Huawei and Li, Dasheng and Kim, HyungSeok and Luo, Weiqi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a novel approach to simulating locomotion in virtual reality using body angular movements, aiming to improve user experience by making motion more natural and immersive.
problem_english: Traditional locomotion methods in virtual reality often fail to provide a natural and immersive experience. These methods can lead to motion sickness and discomfort, limiting user interaction and engagement in virtual environments.
method_english: The authors propose a model that leverages body angular movements to simulate locomotion in virtual reality. This approach includes tracking and translating natural physical movements into virtual motion, enhancing realism and user comfort.
results_english: The study demonstrated that using body angular movements significantly reduces motion sickness and increases user immersion. Participants reported improved comfort and realism during VR interactions, highlighting the effectiveness of the proposed model.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、身体の角度運動を利用するVR内での移動シミュレーション方法を提案し、より自然で没入感のあるユーザー体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 従来のVR移動手法は自然で没入感のある体験を提供できず、これによりモーションシックネスや不快感が生じ、VR環境でのユーザーの相互作用と関与が制限される。
method_japanese: 著者らは身体の角度運動を活用したVR内での移動シミュレーションモデルを提案。自然な身体運動をトラッキングして仮想運動に変換し、リアリズムと快適さを向上させる。
results_japanese: 身体角度運動の活用によりモーションシックネスが大幅に軽減され、ユーザーの没入感が向上したと示されました。参加者はVR操作中の快適さとリアリズム改善を報告し、提案モデルの効果が示されました。

title: Modeling the Impact of Visual Stimuli on Redirection Noticeability with Gaze Behavior in Virtual Reality
authors: Li, Zhipeng and Ji, Yishu and Chen, Ruijia and Liu, Tianqi and Wang, Yuntao and Shi, Yuanchun and Yan, Yukang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper models how visual stimuli affect the noticeability of redirection techniques in VR, using gaze behavior. The goal is to enhance immersion without causing discomfort.
problem_english: In virtual reality (VR), redirection techniques can alter user trajectory to prevent collision with real-world obstacles. However, noticeable redirection can disrupt immersion and cause discomfort. Understanding how visual stimuli affect redirection noticeability is critical for optimizing these techniques to maintain user immersion and comfort.
method_english: The study employs a combination of user experiments and gaze behavior analysis to evaluate the impact of various visual stimuli on the noticeability of redirection techniques in VR environments. Data from gaze tracking provides insights into user awareness and response to visual cues during redirection.
results_english: The research found specific visual stimuli and gaze behaviors that minimize the noticeability of redirection techniques, thereby enhancing user immersion in VR. The model successfully predicts redirection noticeability based on gaze metrics, aiding in the design of less intrusive redirection strategies.
summary_japanese: 本研究はVRにおける視覚刺激がリダイレクトの目立ちやすさに及ぼす影響を視線行動を用いてモデル化し、没入感を向上させることを目指します。
problem_japanese: VRではリダイレクト技術がユーザーの経路を変えて現実の障害物を回避するが、目立つリダイレクトは没入感を損ね不快感を引き起こす。視覚刺激がリダイレクトの目立ちやすさに及ぼす影響を理解することが重要です。
method_japanese: 本研究では、ユーザー実験と視線行動解析を組み合わせ、VR環境でのリダイレクト技術の目立ちやすさに及ぼす視覚刺激の影響を評価します。視線追跡データからユーザーの気づきと視覚的手がかりへの反応を分析します。
results_japanese: 特定の視覚刺激と視線行動がリダイレクトの目立ちにくさを最小化し、VRでの没入感を向上させることが判明しました。視線指標に基づくモデルはリダイレクトの目立ちやすさを予測し、非侵襲的な設計戦略に役立ちます。

title: Self-Disclosure in Social Virtual Reality: The Influence of Information Management Dynamics, Social Presence, and Privacy Concerns
authors: Cummings, James J. and Ingber, Alexis Shore and Jia, Yihan Danny
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores self-disclosure in social VR contexts, influenced by information management dynamics, social presence, and privacy concerns. It examines how these factors affect users' willingness to share personal information in virtual environments.
problem_english: The research identifies a gap in understanding how social virtual reality environments affect self-disclosure behaviors. Specifically, it addresses the need to comprehend the impact of information management, social presence, and privacy on users' willingness to share personal experiences and data.
method_english: The study employs mixed methods, including surveys and experiments within social VR platforms. It assesses user interactions in virtual environments to analyze the interplay between information management, social presence, and privacy concerns affecting self-disclosure.
results_english: Findings reveal complex dynamics where heightened social presence can increase self-disclosure, yet privacy concerns might restrict it. The management of information and social cues in VR environments significantly influences users' sharing behaviors and privacy perceptions.
summary_japanese: 情報管理動態、社会的存在感、プライバシー懸念が影響するソーシャルVRでの自己開示を探る研究。
problem_japanese: ソーシャルVR環境が自己開示行動にどう影響するかの理解が不足。特に情報管理、社会的存在感、プライバシーが個人情報共有意欲に与える影響を解明。
method_japanese: ソーシャルVRプラットフォームでの調査・実験を用い、情報管理、社会的存在感、プライバシー懸念が自己開示に与える影響を分析。
results_japanese: 社会的存在感が自己開示を促進する一方、プライバシー懸念が制限する複雑な動態が明らかに。VR環境での情報管理が共有行動とプライバシー認識に影響。

title: Understanding "Mutes" in Social Virtual Reality
authors: Chen, Qijia and Bellucci, Andrea and Cai, Jie and Nelimarkka, Matti and Jacucci, Giulio
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the concept of 'mutes' in social virtual reality, analyzing the reasons behind this behavior and its impact on communication and interaction in virtual environments.
problem_english: The research addresses the limited understanding of why users choose to remain mute in social virtual reality environments. This behavior can challenge effective communication and social interaction, creating barriers and misunderstandings among participants in virtual spaces.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative interviews and observational studies with users of social virtual reality platforms. They analyzed the data to identify common reasons for mute behavior and its effects on user experience, focusing on communication dynamics and social interaction.
results_english: The study found various reasons for mute behavior, including privacy concerns, social anxiety, and technical issues. Understanding these factors can help developers and designers create more inclusive and effective virtual reality environments that cater to all users.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、社会的VRにおける「ミュート」の概念を探求し、その行動の理由や影響を分析した。
problem_japanese: 社会的VR環境でユーザーがミュート状態になる理由についての理解が不足している。これにより、効果的なコミュニケーションと社会的相互作用が妨げられ、参加者間に障壁や誤解が生じる可能性がある。
method_japanese: 著者らは、社会的VRプラットフォームのユーザーに対する質的インタビューと観察調査を実施し、ミュート行動の共通の理由とユーザー体験への影響を分析した。
results_japanese: 研究は、プライバシーの懸念、社会的不安、技術的問題など、ミュート行動のさまざまな理由を発見した。これにより、より包括的で効果的なVR環境の設計が可能となる。

title: Understanding Social Interactions in Reality Versus Virtuality
authors: L\'{e}chapp\'{e}, Aur\'{e}lien and Johnstone, Ross and Milliat, Aur\'{e}lien and Williamson, John H and Chollet, Mathieu and Williamson, Julie R.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates how social interactions differ between reality and virtual environments using empirical studies. It aims to understand behavioral patterns and social dynamics in each setting, potentially guiding improvements in virtual communication tools.
problem_english: The study seeks to address the gap in understanding the nuanced differences in social interactions between real and virtual environments. There's an increasing need to compare these interactions systematically, given the rise of virtual communication platforms.
method_english: Researchers conducted empirical studies involving controlled experiments in both real and virtual environments. Participants' behaviors and interactions were observed, recorded, and analyzed using both qualitative and quantitative measures to ensure comprehensive insights.
results_english: The findings revealed critical differences in social dynamics, including interaction patterns and engagement levels. Virtual environments showed varied interaction styles, offering opportunities for enhancing virtual communication tools to better replicate real-world experiences.
summary_japanese: この論文は、現実と仮想環境での社会的相互作用の違いを調査し、行動パターンと社会的力学を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 現実と仮想環境間の社会的相互作用の微妙な違いを理解するためのギャップに対処することが求められています。仮想通信プラットフォームの増加に伴い、系統的な比較が必要です。
method_japanese: 研究者は、実環境と仮想環境の両方で制御された実験を行い、参加者の行動と相互作用を観察・記録しました。質的・量的に分析しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、相互作用のパターンやエンゲージメントレベルを含む社会的力学の重要な違いを示しました。仮想環境には異なる相互作用スタイルが見られ、実世界の経験を再現するための改善の機会があります。

title: "I'd Never Actually Realized How Big An Impact It Had Until Now": Perspectives of University Students with Disabilities on Generative Artificial Intelligence
authors: Atcheson, Alex and Khan, Omar and Siemann, Brian and Jain, Anika and Karahalios, Karrie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the perspectives of university students with disabilities on generative AI technology, highlighting their experiences and challenges.
problem_english: University students with disabilities often face unique challenges that are exacerbated by technological advancements. Understanding how generative Artificial Intelligence impacts their academic experience is critical for ensuring accessibility and inclusivity in higher education settings.
method_english: Researchers conducted semi-structured interviews with university students possessing various disabilities, focusing on their experiences with generative AI tools. Data analysis involved thematic coding to identify key issues and benefits related to accessibility and learning.
results_english: Findings reveal that generative AI can significantly improve accessibility for students with disabilities. However, certain limitations persist, including usability challenges and insufficient personalized support, impacting the full potential of AI technologies.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、障がいを持つ大学生の生成AIに対する視点を探り、体験と課題を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 障がいを持つ大学生は技術進化により特有の課題に直面します。生成AIが学業に与える影響を理解することは、高等教育のアクセシビリティと包括性の確保に不可欠です。
method_japanese: 研究者は、生成AIツールの経験に焦点を当てた障がいを持つ大学生への半構造化インタビューを実施し、データ分析を通じてテーマコード化で重大な問題と利点を抽出しました。
results_japanese: 結果は生成AIが障がい学生のアクセシビリティを大幅に向上させることを示しつつ、使い勝手の課題や不足する個別対応でその効果が限定される問題も浮き彫りにしました。

title: "The Internet is Hard. Is Words": Investigating Information Search Difficulties Experienced by People with Aphasia and Strategies for Combatting Them
authors: Kladouchou, Vasiliki and Makri, Stephann and Frankowska-Takhari, Sylwia and Neate, Timothy and MacFarlane, Andrew and Wilson, Stephanie and Roper, Abi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the internet search challenges faced by people with aphasia and proposes strategies to alleviate these difficulties, based on qualitative research.
problem_english: People with aphasia often encounter significant difficulties in conducting effective information searches on the internet. These challenges stem primarily from language comprehension and production deficits, which hinder their ability to query and process search results accurately. As a result, they often struggle to find relevant information and meet their specific information needs. Addressing these challenges is crucial to improving their online experiences and access to information.
method_english: The study employed qualitative research methods, including semi-structured interviews and co-design workshops, with people with aphasia. The aim was to understand the specific challenges they face when searching for information online and to collaboratively develop strategies and tools to alleviate these challenges. Participants provided insights into their experiences, contributing to a better understanding of their needs.
results_english: The research identified specific barriers faced by people with aphasia during online searches, such as difficulties with keyword creation and interpreting search results. Strategies to address these challenges include simplifying user interfaces, employing accessible language cues, and developing supportive technologies to facilitate more effective information retrieval.
summary_japanese: 本論文は失語症者が直面するインターネット検索の課題を探り、質的研究に基づいてそれを軽減する戦略を提案する。
problem_japanese: 失語症者はインターネットでの情報検索時に言語の理解と生成の障害により、適切な情報を見つけるのが難しいという課題に直面している。このため、彼らの情報ニーズに応えるのが困難であり、これを改善することが重要である。
method_japanese: 質的研究手法として、失語症者を対象に半構造化インタビューとコーデザインワークショップを実施。オンライン検索の課題を理解し、問題解消のための戦略とツールを共に開発することを目指した。参加者の経験を通じてニーズを理解した。
results_japanese: 失語症者がオンライン検索で直面するバリアを特定し、キーワード作成や検索結果の解釈に関する困難を明らかにした。これを解決するために、ユーザーインターフェースの簡素化やアクセス可能な言語手掛かりの活用などの戦略を提案した。

title: Accessibility for Whom? Perceptions of Mobility Barriers Across Disability Groups and Implications for Designing Personalized Maps
authors: Li, Chu and Pang, Rock Yuren and Labb\'{e}, Delphine and Eisenberg, Yochai and Hosseini, Maryam and Froehlich, Jon E.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates how different disability groups perceive mobility barriers and explores implications for creating personalized maps. By understanding diverse needs, the research aims to enhance map accessibility.
problem_english: Existing mapping systems often fail to account for the diverse needs of individuals with disabilities, leading to reduced accessibility. This study addresses the gap in understanding how different disability groups perceive and prioritize various mobility barriers, which is crucial for developing more personalized and effective maps.
method_english: The researchers conducted a qualitative study involving interviews and surveys with participants from different disability groups. They analyzed the data to identify common mobility barriers encountered by these groups and assessed how these barriers impact their navigation experiences, aiming to inform the design of personalized, accessible maps.
results_english: Findings reveal significant variations in mobility barrier perceptions among different disability groups. These insights highlight the necessity for personalized navigation solutions. The results inform guidelines and design strategies for developing maps that better accommodate diverse needs, enhancing accessibility and usability for all users.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、異なる障害者グループの移動障壁の認識を調査し、個別化された地図の設計への影響を探ります。
problem_japanese: 既存の地図システムは障害者の多様なニーズを十分に考慮しておらず、アクセシビリティを低下させています。本研究は、異なる障害者グループが抱える移動障壁の違いを理解し、個別化された効果的な地図の開発におけるギャップを埋めることを目的としています。
method_japanese: 研究者は、異なる障害者グループの参加者を対象にインタビューとアンケート調査を実施し、よく遭遇する移動障壁を特定しました。そして、これらの障壁がナビゲーション経験に与える影響を評価し、個別対応の地図設計に活用します。
