authors: Brewster, Kat and DeGuia, Aloe and Mayworm, Samuel and Khan, F. Ria and Monier, Mel and Starks, Denny L and Haimson, Oliver L.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the use of augmented reality face filters as tools for transgender individuals to experiment with gender presentations, affirm gender identities, and explore possibilities beyond traditional norms.
problem_english: Transgender individuals often face barriers in experimenting with gender presentations and affirming their identities due to societal expectations and limited resources. Tools like AR face filters could offer opportunities for identity exploration and affirmation in safe and supportive environments.
method_english: The authors utilize qualitative methods, including in-depth interviews and user studies, to examine how transgender individuals engage with augmented reality face filters. They analyze the emotional and identity-affirming experiences of users interacting with these digital tools.
results_english: Findings suggest that augmented reality face filters facilitate exploration and visualization of desired gender embodiments, affirm gender identities, and foster creative and experimental engagement in transgender communities, generating positive emotional impacts.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、拡張現実フェイスフィルターがトランスジェンダーの性別探求や確認、可能性の探索に役立つツールとしての役割を探ります。
problem_japanese: トランスジェンダーの個人が性別の表現を模索し、アイデンティティを確認する際、社会的期待とリソースの制限により壁にぶつかることが多いです。ARフェイスフィルターは、安全でサポートされる環境でのアイデンティティ探求を可能にします。
method_japanese: 著者たちは質的手法を用いて、トランスジェンダーの個人が拡張現実フェイスフィルターとどのように関与するかを調査します。彼らはユーザーがこれらのデジタルツールと対話する際の感情的でアイデンティティを確認する経験を分析します。
results_japanese: 結果は、拡張現実フェイスフィルターが性別具現化の探求と視覚化、アイデンティティの確認、トランスジェンダーコミュニティでの創造的な挑戦を促進し、ポジティブな感情的影響を与えることを示しています。

title: De-centering Inclusivity: Fitting Design for Aut-Ethnography
authors: Alr\o{}e, Sarah Fjelsted and Krogh, Peter Gall
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the concept of de-centering inclusivity in design practices, specifically focusing on fitting design for aut-ethnography by considering varied personal perspectives and experiences.
problem_english: The challenge lies in conventional inclusivity approaches that often overlook the nuances and specific needs of individuals, particularly in the context of aut-ethnography. This research addresses how design methodologies can better incorporate diverse personal perspectives.
method_english: The authors propose a design framework that prioritizes personal experience and subjective narratives, facilitating a richer spectrum of inclusivity. This involves iterative design processes with active participant engagements to adapt to specific contexts.
results_english: The study successfully demonstrates that by de-centering conventional inclusivity metrics and incorporating diverse narratives, design practices can become more adaptive and responsive, leading to better participant representation in projects.
summary_japanese: 多様な個人の視点と経験を考慮した自動民族誌のためのデザインへの包摂性の脱中心化を探求します。
problem_japanese: 自動民族誌において、従来の包摂性アプローチでは個人の特定のニーズとニュアンスをしばしば見逃しがちです。本研究は、多様な個人の視点を効果的に取り入れるデザイン手法を模索します。
method_japanese: 主観的な物語と個人的な経験を重視するデザインフレームワークを提示。参加者と共にコンテクストに適合するように反復的にデザインを調整します。
results_japanese: 従来の包摂性指標を脱中心化し、多様な物語を取り入れることで、デザインがより適応的で応答性を高め、参加者の表現が向上しました。

title: Facilitators and Barriers of Wearable Stress Management Technology: A Narrative Review of User Perspectives
authors: van den Berg, Merel K. N. and Karahano\u{g}lu, Arma\u{g}an and Noordzij, Matthijs L. and Maeckelberghe, Els L. M. and Ludden, Geke D. S.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study reviews user perspectives to identify facilitators and barriers of wearable stress management technologies, offering insights into enhancing user experience and device effectiveness.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge faced by developers and designers in understanding the varied user perspectives regarding wearable stress management technology, which is often overlooked, affecting user adoption and effectiveness of these technologies in stress management.
method_english: The authors performed a narrative review focusing on user perspectives concerning wearable stress management technologies, synthesizing findings from a range of existing studies to uncover common facilitators and barriers experienced by users.
results_english: The review identified several facilitators such as ease of use, personalization, and feedback, as well as barriers including privacy concerns, data accuracy, and user engagement, highlighting areas for improvement in wearable technology design.
summary_japanese: 本研究はウェアラブルストレス管理技術の利用者視点をレビューし、ユーザー体験とデバイスの有効性向上に役立つ洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、ストレス管理ウェアラブル技術の利用者視点の理解が不十分で、ユーザー採用と技術効果に影響を与えるという開発者・デザイナーの課題に対処します。
method_japanese: 著者らはウェアラブルストレス管理技術に関する利用者視点に焦点を当てたナラティブレビューを行い、既存研究の成果を合成して一般的な促進要因と障壁を明らかにしました。
results_japanese: レビューは、利用の容易さ、個別化、フィードバックといった促進要因や、プライバシー問題、データの正確性、ユーザー関与といった障壁を特定し、改善の余地を示しました。

title: Mining Evidence about Your Symptoms: Mitigating Availability Bias in Online Self-Diagnosis
authors: Zhang, Junti and Zhu, Zicheng and Li, Jingshu and Lee, Yi-Chieh
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates methods to reduce availability bias in online self-diagnosis by mining evidence related to user symptoms using computational techniques.
problem_english: Online self-diagnosis often suffers from availability bias, causing individuals to misinterpret the prevalence of symptoms and conditions based on the information most easily accessible. This leads to misinformation and anxiety, affecting health decision-making.
method_english: The authors propose a system that uses natural language processing and machine learning to analyze and categorize online content related to symptoms. By presenting users with a balanced view, the system aims to mitigate the impact of availability bias.
results_english: Testing indicated that users interacting with the proposed system engaged in more accurate self-diagnosis sessions, displaying reduced availability bias. Users reported increased understanding of their symptoms and improved confidence in their health assessments.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、症状に関する証拠を採掘することでオンライン自己診断の可用性バイアスを軽減する手法を研究しています。
problem_japanese: オンライン自己診断では可用性バイアスが問題であり、人々はアクセスしやすい情報に依存して症状や病状の流行を誤解しやすく、誤情報や不安が健康の意思決定に悪影響を与えています。
method_japanese: 著者は自然言語処理と機械学習を用いて症状に関連するオンラインコンテンツを分析・分類するシステムを提案します。このシステムはバランスの取れた情報をユーザーに提供し、可用性バイアスの影響を軽減します。
results_japanese: 試験の結果、このシステムと対話したユーザーは正確な自己診断セッションを行い、可用性バイアスが減少しました。ユーザーは症状の理解が深まり、健康評価への自信が向上したと報告しました。

title: Unhealthy Comparisons to Promote Healthy Behavior? Exploring the Impact of Social Comparison Strategies in Personal Informatics.
authors: van Zandvoort, Daphne and Vredenborg, Marloes and Bentvelzen, Marit
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates the role of social comparison strategies in promoting healthy behaviors through personal informatics tools.
problem_english: There is a growing interest in utilizing social comparison strategies within personal informatics to encourage healthier behaviors. However, understanding the effectiveness and impact of these strategies, including potentially negative comparisons, is crucial for designing effective interventions.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-methods study involving surveys and user testing to evaluate various social comparison strategies embedded in personal informatics. Participants were exposed to different comparative feedback scenarios to measure their impact on motivation and behavior change.
results_english: The study found that while positive comparisons generally encouraged health-related behavior changes, certain negative comparisons could also be motivating when framed constructively. Personalized comparative feedback, tailored to individual psychological traits, showed the most promise in motivating sustained behavior change.
summary_japanese: 社会比較戦略が個人情報ツールを通じて健康的な行動を促進する役割を調査した。
problem_japanese: 個人情報ツールで健康的な行動を促進する社会比較戦略の使用が期待されているが、その効果と潜在的なネガティブな比較の影響を理解することが重要である。
method_japanese: 調査とユーザーテストを用いた混合手法研究を実施し、参加者に様々な比較フィードバックを提示して動機付けと行動変化への影響を評価した。
results_japanese: ポジティブな比較が健康行動を促進する一方で、ネガティブな比較も構造的に提示されると動機付けにつながることがある。個々の心理的特性に合わせたフィードバックが持続的な行動変化を促進した。

title: Voice by the Non-sighted: Practices and Challenges of Audiobook Voice Actors with Blind and Low Vision in China
authors: Chen, Shi and Zhang, Jingao and Lou, Suqi and Wang, Xiaodong and Xiang, Wei and Sun, Lingyun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines the practices and challenges faced by audiobook voice actors with blindness or low vision in China, using qualitative interviews to explore their experiences.
problem_english: The problem addressed in this study is the lack of understanding about the specific practices, challenges, and needs of blind and low vision audiobook voice actors in China, highlighting the barriers they face in contributing to the audiobook industry.
method_english: The researchers conducted qualitative interviews with blind and low vision audiobook voice actors in China to gather insights into their personal experiences, challenges, and the strategies they employ to overcome hurdles in their profession.
results_english: Findings reveal that these voice actors encounter technology accessibility issues, limited opportunities, and societal biases. However, they employ adaptive strategies and rely on peer support to navigate these challenges and make significant contributions to the industry.
summary_japanese: 中国の視覚障害者のオーディオブック声優の実践と課題を定性的インタビューで探る研究。
problem_japanese: 中国の視覚障害者のオーディオブック声優が直面する具体的な実践や課題、ニーズについての理解不足が問題であり、業界への貢献における障壁を浮き彫りにする。
method_japanese: 中国の視覚障害者の声優を対象に定性的インタビューを行い、彼らの経験、課題、それを克服するための戦略について洞察を得た。
results_japanese: 声優たちは技術的なアクセシビリティの問題や機会の制限、社会的偏見に直面しているが、適応戦略と仲間の支援によりこれらの課題を乗り越え、業界に貢献している。

title: "Who is running it?" Towards Equitable AI Deployment in Home Care Work
authors: Solano-Kamaiko, Ian Ren\'{e} and Tan, Melissa and Ming, Joy and Avgar, Ariel C. and Vashistha, Aditya and Sterling, Madeline and Dell, Nicola
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores equitable AI deployment in home care, focusing on operational and justice aspects. It aims to understand who benefits and who controls these technologies.
problem_english: The deployment of AI in home care work raises concerns about equity and justice, particularly regarding who benefits from AI technologies and who holds control or decision-making power in this context.
method_english: The study employs qualitative research methods, including interviews and surveys with stakeholders in home care environments, to gather insights into AI technology deployment and its impact on work dynamics and equity.
results_english: The findings reveal disparities in benefits and control, highlighting the need for more inclusive and just AI deployments. Certain stakeholders, like care workers, often have less control but face significant impacts from these technologies.
summary_japanese: 在宅ケアにおけるAI展開の公平性を探求し、恩恵を受ける人と技術を制御する人を理解することを目的とする。
problem_japanese: 在宅ケアでのAI展開は、誰がAI技術の恩恵を受け、誰が制御または意思決定権を持つのかに関して、特に公平性と正義の懸念を引き起こしている。
method_japanese: この研究は、在宅ケア環境でのAI技術の展開とその仕事のダイナミクスおよび公平性への影響について洞察を得るために、インタビューや調査を含む質的研究手法を用いる。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、利益と制御における格差を明らかにし、より包括的で公正なAI展開の必要性を強調する。特にケア労働者は、しばしば制御が少なく、これらの技術からの影響が大きいことがわかる。

title: Exploring Data-Driven Advocacy in Home Health Care Work
authors: Ming, Joy and Tolera, Hawi H and Tu, Jiamin and Yitzhaki, Ella and Ngai, Chit Sum Eunice and Sterling, Madeline and Avgar, Ariel C and Vashistha, Aditya and Dell, Nicola
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores data-driven advocacy to improve home health care work conditions by analyzing challenges and opportunities in using data for this purpose.
problem_english: Home health care workers often face difficult working conditions and lack of representation. There's a need for effective advocacy to address these issues. However, the use of data-driven approaches in this advocacy is not well-understood or implemented.
method_english: The researchers conducted interviews and surveys with stakeholders in the home health care sector to gather insights. This data was then analyzed to identify patterns, challenges, and opportunities for implementing data-driven advocacy strategies.
results_english: Findings revealed critical barriers such as privacy concerns and data accessibility. However, potential benefits were identified, including enhanced communication and better policy formulation. The study suggests frameworks for overcoming challenges to implement data-driven advocacy effectively.
summary_japanese: 在宅医療労働の条件改善のためのデータ駆動型アドボカシーを探求し、データ利用の課題と機会を分析した研究。
problem_japanese: 在宅医療労働者は過酷な労働条件と表現の欠如に直面しており、これを改善するための効果的なアドボカシーが必要とされています。しかし、データ駆動型のアプローチの利用が十分に理解されておらず、実施されていないという課題があります。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは在宅医療部門の利害関係者にインタビューとアンケートを行い、データを収集しました。このデータを分析し、データ駆動型アドボカシー戦略を実施するためのパターンや課題、機会を特定しました。
results_japanese: プライバシーの懸念やデータアクセスの制約といった主要な障壁が明らかになりましたが、コミュニケーションの強化や政策立案の改善といった潜在的な利益も確認されました。課題を克服し、データ駆動型アドボカシーを効果的に実施するための枠組みが提示されています。

title: Flexible Platforms? An Ethnographic Study of Flexible Scheduling in Platform-Mediated Delivery
authors: Kusk, Kalle
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores flexible scheduling in platform-mediated delivery through ethnographic methods, analyzing workers' experiences and challenges in gig economy platforms to understand their flexibility aspect better.
problem_english: The research problem focused on the misconception of 'flexibility' in platform-mediated delivery jobs. While platforms advertise flexible work schedules, workers often face constraints due to algorithmic management which restricts true flexibility.
method_english: Using ethnographic research, the study involved in-depth interviews and observations with delivery workers. This approach allowed for comprehensive insights into their lived experiences, highlighting discrepancies between promised flexibility and actual work conditions.
results_english: Results revealed that while platforms tout flexibility, workers face scheduling challenges, dictated by algorithms that impact control over work hours. These findings suggest reevaluating how gig work flexibility is portrayed and managed by platforms.
summary_japanese: 本研究はプラットフォーム媒介型配達における柔軟なスケジュールを民族学的方法で探求し、ギグ経済プラットフォームでの労働者の経験と課題を分析します。
problem_japanese: プラットフォーム媒介型配達業務における「柔軟性」の誤解が課題です。プラットフォームは柔軟な勤務時間を広告しますが、実際にはアルゴリズム管理によって労働者の柔軟性が制約されることが多いです。
method_japanese: 民族学的研究手法を用い、配達労働者への詳細なインタビューと観察を行いました。これにより、約束された柔軟性と実際の労働条件の矛盾を強調した包括的洞察を提供します。
results_japanese: 結果はプラットフォームが柔軟性を謳う一方で、アルゴリズムによって影響される勤務時間の制約を労働者が直面することを示しました。これによりギグ労働の柔軟性の評価と管理の改善が必要です。

title: Gig2Gether: Datasharing to Empower, Unify and Demystify Gig Work
authors: Hsieh, Jane and Zhang, Angie and Surati, Sajel and Xie, Sijia and Ayala, Yeshua and Sathiya, Nithila and Kuo, Tzu-Sheng and Lee, Min Kyung and Zhu, Haiyi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Gig2Gether aims to empower gig workers through collective data sharing, enhancing transparency and unity in gig work, while clarifying uncertainties in the hiring process.
problem_english: Gig workers often face challenges like lack of transparency in compensation, inconsistency in work availability, and isolation. These issues lead to power imbalances between workers and platforms, and can exacerbate disagreements and misunderstandings regarding earnings and tasks.
method_english: Gig2Gether introduces a platform for gig workers to share data on earnings, tasks, and working conditions. By leveraging data collected from multiple sources, Gig2Gether provides insights and analytics that enhance decision-making and foster unity among gig workers.
results_english: The implementation of Gig2Gether successfully increased transparency in gig work, improved how workers understand their tasks and earnings, and enhanced solidarity by enabling collective discussion and problem-solving, thus mitigating power imbalances.
summary_japanese: Gig2Getherはデータ共有によってギグワーカーを支援し、透明性を向上させてギグワークの不確実性を解消します。
problem_japanese: ギグワーカーは報酬の透明性の欠如や契約数の不規則性、孤立に悩まされており、これらがプラットフォームとワーカー間の権力格差を魅せ、報酬やタスクに対する不満を増幅します。
method_japanese: Gig2Getherはギグワーカーが報酬やタスク、勤務条件に関するデータを共有するプラットフォームを提供し、多くのソースから集めたデータを利用して意思決定を支援し団結を促進します。
results_japanese: Gig2Getherの実装によりギグワークの透明性が向上し、ワーカーが自身のタスクや報酬をより深く理解し、集団討論や問題解決が可能になり権力格差が緩和されました。

title: Letters from Future Self: Augmenting the Letter-Exchange Exercise with LLM-based Agents to Enhance Young Adults' Career Exploration
authors: Jeon, Hayeon and Yoon, Suhwoo and Lee, Keyeun and Kim, Seo Hyeong and Kim, Esther Hehsun and Cho, Seonghye and Ko, Yena and Yang, Soeun and Dabbish, Laura and Zimmerman, John and Kim, Eun-mee and Lim, Hajin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces LLM-based agents in a letter-exchange exercise to aid young adults in career exploration, enhancing self-reflection and decision-making processes.
problem_english: Young adults often struggle with career exploration, facing challenges in self-reflection and decision-making due to a lack of guidance and structured support. Traditional exercises can be insufficient, limiting deeper understanding and exploration.
method_english: The researchers employed LLM-based (Large Language Model) agents to simulate future-self letters, augmenting traditional letter-exchange exercises to provide personalized and enriched reflections for participants. This approach aimed to facilitate deeper career insight.
results_english: The integration of LLM-based agents improved participant engagement and provided valuable insights into career choices. Young adults reported enhanced self-reflection and a clearer understanding of future aspirations.
summary_japanese: 研究はLLMベースのエージェントを用いた手紙交換法を紹介し、若者のキャリア探索を支援し、自己反省と意思決定を促進する。
problem_japanese: 若者はキャリア探索に困難を抱え、自己反省や意思決定の欠如が課題となっている。従来の方法では理解や探索が不十分であることがある。
method_japanese: 研究者はLLMベースのエージェントを使用し、参加者に個別の反省を提供するため、従来の手紙交換法を強化しました。この手法はキャリアへの洞察を深めることを目的としています。
results_japanese: LLMベースのエージェントの統合は参加者の関与を改善し、キャリア選択についての貴重な洞察を提供しました。若者は自己反省が促進され、将来の目標が明確になったと報告しました。

title: Nurturing Capabilities: Unpacking the Gap in Human-Centered Evaluations of AI-Based Systems
authors: Khullar, Aman and Nalin, Nikhil and Prasad, Abhishek and Mampilli, Ann John and Kumar, Neha
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines the gap in human-centered evaluations of AI systems, focusing on nurturing capabilities rather than just performance metrics.
problem_english: Traditional AI evaluations often emphasize performance metrics like accuracy and efficiency, overlooking the human-centered impact. This leads to a capability gap where user needs, values, and contexts are not adequately measured, causing a misalignment between AI capabilities and real-world requirements.
method_english: The authors propose a framework for human-centered AI evaluations that goes beyond technical performance. This framework includes qualitative measures such as user satisfaction, ethical considerations, and the contextual fit of AI systems to enhance alignment with human values.
results_english: The proposed framework highlighted significant discrepancies between current AI evaluation practices and human-centered needs. Case studies demonstrated the framework’s effectiveness in evaluating AI systems more holistically, emphasizing user wellbeing and alignment with societal values.
summary_japanese: AIシステムの人間中心評価のギャップを探り、性能指標ではなく能力育成に焦点を当てる。
problem_japanese: 従来のAI評価は性能指標に重きを置き、人間中心の影響を見落としがちである。これにより、ユーザーニーズや価値観、文脈が十分に測定されず、AIの能力と実世界の要求との不整合が生じる。
method_japanese: 著者は、技術的性能を超えた人間中心のAI評価のフレームワークを提案。これには、ユーザー満足度や倫理的考慮、AIシステムの文脈適合性等の定性的指標が含まれる。
results_japanese: 提案したフレームワークは、現行のAI評価慣行と人間中心のニーズとの重大な不一致を浮き彫りにした。事例研究で、ユーザーの幸福と社会的価値への整合性を強調しつつ、より全体的な評価を示した。

title: Walk in Their Shoes to Navigate Your Own Path: Learning About Procrastination Through A Serious Game
authors: Zhang, Runhua and Gan, Jiaqi and Gao, Shangyuan and Chen, Siyi and Wu, Xinyu and Chen, Dong and Tian, Yulin and Wang, Qi and An, Pengcheng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a serious game designed to teach users about procrastination. The game simulates real-world scenarios where players navigate challenges and observe the outcomes of their decisions, enhancing understanding and personal growth.
problem_english: Procrastination is a long-standing issue affecting productivity and mental well-being. Current strategies to address procrastination often lack engagement and practical application, which results in limited effectiveness. There is a need for innovative solutions that facilitate learning and behavior change.
method_english: The authors developed a serious game that mirrors procrastination scenarios. The game enables players to experience the consequences of procrastination, encouraging strategic thinking and learning through immersive, interactive experiences. Player feedback and performance data are analyzed to assess its educational impact.
results_english: The game showed promise as an educational tool, with players demonstrating increased awareness and understanding of procrastination. Participants reported a deeper insight into their behavior, and data indicated improved decision-making skills, suggesting the game's potential to foster positive personal development.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ユーザーに先延ばしについて学ばせるためのゲームを紹介する。ゲームは実際のシナリオをシミュレートし、体験を通じて理解を深める。
problem_japanese: 先延ばしは生産性と精神的健康に影響する長年の課題である。従来の対策は実践的でなく、効果が限定的。学習と行動変容を促す新しい解決策が求められている。
method_japanese: 著者らは先延ばしのシナリオを模倣するゲームを開発した。このゲームはプレイヤーがその影響を体験することで戦略的思考を促し、対話的な体験を通じて学習を促進する。プレイヤーのフィードバックとデータを解析し教育効果を評価した。
results_japanese: ゲームは教育的ツールとしての可能性を示し、プレイヤーは先延ばしについての理解を深めた。参加者は自身の行動についての深い洞察を報告し、データは意思決定スキルの向上を示し、個人の発展を促す可能性を示唆している。

title: "I am a Technology Creator": Black Girls as Technosocial Change Agents in a Culturally-Responsive Robotics Camp
authors: Li, Chun and Solyst, Jaemarie and Scott, Safiyyah and Howse, Gabriella and Nkrumah, Tara and Walker, Erin and Ogan, Amy and Stewart, Angela E.B.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores Black girls as technosocial change agents in a robotics camp, highlighting the impact of culturally-responsive approaches on empowerment and technology engagement.
problem_english: The study addresses the underrepresentation and lack of empowerment of Black girls in technology fields, examining how culturally-responsive educational environments can foster their roles as creators and change agents in technology.
method_english: A culturally-responsive robotics camp was designed, using mentorship and interactive activities tailored to the cultural backgrounds of Black girls, aiming to enhance their engagement and skills in technology creation.
results_english: Participants showed increased confidence and interest in technology fields, identifying themselves as technology creators, empowered to pursue further education and careers in STEM, indicating the effectiveness of the camp's culturally-responsive design.
summary_japanese: ブラック少女が技術変革の担い手となる様をロボットキャンプで探索し、文化的対応が彼女らの意欲をどう高めるかを検討。
problem_japanese: 技術分野でのブラック少女の低い代表性とエンパワーメント不足に対し、文化応答的な教育環境が彼女らを技術創造者として育成できる可能性を検証する。
method_japanese: ブラック少女の文化的背景に応じたメンターシップと対話的活動を組み合わせた文化的対応のロボットキャンプを設計し、技術創造への関与を強化する。
results_japanese: 参加者の技術分野への興味と自信が向上し、技術創造者として認識され、STEMでの学業・キャリアの追求に意欲を示し、キャンプの効果を示した。

title: Designed \& Discovered Euphoria: Insights from Trans-Femme Players' Experiences of Gender Euphoria in Video Games
authors: Liang, Shano and Cormier, Michelle V and Bohrer, Rose and Toups Dugas, Phoebe O.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores trans-femme players' experiences of gender euphoria in video games, revealing how designed and discovered elements in games contribute to their positive gender experiences.
problem_english: Trans-femme players often face unique challenges in accessing and expressing gender euphoria due to societal and gaming barriers, leading to limited understanding of how video games can support their gender identity positively.
method_english: The research utilizes qualitative interviews and thematic analysis, gathering first-hand accounts from trans-femme gamers to explore their experiences of gender euphoria in video game environments, focusing on both designed game features and emergent gameplay elements.
results_english: The study identifies key elements in games facilitating gender euphoria for trans-femme players, such as customizable avatars, inclusive narratives, and community interactions, highlighting their role in affirming trans identities.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ゲーム内の設計および発見された要素がトランスフェムプレイヤーのジェンダーの幸福感にどのように貢献するかを探求しています。
problem_japanese: トランスフェムプレイヤーは、社会的およびゲーム内の障壁により、ジェンダーの幸福感の獲得と表現に困難を抱えることが多く、ビデオゲームが彼らのジェンダーアイデンティティをどのようにサポートするかの理解が不足しています。
method_japanese: 質的インタビューとテーマ分析を用い、トランスフェムゲーマーからの直接の証言を収集し、ゲーム環境におけるジェンダーの幸福感の経験を、設計されたゲーム特徴と出現するゲームプレイ要素の両面から探ります。
results_japanese: 本研究は、トランスフェムプレイヤーのジェンダーの幸福感を促進するゲームの重要な要素、例えばカスタマイズ可能なアバターや包摂的な物語、コミュニティとの相互作用を特定し、それらがトランスアイデンティティの肯定における役割を明らかにしました。

title: Hidden in Plain Sight: a Structured Analysis of Privacy Policies in the Context of Body-worn 'FemTech' Technologies
authors: Grimme, Sophie and Spoerl, Susanna Marie and Jung, Frederike and Koelle, Marion
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study analyzes privacy policies of body-worn 'FemTech' technologies, revealing hidden risks. It evaluates whether policies adequately protect user privacy by providing transparency and control over personal data. Recommendations for improved policy design are offered.
problem_english: Body-worn 'FemTech' devices collect sensitive personal data, posing significant privacy risks. However, existing privacy policies often fail to offer sufficient transparency and control to users, leaving critical gaps in privacy protection. Analyzing these policies can uncover design flaws and yield improvement insights.
method_english: The authors conduct a structured analysis of privacy policies from various 'FemTech' companies. They evaluate transparency, user control, and overall adequacy in privacy protection, combining quantitative analysis with qualitative insights. Additionally, they compare policy designs against privacy best practices.
results_english: The analysis revealed that many privacy policies lack clarity, with vague language and insufficient detail about data handling. Significant discrepancies exist between policy statements and actual practices. The study provided actionable recommendations for enhancing transparency and control for users.
summary_japanese: 本研究は体に装着するFemTech技術のプライバシーポリシーを分析し、隠されたリスクを明かします。個人データの透明性と制御を評価し、改善のための提案を行います。
problem_japanese: 体に装着するFemTechデバイスは、敏感な個人データを収集し、重要なプライバシーリスクをもたらします。現行のプライバシーポリシーは、透明性や制御を十分に提供しておらず、プライバシー保護に重大な欠陥があります。これらの政策を分析することで設計上の欠陥を露呈し、改善のための洞察を得ることができます。
method_japanese: 著者は様々なFemTech企業のプライバシーポリシーを構造的に分析します。透明性、ユーザーの制御、およびプライバシー保護の全体的な十分性を評価し、定量的分析と定性的洞察を組み合わせています。また、プライバシーのベストプラクティスと政策のデザインを比較しています。
results_japanese: 分析により、多くのプライバシーポリシーが曖昧な言葉やデータ処理の詳細の欠如で明確さを欠いていることが判明しました。政策声明と実際の慣行には重大な差異があります。ユーザーへの透明性と制御を強化するための実用的な提案が提供されました。

title: Saying No to "Yes Means Yes": Limitations of Affirmative Consent for Mitigating Unwanted Behavior Online According to Women and LGBTQIA+ Stakeholders
authors: Burger, Braeden and Tebbe, Devin and Walquist, Emma and Kind, Toby and Zytko, Douglas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper critiques affirmative consent policies for curbing online unwanted behavior. Through surveys and interviews with women and LGBTQIA+ stakeholders, it highlights perceived ineffectiveness and suggests alternative measures for better protection.
problem_english: The study addresses the perceived ineffectiveness of affirmative consent policies in mitigating unwanted behavior on digital platforms. Women and LGBTQIA+ stakeholders consistently experience such behaviors, and the 'Yes Means Yes' approach may not adequately protect these vulnerable groups from unwanted interactions online.
method_english: The research employs a mixed-methods approach, combining quantitative surveys and qualitative interviews with women and LGBTQIA+ stakeholders. This approach aims to gather diverse perspectives on the limitations and challenges of current affirmative consent frameworks in effectively preventing unwanted online interactions.
results_english: Findings reveal significant dissatisfaction among women and LGBTQIA+ stakeholders regarding current affirmative consent schemes. These policies often fail to address nuanced scenarios of consent, leading to persistent unwanted behavior. Stakeholders recommend more nuanced, context-aware consent frameworks to enhance online safety and user empowerment.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、「Yes Means Yes」政策がオンラインでの不望行為を抑制する能力に限界があることを批判し、代替措置を提案します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、デジタルプラットフォーム上での望まない行為を緩和する際の肯定的同意ポリシーの効果の限界に対処しています。女性やLGBTQIA+ステークホルダーが一貫してこのような行動を経験しており、「Yes Means Yes」アプローチは不十分な可能性があります。
method_japanese: この研究は混合研究法を採用し、定量的調査と質的インタビューで女性とLGBTQIA+の視点を収集。現行の肯定的同意フレームワークの限界を探ります。
results_japanese: 現行の肯定的同意制度に不満を持つ声が多く、複雑な同意シナリオに対応できず望まない行動が続く。より文脈を考慮した同意フレームワークが推奨されます。

title: The Unintended Costs of Platform Interventions: Black-Owned Restaurants and Yelp Reputation
authors: Moy, Cameron and Bui, Matthew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines the unintended consequences of platform interventions, specifically focusing on Yelp's actions affecting black-owned restaurants and their reputations. The research highlights complexities in digital intermediation and its impact on marginalized communities.
problem_english: Platforms like Yelp intervene to support marginalized groups, but such actions can have unintended consequences. For black-owned restaurants, these interventions can change reputations, leading to complex interactions between digital visibility and perceived quality or authenticity, affecting business operations and customer trust.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-methods study, including quantitative analysis of Yelp ratings and qualitative interviews with black-owned restaurant owners. This approach helped understand the impact of Yelp's interventions on restaurant reputation and the broader socio-economic implications on marginalized businesses.
results_english: The study found that Yelp's interventions sometimes negatively impacted black-owned restaurants' reputations by altering review patterns. This effect led to changes in customer engagement and perceptions, highlighting the complexity of digital support mechanisms and their socio-economic impacts on marginalized enterprises.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、Yelpの介入が黒人経営のレストランの評価に与える影響とその予期せぬ結果を検討し、デジタル仲介の複雑さを明らかにします。
problem_japanese: Yelpなどのプラットフォームが社会的弱者を支援するために介入するも、その結果として予期せぬ影響を与える可能性があります。黒人経営レストランに対する介入が評判を変え、デジタルと見られる品質や信頼性の間で複雑な相互作用を引き起こし、ビジネスに影響を与えます。
method_japanese: 著者らは定量的なYelp評価分析と黒人経営レストランの所有者への質的インタビューを行い、Yelp介入の影響を探り、社会的弱者ビジネスへの広範な社会経済的影響を理解しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、Yelpの介入が黒人経営レストランの評価に影響を与え、レビューのパターンを変えてしまうことがあると発見しました。この効果により顧客の関与や認識が変化し、デジタル支援メカニズムと弱者企業への影響の複雑性が浮き彫りとなりました。

title: Why Can't Black Women Just Be?: Black Femme Content Creators Navigating Algorithmic Monoliths
authors: Williams, Gianna and Chen, Natalie and DeVito, Michael Ann and To, Alexandra
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how Black women content creators navigate algorithmic biases on digital platforms, emphasizing the systemic hurdles faced and strategies employed.
problem_english: Black women content creators face challenges due to algorithmic biases which marginalize their work, impacting visibility and engagement in digital platforms where they develop their content and audience.
method_english: Using qualitative methods, the researchers conducted interviews with Black femme content creators, analyzing their experiences to identify common strategies and obstacles faced in overcoming algorithmic biases.
results_english: The study revealed specific coping mechanisms used by Black women creators such as adapting content to fit algorithms, forming support networks, and activism to challenge algorithmic discrimination and foster inclusion.
summary_japanese: ブラック女性コンテンツ制作者がデジタルプラットフォームでのアルゴリズム的偏りに立ち向かう方法を調査しました。
problem_japanese: ブラック女性コンテンツ制作者は、デジタルプラットフォームのアルゴリズム的偏りにより作品が可視化されにくく、その影響で作品のエンゲージメントが低迷する課題に直面します。
method_japanese: 質的手法を用い、ブラック女性コンテンツ制作者とのインタビューを実施し、その経験を分析して、アルゴリズムバイアス克服に向けた共通攻略法や課題を特定しました。
results_japanese: この研究は、ブラック女性制作者がアルゴリズムに適応させたコンテンツ作りや支援ネットワーク形成、アルゴリズム差別に対抗する活動などの具体的な対応策を明らかにしました。

title: “It feels like we're not meeting the criteria”: Examining and Mitigating the Cascading Effects of Bias in Automatic Speech Recognition in Spoken Language Interfaces.
authors: Ezema, Kelechi and Chandler, Chelsea and Southwell, Rosy and Cholendiran, Niranjan and D'Mello, Sidney
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines biases in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) in spoken language interfaces, and proposes strategies to mitigate cascading effects impacting users of diverse demographics.
problem_english: Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems often exhibit biases affecting users from diverse demographic backgrounds. These biases can lead to cascading effects, negatively impacting user experience, access to technology, and equitable tech usage. Addressing these biases is crucial for ensuring inclusivity and fairness in tech-driven communications.
method_english: The authors explore the cascading effects of bias in ASR systems through empirical analysis of speech data and propose mitigation strategies. They utilize a combination of machine learning model adjustments and evaluation metrics focusing on fairness to reduce bias and improve system performance.
results_english: The study demonstrates successful bias mitigation, with improved recognition accuracy across diverse demographic speech patterns. It highlights the potential for increased inclusivity and fairness in ASR-powered interfaces, although challenges in completely removing biases remain.
summary_japanese: この論文は、話し言葉のインターフェースにおける音声認識の偏見を分析し、多様なユーザに影響を与える階層的な影響を軽減する戦略を提案しています。
problem_japanese: 音声認識システムは、多様な背景を持つユーザーに対して偏見を示すことがあり、これが技術へのアクセスや公平な利用において悪影響を及ぼす可能性があります。この偏見を解決することは、包括性と公平性を保証するために重要です。
method_japanese: 著者は音声データの実証分析を通じて音声認識システムの偏見の階層的影響を探り、機械学習モデルの調整と公平性に焦点を当てた評価指標を使用して偏見を軽減しシステム性能を向上させる戦略を提案します。
results_japanese: 研究は偏見の軽減を成功させ、多様な発話パターンにおける認識精度の改善を示しています。音声認識インターフェースでの包括性と公平性の向上の可能性を示していますが、完全な偏見除去には未だ課題が残ります。

title: BallistoBud: Heart Rate Variability Monitoring using Earbud Accelerometry for Stress Assessment
authors: Islam, Md Saiful and Rahman, Md Mahbubur and Bin Morshed, Mehrab and Lin, David J and Li, Yunzhi and Zhou, Hao and Mendes, Wendy Berry and Kuang, Jilong
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: BallistoBud uses accelerometry in earbuds to monitor heart rate variability for stress assessment, offering a non-invasive and continuous approach to mental health monitoring.
problem_english: Traditional heart rate variability measurement methods are often cumbersome, requiring specialized equipment and setting, limiting their applicability in everyday stress assessment and mental health monitoring.
method_english: The BallistoBud system leverages accelerometers within standard earbuds to capture subtle head motions from cardiac vibrations, enabling the real-time monitoring of heart rate variability for stress assessment.
results_english: BallistoBud demonstrated high accuracy in heart rate variability measurement, comparable to traditional methods, thus validating its potential as a practical tool for real-time stress monitoring using everyday devices.
summary_japanese: BallistoBudはイヤホンの加速度計を用いて、心拍変動を監視しストレスを評価する、非侵襲かつ連続的な手法を提供します。
problem_japanese: 従来の心拍変動測定法は専門機器や特別な環境が必要で日常的なストレス評価やメンタルヘルスの監視を妨げていました。
method_japanese: BallistoBudは標準イヤホン内の加速度計を活用し、心臓の振動による頭の微細運動を捉え、リアルタイムで心拍変動を監視します。
results_japanese: BallistoBudは伝統的な方法に匹敵する高精度の心拍変動測定を実証し、日常デバイスを用いたリアルタイムストレス監視の実用ツールとしての可能性を確認しました。

title: ECG Necklace: Low-power Wireless Necklace for Continuous ECG monitoring
authors: Xue, Qiuyue (Shirley) and Martin, Eric Steven and Liu, Jiaqing and Wang, Ruiqing and Glenn, Antonio and Li, Richard and Iyer, Vikram and Patel, Shwetak
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents the ECG Necklace, a low-power, wireless necklace designed for continuous ECG monitoring. It aims to provide an unobtrusive way to track heart health over long durations.
problem_english: Current ECG monitoring solutions often require bulky equipment or are not suitable for continuous, long-term use. There is a need for a more practical, comfortable, and low-power solution that can be worn daily without disrupting the user's lifestyle.
method_english: The ECG Necklace uses low-power wireless technology and ergonomic design to provide continuous ECG monitoring. It integrates sensors into a wearable necklace format, ensuring both comfort and functionality, and transmits data wirelessly to a companion app for real-time tracking and analysis.
results_english: The ECG Necklace demonstrated effective continuous ECG monitoring capabilities with minimal power consumption. User studies showed high satisfaction due to its comfort and unobtrusiveness. The device successfully provided reliable heart health data over extended periods.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、連続的な心電図モニタリングのための低消費電力のワイヤレスネックレスであるECGネックレスを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現行の心電図モニタリングは、大型機器を必要とするか、長期間の連続使用に適さないことが多く、日常的に利用可能な実用的で快適な低消費電力の解決策が求められている。
method_japanese: 低消費電力のワイヤレス技術と人間工学に基づくデザインを用いて、継続的な心電図モニタリングを実現するネックレス型デバイスを導入し、データをアプリに無線送信する。
results_japanese: ECGネックレスは効果的なモニタリングと低消費電力を実証。利用者調査での快適性評価は高く、長期的な信頼性データを提供した。

title: Exploring Flow in Real-World Knowledge Work Using Discrete cEEGrid Sensors
authors: Knierim, Michael T. and Stano, Fabio and Kurz, Fabio and Heusch, Antonius and Wilson, Max L.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates flow states in real-world knowledge work using discrete cEEGrid sensors, aiming to better understand the productivity and cognitive states in work environments.
problem_english: The challenge is to accurately detect and analyze flow states in knowledge work settings, which often lack direct and non-invasive methods for continuous monitoring of cognitive states during work tasks.
method_english: Researchers used cEEGrid sensors to unobtrusively monitor neural activities to detect flow states in participants during real-world knowledge work, combining sensor data analysis with subjective assessments of flow experiences.
results_english: The findings demonstrated the effectiveness of cEEGrid sensors in identifying flow states, showing correlations between sensor data and self-reported flow experiences, thus validating the approach for future applications.
summary_japanese: この研究は、知識作業におけるフロー状態をcEEGridセンサーで調査し、生産性と認知状態を理解しようとしています。
problem_japanese: 知識作業環境でのフロー状態検知と分析は難しく、タスク中の認知状態を継続的に監視する直接的、非侵襲的な方法が不足しています。
method_japanese: 研究者は参加者のリアルワールドの知識作業中のフロー状態をcEEGridセンサーで監視し、センサーデータ分析と主観的フロー体験評価を組み合わせました。
results_japanese: cEEGridセンサーはフロー状態を識別するのに有効であり、センサーデータと自己報告されたフロー体験の関連性を示し、今後の応用可能性を確認しました。

title: ID.EARS: One-Ear EEG Device with Biosignal Noise for Real-Time Gesture Recognition and Various Interactions
authors: An, Hyunjin and Oh, Eunkyu and Kim, Yoosung and Kim, Seonho and Park, Dasom and Oh, Changhoon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ID.EARS presents a novel one-ear EEG device designed to reduce biosignal noise, enabling real-time gesture recognition and diverse interactions.
problem_english: Current EEG devices often struggle with biosignal noise and limitations in form factor, making them unsuitable for seamless real-time interaction and gesture recognition applications. Enhancing EEG signal clarity and usability necessitates innovative solutions tailored to mitigate noise while maintaining device compactness and user convenience.
method_english: The study introduces a one-ear EEG device, integrating biosignal noise reduction strategies. The device employs sophisticated noise filtration algorithms, combined with ergonomic design to ensure comfort and usability. This device bridges the gap between efficient signal acquisition and practical application in real-time gesture recognition.
results_english: The ID.EARS device successfully minimized biosignal noise and allowed for accurate, real-time gesture recognition. Testing showed significant improvements in interaction smoothness and device reliability, surpassing traditional methods. User feedback indicated enhanced comfort and usability, proving the device's potential for everyday applications.
summary_japanese: ID.EARSは、ノイズを低減する片耳EEGデバイスを提案し、リアルタイムジェスチャー認識を実現。
problem_japanese: 従来のEEGデバイスはノイズやフォームファクタの制約でリアルタイムでのジェスチャー認識に不適。信号の鮮明化とデバイスのコンパクトさを両立する新しい解決策が必要。
method_japanese: 片耳EEGデバイスを導入し、ノイズ低減戦略を統合。洗練されたフィルタリングアルゴリズムと快適なデザインで、実用的なリアルタイムジェスチャー認識を実現。
results_japanese: ID.EARSデバイスはノイズを効果的に低減し、ジェスチャー認識を向上。従来方法を超えた信頼性と利便性を実証し、日常利用に適した潜在力を示す。

title: PPG Earring: Wireless Smart Earring for Heart Health Monitoring
authors: Xue, Qiuyue (Shirley) and Nissanka, Dilini and Yan, Jiachen Tammy and Wang, Ruiqing and Patel, Shwetak and Iyer, Vikram
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PPG Earring is a wireless smart earring designed for continuous heart health monitoring. It uses photoplethysmography (PPG) to measure heart rate, offering a comfortable alternative to wrist-worn devices. The earring integrates seamlessly into daily life, providing real-time data.
problem_english: Existing wearable heart rate monitors, like wristbands, can be uncomfortable or inconvenient for continuous use. There is a need for an unobtrusive, stylish option that offers reliable real-time heart health monitoring without compromising user comfort. Finding a balance between wearability and data accuracy is crucial.
method_english: The PPG Earring integrates photoplethysmography sensors into a conventional earring design. It measures heart rate using reflected light from blood vessels. Wireless connectivity ensures data transmission to external devices for real-time health monitoring. The design prioritizes comfort and style for everyday wear.
results_english: The PPG Earring performed reliably in heart rate detection, with accuracy comparable to standard wearables. User trials indicated high comfort and ease of integration into daily life. It represents a significant advancement in non-invasive, real-time heart health monitoring technology through wearable accessories.
summary_japanese: PPG Earringは、心臓の健康を監視するためのワイヤレススマートイヤリングです。心拍数を測定し、快適な使用感を提供します。
problem_japanese: 従来型の心拍数モニターは装着が不快である場合があります。快適さとデータの正確性を両立するスタイリッシュで信頼性の高い監視方法が求められています。
method_japanese: PPGセンサーをイヤリングに内蔵し、光の反射を通じて心拍数を測定します。ワイヤレス接続によりリアルタイムモニタリングが可能です。快適さと日常的な装着を重視しています。
results_japanese: 心拍数検出において高い精度を示し、ユーザー試験で快適に日常生活に溶け込みました。スタイリッシュなアクセサリーとして革新を提供します。

title: PalateTouch : Enabling Palate as a Touchpad to Interact with Earphones Using Acoustic Sensing
authors: Zhao, Yankai and Zhang, Jin and Li, Jiao and Sun, Tao
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PalateTouch introduces a method to use the palate as a touch interface for earphones by employing acoustic sensing technology. This novel interaction method offers a hands-free alternative for device control.
problem_english: Traditional methods of interacting with earphones, such as physical buttons or touch controls, can be inconvenient in certain scenarios, such as during physical activities or when hands-free operation is necessary. There is a need for an effective, alternative approach that enables seamless interaction without the use of hands.
method_english: The method utilizes acoustic sensing to detect touch and gestures on the palate. The system is designed to interpret various gestures made by the tongue against the palate, allowing users to control earphones through intuitive actions. The approach leverages sound waves and their reflections to accurately sense different interactions.
results_english: The study demonstrates the system's ability to recognize a variety of touch gestures with high accuracy. The evaluation showed promising results, indicating that users could effectively control their earphones through palate interactions. Feedback from participants highlighted the system's convenience and ease of use.
summary_japanese: PalateTouchは、口蓋をタッチインターフェースとして使用し、耳にかける機器を操作する新技術を提案。触れずに操作可能。
problem_japanese: 従来の物理ボタンやタッチ操作による耳にかける機器の操作は、物理活動中や手が使えない状況では不便。手を使わずにスムーズに操作できる代替手法が求められている。
method_japanese: 音響センシングを用いて口蓋への触覚とジェスチャーを検出する方式。音波とその反射を利用し、舌と口蓋による直感的な動作で耳にかける機器を操作可能にする。
results_japanese: システムは多様なタッチジェスチャーを高精度で認識可能であることが実証された。評価では口蓋操作による効果的な制御が示され、参加者から高い利便性が評価された。

title: The Brain Knows What You Prefer: Using EEG to Decode AR Input Preferences
authors: Zhang, Kaining and Teo, Theophilus and Chang, Eunhee and Zheng, Xianglin and Jing, Allison and Billinghurst, Mark
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study uses EEG signals to decode user preferences in augmented reality (AR) input methods, providing insights into more natural human-computer interaction designs.
problem_english: Current AR input methods often fail to offer intuitive and user-friendly interaction experiences. There is a need to understand and predict user preferences for AR inputs to improve accessibility and user satisfaction. However, traditional approaches for evaluating user preferences can be intrusive and subjective.
method_english: The researchers employed EEG to capture brainwave patterns as participants experienced different AR input methods. Through machine learning algorithms, they decoded these signals to predict user preferences, aiming for a non-intrusive way to assess which AR input methods users find more appealing.
results_english: The study demonstrated that EEG-based approaches could reliably predict user preferences for AR input methods, offering a promising avenue for creating more personalized and user-friendly AR experiences by aligning technology with user expectations and neural responses.
summary_japanese: 本研究はEEG信号を用いてAR入力法のユーザー好みを解読し、自然な人間とコンピュータのインタラクション設計への洞察を提供。
problem_japanese: 現行のAR入力法は直感的でユーザーフレンドリーな体験の提供が難しい。AR入力の好みを理解し、客観的に予測する手法が求められる一方で、従来の評価手法は煩雑で主観的。
method_japanese: EEGで脳波を取得し機械学習で解読し、体験したAR入力法に対するユーザー好みを予測することで、客観的な評価を目指す。
results_japanese: EEGを用いた手法でARの入力好みを正確に予測可能であり、個人に合わせたユーザーフレンドリーなAR体験の提供が期待。

title: Becoming One with Kuddi: Touching Data through an Intimate Data Physicalisation
authors: \'{I}vansd\'{o}ttir, Gu\dh{}r\'{u}n Margr\'{e}t and Park, Joo Young and St\r{a}hl, Anna and Balaam, Madeline
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the intersection of data physicalisation and human intimacy through a wearable device named Kuddi, enabling users to experience data through touch and emotion, creating a personalized data interaction.
problem_english: The challenge presented in this study is finding meaningful ways to connect people with data, beyond traditional data visualization, by fostering an emotional and tactile relationship that enhances understanding and personal engagement with data.
method_english: The authors developed Kuddi, a wearable device designed to translate data into a tactile and emotional experience. Through user studies, they explored how this intimate interaction with data could foster a more personal and emotional connection, impacting how individuals perceive and engage with information.
results_english: Kuddi demonstrated potential in bridging the gap between abstract data and personal experience, allowing users to engage with data on a more meaningful level. Feedback suggested increased emotional connection and understanding, indicating that tactile and intimate data physicalisation can enhance personal interactions with data.
summary_japanese: データフィジカル化と人間の親密性を探り、データを触感や感情で体験できるKuddi装置を介した個別データインタラクションを提供。
problem_japanese: 伝統的なデータ視覚化を超える感情的かつ触覚的なデータ関係を促進し、データへの理解と個人的な関与を高める意味のある方法を見つける課題。
method_japanese: データを触覚及び感情経験に翻訳するウェアラブルデバイスKuddiを開発し、ユーザー調査を通じて親密なデータインタラクションが個人の関与に与える影響を探求。
results_japanese: Kuddiはデータと個人の経験を結びつけ、利用者にとって意味のあるデータ体験を実現。触覚的で親密なフィジカル化がデータとの個人的な接触を向上させる可能性を示唆。

title: Designing Touch Technologies for and with Bodies in Menstrual Discomfort
authors: Park, Joo Young and Zheng, Caroline Yan and Campo Woytuk, Nadia and Huang, Xuni and Balaam, Madeline and Ciolfi Felice, Marianela
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the design of touch technologies aimed at alleviating menstrual discomfort, focusing on collaboration with individuals experiencing such discomfort to create effective solutions.
problem_english: Menstrual discomfort is a prevalent issue that affects many individuals worldwide, yet there is limited technology designed specifically to address and alleviate these experiences. Existing solutions often overlook personalized needs and lack user-centric design processes.
method_english: Researchers employ participatory design involving users with menstrual discomfort to co-create touch technology solutions. Through workshops and iterative design processes, they explore interactive prototypes aiming for personalized, effective relief.
results_english: The study develops a range of touch technology prototypes tailored to individual needs in menstrual discomfort. These prototypes demonstrate potential for effective relief, emphasizing personalization and user collaboration in the design process.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、月経不快感を和らげるためのタッチ技術の設計を探求し、効果的な解決策を創出するために、感じている人々との協力に注目しています。
problem_japanese: 月経不快感は世界中の多くの人々に影響を与える普遍的な問題ですが、これに特化した技術は限られています。既存の解決策は個別のニーズを無視し、ユーザー中心のデザインプロセスに欠けています。
method_japanese: 研究者は月経不快感のユーザーを含む参加型デザインを採用し、タッチ技術解決策を共同で作成します。ワークショップと反復的デザインプロセスを通じて、個別対応で効果的なプロトタイプを模索します。
results_japanese: 研究は個々のニーズに合わせた月経不快感に効果的なタッチ技術のプロトタイプを開発しました。これらのプロトタイプは、効果的な緩和を示し、デザインプロセスにおける個別化とユーザー協力の重要性を強調しています。

title: Identifying Critical Points of Departure for the Design of Self-Fashioning Technologies
authors: Blanco Cardozo, Rebeca and Garrett, Rachael and Samuelsson-Gamboa, Mafalda and Haresamudram, Kashyap and Lisy, Dominika and Rogg, Maria and N\'{u}\~{n}ez-Pacheco, Claudia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates key points of departure for designing self-fashioning technologies, exploring how these technologies can be integrated into users' lives. The authors examine existing methodologies and propose new approaches to enhance self-fashioning capabilities.
problem_english: The design of self-fashioning technologies lacks critical points of departure that adequately account for users' diverse lifestyles. Current methods often fall short in integrating these technologies seamlessly into everyday life, necessitating a new perspective on design processes to enhance their functionality and user engagement.
method_english: The authors conducted an extensive review of existing design methodologies and integrated insights from interdisciplinary fields to propose a framework. This framework prioritizes personal narratives and contextual flexibility, aiming to optimize the design and utilization of self-fashioning technologies for diverse user experiences.
results_english: The proposed framework successfully identifies critical design points that enhance the adaptability and personalization of self-fashioning technologies. User testing showed improved engagement and satisfaction when technologies were tailored to individual lifestyles and allowed for greater interaction and customization.
summary_japanese: この論文は、自己装飾技術の設計における重要な出発点を探り、その技術がユーザーの生活にどのように統合できるかを調査します。
problem_japanese: 自己装飾技術の設計において、ユーザーの多様なライフスタイルを十分に考慮した出発点が欠けています。現在の手法はこれらの技術を日常生活にシームレスに統合するには不十分で、新たなデザインプロセスの視点が必要です。
method_japanese: 既存デザイン手法の広範なレビューを実施し、学際的な洞察を統合してフレームワークを提案。個人の物語とコンテキストの柔軟性を重視し、多様なユーザー体験の最適化を目指します。
results_japanese: 提案されたフレームワークは、自己装飾技術の適応性とパーソナライゼーションを向上させる重要な設計ポイントを特定し、ユーザーテストではライフスタイルに合わせた技術がエンゲージメントや満足度を向上させることが示されました。

title: Integrating Technology into Self-Management Ecosystems: Young Adults with Type 1 Diabetes in the UK using Smartwatches
authors: Gordon James, Sam and Armstrong, Miranda Elaine Glynis and Abdallah, Zahraa S. and Emerson, Harry and O'Kane, Aisling Ann
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines how smartwatches support the self-management of Type 1 diabetes in young adults in the UK. It evaluates the integration of technology within self-management ecosystems, considering user experience and effectiveness.
problem_english: Young adults with Type 1 diabetes face challenges in managing their condition efficiently. Traditional monitoring methods can be restrictive and lack integration with everyday technology care systems, impacting adherence and overall management outcomes.
method_english: A mixed-methods approach, including interviews and surveys, was used to study young adults' experiences with smartwatches. The study analyzed user interactions, benefits, and limitations, focusing on the integration of technology in diabetes self-management ecosystems.
results_english: Results indicated enhanced monitoring and management capabilities using smartwatches. Participants reported improved adherence to diabetes management routines, increased convenience, and satisfaction with technology integration, although challenges with device accuracy and usability were noted.
summary_japanese: イギリスの1型糖尿病の若年成人の自己管理にスマートウォッチがどのように支援するかを評価する研究。
problem_japanese: 1型糖尿病の若年成人は効率的な管理が難しく、従来の監視方法は制約があり、日常の技術ケアシステムとの統合が不足しているため管理結果に影響します。
method_japanese: スマートウォッチ使用経験を調査するためにインタビューとアンケートによる混合手法を用い、技術が糖尿病自己管理システムにどのように統合されるかを分析。
results_japanese: スマートウォッチを使用した管理能力向上が確認され、管理習慣への忠実度と利便性が向上。ただし、デバイスの精度と使いやすさに課題も指摘された。

title: Technical Responses To Critique: The Case Of Skin Tone
authors: Bhattacharjee, Sayan and Ribes, David
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines technical solutions to the issues of skin tone representation in computing, focusing on critiques and advancements in inclusivity and accuracy.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of accurately representing diverse skin tones in computing systems, a critical issue due to biases in technologies that cater to dominant groups, leading to marginalization and misrepresentation of underrepresented populations.
method_english: The authors analyze current technical responses and critique historical biases in skin tone representation, using case studies and technological assessments to explore effective solutions that improve inclusivity and decrease misrepresentation.
results_english: Findings indicate significant improvements in inclusivity with emerging technologies, but also highlight persistent issues. Recommendations for future work include advancing algorithmic fairness and establishing more inclusive datasets to better represent diversity in skin tones.
summary_japanese: この論文は、コンピューティングにおける肌の色調表現の問題に対する技術的解決策を検討し、包括性と正確性の向上に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、コンピューティングシステムにおける多様な肌色調の正確な表現に関する課題に取り組んでいます。この問題は、支配的なグループに迎合する技術の偏りが原因で、代表されにくい集団が周縁化されるため、重要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは、ケーススタディや技術評価を用いて、肌色調表現の歴史的偏りを批判し、包括性を向上し誤表現を減少させる効果的な解決策を探ります。
results_japanese: 結果は、新技術による包括性の向上を示す一方で、持続する問題も強調しました。今後の課題として、アルゴリズムの公平性の向上と、皮膚色の多様性をより適切に表現する包括的なデータセットの確立が推奨されます。

title: The Body as Its Own Best Sensor - An Autoethnographic Study of the Sensitivities of the Body in Long-Distance Running
authors: Tholander, Jakob
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how the human body acts as an effective sensor, particularly in long-distance running, highlighting the body's sensitivities and self-awareness through autoethnographic methods.
problem_english: Understanding the complexities and subtleties of how the human body perceives and responds to long-distance running without relying solely on external sensors or devices remains underexplored, necessitating deeper investigation into the body's self-awareness.
method_english: The research employs autoethnographic methods, involving detailed self-observation and reflection by the researcher on personal experiences and bodily responses during long-distance running, providing insights into bodily self-awareness.
results_english: The findings reveal the body's intrinsic capability to sense and adapt to various running conditions, emphasizing a rich, nuanced self-awareness that surpasses traditional monitoring technologies, offering new dimensions of understanding body sensitivities.
summary_japanese: 本研究は長距離ランニングにおける身体の感受性と自己認識を、自己民族誌的手法で探究します。
problem_japanese: 長距離ランニング中の人体が外部センサーやデバイスなしにどのように複雑で微妙な反応を示すかについての理解は未成熟であり、身体の自己認識に関する深い洞察が必要です。
method_japanese: 研究者自身が長距離ランニング中の経験と身体反応を詳細に観察し、反映する自己民族誌的手法を使用し、身体の自己認識に関する洞察を提供します。
results_japanese: 結果は、身体が様々なランニング条件に感知し適応する能力を暗示し、既存のモニタリング技術を超える豊かで微妙な自己認識を強調します。

title: Toward Feminist Ways of Sensing the Menstruating Body
authors: Campo Woytuk, Nadia and Tuli, Anupriya and Park, Joo Young and Turmo Vidal, Laia and Tobin, Deirdre and Reddy, Anuradha and Vincenzi, Beatrice and Maslik, Jan and Ciolfi Felice, Marianela and Balaam, Madeline
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores feminist perspectives on sensing and understanding the menstruating body, aiming to challenge traditional and patriarchal views on menstruation and promote more inclusive technologies.
problem_english: The study addresses the lack of feminist-centric approaches in designing technologies related to menstruation, which often perpetuate patriarchal norms and overlook diverse experiences and needs of those who menstruate.
method_english: Researchers employed participatory design methods with individuals who menstruate to collaboratively create sensor-based technologies that reflect feminist values and priorities, emphasizing inclusivity and diverse bodily experiences.
results_english: The findings highlight successful collaborative efforts in developing menstrual technologies that align with feminist ideals, showcasing designs that respect bodily autonomy, offer personalized insights, and resist stigmatization.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、生理的身体を感知する際のフェミニストの視点を探求し、伝統的な視点を問うて包括的な技術促進を目指す。
problem_japanese: 月経に関連する技術設計におけるフェミニスト中心のアプローチの欠如が課題。これにより、社会的に支配的な規範が無意識に踏襲され、多様な月経経験とニーズが軽視されている。
method_japanese: 月経のある個人と共同でセンサベースの技術を設計する参加型デザイン手法を使用し、フェミニストの価値と優先事項を反映した技術を模索。
results_japanese: フェミニスト理念に沿った月経技術の開発が成功し、身体の自律を尊重したデザインや個別の洞察を提供し、汚名を拒む結果が重要視された。

title: CT4ALL: Towards Putting Teachers in the Loop to Advance Automated Computational Thinking Metric Assessments in Game-Based Learning
authors: Troiano, Giovanni M and Cassidy, Michael and Morales, Daniel Escobar and Pons, Guillermo and Abdollahi, Amir and Robles, Gregorio and Puttick, Gillian and Harteveld, Casper
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CT4ALL proposes integrating teachers into the automated assessment of computational thinking in game-based learning, enhancing the accuracy and effectiveness of these evaluations.
problem_english: The current challenge in game-based learning is the lack of accurate, automated computational thinking assessments that effectively involve educators, who can provide context and insight not possible with algorithms alone.
method_english: CT4ALL introduces a framework that combines automated assessment tools with teacher feedback, allowing educators to input observations and insights, thereby refining the results produced by automated systems and tailoring them to specific educational contexts.
results_english: Initial trials of CT4ALL demonstrated that involving teachers in the assessment loop improved both the accuracy and relevance of computational thinking evaluations in game-based learning environments, benefiting both educators and students.
summary_japanese: CT4ALLは教師を組み込み、ゲームベース学習での計算思考評価を自動化し、精度と効果を向上させる。
problem_japanese: ゲームベース学習では、教師の知識を反映した、正確で効果的な自動計算思考評価が不足しており、アルゴリズムだけでは達成できないコンテキストと洞察を補完する必要がある。
method_japanese: CT4ALLは、自動評価ツールと教師のフィードバックを融合した枠組みを導入。教師が観察を入力し、自動生成された結果を改善し、教育コンテキストに合わせる。
results_japanese: CT4ALLの初期試験では、教師が評価に関与することで、計算思考評価の精度と関連性が向上し、教師と生徒の双方に利益があることが示された。

title: Exploring Security and Privacy Discourse on Twitter During the `Justice Pour Nahel' Movement in France
authors: Laabadli, Hiba and Ma, Yimeng and Radkova, Sofia and Emami-Naeini, Pardis
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines security and privacy discourse on Twitter during the `Justice Pour Nahel' movement in France, analyzing tweets to understand public concerns and discussions.
problem_english: The study addresses the need to understand public perceptions and discussions regarding security and privacy during social movements, especially focusing on the `Justice Pour Nahel' in France, emphasizing the influence of online platforms like Twitter.
method_english: The authors collected and analyzed tweets using natural language processing and sentiment analysis techniques to identify key themes and sentiments related to security and privacy during the `Justice Pour Nahel' movement.
results_english: The analysis revealed that security and privacy concerns were prevalent in the discourse, with users expressing criticisms and apprehensions regarding governmental actions and surveillance, highlighting the role of social media in shaping public opinion.
summary_japanese: フランスの「Justice Pour Nahel」運動中のTwitter上でのセキュリティとプライバシーの議論を分析し、公共の関心と議論を理解する。
problem_japanese: 社会運動中のセキュリティとプライバシーに関する公共の認識と議論を理解する必要性に取り組み、特にフランスの「Justice Pour Nahel」に焦点を当て、Twitterのようなオンラインプラットフォームの影響を強調する。
method_japanese: ナチュラル言語処理と感情分析技術を使用してツイートを収集・分析し、「Justice Pour Nahel」運動中のセキュリティとプライバシーに関する主要テーマと感情を特定した。
results_japanese: 分析により、セキュリティとプライバシーの懸念が議論の中で広く見られ、ユーザーは政府の行動と監視について批判と不安を表現し、ソーシャルメディアが世論形成に果たす役割を浮き彫りにした。

title: Playing Dumb to Get Smart: Creating and Evaluating an LLM-based Teachable Agent within University Computer Science Classes
authors: Rogers, Kantwon and Davis, Michael and Maharana, Mallesh and Etheredge, Pete and Chernova, Sonia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents an LLM-based teachable agent designed for university computer science classes to enhance learning by playing "dumb" and prompting student engagement.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of increasing student engagement and comprehension in computer science classes by employing a teachable agent that simulates ignorance, thereby encouraging students to explain and teach, which deepens their understanding.
method_english: An LLM-based teachable agent was developed to act as a student learning companion. By intentionally making errors or asking naive questions, it prompts students to articulate their understanding and correct the agent, enhancing learning outcomes.
results_english: The results demonstrate that the LLM-based teachable agent effectively increases student engagement and improves learning outcomes by encouraging students to actively participate in the teaching process, thereby strengthening their comprehension of computer science concepts.
summary_japanese: 大学のコンピュータサイエンスクラスでの学習を促進するLLMベースの教えられるエージェントを提案します。
problem_japanese: コンピュータサイエンスの授業において、学生が説明や指導を通じて理解を深めるために、無知を装う教えられるエージェントを用いて学生の関与と理解を向上する課題に取り組む。
method_japanese: 学生の学習パートナーとして機能するLLMベースの教えられるエージェントを開発し、意図的に誤りを犯し、学生に理解を説明しエージェントを修正させることで学習効果を高めます。
results_japanese: LLMベースの教えられるエージェントは、学生の関与を効果的に高め、教えるプロセスに積極的に参加させることで理解を深める結果を示しました。

title: SeQR: A User-Friendly and Secure-by-Design Configurator for Enterprise Wi-Fi
authors: Hasan, S Mahmudul and Tu, Che Wei and Hoque, Endadul and Chowdhury, Omar and Chau, Sze Yiu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SeQR is designed to simplify enterprise Wi-Fi configuration, ensuring security and user-friendliness. It offers solutions for common Wi-Fi setup issues, focusing on ease of use and protection against attacks.
problem_english: The major issue addressed by SeQR is the complexity and security vulnerabilities associated with configuring enterprise Wi-Fi networks. Users often find it challenging to manage advanced settings, leading to potential security breaches and inefficient network setups.
method_english: SeQR employs a secure-by-design approach, integrating user-friendly configurations with advanced security protocols. It provides a guided configuration process that helps users implement security best practices without requiring deep technical knowledge.
results_english: The implementation of SeQR resulted in simplified Wi-Fi configurations that were both easy for users to establish and robust against security threats. Testing showed increased user satisfaction and reduced instances of configuration errors, leading to more secure and efficient networks.
summary_japanese: SeQRは企業Wi-Fiの設定を簡略化し、セキュリティとユーザーフレンドリを重視した設計です。一般的なWi-Fi設定の問題に対処します。
problem_japanese: SeQRが取り組む問題は、企業Wi-Fiネットワーク設定における複雑さとセキュリティ脆弱性です。ユーザーは高度な設定の管理を困難に感じ、セキュリティ侵害や非効率的なネットワーク設定の原因となります。
method_japanese: SeQRはセキュアバイデザインアプローチを採用し、ユーザーフレンドリーな設定と高度なセキュリティプロトコルを統合します。ガイド付きの設定プロセスで、技術知識なしにセキュリティベストプラクティスを実装します。
results_japanese: SeQRの導入により、簡単かつセキュリティに強いWi-Fi設定が可能となり、テストではユーザー満足度が向上し、設定エラーが減少して、より安全で効率的なネットワークになりました。

title: Social Wearables Edu-Larp: Insights From a Novel Camp Combining Crafting, Coding, and Larping Aimed at Non-traditional Steam Participants
authors: Fey, James Collin and Robinson, Raquel B and Ji, Chen and Dagan, Ella and Campe, Shannon and Schweig, Kaia and Crisp, Elliot and Padilla De La Torre, Carmen Alicia and Isbister, Katherine
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines a unique educational program that combines crafting, coding, and edu-larp to engage participants from non-traditional STEAM backgrounds, providing insights into its effectiveness and impact.
problem_english: Non-traditional participants often lack access to engaging STEAM education tailored to their diverse needs. Existing programs frequently emphasize traditional methods, leaving gaps in inclusive learning opportunities, creativity, and collaborative engagement that can attract and retain a broad audience.
method_english: The authors designed and studied a camp that integrated social wearables, crafting, coding, and educational live-action role-playing (edu-larp). This program aimed to captivate and motivate non-traditional STEAM participants through hands-on activities and immersive experiences to foster deeper engagement with STEAM concepts.
results_english: The program successfully engaged non-traditional participants with reported increased interest in STEAM fields and improved skills in crafting and coding. The participants appreciated the collaborative and creative aspects of larping, leading to enhanced understanding and application of STEAM concepts.
summary_japanese: 非伝統的なSTEAM参加者を対象に、クラフト、コーディング、edu-larpを組み合わせた教育プログラムの効果を検討する。
problem_japanese: 非伝統的な参加者が多様なニーズに応じた魅力的なSTEAM教育にアクセスできる機会が乏しい。既存のプログラムは伝統的手法を重視しており、包括的な学習機会、創造性、および幅広い受講者を引きつける共同的な関与においてギャップがある。
method_japanese: 著者は、ソーシャルウェアラブル、クラフト、コーディング、および教育ライブアクションロールプレイング（edu-larp）を統合したキャンプを設計し研究した。参加者がSTEAM概念に深く関心を持つような実践的活動と没入型体験を通じて、非伝統的なSTEAM参加者を魅了することを目的とした。
results_japanese: プログラムは非伝統的参加者を効果的に引き付け、STEAM分野への関心の増加とクラフトやコーディング技術の向上が報告された。参加者はラープの協調的かつ創造的な側面を楽しみ、STEAM概念の理解と応用が向上した。

title: Tangible-MakeCode: Bridging Physical Coding Blocks with a Web-Based Programming Interface for Collaborative and Extensible Learning
authors: Yu, Jin and Garg, Poojita and Synn, DoangJoo and Oh, HyunJoo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Tangible-MakeCode integrates physical coding blocks with online programming interfaces, promoting collaboration and extensibility in learning environments.
problem_english: Current educational coding systems are often limited in capacity to integrate physical and digital programming experiences, hindering collaborative and extensible learning opportunities in classrooms.
method_english: The authors developed Tangible-MakeCode, a hybrid learning system combining physical coding blocks with a web-based interface. It supports seamless integration for collaborative activities and extends learning possibilities beyond traditional methods.
results_english: User studies showed Tangible-MakeCode effectively improved engagement and collaboration among students, providing an extended learning experience through interaction with both physical and digital programming interfaces.
summary_japanese: Tangible-MakeCodeは物理的なコードブロックとオンラインプログラミングを統合し、学習環境での協力と拡張性を促進します。
problem_japanese: 現在の教育用コーディングシステムは、物理とデジタルのプログラミング体験を統合する能力が制限されており、教室での協力的かつ拡張可能な学習機会を妨げています。
method_japanese: Tangible-MakeCodeは、物理的なコードブロックとウェブベースのインターフェースを組み合わせたハイブリッド学習システムで、協力的な活動のシームレスな統合と従来の学習手法を超えた可能性を提供します。
results_japanese: ユーザースタディにより、Tangible-MakeCodeは学生間の参加と協力を効果的に向上させ、物理的およびデジタルのプログラミングインターフェースを介した拡張学習体験を提供することが確認されました。

title: "They're Scamming Me": How Children Experience and Conceptualize Harm in Game Monetization
authors: Hardwick, Taylor and Carter, Marcus and Harkin, Stephanie and Zhangshao, Tianyi and Egliston, Ben
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores how children perceive and experience harm in the monetization strategies of video games, identifying their feelings of being scammed and deceived.
problem_english: Children's gaming experiences often include exposure to monetization practices that can lead to feelings of deception and financial harm. Understanding how children conceptualize these practices is crucial for developing guidelines and policies to mitigate negative impacts and enhance ethical standards in game design.
method_english: The authors used qualitative research methods, including interviews and focus groups with children, to gather insights into their perceptions of game monetization. This approach aimed to explore children's thoughts and feelings about being targeted by such practices and their understanding of financial transactions within games.
results_english: Findings reveal that children often feel manipulated and scammed by game monetization strategies, expressing confusion and dissatisfaction. Many are unaware of the implications of in-game purchases, highlighting a need for increased education and more transparent practices, tailored to young audiences.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、子どもたちがゲームの収益化戦略による損害をどう感じ、捉えているかを探求し、詐欺と欺瞞を感じる様子を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 子どもたちのゲーム体験は、欺瞞や経済的損害を感じる収益化手法にさらされることが多いです。これらの手法を子どもたちがどう捉えているか理解することは、ゲーム設計の倫理基準を向上させるために重要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは子どもたちへのインタビューやフォーカスグループを通じて質的研究手法を使用し、収益化についての認識を収集しました。この手法は、ターゲットされることへの考えやゲーム内取引についての理解を探る目的です。
results_japanese: 調査結果から、子どもたちはしばしばゲームの収益化戦略によって操作され、詐欺に合ったと感じ、混乱と不満を表明していることが判明しました。ゲーム内購入の影響を知らない子供が多く、教育の強化と透明性のある手法の必要性が示唆されます。

title: CharacterCritique: Supporting Children's Development of Critical Thinking through Multi-Agent Interaction in Story Reading
authors: Wang, Zizhen and Pan, Jiangyu and Jin, Duola and Zhang, Jingao and Cao, Jiacheng and Zhang, Chao and Li, Zejian and Hansen, Preben and Zhao, Yijun and Sun, Shouqian and Qiao, Xianyue
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CharacterCritique aids children's critical thinking via interactive multi-agent story reading, enhancing engagement and cognitive growth.
problem_english: Children often face challenges in developing critical thinking skills, especially while reading. Existing educational tools inadequately address the engagement and interaction required to foster cognitive growth through storytelling.
method_english: The study introduces CharacterCritique, a multi-agent system for story reading. Through interactive dialogues and character analysis, it encourages children to critically evaluate narratives, engaging them in questioning and reflection.
results_english: CharacterCritique significantly improved children's critical thinking skills and engagement level during storytelling activities, demonstrating potential for educational enhancement in narrative evaluation.
summary_japanese: CharacterCritiqueは、対話的ストーリー読みで子供の批判的思考を促し、認知的成長を支援します。
problem_japanese: 子供は読書を通じた批判的思考の発達に苦労します。既存の教育ツールは、ストーリーテリングを通じた認知成長に必要なエンゲージメントと対話を十分に提供できていません。
method_japanese: CharacterCritiqueは、ストーリーテリングのための多エージェントシステムであり、対話とキャラクター分析を通じて子供が物語を批判的に評価することを促し、質問と反省を促します。
results_japanese: CharacterCritiqueは、ストーリーテリング活動中の子供の批判的思考スキルとエンゲージメントレベルを大幅に向上させ、物語評価の教育効果を示しました。

title: Escape or D13: Understanding Youth Perspectives of AI through Educational Game Co-design
authors: Lim, Jared Ordo\~{n}a and Barkhuff, Grace and Awuah, Jane and Clyde, Sophie and Sogani, Riya and Gardner-McCune, Christina and Touretzky, David and Uchidiuno, Judith Odili
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores youth perspectives on AI through a co-designed educational game. Engaging students in game co-design helps them understand AI concepts, enhancing their critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
problem_english: Educators face challenges in effectively incorporating AI into curricula due to students' limited understanding of AI concepts and their implications. Bridging this gap requires innovative educational tools that engage students and make AI accessible and understandable.
method_english: The study employs a co-design approach where youths collaboratively design educational games focused on AI concepts. Through iterative workshops, participants develop prototypes, learning AI principles while engaging in creative processes, which foster deeper understanding and retention.
results_english: Students involved in the game co-design process demonstrated increased understanding of AI concepts, improved cognitive engagement, and heightened interest in computing. They developed skills necessary to critically evaluate AI implications and integrate AI knowledge into everyday thinking.
summary_japanese: 共創による教育ゲームを通して、若者のAIに対する視点を探求し、AI概念の理解を促進します。
problem_japanese: 学生のAIに対する理解不足が教育課題であり、AIを身近で理解可能にする革新的な教育ツールが求められています。
method_japanese: 若者がAI概念に基づいた教育ゲームを共にデザインし、ワークショップを通じて学習と創造の過程を体験します。
results_japanese: 参加学生はAI概念の理解を深め、コンピューティングへの興味が高まり、AIの評価能力と日常への応用力が向上しました。

title: Noel: A Chatbot Persona to Support Children Designing for Others
authors: Lo, Priscilla Y. and Veldhuis, Annemiek and Antle, Alissa N. and DiPaola, Steve
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents Noel, a chatbot persona designed to aid children in the collaborative design process by providing feedback and supporting their creativity and design thinking skills in creating solutions for others.
problem_english: Designing for others requires empathy, communication, and creativity. Children, though intuitive problem-solvers, often struggle with these skills when tasked with designing for others. The challenge is to create supportive tools that can guide children in understanding and implementing user-centered design principles effectively.
method_english: Noel is implemented as a conversational agent built on AI technology, which interacts with children through guided dialogues. Noel provides structured feedback and encouragement, helping children to think critically and empathize with users. The development process focuses on creating a supportive yet challenging environment to foster design thinking.
results_english: Evaluation results demonstrate that Noel effectively enhanced children's design skills by increasing engagement, improving empathy for users, and encouraging exploration of creative solutions. Participants showed a greater ability in user-centered thinking and expressed positive attitudes towards using Noel in their design tasks.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、他者のためのデザインを支援する子供向けチャットボット「Noel」を紹介し、創造性とデザイン思考スキルをサポートする。
problem_japanese: 他者のためのデザインには共感やコミュニケーションが必要であり、直感的に問題解決を行う子供たちはこれらのスキルに苦労することがある。子供たちがユーザー中心デザインの原則を理解し実施するための支援ツールの開発が課題である。
method_japanese: NoelはAI技術を用いた会話型エージェントとして実装され、対話を通じて子供たちを導く。Noelは構造化されたフィードバックと励ましを提供し、ユーザーへの共感を持ち批判的思考を促す環境を構築する。
results_japanese: 評価結果は、Noelが子供たちのデザインスキルを向上させ、ユーザーへの共感や創造的解決策の探求を促進する効果があることを示した。参加者はユーザー中心の思考能力が向上し、Noelの使用に対して前向きな態度を示した。

title: Oral History and Qualitative Analysis with Youth: Cultivating Attachments to Create Publics
authors: Sabie, Samar and Soden, Robert and Parikh, Tapan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores using oral history and qualitative analysis with youth to foster social bonds and create engaged publics. It examines the potential of these methods to encourage active participation and understand emerging social issues.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of engaging youth in meaningful, participatory practices to foster connections within communities. It investigates how traditional methods like oral history can be used to cultivate attachments and form engaged publics that actively address social issues.
method_english: The researchers employed oral history interviews and qualitative analysis as methods to engage youth participants. This approach aimed to connect personal narratives with broader social contexts, encouraging introspection and dialogue. Participants shared personal stories, which were analyzed collaboratively to generate insights on community engagement.
results_english: The findings highlight the effectiveness of oral history in fostering social attachments and community engagement among youth.
