title: Conversation Progress Guide : UI System for Enhancing Self-Efficacy in Conversational AI
authors: Jeong, Daeun and Shin, Sungbok and Jeong, Jongwook
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a UI system named Conversation Progress Guide to enhance users' self-efficacy in interacting with conversational AI by improving feedback mechanisms.
problem_english: Users often struggle with interacting with conversational AI due to limited feedback and understanding of the system's status, reducing their self-efficacy and hindering effective communication and task completion.
method_english: The authors developed the Conversation Progress Guide, a UI system that provides real-time feedback and visual cues about the conversation status to users, to improve their understanding and control over interactions with conversational AI.
results_english: The study found that users who utilized the Conversation Progress Guide showed improved self-efficacy, greater satisfaction, and increased efficiency in interactions with conversational AI compared to users without this tool.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、対話型AIとの対話における自己効力感を向上させるUIシステム「Conversation Progress Guide」を提案します。
problem_japanese: ユーザーは対話型AIとのコミュニケーションが難しく、システムの状態を十分に理解できないため、自己効力感が低下し、効果的なコミュニケーションやタスク完了が困難です。
method_japanese: 対話状況に関するリアルタイムフィードバックと視覚的指示を提供するUIシステム「Conversation Progress Guide」を開発し、ユーザーとの対話をより理解しやすく、制御しやすくしました。
results_japanese: 「Conversation Progress Guide」利用者は、自己効力感が向上し、満足度が高まり、対話時間が効率的に利用されたことが確認されました。

title: Designing Conversational AI for Aging: A Systematic Review of Older Adults' Perceptions and Needs
authors: Huang, Yuanhui and Zhou, Quan and Piper, Anne Marie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper reviews older adults' perceptions and needs regarding conversational AI, identifying key factors for effective design to enhance usability and acceptance.
problem_english: Older adults often face challenges in adopting new technologies like conversational AI due to potential mismatches with their needs and interactions habits. Understanding their perceptions and specific requirements is crucial for creating AI systems that are both accessible and beneficial to them.
method_english: A systematic review was conducted analyzing existing literature on older adults' interactions with conversational AI. The review focused on examining studies that explored usability, user satisfaction, and specific needs of older adults regarding conversational AI technologies.
results_english: The review identified several critical factors for designing conversational AI for older adults, including the importance of personalized interactions, accessibility features, and intuitive user interfaces that can cater to diverse preferences and limitations of this demographic.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、高齢者の会話型AIに対する認識とニーズをレビューし、効果的なデザインのための重要要因を特定した。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は、会話型AIのような新技術を採用する際に、そのニーズや相互作用の習慣とのギャップから困難に直面しがちです。高齢者の認識と特定の要求を理解することは、アクセス可能で有益なAIシステムを創出するために重要です。
method_japanese: 既存文献を分析し、高齢者による会話型AIとの相互作用に関する研究を体系的にレビューしました。レビューは、高齢者の会話型AI技術に対する使いやすさ、ユーザー満足度、および特定のニーズを探求した研究を中心に行われました。
results_japanese: 個別化された対話、アクセシビリティ機能、直感的なユーザーインターフェースの重要性など、高齢者向け会話型AI設計の重要要因が特定された。

title: Developing a Social Support Framework: Understanding the Reciprocity in Human-Chatbot Relationship
authors: Pan, Shuyi and de Graaf, Maartje M.A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study develops a social support framework focusing on understanding the reciprocity in human-chatbot relationships to improve user experience.
problem_english: The challenge lies in understanding the dynamics and reciprocity of the human-chatbot relationship, which is essential for designing chatbots capable of providing meaningful social support.
method_english: The research employs a mixed-methods approach, combining qualitative interviews and quantitative surveys to assess user perceptions and expectations from the interaction with chatbots.
results_english: Findings indicate that reciprocity in human-chatbot interactions enhances user satisfaction, trust, and the overall effectiveness of the chatbot in providing social support.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、人とチャットボットの関係における相互性を理解し、ユーザー体験を向上させるための社会的支援フレームワークを開発。
problem_japanese: 人とチャットボットの関係における動態と相互性を理解することが課題。これは有意義な社会的支援を行うチャットボットの設計に不可欠。
method_japanese: 質的インタビューと量的調査を組み合わせ、チャットボットとのやり取りに関するユーザーの認識と期待を評価する混合手法を採用。
results_japanese: 人とチャットボットの相互作用における相互性は、ユーザー満足、信頼、社会的支援の効果を向上させることが示された。

title: Enhancing Self-Efficacy in Health Self-Examination through Conversational Agent's Encouragement
authors: Kollerup, Naja Kathrine and Bahodi, Maria-Theresa and Cox, Samuel Rhys and van Berkel, Niels
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the role of conversational agents in enhancing self-efficacy for health self-examinations, focusing on the impact of encouragement delivered through these agents.
problem_english: Health self-examinations are crucial for early detection of medical conditions but are often neglected. The study explores how conversational agents can encourage individuals to perform regular self-examinations and increase their self-efficacy in maintaining health.
method_english: The researchers developed a conversational agent that delivers encouragement and monitored its impacts through user interactions. They measured changes in self-efficacy and frequency of health self-examinations among participants using validated metrics.
results_english: The incorporation of encouragement through a conversational agent significantly improved the self-efficacy and frequency of health self-examinations among users. Participants reported feeling more confident and motivated in managing their health.
summary_japanese: 対話エージェントの励ましが健康自己検査のセルフエフィカシー向上に与える影響を研究した。
problem_japanese: 健康自己検査は病状の早期発見に重要だが、しばしば見逃される。対話エージェントが、自己検査を促し健康維持のセルフエフィカシーを高めるかを探求する。
method_japanese: 励ましを与える対話エージェントを開発し、ユーザーとの対話を通じてその影響をモニター。参加者の健康自己検査の頻度とセルフエフィカシーの変化を測定した。
results_japanese: 対話エージェントによる励ましの導入により、参加者の健康自己検査のセルフエフィカシーと頻度が有意に向上した。参加者は健康管理に自信と意欲を示した。

title: Proactive Conversational Agents with Inner Thoughts
authors: Liu, Xingyu Bruce and Fang, Shitao and Shi, Weiyan and Wu, Chien-Sheng and Igarashi, Takeo and Chen, Xiang 'Anthony'
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents proactive conversational agents empowered with inner thoughts to enhance human-agent interaction, making agents more capable in suggesting actions, acknowledging concerns, and managing tasks.
problem_english: Existing conversational agents are often reactive and lack the ability to initiate meaningful interactions or propose actions proactively, limiting their effectiveness in collaborative settings where anticipation and cognitive engagement are crucial.
method_english: The paper introduces an innovative design integrating inner thoughts into conversational agents, enabling them to simulate reasoning processes and make proactive suggestions or inquiries, thereby enhancing engagement and user satisfaction.
results_english: The integration of inner thoughts in conversational agents resulted in improved user satisfaction and engagement, showcasing increased efficacy in task management and proactive interactions compared to traditional reactive agents.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、内省機能を備えた積極的会話型エージェントを提案し、人間との対話を向上させ、意思決定支援を強化します。
problem_japanese: 従来の会話型エージェントは受動的であり、意味のある対話を開始したり、積極的に行動を提案する能力を欠いているため、現状では協力的な環境での有効性が制限されています。
method_japanese: 本論文では、内省を組み込んだ会話型エージェントのデザインを提案し、推論プロセスをシミュレートしてユーザーとの対話を強化し、積極的な提案や質問を可能にします。
results_japanese: 内省機能を組み込んだ会話型エージェントは、ユーザー満足度とエンゲージメントを向上させ、従来の受動型エージェントと比較してタスク管理や積極的な対話での効果を示しました。

title: Understanding and Supporting Formal Email Exchange by Answering AI-Generated Questions
authors: Miura, Yusuke and Yang, Chi-Lan and Kuribayashi, Masaki and Matsumoto, Keigo and Kuzuoka, Hideaki and Morishima, Shigeo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the use of AI-generated questions to improve understanding and support in formal email exchanges, enhancing users' email drafting skills.
problem_english: Many people, especially non-native speakers, struggle with composing formal emails. This task can be challenging due to language barriers and lack of experience, leading to poor communication and potential misunderstandings in professional settings.
method_english: The study introduces an AI-driven tool that generates questions about email content. By answering these questions, users can better clarify and refine their email drafts, ensuring more effective communication.
results_english: The tool was evaluated through user studies, showing significant improvements in the quality and clarity of emails composed by participants. Users reported increased confidence and reduced anxiety in sending formal emails.
summary_japanese: AI生成の質問を利用して公式メール交換を支援し、ユーザーのメール作成スキルを向上させます。
problem_japanese: 特に非ネイティブ話者にとって、公式メールの作成は言語の壁や経験不足から難しく、コミュニケーションの不備や誤解を招く恐れがあります。
method_japanese: 研究では、メール内容に関する質問を生成するAIツールを導入。質問に答えることで、ユーザーはメールの下書きを明確にし、修正します。
results_japanese: ユーザー研究でツールを評価し、参加者が作成するメールの質と明確さに大幅な改善が見られました。ユーザーは自信を高め、公式メール送信の不安を軽減しました。

title: 4D Bioforming with Bees: An Industry-Compatible Prototyping Method for Polymorphic Honeycomb Creation
authors: Wang, Yixiong and Suen, Huajie and Duan, Shengfeng and Liang, Chen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a novel prototyping method using bees for industrial honeycomb creation. It explores 4D bioforming for adaptable, sustainable structures, emphasizing industry integration and versatility.
problem_english: Traditional honeycomb structures lack flexibility and adaptability in complex environments and applications. The current prototyping techniques are usually resource-intensive, limiting their application across industries and compromising sustainability.
method_english: This method leverages the natural behavior of bees, directing them to design polymorphic honeycombs with programmable patterns. By manipulating environmental variables, bees create adaptable honeycomb structures suitable for various industrial applications.
results_english: The researchers demonstrated successful honeycomb creation with desired shapes and patterns. The technique proved resource-efficient, offering sustainable alternatives to conventional manufacturing. Additionally, the honeycombs showcased enhanced adaptability and robustness in diverse scenarios.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、蜂を用いた産業用ハニカム構築の新しいプロトタイプ法を紹介し、柔軟な構造の創造を探ります。
problem_japanese: 従来のハニカム構造は複雑な環境や用途での柔軟性に欠け、現状のプロトタイピング技術は資源集約的で展開が限定され持続可能性に欠けています。
method_japanese: 蜂の自然な行動を利用し、環境変数を操作して工業用途に適した多形ハニカムを形成する手法を採用しました。
results_japanese: 研究者は望ましい形状とパターンのハニカムを効果的に作成し、資源効率に優れた持続可能な代替技術として立証しました。

title: Amuse: Human-AI Collaborative Songwriting with Multimodal Inspirations
authors: Kim, Yewon and Lee, Sung-Ju and Donahue, Chris
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Amuse facilitates human-AI collaborative songwriting using multimodal inspirations, integrating text, sound, and image inputs to inspire creativity.
problem_english: Songwriters often seek inspiration from multiple sources, but existing tools don't adequately support integrating various modalities for songwriting inspiration, which can constrain creativity and limit collaborative opportunities.
method_english: The authors developed Amuse, a system that enables human-AI collaboration in songwriting by incorporating multimodal inputs such as text, sound, and images to inspire and generate creative content, utilizing AI to enhance the creativity process.
results_english: The study demonstrated that Amuse effectively supports diverse creative processes in songwriting, improving user satisfaction and creativity by allowing seamless integration of various inspirational modalities and promoting more innovative outcomes.
summary_japanese: Amuseはテキスト、音、画像の入力を用いて、人間とAIの共同作曲を促進し、創造性を高めます。
problem_japanese: 作曲者は多くの情報源からインスピレーションを得ることが多いが、現行のツールは多様なモダリティの統合的インスピレーションを十分にサポートしておらず、創造性を制限し共同の機会を狭めている。
method_japanese: Amuseは、テキスト、音、画像といったマルチモーダル入力を取り入れ、人間とAIの共同で創造的なコンテンツを生成することで、作曲における創造性を高めるシステムです。
results_japanese: Amuseは多様なインスピレーションの統合を可能にし、創造性とユーザー満足度を向上させ、より革新的な作曲を促進することが実証されました。

title: Compositional Structures as Substrates for Human-AI Co-creation Environment: A Design Approach and A Case Study
authors: Cao, Yining and Huang, Yiyi and Truong, Anh and Shin, Hijung Valentina and Xia, Haijun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces a design approach for human-AI co-creation using compositional structures. A case study demonstrates the effectiveness of these structures in facilitating creative interactions between humans and AI.
problem_english: The challenge lies in developing environments where humans and AI can creatively interact, leveraging the strengths of both parties. Existing systems often lack the necessary frameworks to support effective co-creation, limiting the potential for dynamic and imaginative outcomes.
method_english: The authors propose using compositional structures as substrates in a co-creation environment. This involves designing components that both humans and AI can manipulate and combine, fostering intuitive interactions and supporting creative synthesis in the design process.
results_english: The case study validated the approach, revealing enhanced co-creation experiences. Users demonstrated higher satisfaction and creative output with compositional structures, successfully blending human intuitive design with AI computational capabilities for innovative solutions.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、人間とAIの共創を促進するための構成的構造を用いた設計アプローチを紹介し、その効果を実証するケーススタディを示す。
problem_japanese: 人間とAIが創造的に連携できる環境の開発が課題。既存のシステムは効果的な共創を支える枠組みが不足し、動的で創造的な結果を制限している。
method_japanese: 構成的構造を共創環境の基盤として提案。人間とAIが操作・組み合わせ可能なコンポーネントを設計し、直感的な相互作用とデザインプロセスでの創造的合成を支援する。
results_japanese: ケーススタディによりこのアプローチが検証され、共創経験の向上が確認された。構成的構造によりユーザーの満足度と創造的成果が向上した。

title: Paratrouper: Exploratory Creation of Character Cast Visuals Using Generative AI
authors: Leong, Joanne and Ledo, David and Driscoll, Thomas and Grossman, Tovi and Fitzmaurice, George and Anderson, Fraser
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Paratrouper introduces a system that uses generative AI to assist creators in rapidly generating character cast visuals for exploratory purposes, providing intuitive design interface and options for interactive refinement.
problem_english: Designers often face challenges in generating coherent and visually appealing character casts due to time constraints and creative block. Existing tools fail to offer efficient workflows or inspiring collaborative systems for rapid design iterations.
method_english: Paratrouper utilizes generative AI alongside a user-centric interface, allowing creators to input initial concepts that are expanded upon by AI, offering interactive editing and refinement tools to iteratively develop visual and thematic character designs.
results_english: Through user evaluations, Paratrouper demonstrated effectiveness in facilitating rapid ideation and enhancing creative flow, offering a substantial reduction in time spent on generating initial design ideas while boosting user satisfaction and perceived creativity.
summary_japanese: Paratrouperは創造性を助けるために生成AIを使ってキャラクターキャストのビジュアルを迅速に生成するシステムを導入しました。
problem_japanese: デザイナーはキャラクターキャストを練る際、時間制約や創造性の停滞という課題に直面します。現在のツールは迅速なデザイン反復を支援する効果的なワークフローを提供していません。
method_japanese: Paratrouperは生成AIを活用し、ユーザー中心のインターフェースを提供。 AIが初期概念を展開し、ユーザーは視覚的およびテーマ的なキャラクターデザインを反復的に開発するための編集や微調整ツールを使用可能。
results_japanese: ユーザー評価により、Paratrouperは迅速なアイデア創出を助けクリエイティブな流れを強化する効果を示し、初期デザインのアイデア生成にかかる時間を大幅に削減し、ユーザーの満足度と創造性を向上しました。

title: Reflecting on Design Paradigms of Animated Data Video Tools
authors: Shen, Leixian and Li, Haotian and Wang, Yun and Qu, Huamin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper analyzes the design paradigms of animated data video tools, exploring their strengths and weaknesses to enhance user engagement and understanding.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of designing animated data video tools that make complex data understandable while keeping users engaged, which is currently underserved by existing tools.
method_english: A comparative analysis of existing animated data video tools is conducted to identify common design paradigms. User studies are also employed to gather feedback on effectiveness and engagement.
results_english: Findings reveal key design paradigms that enhance comprehension and engagement, providing valuable insights and recommendations for future developments in animated data video tools.
summary_japanese: 動的データビデオツールの設計パラダイムを分析し、ユーザーの関与と理解を向上させる手法を探る。
problem_japanese: 複雑なデータを理解可能にしつつ、ユーザーの関心を保つ動的データビデオツールの設計が不十分である問題に取り組む。
method_japanese: 既存の動的データビデオツールの比較分析を行い、共通の設計パラダイムを特定し、ユーザー調査で効果性と関与度のフィードバックを集める。
results_japanese: 理解力と関与を高める重要な設計パラダイムを明らかにし、将来的な動的データビデオツールの開発への貴重な洞察と提言を提供。

title: VAction: A Lightweight and Integrated VR Training System for Authentic Film-Shooting Experience
authors: Wang, Shaocong and Qu, Che and Yu, Minjing and Zhou, Chao and Wang, Yuntao and Wen, Yu-Hui and Shi, Yuanchun and Liu, Yong-Jin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: VAction provides a lightweight VR system for film-training, offering an authentic shooting experience that bridges the gap between theory and practice.
problem_english: The challenge lies in providing film students with practical shooting experience without access to costly equipment or real-world locations, hindering their skill development and understanding of real-time decision processes in film production.
method_english: VAction integrates a VR environment with film scripts, allowing users to navigate, plan, and execute film sequences. It utilizes motion capture for realistic actor movement simulation, offering a comprehensive tool for film training.
results_english: The system demonstrated significant improvement in learners' filmmaking skills and decision-making processes, as verified by both qualitative feedback and performance metrics collected during trials in educational settings.
summary_japanese: VActionは軽量なVRシステムで、映画制作訓練における実践的な撮影体験を提供。
problem_japanese: 映画学生が高価な撮影機器や実世界のロケーションにアクセスできず、実践的なスキルや意思決定プロセスを学ぶ機会が限られている。
method_japanese: VActionはVR環境を映画脚本と統合して、ユーザーが映画シーケンスを計画・実行する。モーションキャプチャを利用してリアルな演者の動きをシミュレート。
results_japanese: システムは学習者の映画制作スキルと意思決定の向上に効果があり、教育現場での試用で質的フィードバックと性能指標により検証。

title: XCam: Mixed-Initiative Virtual Cinematography for Live Production of Virtual Reality Experiences
authors: Nebeling, Michael and Wu, Liwei and Maddali, Hanuma Teja
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents XCam, a virtual cinematography system enabling mixed-initiative control for live virtual reality experiences. It integrates automated and manual controls to enhance dynamic storytelling.
problem_english: Current virtual reality productions struggle with implementing real-time, dynamic camera control, vital for immersive storytelling. Traditional methods often require extensive manual control, lacking integration with automated systems, hindering seamless narrative flows in VR environments.
method_english: XCam combines automated cinematography with user inputs, allowing dynamic camera adjustments. It utilizes machine learning to predict optimal camera angles and movements while maintaining user influence through manual control options, thus bridging the gap between automation and human creativity.
results_english: XCam demonstrated enhanced engagement and storytelling fluidity in VR environments. User studies showcased its ability to balance automation and manual input, leading to improved narrative experiences. Feedback indicated higher satisfaction and perceived immersion compared to traditional techniques.
summary_japanese: XCamはVR体験のための混合主導型カメラシステムで、自動制御と手動制御を統合し動的な物語性を強化する。
problem_japanese: 現在のVR制作では、没入型の物語を実現するために重要なリアルタイムでの動的なカメラ制御が困難である。従来の方法は自動システムとの統合が不十分で、スムーズな物語の流れを妨げている。
method_japanese: XCamは自動撮影技術とユーザー入力を組み合わせ、動的にカメラを調整する。機械学習で最適なカメラアングルと動きを予測しつつ、手動制御の選択肢も保持することで、オートメーションと人間の創造性の橋渡しを行う。
results_japanese: XCamはVR環境での物語の流動性と没入感を向上させた。ユーザースタディでは自動化と手動入力のバランスが強化され、従来法よりも高い満足度と没入感が確認された。

title: "You'll Be Alice Adventuring in Wonderland!" Processes, Challenges, and Opportunities of Creating Animated Virtual Reality Stories
authors: Yuan, Lin-Ping and Han, Feilin and Xie, Liwenhan and Zhang, Junjie and Zhao, Jian and Qu, Huamin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the processes, challenges, and opportunities of creating animated virtual reality (VR) stories, specifically focusing on adapting 'Alice in Wonderland' for VR settings.
problem_english: Creating animated VR stories faces challenges such as maintaining user immersion, dealing with technological limitations, and effectively adapting existing narratives like 'Alice in Wonderland'. These challenges impede seamless storytelling and user engagement in VR environments.
method_english: The study utilizes a framework combining animation techniques with VR-specific storytelling strategies. This includes using interactive elements, optimizing VR hardware compatibility, and narrative restructuring to enhance immersion and engagement.
results_english: The research demonstrates improved user engagement and storytelling efficacy through a hybrid approach of animation and VR-specific strategies. It also identifies potential areas for future technological advancements in VR storytelling environments.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、VR環境での『不思議の国のアリス』の適応を中心に、アニメーションVRストーリーの創作過程、課題、機会を探る。
problem_japanese: アニメーションVRストーリー作成は、ユーザーの没入感維持や技術的制限、既存物語の効果的適応といった課題に直面しており、VR環境でのシームレスなストーリーテリングとユーザーエンゲージメントを妨げている。
method_japanese: アニメーション手法とVR特有のストーリーテリング戦略を組み合わせるフレームワークを使用し、インタラクティブ要素の活用やハードウェア互換性の最適化、物語再構築を行う。
results_japanese: アニメーションとVR戦略を融合したハイブリッドアプローチにより、ユーザーエンゲージメントとストーリーテリングの効果が向上し、VRストーリー環境の将来の技術進化の可能性を示す。

title: Catalyst for Creativity or a Hollow Trend?: A Cross-Level Perspective on The Role of Generative AI in Design
authors: Naqvi, Syeda Masooma and He, Ruichen and Kaur, Harmanpreet
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the role of generative AI in design, exploring whether it acts as a catalyst for creativity or merely a trend. It analyzes different levels of designing processes and AI's impact.
problem_english: The study aims to address the debate on whether generative AI contributes positively to the design processes by enhancing creativity or whether it is considered a passing trend with minimal real-world application. There is a need to understand its true role within design landscapes.
method_english: The research employs a cross-level analytical approach, examining individual, group, and organizational levels in design practices. Surveys, interviews, and case studies are conducted to gather diverse perspectives on the effectiveness of generative AI.
results_english: Findings reveal that generative AI can enhance creativity by offering new perspectives and aiding idea generation. However, its impact varies across different design contexts. The tool’s effectiveness depends on user skill and the integration within team dynamics.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、生成AIがデザインにおける創造力の触媒か、または流行に過ぎないのかを検討する。
problem_japanese: 生成AIがデザインプロセスにおいて創造性を促進するか、または実際の応用が少ない通過的な流行とされるかの議論を解決することを目的とする。
method_japanese: 個人、グループ、組織レベルでのデザイン実践を分析し、調査、インタビュー、事例研究を通じて多様な視点を収集する。
results_japanese: 生成AIは新しい視点を提供し、アイデア生成を助けることで創造性を高める。効果はデザインの文脈によって異なり、ユーザーのスキルとチーム内の統合に依存する。

title: CreAItive Collaboration? Users' Misjudgment of AI-Creativity Affects Their Collaborative Performance
authors: Bangerl, Mia Magdalena and Disch, Leonie and David, Tamara and Pammer-Schindler, Viktoria
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates user misjudgments of AI's creative capabilities in collaborative tasks and how these misjudgments affect collaborative performance.
problem_english: The issue revolves around the user's tendency to misjudge AI's creative capabilities, which can lead to suboptimal performance in collaborative tasks. When users incorrectly perceive AI's creative potential, it can affect their willingness to collaborate with AI effectively, potentially leading to decreased trust or reliance on AI.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments where participants collaborated with an AI in creative tasks. They assessed participants' perceptions of the AI's creativity and measured the collaborative outcomes. The study aimed to understand how discrepancies between perceived and actual AI creative capabilities impact collaborative task performance.
results_english: The findings reveal that users often overestimate or underestimate AI's creativity, affecting their collaboration strategies and performance. Misjudgment leads to either excessive reliance or unwarranted skepticism towards the AI, influencing the efficiency and outcome of collaborative tasks.
summary_japanese: ユーザーがAIの創造性を誤評価し、共同作業の成果に影響を与えることを調査。
problem_japanese: ユーザーがAIの創造性を誤解し、共同作業のパフォーマンスに悪影響を及ぼす問題に焦点を当てています。AIの創造力を誤って認識することで、AIとの効果的な協力意欲が削がれ、信頼や依存が低下する可能性があります。
method_japanese: 参加者がAIと共同で創造的作業を行う実験を実施し、AIの創造性に対する参加者の認識と共同作業の成果を評価。認識と実際のAI創造能力の差異が共同作業パフォーマンスに与える影響を検証。
results_japanese: ユーザーはしばしばAIの創造性を過大または過小評価し、コラボレーション戦略と成果に影響を与える。誤評価はAIへの過度な依存や不当な懐疑心を引き起こし、効率と成果に影響を与える。

title: Exploring the Needs of Practising Musicians in Co-Creative AI Through Co-Design
authors: Krol, Stephen James and Llano Rodriguez, Maria Teresa and Loor Paredes, Miguel J
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the needs of musicians in co-creative AI systems through co-design sessions, aiming to enhance creative collaboration between humans and AI.
problem_english: The challenge is understanding the specific needs and requirements of practising musicians when interacting with co-creative AI systems, which can differ significantly from other artistic domains. Effective integration remains elusive due to these unique needs.
method_english: The authors employed co-design sessions involving practising musicians, allowing them to actively shape the development of AI tools to ensure they align with the musicians' specific creative processes and requirements.
results_english: The study identified key features that musicians require in co-creative AI, emphasizing personalized interaction, adaptive learning, and real-time collaboration, leading to a more tailored integration of AI into musicians' workflows.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、共同創造AIシステムにおける音楽家のニーズをコーデザインセッションを通じて探求し、人間とAIの創造的協力を促進することを目指す。
problem_japanese: 共同創造AIシステムとの関わりにおいて、音楽家が抱える特有のニーズや要求を理解することが課題。これらのニーズは他の芸術分野と異なり、有効な統合が難しい。
method_japanese: 著者は実践的な音楽家を含むコーデザインセッションを採用し、音楽家の創造プロセスや要求に合わせたAIツールの開発を形作ることを狙った。
results_japanese: 研究は音楽家が共同創造AIに求める主要な特徴を特定し、個別化したインタラクション、適応学習、リアルタイム協力を強調した。AIの音楽家の作業への統合がより調整されたものとなった。

title: Governance of Generative AI in Creative Work: Consent, Credit, Compensation, and Beyond
authors: Kyi, Lin and Mahuli, Amruta and Silberman, M. Six and Binns, Reuben and Zhao, Jun and Biega, Asia J.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores governance issues in generative AI's use in creative work, addressing consent, credit, and compensation. It integrates stakeholder perspectives for responsible AI deployment.
problem_english: Generative AI presents challenges in creative industries, including concerns over how artists and creators grant consent, receive credit, and are appropriately compensated for AI-utilized works. Addressing these challenges is crucial for ethical and sustainable AI integration.
method_english: The authors propose a multi-stakeholder approach to address governance challenges, including interviews and workshops with artists, AI developers, and legal experts. This methodology seeks to capture diverse perspectives and develop comprehensive governance frameworks.
results_english: Findings indicate the need for clear consent frameworks, fair credit attribution systems, and reliable compensation models. Stakeholder involvement is crucial to create balanced governance systems that support both creative freedom and legal protection.
summary_japanese: 本論文は生成AIの創作活動での利用に関するガバナンス問題を探り、同意、信用、報酬を扱い、AIの責任ある運用を目指す。
problem_japanese: 生成AIのクリエイティブ分野での利用において、アーティストや創作者がどのように同意を与え、クレジットを受け、AIによる作品に対して適切に報酬を得るかという課題が存在する。これらの課題を解決することは倫理的かつ持続可能なAI統合にとって重要である。
method_japanese: 著者らはマルチステークホルダーアプローチを提案し、アーティスト、AI開発者、法専門家とのインタビューやワークショップを含む。この手法は多様な視点を収集し、包括的なガバナンスフレームワークの開発を目指す。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、明確な同意フレームワーク、公平なクレジット帰属システム、信頼できる報酬モデルの必要性を示している。利害関係者の関与は、クリエイティブな自由と法的保護を支えるバランスの取れたガバナンスシステムを構築するために不可欠である。

title: How Do Hackathons Foster Creativity? Towards Automated Evaluation of Creativity at Scale
authors: Falk, Jeanette and Chen, Yiyi and Rafner, Janet and Zhang, Mike and Bjerva, Johannes and Nolte, Alexander
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines how hackathons foster creativity and proposes methods for automating creativity evaluation at scale, focusing on the utilization of computational techniques.
problem_english: Creativity is a crucial aspect of innovation yet notoriously difficult to quantify, especially at scale. Traditional methods of evaluating creativity are limited in scope and scalability, making it challenging to assess creativity comprehensively in hackathon settings.
method_english: The authors propose an automated evaluation system utilizing computational creativity metrics and machine learning algorithms to assess creativity in hackathons. The approach combines qualitative assessments with quantitative data analyses to offer a scalable solution.
results_english: The automated system demonstrated promising results in accurately evaluating creativity at scale. The blended method showed its potential in overcoming traditional limitations, enabling comprehensive assessments in hackathon environments.
summary_japanese: 本研究はハッカソンが創造性を促進する方法を検討し、大規模な創造性評価の自動化方法を提案、計算技術の利用に焦点を当てる。
problem_japanese: 創造性は革新に重要だが、定量化が困難で特に大規模な評価が課題。従来の方法ではハッカソンでの創造性評価が包括的ではない。
method_japanese: 著者は計算創造性指標と機械学習アルゴリズムを用いて、自動評価システムを提案。定性的評価と定量データ分析を組み合わせ、大規模な評価を可能にする。
results_japanese: 自動システムは創造性の精度ある大規模評価において有望な結果を示し、伝統的な制限を克服し包括的評価を可能にした。

title: Mentigo: An Intelligent Agent for Mentoring Students in the Creative Problem Solving Process
authors: Zha, Siyu and Liu, Yujia and Zheng, Chengbo and Xu, Jiaqi and Yu, Fuze and Gong, Jiangtao and Xu, Yingqing
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Mentigo is an intelligent agent designed to guide students through the Creative Problem Solving (CPS) process, helping improve their creativity and problem-solving skills.
problem_english: Students often struggle with the Creative Problem Solving (CPS) process due to a lack of guidance and feedback, which is crucial for developing effective problem-solving strategies and fostering creativity.
method_english: The authors introduced Mentigo, an intelligent agent that provides real-time feedback and tailored guidance to students. It utilizes machine learning to adapt to individual learning styles and offers interactive problem-solving sessions.
results_english: Evaluation of Mentigo demonstrates significant improvements in students' problem-solving abilities and creativity. Students showed increased engagement and reported a better understanding of the CPS process, highlighting the agent's effectiveness.
summary_japanese: Mentigoは学生の創造的問題解決プロセスを支援するために設計された知能エージェントです。
problem_japanese: 学生は創造的問題解決（CPS）プロセスでの指導不足から効果的な問題解決戦略の開発や創造力の発揮に苦労しています。
method_japanese: Mentigoは、リアルタイムのフィードバックと個別のガイダンスを提供する知能エージェントで、機械学習を使い個々の学習スタイルに適応します。
results_japanese: Mentigoの評価により、学生の問題解決能力と創造性の向上が示され、プロセス理解が深まり、エージェントの有効性が強調されました。

title: "Ethics is not neutral": Understanding Ethical and Responsible AI Design from the Lenses of Black Youth
authors: Tanksley, Tiera and Smith, Angela D. R. and Sharma, Saloni and Huff, Earl W
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the perspectives of Black youth on ethical and responsible AI design, emphasizing that ethics is not neutral. It seeks to understand these perspectives to inform and improve AI systems.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of incorporating diverse perspectives, particularly from Black youth, into the design of ethical and responsible AI systems. Current approaches often overlook the unique insights and needs of marginalized communities, leading to biased and non-inclusive AI technologies.
method_english: The method involves participatory design sessions with Black youth, which facilitate discussions and activities to elicit their views and experiences. This approach enables the co-creation of guidelines and recommendations to inform more equitable AI design.
results_english: The findings reveal critical insights into how Black youth perceive AI ethics, highlighting the importance of representation and cultural understanding. The engagement yielded actionable recommendations aimed at fostering inclusivity and fairness in AI systems.
summary_japanese: 研究は、ブラックユースの視点からAIの倫理的設計を探り、その中立性の欠如を強調します。これにより、AIシステムの改善を図ります。
problem_japanese: 研究は、倫理的かつ責任あるAI設計において多様な視点、特にブラックユースからの視点を組み込む課題に取り組んでいます。現行のアプローチはしばしば疎外されたコミュニティの洞察やニーズを見落とし、偏りや非包括的なAI技術を生んでいます。
method_japanese: ブラックユースと共に参加型デザインセッションを実施し、彼らの視点や経験を引き出すための議論と活動を行います。これにより、より公正なAI設計のためのガイドラインや提言を共創します。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、ブラックユースがAI倫理をどのように認識しているかに関する重要な洞察を示し、代表性や文化的理解の重要性を浮き彫りにしています。これにより、包括性と公正性を高めるための具体的な提言が得られました。

title: AI and Non-Western Art Worlds: Reimagining Critical AI Futures through Artistic Inquiry and Situated Dialogue
authors: Qadri, Rida and Mirowski, Piotr and Denton, Remi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the intersection of artificial intelligence with non-Western art and cultural traditions, aiming to reimagine AI applications through artistic inquiry and diverse dialogues.
problem_english: Mainstream AI research often lacks engagement with non-Western artistic and cultural traditions, which can limit the cultural awareness and versatility of AI applications. Addressing this gap is crucial for fostering more inclusive and diverse AI futures.
method_english: The authors propose a methodology involving artistic inquiry and situated dialogue with stakeholders from non-Western art worlds. This approach emphasizes collaboration and cultural exchange to integrate diverse perspectives into AI development processes.
results_english: The study demonstrates that integrating non-Western artistic and cultural perspectives into AI development can enrich AI's cultural contextuality and lead to more inclusive and culturally aware applications, promoting diverse AI futures.
summary_japanese: AIが非西洋の芸術・文化的伝統と交わることで、芸術的探求と多様な対話を通じてAIの未来を再考する研究。
problem_japanese: 主流のAI研究は非西洋の芸術・文化的伝統との関与が少なく、AIアプリの文化的意識と多様性が制限されることがあります。このギャップを埋めることは包摂的で多様なAIの未来を育むために重要です。
method_japanese: 著者は非西洋の芸術界の関係者との芸術的探求と対話を含む方法論を提案し、共同作業と文化交換を強調してAI開発プロセスに多様な視点を組み込むことを目指します。
results_japanese: 非西洋の芸術文化視点をAI開発に組み込むことが、文化的コンテクストを豊かにし、包摂的で文化に配慮したアプリケーションを生み出し、多様なAIの未来を促進することを示します。

title: Copying style, Extracting value: Illustrators' Perception of AI Style Transfer and its Impact on Creative Labor
authors: Porquet, Julien and Wang, Sitong and Chilton, Lydia B
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates how illustrators perceive AI style transfer technology and its impact on creative labor, exploring potential benefits and challenges.
problem_english: The study addresses illustrators' concerns regarding the use of AI style transfer technology, which can replicate artistic styles, potentially devaluing human creativity, leading to job displacement and redefining creative labor's value.
method_english: The study employs qualitative methods, including interviews and surveys with professional illustrators, to gather perspectives on AI style transfer's implications, examining both technological adoption benefits and challenges impacting their creative work.
results_english: Illustrators expressed mixed feelings about AI; while some see it as a tool for enhancing creativity, others fear job displacement. The study highlights a need for ethical considerations and policy development to address these technological impacts.
summary_japanese: この研究はAIスタイル転送技術がイラストレーターの創造的労働に与える影響を探る。
problem_japanese: AIスタイル転送技術が芸術的スタイルを模倣することで人間の創造性を低価値化し、仕事の喪失や創造的労働の価値の再定義を招く可能性がある問題を調査。
method_japanese: プロのイラストレーターへのインタビューやアンケートなどの質的手法を用い、AIスタイル転送の技術が創造的仕事に与える影響を調査。
results_japanese: イラストレーターはAIに対し複雑な感情を抱いており、創造性を高めるツールと見る一方、職の喪失を懸念している。技術的影響への倫理的考慮と政策の開発が必要とされる。

title: Empowering Adults with AI Literacy: Using Short Videos to Transform Understanding and Harness Fear for Critical Thinking
authors: Cao, Huajie Jay and Lee, Hee Rin and Peng, Wei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores using short videos to enhance AI literacy among adults, transforming their fear into critical thinking. This method aims to improve understanding and engagement with AI technologies.
problem_english: Adults often have limited AI literacy, which leads to misconceptions and fear towards AI technologies. The paper addresses the need for effective educational tools to enhance understanding and foster critical thinking about AI, especially amid rapid technological advancements.
method_english: The authors employed short, engaging videos as educational tools to convey complex AI concepts in an understandable manner. These videos aimed to harness adults' fears and misconceptions about AI, transforming them into opportunities for critical engagement and deeper understanding.
results_english: The study found that short video interventions significantly improved AI literacy among adults. Participants expressed decreased fear and increased confidence in understanding AI, fostering a critical approach to technology engagement.
summary_japanese: 短動画を使い成人のAIリテラシー向上を探求し、恐怖を批判的思考へと変化させる方法を考察する。
problem_japanese: 成人のAIリテラシーが低く、誤解と恐怖を招きがちであるため、効果的な教育ツールを通じて理解を深め、AIへの批判的思考を促進する必要がある。
method_japanese: 複雑なAI概念を短動画で分かりやすく伝え、成人の恐怖と誤解を批判的な考察へ変換する機会を提供する手法を採用した。
results_japanese: 短動画の介入により成人のAIリテラシーが大幅に向上し、恐怖が軽減され、AI理解への信頼が増し批判的なアプローチが育まれた。

title: Fictional Failures and Real-World Lessons: Ethical Speculation Through Design Fiction on Emotional Support Conversational AI
authors: Kollig, Faye and Pater, Jessica and Nova, Fayika Farhat and Fiesler, Casey
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores ethical considerations of emotional support AI through design fiction, identifying potential failures and providing real-world lessons.
problem_english: As emotional support conversational AIs become increasingly prevalent, potential misuse and ethical challenges arise, necessitating careful examination of potential failures and the ethical implications linked to these technologies.
method_english: The authors employed design fiction to simulate scenarios where emotional support AIs fail. This speculative approach permitted detailed examination of ethical implications and offered insights into potential real-world impacts, steering future design considerations.
results_english: The study identifies key ethical challenges, such as privacy concerns and dependency risks, associated with emotional support AIs. It lays out lessons to better inform real-world AI design, emphasizing the need for ethical oversight and user-centric solutions.
summary_japanese: 感情サポートAIの倫理をデザイン・フィクションで分析し、失敗点を特定し現実の教訓を提供。
problem_japanese: 感情支援会話型AIの普及に伴い、誤用や倫理的課題が生じる可能性があり、これら技術の倫理的含意と失敗の可能性を慎重に検討する必要がある。
method_japanese: 感情サポートAIが失敗するシナリオをデザインフィクションで模擬。それにより、倫理的影響を詳細に解明し、現実のインパクトについての洞察を得て将来の設計指針を導く。
results_japanese: プライバシー問題や依存リスク等の倫理的課題を特定。倫理的管理とユーザー中心の解決策の重要性を強調しAI設計への教訓を提示。

title: Generative AI as a Playful yet Offensive Tourist: Exploring Tensions Between Playful Features and Citizen Concerns in Designing Urban Play
authors: Hung, Peng-Kai and Huang, Janet Yi-Ching and Liang, Rung-Huei and Wensveen, Stephan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the tensions between playful urban design features enabled by generative AI and the concerns of citizens. It highlights the balance needed between innovation and community acceptance in urban play designs.
problem_english: The challenge lies in designing urban play environments using generative AI that offer engaging, playful features while addressing concerns about privacy, safety, and cultural sensitivities from local citizens. Balancing innovation with public acceptance is critical for successful implementation.
method_english: The study employs a multidisciplinary approach, combining human-computer interaction research, urban design exploration, and generative AI technology assessment. It engages stakeholders actively through workshops and feedback sessions to gather diverse perspectives and ensure that designs meet community needs and expectations.
results_english: Results indicate a successful identification of key concerns among local citizens. The framework developed helps guide the balance between playful urban features and public concerns, aiding designers in creating more accepted and effective urban play implementations.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ジェネレーティブAIがもたらす都市遊びと市民の懸念との緊張を探求し、革新と受容のバランスを論じる。
problem_japanese: ジェネレーティブAIを用いた都市遊びの設計において、プライバシーや安全性、文化的感受性への市民の懸念に対処しつつ、魅力的な遊びの特徴を提供することが課題とされる。
method_japanese: 人間とコンピュータの相互作用、都市デザイン探索、ジェネレーティブAI技術評価を組み合わせた学際的手法を採用し、ワークショップでの意見収集を通じて多様な視点を集めた。
results_japanese: 市民の懸念の主要点を特定、獲得し、遊びの特徴と市民の懸念間のバランスを導く枠組みを開発。デザインの受け入れ向上に寄与した。

title: How CO2STLY Is CHI? The Carbon Footprint of Generative AI in HCI Research and What We Should Do About It
authors: Inie, Nanna and Falk, Jeanette and Selvan, Raghavendra
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines the carbon footprint of generative AI in HCI research and proposes strategies to mitigate its environmental impact. The authors emphasize the need for sustainable practices in AI deployment to reduce carbon emissions associated with training and execution.
problem_english: The growing use of generative AI in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) research significantly contributes to carbon emissions due to the substantial energy requirements of AI model training and execution. This environmental impact poses a challenge to sustainability efforts within the field.
method_english: The authors conducted an analysis of the carbon footprint of generative AI applications in HCI research. They surveyed current practices and identified key areas of high energy consumption. The paper proposes sustainable practices and guidelines to reduce energy use and emissions in the deployment of AI systems.
results_english: The study highlights significant variability in the carbon emissions of AI models, emphasizing the importance of model efficiency and optimization. The recommended practices and guidelines, when implemented, can lead to a marked reduction in the environmental impact of AI systems within HCI research.
summary_japanese: 本論文はHCI研究における生成AIの炭素足跡を調査し、環境への影響を軽減する戦略を提唱している。
problem_japanese: HCI研究における生成AIの使用は、AIモデルの学習と実行に大量のエネルギーを必要とするため、炭素排出量を大幅に増加させ、持続可能性の問題を引き起こしている。
method_japanese: 生成AIアプリケーションの炭素足跡を分析し、エネルギー消費が多い領域を特定。エネルギー使用と排出量を削減するための持続可能なガイドラインを提案した。
results_japanese: AIモデルの炭素排出量には大きな変動があり、モデルの効率と最適化が重要。提案されたガイドラインの実施でHCI研究の環境影響が大幅に削減可能。

title: Crowdsourced Think-Aloud Studies
authors: Cutler, Zach and Harrison, Lane and Nobre, Carolina and Lex, Alexander
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the feasibility of conducting think-aloud studies through crowdsourcing. The authors investigate methods to gather qualitative data effectively, offering insights into user behavior and thought processes.
problem_english: Traditional think-aloud studies are time-consuming, expensive, and limited to small groups due to logistical constraints. There's a need for scalable methods that allow researchers to collect qualitative insights from a broader audience, efficiently and cost-effectively.
method_english: The authors propose utilizing crowdsourcing platforms to conduct think-aloud studies. They design a structured approach to instruct participants remotely, enabling the collection of verbalized thoughts during interactions with digital interfaces while ensuring data quality.
results_english: The study demonstrates that crowdsourced think-aloud methods can yield reliable data comparable to traditional methods. These methods increase scalability, reduce costs, and provide a broader perspective on user interactions and thought processes.
summary_japanese: クラウドソーシングを用いたthink-aloud研究の実現可能性を探求し、ユーザーの行動と考えを効果的に収集する方法を模索。
problem_japanese: 従来のthink-aloud研究は時間とコストがかかり、少人数に制限されるため、より広い参加者から効率的かつコスト効果の高い質的洞察を集めるスケーラブルな方法が必要。
method_japanese: クラウドソーシングプラットフォームを利用し、リモートで参加者に指導する構造化されたアプローチを設計、デジタルインターフェースとの対話中の思考を収集しつつデータ品質を確保。
results_japanese: クラウドソーシングによるthink-aloud手法は、従来の手法と比較可能な信頼性の高いデータを生成。スケーラビリティやコスト削減を実現し、ユーザーのインタラクションと思考過程に幅広い視点を提供。

title: Deploying and Examining Beacon for At-Home Patient Self-Monitoring with Critical Flicker Frequency
authors: Li, Richard and Vutien, Philip and Omer, Sabrina and Yacoub, Michael and Ioannou, George and Karkar, Ravi and Munson, Sean A. and Fogarty, James
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the feasibility of using Beacon for at-home patient self-monitoring, focusing on Critical Flicker Frequency as a marker for certain health conditions.
problem_english: Many patients require continuous monitoring of health conditions, which is often burdensome and intrusive. There's a need for non-invasive and simple tools for home monitoring that can provide reliable data without frequent clinical visits.
method_english: Beacon leverages Critical Flicker Frequency, a neuropsychological test, as a non-invasive measurement. The system was deployed in patients' homes, allowing them to self-monitor and report data back to health practitioners.
results_english: The deployment of Beacon demonstrated promising results in terms of user compliance and data reliability, suggesting that Critical Flicker Frequency can be effectively measured at home, providing valuable insights into patient health.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、Beconを用いた在宅患者の自己モニタリングの実現可能性を探り、特に臨界フリッカ周波数に焦点を当てます。
problem_japanese: 多くの患者が健康状態の継続的な監視を必要とし、それはしばしば負担であり侵襲的です。頻繁な臨床訪問なしに信頼できるデータを提供する非侵襲的で簡単な在宅監視ツールが必要です。
method_japanese: 臨界フリッカ頻度を非侵襲的な測定法として活用するBeconを、患者宅で展開し、自己モニタリングとデータ報告を可能にしました。
results_japanese: Beconの展開はユーザーの遵守率とデータの信頼性において有望な結果を示し、在宅で臨界フリッカ周波数を効果的に測定できることが示唆されました。

title: Describing Explored Places through OpenStreetMap Data
authors: Schade, Eve and Savino, Gian-Luca and Niess, Jasmin and Sch\"{o}ning, Johannes
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study leverages OpenStreetMap data to describe explored locations, aiming to enhance user experiences and provide insights into geospatial information representation.
problem_english: Current geospatial data representations often lack detailed contextual information that can facilitate meaningful user interactions and improve exploration experiences. Users may struggle to understand the significance and characteristics of places due to limited descriptive data.
method_english: The authors propose a framework using OpenStreetMap data to automatically generate detailed descriptions of locations. This approach integrates geospatial data analysis and natural language processing techniques to enhance the depth and context of place descriptions.
results_english: The method successfully generated enriched descriptions of explored locations, offering users more informative insights and improving their ability to comprehend and interact with geospatial data.
summary_japanese: 本研究はOpenStreetMapデータを利用して探索した場所を記述し、ユーザー体験の向上と地理情報の表現に関する洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 現行の地理空間データ表現は、意味あるユーザーインタラクションや探索体験を改善するための詳細な文脈情報が不足していることが多く、ユーザーは場所の意義や特徴を十分に理解できません。
method_japanese: 著者らは、OpenStreetMapデータを用いて自動的に場所の詳細な記述を作成する枠組みを提案。地理空間データ解析と自然言語処理技術を統合し、記述の深度と文脈を強化する。
results_japanese: この手法により、探索した場所の説明が豊かになり、ユーザーにより情報豊富な洞察を提供し、地理空間データとの相互作用を向上させました。

title: Friend or Foe? Navigating and Re-configuring “Snipers' Alley“
authors: Dwyer, Andrew C and Coles-Kemp, Lizzie and Heath, Claude P R and Crivellaro, Clara
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores strategies to navigate and re-configure digital 'Snipers' Alley' environments, where online activities face constant surveillance and threats.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of operating in 'Snipers' Alley', digital spaces where surveillance and threats are pervasive. Users need methods to traverse these hostile environments while maintaining personal security and privacy online.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative research, analyzing user interactions within 'Snipers' Alley' using a combination of ethnographic fieldwork and participatory design sessions to propose new navigation strategies and systems.
results_english: The findings reveal effective strategies for users to navigate 'Snipers' Alley'. The study highlights methods to enhance digital security practices, enabling safer and more private online interactions in surveilled environments.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、デジタル上の「スナイパーアレー」における戦略と環境の再構築を探求しています。
problem_japanese: デジタル空間「スナイパーアレー」における監視及び脅威への対処が課題です。利用者は個人の安全とプライバシーを守りつつ、この過酷な環境を移動する方法を求めています。
method_japanese: 著者らは質的調査を行い、「スナイパーアレー」でのユーザーのインタラクションをエスノグラフィフィールドワークと参加型デザインセッションを組み合わせて分析、ナビゲーション戦略を提案します。
results_japanese: 調査結果は「スナイパーアレー」での有効なナビゲーション戦略を明らかにし、安全でプライバシーを確保したオンライン活動を可能にする方法を示しています。

title: Snap, Sweat, and Sketch: Designing Home Exercise Experiences for Augmented Reality Head-mounted Displays
authors: Adiwangsa, Michelle and Sweetser, Penny and Ozdowska, Anne
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores designing home exercise experiences using augmented reality (AR) head-mounted displays, aiming to enhance engagement and effectiveness. The researchers propose a new interaction design approach combining physical feedback and virtual elements.
problem_english: With the rise of home exercise, traditional workouts often lack engagement and personalization, leading to decreased motivation and adherence. Existing AR solutions have not fully addressed these issues, often focusing more on entertainment than effective exercise facilitation.
method_english: The authors propose an interaction design framework for AR head-mounted displays that integrates physical feedback with virtually augmented workouts. This approach includes real-time biometric tracking, personalized environment adjustments, and interactive virtual coaches to enhance user engagement and workout effectiveness.
results_english: The study found that integrating physical feedback and personalized virtual elements in AR home workouts significantly improved user motivation and satisfaction. Test users reported increased engagement and perceived effectiveness, suggesting potential for broader adoption and impact on home exercise routines.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ARヘッドマウントディスプレイを用いてホームエクササイズ体験をデザインし、エンゲージメントと効果を向上させる方法を探ります。
problem_japanese: ホームエクササイズの拡大に伴い、従来のワークアウトはしばしばエンゲージメントやパーソナライゼーションに欠け、モチベーションや遵守力の低下を招く。この課題を現在のARソリューションは充分に解決していない。
method_japanese: 著者は、ARヘッドマウントディスプレイ用のインタラクションデザインフレームワークを提案し、身体的フィードバックを仮想のワークアウト体験に統合する方法をとる。
results_japanese: 本研究は、身体的フィードバックとパーソナライズされた仮想要素を統合することで、ユーザーのモチベーションと満足度が大幅に向上することを示しました。

title: Towards Fair and Equitable Incentives to Motivate Paid and Unpaid Crowd Contributions
authors: Wallace, Shaun and Massachi, Talie and Su, Jiaqi and Miller, Dave B and Huang, Jeff
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores fair incentives for both paid and unpaid crowd contributions, seeking balance and equity to motivate diverse participation.
problem_english: Crowdsourcing platforms often lack equitable incentive structures, which can skew participation towards monetary compensations and overlook intrinsic motivations. This imbalance may lead to reduced diversity and engagement in unpaid contributions, compromising the richness and effectiveness of crowd-collaborative tasks.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach, integrating qualitative interviews with quantitative analysis of existing incentive models. It evaluates new frameworks for incentivizing contributions across different motivation spectrums, aiming to design equitable systems that reflect both intrinsic and extrinsic motivators.
results_english: The findings reveal that a tailored incentive system, considering both monetary and non-monetary rewards, significantly enhances participation diversity. The proposed model not only distributes contributions equitably but also increases engagement across varied demographics, bridging gaps between paid and unpaid collaboration opportunities.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、報酬に偏らず、公平で多様な参加を促す群衆貢献のインセンティブを探求する。
problem_japanese: クラウドソーシングプラットフォームは、公平なインセンティブ構造が欠如しており、金銭的報酬重視の参加に偏りがちで、内在的動機を軽視する。この不均衡は、未払い貢献の多様性と関与の低下を招き、群衆協働タスクの豊かさと効果を損なう可能性がある。
method_japanese: 本研究は質的インタビューと量的なインセンティブモデル分析を組み合わせた混合法を用いる。新たなインセンティブフレームワークを評価し、内在的・外在的動機を反映した公平なシステム設計を目指す。
results_japanese: 結果は、金銭的・非金銭的報酬を考慮したオーダーメイドインセンティブシステムが多様な参加を大幅に向上させることを示した。提案モデルは貢献を公平に分配し、支払いのある・ない協働機会のギャップを埋め、多様な人口層の関与を高める。

title: Why does Automation Adoption in Organizations Remain a Fallacy?: Scrutinizing Practitioners' Imaginaries in an International Airport
authors: Gomez-Beldarrain, Garoa and Verma, Himanshu and Kim, Euiyoung and Bozzon, Alessandro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines why automation adoption in organizations often fails. Using a case study of an international airport, it analyzes practitioners' perceptions and imaginaries about automation.
problem_english: Despite advances in technology, organizations struggle with automating processes due to divergent perceptions among practitioners. These misunderstandings hinder successful integration and reveal a gap between technical possibilities and actual implementation.
method_english: The study employs qualitative methods, including interviews and observations, to explore how practitioners at an international airport perceive and imagine automation. This approach highlights the disconnect between their expectations and the real-world application of automated systems.
results_english: Findings illustrate a significant gap between automation's potential and its perceived capabilities by practitioners, leading to limited adoption. Misaligned expectations and organizational cultures contribute to the fallacy of successful automation integration.
summary_japanese: 本論文は組織での自動化採用の失敗要因を、国際空港の事例を用いて探求し、関係者の認識に着目しています。
problem_japanese: 技術の進歩にもかかわらず、組織の自動化が進まないのは、関係者間の認識の違いが原因です。これにより技術的可能性と実際の実装の間にギャップが生じ、統合が妨げられています。
method_japanese: 国際空港の関係者が自動化をどう認識・想像するかを、インタビューや観察を用いる質的手法で調査し、期待と現実の不一致を浮き彫りにします。
results_japanese: 自動化の潜在能力と関係者の認識に大きなギャップがあり、採用が進まない現状を示します。期待と組織文化の不一致が統合の失敗要因です。

title: "It's about Research. It's Not about Language": Understanding and Designing for Mitigating Non-Native English-Speaking Presenters' Challenges in Live Q&A Sessions at Academic Conferences
authors: Li, Lingyuan and Wang, Ge and Freeman, Guo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the linguistic and non-linguistic challenges non-native English-speaking presenters face in academic Q&A sessions and suggests design strategies to alleviate these issues.
problem_english: Non-native English-speaking presenters at academic conferences face significant challenges during live Q&A sessions, including language proficiency, cultural differences, and anxiety, affecting their ability to effectively communicate their research to an international audience.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and surveys with non-native English-speaking academics to identify their challenges. They utilized qualitative analysis to uncover common themes and developed design recommendations to assist presenters in overcoming these difficulties in the Q&A context.
results_english: The study reveals that non-linguistic factors like cultural misunderstandings and anxiety exacerbate the language barrier. Design interventions like pre-session practice and real-time translation tools can help non-native speakers better engage and convey their ideas during conferences.
summary_japanese: この論文は、非ネイティブ英語話者が学会Q&Aで直面する課題とその軽減策を分析しています。
problem_japanese: 非ネイティブ英語話者の発表者は学会のQ&Aセッションで言語能力や文化的差異、不安感など多くの課題に直面し、研究を国際的な聴衆に効果的に伝えることが難しくなっています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、非ネイティブ英語話者の学者へのインタビューとアンケートを実施し、課題を特定しました。質的分析で共通のテーマを明らかにし、Q&Aセッションでの困難を克服するためのデザイン推奨を開発しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、文化的誤解や不安が言語の壁を悪化させることを明らかにしました。事前練習やリアルタイム翻訳ツールのようなデザインの介入が非ネイティブスピーカーの参加とアイデアの伝達を助ける可能性があります。

title: A robot teacher "is very good for learning, but not for human relationships": Japanese Children's Critical Perspectives Towards Ethical AI Futures
authors: Sharma, Sumita and Klemettil\"{a}, Pauli and Tanaka, Junko
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines Japanese children's views on robot teachers in learning versus human relationships, revealing critical perspectives on ethical AI futures.
problem_english: The study addresses the ethical implications of deploying AI-based robot teachers in educational settings, specifically focusing on their impact on learning outcomes versus their influence on human relational development, as perceived by Japanese children. It seeks to understand the children's critical perspectives towards this dual role.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative interviews with Japanese children, collecting data on their perceptions of robot teachers. They employed thematic analysis to identify patterns and themes in the children's responses, focusing on distinctions between educational benefits and relational drawbacks.
results_english: Findings reveal that children appreciate robot teachers for effective learning enhancements but express concerns about the inability to foster human relationships. The study highlights a critical view among children who value emotional and relational aspects of education, calling for balanced AI integration.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、学習におけるロボット教師に対する日本の子供たちの見解を分析し、倫理的AIの未来についての批判的視点を明らかにする。
problem_japanese: 教育現場でAIベースのロボット教師を導入することの倫理的影響に焦点を当て、日本の子供たちが学習成果と人間関係の発達に与える影響について批判的視点を持っているか検討する。
method_japanese: 日本の子供たちに質的インタビューを実施し、ロボット教師に対する認識を収集。テーマ分析を行い、教育的利益と関係的欠点に関するパターンを特定。
results_japanese: 子供たちは学習の向上にはロボット教師を評価するが、人間関係形成には否定的。感情と関係性の重要性を考慮したAIのバランスの取れた統合が提唱される。

title: All-inclusive TORs: Cross-Cultural and Age-Sensitive Design for Take-Over Requests in Level 3 Cars
authors: Srour Zreik, Rawan and Harvey, Monika and Brewster, Stephen Anthony
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates cross-cultural and age-sensitive design for Take-Over Requests (TORs) in Level 3 semi-autonomous cars to enhance user accessibility and safety.
problem_english: With the rise of Level 3 semi-autonomous vehicles, ensuring an effective and inclusive design for Take-Over Requests (TORs) becomes crucial. Differing cultural backgrounds and age groups may impact how users perceive and respond to these requests, raising safety and usability concerns.
method_english: The researchers conducted user studies involving participants from various cultural backgrounds and age groups. They tested several TOR designs under controlled driving simulator environments to assess users' perception and response times. Data analysis focused on identifying patterns related to cultural and age-specific preferences and challenges.
results_english: The study found significant differences in response times and preference based on cultural and age variations. These findings emphasize the need for customizable TOR designs to cater to diverse user groups, thereby enhancing usability and safety in Level 3 vehicles.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、レベル3自動車におけるTake-Over Requests（TORs）の文化・年齢に配慮したデザインを探求し、安全性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: レベル3の半自律車両の普及に伴い、Take-Over Requests（TORs）の効果的かつ包括的なデザインが重要となっています。異なる文化的背景や年齢層は、利用者がこれらの要求をどう受け取り反応するかに影響し、安全性や使いやすさに課題を生じさせます。
method_japanese: 研究者は異なる文化背景と年齢層の参加者を含むユーザースタディを実施しました。制御された運転シミュレーター環境で複数のTORデザインをテストし、ユーザーの認知と反応時間を評価しました。データ解析は、文化および年齢に固有の好みと課題に関連するパターンの特定に焦点を当てました。
results_japanese: 研究で文化や年齢の変化による反応時間と嗜好の顕著な差が明らかになりました。これらの結果は、多様なユーザーグループに対応できるカスタマイズ可能なTORデザインの必要性を強調しています、これによりレベル3車両の使いやすさと安全性が向上します。

title: Around the World in 60 Cyclists: Evaluating Autonomous Vehicle-Cyclist Interfaces Across Cultures
authors: Al-Taie, Ammar and Matviienko, Andrii and O'Hagan, Joseph and Pollick, Frank and Brewster, Stephen Anthony
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines the effectiveness of autonomous vehicle-cyclist interfaces across different cultures, involving 60 cyclists from various backgrounds to assess interaction quality and usability.
problem_english: As autonomous vehicles become more prevalent, ensuring safe and effective communication with cyclists is critical. However, cultural differences may influence how these interfaces are interpreted and interacted with, posing a challenge in creating universally effective designs.
method_english: The researchers conducted a cross-cultural study with 60 cyclists from diverse cultural backgrounds. They evaluated several autonomous vehicle-cyclist interfaces using standardized interaction scenarios, usability questionnaires, and interviews, aiming to identify cultural variations in interface effectiveness and preferences.
results_english: The study found significant cultural differences in interface preferences and interpretations among cyclists. While some interfaces showed universal effectiveness, others varied widely in usability and acceptance, highlighting the need for culturally adaptable design solutions in autonomous vehicle interactions.
summary_japanese: 自動車と自転車者のインターフェースを文化横断的に評価し、60人の自転車者を対象に質と使いやすさを調査した。
problem_japanese: 自動運転車が普及する中、安全で効果的な自転車者とのコミュニケーションが不可欠となる。しかし、文化の違いがインターフェースの解釈や使い方に影響を与え、普遍的に効果的な設計が難しいという課題がある。
method_japanese: 多様な文化背景を持つ60人の自転車者と共に国際的な調査を実施。標準化されたインタラクションシナリオ、アンケート、インタビューを利用し、文化的差異を考慮したインターフェースの評価を行った。
results_japanese: 文化によるインターフェースの好みと解釈に顕著な違いが見られた。普遍的に効果を示したものもあれば、使いやすさや受容に違いがあるものも確認され、文化に適応した設計の必要性が示された。

title: Toward Language Justice: Exploring Multilingual Captioning for Accessibility
authors: Desai, Aashaka and Alharbi, Rahaf and Hsueh, Stacy and Ladner, Richard E. and Mankoff, Jennifer
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the potential of multilingual captioning as a tool for accessibility and language justice, analyzing its impact on non-native speakers and hearing-impaired viewers.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of language accessibility in multimedia content, particularly for non-native speakers and individuals with hearing impairments, emphasizing the need for inclusive solutions like multilingual captioning.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies focusing on the effectiveness and user preferences of multilingual captioning across different language speakers, analyzing both accessibility and comprehension outcomes.
results_english: The study found that multilingual captioning significantly improved content accessibility and comprehension for both non-native speakers and hearing-impaired users, showcasing its potential for broader application.
summary_japanese: 本論文は多言語字幕がアクセシビリティと言語正義に貢献する可能性を探求し、非母語話者や聴覚障害者への影響を分析しています。
problem_japanese: 非母語話者や聴覚障害者向けのマルチメディアコンテンツにおける言語アクセシビリティの課題を取り上げ、多言語字幕などの包括的な解決策の必要性を強調しています。
method_japanese: 異なる言語話者に対する多言語字幕の有効性やユーザーの好みをユーザースタディで調査し、アクセシビリティと理解度の結果を分析しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、多言語字幕が非母語話者や聴覚障害者に対してコンテンツのアクセシビリティと理解度を著しく向上させることを示しました。

title: Towards Youth-Sensitive Hateful Content Reporting: An Inclusive Focus Group Study in Germany
authors: B\"{a}umler, Julian and Bader, Helen and Kaufhold, Marc-Andr\'{e} and Reuter, Christian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores youth-sensitive reporting of hateful online content in Germany through inclusive focus group discussions, aiming to enhance youth engagement and improve reporting mechanisms.
problem_english: Current online platforms often lack effective reporting mechanisms for hateful content that are sensitive to youth's needs, leading to underreporting and insufficient moderation, which can harm users, especially younger demographics who may be more vulnerable.
method_english: Researchers conducted inclusive focus group sessions with diverse youth representatives in Germany, utilizing qualitative methods to gather insights on how current reporting systems handle hateful content and identifying youths' specific needs and preferences.
results_english: The study highlights the importance of integrating youth perspectives into reporting systems, revealing that youths desire clearer guidelines, better feedback loops, and more supportive environments to report hateful content safely and effectively.
summary_japanese: 本研究はドイツでの若者向け憎悪コンテンツ報告を探るためのインクルーシブなフォーカスグループを用い、若者の関与を促進し報告メカニズムの改善を目指します。
problem_japanese: 現在のオンラインプラットフォームは若者のニーズに敏感な憎悪コンテンツの報告メカニズムを欠いており、過小報告や不十分なモデレーションにより、特に若い世代に悪影響を及ぼしています。
method_japanese: 研究者はドイツの多様な若者の代表者とのインクルーシブなフォーカスグループセッションを実施し、現在の報告システムが憎悪コンテンツをどのように扱っているかについての洞察を収集しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、報告システムへの若者の視点の統合の重要性を強調し、若者が明確なガイドライン、フィードバックループ、支援環境を求めていることを明らかにしました。

title: Wordplay: Accessible, Multilingual, Interactive Typography
authors: Ko, Amy J and Aldana Lira, Carlos and Amaya, Isabel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Wordplay explores creating multilingual interactive typography that is accessible, promoting inclusivity in digital design, enabling diverse interactions through adaptable font technologies.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of designing digital typography that is inclusive and accessible across multiple languages. Current digital typographic designs often lack interactivity and adaptability, limiting user experiences and excluding non-native speakers or those with disabilities from effectively engaging with text content.
method_english: The authors propose a framework for developing multilingual interactive typography focusing on accessibility by utilizing adaptable font technologies. They emphasize user-centered design principles and conduct user studies to evaluate the effectiveness of their approach in enhancing text interaction across languages.
results_english: The study found their interactive typography framework significantly improved user engagement and inclusivity, with users of diverse linguistic backgrounds and abilities reporting enhanced readability and interaction. Their approach proved effective across multiple digital platforms, showcasing the potential for broader application.
summary_japanese: Wordplayは、アクセシブルで多言語対応のインタラクティブなタイポグラフィの作成を探求し、デジタルデザインの包括性を促進します。
problem_japanese: 本稿では、デジタルタイポグラフィの設計における多言語対応の重要性と、現在のデザインが持つインタラクティブ性や適応性の不足が、非母語話者や障害を持つ人々の効果的なテキスト利用を妨げている点を指摘しています。
method_japanese: アクセシブルな多言語インタラクティブタイポグラフィを開発するためのフレームワークを提案し、ユーザー中心設計とユーザースタディを用いてその効果を評価しました。
results_japanese: インタラクティブタイポグラフィフレームワークが多様なユーザーのエンゲージメントと包括性を改善し、読みやすさとインタラクションを向上させる効果を確認しました。

title: "They've Over-Emphasized That One Search": Controlling Unwanted Content on TikTok's For You Page
authors: Vera, Julie A. and Ghosh, Sourojit
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores users' experiences with unwanted content on TikTok's For You Page, highlighting challenges in controlling and personalizing feed recommendations.
problem_english: Users face difficulty in managing the content they encounter on TikTok's For You Page. Despite efforts to personalize experiences, unwanted content persists, disrupting user satisfaction and content consumption. This research seeks to understand these challenges.
method_english: The research employs qualitative interviews and surveys with TikTok users to gather insights into their experiences and strategies for managing unwanted content and controlling feed curation. It analyzes user feedback on TikTok's algorithms and control options.
results_english: Findings reveal dissatisfaction with TikTok's existing control mechanisms and algorithms. Users struggle to eliminate unwanted content efficiently, indicating a need for better personalization options and increased transparency in content recommendation processes.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、TikTokのFor You Pageでの不要なコンテンツの管理に関するユーザーの困難点を調査し、フィードレコメンデーションの個別化の課題を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: ユーザーはTikTokのFor You Pageで遭遇するコンテンツの管理に苦労しています。体験を個別化する試みにもかかわらず、不要なコンテンツが持続し、ユーザーの満足度とコンテンツ消費を妨げている状況が課題です。
method_japanese: この研究は、ユーザー体験と不要なコンテンツ管理の戦略についての定性的インタビューと調査を用いてTikTokユーザーから洞察を収集し、アルゴリズムと制御オプションについてのユーザーのフィードバックを分析します。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、TikTokの既存の制御メカニズムとアルゴリズムに対する不満を示しています。ユーザーは不要なコンテンツを効率的に排除するのに苦労しており、より良い個別化オプションとコンテンツ推薦プロセスの透明性向上が必要です。

title: A Comparative Study of How People With and Without ADHD Recognise and Avoid Dark Patterns on Social Media
authors: Mildner, Thomas and Fidel, Daniel and Stefanidi, Evropi and Wo\'{z}niak, Pawe\l{} W. and Malaka, Rainer and Niess, Jasmin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the differences in how individuals with and without ADHD identify and navigate dark patterns on social media, employing surveys and experiments to assess recognition and avoidance behaviors.
problem_english: The research aims to address how individuals with ADHD respond to dark patterns on social media compared to those without ADHD. Dark patterns are deceptive design elements that can manipulate user behavior, and understanding these patterns' impact on users with ADHD is critical for developing inclusive design practices.
method_english: The study employed surveys and controlled experiments involving participants with and without ADHD. Participants were exposed to a variety of dark patterns on social media platforms, and their ability to recognize and avoid these was systematically assessed through behavioral observation and self-reported data.
results_english: Findings indicate that individuals with ADHD are less aware of and have greater difficulty avoiding dark patterns compared to those without ADHD. Strategies for enhancing awareness and design recommendations for mitigating negative effects are proposed to support ADHD users in social media environments.
summary_japanese: この研究は、ADHDの有無によるソーシャルメディア上のダークパターンの認識と回避行動の違いを調査しました。
problem_japanese: この研究では、ADHDを持つ人がソーシャルメディア上のダークパターンにどのように反応するかを、ADHDを持たない人と比較することを目的としています。ダークパターンはユーザーの行動を操作する可能性のある欺瞞的なデザイン要素であり、ADHDユーザーへの影響を理解することは包括的な設計プラクティスの開発に重要です。
method_japanese: ADHD持つ人と持たない人を対象にした調査と実験を用いました。参加者はソーシャルメディア上のダークパターンにさらされ、認識と回避能力が観察と自己報告データを通じて体系的に評価されました。
results_japanese: ADHDを持つ個人は、ダークパターンを認識する能力が低く、回避も困難であると判明しました。意識向上のための戦略とADHDユーザー支援の設計推奨が提案されました。

title: Dark Patterns in the Opt-Out Process and Compliance with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
authors: Tran, Van Hong and Mehrotra, Aarushi and Sharma, Ranya and Chetty, Marshini and Feamster, Nick and Frankenreiter, Jens and Strahilevitz, Lior
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines the use of dark patterns in opt-out processes under the CCPA, analyzing compliance issues and their impact on consumer privacy decisions.
problem_english: The study highlights concerns regarding the presence of dark patterns in opt-out processes, which can undermine consumer autonomy and complicate compliance with the CCPA. Such manipulative designs could lead to ineffective consumer choices, thus compromising privacy rights under California law.
method_english: Researchers conducted an empirical analysis of multiple websites’ opt-out processes, evaluating the presence and types of dark patterns used. They utilized a combination of qualitative and quantitative techniques, including user studies and pattern recognition algorithms.
results_english: The analysis revealed widespread use of dark patterns that hinder easy opt-out, with significant non-compliance with CCPA mandates. This suggests insufficient enforcement and consumer protection, affecting privacy decisions negatively.
summary_japanese: 暗黙の同意を得るプロセスでのダークパターン使用を調査し、CCPAの遵守問題と消費者のプライバシー決定への影響を分析。
problem_japanese: 暗黙の同意を得るプロセスでのダークパターンの存在が懸念されており、消費者の自律性を損ない、CCPAの遵守を複雑にしています。こうした操作的デザインは効果的な消費者選択を妨げ、カリフォルニア州法に基づくプライバシー権を脅かす可能性があります。
method_japanese: 研究者は、複数のウェブサイトの暗黙の同意プロセスの実証的分析を行い、使用されているダークパターンの存在と種類を評価しました。ユーザー研究やパターン認識アルゴリズムを含む定性・定量的技法を使用しました。
results_japanese: 分析により、容易に同意できないダークパターンの広範な使用とCCPA規約の重大な不遵守が明らかになり、不十分な法執行と消費者保護がプライバシー決定に悪影響を与えています。

title: From Awareness to Action: The Effects of Experiential Learning on Educating Users about Dark Patterns
authors: Ye, Jingzhou and Li, Yao and Zou, Wenting and Wang, Xueqiang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates the impact of experiential learning on raising awareness and motivating action against dark patterns in digital interfaces. Using experimental methods, it evaluates users' behavioral changes after interactive educational interventions.
problem_english: Dark patterns are manipulative design techniques in digital interfaces that exploit users' cognitive biases without their awareness, leading to unfavorable outcomes. Educating users about these patterns is crucial but challenging as mere awareness often does not translate into behavioral change. The main challenge is finding effective ways to motivate users to act against these patterns.
method_english: The authors employ a series of controlled experiments involving simulated interactions with dark patterns in a safe environment. Participants experience these manipulative interfaces firsthand, followed by educational sessions that explain the underlying psychological principles. The study evaluates the effectiveness of this experiential learning approach in enhancing users' understanding and changing their behaviors towards dark patterns.
results_english: The study finds that experiential learning significantly improves users' ability to identify dark patterns and increases their likelihood to resist and report these manipulative interfaces. Participants who underwent experiential training displayed greater confidence and vigilance towards dark patterns, suggesting that active engagement leads to more effective educational outcomes.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ダークパターン認識の向上と行動促進における体験学習の効果を検討し、インタラクティブな教育介入後の行動変化を評価します。
problem_japanese: ダークパターンは、デジタルインターフェースでユーザーの認知バイアスを利用した操作的なデザイン手法で、課題は、ユーザーの認識が行動変化につながらないことが多い点です。効果的にユーザーを行動に駆り立てる方法を見つけ出すことが課題です。
method_japanese: 擬似的なダークパターンを体験させる実験を行い、体験後に心理学原理を説明する教育セッションで理解を深める手法を用います。体験学習がダークパターンの認識向上と行動変化に及ぼす効果を評価します。
results_japanese: 体験学習はダークパターンを特定する能力を向上させ、抵抗や報告の可能性を高めました。体験を通じた訓練後、参加者はダークパターンへの警戒心や自身が向上し、教育効果が増したことが示されました。

title: Getting Trapped in Amazon's "Iliad Flow": A Foundation for the Temporal Analysis of Dark Patterns
authors: Gray, Colin M. and Mildner, Thomas and Gairola, Ritika
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores temporal patterns in dark design, focusing on Amazon's "Iliad Flow." It provides foundational analysis and identifies how users are systematically trapped.
problem_english: Users frequently encounter dark patterns that elongate interaction times and obscure decision-making processes. These patterns often lead to user frustration, manipulation, and unintended actions, which necessitate detailed analysis.
method_english: The authors use a qualitative approach, analyzing user interactions with Amazon's checkout process. They apply Temporal Analysis of Interaction and Decision pathways to understand how dark patterns trap users.
results_english: The study reveals Amazon's use of the "Iliad Flow" to extend shopping time and manipulate decisions. Results highlight specific design elements that systematically trap users, indicating deliberate design strategies.
summary_japanese: この論文は、アマゾンの「イリアスフロー」に焦点を当て、暗黙のデザインにおける時間的パターンを探る。
problem_japanese: ユーザーは暗黙のパターンにより、操作時間の延長や決定プロセスの曖昧化に頻繁に直面する。ユーザーのフラストレーションや意図しない行動を引き起こすこれらのパターンの詳細な分析が必要とされる。
method_japanese: アマゾンのチェックアウトプロセスでのユーザーのインタラクションを質的に分析し、時間的な分析と意思決定経路分析を適用して暗黙のパターンの追求方法を理解する。
results_japanese: 調査によりアマゾンの「イリアスフロー」が購買時間を延ばし決定を操作する手法が明らかになり、ユーザーを計画的に閉じ込めるデザイン要素が特定される。

title: Placebo Effect of Control Settings in Feeds Are Not Always Strong
authors: Hsu, Silas and Koshy, Vinay and Vaccaro, Kristen and Sandvig, Christian and Karahalios, Karrie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the placebo effect of user-selected control settings on feeds, focusing on whether users perceive changes in feed presentation as actual improvements.
problem_english: The research examines whether users perceive user-selected control settings in feed presentation as effective, despite the settings potentially having no technical impact, questioning the strength of placebo effects in digital interfaces.
method_english: The study uses a combination of controlled experiments and surveys to assess users' perceptions and satisfaction with their feed settings, comparing actual changes versus placebo conditions.
results_english: Findings show that the placebo effect of control settings is not universally strong, with user perception of improvements varying based on context and individual differences in understanding and expectation.
