summary_japanese: フィードのコントロール設定のプラセボ効果を調査し、ユーザーが改善を感じるかを検証する。
problem_japanese: ユーザー選択型フィード設定が技術的な影響を持たない場合でも有効と感じられるかを調査し、デジタルインターフェースのプラセボ効果の強さを問いかける。
method_japanese: 実験と調査を組み合わせて、フィード設定に対するユーザーの認識と満足度を評価し、実際の変更とプラセボ条件を比較する。
results_japanese: コントロール設定のプラセボ効果は一律に強くはなく、改善の認識は文脈や個々の理解と期待に依存して変動することがわかった。

title: The Role of Expertise in Effectively Moderating Harmful Social Media Content
authors: Abdelkadir, Nuredin Ali and Yang, Tianling and Kapania, Shivani and Estefanos, Meron and Gebrekidan, Fasica Berhane and Zelalem, Zecharias and Ali, Messai and Berhe, Rishan and Baker, Dylan and Talat, Zeerak and Miceli, Milagros and Hanna, Alex and Gebru, Timnit
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores the role of expertise in moderating harmful social media content, emphasizing the importance of skilled moderators to enhance the effectiveness of content moderation strategies.
problem_english: Social media platforms struggle with effectively moderating harmful content due to the lack of nuanced understanding by general moderators, leading to improper handling and potential spread of misinformation and damaging content.
method_english: Researchers analyzed various moderation techniques, technologies, and policies, evaluating the effectiveness of moderators with specialized expertise in different fields compared to general moderators in handling harmful social media content.
results_english: The findings demonstrated that moderators with specialized expertise significantly improve moderation effectiveness, reducing harmful content proliferation and enhancing user experience, compared to general moderators without specialized knowledge.
summary_japanese: 専門知識に基づく有害なソーシャルメディアコンテンツの効果的なモデレーションの役割を探る研究です。
problem_japanese: ソーシャルメディアの有害なコンテンツを効果的にモデレーションできないのは、一般モデレーターによる詳細な理解の欠如が原因で、誤った取り扱いや誤情報の拡散につながります。
method_japanese: 研究者は異なる分野の専門知識を持つモデレーターと一般的なモデレーターの有害コンテンツ処理における効果を評価し、様々な技術や政策を分析しました。
results_japanese: 専門知識を持つモデレーターが有害コンテンツの拡散を減少させ、ユーザー体験を向上させるため一般モデレーターと比較して効果的であると示されています。

title: Chatbots for Data Collection in Surveys: A Comparison of Four Theory-Based Interview Probes
authors: Jacobsen, Rune M\o{}berg and Cox, Samuel Rhys and Griggio, Carla F. and van Berkel, Niels
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper evaluates the effectiveness of chatbots using four theory-based probes in conducting surveys. Researchers assess how these mechanisms influence participant engagement and data quality.
problem_english: Traditional survey methods face challenges like limited participant engagement and potential biases during data collection. Chatbots offer a novel approach but lack comprehensive understanding regarding their effectiveness and impact on data quality.
method_english: Researchers implemented four theory-based interview probes within chatbots to conduct surveys. These probes were derived from existing theories on human-computer interaction, focusing on enhancing engagement and improving data quality.
results_english: Findings indicate that chatbots employing theory-based probes improved participant engagement and yielded higher quality data. Each probe's impact varied, highlighting the importance of tailored approaches in survey design.
summary_japanese: この論文は、4つの理論ベースのプローブを用いたチャットボットが、調査の実施においてどれほど効果的かを評価しています。
problem_japanese: 従来の調査手法には、参加者の関与の欠如やデータ収集時のバイアスがある。チャットボットの新手法にはその効果やデータ品質に関する十分な理解が不足している。
method_japanese: 研究者はチャットボットに4つの理論に基づいたインタビュープローブを実装し、参加者の関与とデータ品質向上を目指しました。
results_japanese: チャットボットは理論ベースプローブを使用することで、参加者の関与とデータ品質を向上させた。各プローブの効果は異なり、調査設計においての工夫の重要性が示された。

title: Data Bias Recognition in Museum Settings: Framework Development and Contributing Factors
authors: Quinto Lima, Stella and Buraglia, Gabriela and Kam-Kwai, Wong and Roberts, Jessica
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a framework for recognizing data bias in museum settings, examining the contributing factors and proposing solutions to address these biases effectively.
problem_english: Museum datasets often contain inherent biases that can influence both public perception and academic research. These biases, stemming from collection, curation, and presentation processes, can result in skewed data that affects historical narratives and cultural insights. Identifying and addressing these biases is crucial for ensuring accurate representation.
method_english: The authors develop a framework analyzing museum data workflows to identify areas where bias can be introduced. They employ case studies, expert interviews, and statistical analyses to uncover biases in the data and propose methods for their mitigation through enhanced curation practices and inclusive policy development.
results_english: The study identifies key areas prone to bias within museum data processes, highlighting the importance of comprehensive auditing techniques. The proposed framework effectively reduces biases, leading to more balanced and representative museum collections that enhance both public understanding and scholarly research.
summary_japanese: この論文は、博物館におけるデータバイアスの認識フレームワークと、その要因となる要素を検討し、効果的な対策を提案する。
problem_japanese: 博物館のデータセットには、本質的なバイアスが含まれており、これが公衆の認識や学術研究に影響を与える。コレクション、キュレーション、プレゼンテーションの過程で生じるこれらのバイアスは、歴史的物語や文化的洞察にまで影響を及ぼすことがある。
method_japanese: 著者らは、博物館データのワークフローを分析し、バイアスが生じやすい領域を特定するフレームワークを開発した。ケーススタディ、専門家インタビュー、統計分析を使用し、データ内のバイアスを発見、緩和方法を提案した。
results_japanese: 研究は博物館データプロセスのバイアスのある主要領域を特定し、包括的な監査技術の重要性を強調する。提案されたフレームワークはバイアスを効果的に減少させ、均衡の取れた代表的な博物館コレクションを実現する。

title: Effects of Alternative Scatterplot Designs on Belief
authors: Strain, Gabriel and Stewart, Andrew J. and Jay, Caroline and Rutherford, Charlotte and Warren, Paul A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates how different scatterplot designs influence users’ beliefs. Through experimental studies, it assesses the impact of visual transformations on perception, cognition, and decision-making.
problem_english: Traditional scatterplots may not effectively convey relationships between variables, potentially leading to misinterpretation. Exploring alternative designs could enhance understanding and improve decision-making based on data insights.
method_english: The study employs experimental designs to compare traditional scatterplots with alternative designs, measuring their impact on belief through metrics such as accuracy, confidence, and decision-making efficacy.
results_english: Results indicate that certain alternative scatterplot designs lead to more accurate interpretations and increased confidence in decision-making, suggesting that design adaptations can significantly affect user beliefs.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、さまざまな散布図デザインがユーザーの信念にどのように影響するかを調査しています。
problem_japanese: 従来の散布図は変数間の関係を効果的に伝えられず、誤解を招く可能性があります。代替デザインを探ることは、理解を深め、データ洞察に基づく意思決定を向上させる可能性を示します。
method_japanese: 実験的なデザインを採用し、従来の散布図と代替デザインを比較して、正確性、自信、意思決定効力などの信念への影響を測定します。
results_japanese: 結果は、ある代替散布図デザインがより正確な解釈と意思決定への自信を増加させることを示しています。デザイン変更がユーザーの信念に大きく影響することが示唆されます。

title: Stills from the Inner Ear Shorts: Collecting and Living with Data
authors: Olson, Wyatt and Shabazz-Thompson, Freesoul El and Wells, Melanie and Xiong, Chuanzhe and Yee, Janey and Saimo, Julia R and Vu, Ocean and Narita, Jonathan and Craft, Brock and Tihanyi, Timea and Desjardins, Audrey
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the concept of collecting and living with data, focusing on how individuals interact with and relate to personal data in everyday life. It investigates the intimate connections formed and how data influences personal identities and experiences.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of understanding the personal relationships individuals have with their data. It seeks to explore how data collection and usage affect people's identities, experiences, and how they manage and interpret their personal data in their daily lives.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative research methods, including interviews and ethnographic studies, to investigate the personal narratives and experiences individuals have with their data. They analyze how people collect, manage, and interpret data, emphasizing the emotional and contextual aspects of these interactions.
results_english: The study reveals that individuals form deep, personal connections with their data, often reflecting their identities and emotional states. It identifies patterns in how data influences daily experiences and decisions, highlighting the important role personal data plays in shaping one's life and self-perception.
summary_japanese: この論文はデータとの関係に焦点を当て、個人が日常生活でデータとどのように関わり、影響を受けるかを探ります。
problem_japanese: 論文は個人がデータとの関係をどのように理解し、管理しているかという課題に取り組み、データ収集と使用が人々のアイデンティティや経験にどのように影響するかを探ります。
method_japanese: 著者はインタビューやエスノグラフィック研究を用いて、個人がデータとどのように関わるかを探求し、感情的・状況的側面に焦点を当て分析します。
results_japanese: 研究は個人がデータと深く個人的な関係を築き、それがアイデンティティや感情状態を反映することを示し、データが日常経験や意思決定に影響を与えるパターンを確認します。

title: Surrendering to Powerlesness: Governing Personal Data Flows in Generative AI
authors: G\'{o}mez Ortega, Alejandra and Morales Ornelas, Hosana and Gen\c{c}, U\u{g}ur
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the governance of personal data flows in generative AI, focusing on the powerlessness individuals feel regarding data control. It examines regulatory frameworks, ethical concerns, and proposes solutions for better governance.
problem_english: The governance of personal data in generative AI systems is problematic due to the lack of transparency and control individuals have over their data. This lack of control leads to ethical concerns and potential misuse of personal information, posing significant challenges for effective regulation.
method_english: The authors analyze existing regulatory frameworks and conduct case studies to identify the primary challenges in governing personal data flows in generative AI. They propose a new model of governance that emphasizes stakeholder engagement and adaptive regulatory practices to enhance data control and transparency.
results_english: The study finds that empowering users and improving transparency can significantly reduce the feelings of powerlessness. The proposed governance model shows potential in bridging gaps in current regulatory frameworks, promoting ethical data management and fostering trust between users and AI systems.
summary_japanese: 本論文では生成的AIにおける個人データの流れのガバナンスを探求し、個人のデータ制御に関する無力感に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: 生成AIにおける個人データのガバナンスは、個人が自分のデータに対する透明性と制御が欠如しているため問題が生じる。この制御の欠如は倫理的な懸念や個人情報の不適切な使用につながり、効果的な規制の課題となっています。
method_japanese: 著者は既存の規制フレームワークを分析し、ケーススタディを行って生成AIにおける個人データの流れを統治する上での主要な課題を特定し、利害関係者の参加と適応的な規制実践を強調する新たなガバナンスモデルを提案しています。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、ユーザーのエンパワーメントと透明性の向上が無力感を大幅に軽減できることが明らかになりました。提案されたガバナンスモデルは、現在の規制フレームワークのギャップを埋め、倫理的なデータ管理を促進し、ユーザーとAIシステム間の信頼を築く可能性があります。

title: TangibleNet: Synchronous Network Data Storytelling through Tangible Interactions in Augmented Reality
authors: Takahira, Kentaro and Kam-Kwai, Wong and Yang, Leni and Xu, Xian and Fujiwara, Takanori and Qu, Huamin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TangibleNet leverages augmented reality to create interactive storytelling of network data through tangible interactions, enhancing data understanding and collaboration.
problem_english: Existing methods for network data visualization often lack interactivity and personalization, restricting effective data exploration and collaborative analysis, especially in dynamic environments.
method_english: TangibleNet integrates tangible interactions within augmented reality, allowing users to physically manipulate data elements, enhancing intuitive exploration, personalized analysis, and collaborative storytelling of network data.
results_english: Empirical studies show TangibleNet significantly improves user engagement and understanding, facilitating efficient collaboration in dynamic network data tasks through its interactive augmented reality framework.
summary_japanese: TangibleNetは拡張現実を活用して、ネットワークデータの物理的な操作による対話的なストーリーテリングを実現し、理解とコラボレーションを向上させます。
problem_japanese: ネットワークデータの視覚化は、動的な環境でのデータ探索や協力的分析を制約することが多いため、インタラクティブ性や個人化が欠けています。
method_japanese: TangibleNetは拡張現実内で物理的なデータ要素の操作を可能にし、直感的な探索、個別の分析、協調的なネットワークデータのストーリーテリングを強化します。
results_japanese: 実験研究により、TangibleNetはユーザーの関与と理解を大幅に向上させ、対話的拡張現実フレームワークを通じた動的ネットワークデータ作業の効率的な共同作業を促進することが示されました。

title: "I'm not as afraid as a woman might be about sharing my exact location:" On the Intersection of Identity and Privacy Concerns in Fitness Tracking
authors: Jo, Yeeun and Jameel, Mahnoor and Cobb, Camille and Bates, Adam
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates how identity factors like gender influence privacy concerns related to fitness tracking technologies. It identifies disparities in privacy risk perception, notably regarding location data sharing.
problem_english: Fitness tracking technologies present privacy challenges, notably in sharing sensitive data like location. These challenges intersect with identity factors like gender, affecting individuals' privacy concerns and perceptions of risk.
method_english: The study employs qualitative methods, including interviews and surveys, to gather data on individuals' privacy perceptions regarding fitness tracking. It focuses on the influence of gender identity on these perceptions.
results_english: The findings show gender significantly impacts privacy concerns in fitness tracking. Women express higher anxiety regarding location data sharing compared to men, illustrating identity's role in privacy perceptions.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、フィットネストラッキング技術におけるプライバシー懸念が性別などのアイデンティティ要因によって影響を受けることを調査した。
problem_japanese: フィットネストラッキング技術は、位置情報の共有など敏感なデータに関するプライバシーの課題を抱えており、これが性別などのアイデンティティ要因と交差し、個々のプライバシー懸念やリスク認識に影響を与えている。
method_japanese: 研究は質的手法、インタビューや調査を通じてフィットネストラッキングに関するプライバシー認識のデータを収集し、これらの認識に対する性別の影響に焦点を当てている。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、フィットネストラッキングにおいてプライバシー懸念が性別によって大きく影響を受けることを示している。女性は男性よりも位置情報の共有に対する不安を強く示し、アイデンティティがプライバシー認識において重要な役割を果たすことを明らかにしている。

title: Exploring the use of Speculative Concept Films for Co-Speculation around Data Ethics
authors: Olson, Wyatt and Pierce, James
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the potential of speculative concept films as a medium for engaging diverse audiences in discussions around data ethics and technology futures.
problem_english: A challenge in fostering effective discussions on data ethics and technology's future involves engaging diverse audiences and facilitating imaginative speculations on potential implications. Current methods often lack creative engagement, leading to limited impact.
method_english: The researchers employed speculative concept films, fictional works designed to provoke thoughtful discussions, as a tool to enable participants to envision and critically engage with possible futures, thereby exploring ethical dimensions of data technologies.
results_english: Participants who engaged with speculative concept films demonstrated enhanced critical thinking about data ethics. They reported increased understanding of ethical implications and expressed diverse perspectives, indicating the films' effectiveness as catalysts for meaningful dialogue.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、データ倫理と技術の未来に関する議論を行うための媒体として、概念映像を使用する可能性を探求しています。
problem_japanese: データ倫理と技術の未来に関する効果的な議論を促進するには、多様な聴衆を惹きつけ、可能性を想像するための方法を必要とします。現行方法には創造的な関与が欠け、影響が限定的です。
method_japanese: 研究者は、参加者が未来を想像し、データ技術の倫理的側面を探求するために、概念映像という想像力を刺激する手段を用いました。
results_japanese: 概念映像に触れた参加者はデータ倫理に関する批判的思考を強化し、倫理的影響への理解が深まりました。また、多様な視点が示され、映像が対話促進に効果的であることが確認されました。

title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind? Exploring Data Protection Practices for Personal Data in Usable Security \& Privacy Studies
authors: Martius, Florin and Jansen, Luisa and Struck, Lukas and Arumugam, Arthi and Geierhaas, Lisa and Ortloff, Anna-Marie and Smith, Matthew and Tiefenau, Christian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates data protection practices in usable security and privacy studies, aiming to understand how personal data is managed and protected.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of ensuring proper data protection practices in usable security and privacy research. It highlights the gap between current data management behaviors and the best practices needed to safeguard participants' personal information.
method_english: The authors conducted a thorough review of existing literature on data protection in usable security and privacy studies, and performed interviews with researchers to gain insights into their practices.
results_english: The results reveal inconsistencies in data protection practices among researchers, pointing to a need for standardized guidelines. A set of recommendations is provided to improve data handling and protection in future studies.
summary_japanese: 利用可能なセキュリティとプライバシー研究におけるデータ保護の実践を探り、個人データの管理と保護の現状を理解する。
problem_japanese: 利用可能なセキュリティとプライバシー研究における適切なデータ保護実践の確立が課題であり、現在のデータ管理状況と理想的な保護対策との間のギャップが強調されている。
method_japanese: 著者らは、データ保護に関する既存の文献をレビューし、研究者へのインタビューを通じて実態を明らかにした。
results_japanese: 研究者間でのデータ保護実践に不一致が見られ、標準化されたガイドラインの必要性が示された。今後の研究に向けた改善策が提案されている。

title: Privacy Perceptions of Custom GPTs by Users and Creators
authors: Ma, Rongjun and Maidhof, Caterina and Carrillo, Juan Carlos and Lindqvist, Janne and Such, Jose
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores privacy perceptions of Custom GPTs by users and creators, analyzing their concerns and expectations. It identifies differing views between these groups regarding control over data and trustworthiness.
problem_english: There is a growing concern about privacy in Custom GPTs, as users and creators have different expectations and concerns regarding data control and trust. Understanding these differences is crucial for developing privacy-enhancing technologies and creating trust between stakeholders.
method_english: The researchers conducted surveys and interviews with both users and creators of Custom GPTs to gather insights into their privacy perceptions. They analyzed the collected data to identify patterns and differences in concerns and expectations related to data control and trustworthiness.
results_english: The study found significant variance in privacy perceptions between users and creators. Users were more concerned about data misuse, while creators prioritized transparency and data protection measures. The insights can aid in designing better-informed privacy strategies for Custom GPTs.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、Custom GPTsのユーザーとクリエーターのプライバシー認識を探り、データ制御と信頼性に関する異なる見解を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: Custom GPTsにおけるプライバシーへの懸念が高まっており、ユーザーとクリエーター間でデータ制御と信頼性に関する期待や懸念が異なります。これらの違いを理解することは、プライバシー技術の開発やステークホルダー間の信頼構築において重要です。
method_japanese: 研究者は、Custom GPTsのユーザーとクリエーターに対してアンケートとインタビューを実施し、プライバシー認識についての洞察を収集。データを分析し、懸念や期待のパターンを特定しました。
results_japanese: 研究では、ユーザーとクリエーターでプライバシー認識に大きな差異があることが判明しました。ユーザーはデータ誤用を懸念し、クリエーターは透明性とデータ保護を重視します。この知見は、Custom GPTsのプライバシー戦略の設計に役立ちます。

title: Raising Awareness of Location Information Vulnerabilities in Social Media Photos using LLMs
authors: Ma, Ying and Zhang, Shiquan and Yang, Dongju and Sarsenbayeva, Zhanna and Knibbe, Jarrod and Goncalves, Jorge
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the use of LLMs to enhance user awareness about location data vulnerabilities in social media posts, aiming to promote safer sharing practices.
problem_english: Social media users often unknowingly disclose sensitive location information in their photos. This can lead to privacy breaches and personal safety risks as such data might be exploited by malicious entities. There is a need to raise awareness among users about these vulnerabilities and how to mitigate them.
method_english: The study proposes utilizing large language models (LLMs) to analyze social media photos and provide users with insights about potential location data vulnerabilities. The approach includes detecting sensitive location information and suggesting safer sharing practices through real-time feedback.
results_english: The implementation of LLMs was effective in improving user awareness and understanding of location data vulnerabilities. Users reported increased confidence in identifying and mitigating potential privacy risks, leading to more cautious sharing behavior on social media.
summary_japanese: LLMを使用して、ソーシャルメディア写真の位置情報による脆弱性に対する利用者の意識向上を図り、安全な共有方法を促進します。
problem_japanese: 多くのソーシャルメディア利用者は、写真を通じて無意識に機密性の高い位置情報を公開してしまいます。この情報は攻撃者によって悪用され、プライバシー侵害や安全リスクを引き起こす可能性があります。これらの脆弱性についてのユーザーへの啓発が必要です。
method_japanese: LLMを用いて、ソーシャルメディアの写真から位置情報に関する脆弱性を検出し、リアルタイムフィードバックで安全な共有に向けた提案を行う手法を提唱。
results_japanese: LLMの実施は位置情報の脆弱性に対するユーザーの意識向上に有効であり、ユーザーはプライバシーリスクを特定・軽減する自信が高まり、共有行動が慎重になりました。

title: The Illusion of Privacy: Investigating User Misperceptions in Browser Tracking Protection
authors: Windl, Maximiliane and Amberg, Roman and Kosch, Thomas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores user misperceptions regarding browser tracking protection, identifying that users often overestimate the privacy afforded by these features.
problem_english: Despite browser tracking protections, users often misunderstand the level of protection these tools provide. This misperception leads to a false sense of security, potentially exposing users to privacy risks as they fail to adopt additional security measures.
method_english: The researchers conducted user studies to assess participants' understanding of browser tracking protections. They employed surveys and usability testing to analyze how users perceive and interact with these features in real-world scenarios.
results_english: The findings revealed significant discrepancies between users' perceived and actual privacy levels. Many users believed they were better protected than they were, highlighting the need for better communication and education about these features.
summary_japanese: 研究は、ブラウザ追跡保護に関するユーザーの誤解を調査し、これらの機能によるプライバシーを過大評価していることを示す。
problem_japanese: ブラウザ追跡保護があるにもかかわらず、ユーザーはこれらのツールが提供する保護レベルを誤解していることが多い。この誤解は誤った安心感を生むため、ユーザーが追加のセキュリティ対策を取らない可能性がある。
method_japanese: 研究者はユーザー調査を実施し、参加者のブラウザ追跡保護の理解を評価。アンケートと使いやすさテストを用いて、現実世界での機能認識と相互作用を分析。
results_japanese: 結果は、ユーザーの認識と実際のプライバシーレベルに大きな相違があることを示した。多くのユーザーは、実際よりも保護されていると誤解しており、機能の説明に改善の必要性がある。

title: Understanding Users' Perception of Personally Identifiable Information
authors: Song, Qiurong and Wu, Yanlai and Hernandez, Rie Helene (Lindy) and Li, Yao and Kou, Yubo and Gui, Xinning
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines users' perceptions of personally identifiable information (PII) to inform design strategies for systems that handle PII, exploring both technical and emotional aspects.
problem_english: The problem addresses the lack of understanding about users' perceptions of personally identifiable information (PII), which impacts the design and privacy policies of systems dealing with PII. Users often have varied and complex emotional responses to how their information is collected, stored, and shared.
method_english: The research employs qualitative methods, conducting interviews and surveys to gather insights on users' perceptions of PII. It analyzes emotional and cognitive reactions, using thematic coding to identify common views and concerns that influence user interaction with PII systems.
results_english: Findings reveal diverse user perceptions, emphasizing the need for transparent communication and control over PII management. Many users express concerns regarding privacy infringement, indicating a necessity for systems to offer more customizable privacy settings and clear information usage explanations.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、個人識別情報に対するユーザーの認識を調査し、関連するシステムの設計戦略を立案するための知見を提供します。
problem_japanese: 個人識別情報（PII）に対するユーザーの認識の不足が、PIIを扱うシステムの設計やプライバシーポリシーに影響を及ぼしています。ユーザーは情報収集・保存・共有の過程に対して多様で複雑な感情を抱いています。
method_japanese: 質的手法を用いてインタビューやアンケートを実施し、ユーザーのPII認識に関する洞察を収集しました。テーマごとのコーディングを通じて、ユーザーがPIIシステムとの連携に影響を与える一般的な意見や懸念を分析しました。
results_japanese: 調査結果は多様なユーザーの認識を示し、PII管理における透明性の必要性を強調しています。プライバシー侵害への懸念が示され、よりカスタマイズ可能なプライバシー設定と情報利用の明確な説明が必要であることが判明しました。

title: ChainBuddy: An AI-assisted Agent System for Generating LLM Pipelines
authors: Zhang, Jingyue and Arawjo, Ian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents ChainBuddy, an AI-assisted system designed for generating large language model (LLM) pipelines using a user-friendly interface.
problem_english: As LLM applications become more complex, creating efficient data processing pipelines is challenging for users with varying skill levels. Many struggle with technical hurdles, preventing the effective utilization of LLMs to achieve desired outcomes.
method_english: ChainBuddy addresses these challenges by providing a visual interface, allowing users to easily design and experiment with LLM pipelines. It includes AI-assisted functions that guide users through pipeline configuration, reducing the need for technical expertise.
results_english: The introduction of ChainBuddy led to significant improvements in user efficiency and satisfaction when constructing LLM pipelines. Users reported enhanced understanding and were able to build complex pipelines with less difficulty compared to existing methods.
summary_japanese: ChainBuddyは、LLMパイプラインを生成するためのAI支援システムで、ユーザーフレンドリーなインターフェースを提供します。
problem_japanese: LLMアプリケーションが複雑化する中で、技術的障壁が利用者にとって効率的なパイプラインの構築を困難にし、LLMの効果的な利用を阻害しています。
method_japanese: ChainBuddyは視覚的インターフェースを提供し、LLMパイプラインの設計を容易にします。AI支援機能により、ユーザーは技術的な専門知識がなくても適切なパイプラインを構成できます。
results_japanese: ChainBuddyの導入によりユーザーの効率と満足度が向上し、既存手法よりも複雑なパイプラインを容易に構築できるようになりました。

title: LLM Whisperer: An Inconspicuous Attack to Bias LLM Responses
authors: Lin, Weiran and Gerchanovsky, Anna and Akgul, Omer and Bauer, Lujo and Fredrikson, Matt and Wang, Zifan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents LLM Whisperer, a subtle technique to bias large language model (LLM) responses, exploiting attention mechanisms to adjust output inconspicuously.
problem_english: LLMs are susceptible to biases which can lead to outputs that are not aligned with intended uses. Existing attacks on LLMs are often detectable or require significant modifications that are impractical in real-world settings.
method_english: The authors introduce LLM Whisperer, employing a hidden layer manipulation strategy targeting attention mechanisms in LLMs. This method subtly biases the model’s output without altering word embeddings or visible components, thus remaining undetected.
results_english: LLM Whisperer successfully biases outputs in controlled experiments by subtly influencing attention mechanisms. It demonstrates that biases can be introduced without overtly altering the model’s visible components, evading detection.
summary_japanese: LLM Whispererは、注意メカニズムを活用してLLMの応答に隠れたバイアスを生じさせる手法を紹介する。
problem_japanese: LLMは意図された用途と一致しないバイアスの影響を受けやすい。既存の攻撃は検出可能かつ現実的でない大規模な変更を伴うことが多い。
method_japanese: 著者らは、注意メカニズムに着目して隠れ層を操作するLLM Whispererを導入。この手法は、言語モデルの出力を目に見える要素を変えずに微妙にバイアスする。
results_japanese: LLM Whispererは、注意メカニズムを介して出力に隠れたバイアスを加えることに成功し、可視的な変更を回避しつつバイアスを導入可能なことを示した。

title: No Evidence for LLMs Being Useful in Problem Reframing
authors: Shin, Joongi and Polyanskaya, Anna and Lucero, Andr\'{e}s and Oulasvirta, Antti
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates whether large language models (LLMs) assist in reframing problem statements for improved creativity or problem-solving. It finds no evidence supporting the effectiveness of LLMs in problem reframing.
problem_english: The study explores the potential of large language models (LLMs) in aiding the reframing of problem statements, which is considered crucial for enhancing creativity and problem-solving capabilities. Despite the anticipated benefits of leveraging LLMs, there is skepticism about their actual utility in successfully producing innovative reframes.
method_english: The authors evaluate the capabilities of LLMs in problem reframing through controlled experiments. Participants were tasked with generating problem reframes with and without LLM assistance. The outcomes of these interventions were assessed for creativity and effectiveness to determine LLMs' influence.
results_english: The findings indicate that LLMs do not significantly enhance the quality of problem reframes. When compared to human-generated reframes without LLM aid, the LLM-assisted reframes showed no marked improvement in creativity or problem-solving effectiveness.
summary_japanese: この研究は、問題再フレーミングにおけるLLMの有用性を調査し、効果の証拠がないことを示しています。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、創造性や問題解決能力を向上させるために、LLMが問題の再フレーミングにどの程度寄与するかを探求しましたが、その実効性に懐疑的な声があります。
method_japanese: 著者らは、LLMの問題新枠組み能力を制御実験で評価。参加者にLLM支援の有無で問題を再構築させ、その創造性と有効性を比較検証。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、LLMが問題再フレーミングの質を大幅に向上させないことを示す。LLM支援ありとなしの再構築の創造性や有効性に改善は見られない。

title: Ontologies in Design: How Imagining a Tree Reveals Possibilities and Assumptions in Large Language Models
authors: Haghighi, Nava and Yu, Sunny and Landay, James A. and Rosner, Daniela
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores ontological assumptions and possibilities for design through the conceptualization of 'trees' in Large Language Models (LLMs). It investigates how these models interpret complex concepts and their implications for design practice.
problem_english: Understanding how Large Language Models interpret and generate complex and multi-layered concepts like 'tree' reveals inherent assumptions that these models make, impacting their effectiveness and reliability in design applications and knowledge representation.
method_english: The authors employed a qualitative analysis method, using a series of prompts related to the concept of 'trees' to investigate the interpretative behaviors of LLMs, examining how design possibilities emerge from these interpretations and reveal inherent assumptions.
results_english: Results showed that LLMs often rely on simplified representations, reflecting specific ontological assumptions. This affects their ability to accurately capture complex design ideas, suggesting a need for improved model training and better integration of varied ontological perspectives.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、LLMにおける「樹木」の概念化を通じて設計における可能性と仮定を探る。
problem_japanese: LLMが複雑な「樹木」のような概念をどう解釈し生成するかを理解することで、設計と知識表現の効果や信頼性に影響するモデル固有の仮定を明らかにする。
method_japanese: 「樹木」に関連する一連のプロンプトを用いた質的分析で、LLMの解釈行動を調査し、設計可能性の生成と仮定を検証した。
results_japanese: LLMは簡略化された表現に依存しがちで、固有の仮定を反映する。このため、複雑な設計アイデアの正確な把握能力に影響があり、モデルの訓練や多様な視点の統合が必要となる。

title: Plurals: A System for Guiding LLMs via Simulated Social Ensembles
authors: Ashkinaze, Joshua and Fry, Emily and Edara, Narendra and Gilbert, Eric and Budak, Ceren
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Plurals proposes a novel approach for guiding LLMs using simulated social ensembles that improve robustness, diversity, and adaptability across applications. The system leverages group dynamics to offer enhanced decision-making capabilities for automated systems.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of incorporating diverse social perspectives into Large Language Models (LLMs) to improve their robustness and adaptability. Current methods often lack mechanisms for integrating varied human-like responses, limiting their effectiveness across different contexts.
method_english: Plurals employs simulated social ensembles, where multiple LLM instances mimic group interactions. The system fosters diverse perspectives and dynamic adaptability by simulating consensus-building and decision-making processes akin to human social behaviors.
results_english: The study demonstrates that Plurals significantly enhances LLM performance in diversity and robustness. Evaluations across multiple domains show improved decision-making capabilities, reflecting the value of integrating social dynamics into LLM architectures.
summary_japanese: Pluralsは、LLMsをガイドする新手法としてシミュレートされた社会的アンサンブルを提案し、頑健性や多様性を向上させ、適応性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 多様な社会的視点を大規模言語モデル（LLMs）に組み込み、頑健性と適応性を向上させる課題を扱っています。現在の手法は多様な人間的応答を統合する仕組みに欠け、異なる文脈での有効性が制限されています。
method_japanese: Pluralsは、グループ対話を模倣する複数のLLMインスタンスを用いてシミュレートされた社会的アンサンブルを採用。人間の社会的行動に似た合意形成をシミュレートし、多様な視点と適応性を促進します。
results_japanese: 研究は、PluralsがLLMの多様性と頑健性を大幅に向上させることを示しています。複数の領域での評価では、社会的動態を統合する価値が反映された意思決定能力が向上しました。

title: Rescriber: Smaller-LLM-Powered User-Led Data Minimization for LLM-Based Chatbots
authors: Zhou, Jijie and Xu, Eryue and Wu, Yaoyao and Li, Tianshi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Rescriber is a method using smaller LLMs for user-driven data minimization in chatbots. It ensures data privacy and reduces information overload while maintaining interaction quality.
problem_english: Increased usage of LLM-based chatbots raises concerns about data privacy and processing large amounts of user data. Current solutions often lack user control over data sharing and minimization, potentially compromising user privacy.
method_english: Rescriber utilizes smaller LLMs to process user data selectively under user guidance, allowing for minimizing data shared with chatbots. It balances the need for personalized, quality interaction with strong data privacy measures.
results_english: The implementation of Rescriber demonstrated effective data minimization without sacrificing chatbot interaction quality. It allowed users to control data sharing better, addressing privacy concerns while maintaining service efficiency.
summary_japanese: Rescriberは小型LLMを用いて、チャットボットでのデータ削減をユーザー主導で実現します。データプライバシーを確保しつつ、情報過多を抑えます。
problem_japanese: LLMベースのチャットボットの利用増加により、データプライバシーと大量のユーザーデータ処理に関する懸念が高まっています。現在の解決策は、データ共有と削減においてユーザーの制御が不足し、プライバシーを損なう可能性があります。
method_japanese: Rescriberは小型LLMを活用し、ユーザーの指示に従ってデータ処理を実施します。これにより個人化された品質の高い対話とデータプライバシーの強化を両立します。
results_japanese: Rescriberの実装により、会話の質を損なうことなく効果的にデータ削減が実現されました。ユーザーはデータ共有をよりよく制御でき、プライバシー問題に対応しつつサービス効率を維持しました。

title: VeriPlan: Integrating Formal Verification and LLMs into End-User Planning
authors: Lee, Christine P. and Porfirio, David and Wang, Xinyu Jessica and Zhao, Kevin Chenkai and Mutlu, Bilge
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: VeriPlan integrates formal verification and LLMs to enhance end-user planning by ensuring plan correctness while leveraging AI capabilities for improved user experience.
problem_english: End-user planning tools often lack robust mechanisms to guarantee the correctness of plans, leading to potential errors or inefficiencies. This challenge is compounded by the complexity of user intentions and the limitations in current AI-based assistance, which may not adequately address verification needs.
method_english: VeriPlan employs formal verification techniques alongside large language models (LLMs) to provide a dual approach in ensuring plan integrity. The system validates the logical soundness of plans while utilizing LLMs for seamless, AI-driven user interactions, bridging the gap between correctness and usability.
results_english: The integration of formal verification and LLMs in VeriPlan significantly improves both plan accuracy and user experience. Evaluation shows that users are more confident in their plans’ reliability and appreciate the AI-assisted features that simplify the planning process.
summary_japanese: VeriPlanは形式検証とLLMsを組み合わせ、計画の正確性を保証しつつAI機能を活用してユーザー体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: エンドユーザー向け計画ツールは、計画の正確性を保証する仕組みが不足し、誤りや非効率性を招く可能性があります。この問題は、ユーザーの意図の複雑さや現在のAI支援の限界によって悪化します。
method_japanese: VeriPlanは、形式検証技術と大規模言語モデル（LLMs）を利用し、計画の論理的健全性を確認しつつ、LLMsでユーザーフレンドリーな対話を提供します。
results_japanese: VeriPlanの導入により、計画の精度が向上し、ユーザー体験が向上。評価では、ユーザーが計画の信頼性に自信を持ち、AI支援機能が計画作成を容易にすることを評価しました。

title: BIASsist: Empowering News Readers via Bias Identification, Explanation, and Neutralization
authors: Noh, Yeo-Gyeong and Han, MinJu and Jeon, Junryeol and Hong, Jin-Hyuk
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study introduces BIASsist, a tool designed to help news readers detect, explain, and neutralize biases in news articles, enhancing informed decision-making.
problem_english: The problem addressed is the challenge faced by news readers in identifying and understanding biases inherent in news articles, which can affect decision-making and perpetuate misinformation.
method_english: BIASsist employs machine learning algorithms to detect bias in news articles. It provides explanations on the detected biases and strategies for neutralizing them, offering users a means to counteract bias in their news consumption.
results_english: Results indicate BIASsist effectively identifies biases, offers clear explanations and suggests methods for neutralization, enhancing reader's critical thinking and enabling informed decisions when engaging with news content.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ニュース記事の偏見を検出、説明、無効化するツールBIASsistを提案し、情報に基づいた意思決定を向上させる。
problem_japanese: ニュース読者がニュース記事に潜む偏見を特定し理解するのは難しく、意思決定に影響を与え誤情報を広めることがあります。
method_japanese: BIASsistは機械学習アルゴリズムを使用し、偏見を検出して説明し、無効化する戦略を提供し、ニュース消費の偏見を打ち消す手段を用户に提供します。
results_japanese: 結果として、BIASsistは偏見を効果的に特定し、明瞭な説明と無効化方法を提案し、ニュースコンテンツに対する批判的思考を高め、情報に基づいた判断を助ける。

title: Can AI Model the Complexities of Human Moral Decision-making? A Qualitative Study of Kidney Allocation Decisions
authors: Keswani, Vijay and Conitzer, Vincent and Sinnott-Armstrong, Walter and Nguyen, Breanna K. and Heidari, Hoda and Schaich Borg, Jana
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the potential of AI models to handle moral complexities of human decision-making, focusing on kidney allocation decisions. Researchers conducted a qualitative analysis involving ethicists and AI specialists.
problem_english: Allocating kidneys ethically involves complex moral decision-making, which poses a challenge for AI models aiming to automate such processes. Understanding whether AI can adequately model these complexities is critical for its applicability in ethical medical contexts.
method_english: The study employs qualitative methods, including interviews and discussions with experts in ethics and AI to assess how AI can emulate human moral reasoning in kidney allocation contexts. The aim is to identify gaps and potential enhancements in AI models.
results_english: Findings reveal AI models struggle with capturing nuanced moral reasoning required for ethical kidney allocation decisions. Experts emphasized the need for improvements in model interpretability and inclusion of diverse ethical perspectives.
summary_japanese: 臓器分配の倫理的側面をAIがどれほど再現可能かを調査。意思決定の複雑性評価を通じてその可能性を考察。
problem_japanese: 腎臓分配の際の倫理的意思決定は複雑であり、AIによる自動化は課題がある。AIモデルがこうした複雑性を適切に再現できるかの理解が不可欠である。
method_japanese: 倫理学者とAI専門家の協力を得てインタビューを行い、腎臓分配における人間の倫理的思考をAIが再現する方法を評価。AIモデルの改善点を明らかにする。
results_japanese: AIモデルは倫理的腎臓分配の意思決定に必要な繊細な道徳的推論を捉えるのに苦労。専門家はモデルの解釈性向上と多様な倫理観の取り入れが必要と強調。

title: Generative AI and News Consumption: Design Fictions and Critical Analysis
authors: Kiskola, Joel and Rydenfelt, Henrik and Olsson, Thomas and Haapanen, Lauri and V\"{a}nttinen, Noora and Nelimarkka, Matti and Vigren, Minna and Laaksonen, Salla-Maaria and Lehtiniemi, Tuukka
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the impact of generative AI on news consumption using design fictions and critical analysis. It investigates the potential consequences and ethical considerations of AI-generated news content.
problem_english: The rise of generative AI presents challenges in the realm of news consumption. Issues include the authenticity and credibility of AI-generated content, potential biases, and the ethical implications of relying on automated news sources.
method_english: The authors employ design fictions and critical analysis to study the implications of generative AI in news consumption. These methodologies enable speculative exploration and nuanced understanding of future scenarios and ethical concerns.
results_english: The findings reveal varied implications of generative AI on news consumption, emphasizing ethical challenges, potential biases, and shifts in media landscapes. The study encourages critical discourse and proactive strategies to address these issues.
summary_japanese: 本稿は生成AIがニュース消費に与える影響をデザインフィクションと批判的分析で探る。AI生成コンテンツの倫理的考慮を検討。
problem_japanese: 生成AIの台頭によりニュース消費の領域で課題が生じている。AI生成コンテンツの信頼性や公平性、倫理的な影響が問題となる。
method_japanese: 著者らはデザインフィクションと批判的分析を用いて、生成AIのニュース消費への影響を研究。これにより未来のシナリオと倫理的懸念を探求。
results_japanese: 生成AIがニュース消費に与える影響は多様で、倫理的課題やバイアス、メディアの変化を強調。これらの課題への対応策の必要性を提唱。

title: More Forecasts, More (Decision) Problems: How Uncertainty Representations for Multiple Forecasts Impact Decision Making
authors: Sarma, Abhraneel and Hedayati, Maryam and Kay, Matthew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates how different uncertainty representations in multiple forecasts affect decision making, highlighting complexities and potential impacts on choices.
problem_english: The study addresses the issue of how multiple forecasts with various representations of uncertainty complicate decision making. With multiple sources providing forecasts, individuals face challenges in interpreting and selecting the best decision from these varied representations, impacting decision quality and confidence.
method_english: The researchers designed experiments involving participants making decisions based on multiple forecasts presented with different uncertainty representations. They evaluated how these representations influenced decision-making processes, measuring parameters like the accuracy of decisions, confidence, and user preferences for certain types of uncertainty visualizations.
results_english: Results show that different representations of uncertainty in forecasts significantly affect users' decision-making processes. Participants expressed preferences for certain visualization types, which aligned with higher decision confidence and perceived accuracy. The study underscores the importance of effective uncertainty visualization to improve decision outcomes in multi-forecast environments.
summary_japanese: 異なる不確実性表現が複数の予測で意思決定にどのように影響するかを調査し、選択の複雑さと潜在的影響を示す。
problem_japanese: 複数の予測における多様な不確実性の表現が意思決定を複雑化する問題を扱う。複数の情報源から提供される予測により、個人はこれらの異なる表現を理解し最良の意思決定を選ぶのに課題に直面し、決定の質と自信に影響を与える。
method_japanese: 参加者が異なる不確実性表現で提示された複数の予測に基づき意思決定を行う実験を設計。これらの表現が意思決定過程に与える影響を評価し、意思決定の正確さ、自信、特定の不確実性視覚化への嗜好を測定した。
results_japanese: 予測内の不確実性の異なる表現が意思決定に大きく影響することが判明。参加者は特定の視覚化タイプを好み、高い決定の自信と正確性の認識が一致した。不確実性視覚化の効果が複数予測環境において決定結果改善に重要であることを示唆。

title: Persuasion in Pixels and Prose: The Effects of Emotional Language and Visuals in Agent Conversations on Decision-Making
authors: Gen\c{c}, H\"{u}seyin U\u{g}ur and Chandrasegaran, Senthil and Dingler, Tilman and Verma, Himanshu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates the impact of emotional language and visuals in agent conversations on users' decision-making, finding that both elements significantly affect decision outcomes.
problem_english: The study addresses how emotional language and visuals used in conversational agents influence users' decision-making, a critical aspect as these agents are increasingly present in various domains requiring enhanced user interaction and decision-making support. However, there's limited understanding of their combined effects on user decisions.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments with participants engaging with conversational agents featuring varying levels of emotional language and visual elements. They analyzed decision-making processes and outcomes using both quantitative and qualitative methods to assess the impact of these conversational components on user decisions.
results_english: Results indicated that both emotional language and visual cues in agent conversations significantly impact decision-making. Emotional language was found to strongly influence user emotions and choices, while visuals enhanced information retention and clarity, leading to more confident decision-making.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、エージェント会話の感情的言語と視覚要素が意思決定に及ぼす影響を調査し、それらが意思決定結果に有意に影響を与えることを発見した。
problem_japanese: 会話型エージェントに使用される感情的言語と視覚要素が、ユーザーの意思決定にどのように影響を与えるかを解明。こうしたエージェントは様々な分野で利用が増加しているが、これらの要素がユーザーの意思決定に与える影響の理解は限られている。
method_japanese: 著者らは、様々な感情的言語と視覚要素を含む会話型エージェントと参加者のやり取りを用いた実験を実施。定量・定性分析を通じて、会話要素がユーザーの意思決定に与える影響を評価した。
results_japanese: 結果として、エージェント会話における感情的言語と視覚的手がかりが意思決定に有意な影響を与えることが判明。感情的言語は強くユーザーの感情と選択に影響し、視覚要素は情報の保持と明確性を高め、自信ある意思決定に繋がった。

title: The News Says, the Bot Says: How Immigrants and Locals Differ in Chatbot-Facilitated News Reading
authors: Zhang, Yongle and Nguyen-Le, Phuong-Anh and Singh, Kriti and Gao, Ge
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines differences in news reading facilitated by chatbots between immigrants and locals, revealing distinct patterns in information interaction and comprehension.
problem_english: Understanding how immigrants and locals interact differently with chatbot-facilitated news reading. The study aims to uncover variations in comprehension, engagement, and information processing influenced by cultural and linguistic backgrounds.
method_english: The research employs qualitative analysis to compare chatbot-mediated news interactions, utilizing surveys and interviews to assess user experiences among immigrants and locals. Data is interpreted using thematic analysis to identify differences.
results_english: The findings show that immigrants exhibit varied engagement and information processing patterns due to linguistic and cultural differences, resulting in unique interaction styles. Locals show more straightforward comprehension and engagement patterns.
summary_japanese: 研究は、移民と現地の人々がチャットボットによるニュース読み取りで異なるパターンを示すことを明らかにしています。
problem_japanese: 移民と現地住民がチャットボットを用いたニュース閲覧でどのように異なるかを理解するための研究です。異文化や言語背景が理解や情報処理に与える影響を探ります。
method_japanese: 調査は質的分析を用いてチャットボットを介したニュースのやり取りを比較し、調査とインタビューを通じて移民と現地住民の経験を評価します。テーマ分析でデータの差異を識別します。
results_japanese: 結果は、移民が言語と文化差異により多様な情報処理パターンを示し、現地住民はより直接的な理解・関与パターンを示すことを発見しました。

title: Decision Theoretic Foundations for Experiments Evaluating Human Decisions
authors: Hullman, Jessica and Kale, Alex and Hartline, Jason
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper proposes a decision-theoretic framework to improve experiments evaluating human decision-making by considering subjects' goals and costs more accurately.
problem_english: Current experiments often fail to adequately account for participants' decision-making processes and incentives, which can lead to inaccurate conclusions about human behavior. This paper addresses the challenge of designing experiments that better understand participants' decision contexts and the underlying factors informing their choices.
method_english: The authors introduce a decision-theoretic approach that incorporates participants' objectives and constraints. This framework helps in developing experiments that are more aligned with the natural contexts in which individuals make decisions, providing a more accurate analysis of behavior.
results_english: The framework allows for more reliable predictions about human decision-making by closely replicating real-world scenarios and accounting for varying motivations and constraints, leading to more valid insights into human behavior.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、人的決定評価実験を改善するための意思決定理論的枠組みを提案しています。
problem_japanese: 従来の実験は参加者の意思決定プロセスやインセンティブを十分に考慮しておらず、人間行動についての不正確な結論に至ることがあります。本論文は参加者の意思決定文脈やその選択を形作る要因をよりよく理解できる実験設計を課題とします。
method_japanese: 著者は参加者の目標と制約を組み込んだ意思決定理論アプローチを導入します。この枠組みは、個人が意思決定を行う自然な文脈により適した実験の開発を支援し、行動のより正確な分析を提供します。
results_japanese: この枠組みにより、実際のシナリオを厳密に再現し、様々な動機や制約を考慮することで、人間の意思決定に関するより正確な予測と洞察が得られます。

title: AI, Help Me Think—but for Myself: Assisting People in Complex Decision-Making by Providing Different Kinds of Cognitive Support
authors: Reicherts, Leon and Zhang, Zelun Tony and von Oswald, Elisabeth and Liu, Yuanting and Rogers, Yvonne and Hassib, Mariam
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses AI systems designed to support complex decision-making by assisting cognitive processes, encouraging autonomy, and providing diverse perspectives to decision-makers.
problem_english: The problem addressed is the challenge people face in complex decision-making, where conventional AI systems often fail to enhance cognitive processes, leading to biased or non-optimal choices without fostering user autonomy or diverse consideration.
method_english: The authors propose an approach where AI systems provide cognitive support by offering different perspectives, utilizing visualization tools, and maintaining user autonomy, ensuring users can think independently while benefiting from AI assistance.
results_english: The study shows that AI systems designed to offer cognitive support without dictating solutions resulted in users feeling more in control, better decision outcomes, enhanced understanding, satisfaction, and reduced biases compared to traditional AI approaches.
summary_japanese: この論文は、人間の判断を支援するAIシステムについて論じ、認知プロセスを助けて自律性を促進し、意思決定者に多様な視点を提供する方法を示しています。
problem_japanese: 複雑な意思決定において、人々が直面する課題は、従来のAIシステムが認知プロセスを強化せずにバイアスや非最適な選択を導き、ユーザーの自律性や多様な考慮を促進しないことです。
method_japanese: 著者は、AIシステムが多様な視点を提供し、視覚ツールを利用し、ユーザーの自律性を保ちながら認知支援を行う手法を提案しています。
results_japanese: 研究は、解決策を押し付けない認知支援AIシステムが、ユーザーのコントロール感の向上、意思決定成果の改善、理解の深化、満足度の向上、バイアスの低減につながることを示しています。

title: From Scores to Careers: Understanding AI’s Role in Supporting Collaborative Family Decision-Making in Chinese College Applications
authors: Chen, Si and Xie, Jingyi and Wang, Ge and Wang, Haizhou and Cheng, Haocong and Huang, Yun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores AI's role in aiding Chinese families in college application decisions, focusing on how AI can bridge gaps in collaborative decision-making processes and improve outcomes.
problem_english: Chinese families often involve multiple members in the college application decision process, leading to complex dynamics and potential conflicts. The challenge lies in coordinating this collaborative decision-making effectively, considering various academic and personal preferences and managing expectation gaps.
method_english: The study uses mixed methods, combining interviews and case studies with Chinese families and college counselors. It integrates these insights with computational models assessing AI tools' impacts on collaborative decision structuring, information sharing, and conflict resolution within the college selection process.
results_english: The findings reveal that AI can significantly support Chinese families by providing personalized recommendations, enhancing communication, and reducing decision-making conflicts, thus improving satisfaction and alignment with applicants' academic and career goals.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、AIが中国の家族の大学志願選択を支援し、協働的意思決定プロセスを改善する役割を探る。
problem_japanese: 中国の家族では大学志願の意思決定が複雑で、家族間での協調が難しい。個人の学問的・個人的な希望を考慮し、期待の差を管理することが課題。
method_japanese: インタビューとケーススタディを用いて中国の家族とカレッジカウンセラーから洞察を得て、AIツールの影響を評価する計算モデルと統合。
results_japanese: AIは個別推薦を通じて家族のコミュニケーションを向上させ、意思決定の対立を減少させ、学業的かつキャリア目標に沿った満足度を向上させる。

title: How a Clinical Decision Support System Changed the Diagnosis Process: Insights from an Experimental Mixed-Method Study in a Full-Scale Anesthesiology Simulation
authors: Wolf, Sara and Grundgeiger, Tobias and Z\"{a}hringer, Raphael and Shishkova, Lora and Maas, Franzisca and Dilling, Christina and Happel, Oliver
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the impact of a Clinical Decision Support System (CDSS) on the diagnosis process in anesthesiology using a mixed-method approach in a simulated environment.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding how Clinical Decision Support Systems (CDSS) influence the diagnosis process in anesthesiology, particularly in terms of accuracy, decision-making efficiency, and user satisfaction in a simulated environment.
method_english: A mixed-method approach was used, combining quantitative data from simulations with qualitative interviews. Anesthesiologists participated in a full-scale simulation environment to assess the use and impact of a CDSS on their diagnosis process.
results_english: Results indicated that the CDSS improved diagnostic accuracy and efficiency. Participants reported enhanced decision-making confidence and satisfaction. The mixed-method analysis revealed insights into how the CDSS integrated into clinical workflows, highlighting potential areas for optimization.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、診断プロセスにおけるCDSSの影響をシミュレーション環境で探求しています。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、麻酔領域におけるCDSSが診断プロセスに与える影響を理解するという課題に取り組んでおり、特に精度、意思決定の効率、ユーザー満足度の面での影響をシミュレート環境で検証しています。
method_japanese: 混合研究法を用い、シミュレーションによる定量データと質的インタビューを組み合わせました。麻酔科医が実際のシミュレーション環境でCDSSの診断プロセスへの影響を評価しました。
results_japanese: CDSSは診断の正確性と効率を向上させ、参加者は意思決定の自信と満足度が向上したと報告しました。混合分析により、CDSSが臨床ワークフローに統合される方法と最適化の可能性が明らかになりました。

title: Hype versus Historical Continuity: Situating the Rise of AI in Climate and Disaster Risk Modeling
authors: Paudel, Shreyasha and Loos, Sabine and Soden, Robert
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in climate and disaster risk modeling, questioning whether it represents a hasty trend or a continuation of historical methods. It emphasizes critically evaluating AI's role while acknowledging long-standing practices.
problem_english: The rapid adoption of AI in climate and disaster risk modeling raises concerns about whether it truly enhances predictive capabilities or merely follows a tech hype, potentially overlooking established methodologies. This paper investigates the balance and integration between emerging AI tools and traditional modeling techniques.
method_english: The authors employ a literature review and case study analysis to explore the application and impact of AI in climate and disaster risk modeling. They contrast AI-driven approaches with traditional methods, assessing strengths, limitations, and opportunities for integration, and conduct expert interviews to gather insights from practitioners.
results_english: The study reveals that while AI offers innovative tools for enhanced modeling accuracy, its success depends on integrating with existing methods. Experts emphasize that thoughtful implementation and a nuanced understanding of AI's capabilities can lead to more robust and comprehensive risk assessments.
summary_japanese: AIの台頭が気候・災害リスクモデルにおいて急な流行なのか、歴史的手法の継続なのかを検証し、AIの役割を批判的に評価する。
problem_japanese: 気候及び災害リスクモデリングにおけるAIの急速な採用は、予測能力を本当に強化するのか、単なる技術トレンドに過ぎないのか、既存の方法論を無視していないかの懸念を引き起こす。この論文は、新興のAIツールと従来のモデリング手法の統合とバランスを探る。
method_japanese: 文献レビューと事例分析を通じて、気候・災害リスクモデルにおけるAIの応用と影響を探る。AIアプローチと伝統的方法を比較し、専門家インタビューも実施。
results_japanese: AIはモデリング精度向上の新ツールを提供するが、成功には既存手法との統合が不可欠であることを示す。慎重な実装とAI能力の理解が重要である。

title: The Amplifying Effect of Explainability in AI-assisted Decision-making in Groups
authors: de Brito Duarte, Regina and Abreu, M\'{o}nica Costa and Campos, Joana and Paiva, Ana
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the amplifying effect of explainability in AI-assisted group decision-making, highlighting improved trust and decision quality.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of integrating AI in group decision-making processes, particularly focusing on how explainability can influence trust and the quality of collective decisions.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments with groups using AI-assisted decision-making tools, incorporating explainable AI (XAI) features, to assess their influence on trust and decision outcomes.
results_english: Results showed that explainability in AI tools significantly enhances trust among group members and improves the overall quality of decisions made collaboratively.
summary_japanese: 本論文では、AIが支援するグループ意思決定における説明可能性の効果を探求し、信頼性と意思決定の質の向上を示した。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、AIをグループによる意思決定プロセスに統合する際の課題、特に説明可能性が信頼性や集団の意思決定の質に与える影響に焦点を当てる。
method_japanese: 著者らは、説明可能AI(XAI)機能を組み込んだAI支援意思決定ツールを用い、信頼と意思決定結果への影響を評価する実験を行った。
results_japanese: 結果として、AIツールの説明可能性がグループメンバー間の信頼を著しく高め、共同で行われる意思決定の質を向上させることが示された。

title: The Role of Initial Acceptance Attitudes Toward AI Decisions in Algorithmic Recourse
authors: Tominaga, Tomu and Yamashita, Naomi and Kurashima, Takeshi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This research examines how initial acceptance attitudes towards AI decisions impact the perception of algorithmic recourse, aiming to understand user interactions with AI and enhance transparency and fairness.
problem_english: As AI systems increasingly influence critical decision-making processes, there is a growing need to explore how individuals initially perceive AI-driven decisions. Understanding this is crucial to enhance algorithmic transparency and fairness. However, it remains unclear how initial acceptance attitudes towards AI decisions affect perceptions of algorithmic recourse, which can influence user satisfaction and trust.
method_english: The study carried out experiments with diverse user groups to explore how varying initial acceptance attitudes toward AI-driven decisions impacted perceptions of algorithmic recourse. Participants interacted with AI systems in controlled environments, and their feedback and attitudes were analyzed using quantitative and qualitative research methods to derive insights into their perceptions and interactions with AI.
results_english: Findings indicate that individuals with initially positive attitudes towards AI decisions tend to view algorithmic recourse more favorably, showing higher trust and satisfaction. Conversely, those with lower initial acceptance rates exhibit skepticism and lower satisfaction with AI recourse processes. These outcomes suggest tailoring AI explanation frameworks based on user acceptance levels to improve engagement and trust.
summary_japanese: AI決定に対する初期受容態度がアルゴリズム救済の認識に与える影響を探り、ユーザーとAIの相互作用を理解し透明性と公平性の向上を目指す。
problem_japanese: AIシステムが重要な意思決定に影響を与える中、AIに基づく決定をどのように受け入れるかを探求する必要がある。この理解はアルゴリズムの透明性と公平性向上に重要であるが、AIの初期受容態度が救済認識にどう影響するかは不明で、ユーザーの満足度と信頼度に影響を与える可能性がある。
method_japanese: 異なる初期受容態度を持つユーザ群でAIに基づく決定がアルゴリズム救済の認識にどのように影響するかを実験した。AIシステムと制御環境で相互作用し、定量的・定性的手法でフィードバックと態度を分析し、AIに対する認識と相互作用の洞察を得た。
results_japanese: 初期受容態度が高い個人はアルゴリズム救済を好意的に見ており、信頼度と満足度が高い。一方、初期受容態度が低い個人は懐疑的で満足度が低い。これらの結果は、ユーザーの受容レベルに基づいたAI説明フレームワークの適応がエンゲージメントと信頼構築に貢献することを示唆する。

title: Towards Human-AI Deliberation: Design and Evaluation of LLM-Empowered Deliberative AI for AI-Assisted Decision-Making
authors: Ma, Shuai and Chen, Qiaoyi and Wang, Xinru and Zheng, Chengbo and Peng, Zhenhui and Yin, Ming and Ma, Xiaojuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates a novel approach to enhance decision-making through the integration of large language models (LLMs) in Human-AI deliberation. By designing and evaluating AI systems, the study aims to improve collaborative decision processes.
problem_english: There is a growing need to enhance decision-making processes involving humans and AI systems. Current AI tools often lack the ability to support effective deliberation and collaboration, which is crucial for complex decision-making tasks. The challenge involves creating AI systems that not only assist but also engage in meaningful deliberative processes with humans.
method_english: The method involves designing an AI framework empowered by large language models to participate in decision-making processes. The framework facilitates mutual dialogue between humans and the AI, encouraging deliberative interaction and collective reasoning. The study evaluates the system's performance in real-world scenarios.
results_english: Findings indicate that the LLM-empowered deliberative AI system enhances the quality of decision-making. Participants experienced improved collaboration and satisfaction in the deliberative process. The study highlights the potential of these AI systems to elevate human-AI interaction effectiveness in complex decision-making environments.
summary_japanese: 本稿では、大規模言語モデルを用いた人間-AI討議による意思決定支援の新手法を研究し、AIシステムの設計と評価を通じて共同意思決定プロセスの向上を目指す。
problem_japanese: 人間とAIシステムが関与する意思決定プロセスの改善ニーズが高まっている。現状のAIツールは効果的な討議や協力を支援する能力が乏しく、複雑な意思決定業務での課題となっている。
method_japanese: 大規模言語モデルに基づいたAIフレームワークを設計し、意思決定プロセスに参加させる。これにより、人間とAIの対話を促進し、討議的インタラクションを図る。実世界での性能評価を行った。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、LLMを活用した討議AIシステムが意思決定の質を向上させることを示す。参加者は協力と満足感の向上を経験し、複雑な意思決定環境でのAIシステムの効果を示唆した。

title: ConTextural: A Toolpath-Based Texture Editing Tool for Extrusion 3D Printers
authors: Kaplan, Daphna and Ben Chen, Mirela and Sterman, Yoav
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ConTextural is a software tool designed for enhancing texture editing in extrusion 3D printing by facilitating toolpath manipulation, thereby enhancing the printed object’s surface finish and tactile quality.
problem_english: Current 3D printing technologies often lack the ability to easily modify and enhance textures on printed objects, which limits users’ ability to customize the tactile and aesthetic properties of their creations using typical extrusion printers.
method_english: The authors developed ConTextural, a tool that enables designers to directly manipulate toolpaths to edit textures. This approach allows users to visualize and modify surface textures pre-printing, offering an intuitive interface for customized tactile and aesthetic designs.
results_english: ConTextural was evaluated in user studies revealing significant improvement in users' ability to create and reproduce desired textures. Participants reported enhanced control over texture customization and noted the tool's ease of use and intuitive interaction.
summary_japanese: ConTexturalは押出式3Dプリンターのツールパスを操作し、物体の表面と触感を強化するテクスチャ編集ソフトです。
problem_japanese: 現在の3Dプリンティング技術では、押出式プリンターでの印刷物のテクスチャを簡単に編集・強化する機能が不足しており、ユーザーが触感や美的特性をカスタマイズしにくいという課題があります。
method_japanese: 著者らはConTexturalを開発し、デザイナーがツールパスを直接操作してテクスチャを編集できるようにした。この手法により、印刷前に表面のテクスチャを視覚化し、変更することができる。
results_japanese: ユーザースタディの結果、ConTexturalは目的のテクスチャを作成・再現する能力が大幅に改善され、ユーザーはテクスチャカスタマイズの制御が向上し、直感的な使いやすさを報告しました。

title: How Can We Change the System? Understanding and Addressing Redesign Inertia in Digital Public Services
authors: Carreras, Barbara N. and Borsotti, Valeria
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores redesign inertia in digital public services, examining factors that impede system change. It presents strategies to overcome these barriers by focusing on stakeholders' perspectives and technological adaptability.
problem_english: Redesign inertia in digital public services is a significant barrier to innovation and efficiency. The issue arises from organizational, technological, and psychological factors that prevent necessary changes, thereby affecting service delivery and public satisfaction.
method_english: The authors use a mixed-method approach, including case studies and interviews with stakeholders in digital public services. They analyze the barriers to redesign and assess strategies employed to initiate change. The focus is on understanding the underlying causes of inertia and exploring solutions.
results_english: Findings reveal multiple layers of inertia, including resistance to organizational change, outdated technology, and stakeholder reluctance. Effective strategies involve inclusive design processes, stakeholder engagement, and adaptive technologies. These strategies can reduce redesign inertia, improving service efficiency and user satisfaction.
summary_japanese: デジタル公共サービスの再設計停滞を探り、障害となる要因を分析し、対策を提案しています。
problem_japanese: デジタル公共サービスにおける再設計の停滞は、革新と効率性を妨げる重大な障害です。組織的、技術的、心理的要因が変革を阻み、サービス提供と市民満足度に影響を及ぼします。
method_japanese: 著者はケーススタディとデジタル公共サービスの関係者へのインタビューを用いた混合手法で、再設計への障害を分析し、変革を開始するための戦略を評価します。
results_japanese: 研究は組織変革への抵抗、旧式技術、関係者の消極性を含む多層的な停滞を示し、包括的デザインと新技術導入が効果的な戦略であると結論付けます。

title: How to Design with Ambiguity: Insights from Self-tracking Wearables
authors: Di Lodovico, Chiara and Houben, Steven and Colombo, Sara
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores design principles for self-tracking wearables that embrace ambiguity, offering insights into user engagement and data interpretation. It showcases how ambiguity can enhance user experience by allowing personalization and flexibility in tracking goals.
problem_english: With the increasing ubiquity of self-tracking wearables, users often face challenges in interpreting data due to its ambiguity. This study addresses how to design wearable technologies that intentionally incorporate ambiguity to enhance user interaction, offering flexibility and personalization in goal-setting, while mitigating any resulting user confusion.
method_english: The authors conducted a series of workshops and interviews with both users and designers of self-tracking wearables. They analyzed how ambiguity affects user perception and engagement. Prototypes were developed that integrate ambiguous elements, allowing participants to explore their benefits and drawbacks in real-world scenarios.
results_english: Findings revealed that carefully integrated ambiguity in wearable designs can enhance user engagement and satisfaction. Users appreciated the flexibility to interpret data in personally meaningful ways. However, designers must balance ambiguity to prevent overwhelming users with too much uncertainty, while ensuring clarity in essential features for goal achievement.
summary_japanese: 本研究は曖昧性を取り入れた自己追跡ウェアラブルの設計原則を探り、ユーザーのエンゲージメントとデータ解釈についての洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 自己追跡ウェアラブルの普及に伴い、ユーザーはデータの曖昧性による解釈の課題に直面します。本研究は、個別化と柔軟性を提供しつつ、ユーザーの混乱を軽減するために曖昧性を意図的に取り入れた設計方法を検討します。
method_japanese: ワークショップとインタビューを通じてユーザーとデザイナーの意見を収集し、曖昧性がユーザーの知覚と関与に与える影響を分析しました。曖昧な要素を取り入れたプロトタイプを開発し、実際のシナリオでその利点と欠点を探索しました。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、適切に統合された曖昧性がユーザーのエンゲージメントと満足度を向上させることを示しました。ただし、デザイナーは曖昧性を慎重に調整し、ユーザーが不必要な不確実さに圧倒されず、目標達成に必要な明確さを保つ必要があります。

title: SummAct: Uncovering User Intentions Through Interactive Behaviour Summarisation
authors: Zhang, Guanhua and Ahmed, Mohamed Adel Naguib and Hu, Zhiming and Bulling, Andreas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SummAct leverages interactive behavior summarization to uncover user intentions in digital environments, showcasing its effectiveness in enhancing user experience and interface design.
problem_english: Understanding users' intentions in digital environments is crucial for enhancing user interaction and experience but remains challenging due to the complexity of behaviors and contexts involved.
method_english: The authors propose an approach called SummAct, utilizing interactive behavior summarization techniques to distill and analyze user actions and intentions, facilitating improved interpretation of user interactions.
results_english: SummAct demonstrated the ability to effectively identify user intentions, providing valuable insights that can significantly inform and improve user interface design and overall user experience.
summary_japanese: SummActはインタラクティブ行動の要約により、デジタル環境でのユーザー意図を明らかにし、ユーザーエクスペリエンスとインターフェースデザインを向上。
problem_japanese: デジタル環境でのユーザーの意図を理解することは、ユーザーインタラクションと体験を向上させるために重要ですが、行動やコンテクストの複雑さから困難です。
method_japanese: 著者はSummActというアプローチを提案し、インタラクティブ行動の要約技術を用いてユーザーの行動と意図を分析し、インタラクションの解釈を深化させます。
results_japanese: SummActはユーザーの意図を効果的に特定し、ユーザーインターフェースデザインと体験を大幅に向上させるための貴重な洞察を提供しました。

title: All in One: Rapid Game Prototyping in a Single View
authors: Krebs, Eva and Beckmann, Tom and Geier, Leonard and Grenda, Jonathan and Ramson, Stefan and Hirschfeld, Robert
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a new interface for rapid game prototyping that integrates all necessary tools into a single view, enhancing efficiency and user experience.
problem_english: Designing and prototyping games often involves switching between multiple tools and interfaces, which can be time-consuming and disrupt the workflow of developers, leading to inefficiencies and increased complexity in the game development process.
method_english: The authors propose an integrated interface that combines essential tools for game prototyping into one unified view. This approach intends to streamline the prototyping process by minimizing context switching, thereby enhancing the productivity and focus of developers.
results_english: The implementation of the unified interface demonstrated improved efficiency and user satisfaction among developers. Evaluations showed a reduction in time required for prototyping tasks and an increase in the quality of the resulting game prototypes.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、効率とユーザー体験を向上させる単一ビューでのゲームプロトタイピングの新インターフェースを紹介します。
problem_japanese: ゲームデザインとプロトタイピングは、多くの場合、複数のツールやインターフェース間を切り替える必要があり、開発者の作業フローを中断させ、効率を下げ、開発プロセスを複雑化する可能性があります。
method_japanese: 著者は、ゲームプロトタイピングに必要なツールを統合し、単一ビューで提供するインターフェースを提案します。このアプローチは、状況の切り替えを最小限に抑え、生産性と集中力を向上させます。
results_japanese: 統一インターフェースの実装により、開発者の効率と満足度が向上。プロトタイピング作業にかかる時間が短縮され、作成されたゲームプロトタイプの品質も向上しました。

title: Creativity Supportive Ecosystems: A Framework for Understanding Function and Disruption in Online Art Worlds
authors: Almeda, Shm Garanganao and Kim, Joy O and Hartmann, Bjoern
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a framework for understanding the function and disruption of online art worlds as creativity supportive ecosystems, focusing on how digital tools and platforms influence artistic community dynamics.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is understanding how online platforms can both support and hinder artistic creativity and community by examining factors such as platform functionalities, user interactions, and the balance between structured and organic growth in digital art ecosystems.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative research methods, including case studies of various online art platforms, interviews with artists and community members, and analysis of platform features to model the interplay between technical functionalities and collective artistic creativity.
results_english: Findings reveal that certain functionalities and governance structures within platforms significantly impact artistic creativity and community dynamics, highlighting the importance of balancing technical design with user-driven artistic growth to sustain creativity supportive ecosystems.
summary_japanese: オンラインアート世界の機能と混乱を理解するための枠組みを提示し、デジタルツールとプラットフォームが芸術コミュニティの動態に与える影響に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: オンラインプラットフォームが芸術的創造性やコミュニティを支援または阻害する要因を、プラットフォーム機能、ユーザー間の相互作用、デジタルアートエコシステムにおける構造的成長と有機的成長のバランスを検討することで理解する課題。
method_japanese: 著者は、様々なオンラインアートプラットフォームのケーススタディ、アーティストやコミュニティメンバーへのインタビュー、プラットフォーム機能の分析を行い、技術的機能と集合的芸術創造性の相互作用をモデル化する定性研究手法を採用。
results_japanese: プラットフォームの特定の機能とガバナンス構造が芸術的創造性とコミュニティ動態に大きく影響を与えることを示し、技術設計とユーザー主導の芸術的成長のバランスを取ることが創造性支援エコシステムの維持に重要であることを示した。

title: Design for Civic Quality of Life Things
authors: Dove, Graham and Corbett, Eric
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the design of interconnected objects to improve civic quality of life, integrating community needs and user-centered design. It addresses challenges in creating inclusive technology solutions.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of designing interconnected technologies that genuinely enhance civic quality of life. It focuses on complexities such as ensuring inclusivity, adaptability to diverse community needs, and meaningful engagement. The goal is to overcome barriers in creating technology that is not only functional and efficient but also equitable and empowering for all user groups.
method_english: The authors employ a multidisciplinary design framework combining human-centered design principles with technical exploration. Workshops and participatory design sessions with community members were utilized, along with iterative prototyping. The framework encourages active user involvement in the design process, aiming to ensure the technology's relevance and accessibility. The approach emphasizes adaptability to diverse needs and contexts, engaging stakeholders at every design stage.
results_english: Results indicate that incorporating community feedback through iterative design and prototyping resulted in more inclusive and effective civic technologies. The participatory approach fostered a sense of ownership among community members. The final designs showed increased usability, adaptability, and alignment with user needs. Additionally, stakeholder engagement led to innovative insights, demonstrating the value of collaborative frameworks in developing civic technology.
summary_japanese: 市民生活向上を目指したデザイン研究で、コミュニティのニーズを取り入れたインクルーシブな技術ソリューションを探求。
problem_japanese: 市民生活を向上させる技術のデザインは、包摂性、多様なコミュニティニーズへの適応、意義ある関与の確保が課題。機能性と公平性を両立させる技術開発が求められる。
method_japanese: 人間中心設計と技術探索を統合した学際的なフレームワークを用い、ワークショップや参加型デザインでコミュニティと共創。適応性と関連性を重視し、試作を重ねながら設計。
results_japanese: コミュニティのフィードバックを反映した設計で包摂的かつ効果的な技術を実現。参加型アプローチにより所有感を高め、ユーザーニーズに合った高い適応性と使いやすさを実現した。

title: Designing Virtual Funerals as a Design Fiction: A Film-Based Exploration of Near-Future Memorial Rituals
authors: Uriu, Daisuke and Arima, Shun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores designing virtual funerals as design fiction, focusing on future memorial rituals through a film-based approach, gauging human-computer interaction implications.
problem_english: The study addresses the lack of exploration into how emerging technologies can transform memorial rituals and the implications of virtual funerals on human-computer interaction, offering limited insights into their potential integration into future social practices.
method_english: The authors employ a design fiction methodology using film-based exploration to envision and analyze possible near-future scenarios of virtual funerals, assisting in understanding societal impacts and human-computer interaction dynamics in such contexts.
results_english: The research revealed diverse human experiences and interactions in virtual funeral settings, highlighting potential challenges and benefits. It emphasizes the necessity of considering emotional, social, and cultural dimensions in designing future memorial technologies.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、未来の追悼儀式を映画ベースのアプローチで探求し、仮想葬儀の人間とコンピュータの相互作用の影響を調査する。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、新しい技術が記念儀式をどのように変革し得るか、仮想葬儀が人間・コンピュータ間の相互作用に与える影響についての探求が不足している点に着目する。
method_japanese: 著者は、デザインフィクションの手法を用いて、仮想葬儀の近未来シナリオを映画ベースで探求し、社会的影響と人間・コンピュータ相互作用の理解を促進する。
results_japanese: 研究は、仮想葬儀における多様な人間の経験と相互作用を明らかにし、感情的、社会的、文化的次元を考慮した未来の追悼技術の設計の必要性を強調した。

title: GeneyMAP: Exploring the Potential of GenAI to Facilitate Mapping User Journeys for UX Design
authors: Mei, Yihan and Wu, Zhao and Yu, Junnan and Li, Wenan and Zhou, Zhibin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: GeneyMAP explores GenAI's potential to enhance UX design by mapping user journeys. It aims to streamline processes and provide insights, improving user experiences.
problem_english: The challenge lies in the complexity and time-consuming nature of mapping user journeys in UX design. Manual processes can lead to inefficiencies and missed insights, hindering the enhancement of user experience.
method_english: GeneyMAP employs Generative AI to automate and enhance the mapping of user journeys in UX design. This involves leveraging AI algorithms to streamline data analysis and visualization, providing UX designers with actionable insights.
results_english: The study demonstrates that GeneyMAP significantly reduces the time required for mapping user journeys and improves the quality of insights, thus enhancing the design process and user experience outcomes.
summary_japanese: GeneyMAPは、GenAIを利用してUXデザインにおけるユーザージャーニーのマッピングを効率化・向上します。
problem_japanese: UXデザインにおけるユーザージャーニーのマッピングは複雑で時間がかかるため、効率が悪く洞察を逃す可能性があり、ユーザーエクスペリエンスの向上が妨げられます。
method_japanese: GeneyMAPは生成AIを活用し、UXデザインにおけるユーザージャーニーのマッピングを自動化・高度化します。AIアルゴリズムを用いてデータ分析と可視化を効率化し、実用的な洞察を提供します。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、GeneyMAPがユーザージャーニーのマッピングに要する時間を大幅に短縮し、洞察の質を向上させ、デザインプロセスとユーザー体験の結果を向上させることを示しました。

title: Understanding Older Adults' (Dis)Engagement with Design Materials
authors: Pradhan, Alisha and Jelen, Ben and Thangaraj, Ramprabu and Siek, Katie A. and Jette, Shannon and Lazar, Amanda
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how older adults engage and disengage with design materials, aiming to improve the design processes in technology tailored for them.
problem_english: Older adults often face difficulties engaging with design materials, impacting the effectiveness of technology designed for them. Understanding their (dis)engagement can reveal barriers and facilitators in technology adoption.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative studies involving interviews and workshops with older adults to explore their interactions with various design materials. This aids in identifying patterns and factors influencing engagement.
results_english: The study found diverse reasons for (dis)engagement, including personal preferences, perceived relevance, and accessibility concerns, providing insight into enhancing design materials for older adults.
summary_japanese: この論文は、高齢者がデザイン材料とどのように関わり合うかを探求し、彼ら向けの技術設計プロセスの改善を称賛します。
problem_japanese: 高齢者がデザイン材料との関わりに難しさを感じることは、彼ら向けに設計された技術の有効性に影響を与えています。その関与と不関与を理解することは、技術採用における障壁や促進要因を明らかにします。
method_japanese: 著者は、高齢者とのインタビューとワークショップを含む質的研究を行い、様々なデザイン材料との関わりを調査した。これにより、関与に影響を与えるパターンと要因を特定する。
results_japanese: 本研究では、個人的嗜好、重要性の認識、アクセシビリティの懸念を含む多様な関与理由を発見し、高齢者向けデザイン材料の改善について洞察を提供します。

title: "I Need Your Help!" : Facilitating Psychological Communication Between Left-Behind Children and Their Parents with an AI-Powered Sandbox
