authors: Shi, Yan and Gong, Lidan and Lu, Yiwen and Liu, Lijuan and Zhang, Chao and Zhang, Shujun and Wang, Longfei and Zhou, Shan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents an AI-powered sandbox tool designed to improve psychological communication between left-behind children and their distant parents.
problem_english: Left-behind children often face psychological challenges due to the lack of proper communication and emotional bonding with their parents. This gap can lead to emotional distress and developmental issues, necessitating effective communication systems that address these psychological and emotional needs.
method_english: The researchers developed an AI-powered sandbox system that facilitates interactive and emotional communication between children and their parents. This tool uses AI algorithms to encourage expressive play and emotional sharing, creating a virtual environment that supports psychological bonding and communication.
results_english: The AI sandbox demonstrated considerable effectiveness in enhancing emotional communication between left-behind children and their parents. It provided a means for sharing emotions and building stronger psychological connections, as shown by improved emotional responses and communication depth in the participants.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、AIを活用したサンドボックスツールを提案し、留守児童と両親間の心理的コミュニケーションを改善。
problem_japanese: 留守児童は親との適切なコミュニケーション不足で心理的課題を抱えやすく、感情的な困難や発達の問題につながるため、心理と感情のニーズに応じた効果的なコミュニケーションシステムが必要。
method_japanese: 研究者はAI搭載のサンドボックスシステムを開発し、子供と親の間での対話型かつ感情的なコミュニケーションを促進。AIアルゴリズムを用いて表現的な遊びと感情の共有を推進。
results_japanese: AIサンドボックスは、留守児童と親の感情コミュニケーションの向上に有効。感情共有と心理的絆を強化する手段を提供し、参加者の感情応答とコミュニケーション深度が改善された。

title: 3D Printing for Accessible Education: A Case Study in Assistive Technology Adoption
authors: Holloway, Leona and Butler, Matthew and Waddell, Alex and Marriott, Kim
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the role of 3D printing in making education more accessible through assistive technology. A case study highlights the adoption process and its benefits. Key insights include increased engagement and potential for personalization.
problem_english: The challenge addressed in this study is the lack of accessible educational materials for students with disabilities, which can hinder their learning experience. Traditional resources often do not cater to individual needs, making it difficult for educators to provide inclusive education.
method_english: The authors conducted a case study analyzing the adoption of 3D printing technologies to create tailored educational tools for students with disabilities. They explored implementation processes, stakeholder involvement, and assessed its effectiveness in enhancing educational accessibility.
results_english: The results demonstrated significant improvements in student engagement and learning outcomes when 3D printed materials were incorporated. These tools provided personalized educational experiences, showing that assistive technology effectively supports inclusive education environments.
summary_japanese: 3D印刷を活用した教育のアクセス向上を探る。具体的な採用事例を通じて利点を示す。関与や個別化の可能性が明らかに。
problem_japanese: この研究が取り組む課題は、障害を持つ学生向けの教育資料の不足であり、これは彼らの学習体験を阻害する可能性がある。従来の教材は個々のニーズに応えず、包括的教育の提供が困難である。
method_japanese: 障害を持つ学生向けに3D印刷技術を採用し、個別化された教育ツールを作成する事例研究を実施。実施プロセスや関係者の関与、教育アクセスの向上を評価。
results_japanese: 3D印刷教材導入により学生の関与と学習成果が大幅に改善。個別化教育体験を提供し、支援技術が包括的教育環境を効果的にサポートすることを示した。

title: Autoethnographic Insights from Neurodivergent GAI “Power Users”
authors: Glazko, Kate and Cha, JunHyeok and Lewis, Aaleyah and Kosa, Ben and Wimer, Brianna L and Zheng, Andrew and Zheng, Yiwei and Mankoff, Jennifer
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores autoethnographic insights from neurodivergent power users of Generative AI (GAI), examining their unique experiences and strategies coping with GAI systems.
problem_english: The research seeks to understand how neurodivergent individuals uniquely interact with and utilize Generative AI systems. It addresses the gap in understanding the challenges and benefits such users experience, which are often underrepresented in AI usability studies.
method_english: The study utilized autoethnography, a qualitative research method, with neurodivergent GAI power users documenting their interactions and experiences with GAI systems. This approach allowed for a detailed understanding of personal narratives and strategies.
results_english: Results revealed specific strategies neurodivergent individuals employ while interacting with GAI, highlighting both positive adaptations and challenges faced. These insights can inform the design of more inclusive AI systems that cater to diverse user needs.
summary_japanese: この論文は、神経多様性を持つGAIのパワーユーザーの自伝的洞察を探求し、彼らの経験を分析します。
problem_japanese: 神経多様性を持つ個人がどのようにGAIを利用し、その利点や課題を経験するかを理解することが求められています。これらのユーザー体験はAIの利用性研究で十分に取り上げられていません。
method_japanese: 神経多様性を持つGAIのパワーユーザーが自己エスノグラフィを使い、GAIとのやり取りや体験を文書化しました。個人の物語や戦略を深く理解するための手法です。
results_japanese: 神経多様性を持つ個人がGAIと接するときの特定の戦略が明らかになり、課題と適応の両方が確認されました。この洞察は、より包括的なAI設計に寄与します。

title: Beyond the Buckets of Support: Designing for Agency and Interaction in Personalised Disability Systems
authors: Bircanin, Filip and Sitbon, Laurianne and Hoogstrate, Maria and Abbas, Ahmed K. and Hajizadeh Saffar, Alieh and Brereton, Margot
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the design of personalized disability systems that enhance user agency and promote user interaction, moving beyond traditional categorized support methods.
problem_english: Existing disability support systems often rely on fixed categories or 'buckets' of services, limiting personalization and the ability to adapt to individual needs and preferences. This restricts user agency and diminishes interaction possibilities between users and technology.
method_english: The authors propose a novel design framework that emphasizes agency and interaction through user-centered design principles. They utilize iterative design processes, incorporating feedback from end-users, to create systems that adapt to individual needs while encouraging active participation and personalization.
results_english: The proposed framework successfully increased user agency and interaction capabilities, allowing users to have more control over their personalized support systems. This approach demonstrated substantial improvements in user satisfaction and adaptability, advancing beyond conventional disability support structures.
summary_japanese: 個人のエージェンシーを高め、対話を促進するパーソナライズされた障害者支援システムの設計を探求した。
problem_japanese: 従来の障害者支援システムは固定化された支援カテゴリーに依存し、個別のニーズに対応しづらくユーザーのエージェンシーやテクノロジーとの相互作用を制限している。
method_japanese: ユーザー中心設計原則を用いてエージェンシーと対話を強調する新しい設計フレームワークを提案。ユーザーのフィードバックを取り入れた反復的デザインプロセスを採用。
results_japanese: 提案されたフレームワークにより、ユーザーのエージェンシーと対話能力が向上し、個別の支援システムの制御が可能になり、ユーザー満足度と適応性が大幅に向上した。

title: Human Robot Interaction for Blind and Low Vision People: A Systematic Literature Review
authors: Wei, Yize and Rocher, Nathan and Gupta, Chitralekha and Nguyen, Mia Huong and Zimmermann, Roger and Ooi, Wei Tsang and Jouffrais, Christophe and Nanayakkara, Suranga
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper systematically reviews literature on human-robot interaction (HRI) for blind and low vision people, identifying functionality, design principles, and challenges, offering insights for future development.
problem_english: Development and deployment of robotic assistive technologies for blind and low vision individuals face challenges such as inclusivity, accessibility, and effectiveness. Current literature lacks comprehensive insights into how these systems can be optimized for user needs, behavior, and technology adaptations to enhance daily living activities and independence.
method_english: The authors conducted a systematic literature review on HRI for individuals with visual impairments, analyzing existing research works to evaluate functionalities, design principles, and challenges. They also considered user feedback, technological feasibility, and future trends to derive recommendations that can guide researchers and developers in this field.
results_english: The review provides an organized assessment of functionalities, highlighting key areas such as navigation aid, communication assistance, and daily task support. It also outlines design principles focusing on user-centered design and challenges like adaptability and user acceptance, proposing recommendations for future research and development.
summary_japanese: 本稿は視覚障害者向けのHRIに関する文献を系統的にレビューし、機能性や設計原則、課題を明らかにし将来開発の洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者向けロボット支援技術の開発には、包摂性、アクセシビリティ、有効性の課題があり、現状の研究ではユーザーのニーズや行動、技術の適応についての包括的な知見が不足している。
method_japanese: 視覚障害者向けHRIに関する既存研究を分析し、機能性、設計原則、課題を評価しました。ユーザーフィードバックや技術的実現可能性、トレンドも考慮し、今後の指針を提案します。
results_japanese: ナビゲーション支援、コミュニケーション補助、日常業務支援などの機能を評価し、ユーザー中心設計の原則や適応性、ユーザー受容性といった課題を明示、今後の研究開発の提案を行いました。

title: Sounds Accessible: Envisioning Accessible Audio-Media Futures with People with Aphasia
authors: Bircanin, Filip and Nevsky, Alexandre and Perera, Himaya and Agarwal, Vaasvi and Song, Eunyeol and Cruice, Madeline and Neate, Timothy
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the future of accessible audio-media for people with aphasia, emphasizing the importance of inclusive design through participatory methods.
problem_english: People with aphasia face barriers in accessing audio-media due to design shortcomings that do not account for the unique needs of this population, necessitating research into more inclusive design approaches.
method_english: The authors engaged people with aphasia through participatory workshops, gathering insights and preferences to guide the design and development of more accessible audio-media systems.
results_english: The study identified key features desired by people with aphasia, such as simplified navigation and adjustable audio properties, offering a foundation for developing future accessible audio-media.
summary_japanese: 本研究は失語症者に向けた音声メディアのアクセシブルデザインを探求し、参加型手法による包括的デザインの重要性を強調する。
problem_japanese: 失語症の人々は音声メディアへのアクセスにおいて、特有のニーズを考慮していないデザインの欠陥により障壁に直面している。このため、より包括的なデザインアプローチの研究が必要である。
method_japanese: 著者は、失語症者を参加型ワークショップに招き、よりアクセシブルな音声メディアシステムの設計と開発を導くための洞察と嗜好を収集した。
results_japanese: 研究により失語症者が求める簡易ナビゲーションや音声プロパティの調整可能性などの主要機能が特定され、将来のアクセシブル音声メディア開発の基盤を提供する。

title: Towards AI-driven Sign Language Generation with Non-manual Markers
authors: Zhang, Han and Shalev-Arkushin, Rotem and Baltatzis, Vasileios and Gillis, Connor and Laput, Gierad and Kushalnagar, Raja and Quandt, Lorna C and Findlater, Leah and Bedri, Abdelkareem and Lea, Colin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents an AI-driven method for generating sign language with non-manual markers, a crucial aspect for accurate communication.
problem_english: Sign language generation has traditionally focused on manual signs, often neglecting non-manual markers such as facial expressions and body movements, which are essential for conveying meaning and emotion in sign language.
method_english: The authors propose an AI-driven approach that integrates non-manual markers into sign language generation. This involves leveraging machine learning techniques to handle the complexities and nuances of non-manual expressions.
results_english: The proposed method improves the expressiveness and accuracy of sign language generation. Evaluation shows that integrating non-manual markers significantly enhances the perceived naturalness and effectiveness of generated sign language.
summary_japanese: 手話生成における非手動標識を活用するAI駆動の手法を提案し、精度の高いコミュニケーションを実現。
problem_japanese: 手話生成は主に手動の手話に焦点を当てており、意味や感情を伝えるのに重要な非手動のマーカーである顔の表情や身体の動きがしばしば無視されている。
method_japanese: 非手動標識を手話生成に統合するAI駆動のアプローチを提案。機械学習技術を用いて非手動表現の複雑さとニュアンスを扱う。
results_japanese: 提案手法は手話生成の表現力と精度を向上させる。非手動標識の統合により生成された手話の自然さと効果が大幅に向上することが評価で示された。

title: Automatic Tuning of Haptic Motion Effects to Evoke Specific Feelings in Multisensory Content
authors: Lee, Jiwan and Jeong, Dawoon and Han, Sung H. and Choi, Seungmoon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a method for automatically tuning haptic motion effects in multisensory content to evoke specific emotions, enhancing user experience.
problem_english: Creating haptic effects that can evoke specific emotions in multisensory content is challenging. The need for a systematic approach to tune these effects automatically is crucial for enhancing user experience in virtual environments.
method_english: The authors propose an automatic tuning system that uses a machine learning model trained on user feedback to adjust haptic parameters, aiming to evoke desired emotional responses effectively.
results_english: The proposed system successfully tuned haptic effects to evoke target emotions in user studies, demonstrating its potential to enhance emotional engagement in multisensory digital content.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、特定の感情を引き出すために多感覚コンテンツでの触覚効果を自動調整する手法を提案し、ユーザー体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 特定の感情を引き起こす触覚効果の作成は困難であり、バーチャル環境でのユーザー体験を向上させるために、これらの効果を自動的に調整する体系的な手法が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは、ユーザーのフィードバックで訓練された機械学習モデルを使用し、触覚パラメータを調整して望ましい感情反応を効果的に引き出す自動調整システムを提案します。
results_japanese: 提案されたシステムは利用者研究で目標とする感情を引き起こす触覚効果を成功裏に調整し、多感覚デジタルコンテンツにおける感情的な関与の向上の可能性を示しました。

title: Bumpy Ride? Understanding the Effects of External Forces on Spatial Interactions in Moving Vehicles
authors: Sasalovici, Markus and Zeqiri, Albin and Schramm, Robin Connor and Ariza Nunez, Oscar Javier and Jansen, Pascal and Freiwald, Jann Philipp and Colley, Mark and Winkler, Christian and Rukzio, Enrico
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the impact of external forces on spatial interactions within moving vehicles, focusing on how vibrations affect user experiences and interactions.
problem_english: Understanding human-computer interaction in moving vehicles is crucial as external forces can alter the effectiveness of spatial interfaces. The challenge lies in designing interfaces that remain functional despite vibrations and other external disturbances.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments in a simulated vehicle environment to assess how various frequencies of vibrations affect spatial interactions. They evaluated different interface designs to identify which are most resilient to these disturbances.
results_english: Results showed that certain interface designs significantly reduce the negative impacts of vibrations, allowing for more stable and reliable spatial interactions in moving vehicles, suggesting best practices for future interface designs.
summary_japanese: この論文は、移動中の車内での空間的インタラクションに対する外部力の影響を調査し、振動がユーザー体験に与える影響に注目しています。
problem_japanese: 移動車両における人間とコンピュータのインタラクションを理解することは重要です。外部力が空間インターフェイスの効果を変える可能性があり、振動や外部妨害に対応するインターフェイス設計が課題です。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは、様々な振動周波数が空間的インタラクションに与える影響を評価するため、シミュレーション環境で実験を行い、最も耐性のあるインターフェイス設計を評価しました。
results_japanese: 特定のインターフェイス設計が振動の悪影響を著しく軽減し、移動車両内での空間インタラクションをより安定させることが示され、将来のインターフェイス設計のベストプラクティスを示唆します。

title: Datamancer: Bimanual Gesture Interaction in Multi-Display Ubiquitous Analytics Environments
authors: Patnaik, Biswaksen and Borowski, Marcel and Peng, Huaishu and Klokmose, Clemens Nylandsted and Elmqvist, Niklas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces Datamancer, a system for bimanual gesture interaction in ubiquitous analytics environments employing multiple displays.
problem_english: In multi-display environments, user interaction often lacks intuitive methods, limiting effective data analytics and collaboration. Current interfaces do not efficiently support bimanual gestures for complex analysis tasks across multiple screens.
method_english: Datamancer establishes a gesture-based interaction model optimized for synchronous bimanual use and interaction across multiple screens, enhancing user engagement and collaborative analytics capabilities in ubiquitous computing contexts.
results_english: Testing showed improved engagement and efficiency in data interaction tasks with the Datamancer system, indicating potential for broader application in multi-display analytics environments.
summary_japanese: 複数ディスプレイを利用した普遍的分析環境での両手ジェスチャー相互作用システム、Datamancerを紹介。
problem_japanese: マルチディスプレイ環境では、ユーザーが直感的に操作できず、効果的なデータ分析と協業が制限されている。現行のインターフェースは、複雑な分析作業において効率的な両手ジェスチャーをサポートしていない。
method_japanese: Datamancerは複数スクリーンでの同期両手使用に最適化したジェスチャーベースの操作モデルを確立し、ユーザーの参加と協業分析の能力を向上させる。
results_japanese: Datamancerシステムを使用したデータ操作作業でエンゲージメントと効率改善が確認され、マルチディスプレイ分析環境への広範な応用が期待される。

title: ExoKit: A Toolkit for Rapid Prototyping of Interactions for Arm-based Exoskeletons
authors: Muehlhaus, Marie and Liggesmeyer, Alexander and Steimle, J\"{u}rgen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ExoKit is a toolkit developed to enable rapid prototyping of user interactions for arm-based exoskeletons, focusing on enhancing usability and customization.
problem_english: Arm-based exoskeletons can improve motor skills and support users, but the lack of tools for rapid prototyping of user interactions hinders their usability and customization. The complexity in creating tailored interactions limits user adaptability.
method_english: ExoKit provides a modular framework with customizable components for developing interactions. It includes both hardware and software elements, allowing immediate testing and feedback from users to fine-tune exoskeleton responses.
results_english: ExoKit demonstrated improved efficiency in prototyping interactions for exoskeletons, enabling quicker user feedback loops and better personalization in user experiences, which can lead to enhanced usability and user satisfaction.
summary_japanese: ExoKitは腕型外骨格用のユーザーインタラクションの迅速なプロトタイプ作成を支援するツールキットです。
problem_japanese: 腕型外骨格は運動スキル改善を支援しますが、ユーザーインタラクションの迅速なプロトタイピングを行えるツールが不足しており、使用性とカスタマイズが妨げられています。
method_japanese: ExoKitはハードウェアおよびソフトウェアのカスタマイズ可能なコンポーネントを提供し、インタラクションの設計、ユーザーの即時のテストとフィードバックを可能にします。
results_japanese: ExoKitにより外骨格のインタラクションプロトタイプ作成の効率が向上し、迅速なフィードバックと経験のパーソナライズが可能になり、使用性が改善されました。

title: Intermanual Deictics: Uncovering Users' Gesture Preferences for Opposite-Arm Referential Input, from Fingers to Shoulder
authors: Vatavu, Radu-Daniel and Gheran, Bogdan-Florin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates user preferences for intermanual deictics, gestures with the opposite arm, covering fingers to shoulders, in human-computer interaction.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of understanding the preferences users have for intermanual deictics, which involve using gestures with the opposite arm, from fingers to shoulders, as referential input for human-computer interaction. This is crucial for designing intuitive and effective gesture-based systems.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies to collect data on gesture preferences for the opposite arm across different body parts, from fingers to shoulder. This included tasks to capture natural user behavior and analyses to determine preferred gestures and their characteristics in interactive contexts.
results_english: The findings reveal specific preferences for intermanual gestures based on body part, with certain gestures being favored for their perceived comfort and intuitiveness. These insights contribute to the design of more user-friendly gesture-based input systems.
summary_japanese: 研究は、異腕部デイキティック、特に指から肩にかけてのジェスチャーのユーザーの好みを調査した。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、異腕部デイキティック、つまり指から肩までのジェスチャーを使った参照入力におけるユーザーの好みを理解することの課題を解決する。これは、直感的で効果的なジェスチャーベースのシステム設計に重要。
method_japanese: 著者らは、指から肩に渡る異腕ジェスチャーの好みに関するデータを収集するためのユーザースタディを実施。自然なユーザー行動を捉えるタスクを含め、好まれるジェスチャーとその特徴を分析。
results_japanese: 結果は、特定の身体部位に基づいた異腕ジェスチャーの好みを示し、快適さと直感性で好まれるジェスチャーがあることがわかった。これらの洞察は、よりユーザーフレンドリーなジェスチャー入力システムの設計に貢献。

title: ProxiCycle: Passively Mapping Cyclist Safety Using Smart Handlebars for Near-Miss Detection
authors: Breda, Joseph and Chen, Keyu and Pl\"{o}tz, Thomas and Patel, Shwetak
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ProxiCycle develops a smart handlebar system to map cyclist safety by detecting near-miss incidents passively. This innovative technology enhances urban cycling safety measures by identifying hazardous areas.
problem_english: Cyclists often face near-miss incidents, which are underrepresented in traditional accident data, impacting safety assessments. Efficiently capturing these events could significantly improve urban cycling infrastructures and safety strategies.
method_english: ProxiCycle employs smart handlebars equipped with proximity sensors and accelerometers to collect data about potential near-misses. This data is analyzed to pinpoint frequent incident locations, offering insights into urban cycling risks without active cyclist engagement.
results_english: The use of ProxiCycle showed improved detection of near-miss incidents compared to traditional methods. Data collected informed urban planners of high-risk areas, allowing for targeted interventions to enhance cyclist safety.
summary_japanese: ProxiCycleは、近距離事故を受動的に検出しサイクリストの安全を図るスマートハンドルを開発。都市部の安全対策を強化。
problem_japanese: 自転車利用者は接触寸前の事態を頻繁に経験するが、通常の事故データでは十分に表されないため、安全評価に影響を及ぼす。これらの事象を効果的に捕捉することにより、都市の自転車インフラと安全対策が改善される可能性がある。
method_japanese: ProxiCycleは、近距離センサーと加速度センサーを搭載したスマートハンドルを使用し、近距離事故の可能性に関するデータを収集する。このデータを分析し、頻出地域を特定することで、サイクリストの積極的な関与なしに都市のリスクを把握する。
results_japanese: ProxiCycleの使用により、従来の方法よりも近距離事故の検出が改善された。収集したデータは都市計画者に高リスク地域を通知し、サイクリストの安全性を向上させるための対策を可能にした。

title: Slip-Grip: An Electrotactile Method to Simulate Weight
authors: Lin, Hongnan and Gao, Lei and Jiang, Shengsheng and Yue, Hongyu and Fu, Ziyi and Luo, Jinyi and Wu, Chengxiao and Han, Teng and Tian, Feng and Subramanian, Sriram
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces Slip-Grip, an electrotactile method to simulate weight perception through electrical stimuli. It enhances virtual experiences by mimicking weight sensations.
problem_english: With the increasing importance of immersive virtual environments, reproducing weight sensations precisely has remained a challenge. Existing methods lack accuracy or require bulky equipment, which limits their practical applications.
method_english: Slip-Grip employs electrotactile stimulation to modulate the perceived friction between the skin and a surface, effectively simulating weight. It uses electronically controlled pulses to generate sensory feedback corresponding to different weights.
results_english: Through experiments, Slip-Grip successfully simulates various weights in a lightweight and non-intrusive manner. Participants reported realistic weight sensations, demonstrating the system's potential for enhancing virtual and augmented reality experiences.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、電気刺激による重量感のシミュレーション手法「Slip-Grip」を提案し、仮想体験を強化します。
problem_japanese: 没入型仮想環境の重要性が増す中、重量感の再現が課題です。現行技術は正確性に欠けるか、装置が大きいため実用性が制限されています。
method_japanese: Slip-Gripは電気触覚刺激を用いて、肌と表面間の摩擦を調整し重量感を模倣します。電子制御パルスにより重量に応じた感覚を生成します。
results_japanese: 実験によりSlip-Gripは軽量で非侵襲的に複数の重量をシミュレートし、参加者はリアルな重量感を報告し、VR/AR体験の向上可能性を示しました。

title: "I use video calling in all areas of my life": Understanding the Video Calling Experiences of Chronically Ill People
authors: Curtis, Humphrey and Beneteau, Erin and Cutrell, Edward and Ford, Denae and Junuzovic, Sasa and Paradiso, Ann and Tang, John and Mott, Martez E
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores chronically ill individuals' experiences with video calling across various areas of life, aiming to understand the challenges and benefits they encounter, and provides design recommendations for improving video calling technologies for better support.
problem_english: Chronically ill individuals face unique challenges when using video calling technologies, impacting their social, medical, and personal lives. Existing solutions inadequately address these challenges, necessitating research into how these tools can be optimized to better support this group.
method_english: Researchers conducted qualitative interviews and surveys with chronically ill individuals to gather insights into their experiences with video calling. They analyzed the data to identify common themes, challenges, and areas for improvement in video calling technology.
results_english: Findings revealed that video calling is a crucial tool, serving as a bridge for social connection, medical consultations, and personal management. However, accessibility and ease of use remain major concerns, prompting recommendations for more inclusive video call interfaces and features.
summary_japanese: 慢性疾患の人々のビデオ通話体験を調査し、技術改善のための設計提案を行います。
problem_japanese: 慢性疾患を持つ個人はビデオ通話技術使用時に独自の課題に直面し、社会的、医療的、個人的生活に影響を受けています。既存のソリューションはこれらの課題に対応が不十分であり、より良い支援のための技術最適化研究が必要です。
method_japanese: 研究者は慢性疾患の人々に対して質的インタビューと調査を行い、ビデオ通話の経験についての洞察を収集しました。データを分析し、共通のテーマや課題、改善すべき領域を特定しました。
results_japanese: ビデオ通話は社会的つながりや医療相談、個人管理の重要な手段であることが判明。しかし、アクセシビリティと使いやすさが主要な懸念点であり、より包括的なビデオ通話インターフェイスと機能を推奨します。

title: A Critical Review of Sexuality, Technology and Disability
authors: Patel, Dilisha and Osipova, Ekat and Spiel, Katta and Barbareschi, Giulia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper reviews the intersection of sexuality, technology, and disability, exploring existing literature, identifying gaps, and suggesting future research directions.
problem_english: Sexuality for individuals with disabilities is often overlooked, especially in the context of technological advancements. This neglect results in a lack of inclusive and accessible technology that supports the sexual and relational needs of disabled individuals. The existing literature lacks comprehensive insights into how technology can empower or hinder their sexual experiences.
method_english: The authors conducted a critical literature review, examining existing studies and frameworks related to sexuality, disability, and technology. They analyzed various thematic areas to discern prevailing narratives, challenges, and opportunities. Through this systematic review, they highlighted gaps and potential research avenues that future studies need to address.
results_english: The review identified significant gaps in technology's role in supporting disabled individuals' sexuality. It emphasized a need for inclusive design practices and equity-focused research. The authors suggest collaborative efforts among technologists, designers, and disabled communities to create sustainable solutions that foster autonomy and inclusive sexual experiences.
summary_japanese: この論文は、セクシュアリティ、技術、障害の交差点をレビューし、文献を探り、ギャップを特定し、今後の研究方向を示唆します。
problem_japanese: 障害を持つ個人のセクシュアリティは技術革新の文脈ではしばしば見過ごされ、インクルーシブでアクセスしやすい技術が欠如しています。これは障害者の性的経験を支えるために技術がどのように役立つかの包括的洞察を欠いています。
method_japanese: セクシュアリティ、障害、技術に関連する既存の研究やフレームワークを批判的に文献レビューし、テーマ別に分析し、現在のナラティブや課題を明らかにします。
results_japanese: 障害者のセクシュアリティを支える技術の重要性が浮き彫りにされました。インクルーシブな設計と平等重視の研究が必要。技術者と障害者コミュニティの協働が求められます。

title: Designing Accessible Audio Nudges for Voice Interfaces
authors: Jamshed, Hira and Nurain, Novia and Brewer, Robin N.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the design of audio nudges to enhance accessibility in voice interfaces, emphasizing user-centered design principles to accommodate diverse user needs.
problem_english: As voice interfaces become more prevalent, ensuring their accessibility for people with diverse needs remains a challenge. Audio nudges, subtle cues designed to guide user interaction, can enhance user experience but must be thoughtfully designed to be effective and inclusive.
method_english: The authors employed a user-centered design approach, involving iterative testing with diverse user groups. They developed and evaluated different types of audio cues, focusing on clarity, timing, and integration within existing voice interfaces to ensure usability and accessibility.
results_english: The study found that thoughtfully designed audio nudges significantly improved interaction for all user groups. Participants reported enhanced understanding and engagement, highlighting the potential of well-integrated audio cues to make voice interfaces more accessible and user-friendly.
summary_japanese: 本論文は音声インターフェースのアクセシビリティ向上のための音声ナッジの設計を研究し、ユーザー中心設計を強調しています。
problem_japanese: 音声インターフェースの普及に伴い、多様なニーズを持つ人々にアクセシブルな設計が求められています。効果的かつ包容力のある音声ナッジによりユーザー体験を向上させることが課題です。
method_japanese: 著者らはユーザー中心設計手法を採用し、多様なユーザーグループとの反復的なテストを実施しました。使用可能性とアクセシビリティの両立を図りつつ、音声インターフェース内における音声キューの明瞭さ、タイミング、統合を評価しました。
results_japanese: 研究により、十分に設計された音声ナッジが全てのユーザーグループにおけるインタラクションを著しく向上させることが確認され、音声インターフェースのアクセシビリティを高める効果が示されました。

title: Digital Technologies for Deaf and Hard of Hearing Children: a Systematic Review, Critical Reflections, and Future Research Directions
authors: Zhao, Jing and Neto, Isabel and Pires, Ana Cristina and Tom\'{e}-Pires, Catarina and Nicolau, Hugo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper systematically reviews digital technologies aimed at supporting deaf and hard of hearing children, offering critical reflections and suggesting future research directions in this area.
problem_english: There exists a critical need to identify, analyze, and synthesize digital technologies that effectively support the educational and developmental needs of deaf and hard of hearing children, addressing technological gaps and efficiency issues.
method_english: The authors conduct a systematic review of existing digital technologies, followed by a critical analysis of their effectiveness and limitations. They synthesize the findings to propose future research directions tailored to the needs of deaf and hard of hearing children.
results_english: Findings reveal varied levels of effectiveness in digital solutions. The paper highlights the importance of user-centered designs and calls for increased collaboration among developers, educators, and the deaf community for future advancements.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、聴覚障害児向けデジタル技術を体系的にレビューし、批判的考察と将来の研究方向を提案します。
problem_japanese: 聴覚障害児の教育と発達ニーズを効果的に支援するデジタル技術を特定、分析、統合する必要があるが、技術的ギャップと効率問題が存在。
method_japanese: 既存のデジタル技術を体系的にレビューし、その有効性と限界を批判的に分析。聴覚障害児のニーズに合わせた将来の研究方向を提案する。
results_japanese: デジタルソリューションの有効性にはばらつきがある。ユーザー中心の設計の重要性を強調し、開発者、教育者、聴覚障害コミュニティの協力を呼びかける。

title: Emotionally Challenging Games Can Satisfy Older Adults' Psychological Needs: From Empirical Study to Design Guidelines
authors: Zhou, Min and Peng, Xiaolan and Liu, Binjie and Denisova, Alena and Barathi, Soumya C. and Li, Zhuying and Xie, Xurong and Huang, Jin and Tian, Feng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines how games with emotional challenges can fulfill psychological needs of older adults. It suggests design guidelines based on empirical findings.
problem_english: There is a lack of understanding about how emotionally challenging games impact psychological needs such as competence, autonomy, and relatedness in older adults, which could help in designing better age-appropriate game experiences.
method_english: The authors conducted empirical studies involving older adults playing emotionally challenging games, analyzing their experiences using qualitative and quantitative measures. Design guidelines were then derived from the findings.
results_english: The study revealed that games with emotional challenges could satisfy older adults' psychological needs, enhancing feelings of competence, autonomy, and relatedness. This led to actionable design guidelines for game designers.
summary_japanese: 感情的な挑戦を伴うゲームが高齢者の心理的ニーズを満たす可能性があることを調査した。
problem_japanese: 高齢者の心理的ニーズ（能力感、自律性、関係性）に対する感情的に挑戦的なゲームの影響理解が不足しており、適切なゲームデザインの改善に役立つ可能性がある。
method_japanese: 高齢者を対象にした感情的な挑戦を含むゲーム経験を、質的および量的手法を用いて分析。研究結果からデザインガイドラインを導出した。
results_japanese: 感情的な挑戦を持つゲームが高齢者の能力感、自律性、関係性を満たすことが判明。これによりゲームデザインの指針が提示された。

title: Envisioning Financial Technology Support for Older Adults Through Cognitive and Life Transitions
authors: Dai, Jiamin and McGrenere, Joanna
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines how financial technology can better support older adults through cognitive and life transitions, identifying key challenges and proposing solutions.
problem_english: Older adults face unique challenges in managing finances due to cognitive decline and life transitions. Current financial technologies often fail to accommodate these needs, leading to potential financial insecurity. There is a need for solutions that are accessible, intuitive, and tailored to support older adults through these changes.
method_english: The study involved interviewing older adults to understand their experiences and challenges related to financial management. The authors combined user-centered design principles with insights from cognitive psychology to propose design solutions for financial technologies that better support older adults.
results_english: The research identified specific issues older adults face, such as difficulty understanding complex interfaces and concerns about security. The authors proposed solutions including simplified interfaces, personalized support features, and enhanced security measures. These solutions aim to improve financial technology's accessibility and usability for older adults.
summary_japanese: この論文は、高齢者が認知および生活の変遷を経る際の金融技術の支持方法を検討し、課題を特定し解決策を提案している。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は認知能力の低下や生活の変化に伴い、金融管理において特有の課題に直面しており、現行の金融技術はこれらのニーズに対応できていないため、金融不安の可能性がある。これに対処するため、アクセスしやすく直感的で高齢者向けにカスタマイズされた解決策が求められている。
method_japanese: 高齢者の金融管理に関する経験や課題を理解するためにインタビューを行い、ユーザー中心設計の原則と認知心理学の洞察を組み合わせたデザインソリューションを提案した。
results_japanese: 高齢者が直面する問題として、複雑なインターフェースの理解の難しさやセキュリティへの懸念が特定された。解決策として、簡素化されたインターフェース、個別サポート機能、強化されたセキュリティ対策を提案し、高齢者にとっての金融技術の利用しやすさとアクセス性の向上を図った。

title: From Participation to Solidarity: A Case Study on Access of Maker Spaces from Deaf and Hearing Perspectives
authors: Suchanek, Oliver and Meissner, Janis Lena and Angelini, Robin and Spiel, Katta
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores access to maker spaces from both deaf and hearing perspectives, shifting focus from mere participation to solidarity.
problem_english: Many maker spaces have been designed without considering the needs of the deaf community, resulting in limited access and engagement opportunities. The problem is understanding how these spaces can be adapted to not only enhance participation but foster solidarity across differences in hearing abilities.
method_english: The authors conducted a qualitative case study including interviews and observational research with both deaf and hearing participants in various maker spaces. This approach aimed to uncover barriers and opportunities for fostering solidarity and inclusive practices.
results_english: Findings highlight the challenges faced by deaf individuals in maker spaces, including communication barriers. The study emphasizes the importance of inclusive dialogue and co-creation practices for fostering solidarity and improving access.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ろう者と聴者の視点からメイカースペースへのアクセスを探り、単なる参加から連帯への変化を検討します。
problem_japanese: 多くのメイカースペースはろう者のニーズを考慮せずに設計されており、アクセスと参加の機会が制限されています。課題は、聴覚能力の差を超えて連帯を育むためにこれらのスペースをどのように適応させるかです。
method_japanese: ろう者と聴者の参加者を対象に、インタビューおよび観察調査を行った事例研究を実施し、障壁と連帯の可能性を見出すことを目的としました。
results_japanese: 分析結果では、ろう者がメイカースペースで直面するコミュニケーション障壁などの課題が強調されました。連帯を育むためには包括的な対話と共創の重要性が示されています。

title: DanmuA11y: Making Time-Synced On-Screen Video Comments (Danmu) Accessible to Blind and Low Vision Users via Multi-Viewer Audio Discussions
authors: Xu, Shuchang and Jin, Xiaofu and Qu, Huamin and Yan, Yukang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: DanmuA11y enhances accessibility for blind and low vision users to video comments by using audio discussions synchronized with videos, enabling multisensory engagement.
problem_english: Blind and low vision users face challenges in accessing Danmu, time-synchronized on-screen video comments. Current accessibility measures are insufficient, limiting their engagement and learning from video content adorned with these comments.
method_english: The authors proposed a system, DanmuA11y, facilitating audio discussions among multiple viewers to describe Danmu content. This enables blind and low vision users to receive synchronized auditory descriptions, enhancing accessibility and interaction.
results_english: User studies demonstrated that DanmuA11y significantly improved the accessibility of time-synced comments for blind and low vision users. Participants reported enhanced comprehension, engagement, and overall experience when accessing video content.
summary_japanese: DanmuA11yは、視覚障害者が動画コメントにアクセスできるよう、ビデオと同期された音声討議を用いて多感覚での参加を促進します。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は、画面上のタイムシンクコメントであるDanmuへのアクセスが困難であり、既存のアクセシビリティ対応は不十分で、これらのコメント付き動画からの学習と参加が制限されています。
method_japanese: DanmuA11yは、複数の視聴者がDanmu内容を音声で説明するシステムを提案し、視覚障害者に同期した音声解説を提供することで、アクセシビリティとインタラクションを向上させます。
results_japanese: ユーザースタディにより、DanmuA11yが視覚障害者の時間同期コメントへのアクセス性を著しく向上させたことが示されました。参加者は、ビデオコンテンツへの理解、参与、体験が向上したと報告しました。

title: Enhancing Tactile Learning: A Co-Designed System for Supporting Speech Interaction with Multi-Part 3D Printed Models by Students who are Blind
authors: Nagassa, Ruth Galan and Pham, Andre Ky and Butler, Matthew and Holloway, Leona and Stefanov, Kalin and de Vent, Skye and Marriott, Kim
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a system co-designed with blind students for enhancing tactile learning through speech interaction with 3D printed models, aiming to improve educational experiences for the visually impaired.
problem_english: Blind students face challenges in accessing complex 3D information necessary for STEM education due to the reliance on predominantly visual teaching materials, resulting in limited understanding and exclusion from certain educational experiences.
method_english: The researchers co-designed a tactile-based system allowing speech interaction with 3D printed models involving blind students. This approach integrated tactile feedback with audio descriptions, facilitating better exploration and understanding of educational models.
results_english: The system improved comprehension of 3D models for blind students, enhancing engagement and interaction through tactile and auditory input. User feedback indicates significant benefits, showing promising results in facilitating STEM education access.
summary_japanese: 視覚障害者学生向けに、3Dモデルとの音声対話を支援する触覚学習システムを共同設計し、教育体験の向上を目指します。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者用の教育資料が主に視覚的であるため、STEM教育に必要な複雑な3D情報へのアクセスに課題があり、理解が制限され、教育体験からの除外が発生しています。
method_japanese: 視覚障害学生との共同設計で、3Dモデルとの音声対話を可能にする触覚ベースのシステムを開発し、触覚フィードバックと音声記述を統合して教育モデルへの理解を促進します。
results_japanese: このシステムは視覚障害学生の3Dモデルの理解を改善し、触覚と聴覚入力による学習の関与と対話を向上させた。ユーザーのフィードバックは大きな利点を示し、STEM教育へのアクセスを促進する可能性を示しています。

title: LifeInsight: Design and Evaluation of an AI-Powered Assistive Wearable for Blind and Low Vision People Across Multiple Everyday Life Scenarios
authors: Mathis, Florian and Sch\"{o}ning, Johannes
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: LifeInsight is an AI-powered wearable designed to assist blind and low vision individuals in various daily scenarios. It aims to improve independence and accessibility. Evaluation shows promising results in enhancing users' everyday life experiences.
problem_english: Blind and low vision individuals face challenges in navigating everyday life, impacting their independence and accessibility. Current assistive technologies are limited in addressing diverse scenarios effectively, necessitating innovative solutions to improve their quality of life.
method_english: The researchers designed LifeInsight, which integrates AI technology into a wearable device. It assists in real-time decision-making across daily scenarios by providing auditory feedback and guidance, thus enabling greater autonomy and situational awareness for users.
results_english: The evaluation of LifeInsight demonstrated significant improvements in navigation, task completion, and users' confidence. Participants experienced greater ease in performing various everyday activities, showing promise for its widespread adoption among visually impaired communities.
summary_japanese: LifeInsightは、視覚障害者の日常生活を支援するAI搭載のウェアラブルで、独立性とアクセシビリティの向上を目指します。評価ではユーザーの生活改善に役立つことが示されました。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は日常生活での移動が困難であり、独立性や生活の質に影響を与えています。現行の支援技術は様々な場面に対応することが難しく、革新的な解決策が求められています。
method_japanese: 研究者はAI技術をウェアラブルデバイスに統合したLifeInsightを設計しました。リアルタイムの意思決定支援を提供し、聴覚フィードバックで視覚障害者の自律性と状況認識を向上させます。
results_japanese: LifeInsightの評価により、ナビゲーションやタスク完了、ユーザーの自信において著しい改善が確認されました。参加者は様々な日常活動を容易に行え、有望な結果となりました。

title: Project TapTap: A Longitudinal Study Exploring Non-Verbal Communication through Vibration Signals Between Teachers and Blind or Low Vision Music Learners
authors: Lu, Leon and Crispin, Chase and Piao, Ziyue and Eze-Anyanwu, Aino and Girouard, Audrey
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Project TapTap explored non-verbal communication using vibration signals between teachers and blind or low vision music learners, employing longitudinal studies to analyze effectiveness and user experience.
problem_english: Blind or low vision music learners face challenges in receiving non-verbal feedback from teachers, which impacts their learning experience. Traditional methods often fall short in effectively conveying nuanced instructional cues, necessitating exploration of alternative communication methods.
method_english: The study utilized vibration signal devices to facilitate non-verbal communication between music teachers and blind or low vision learners. Longitudinal assessment was conducted to understand the effectiveness, practicality, and user acceptance of this method in real-world educational settings.
results_english: Results demonstrated that vibration signal devices improved communication efficiency and user satisfaction. Participants reported enhanced understanding of non-verbal cues, contributing to improved learning outcomes and highlighting the potential for broader application in educational contexts.
summary_japanese: Project TapTapは振動信号を用いて音楽教師と視覚障害学習者間の非言語コミュニケーションを探る長期的研究を実施しました。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害の音楽学習者は、教師からの非言語的なフィードバックを受け取る際に課題に直面します。従来の方法では指示の微細なニュアンスを効果的に伝えることが難しいため、代替コミュニケーション方法の探索が必要です。
method_japanese: 振動信号デバイスを用いて音楽教師と視覚障害学習者間の非言語コミュニケーションを支援。長期的な評価を通じて、この方法の効果、実用性、ユーザー受容性を教育現場で検証しました。
results_japanese: 振動信号デバイスはコミュニケーションの効率とユーザー満足度を向上させました。参加者は非言語的キューの理解が向上し、学習成果の向上につながると報告しており、教育分野での広範な応用の可能性を示しました。

title: TableNarrator: Making Image Tables Accessible to Blind and Low Vision People
authors: Mo, Ye and Huang, Gang and li, liangcheng and Deng, Dazhen and Yu, Zhi and Xu, Yilun and Ye, Kai and Zhou, Sheng and Bu, Jiajun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TableNarrator improves accessibility in image tables for the blind and low vision community, enhancing information retrieval and interaction based on advanced image processing and NLP techniques.
problem_english: Blind and low vision individuals face significant barriers in accessing image tables, which are often used in academic and technical content. Current solutions are inadequate in providing comprehensive access to this information-rich format.
method_english: TableNarrator employs cutting-edge image processing algorithms and natural language processing (NLP) techniques to translate image tables into accessible formats. It ensures the extraction of data from images and its effective narration for improved accessibility.
results_english: TableNarrator significantly enhances information access and understanding for users with visual impairments. The approach demonstrates notable improvements in interaction and comprehension, outperforming traditional methods in usability tests.
summary_japanese: TableNarratorは視覚障害者向けに画像テーブルのアクセスを改善し、高度な画像処理とNLP技術で情報収集とインタラクションを向上させます。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は学術や技術コンテンツで頻繁に使用される画像テーブルへのアクセスに大きな障壁があります。現行のソリューションはこの情報豊かな形式への包括的なアクセスを提供するには不十分です。
method_japanese: TableNarratorは最先端の画像処理アルゴリズムと自然言語処理（NLP）技術を用いて画像テーブルをアクセシブルな形式に翻訳します。画像からのデータ抽出と効果的なナレーションを保証します。
results_japanese: TableNarratorは視覚障害を持つユーザーの情報アクセスと理解を大幅に向上させます。このアプローチはインタラクションと理解力で著しい改善を示し、従来の方法を使用性試験で上回っています。

title: VisiMark: Characterizing and Augmenting Landmarks for People with Low Vision in Augmented Reality to Support Indoor Navigation
authors: Chen, Ruijia and Jiang, Junru and Maheshwary, Pragati and Cochran, Brianna R and Zhao, Yuhang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces VisiMark, a system using augmented reality to improve indoor navigation for people with low vision by enhancing landmark visibility.
problem_english: People with low vision often face challenges in navigating indoor environments due to limited visibility and recognition of landmarks, which affects their spatial awareness and independence.
method_english: VisiMark utilizes augmented reality to characterize and enhance landmarks, providing visual and auditory cues to aid low vision individuals in better identifying and navigating indoor spaces.
results_english: The study shows that VisiMark significantly improves the ability of low vision users to recognize and navigate using landmarks, enhancing their spatial awareness and reducing navigation time.
summary_japanese: VisiMarkは、視覚障害者のためにランドマークの視認性を強化し、屋内ナビゲーションを改善する増強現実システムです。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は、ランドマークの視認性と認識能力の問題で屋内環境におけるナビゲーションが困難であり、空間認識と自立性に影響を及ぼしています。
method_japanese: VisiMarkは増強現実を利用してランドマークを特徴づけ、視覚および聴覚のサポートを提供し、視覚障害者が屋内空間をより良く特定しナビゲートできるように支援します。
results_japanese: VisiMarkは視覚障害者のランドマーク認識能力とナビゲーションを大幅に向上させ、空間認識を強化し、ナビゲーション時間を短縮します。

title: 3D Printing Eggshells: Exploring Eco-Socio-Technical Relations through Biomaterial Design
authors: Bell, Fiona and Friedman-Gerlicz, Camila and Urenda, Lauren and Buechley, Leah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates eco-socio-technical relations via biomaterial design, specifically using eggshells in 3D printing. It explores sustainability in material science and digital fabrication, aiming to encourage novel, environmentally friendly fabrication practices.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of integrating sustainability into digital fabrication processes by examining the potential of using biomaterials, such as eggshells, in 3D printing. This involves understanding the eco-socio-technical implications and creating a framework to foster sustainable practices in this domain.
method_english: The authors developed a methodology combining material science and digital fabrication techniques to process eggshells for 3D printing. This involved characterizing the mechanical properties of the biomaterial, integrating software design, and conducting experimental trials to observe outcomes.
results_english: The study demonstrated that eggshells can be effectively utilized in 3D printing, revealing promising mechanical properties. This approach not only highlights a sustainable use of waste materials but also suggests potential for broader applications in eco-conscious digital fabrication.
summary_japanese: この論文はバイオマテリアルデザインを通じた持続可能性を探求し、特に卵殻を用いた3Dプリントを研究しています。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、卵殻のようなバイオマテリアルを使用した3Dプリントによるデジタル製造プロセスへの持続可能性の統合という課題に取り組み、エコ-社会-技術的影響を理解し、持続可能な実践を促進するためのフレームワークを作成することを目的としています。
method_japanese: 卵殻を3Dプリント用に加工するため、材料科学とデジタル製造技術を組み合わせた方法論を開発しました。バイオマテリアルの機械的特性を特徴付け、ソフトウェア設計を統合し、結果を観察するための実験的試行を実施しました。
results_japanese: 卵殻が3Dプリントに効果的に利用できることが示され、有望な機械的特性が明らかになりました。この方法は廃棄物材料の持続可能な利用を示すだけでなく、エコ意識の高いデジタル製造への幅広い応用の可能性を示唆しています。

title: American Indian Pottery and Clay 3D Printing: An Exploration of Opportunities and Risks in Professional Practice
authors: Silva Lovato, Monica and Suina, Jeff and Tso, Jared and Kaminsky, Alexis and Friedman-Gerlicz, Camila and Buechley, Leah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the integration of 3D printing in American Indian pottery, examining its opportunities and risks in professional practice. It discusses technological impacts on cultural preservation and artistic innovation.
problem_english: The main problem addressed is the tension between technological advancement and traditional craftsmanship in American Indian pottery. The paper examines how 3D printing might affect cultural traditions, authenticity, and the balance between innovation and preservation within this practice.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews with American Indian potters and artisans, analyzed case studies of 3D printing applications in pottery, and surveyed the perceptions of technology's impact on traditional practices to evaluate current opportunities and risks.
results_english: The study found mixed opinions: some artisans appreciate 3D printing for creativity and efficiency, while others worry about cultural dilution and loss of craftsmanship. Recommendations for integrating technology respectfully within traditional practices are provided.
summary_japanese: この論文は、アメリカインディアンの陶芸における3D印刷の統合を探求し、専門的な実践における機会とリスクを検討します。
problem_japanese: 技術革新と伝統的なアメリカインディアンの陶芸の間の緊張が課題です。3D印刷が文化的伝統や制作の真偽、革新と保存のバランスにどのように影響するかを検討します。
method_japanese: アメリカインディアンの陶芸家へのインタビュー、陶芸への3D印刷適用の事例分析、技術が伝統的慣習に与える影響に関する調査を実施しました。
results_japanese: 調査は賛否両論を示し、一部の職人は創造性と効率性を評価する一方、他者は文化的希薄化と技術の損失を懸念します。伝統的慣習に技術を尊重しながら統合するための推奨事項が提供されます。

title: ColdGlass: Full-Color Desktop 3D Printing in Glass
authors: Friedman-Gerlicz, Camila and Gould, Jaime and Bell, Fiona and Buechley, Leah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ColdGlass presents a novel method for full-color 3D printing in glass, designed for desktop environments. The system leverages proprietary technologies to overcome traditional challenges in glass 3D printing.
problem_english: Traditional glass 3D printing methods face challenges such as high temperatures, limited color options, and expensive setups. These limitations hinder accessibility and practicality for home users and small-scale operations, necessitating a more user-friendly and cost-effective solution.
method_english: ColdGlass employs a cold-processing technique that combines a specialized 3D printer with a proprietary ink formulation. This method eliminates the need for high temperatures and enables full-color print capabilities. The innovative approach makes glass 3D printing more accessible by reducing costs and complexity.
results_english: The ColdGlass system successfully produces full-color glass 3D prints without high-temperature processes. It demonstrates improved accessibility for users by offering a cost-effective, practical solution for desktop applications while maintaining quality and color versatility in the resulting products.
summary_japanese: ColdGlassはフルカラーガラス3Dプリントを可能にする新手法を発表し、デスクトップ環境向けに設計されています。
problem_japanese: 従来のガラス3Dプリント法は高温が必要で色が限られており、高価なセットアップが必要です。これらの制限により一般家庭や小規模用途での実用性が低下し、より使いやすくコスト効果の高いソリューションが求められています。
method_japanese: ColdGlassは特殊インクと3Dプリンターを組み合わせた低温プロセス技術を活用し、高温が不要なフルカラー印刷を可能にする手法を採用しています。革新的な手法でコストと複雑さを軽減し、ガラス3Dプリントをより身近にしています。
results_japanese: ColdGlassシステムは高温プロセスを使用せずにフルカラーガラス3D印刷を成功させました。コスト効率と実用性を兼ね備えたデスクトップ用途向けのソリューションを提供し、ユーザーの利用しやすさを向上させています。

title: Draw2Cut: Direct On-Material Annotations for CNC Milling
authors: Gui, Xinyue and Xia, Ding and Gao, Wang and Dogan, Mustafa Doga and Larsson, Maria and Igarashi, Takeo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Draw2Cut introduces a method for direct on-material annotations in CNC milling, simplifying the design-to-manufacture process.
problem_english: Traditional CNC milling requires complex software for design and setup, which can be daunting for novice users and inefficient for quick iterations.
method_english: Draw2Cut employs a direct on-material annotation approach where users can hand-draw on materials, translating these into milling paths through intuitive software integration.
results_english: The method enhances usability and efficiency in CNC milling, allowing users to achieve faster prototyping and reduced errors when translating designs into cuts.
summary_japanese: Draw2CutはCNCミリングにおける直接材料上の注釈手法を紹介し、設計から製造へのプロセスを簡素化します。
problem_japanese: 従来のCNCミリングは複雑なソフトウェアを要し、初心者には難解で迅速な反復作業に非効率的です。
method_japanese: Draw2Cutは直接材料上に手描きするアプローチを採用し、これを直感的なソフトウェアでミリングパスに変換します。
results_japanese: この手法はCNCミリングの使いやすさと効率を向上させ、迅速な試作と設計から切断への誤差を減少させます。

title: Enabling Recycling of Multi-Material 3D Printed Objects through Computational Design and Disassembly by Dissolution
authors: Wen, Xin and Bae, S. Sandra and Rivera, Michael L.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses a new approach for recycling multi-material 3D printed objects using computational design and dissolution-based disassembly, enabling environmentally sustainable practices.
problem_english: Multi-material 3D printed objects pose significant recycling challenges due to their complex structure, which leads to environmental issues. Traditional methods often fail to efficiently separate different materials for effective recycling.
method_english: The authors present a computational design workflow that integrates materials science principles to design objects for easy disassembly by dissolution, facilitating the separation and recycling of individual materials.
results_english: Experiments demonstrated efficient material separation and recovery through dissolution-based disassembly, validating the approach's effectiveness in enabling sustainable recycling of multi-material 3D printed objects.
summary_japanese: 複数素材3Dプリント物のリサイクルを可能にする計算デザインと溶解分解の手法を提案。
problem_japanese: 複数素材の3Dプリント物はその複雑な構造ゆえにリサイクルが困難で環境問題を引き起こしており、従来の方法では素材の効率的な分離が難しかった。
method_japanese: 素材科学原理を組み込んだ計算デザインワークフローにより、溶解を利用した簡単な分解を可能にし、各素材のリサイクルを支援する手法を提案。
results_japanese: 実験により溶解分解による効率的な素材分離と回収が実証され、この手法が複数素材3Dプリント物の持続可能なリサイクル可能性を有することを検証した。

title: Layered Interactions: Exploring Non-Intrusive Digital Craftsmanship Design Through Lacquer Art Interfaces
authors: Dong, Yan and Yu, Hanjie and Chen, Yanran and Zhang, Zipeng and Qiong, Wu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines non-intrusive digital craftsmanship design through lacquer art interfaces, combining tradition with modern technology to enhance user interactions.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of integrating traditional craftsmanship, like lacquer art, into modern digital interfaces without compromising the authenticity and aesthetic value inherent in such crafts. There is a need to develop methods that respect traditional artistry while enhancing user interaction through digital advancements, aiming to create harmonious layered interactions.
method_english: The method involves the development of interfaces that simulate lacquer art's layered texture and depth through advanced digital rendering techniques. It leverages haptic feedback and visual simulations to mimic the tactile and visual experiences of real lacquer art, enhancing the user's interaction with digital surfaces by creating a more authentic, engaging experience.
results_english: The results indicate that users experience a more authentic interaction with digital surfaces, as the simulation of lacquer art enhances the aesthetic and tactile dimensions of digital craftsmanship. The approach successfully integrates traditional art forms into modern technology, preserving the craftsmanship’s essence while providing a novel interaction experience.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、漆芸インターフェースを通じて侵襲性のないデジタル職人技を探求し、伝統と現代技術を組み合わせてユーザーインタラクションを向上させる。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、漆芸のような伝統的な職人技を、風格や美的価値を損なうことなく現代のデジタルインターフェースに統合する課題に取り組む。デジタル技術を通じてユーザーインタラクションを強化しつつ、伝統的な芸術性を尊重する方法の開発が必要である。
method_japanese: この手法は、漆芸の層状の質感や深みを高度なデジタルレンダリング技術でシミュレートするインターフェースの開発を含む。触覚フィードバックと視覚シミュレーションを活用して、実際の漆芸の触覚的かつ視覚的な体験を模倣し、ユーザーのデジタル面でのインタラクションをより本格的で没入感のあるものに改良する。
results_japanese: 漆芸のシミュレーションは、デジタル職人技の美的および触覚的側面を強化し、ユーザーがデジタル面とより本格的にインタラクションすることを示した。このアプローチは、伝統的な芸術形式を現代技術に統合し、職人技の本質を保持しつつ新たなインタラクション体験を提供することに成功した。

title: Wearable Material Properties: Passive Wearable Microstructures as Adaptable Interfaces for the Physical Environment
authors: Lin, Yuyu and Guner, Hatice Gokcen and Gu, Jianzhe and Prashant, Sonia and Ion, Alexandra
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces wearable microstructures that adapt to the physical environment without active components, presenting an innovative interface solution.
problem_english: Current wearable technologies often rely on active components, which can limit adaptability, efficiency, and user comfort. The challenge is to develop passive systems that enhance interaction with the environment while maintaining flexibility and effectiveness.
method_english: The authors developed passive microstructures integrated into wearables, using smart materials that respond to environmental stimuli. These structures change shape or properties, enabling adaptability without electronic components.
results_english: Experiments demonstrated that the proposed passive wearable microstructures effectively adapt to varying environmental conditions, enhancing interface capabilities while remaining comfortable and energy-efficient.
summary_japanese: 能動的要素なしで環境に適応するウェアラブル微細構造を提案し、新しいインターフェイス解を紹介。
problem_japanese: 現在のウェアラブル技術は能動的な要素に依存することが多く、適応性、効率、ユーザーの快適さを制限する。柔軟で効果的な環境との相互作用を強化する受動的システムの開発が課題。
method_japanese: 環境刺激に応答するスマート素材を用いた受動的微細構造をウェアラブルに統合し、電子部品を使わずに適応性を実現。
results_japanese: 提案された受動的ウェアラブル微細構造がさまざまな環境条件に効果的に適応し、インターフェイス能力を向上させつつ、快適性と省エネ性を維持することを実証。

title: ExploreSelf: Fostering User-driven Exploration and Reflection on Personal Challenges with Adaptive Guidance by Large Language Models
authors: Song, Inhwa and Park, SoHyun and Pendse, Sachin R and Schleider, Jessica Lee and De Choudhury, Munmun and Kim, Young-Ho
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ExploreSelf uses large language models to guide users in exploring and reflecting on personal challenges, enhancing self-directed growth with adaptive support.
problem_english: Individuals often struggle with self-reflection and addressing personal challenges without structured guidance. There is a need for a system that can assist users in exploring and understanding their issues in a personalized and supportive manner, leveraging advancements in language models to provide adaptive guidance tailored to individual needs.
method_english: The study introduces ExploreSelf, an innovative framework utilizing large language models to foster personalized exploration of personal challenges. It offers adaptive guidance by dynamically adjusting its support based on users' input and needs, facilitating deeper self-reflection and understanding through interactive and user-centered dialogues.
results_english: ExploreSelf successfully enhanced users' ability to reflect on personal challenges, with participants reporting improved clarity and insight into their issues. The model's adaptive guidance was effective in customizing support, leading to a more engaging and supportive self-exploration process, demonstrating the potential of AI-driven tools in personal growth contexts.
summary_japanese: ExploreSelfは、大規模言語モデルを利用してユーザーの個人的課題の探求と反省を促進し、適応的サポートで自己成長を促します。
problem_japanese: 自己反省や個人的課題への対処は、多くの人にとって体系的なガイダンスなしでは困難です。個人のニーズに合わせた適応的なガイダンスを提供できるシステムが必要です。
method_japanese: ExploreSelfは、大規模言語モデルを活用して個人の課題探求を支援するフレームワークです。ユーザーの入力に応じて動的にサポートを適応させ、自己反省を促進する対話を提供します。
results_japanese: ExploreSelfは、ユーザーの課題反省能力を向上させ、適応的ガイダンスが効果的であることを示し、自己成長促進の潜在力を示しました。

title: How the Algorithmic Transparency of Search Engines Influences Health Anxiety: The Mediating Effects of Trust in Online Health Information Search
authors: Wu, Yuheng and Dong, Yujie and Mou, Yi and Kim, Ki Joon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how algorithmic transparency of search engines impacts health anxiety, exploring trust as a mediator. The findings provide insights into the relationship between search engine transparency and online health information trust.
problem_english: Health anxiety triggered by online health information search is a growing issue, potentially influenced by the transparency of search engine algorithms. Understanding how trust mediates this relationship can offer valuable insights for improving online health information consumption.
method_english: The study employed a quantitative research approach, utilizing surveys to collect data on individuals' perceptions of search engine transparency, trust in online health information, and experienced health anxiety, then analyzing the data through statistical mediation analysis to understand the relationships among these variables.
results_english: Results indicated a significant mediating effect of trust in online health information between the algorithmic transparency of search engines and health anxiety, suggesting that increased transparency can enhance trust, consequently reducing health anxiety.
summary_japanese: 検索エンジンのアルゴリズムの透明性が健康不安に与える影響を検討し、信頼が媒介する様子を探る。透明性と信頼の関係についての洞察を提供。
problem_japanese: オンライン健康情報検索による健康不安が増加しており、検索エンジンのアルゴリズムの透明性の影響が考えられる。この関係を信頼が媒介する仕組みを理解することで、オンライン健康情報の消費改善に役立つ示唆が得られる。
method_japanese: 量的研究手法を用い、検索エンジンの透明性の認識、オンライン健康情報への信頼、経験した健康不安についての調査を実施し、これらの変数間の関係を理解するために統計的な媒介分析を行った。
results_japanese: 検索エンジンのアルゴリズムの透明性と健康不安の間には、オンライン健康情報への信頼が有意な媒介効果を示し、透明性の向上が信頼を高め、健康不安を軽減することが示唆された。

title: Sonora: Human-AI Co-Creation of 3D Audio Worlds and its Impact on Anxiety and Cognitive Load
authors: De La Torre, Fernanda M and Hernandez, Javier and Wilson, Andrew D and Amores, Judith
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores Sonora, a Human-AI system that facilitates the co-creation of 3D audio worlds, and examines its effects on anxiety and cognitive load.
problem_english: The challenge in designing immersive 3D audio experiences lies in balancing the levels of user engagement and cognitive load, while also addressing the potential benefits for anxiety reduction. Existing systems often require significant user effort and expertise, lacking intuitive interfaces that aid non-experts.
method_english: Sonora enables users to co-create 3D audio worlds with AI assistance. The system uses machine learning algorithms to generate personalized audio experiences. By incorporating user feedback, Sonora adjusts and refines the soundscapes, aiming to reduce user anxiety and cognitive load through a user-friendly and intuitive interface.
results_english: The study found that Sonora effectively reduced participants' anxiety and cognitive load. Users reported a notable improvement in emotional states and higher engagement levels. The intuitive interface and AI-driven content customization were highlighted as key factors in enhancing users' overall experiences, indicating the potential of Sonora for therapeutic use.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、3Dオーディオ世界の共創システムSonoraとその不安および認知負荷への影響を探求。
problem_japanese: 没入型3Dオーディオ体験設計の課題は、ユーザーの関与と認知負荷のバランスを取りながら、不安軽減の利点を考慮すること。既存システムは、往々にしてユーザーの労力と専門知識を多く要求し、直感的なインターフェースに欠ける。
method_japanese: SonoraはAIの支援で3Dオーディオ世界を共創し、機械学習で個人化した音響を生成。ユーザーのフィードバックを取り入れ、音響を調整しやすいインターフェースを提供。
results_japanese: Sonoraはユーザーの不安と認知負荷を効果的に軽減。感情状態の改善と関与の向上が報告され、直感的なインターフェースとAIによるコンテンツ調整が体験の向上に寄与。

title: TeamVision: An AI-powered Learning Analytics System for Supporting Reflection in Team-based Healthcare Simulation
authors: Echeverria, Vanessa and Zhao, Linxuan and Alfredo, Riordan and Milesi, Mikaela E and Jin, Yueqiao and Abel, Sophie and Fan, Jie Xiang and Yan, Lixiang and Dix, Samantha and Wotherspoon, Rosie and Li, Xinyu and Jaggard, Hollie A and Osborne, Abra and Buckingham Shum, Simon and Gasevic, Dragan and Martinez-Maldonado, Roberto
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TeamVision is an AI-powered system designed to support reflective learning in team-based healthcare simulations by providing analytics on team performance.
problem_english: Effective reflection in team-based healthcare simulations requires meaningful data on team dynamics. Traditional methods often fail to capture detailed insights, limiting the potential for reflective learning.
method_english: TeamVision uses AI to analyze data from healthcare simulations, providing visualizations and feedback on team dynamics and performance, facilitating effective reflective practices.
results_english: The system was found to significantly enhance reflective learning in healthcare simulations by offering comprehensive insights into team performance and dynamics, improving participants' reflective practices.
summary_japanese: TeamVisionはAIを用いてチーム医療シミュレーションの学習を支援するシステムで、チームのパフォーマンス分析を提供します。
problem_japanese: チーム医療シミュレーションでの有効な振り返りには、チームダイナミクスに関する意味のあるデータが必要ですが、従来の方法では詳細な洞察を得ることが難しく、学習の振り返りが制限されています。
method_japanese: TeamVisionはAIを活用し、チームダイナミクスとパフォーマンスに関する視覚化とフィードバックを提供し、振り返りの実践を促進します。
results_japanese: システムは、参加者の振り返り実践を向上させ、医療シミュレーションでの学習を大幅に強化することが確認されました。

title: The Interaction Layer: An Exploration for Co-Designing User-LLM Interactions in Parental Wellbeing Support Systems
authors: Viswanathan, Sruthi and Ibrahim, Seray and Shankar, Ravi and Binns, Reuben and Van Kleek, Max and Slovak, Petr
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates co-designing user-Large Language Model (LLM) interactions in parental wellbeing support systems, focusing on creating an 'Interaction Layer'.
problem_english: The challenge is in optimizing user-LLM interactions in parental wellbeing support systems, addressing a lack of understanding in designing intuitively navigable interfaces that facilitate effective, transparent communication between users and LLMs.
method_english: The method involves employing participatory design workshops with parents and experts to co-design interaction prototypes, using iterative feedback to refine the 'Interaction Layer' tailored for parental wellbeing scenarios.
results_english: The study uncovers various interaction design principles, emphasizing transparency and feedback mechanisms, with prototypes demonstrating improved user engagement and efficacy in navigating and utilizing wellbeing support systems.
summary_japanese: 親のウェルビーイング支援システムでのユーザーとLLMのインタラクション共設計を探求し、「インタラクションレイヤー」を開発。
problem_japanese: 親のウェルビーイング支援システムにおけるユーザーとLLMのインタラクションを最適化することが課題であり、直感的に操作しやすいインターフェース設計の理解が不足している。
method_japanese: 親と専門家による共設計ワークショップを実施し、参加型デザインでインタラクションプロトタイプを開発し、逐次フィードバックで「インタラクションレイヤー」を改良。
results_japanese: 透明性とフィードバックメカニズムを重視したデザイン原則が示され、プロトタイプは支援システムのユーザー参加および利用効果の向上を示した。

title: Understanding Adolescents' Perceptions of Benefits and Risks in Health AI Technologies through Design Fiction
authors: Lee, Jamie and Jung, Kyuha and Newman, Erin Gregg and Chow, Emilie and Chen, Yunan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores adolescents' views on the benefits and risks of health AI technologies through design fiction. It aims to understand their perceptions to inform better future designs.
problem_english: Adolescents' perspectives on health AI technologies are not well-understood. This gap can hinder the development of technologies that effectively address their unique needs and concerns, impacting the relevance and safety of these solutions for younger populations.
method_english: The authors used design fiction as a qualitative research method. This approach involved creating speculative narratives around health AI technologies and engaging adolescents in discussion sessions to understand their perceptions of benefits, risks, and ethical concerns surrounding these technologies.
results_english: The findings revealed that adolescents are both curious and concerned about AI in healthcare. Participants often voiced worries about privacy, data security, and autonomy while seeing potential in personalization and improved health management. Insights will assist in tailoring user-centered health AI innovations.
summary_japanese: 研究は、デザインフィクションを通じて健康AI技術の利点とリスクに対する青年の見解を探ります。
problem_japanese: 青少年の健康AI技術に対する視点は十分に理解されていません。このギャップは、彼らの独自のニーズと懸念を効果的に解決する技術の開発を妨げ、若い世代における問題の関連性と安全性に影響を与える可能性があります。
method_japanese: 著者はデザインフィクションを質的研究手法として使用しました。この手法では、健康AI技術に関する架空のシナリオを作成し、青年たちとのディスカッションを通じて利点、リスク、倫理的懸念に対する認識を理解しました。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、青年が医療におけるAIに対して好奇心と不安を抱いていることを示しました。プライバシーやデータセキュリティ、自律性に対する懸念を表明しつつ、個別対応や健康管理の改善に可能性を見出していました。

title: “A Bridge to Nowhere”: A Healthcare Case Study for Non-Reformist Design
authors: Huber, Linda
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: A healthcare case study explores 'non-reformist' design, emphasizing designing systems that embrace ambiguity and resist traditional reform frameworks.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of designing healthcare systems that often conform to existing structures. These systems lack flexibility and fail to accommodate diverse needs, resulting in inadequate care delivery. Conventional reform strategies typically impose rigid standards, inhibiting creative solutions.
method_english: The study employs a 'non-reformist' design approach by engaging stakeholders in participatory design sessions. These focus on understanding the complexities of healthcare environments and embrace ambiguous needs. Interdisciplinary collaboration and iterative feedback loops are emphasized to co-create adaptable solutions.
results_english: The results indicate that non-reformist design methods enable more adaptable healthcare systems by fostering inclusion and flexibility. Participants reported increased satisfaction with solutions that better addressed specific local needs. The study recommends broader adoption for more responsive systems.
summary_japanese: 非改革的デザインの医療事例研究は、曖昧さを受け入れるシステム設計を探ります。
problem_japanese: 医療システム設計が現行構造に固執し柔軟性を欠くため、多様なニーズを満たせず不十分なケアとなる現状を解決することが課題である。従来の改革は独創的解決策を阻む。
method_japanese: 利害関係者を参加させたデザインセッションで非改革的デザインを採用。医療環境の複雑さを理解し、曖昧なニーズを受け入れる。
results_japanese: 非改革的手法は柔軟で包括的なシステムを実現し参加者満足度が向上。より応答性の高いシステム構築への採用を推奨。

title: CardioAI: A Multimodal AI-based System to Support Symptom Monitoring and Risk Prediction of Cancer Treatment-Induced Cardiotoxicity
authors: Wu, Siyi and Cao, Weidan and Fu, Shihan and Yao, Bingsheng and Yang, Ziqi and Yin, Changchang and Mishra, Varun and Addison, Daniel and Zhang, Ping and Wang, Dakuo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CardioAI is a multimodal AI system designed to monitor symptoms and predict risks of cardiotoxicity caused by cancer treatments, integrating various clinical data sources for enhanced accuracy.
problem_english: Cardiotoxicity is a serious side effect of many cancer treatments, leading to severe cardiovascular complications. Current methods for monitoring and predicting these risks are limited and often inaccurate, necessitating improved predictive models integrating multiple data sources.
method_english: CardioAI employs a multimodal approach by integrating electronic health records, wearable device data, and patient-reported symptoms using machine learning algorithms to provide accurate cardiotoxicity risk assessments for cancer patients.
results_english: The study demonstrated that CardioAI significantly improved risk prediction accuracy compared to conventional models, by effectively integrating diverse data types, thus enhancing patient care through timely monitoring and intervention strategies.
summary_japanese: CardioAIは、がん治療による心毒性の症状監視とリスク予測を支援する多様な臨床データを統合したAIシステムです。
problem_japanese: 心毒性は多くのがん治療の重大な副作用であり、深刻な心血管障害を引き起こします。現在の監視および予測方法は制限があり、不正確であることが多く、複数のデータソースを統合した予測モデルの改善が必要です。
method_japanese: CardioAIは電子カルテ、ウェアラブルデバイスデータ、患者報告症状を機械学習アルゴリズムで統合し、がん患者への心毒性リスクの正確な評価を提供します。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、CardioAIは多様なデータを効果的に統合することで、従来モデルよりもリスク予測精度を大幅に向上させ、患者ケアの改善につながることが示されました。

title: Exploring the Design of LLM-based Agent in Enhancing Self-disclosure Among the Older Adults
authors: Guo, Yijie and Wang, Ruhan and Huang, Zhenhan and Jin, Tongtong and Yao, Xiwen and Feng, Yuan-Ling and Zhang, Weiwei and Yao, Yuan and Mi, Haipeng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how LLM-based agents can boost self-disclosure among older adults, revealing new design strategies for enhancing digital interaction.
problem_english: Older adults often face challenges in self-disclosure, which can affect their mental well-being and social connections. Current digital tools do not adequately support this demographic in sharing personal information.
method_english: The researchers employed a design research methodology to create and evaluate a large language model-based agent, focusing on its capacity to facilitate self-disclosure among older adults via iterative testing and user feedback.
results_english: The study found that the LLM-based agent significantly improved self-disclosure among older adults by providing personalized, empathetic interactions, leading to enhanced user satisfaction and engagement.
summary_japanese: 本研究はLLMエージェントが高齢者の自己開示を促進し、新たなデザイン戦略を明らかにしました。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は自己開示に困難を感じることが多く、これが精神的健康や社会的つながりに影響を及ぼします。現行のデジタルツールは十分に支援できていません。
method_japanese: 研究者は、設計研究手法を用い、高齢者の自己開示を促進するLLMエージェントを開発し、反復テストとユーザーフィードバックを通じて評価しました。
results_japanese: LLMエージェントは、高齢者に対しパーソナルかつ共感的な応答を提供することで、自己開示の向上に寄与しました。

title: Exploring the Effects of Social VR Coupling Modes on Engagement and Task Performance for Older Adults
authors: Vo, Thuan T and Das, Satabdi and Noroozi, Shamim and Dang, Lakshay and Sin, Jaisie and Boger, Jennifer N and Jakobi, Jennifer and Hasan, Khalad
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates how different social VR coupling modes affect engagement and task performance in older adults. This research aims to identify optimal VR settings for enhancing experiences and promoting active participation.
problem_english: Older adults often face challenges in technology engagement due to cognitive decline or unfamiliarity. Virtual Reality, an evolving technology, could enhance their engagement and task performance. However, it's unclear which social VR coupling modes best support older adults' interaction and participation.
method_english: Researchers conducted a controlled study with older adult participants, testing different VR coupling modes such as avatar-based interactions and direct user control. They evaluated engagement levels and task performance using standardized metrics, focusing on understanding the relationship between VR settings and participant responses.
results_english: The study found that certain VR coupling modes significantly improved engagement and task performance among older adults. Specifically, modes offering personalized interactions were more effective, highlighting the importance of customizable VR experiences to enhance older adults' participation and motivation.
summary_japanese: この研究は、異なるソーシャルVRカップリングモードが高齢者のエンゲージメントとタスクパフォーマンスに及ぼす影響を調査します。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は認知機能の低下や技術への不慣れから、技術との関与が困難です。VRは関与とパフォーマンスを高める可能性がありますが、最適なソーシャルVRカップリングモードは不明です。
method_japanese: 高齢者参加者を対象にした制御スタディを実施、アバターを用いるなどの異なるVRカップリングモードをテストし、標準化された指標でエンゲージメントレベルとパフォーマンスを評価しました。
results_japanese: 特定のVRカップリングモードが高齢者のエンゲージメントとタスクパフォーマンスを大幅に向上させ、個別化されたインタラクションがより効果的であることが明らかになりました。

title: From Concept to Clinic: Multidisciplinary Design, Development, and Clinical Validation of Augmented Reality-Assisted Open Pancreatic Surgery
authors: Javaheri, Hamraz and Ghamarnejad, Omid and Lukowicz, Paul and Stavrou, Gregor A and Karolus, Jakob
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces an augmented reality system for assisting open pancreatic surgery, focusing on multidisciplinary design, development, and clinical validation to improve surgical precision and patient outcomes.
problem_english: Open pancreatic surgeries are complex, posing risks to patients due to the intricate anatomy and the challenges in accessing tumors. Current imaging techniques do not provide real-time guidance, leading to potential errors and complications during surgery.
method_english: The research team developed an augmented reality system using multidisciplinary approaches, including computer vision, hardware engineering, and clinical expertise. They integrated real-time imaging and visualization tools to guide surgeons during open pancreatic surgery and validated the system's effectiveness in clinical settings.
results_english: Clinical validation showed that the augmented reality system significantly improved surgical precision, reduced operation times, and minimized complications. Surgeons reported enhanced tumor localization and increased confidence during procedures, marking a substantial advancement in pancreatic surgery techniques.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、拡張現実システムを用いた膵臓手術支援の多分野設計、開発、臨床評価を通じて、外科の精度と患者の転帰を改善することを紹介する。
problem_japanese: 開腹膵臓手術は複雑であり、解剖学的な難しさや腫瘍へのアクセスの課題から患者にリスクをもたらす。現在の画像技術ではリアルタイムのガイダンスが提供されず、手術中に誤りや合併症が生じる可能性がある。
method_japanese: 研究チームは、コンピュータビジョン、ハードウェア工学、臨床専門知識を統合した拡張現実システムを開発。リアルタイム画像と可視化ツールを統合し、開腹膵臓手術中の外科医を支援し、臨床で有効性を検証した。
results_japanese: 臨床検証によって拡張現実システムが外科の精度を大幅に向上させ、手術時間を短縮し、合併症を最小化することが示された。外科医は腫瘍の位置特定能力向上と手技中の自信増強を報告し、膵臓手術技術の重要な進歩が示された。

title: Promoting Cognitive Health in Elder Care with Large Language Model-Powered Socially Assistive Robots
authors: Lima, Maria R. and O'Connell, Amy and Zhou, Feiyang and Nagahara, Alethea and Hulyalkar, Avni and Deshpande, Anura and Thomason, Jesse and Vaidyanathan, Ravi and Matari\'{c}, Maja
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores using large language model-powered socially assistive robots to promote cognitive health in elder care, detailing their design, implementation, and evaluation.
problem_english: The cognitive health of elderly individuals is crucial yet often neglected in elder care settings.
