Traditional care methods lack personalized, engaging interactions necessary for cognitive stimulation, failing to address issues like social isolation, cognitive decline, and mental well-being in elderly populations.
method_english: The study involves the design and deployment of socially assistive robots powered by large language models, providing personalized cognitive engagement. The methodology includes developing task frameworks within the robots to facilitate natural conversations, monitor cognitive health, and adapt to individual needs.
results_english: Results indicate significant improvements in cognitive engagement and mental well-being among elder individuals interacting with the robots. The findings suggest these robots can be viable tools for enhancing cognitive health, reducing loneliness, and improving overall life satisfaction in eldercare environments.
summary_japanese: 大型言語モデル搭載のソーシャルアシストロボットが高齢者ケアでの認知健康を促進する取り組みを探求する。
problem_japanese: 高齢者ケアにおける認知健康は重要であるが、しばしば見過ごされがちである。従来のケア方法は、認知刺激に必要な個別対応やエンゲージメントに欠け、社会的孤立や認知機能低下、精神的健康を効果的に改善できていない。
method_japanese: 本研究は、大型言語モデルを搭載したソーシャルアシストロボットを用いて、個別に適応した自然な対話を通じて認知的エンゲージメントを促進する手法を検討する。
results_japanese: ロボットとの対話により高齢者の認知的エンゲージメントと精神的健康が向上することが確認された。高齢者ケアにおける認知健康の改善に有望な手段として、ロボットの可能性が示唆される。

title: The Role of ICT Tools through a Community Program Co-creation in a Japanese Aging Community
authors: Zhao, Jianrui and Chen, Dunya and Barbareschi, Giulia and Sato, Chihiro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the integration of ICT tools in co-creating community programs for aging populations in Japan, emphasizing enhancing social inclusion and quality of life.
problem_english: The challenge addressed in this study is the social isolation and decreased quality of life faced by aging populations in Japanese communities. By leveraging ICT tools, the research aims to foster meaningful connections and support systems to enhance social inclusion and well-being among older adults.
method_english: A participatory design approach was employed, involving community stakeholders in the co-creation process of community programs. ICT tools were integrated as part of interactive workshops and collaborative sessions to facilitate communication, engagement, and program development tailored to elderly needs.
results_english: The study found that integrating ICT tools within community programs significantly improved elderly participants' social connectedness and engagement. It highlighted increased enthusiasm and participation rates, revealing the importance of customized ICT solutions in addressing social and participatory challenges among aging communities.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、日本の高齢化コミュニティでのICTツールの統合が社会的包摂と生活の質向上にどう寄与するかを探る。
problem_japanese: 本研究が取り組む課題は、日本の高齢化コミュニティでの社会的孤立と生活の質の低下である。ICTツールを活用して、高齢者の社会的包摂と福祉を向上させるための有意義なつながりと支援体制を形成することを目指す。
method_japanese: 参加型デザインアプローチを採用し、コミュニティ関係者を巻き込んでプログラムを共創。ICTツールを活用したワークショップやセッションで、高齢者ニーズに応じたコミュニケーションとプログラム開発を支援。
results_japanese: 研究では、コミュニティプログラムにICTツールを組み込むことで高齢者の社会的つながりと参加が大幅に向上することが示された。カスタマイズされたICTソリューションの重要性を明らかにした。

title: Towards Hormone Health: An Autoethnography of Long-Term Holistic Tracking to Manage PCOS
authors: Kang, Daye and Li, Jingjin and Leshed, Gilly and Rzeszotarski, Jeffrey M and Lu, Xi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores holistic tracking as a method for managing PCOS through autoethnography. The authors detail experiences over time to assess effectiveness in hormone health.
problem_english: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) affects many women worldwide, leading to hormonal imbalances and various symptoms. Traditional medical approaches may not fully address individual needs, requiring holistic, personalized management strategies.
method_english: The authors employed autoethnography to conduct long-term holistic tracking of their own experiences with PCOS. This included documenting practices around diet, exercise, and lifestyle modifications to evaluate their impact on hormonal health.
results_english: Long-term holistic tracking provided valuable insights into managing PCOS. Participants observed improved hormonal balance and overall well-being, suggesting personalized approaches could complement traditional medical treatments.
summary_japanese: この研究は自己民族誌を通じてPCOS管理のためのホリスティックトラッキングを探求し、著者の経験を通じてその健康への効果を評価します。
problem_japanese: 多くの女性が世界的にPCOSに苦しんでおり、ホルモンの不均衡や多様な症状をもたらします。伝統的な医療アプローチは個々のニーズに完全に対処せず、ホリスティックで個別化された管理戦略が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者は自己民族誌を利用してPCOSに対する自身の経験を長期的にホリスティックな形で追跡しました。食事、運動、ライフスタイルの変更に関する実践を記録し、そのホルモン健康への影響を評価しました。
results_japanese: 長期的なホリスティックトラッキングはPCOS管理に貴重な洞察を提供しました。参加者はホルモンのバランスと全体的な健康の改善を観察し、個別の方法が伝統的な治療を補完する可能性を示唆しています。

title: Beyond Bridging Divides: Examining the Goals of Digital Inclusion Practice in Post-Digital Societies
authors: Parnaby, Adam W and Kharrufa, Ahmed and Crivellaro, Clara
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates digital inclusion goals in post-digital societies, arguing for a nuanced understanding beyond simple access divides. It explores the implications for individuals and communities in engaging with technology meaningfully.
problem_english: The study addresses the limitations of traditional digital inclusion efforts that focus primarily on bridging access gaps. In post-digital societies, where technology is ubiquitous, it is crucial to reassess the goals of digital inclusion to ensure individuals and communities engage meaningfully and beneficially with digital technologies.
method_english: The authors use a qualitative research methodology, conducting interviews and workshops with stakeholders involved in digital inclusion initiatives. They analyze these interactions to identify key themes and insights that can inform a revised approach to digital inclusion in post-digital contexts.
results_english: The findings reveal that mere access to technology does not guarantee meaningful engagement. Instead, digital inclusion initiatives should prioritize factors like digital literacy, empowerment, and community-specific needs to enhance the beneficial use of technology in post-digital societies.
summary_japanese: 本論文はポストデジタル社会におけるデジタル包摂の目的を探り、単なるアクセスの格差解消を超えた理解を提唱します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、主にアクセス格差解消に焦点を当てた従来のデジタル包摂努力の限界に対処します。技術があまねく普及するポストデジタル社会では、デジタル技術との有意義な関わりを保証するために、目的を再評価することが重要です。
method_japanese: 著者は質的研究手法を用いて、デジタル包摂イニシアチブに関与するステークホルダーへのインタビューやワークショップを行い、ポストデジタル文脈でのデジタル包摂への新しいアプローチを導く重要なテーマや洞察を分析します。
results_japanese: 単なる技術へのアクセスでは有意義な関わりが保証されないことが明らかになりました。デジタル包摂イニシアチブは、デジタルリテラシーやエンパワーメント、コミュニティ固有のニーズを優先し、ポストデジタル社会における技術の有益な利用を強化すべきです。

title: D-Twins: Your Digital Twin Designed for Real-Time Boredom Intervention
authors: Lo, I-Chen and Rau, Pei-Luen Patrick
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses D-Twins, a digital twin design for real-time boredom intervention, enhancing user engagement and satisfaction through personalized experiences.
problem_english: The issue addressed is the prevalent challenge of user boredom in digital environments, which negatively impacts user engagement and productivity. Existing solutions lack real-time adaptive interventions that cater to individual user needs, resulting in limited effectiveness in sustaining user interest and increasing satisfaction. The paper aims to develop a method that provides timely and personalized interactions to combat this problem.
method_english: The study introduces D-Twins, a system that utilizes machine learning algorithms to analyze user behavior in real-time. The system is designed to detect signs of boredom and dynamically adjust digital content or activities to re-engage users. D-Twins continuously learns and adapts to individual preferences, creating a tailored experience that aligns with user interests and moods.
results_english: Results indicate that D-Twins successfully enhances user engagement by reducing the frequency and duration of boredom episodes in digital environments. User satisfaction improved as the system provided timely and context-specific interventions. Empirical evaluations demonstrated that the personalized approach effectively maintained user interest, showing potential for broader applications in various digital platforms.
summary_japanese: 本研究はD-Twinsというリアルタイム退屈介入を実現するデジタルツインの設計について述べ、個別体験でユーザーエンゲージメントを向上させます。
problem_japanese: デジタル環境におけるユーザーの退屈という課題が、エンゲージメントや生産性の低下を招いています。既存の解決策はリアルタイムで適応的な介入が不足し、個々のユーザーの関心を持続させる効果が限られています。本研究は、この問題に対処するためタイムリーかつパーソナライズされたインタラクションを提供する手法の開発を目指します。
method_japanese: D-Twinsは機械学習アルゴリズムを用い、ユーザーの行動をリアルタイムで分析します。退屈の兆候を検出し、デジタルコンテンツや活動を動的に調整して再エンゲージします。D-Twinsは、ユーザーの興味や気分に合わせて継続的に学習し、個別最適化された体験を提供します。
results_japanese: 結果として、D-Twinsはデジタル環境での退屈エピソードの頻度と期間を減少させ、ユーザーのエンゲージメントを向上させました。ユーザーの満足度は時間的かつコンテキストに応じた介入により改善され、個別化されたアプローチが利用者の関心を効果的に維持できることが実証されました。

title: Digital Archives, Knowledge Conflicts, and Epistemic Injustices in the Himalayas
authors: Chauhan, Aarjav and Soden, Robert
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores digital archives in the Himalayas, focusing on knowledge conflicts and epistemic injustices experienced by indigenous and local communities.
problem_english: The study investigates how digital archives contribute to knowledge conflicts in the Himalayas, leading to epistemic injustices for indigenous communities whose knowledge systems are marginalized by dominant archival practices.
method_english: The authors employ ethnographic research and participatory workshops with Himalaya communities, analyzing interactions with digital archives to identify aspects of differentiation in knowledge representation and access.
results_english: Findings indicate digital archives often fail to represent indigenous knowledge accurately, worsening epistemic injustices. Collaborative archiving approaches can mitigate these issues by including local voices in knowledge documentation.
summary_japanese: 本研究はヒマラヤのデジタルアーカイブを調査し、知識の対立と先住民が経験する認識的不正について考察する。
problem_japanese: 先住民の知識システムが支配的なアーカイブの実践によって周縁化されるため、ヒマラヤでの知識の対立と認識的不正を引き起こすデジタルアーカイブの役割を探求する。
method_japanese: 著者はエスノグラフィック調査と参加型ワークショップを用いて、地域とのデジタルアーカイブの相互作用を分析し、知識の表現とアクセスの違いを特定する。
results_japanese: デジタルアーカイブはしばしば先住民の知識を正確に表現できず、認識的不正を悪化させる。地元の声を含めた共同アーカイブがこれらの問題を軽減可能である。

title: Digital Legacy Systems for Young Adults: Emphasizing Relationship-Oriented Perspectives and Physical Artifacts in Death Preparation
authors: Kwon, Soonho and Jo, Hyunah and Ryu, Sohee and Do, Jihwan Ryan and Lee, HwaJung and Lee, JooHyun and Lee, Keeheon and Kang, Younah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores digital legacy systems for young adults, focusing on relationship-oriented perspectives and physical artifacts in death preparation. It investigates how these systems can enable meaningful connections.
problem_english: Young adults often overlook death preparation despite its importance. Current digital legacy systems do not adequately address their relational needs, nor emphasize physical artifacts that can foster meaningful interactions.
method_english: The authors conducted a user study involving young adults to gather insights into their preferences and expectations for digital legacy systems, emphasizing relationship-oriented perspectives and how physical artifacts aid meaningful connections.
results_english: Findings revealed young adults value relationship-oriented digital legacy systems, desiring meaningful connections through physical artifacts in death preparation. The study highlights the need for systems addressing relational needs.
summary_japanese: 若年成人向けのデジタル遺産システムを、関係性重視の視点と物理的遺物強調で探る。これらが意味ある関係を如何に形成するかを調査。
problem_japanese: 若年成人は死への準備を重要視せず、現行デジタル遺産システムは関係性や物理的遺物の強調が不十分で、意味ある交流を促進できていない。
method_japanese: 若年成人を対象にユーザー研究を行い、デジタル遺産システムに期待する関係性重視の視点や物理的遺物が関係構築に如何に役立つかの洞察を収集。
results_japanese: 若年成人は関係重視のデジタル遺産システムを価値あると捉え、物理的遺物を通じた意味のある繋がりを望んでいる。関係性のニーズを満たすシステムが求められている。

title: Digital Play in Nature: A Study of Digital Play Installations from a Nature Play Perspective
authors: Waern, Annika and M\r{a}rtensson, Fredrika and Back, Jon and Litsmark, Anna and Salln\"{a}s Pysander, Eva-Lotta
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: A study explores digital play installations integrated with nature play environments. The research focuses on understanding how technology influences traditional outdoor play and impacts children's engagement with nature.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is understanding how digital play installations in natural environments affect children's interactions and engagement with nature. It explores the balance between technology and traditional nature play, assessing potential impacts on children's play experiences.
method_english: The research utilizes observational studies and interviews with children, parents, and professionals in nature play environments. It examines various digital installations, assessing their influence on children's natural play patterns and interaction with the environment.
results_english: The study finds digital installations can enhance children's engagement with nature, offering new play possibilities. However, it emphasizes the need for careful design to avoid distracting from the natural environment and ensure a balanced play experience.
summary_japanese: 自然遊び環境に組み込まれたデジタル遊び設備の影響を調査し、子供の自然との関わりを探る研究。
problem_japanese: 自然環境におけるデジタル遊び設備が子供の自然との関わりと遊び方にどのように影響するかを理解する課題を探求。技術と従来の自然遊びのバランス、遊び体験への影響を評価。
method_japanese: 観察研究と子供、親、自然遊びの専門家へのインタビューを用いて、様々なデジタル設備の影響を調査し、自然遊びパターンへの影響を検証。
results_japanese: デジタル設備が自然への関与を促進可能であるが、自然環境からの気を散らさない設計と遊びのバランスが重要と強調。

title: Play It Till You Make It: The Potential of Playful Role Enactment to Foster Digital Agency
authors: Bertel, Diotima and Himmelsbach, Julia and Schwarz, Stephanie and Sellitsch, David and Wildmann, Andreas and Schm\"{o}lz, Alexander and Tscheligi, Manfred
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates how playful role enactment can enhance digital agency. The authors explore interactive methods to empower individuals, emphasizing creativity and engagement. Through theoretical and practical frameworks, they aim to redefine digital interaction spaces, fostering autonomy and competence in users.
problem_english: Digital tools and environments often limit individuals' ability to act autonomously and creatively, leading to restricted digital agency. The challenge is how to encourage active engagement and foster a sense of empowerment that enables users to navigate and utilize digital spaces effectively.
method_english: The authors employed a mixed-methods approach combining theoretical exploration with practical interventions. Through workshops, simulations, and interactive activities, participants engaged in playful role enactment. This cultivated creativity and autonomy, facilitating a deeper understanding of digital environments and enhancing digital agency.
results_english: Results indicated that playful role enactment significantly improved users' sense of digital agency. Participants reported increased confidence and competence within digital spaces, exhibiting greater creativity and autonomy. These outcomes suggest that such interactive methodologies can effectively enhance digital empowerment.
summary_japanese: 本研究は遊び心のある役割遂行がデジタルエージェンシーを向上させる方法を探求します。創造性と関与を強調し、デジタルインタラクションの空間を再定義することを目指しています。
problem_japanese: デジタルツールや環境はしばしば個人の自主性や創造性を制限し、デジタルエージェンシーを阻害します。ユーザーがデジタル空間を効果的に利用し、ナビゲートする力をどのように促進するかが課題です。
method_japanese: 理論的探究と実践的介入を組み合わせた混合手法を使用。参加者はワークショップ、シミュレーション、インタラクティブ活動を通じて遊び心のある役割遂行を行い、創造性と自主性を育むことでデジタル環境の理解を深めました。
results_japanese: 遊び心のある役割遂行によりユーザーのデジタルエージェンシーが大幅に改善。参加者はデジタル空間での自信と能力が向上し、創造性と自主性を示しました。これらの方法論がデジタルエンパワーメントを促進することが示唆されています。

title: Savouring Slow Gifts: Reflection from the Field Study of Hybrid Gifting
authors: Kwon, Hyosun and Benford, Steve David and Koleva, Boriana
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores hybrid gifting through a field study, focusing on 'slow gifts' that emphasize reflection and savoring. It highlights the challenges and opportunities these gifts present for meaningful and thoughtful exchanges.
problem_english: The research investigates the challenges and opportunities of hybrid gifting, particularly focusing on 'slow gifts' that require reflection and savoring. It aims to uncover how these gifts influence meaningful exchanges and address potential issues in their integration with digital systems.
method_english: A field study involving hybrid gifting practices was conducted, focusing on slow gifts that require savoring and reflection. Participants engaged in gifting scenarios to explore the interactions between digital systems and slow gift practices, providing insights on the integration challenges.
results_english: The study found that slow gifts facilitated deeper reflection and meaningful exchanges. However, integrating them with digital systems posed challenges, including preserving the slow nature of gifts and managing expectations. Opportunities for enhancing such gifting experiences through design emerged.
summary_japanese: 「スローギフト」の反映に焦点を当てたハイブリッドギフトのフィールド研究を通じて、意味深い贈り物の交換のための課題と機会を探求します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、反映と味わいを必要とする「スローギフト」に焦点を当てたハイブリッドギフトの課題と機会を調査し、デジタルシステムとの統合における問題に対処することを目指します。
method_japanese: 参加者がギフトシナリオに参加し、デジタルシステムとスローギフトの慣習との相互作用を探求するフィールド研究を実施し、統合の課題に関する洞察を提供します。
results_japanese: 研究はスローギフトがより深い反映と意味深い交換を促進することを明示しましたが、デジタルシステムとの統合には贈り物のゆっくりとした性質を維持することや期待の管理の課題があります。設計による贈答体験の向上の機会が見出されました。

title: From Camera-Eye to AI: Exploring the Interplay of Cinematography and Computational Visual Storytelling
authors: Halperin, Brett A. and Lukin, Stephanie M.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the symbiotic relationship between cinematography and computational visual storytelling, focusing on AI's role in enhancing narrative techniques in film and media.
problem_english: There's a gap in understanding how traditional cinematographic techniques can be integrated with AI-driven storytelling. This paper addresses the challenge of synergizing creative elements of film production with advanced computational methods.
method_english: The authors employ a mixed-method approach, combining qualitative analysis of film techniques with quantitative models of AI-driven narration. They explore machine learning algorithms that replicate and innovate visual storytelling aspects.
results_english: Findings reveal that AI can enhance narrative depth and visual composition in films, offering new creative possibilities for filmmakers. Successful integration relies on balancing computational efficiency with artistic authenticity.
summary_japanese: 論文は、映画とメディアでのAIが物語技法を向上させる役割に焦点を当て、シネマトグラフィーと計算的視覚物語の関係を探ります。
problem_japanese: 従来の映画技術とAIによる物語をどう統合するか未解明です。この論文は、映画制作の創造的要素と高度な計算手法の相乗効果の課題に取り組みます。
method_japanese: 著者は質的分析とAI駆動のナレーションを行う定量モデルを組み合わせた混合手法を採用し、機械学習アルゴリズムで視覚物語を探求します。
results_japanese: AIは映画での物語の深みと視覚構成を強化し、新たな創造可能性を提供します。成功は計算効率と芸術的信憑性のバランスに依存します。

title: From Words to Wonder: Designing and Evaluating an AI-Empowered Creative Storytelling System for Elementary Children
authors: Fan, Min and Cui, Xinyue and Ma, Wanqing and Li, Haiyan and Tong, Xin and Yang, Lin and Wang, Yonghui
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents an AI-empowered storytelling system designed for elementary children, assisting them in creating diverse narratives and evaluating its effectiveness in enhancing creativity.
problem_english: Children often struggle with constructing meaningful stories due to limited vocabulary, imagination, and structuring skills. This study addresses the need for tools that can foster creativity and storytelling skills in young learners effectively.
method_english: Researchers developed an AI-driven storytelling system which guides children through interactive story creation, providing prompts, suggestions, and feedback using natural language processing algorithms to enhance engagement and creativity.
results_english: The study found significant improvements in children's storytelling skills, including narrative diversity and creativity. The feedback from educators and participants highlighted the system's effectiveness in engaging young learners actively.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、小学生の創造性向上を支援するAI活用のストーリーテリングシステムを提供し、その有効性を評価しています。
problem_japanese: 子供たちは限られた語彙、想像力、構造化スキルのため、意味ある物語を構築するのが苦手です。この研究は、若い学習者の創造性を効果的に育むツールの必要性に対処します。
method_japanese: 研究者は、児童がインタラクティブな物語を作成する際に、プロンプト、提案、フィードバックを提供する自然言語処理アルゴリズムを用いたAI駆動のストーリーテリングシステムを開発しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、物語の多様性や創造性を含む児童のストーリーテリング能力の大幅な向上を発見しました。また、教育者と参加者からのフィードバックで子供たちの積極的な関与を促すシステムの有効性が確認されました。

title: Generative AI in Documentary Photography: Exploring Opportunities and Challenges for Visual Storytelling
authors: Martinez, Lenny and Caramiaux, Baptiste and Fdili Alaoui, Sarah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the role of generative AI in documentary photography, highlighting its potential to enhance visual storytelling and presenting the challenges it poses regarding authenticity and ethical considerations.
problem_english: The introduction of generative AI in documentary photography raises concerns about the authenticity of images and the ethical implications of altering real-life depictions. There is a need to evaluate how these technologies impact the credibility of visual storytelling and influence the perception of reality in documentary works.
method_english: The authors conducted a qualitative study involving interviews with professional photographers and AI experts to understand the implications of generative AI on documentary photography. They explored how AI tools can be used to augment storytelling while maintaining ethical standards and preserving the authenticity of visual narratives.
results_english: The study reveals a divide among photographers regarding the acceptance of AI in documentary photography. While some see potential in enhancing creativity and engagement, others worry about misleading audiences. The authors propose guidelines to balance AI-driven creativity with ethical storytelling, ensuring both innovation and authenticity.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、生成AIがドキュメンタリー写真で果たす役割を探り、ビジュアルストーリーテリングの向上と真実性および倫理的課題を示します。
problem_japanese: ドキュメンタリー写真における生成AIの導入は、画像の真実性と現実の描写の倫理的影響に懸念をもたらしており、これらの技術がビジュアルストーリーテリングの信頼性や現実の認識にどのように影響するかの評価が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者らはプロの写真家やAI専門家へのインタビューを含む定性的研究を実施し、生成AIがドキュメンタリー写真に与える影響を調査しました。AIツールがストーリーテリングを強化しつつ、倫理基準を維持し視覚物語の真実性を保つ方法を探りました。
results_japanese: 研究は、AIのドキュメンタリー写真への受け入れに関する写真家間の意見の対立を示しています。創造性と関与を高める可能性を見出す一方で、観衆を誤解させることを懸念する声もあります。著者は、AI主導の創造性と倫理的ストーリーテリングを両立するガイドラインを提案しました。

title: Micro-narratives: A Scalable Method for Eliciting Stories of People’s Lived Experience
authors: Skeggs, Amira and Mehta, Ashish and Yap, Valerie and Ibrahim, Seray B and Rhodes, Charla and Gross, James J. and Munson, Sean A. and Klasnja, Predrag and Orben, Amy and Slovak, Petr
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces micro-narratives, a scalable method for gathering people's lived experiences. This method effectively captures online narratives while ensuring scalable data collection and analysis.
problem_english: Many existing methods for collecting qualitative data about people's experiences are often resource-intensive, time-consuming, and not easily scalable, limiting researchers' ability to gather comprehensive data across diverse populations.
method_english: The micro-narratives method involves collecting short, focused narratives from individuals about their experiences. This hybrid approach allows researchers to efficiently gather qualitative data online, integrating scalable data collection and automated analysis tools.
results_english: The study found that micro-narratives successfully captured diverse personal experiences, providing rich qualitative insights. This method proved to be scalable and efficient, allowing for extensive data collection while maintaining the depth of traditional qualitative research.
summary_japanese: マイクロナラティブは、人々の体験談を集めるためのスケーラブルな手法として効果的なデータ収集を可能にします。
problem_japanese: 既存の質的データ収集手法はリソース集約的で時間を要し、スケールしにくいため、研究者が多様な人口で包括的なデータ収集を困難にします。
method_japanese: マイクロナラティブ法は、個人の体験に関する短く焦点を絞ったナラティブを集めます。オンラインで効率的に質的データを収集し、分析可能にする手法です。
results_japanese: この手法は多様な体験を捉え、豊かな質的インサイトを提供しました。スケーラブルかつ効率的で、従来の質的研究の深さを維持しつつ広範なデータ収集が可能でした。

title: Toyteller: AI-powered Visual Storytelling Through Toy-Playing with Character Symbols
authors: Chung, John Joon Young and Roemmele, Melissa and Kreminski, Max
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Toyteller presents an AI-driven system that facilitates storytelling through toy-playing. Character symbols are used to generate narrative sequences, allowing users to engage in creative and interactive storytelling experiences.
problem_english: Storytelling is a creative activity that can benefit from fostering imaginative play. Traditional storytelling methods may limit interaction and creativity. There is a demand for systems that can enhance storytelling through playful experiences, integrating tangible elements like toys.
method_english: Toyteller integrates AI with physical interaction using toys. Character symbols on toys are detected and interpreted by the system to generate narrative sequences. Users can manipulate toys to alter stories, promoting dynamic storytelling experiences.
results_english: Toyteller demonstrated improved user engagement and creativity in storytelling practices. The system allowed users to create more interwoven narrative structures and showed potential in expanding the scope of interactive storytelling. Users reported satisfaction in controlling the narrative.
summary_japanese: ToytellerはAI駆動のシステムで、おもちゃ遊びを通じた物語創作を支援し、キャラクターシンボルにより物語を生成します。
problem_japanese: 創造的な活動である物語創作は、伝統的手法だとインタラクションや創造性が制約されがちで、物理的な要素を取り入れながら物語創作を強化するシステムが求められている。
method_japanese: ToytellerはAIとおもちゃを用いた物理的インタラクションを統合します。キャラクターシンボルを検出・解釈し、ユーザーが物語を変更できるインタラクティブな物語創作を促進します。
results_japanese: Toytellerはユーザーの創造性や物語への関与を向上させ、語りの満足感を向上させる結果を示し、インタラクティブな物語創作の可能性を拡大しました。

title: TravelGalleria: Supporting Remembrance and Reflection of Travel Experiences through Digital Storytelling in Virtual Reality
authors: Yin, Michael and Xiao, Robert
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TravelGalleria uses digital storytelling in VR to enhance the remembrance and reflection of travel experiences, offering a novel and immersive approach for users to relive their travel memories.
problem_english: Traditional methods of reminiscing travel experiences such as photos and videos lack interactivity and immersive qualities, making it difficult for users to fully relive and reflect on their travel memories in a meaningful and engaging manner.
method_english: TravelGalleria employs virtual reality technology combined with digital storytelling to create a rich and immersive environment. Users can interact with personalized travel narratives, enhancing their ability to relive and reflect on past travel experiences.
results_english: TravelGalleria was positively received by users who found the immersive storytelling approach highly engaging and effective in enabling a deeper reflection and remembrance of their travel experiences compared to traditional media.
summary_japanese: TravelGalleriaは、VRでのデジタルストーリーテリングを用いて旅行体験の記憶と振り返りを促進する没入型手法を提供します。
problem_japanese: 従来の写真や動画による旅行体験の振り返りは、インタラクティブ性や没入感に欠け、旅行の思い出を十分に追体験・反映することが困難です。
method_japanese: VR技術とデジタルストーリーテリングを用い、個別の旅行体験に基づく没入型環境を提供し、旅行の思い出を振り返りやすくします。
results_japanese: 利用者はTravelGalleriaの没入型ストーリーテリングを高評価し、従来の方法よりも深い旅行体験の振り返りが可能であると感じました。

title: WhatELSE: Shaping Narrative Spaces at Configurable Level of Abstraction for AI-bridged Interactive Storytelling
authors: Lu, Zhuoran and Zhou, Qian and Wang, Yi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces WhatELSE, a system that enables interactive storytelling at customizable abstraction levels, bridging AI technology with narrative spaces to enhance user experiences.
problem_english: Current interactive storytelling systems often lack flexibility in adjusting abstraction levels, limiting users' control over narrative depth and personalization, thus hindering seamless integration with advanced AI technologies.
method_english: WhatELSE offers modular narrative configurations, allowing users to adjust abstraction levels dynamically. The system integrates AI to bridge narrative elements, enhancing personalization and interactivity within digital storytelling environments.
results_english: The implementation of WhatELSE demonstrated improved user engagement and satisfaction. Users appreciated the ability to personalize narrative depth, resulting in richer, more immersive storytelling experiences facilitated by AI integration.
summary_japanese: この論文では、物語の抽象レベルを調整可能なWhatELSEを紹介し、AI技術で物語空間を橋渡しする。
problem_japanese: 現在のインタラクティブストーリーテリングシステムは抽象レベルの調整が難しく、物語の深さや個性化の制御が制限されており、AI技術のシームレスな統合が困難である。
method_japanese: WhatELSEは、モジュラー型の物語設定を提供し、ユーザーが抽象レベルを動的に調整可能で、AIと統合して物語要素を橋渡しし、個性化とインタラクティブ性を向上させる。
results_japanese: WhatELSEの実装によりユーザーエンゲージメントと満足度が向上し、AIとの統合によりパーソナライズされた豊かで没入的な物語体験が提供された。

title: "Is This Seat Accessible for Me?": An Autoethnography of a Person With a Mobility Disability Using Interactive Seat Plans for Public Events
authors: Strobel, Lukas and Gerling, Kathrin Maria and Rixen, Jan Ole
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the challenges faced by individuals with mobility disabilities when using interactive seat plans for public events through autoethnography.
problem_english: People with mobility disabilities often face barriers when trying to access seating information for public events. Interactive seating plans, while intended to aid in accessibility, can present unique challenges and inconsistencies that complicate the decision-making process for these individuals.
method_english: The authors employ autoethnography, a qualitative research method, to document and analyze personal experiences navigating interactive seat plans. This approach helps to highlight specific accessibility issues and inconsistencies within these systems faced by individuals with mobility impairments.
results_english: The study reveals that interactive seat plans often lack sufficient accessibility information and feature inconsistencies, making the seat selection process challenging for individuals with mobility disabilities. These findings indicate a need for improved design and standardized accessibility information.
summary_japanese: 移動障害者が公共イベントの座席図を利用する際の課題を自己民族誌で探究。
problem_japanese: 移動障害のある人々は、公共イベントでの座席情報の取得において障壁に直面します。インタラクティブな座席図はアクセシビリティを向上させるためのものですが、個人の意思決定を困難にする独自の課題や不整合を提示することがあります。
method_japanese: 自己民族誌という質的研究手法を用いて、インタラクティブな座席図を利用する際の個人的な体験を記録・分析し、移動障害者が直面する問題や不整合を明らかにします。
results_japanese: 研究では、インタラクティブな座席図が十分なアクセシビリティ情報を欠くこと、また不整合が多いことを明らかにし、座席選択が困難であることを示します。改善と標準化の必要性があります。

title: (Re)discovering Sexual Pleasure after Cancer: Understanding the Design Space
authors: Offerman, C\'{e}line and Bourgeois, Jacky and van Beurden, Jules and Bozzon, Alessandro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores the design space for rediscovering sexual pleasure after cancer, emphasizing the importance of tailored interventions and supportive technologies for individuals affected by cancer.
problem_english: Cancer treatments often impact sexual wellbeing, leaving many patients struggling with sexual pleasure and self-discovery post-treatment. Despite the significance, supportive design for facilitating sexual wellbeing in cancer survivors remains underexplored.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews with cancer survivors and healthcare professionals to gather insights on challenges. They used these findings to map the design space and identify potential technological interventions that address sexual wellbeing post-cancer.
results_english: Findings highlight diverse needs and challenges related to sexual pleasure post-cancer. Participants express a need for personalized solutions, indicating promising directions for technology-based interventions that cater to individual preferences and difficulties.
summary_japanese: 本研究はがん後の性的快楽の再発見に向けた設計空間を探求し、個別の支援が重要であることを強調しています。
problem_japanese: がん治療はしばしば性的健康に影響を与え、治療後の性的快楽の自己発見に苦しむ患者が多い。重要性にもかかわらず、がんサバイバーの性的健康を支援するデザインは十分に探求されていない。
method_japanese: 著者はがんサバイバーと医療専門家にインタビューを行い、課題に関する洞察を収集しました。これらの発見を使用して設計空間をマッピングし、がん後の性的健康を支援する潜在的な技術的介入を特定しました。
results_japanese: がん後の性的快楽に関連する多様なニーズと課題が明らかにされました。参加者は個別の解決策を求めており、個人の好みや困難に対応する技術ベースの介入の有望な方向性を示しています。

title: Behavior Change Interventions Combating Online Misinformation: A Scoping Review
authors: Konstantinou, Loukas and Karapanos, Evangelos
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper reviews behavior change interventions aimed at combating online misinformation, identifying effective strategies and gaps in current research. It provides a systematic overview of recent efforts in addressing misinformation through behavioral approaches.
problem_english: Digital misinformation poses significant challenges to public discourse and knowledge dissemination. Despite efforts to mitigate its impacts, effective interventions remain elusive, and understanding how behavioral strategies can be applied to combat online misinformation requires further exploration.
method_english: The authors conducted a scoping review, analyzing existing literature on behavior change interventions for misinformation. They categorized studies based on types of interventions, methodologies employed, and outcomes measured, to synthesize current findings and highlight effective practices.
results_english: The review identified effective interventions, such as educational campaigns, critical thinking enhancement, and social media regulation. However, the findings reveal gaps in empirical evaluations, particularly regarding long-term impacts and adaptation to rapidly changing misinformation tactics.
summary_japanese: オンラインの誤情報に対抗する行動変容介入をレビューし、効果的な戦略と研究の欠落を特定します。
problem_japanese: デジタル誤情報は公共の議論や知識の普及に大きな課題をもたらします。影響を緩和するための努力にもかかわらず、有効な介入は得難く、行動戦略の適用には更なる研究が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者は誤情報に対する行動変容介入の既存文献をスコープレビューで分析。介入タイプや方法、測定結果に基づき、現在の知見を整理し、有効な慣行を強調しました。
results_japanese: 教育キャンペーンなどの効果的な介入を特定しましたが、特に長期的影響と急速に変わる誤情報戦術への適応の実証評価に欠落があります。

title: Embracing Gender Diversity: Designing an Adaptive Pleasure Object for a Changing Body
authors: Regis, Valeria and Ferraro, Venere and Burzio, Giorgia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the design of adaptive pleasure objects that accommodate gender diversity and the evolving needs of individuals' bodies, promoting inclusive sexual wellness.
problem_english: Traditional pleasure objects often do not cater to the diverse needs of individuals, particularly those undergoing gender transitions or experiencing changes in their body. This lack of adaptability limits access to inclusive and fulfilling sexual wellness experiences for many people, highlighting the need for more responsive and personalized solutions in this domain.
method_english: The authors employ a user-centered design approach, involving individuals from diverse gender backgrounds in the development process. By conducting interviews, surveys, and prototype testing, the authors gather insights into user needs and preferences, which inform the design of an adaptable pleasure object capable of accommodating varying physical and emotional requirements over time.
results_english: The study results in the creation of a prototype that adjusts to diverse body changes and gender identities, offering enhanced user satisfaction and inclusivity. Feedback from participants indicates increased comfort and a more personalized experience, demonstrating the potential of adaptable design in enhancing sexual wellness across a spectrum of users.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、性の多様性と身体の変化に対応する適応的な快感製品の設計を探究し、包括的な性の健康を促進します。
problem_japanese: 従来の快感製品は、多様なニーズを持つ、特に性別移行中の個人や身体の変化を経験する人々に対応していないことが多いです。これにより、多くの人々が包括的で満足できる性的健康体験にアクセスできず、この分野におけるより反応的で個別化された解決策の必要性が浮き彫りになっています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、ユーザー中心設計を採用し、多様な性背景を持つ個人を開発プロセスに巻き込みます。インタビュー、調査、プロトタイプテストを通じて、ユーザーのニーズと希望を収集し、時と共に変化する身体的および感情的な要件に対応できる適応可能な快感製品の設計にこれを反映します。
results_japanese: 研究により、様々な身体変化と性同一性に調整可能なプロトタイプが作成され、ユーザーの満足度と包括性が向上しました。参加者からのフィードバックは、快適さの向上とより個別化された体験を示し、適応可能な設計が広範なユーザーの性の健康を向上させる可能性を示しています。

title: IncluSim: An Accessible Educational Electronic Circuit Simulator for Blind and Low-Vision Learners
authors: Mouallem, Aya and Mendez Pons, Mirelys and Malik, Ali and Rogando, Trini and Kim, Gene S-H and Kulkarni, Trisha and Chong, Charlene and Fan, Danyang and Patel, Shloke Nirav and Shluzas, Lauren Aquino and Chen, Helen L. and Sheppard, Sheri D.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: IncluSim is a simulation tool for blind and low-vision learners to learn electronic circuits. It aims to improve accessibility in engineering education by providing a user-friendly interface focusing on inclusivity.
problem_english: Engineering education materials, like electronic circuit simulators, often lack accessibility features for blind and low-vision learners. This limits their ability to fully participate in learning activities, hindering their educational advancement.
method_english: The IncluSim employs tactile and auditory feedback to facilitate electronic circuit simulation for blind and low-vision learners. The tool is designed with input from users to ensure accessibility and ease of use, incorporating elements that aid learning.
results_english: Initial evaluations suggest IncluSim significantly improves learning experiences and outcomes for blind and low-vision users. The tool successfully fills gaps in accessibility, providing a robust platform for studying electronic circuits effectively.
summary_japanese: IncluSimは視覚障害者向けの電子回路学習シミュレーターで、工学教育へのアクセスを向上させることを目指しています。
problem_japanese: 電子回路シミュレーターなどの工学教育素材は、視覚障害者に対するアクセシビリティ機能が不足しているため、学習活動への十分な参加が困難であり、教育の進展を妨げています。
method_japanese: IncluSimは視覚障害者向けに触覚と聴覚フィードバックを導入し、ユーザーの意見を取り入れた設計で学習を支援するアクセシブルな電子回路シミュレーションを提供します。
results_japanese: 初期評価でIncluSimは視覚障害者の学習体験と成果を大きく向上させることが示され、アクセシビリティのギャップを埋め、電子回路学習の効果的なプラットフォームを提供します。

title: Translation and Validation of The Video Game Demand Scale to Spanish
authors: Lee, Heejae and Dominguez Partida, Gabriel and Bowman, Nicholas David and Chauveau, Philippe de Villemor
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study translates and validates the Video Game Demand Scale into Spanish, aiming to facilitate its use for Spanish-speaking populations.
problem_english: Despite the widespread use of video games, certain populations lack access to precise and culturally relevant measures of user demand, such as the Video Game Demand Scale, highlighting the need for linguistic and cultural adaptation.
method_english: The study employed a multi-step approach involving translation, back-translation, expert reviews, and pilot testing to ensure cultural relevance and accuracy of the Video Game Demand Scale in Spanish.
results_english: The translated scale demonstrated strong reliability and validity, providing an effective tool for Spanish-speaking researchers to assess video game demand, aligning closely with the original scale's performance.
summary_japanese: ビデオゲーム需要尺度をスペイン語に翻訳・検証し、スペイン語圏の利用を促進。
problem_japanese: ビデオゲーム需要尺度のようなユーザー需要の正確で文化的に適切な指標が不足しているため、特定の人口層がアクセスできず、言語的・文化的適応が必要です。
method_japanese: 翻訳、逆翻訳、専門家レビュー、試験的テストを含む多段階アプローチを使用し、文化的関連性と正確性を確保しました。
results_japanese: 翻訳尺度は強固な信頼性と妥当性を示し、スペイン語圏の研究者へ有効な手段を提供し、元の尺度に近い性能を保持。

title: "We Have to Be Advocates for Ourselves": A Social-Ecological Approach to Mobile Health Design with Black Older Adults Living with Diabetes
authors: Baseman, Cynthia M and Dembure, Seka M and Arriaga, Rosa I
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores mobile health design for Black older adults with diabetes, using a social-ecological approach to improve health outcomes by fostering self-advocacy.
problem_english: Black older adults living with diabetes face significant health disparities and barriers to accessing appropriate care, partly due to systemic inequities and cultural insensitivity in traditional healthcare designs.
method_english: A social-ecological framework was employed to engage Black older adults in co-designing a mobile health intervention. This approach considered personal, social, and systemic factors to ensure culturally sensitive and accessible health care solutions.
results_english: The study found that incorporating cultural context and fostering self-advocacy in mobile health design significantly improved user engagement and health management in Black older adults with diabetes.
summary_japanese: 本研究は黒人高齢者の糖尿病患者に適したモバイル健康設計を探求し、社会生態学的アプローチで自己主張を促進します。
problem_japanese: 黒人高齢者の糖尿病患者は、システム的不平等と文化的無配慮が理由で、適切なケアへのアクセスに障壁があり健康格差が生じています。
method_japanese: 社会生態学的枠組みを用いて黒人高齢者を共創に巻き込み、個人的・社会的・システム的要因を考慮し、文化的に配慮されたモバイル健康介入策を設計しました。
results_japanese: 文化的文脈を取り入れ自己主張を促すモバイル健康設計が、黒人高齢の糖尿病患者のユーザーエンゲージメントと健康管理を大きく改善しました。

title: A Stakeholder Value Framework for Augmentative and Alternative Communication
authors: Zolyomi, Annuska and Koushik, Varsha and Asyet, Dinara and Huynh, Linh H
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a stakeholder value framework for augmentative and alternative communication, aiming to enhance communication tools and aid for individuals with communication disabilities.
problem_english: Current augmentative and alternative communication systems may not fully address the diverse needs and values of all stakeholders, including individuals with communication disabilities, caregivers, professionals, and technology developers.
method_english: The authors propose a multi-dimensional framework that incorporates stakeholder perspectives, focusing on value-sensitive design principles to ensure tailored enhancements and better communication outcomes for affected individuals.
results_english: The framework successfully identifies and integrates stakeholder values, promoting more inclusive and adaptive augmentative and alternative communication technologies that cater to broader individual needs and preferences.
summary_japanese: この論文は、コミュニケーション障害者に向けてコミュニケーションツールの改善を目指す、ステークホルダー価値フレームワークを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現在の拡張代替コミュニケーションシステムは、コミュニケーション障害者、介護者、専門家や技術開発者などのステークホルダーすべての多様なニーズと価値を完全に反映していない可能性があります。
method_japanese: 著者は、ステークホルダー視点を取り入れた多次元のフレームワークを提案し、価値に敏感なデザイン原則に基づいて影響を受ける個人への適切な改善を図ります。
results_japanese: このフレームワークは、ステークホルダーの価値を効果的に特定・統合し、より包括的で適応的なコミュニケーション技術の促進を実現します。

title: Designing for Difference: How We Learn to Stop Worrying and Love the Doppelganger
authors: Seberger, John S. and Gupta, Sanonda Datta
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the role of doppelgangers in user experience design, arguing for embracing differences to enhance system adaptability and user satisfaction.
problem_english: The challenge addressed in the paper is the proclivity of user experience design to homogenize user interaction, thus failing to accommodate varying user needs and backgrounds, leading to unsatisfactory user experiences.
method_english: The authors propose utilizing a doppelganger approach, creating virtual replicas of users that adapt and learn from diverse user inputs, thereby enabling more personalized and adaptable user interactions.
results_english: The study's findings indicate that embracing the doppelganger methodology significantly improves user satisfaction by facilitating systems that are more responsive and adaptable to individual user differences and preferences.
summary_japanese: 本論文はユーザーエクスペリエンス設計におけるドッペルゲンガーの役割を探り、システムの適応性とユーザー満足度を高めるための異なる視点の受容を提案します。
problem_japanese: この論文で取り上げられている課題は、ユーザーエクスペリエンス設計の傾向がユーザーの相互作用を均一化し、異なるユーザーのニーズや背景を満たせないことで、不満足なユーザーエクスペリエンスをもたらすことです。
method_japanese: 著者らはドッペルゲンガーアプローチを提案し、ユーザーの仮想レプリカを作成して多様な入力から学習し、より個別化された適応可能なユーザーインタラクションを可能にします。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、ドッペルゲンガー手法の受容により個々のユーザーの違いや好みに応じたシステムの応答性と適応性が向上し、ユーザー満足度が大幅に向上することを示しています。

title: Investigating the Intersection of Cultural Design Preferences and Web Accessibility Guidelines with Designers from the Global South
authors: Nourian, Laleh and Naikar, Vinaya Hanumant and Shinohara, Kristen and Tigwell, Garreth W.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores how cultural design preferences from the Global South intersect with existing web accessibility guidelines, aiming to enhance inclusivity in digital design.
problem_english: Many web accessibility guidelines prioritize perspectives from Western cultures, potentially neglecting cultural design preferences from the Global South. This misalignment impedes efforts to create universally inclusive digital environments, which could marginalize users from diverse cultural backgrounds.
method_english: Researchers used interviews and participatory design workshops with designers from the Global South. They analyzed cultural preferences and patterns, then compared these findings with current web accessibility guidelines to identify disparities and potential improvements.
results_english: Findings reveal significant discrepancies between cultural design preferences in the Global South and existing web accessibility guidelines. Recommendations include integrating local insights into global guidelines to enhance inclusivity without sacrificing cultural relevance.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、グローバルサウスの文化的デザインとウェブアクセシビリティガイドラインの交差を探り、デジタルデザインの包容性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 多くのウェブアクセシビリティガイドラインは西洋文化の視点を優先し、グローバルサウスの文化的デザインを考慮しないことがあります。このずれは普遍的に包括的なデジタル環境の構築を妨げ、多様な文化背景のユーザーを疎外する可能性があります。
method_japanese: 研究者はグローバルサウスのデザイナーとインタビューと参加型デザインワークショップを実施。文化的嗜好とパターンを分析し、既存のウェブアクセシビリティガイドラインと比較しました。
results_japanese: グローバルサウスの文化的デザイン嗜好と既存のウェブアクセシビリティガイドライン間に大きな乖離があることが判明。地域の知見をグローバルガイドラインに統合し、包容性を高めつつ文化的関連性を犠牲にしない推奨が提案されました。

title: Prestige and Prejudice: How the Interplay of Recruiting Work and Algorithms Reinforces Social Inequities in Software Engineering
authors: Biehl, Austin and Perez, Daniela and Ingle, Jessica and Ames, Morgan G.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper analyzes how recruitment practices and algorithms in software engineering perpetuate social inequalities, focusing on prestige biases and how they impact hiring and career advancement.
problem_english: The research identifies the issue of biases in recruitment algorithms exacerbating social inequities, particularly in software engineering. It highlights how these biases favor prestige over merit, reinforcing existing disparities in career opportunities and advancement.
method_english: The authors used a mixed-methods approach, combining qualitative interviews with recruiters and quantitative analysis of algorithmic recommendation systems used in software engineering hiring. They examined the interplay between human decisions and machine learning outcomes.
results_english: The study found that recruitment algorithms often prioritize candidates from prestigious backgrounds, thereby perpetuating inequities. It calls for critical evaluation of these systems to ensure fairer recruitment processes, suggesting changes to algorithm design and recruiter training.
summary_japanese: 本論文はソフトウェアエンジニアリングにおける採用活動とアルゴリズムがどのように社会的不平等を助長するかを分析します。
problem_japanese: この研究は採用アルゴリズムのバイアスが特にソフトウェアエンジニアリングにおいて社会的不平等を悪化させる問題を特定し、名声が才能よりも優先され、既存の職業機会と昇進の格差を強化していることを強調します。
method_japanese: 著者は質的インタビューとソフトウェアエンジニアリング採用で使用されるアルゴリズム推薦システムの定量分析を組み合わせた混合手法を使用しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、採用アルゴリズムが名門背景を優先する傾向があり、不平等を助長していることを明らかにしました。公平な採用プロセスのためのシステム評価の必要性を呼びかけています。

title: Sustaining Human Agency, Attending to Its Cost: An Investigation into Generative AI Design for Non-Native Speakers' Language Use
authors: Xiao, Yimin and Hancock, Cartor and Agrawal, Sweta and Mehandru, Nikita and Salehi, Niloufar and Carpuat, Marine and Gao, Ge
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the design of generative AI tools to support non-native speakers in language use while acknowledging the costs associated with maintaining human agency.
problem_english: The problem addressed in this paper is the challenge non-native speakers face in using generative AI tools for language tasks. These tools can undermine human agency by controlling language outputs, potentially suppressing individual expression and linguistic diversity.
method_english: The authors examine existing AI systems and user interactions to understand their impact on non-native speakers. They propose design principles that balance the support offered by AI and the maintenance of user control, ensuring that user agency is preserved.
results_english: The study finds that carefully designed AI systems can enhance language use for non-native speakers. However, it also highlights potential costs, such as diminishing linguistic diversity and user autonomy, underscoring the need for thoughtful AI tool design.
summary_japanese: 非ネイティブ話者の言語使用を支援する生成AIツールの設計と人間の主体性維持のコストに焦点を当てた研究。
problem_japanese: 非ネイティブ話者が言語タスクで生成AIツールを使用する際の課題は、人間の主体性を損ない、個別の表現力や言語の多様性を抑制するリスク。
method_japanese: 既存のAIシステムとユーザーの相互作用を調査し、AIの支援とユーザーのコントロール維持を両立させる設計原則を提案。
results_japanese: 適切に設計されたAIシステムは非ネイティブ話者の言語使用を向上させるが、多様性と自律性の低下というコストも示され、慎重な設計の必要性を強調。

title: “My doctor didn't give me half of that privilege”: Incorporating Black Patients’ Lived Experiences in Virtual Patients for Racial Bias Mitigation Training
authors: Zalake, Mohan and Swirsky, Eric S and Chisunkha, Blessings and Jindal, Monique
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study incorporates Black patients' experiences into virtual patients for training healthcare professionals to mitigate racial bias.
problem_english: The healthcare sector faces a significant challenge in addressing racial bias, which affects the quality of care received by Black patients. Traditional training methods have limitations in effectively sensitizing medical professionals to the lived experiences of marginalized groups, leading to ongoing disparities and inequality in healthcare services.
method_english: The authors developed a virtual patient training program based on the lived experiences of Black patients. This program employs interactive simulations where healthcare professionals engage with virtual Black patients, experiencing scenarios reflective of real-life biases and challenges. The goal is to enhance empathy and understanding, ultimately reducing racial bias in medical practice.
results_english: The study found that participants in the virtual patient training reported increased awareness and sensitivity towards racial bias issues. There was an improvement in their ability to recognize and address biased behavior, suggesting that incorporating Black patients' experiences into training modules significantly aids in mitigating racial bias within healthcare contexts.
summary_japanese: 本研究は黒人患者の経験を仮想患者に組み込み、人種的バイアス軽減トレーニングに活用。
problem_japanese: 医療分野は人種的バイアスへの対応が課題であり、黒人患者が受けるケアの質に影響を与えている。従来のトレーニング法は限界があり、被差別グループの経験に鈍感な医療専門家を作り出し、医療サービスの不平等を助長している。
method_japanese: 著者らは黒人患者の経験に基づく仮想患者トレーニングプログラムを開発。医療専門家は仮想黒人患者と対話し、実際のバイアスや課題を反映したシナリオを体験する。このプログラムは共感や理解を深め、医療実践における人種的バイアスを低減することを目指す。
results_japanese: 研究は、仮想患者トレーニングの参加者が人種的バイアス問題への意識が高まったことを発見。バイアス行動を認識し取り組む能力が向上し、黒人患者の経験をトレーニングに組み込むことが医療現場での人種的バイアス軽減に有効であることが示唆された。

title: BudsID: Mobile-Ready and Expressive Finger Identification Input for Earbuds
authors: Kim, Jiwan and Han, Mingyu and Oakley, Ian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces BudsID, a novel mobile-ready finger identification system designed for earbuds. It provides expressive and seamless input capabilities, improving user interaction with devices.
problem_english: The challenge is creating an intuitive and effective input method for earbuds, which traditionally have limitations in user interaction due to their small size and lack of control interface.
method_english: This research presents BudsID, utilizing finger identification technology integrated with earbuds, allowing users to achieve more expressive input and interaction by recognizing different touches and gestures.
results_english: BudsID demonstrates high accuracy in identifying fingers and detecting various gestures, enhancing user-device interaction. It proves viable with promising performance metrics, offering a new method for earbud control.
summary_japanese: この論文は、イヤフォン向けの指識別システムBudsIDを紹介し、より表現力豊かな入力を可能にする。
problem_japanese: イヤフォンは小型で制御インターフェースが不足しているため、ユーザーの操作が限られるという課題がある。直感的で効果的な入力方法を確立することが重要である。
method_japanese: BudsIDは指識別技術をイヤフォンに組み込み、様々なタッチとジェスチャーを認識することでより表現力のある入力と操作を可能にする。
results_japanese: BudsIDは高精度で指とジェスチャーを識別し、ユーザーとのインタラクションを向上する。イヤフォン制御の新しい方法として有望な性能を示す。

title: EchoBreath: Continuous Respiratory Behavior Recognition in the Wild via Acoustic Sensing on Smart Glasses
authors: Guo, Kaiyi and Zhang, Qian and Wang, Dong
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: EchoBreath utilizes smart glasses' acoustic sensing to monitor and analyze continuous respiratory behavior in natural environments, aiding health monitoring.
problem_english: Respiratory health monitoring is traditionally done in controlled environments, limiting continuous real-world observation crucial for effective assessment and timely intervention for respiratory issues.
method_english: EchoBreath employs smart glasses equipped with acoustic sensors to capture respiratory sounds utilizing algorithms to interpret these sounds for sustained respiratory behavior analysis in diverse settings.
results_english: EchoBreath's acoustic sensing demonstrated reliable accuracy in recognizing and analyzing respiratory behavior, proving effective for real-world health monitoring applications beyond clinical environments.
summary_japanese: EchoBreathはスマート眼鏡の音響センサーを活用し、自然環境での連続的な呼吸行動を監視・解析し健康管理を支援します。
problem_japanese: 呼吸の健康管理は従来の制御された環境での実施が多く、実世界での連続的な呼吸の観察が効果的な評価と迅速な介入に重要です。
method_japanese: EchoBreathは音響センサー付きのスマート眼鏡を使用して呼吸音を捉え、アルゴリズムで解析し広範な環境での連続呼吸行動を分析します。
results_japanese: EchoBreathの音響センサーは呼吸行動の認識と分析で信頼性のある精度を示し、臨床環境外での健康管理に効果的であることを証明しました。

title: Effects of Acoustic Transparency of Wearable Audio Devices on Audio AR
authors: Watanabe, Yuki and Chiba, Hironobu and Noguchi, Kenichi and Itou, Hiroaki and Kako, Tatsuya
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how acoustic transparency in wearable audio devices affects audio AR experiences, emphasizing user interaction and perception within augmented soundscapes.
problem_english: There is limited understanding of how different levels of acoustic transparency in wearable audio devices influence user experience, interaction, and perception in audio AR environments. This lack of knowledge affects the development of effective auditory augmented reality applications.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments using various wearable audio devices with adjustable acoustic transparency levels. Participants engaged with audio AR scenarios while their interactions and perceived experiences were assessed to determine the influence of transparency on audio perception and augmentation.
results_english: Findings show that optimal acoustic transparency enhances user experience by allowing clearer interaction with both real and augmented audio elements. Overly transparent or opaque settings either disrupt or diminish natural sound blending with AR sounds.
summary_japanese: この研究は、ウェアラブルオーディオデバイスの音響透過性がオーディオAR体験に与える影響を調査し、拡張音響環境でのユーザーの相互作用と認識に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: オーディオAR環境において、ウェアラブルオーディオデバイスの音響透過性がユーザー体験や相互作用、認識にどのように影響するかが十分に理解されていません。この知識不足は効果的な聴覚的拡張現実アプリケーションの開発に影響を与えています。
method_japanese: 研究者は、音響透過性を調整可能なウェアラブルオーディオデバイスを使用し、被験者にオーディオARシナリオに参加させました。透過性が音の認識と拡張に及ぼす影響を評価するために、彼らの相互作用と体験を調査しました。
results_japanese: 最適な音響透過性は、現実音と拡張音のクリアな相互作用を許容し、ユーザー体験を向上させることを示しました。過度に透過性が高いまたは不透明な設定は、自然音とAR音との融合を妨げたり、減少させる可能性があります。

title: FlexEar-Tips: Shape-Adjustable Ear Tips Using Pressure Control
authors: Amesaka, Takashi and Yamamoto, Takumi and Watanabe, Hiroki and Shizuki, Buntarou and Sugiura, Yuta
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: FlexEar-Tips present a novel approach to adjustable ear tips using pressure control to enhance comfort and audio experience. Researchers introduce a customizable ear tip solution that adapts to individual ear shape.
problem_english: Conventional ear tips often fail to fit all users comfortably, leading to poor audio experiences and discomfort. Existing solutions lack flexibility and real-time adaptability, which affects user satisfaction and auditory performance.
method_english: The method involves shape-adjustable ear tips utilizing precise pressure control. Through microfluidic channels within the ear tip, the system allows users to customize fit by inflating or deflating the internal structure, achieving optimal comfort and sound quality.
results_english: Testing indicates improved comfort and sound performance across diverse users compared to standard ear tips. FlexEar-Tips offer better adaptability, confirming the approach's potential in enhancing personalized audio wearables.
summary_japanese: FlexEar-Tipsは圧力制御を用いて耳の快適さと音響体験を向上させる新しい調整可能なイヤーチップを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 通常のイヤーチップは、すべてのユーザーに快適にフィットせず、音声体験が悪化し不快感を引き起こしやすい。適応性やユーザーの満足度に欠け、聴覚性能にも影響を与えている。
method_japanese: 圧力制御を用いて形状を調整可能にする。イヤーチップ内のマイクロ流体チャンネルを介して内部構造を膨張または収縮させ、ストレスなく最適なフィット感と音質を得る。
results_japanese: テストで標準イヤーチップと比較し、快適さと音質が向上。FlexEar-Tipsは高い適応性を示し、個別化された音響ウェアラブル改善の可能性を確認しました。

title: SmarTeeth: Augmenting Manual Toothbrushing with In-ear Microphones
authors: Yang, Qiang and Liu, Yang and Stuchbury-Wass, Jake and Butkow, Kayla-Jade and Panariti, Emeli and Ma, Dong and Mascolo, Cecilia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SmarTeeth utilizes in-ear microphones to enhance toothbrushing by detecting brush strokes and providing feedback. This innovation aims to improve dental hygiene habits through real-time guidance and brushing technique monitoring.
problem_english: Manual toothbrushing often suffers from inadequate technique, leading to ineffective dental hygiene. Users lack precise feedback on whether they brush correctly, which could result in oral health issues if not addressed appropriately.
method_english: The study employs in-ear microphones to record sound patterns generated during brushing. Machine learning algorithms analyze these sounds to detect brush strokes and evaluate brushing effectiveness. The system provides users with feedback, enhancing habitual brushing methods.
results_english: SmarTeeth demonstrated high accuracy in detecting brush strokes and assessing brushing quality. Users experienced improved brushing techniques through real-time feedback, leading to potential enhancements in overall dental hygiene practices.
summary_japanese: SmarTeethは耳内マイクでブラッシングを向上させ、リアルタイムフィードバックを提供する。これにより歯科衛生習慣の改善が目指される。
problem_japanese: 手動による歯磨きはテクニック不足により不効果的なことが多く、利用者は正しく磨いているかの正確なフィードバックが不足している。このため、適切に対策しなければ口腔健康上の問題が生じる可能性がある。
method_japanese: 耳内マイクを使用してブラッシング中の音パターンを記録。機械学習アルゴリズムで音を分析し、ブラシストロークを検知し有効性を評価することで、ユーザーにフィードバックを提供し慣習的なブラッシングを強化。
results_japanese: SmarTeethはブラシストロークの検知と品質評価に高精度を示し、ユーザーにリアルタイムフィードバックを提供することで、歯磨き技術の改善と歯科衛生習慣の向上をもたらす可能性が高い。

title: Spatial Speech Translation: Translating Across Space With Binaural Hearables
authors: Chen, Tuochao and Wang, Qirui and He, Runlin and Gollakota, Shyamnath
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces spatial speech translation using binaural hearables, allowing translation across space by leveraging 3D audio cues for immersive experiences.
problem_english: Current speech translation systems are limited in providing spatial context, leading to a loss of immersive experiences. This paper addresses the challenge of incorporating spatial audio cues into translation systems to retain the spatial positioning and enhance user experience.
method_english: The authors propose a technique using binaural hearables to capture and process spatial audio, enhancing speech translation by integrating 3D audio cues. This method preserves spatial context, providing a more immersive audio experience for users during translation.
results_english: Evaluations show that the proposed method successfully preserves spatial audio cues in speech translation, enhancing the user experience with increased satisfaction and immersion when using binaural hearables for translation tasks.
summary_japanese: 空間的文脈を利用した翻訳を可能にするバイノーラルヒアラブルを使用した空間音声翻訳を提案。
problem_japanese: 現行の音声翻訳システムでは空間的文脈に欠けており、没入感が損なわれる。空間音声の手掛かりを翻訳に組み込む課題に取り組む。
method_japanese: バイノーラルヒアラブルを用い、3D音声を活用して空間音声を翻訳に組み込み、没入感のある体験を提供。
results_japanese: 評価により提案手法が空間音声の手掛かりを保持し、ヒアラブル使用時の満足度と没入感を向上させることが示された。

title: Living Bento: Heartbeat-Driven Noodles for Enriched Dining Dynamics
authors: Chen, Weijen and Gao, Qingyuan and Hu, Zheng and Minamizawa, Kouta and Pai, Yun Suen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces an interactive dining experience, 'Living Bento,' where noodles change shape and texture in response to the diner's heartbeat, enhancing meal engagement and enjoyment.
problem_english: Current dining experiences often lack dynamic interaction, limiting emotional and sensory engagement. Traditional dining mainly focuses on taste and presentation, missing opportunities for deeper emotional involvement and personal connection with the food.
method_english: The researchers developed 'Living Bento,' a system where noodles embedded with soft robotics and sensors respond to the diner's heartbeat. This system uses real-time data to alter noodle shape and texture, creating a dynamic dining experience linked closely to the diner's physiological states.
results_english: The implementation of 'Living Bento' demonstrated increased engagement and enjoyment at meals. Participants reported a unique interactive experience, where the responsive nature of the noodles added a novel emotional and sensory dimension to their dining experience.
summary_japanese: 論文は、食事の際に利用者の心拍に応じて形状と食感が変わる「Living Bento」を紹介し、食事の楽しさを増やします。
problem_japanese: 従来の食体験は動的な相互作用に乏しく、感情的および感覚的な関与が制限されています。伝統的な食事は主に味や見た目に注力し、食事とのより深い感情的関与や個人的なつながりの機会を見逃しています。
method_japanese: 研究者は心拍に反応するヌードルを備えた「Living Bento」を開発しました。ソフトロボティクスとセンサーを組み込み、利用者の生理的状態に基づいてリアルタイムでヌードルの形状と食感を変化させます。
results_japanese: 「Living Bento」の実施により、参加者は食事中のユニークなインタラクティブ体験を報告し、ヌードルの応答性が新しい感情的かつ感覚的な次元を提供しました。

title: Preparing and Experiencing Food During Life Events: Implications for Technology Supporting Social and Value Changes
authors: Ha, Seung Wan and Nurain, Novia and Agapie, Elena and Chung, Chia-Fang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the role of food preparation and experiences during significant life events and implications for technology design to support social and value changes.
problem_english: The study addresses the gap in understanding how food-related practices evolve during major life events and how technology can better support individuals in adapting to these changes, integrating social and value transformations.
method_english: This research uses qualitative methods, including interviews and diary studies, to gather data from participants who have undergone notable life changes, analyzing how their food practices and technologies play a role during these transitions.
results_english: Findings suggest that food becomes a medium to navigate changes, maintain identity, and forge new relationships. Technologies need to be adaptable to individuals' evolving values and social needs during significant life events.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、重要な人生イベント中の食事準備や経験の役割と、社会的価値の変化を支援する技術設計への影響を探る。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、重大な人生イベント時に食事関連の慣習がどのように進化するか、技術がこれらの変化への適応をどのように支援できるか、社会的価値の統合における理解のギャップを取り上げる。
method_japanese: 本研究は、著名な人生の変化を経験した参加者からのインタビューと日記研究を含む質的手法を用い、変遷期における食事慣習と技術の役割を分析する。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、食事が変化を乗り越えるための手段となり、自己のアイデンティティを維持し、新たな関係を築くことを示唆する。技術は重要な人生イベント中の個々の価値観や社会的ニーズに適応可能である必要がある。

title: Rethinking Lived Experience in Chronic Illness: Navigating Bodily Doubt with Consumer Technology in Atrial Fibrillation Self-Care
authors: Keys, Rachel and Marshall, Paul and Stuart, Graham and O'Kane, Aisling Ann
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the role of consumer technology in managing atrial fibrillation, addressing how it influences bodily doubt in chronic illness care. It examines the interplay between technology and self-care practices.
problem_english: People with chronic illnesses like atrial fibrillation often experience bodily doubt, a lack of confidence in understanding their symptoms and conditions. The study seeks to understand how consumer technology influences these experiences, potentially altering self-care practices.
method_english: The authors utilize qualitative research methods, including interviews and participant observations with individuals managing atrial fibrillation. They analyze how these individuals integrate consumer technology into their self-care routines and the impact it has on their lived experiences.
results_english: The study found that consumer technology helps manage bodily doubt by offering more data to individuals, influencing their decision-making process and leading to increased trust in their self-care practices and monitoring abilities.
summary_japanese: 本論文は心房細動管理における消費者技術の役割を探求し、慢性疾患ケアの身体的疑念に及ぼす影響を検討します。
problem_japanese: 慢性疾患を抱える人は症状や状態を理解する自信を欠く身体的疑念を抱えやすい。この研究は、消費者技術がこれらの経験にどのように影響し、自己ケアの実践を変えるかを理解することを目指す。
method_japanese: 著者は心房細動管理者へのインタビューと参加者の観察を含めた定性研究を利用。消費者技術を自己ケアに統合する様子とその影響を分析。
results_japanese: 消費者技術は個人により多くのデータを提供し、自己ケアの決定プロセスに影響を与え、ケア実践と監視能力への信頼を高める結果が見出された。

title: Sonic Delights: Exploring the Design of Food as An Auditory-Gustatory Interface
authors: Deng, Jialin and Li, Yinyi and Wang, Hongyue and Fang, Ziqi and Mueller, Florian ‘Floyd’
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study delves into designing food as an auditory-gustatory interface, enhancing the sensory eating experience by integrating soundscapes with taste. Using various methodologies, the authors explore how sound can influence and enhance flavor perception.
problem_english: The intersection of sound and taste in culinary experiences is underexplored. This gap hinders our full understanding of how auditory stimuli can enhance or alter taste perceptions. Addressing this could elevate multisensory dining experiences, offering new avenues for interaction design in food technology.
method_english: The authors employed experimental designs using a combination of food items paired with curated soundscapes. They conducted user studies to evaluate taste perception changes, analyzing how different sound elements influenced users' gustatory experiences, while leveraging sensory enhancement techniques to optimize sound-taste integration.
results_english: The study reveals that pairing specific soundscapes with food can significantly alter taste perception, proving that sound is a powerful modulator in sensory experiences. Participants reported enhanced flavors and heightened enjoyment, demonstrating the potential of using auditory cues to enrich gustatory engagements.
summary_japanese: この研究は、音と味を組み合わせた食体験の設計を探求し、聴覚と味覚のインターフェイスとしての食の設計を探る。
problem_japanese: 食品体験における音と味覚の交差は十分に探求されていない。このギャップは、音の刺激がどのように味の知覚を強化または変化させるかを完全に理解するのを妨げている。これを解決することで、マルチセンソリーな食の体験を高め、新たなインタラクションデザインの可能性を提供できる。
method_japanese: 著者は、食品と特定の音の組み合わせを用いた実験を行い、音が味の知覚に与える影響をユーザースタディで評価した。さらに、感覚強化技術を用いて音と味の統合を最適化した。
results_japanese: 特定の音を組み合わせることで味の知覚が大きく変わることが確認され、音が感覚体験の強力な調整役であることが示された。参加者は味の向上と楽しみの増加を報告し、音の刺激が味覚体験を豊かにする可能性を明らかにした。

title: T2 Coach: A Qualitative Study of an Automated Health Coach for Diabetes Self-Management
authors: Mitchell, Elliot G and Desai, Pooja and Smaldone, Arlene and Cassells, Andrea and Tobin, Jonathan N. and Albers, David and Levine, Matthew and Mamykina, Lena
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores T2 Coach, an automated health coach for diabetes management, analyzing its effectiveness in supporting self-management. It uses qualitative methods to gather user insights.
problem_english: Managing diabetes requires consistent self-care and lifestyle adjustments, posing challenges for many individuals. Automation in health coaching, like T2 Coach, could potentially support patients by providing continuous, personalized guidance. The study investigates its impact and user experience.
method_english: Researchers employed qualitative methods, including user interviews and observations, to understand the effectiveness of T2 Coach. This approach aimed at capturing detailed user feedback on the coaching system and its applicability in real-world diabetes management.
results_english: Findings indicate that T2 Coach could enhance diabetes self-management by offering personalized, consistent guidance. Users reported improved self-efficacy and better understanding of their health, but also highlighted areas for improvement in system flexibility and responsiveness.
summary_japanese: 本研究はT2 Coachという糖尿病管理の自動化コーチの有効性を探求し、自己管理支援に関する洞察を収集しました。
problem_japanese: 糖尿病の管理には一貫した自己管理とライフスタイルの調整が必要であり、多くの人にとって課題です。T2 Coachのような自動化ヘルスコーチングが患者支援にどのように寄与するかを調査します。
method_japanese: ユーザーのインタビューや観察を含む質的方法を用いて、T2 Coachの効果を理解するための詳細なユーザーフィードバックを収集しました。
results_japanese: T2 Coachはパーソナライズされたガイダンスで糖尿病の自己管理を強化し、自己効力感と健康理解の向上を報告しましたが、柔軟性と応答性の改善が必要とされました。

title: Towards Understanding Interactive Sonic Gastronomy with Chefs and Diners
authors: Wang, Hongyue and Deng, Jialin and He, Linjia and Overdevest, Nathalie and Wee, Ryan and Wang, Yan and Toups Dugas, Phoebe O. and Elvitigala, Don Samitha and Mueller, Florian Floyd
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores interactive sonic gastronomy by studying how chefs and diners respond to sonic elements in dining experiences, aiming to understand their impact on culinary practices.
problem_english: Current culinary practices often overlook the significance of sound in dining experiences. There is limited understanding of how sonic elements can enhance or alter these experiences, particularly in the interactions between chefs and diners.
method_english: The authors conducted observational and participatory sessions with chefs and diners, using audio recordings and interviews to gather insights on the integration of sonic elements in cooking and dining processes.
results_english: Findings suggest sonic gastronomy can enrich dining experiences by enhancing emotional engagement and interaction, leading to improved culinary practices. Chefs and diners responded positively to sound, indicating its potential in the gastronomy field.
summary_japanese: 音響ガストロノミーを探究し、料理経験の音響要素がシェフや食事客に与える影響を理解することを目指します。
problem_japanese: 現在の料理実践では、食事経験における音の重要性が見落とされています。音響要素が料理経験をいかに向上または変えることができるかについて十分な理解がありません。
method_japanese: 著者はシェフや食事客との観察および参加セッションを行い、料理や食事プロセスでの音響要素の統合についてオーディオ録音とインタビューを用いて洞察を収集しました。
results_japanese: 音響ガストロノミーは、感情的な関与と交流を向上させることで食事体験を豊かにし、調理の実践を向上させる可能性があることが示唆されています。シェフと食事客は音に対してポジティブな反応を示し、ガストロノミー分野での潜在的な価値を示しています。

title: ViFeed: Promoting Slow Eating and Food Awareness through Strategic Video Manipulation during Screen-Based Dining
authors: Chen, Yang and Tan, Felicia Fang-Yi and Wang, Zhuoyu and Liu, Xing and Zhang, Jiayi and Huang, Yun and Zhao, Shengdong and Yen, Ching Chiuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ViFeed uses video manipulation techniques to promote slow eating and enhance food awareness during screen-based dining by altering video playback speed in real-time.
problem_english: Screen-based dining often leads to distracted eating, resulting in habitual fast eating and reduced food awareness. This can negatively impact digestion, satiation recognition, and overall dietary health, necessitating a method to encourage more mindful eating habits.
method_english: ViFeed employs real-time video manipulation, dynamically adjusting playback speed based on eating pace. By synchronizing video content with eating speeds, ViFeed encourages slower consumption and enhances awareness of food, helping users cultivate healthier eating behaviors.
results_english: ViFeed's video manipulation significantly decreased eating speed, increased chewing counts, and improved users' awareness of eating pace and food quality, suggesting it effectively fosters healthier, more mindful eating practices among participants.
summary_japanese: ViFeedは動画を操作し、画面を見ながらゆっくり食事をし、食意識を高めます。
problem_japanese: 画面を見ながらの食事は気を散らしがちで早食いを助長し、消化不良や食事の認識を鈍らせます。意識的な食事習慣を促進する方法が必要です。
method_japanese: ViFeedは食事のペースに応じた動画速度の操作を行い、ゆっくりした食事と食物の認識向上を促進します。
results_japanese: ViFeedにより食事速度が低下し、咀嚼回数が増加し、食事ペースと食事の質に対する意識が向上しました。

title: A Route to Somatic Literacy of the Pelvic Floor through Technology-Initiated Touch
authors: Yadav, Deepika and Zheng, Caroline Yan and St\r{a}hl, Anna and Balaam, Madeline
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores enhancing somatic literacy of the pelvic floor through technology-initiated touch, aiming to improve body awareness and understanding.
problem_english: Many individuals lack somatic literacy regarding their pelvic floor, which can lead to issues in body awareness, health, and wellbeing. The challenge is to address this gap in understanding through innovative means that are accessible and effective.
method_english: The study utilizes technology-driven touch interfaces to create a novel interaction experience, aiming to enhance somatic literacy. This method involves user engagement with interactive devices that provide tactile feedback to promote awareness and understanding of pelvic floor dynamics.
results_english: Findings suggest that participants improved their body awareness and understanding of the pelvic floor, demonstrating potential for technology-initiated touch to enhance somatic literacy and promote wellness.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、テクノロジーを通じて骨盤底の体性感覚リテラシーを向上させる方法を探求します。
problem_japanese: 多くの人々は骨盤底に関する体性感覚リテラシーが不足し、身体感覚、健康、幸福に問題を引き起こします。この理解不足をアクセスしやすく効果的な革新によって解決する課題があります。
method_japanese: テクノロジー駆動のタッチインターフェースを用い、体性感覚リテラシーを向上させる新しい体験を創出します。インタラクティブなデバイスを使って、触覚フィードバックを提供し、骨盤底の動態を理解させる方法です。
results_japanese: 結果は、参加者の身体意識と骨盤底の理解が向上したことを示し、テクノロジーを利用した触覚がリテラシー向上と健康促進に寄与する可能性を示しました。

title: Adaptive Electrical Muscle Stimulation Improves Muscle Memory
authors: Choudhary, Siya and Nith, Romain and Ho, Yun and Brooks, Jas and Guruvugari, Mithil and Lopes, Pedro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents the development of an adaptive electrical muscle stimulation (EMS) system that enhances muscle memory, showing significant improvements in skill retention and performance.
problem_english: Traditional methods for improving muscle memory, such as repetitive practice, often require significant time and effort, which may not be feasible for everyone. The paper addresses the need for alternative solutions that can optimize skill acquisition and retention effectively.
method_english: The study introduces an adaptive EMS system that customizes stimulation patterns according to the individual's physiological responses, aiming to enhance muscle memory by optimally engaging the musculoskeletal system during practice sessions.
results_english: Results demonstrated that participants who utilized adaptive EMS showed rapid improvements in skill acquisition and retention, outperforming control groups in various motor tasks, suggesting that adaptive EMS can serve as a practical tool for muscle memory enhancement.
summary_japanese: この論文は筋肉記憶を向上させる適応型電気筋刺激システムの開発を紹介し、技術保持とパフォーマンスにおいて顕著な改善を示しています。
problem_japanese: 筋肉記憶改善には多くの時間と労力が必要な反復練習が一般的だが、それは誰もが利用できるわけではない。効果的なスキル獲得と保持を最適化する代替手段が必要とされている。
method_japanese: 本研究では、個々の生理的反応に応じた刺激パターンを調整する適応型EMSシステムを導入し、練習時に筋骨格系を最適に活性化して筋肉記憶を強化することを目指している。
results_japanese: 適応型EMSを使用した参加者はスキルの獲得と保持において迅速な改善を示し、様々な運動課題で対照群を上回り、筋肉記憶の向上に有効な手段であることが示唆された。

title: Improving Putting Accuracy with Electrical Muscle Stimulation Feedback Guided by Muscle Synergy Analysis
authors: Niijima, Arinobu and Takeda, Shoichiro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The research explores using Electrical Muscle Stimulation (EMS) guided by muscle synergy analysis to improve putt accuracy in golf, presenting effective feedback mechanisms.
problem_english: Achieving precision in golf putting demands a high level of motor control and coordination. Traditional training methods often struggle to address the complexities of muscle synergy effectively, leading to inconsistent performance among golfers.
method_english: The study utilizes muscle synergy analysis to identify key muscle groups involved in putting, applying precise EMS to enhance the motor control of these muscles during practice, thus improving putting accuracy.
results_english: The application of EMS feedback significantly improved golfers' putting performance by enhancing muscle coordination and reducing movement errors, proving the efficacy of integrating muscle synergy analysis into training routines.
summary_japanese: 筋シナジー解析によるEMSフィードバックでゴルフのパット精度向上を探る研究と、その効果的なメカニズムを提示。
problem_japanese: ゴルフパットの正確さには高度な運動制御と筋肉の協調が求められるが、従来のトレーニングでは筋シナジーの複雑さに対処が難しく、一貫した成果が得られにくい。
method_japanese: 筋シナジー解析でパットに関与する主要筋群を特定し、EMSを適用して練習中の筋制御を強化しパット精度を向上させる。
results_japanese: EMSフィードバックの適用により筋協調が向上し、動作のエラーが減少してパット性能が大きく向上し、筋シナジー分析のトレーニングへの統合効果が確認された。

title: NeuResonance: Exploring Feedback Experiences for Fostering the Inter-brain Synchronization
authors: Dinh, Jamie Ngoc and Shrestha, Snehesh and Kim, You-Jin and Nishida, Jun and Lee, Myungin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
