summary_english: NeuResonance explores methods to enhance inter-brain synchronization using feedback experiences. It investigates neural mechanisms to improve co-thinking and collaboration.
problem_english: Current technological solutions lack effective methods for enhancing inter-brain synchronization, crucial for collaborative efforts involving co-thinking and joint problem-solving processes.
method_english: The study employs feedback-driven experiences to investigate neural synchronization between individuals, using EEG to measure and modulate inter-brain activities during collaborative tasks.
results_english: The results demonstrate that specific feedback experiences can significantly enhance inter-brain synchronization, improving collaborative performance and co-thinking processes among participants.
summary_japanese: NeuResonanceは、フィードバック体験を用いて脳間同期を高める方法を探求しています。
problem_japanese: 現行の技術的解決策は、共同作業に重要な脳間同期を高める効果的な方法に欠けている。
method_japanese: フィードバック駆動体験を用いて、協同作業中の脳間活動をEEGで測定・調整し、同期を調査します。
results_japanese: 特定のフィードバック体験が脳間同期を著しく向上させ、協同作業能力が改善されることを示しました。

title: PiaMuscle: Improving Piano Skill Acquisition by Cost-effectively Estimating and Visualizing Activities of Miniature Hand Muscles
authors: Liu, Ruofan and Peng, Yichen and Oku, Takanori and Liao, Chen-Chieh and Wu, Erwin and Furuya, Shinichi and Koike, Hideki
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PiaMuscle enhances piano skill development by cost-effectively estimating and visualizing miniature hand muscle activities. It aids in understanding muscle engagement during piano practice.
problem_english: Current piano learning methodologies often neglect the importance of hand muscle activities, which are crucial for skill acquisition. Capturing detailed muscle activities is typically costly and not easily accessible for aspiring musicians.
method_english: The PiaMuscle system employs affordable muscle activity sensors integrated with visualization software. It analyzes musicians' finger movements to estimate hand muscle activity, providing visual feedback that informs practice and technique improvement.
results_english: Results indicate PiaMuscle effectively visualizes miniature hand muscle activities, allowing musicians to gain insights into muscle engagement patterns. This aids in efficient skill acquisition through enhanced technique awareness and tailored practice sessions.
summary_japanese: PiaMuscleはピアノ技能向上を手筋肉活動の費用効果的な推定と可視化で支援し、練習時の筋肉使用を理解する助けとなります。
problem_japanese: 現在のピアノ学習方法は、技能獲得に不可欠な手筋肉活動の重要性を無視しがちです。詳細な筋肉活動の捕捉は通常コストがかかり、音楽愛好者にとって容易でありません。
method_japanese: PiaMuscleは手頃な筋肉活動センサーと視覚化ソフトを統合したシステムです。演奏者の指の動きを分析し、手筋肉活動の推定と視覚的フィードバックを提供し、練習と技術向上を支援します。
results_japanese: 結果はPiaMuscleが手筋肉活動を効果的に視覚化し、演奏者に筋肉使用パターンの洞察を提供することを示しています。技術意識と練習セッションの改善により効率的な技能獲得を助けます。

title: TelePulse: Enhancing the Teleoperation Experience through Biomechanical Simulation-Based Electrical Muscle Stimulation in Virtual Reality
authors: Hwang, Seokhyun and Kang, Seongjun and Oh, Jeongseok and Park, Jeongju and Shin, Semoo and Luo, Yiyue and DelPreto, Joseph and Lee, Sangbeom and Lee, Kyoobin and Matusik, Wojciech and Rus, Daniela and Kim, SeungJun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TelePulse integrates biomechanical simulation-based electrical muscle stimulation (EMS) with VR, enhancing teleoperation by providing realistic feedback of remote actions to users, improving immersive experience.
problem_english: Teleoperation using VR often lacks realistic feedback, limiting the immersive experience for users. Conventional haptic feedback methods fail to replicate the nuances of actual interactions, affecting task execution precision and user engagement.
method_english: The TelePulse system utilizes a combination of biomechanical simulations and electrical muscle stimulation (EMS) to provide users with realistic muscle feedback in VR environments, bridging the gap between physical actions and virtual representation in teleoperation systems.
results_english: TelePulse showed significant improvements in user experience by providing more realistic sensations during teleoperation. Experimental data indicated enhanced task performance and user satisfaction over conventional haptic feedback systems, with participants reporting heightened realism and efficiency.
summary_japanese: TelePulseは生体力学シミュレーションを基にしたEMSをVRと統合し、遠隔操作の臨場感を向上させます。
problem_japanese: VRを用いた遠隔操作はリアルなフィードバックが欠如しており、臨場感に制限があります。従来の触覚フィードバックは実際のインタラクションのニュアンスを再現できず、タスクの精度やユーザーのエンゲージメントに影響を与えます。
method_japanese: TelePulseシステムは、生体力学シミュレーションとEMSを組み合わせ、遠隔操作のVR環境でリアルな筋肉フィードバックを提供し、物理的な動作と仮想表現のギャップを埋めます。
results_japanese: TelePulseは遠隔操作中のよりリアルな感覚を提供することでユーザー体験の大幅な向上を示しました。実験データから従来の触覚フィードバックシステムよりもタスク性能とユーザー満足度が高かったと確認され、参加者はリアル感と効率の向上を報告しました。

title: Understanding the Influence of Electrical Muscle Stimulation on Motor Learning: Enhancing Motor Learning or Disrupting Natural Progression?
authors: Villa, Steeven and Krammer, Finn Jacob Eliyah and Weiss, Yannick and Welsch, Robin and Kosch, Thomas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the effects of electrical muscle stimulation (EMS) on motor learning, evaluating whether it aids or hinders natural motor skill acquisition processes.
problem_english: There is limited understanding of how electrical muscle stimulation impacts motor learning processes. It's uncertain whether EMS can be used to enhance motor skill acquisition or if it disrupts the natural progression of learning these skills.
method_english: The study employs a controlled experiment involving participants undergoing motor skill training with and without EMS to assess its effects on learning rates and skill retention. Data analysis focuses on performance metrics and subjective feedback.
results_english: The findings suggest that electrical muscle stimulation can accelerate the initial phase of motor learning but may also lead to reduced skill retention over time. The results indicate potential benefits and drawbacks of using EMS in motor skill training.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、電気筋肉刺激 (EMS) が運動学習に及ぼす影響を調査し、技能習得を促進するか妨げるかを評価します。
problem_japanese: 電気筋肉刺激が運動学習プロセスに与える影響の理解は限られており、EMSが運動技能習得を助けるのか、学習の自然な進展を妨げるのか不明な点があります。
method_japanese: 参加者を対象に、EMSあり・なしの環境で運動技能トレーニングを実施し、学習速度と技能保持に与える影響を比較する実験を行います。パフォーマンス指標と主観的フィードバックを分析します。
results_japanese: EMSは学習初期段階を加速させるが、長期的には技能保持が低下する可能性が示されました。EMSによる技能トレーニングの利点と欠点が明らかになりました。

title: "It Brought the Model to Life": Exploring the Embodiment of Multimodal I3Ms for People who are Blind or have Low Vision
authors: Reinders, Samuel and Butler, Matthew and Marriott, Kim
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates multimodal Intelligent Interactive Information Models (I3Ms) to enhance accessibility for blind or low vision (BLV) individuals, providing enriching interactive experiences.
problem_english: There is a significant challenge in providing meaningful and accessible representations of complex information to people who are blind or have low vision (BLV), causing them to miss out on critical interactions necessary for complete understanding and engagement.
method_english: The research explores the development and implementation of multimodal Intelligent Interactive Information Models (I3Ms), utilizing auditory and tactile feedback to create a more immersive and accessible experience for BLV users.
results_english: The study demonstrates that incorporating auditory and tactile modalities significantly improves the engagement and comprehension of complex models for BLV users, bridging the gap between information access and experiential understanding.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、視覚障害者に対するマルチモーダル知的情報モデル（I3Ms）の利用可能性を調査し、豊かなインタラクション体験を提供する。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者にとって意味のある複雑な情報表現を提供することは大きな課題であり、これにより重要な相互作用を逃してしまい、完全な理解と関与が困難になる。
method_japanese: 本研究は、視覚障害者向けに聴覚および触覚フィードバックを利用したマルチモーダルな知的インタラクション情報モデル（I3Ms）の開発と実装を探る。
results_japanese: 研究により、聴覚と触覚モダリティを組み込むことで視覚障害者の複雑なモデルの理解が大幅に改善し、情報アクセスと体験理解のギャップを埋めることが示された。

title: Being in Virtual Worlds: How Interaction Environment and Touch Shape Embodiment in Immersive Experiences
authors: Desnoyers-Stewart, John and Antle, Alissa N. and Riecke, Bernhard E.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how interaction environment and touch influence embodiment in virtual worlds. It examines immersive experiences, analyzing the effects of different environments and touch interfaces on user embodiment.
problem_english: This research aims to address uncertainties surrounding how different interaction environments and touch interfaces impact the user's sense of embodiment in virtual realities. The challenge is understanding these influences to improve immersive experiences.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments using various virtual environments and touch interfaces. Participants experienced these setups, and their sense of embodiment was evaluated through surveys and behavioral analysis, focusing on how different setups affect user perception.
results_english: The findings reveal that both environment and touch significantly influence embodiment in virtual worlds. Specific environments created more immersive experiences, while certain touch interfaces enhanced or diminished the sense of presence and embodiment among users.
summary_japanese: 研究は、仮想世界でのインタラクション環境と触覚が身体感覚に与える影響を探る。異なる環境とタッチインターフェースの効果を分析する。
problem_japanese: さまざまなインタラクション環境と触感インターフェースが、ユーザーの仮想空間での身体感覚にどう影響するかについての不確実性を解決し、没入体験を向上する課題に取り組む。
method_japanese: 研究者は異なる仮想環境と触覚インターフェースを使用した実験を行った。参加者はこれらのセットアップを体験し、調査や行動分析を通じて身体感覚を評価し、異なるセットアップがユーザーの認識に与える影響を検討。
results_japanese: 環境と触覚の両方が仮想世界での身体感覚に大きく影響することが判明。特定の環境は没入体験を向上し、特定の触覚インターフェースはユーザーの存在感と身体感覚を強化または減少させた。

title: Does Random Movements mean Random Results? Why Asynchrony in Experiments on Body Ownership does not Work as Intended
authors: Iarygina, Olga and Hornb\ae{}k, Kasper and Mottelson, Aske
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates whether asynchronous movements in experiments on body ownership yield expected results, finding discrepancies from intended outcomes.
problem_english: Experiments on body ownership often use asynchronous movements to explore body-related cognitive phenomena. However, the effectiveness and underlying mechanisms of this technique remain questionable, prompting a need for empirical examination and validation.
method_english: The researchers conducted a series of experiments evaluating the effectiveness of using asynchronous movements in body ownership studies, comparing participant responses with theoretically expected outcomes.
results_english: The experimentation revealed that asynchronous movements often do not achieve the anticipated effects on participants' sense of body ownership, challenging existing assumptions and suggesting alternative methods might be needed.
summary_japanese: この研究は、身体所有感実験における非同期動作が意図された結果をもたらすか検討し、期待された結果との差異を発見しました。
problem_japanese: 身体所有感に関する実験では、非同期動作が使用されることが多いが、その効果とメカニズムには疑問が残る。これには、経験的な検証と確認が必要です。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは、非同期動作を使用した身体所有感の研究における効果を評価する実験を行い、参加者の反応と理論的に期待される結果を比較しました。
results_japanese: 実験の結果、非同期動作は参加者の身体所有感に期待される効果をしばしば達成せず、既存の仮定に疑問を投げかけ、代替手法の必要性を示唆しました。

title: Owning the (Virtual) World: A Systematic Review of Psychological Ownership of Interactive Virtual Objects and Environments
authors: Krauss, Jana and Wienrich, Carolin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper systematically reviews research on psychological ownership of interactive virtual objects and environments, highlighting theoretical frameworks and factors influencing ownership experiences.
problem_english: Understanding psychological ownership in virtual settings is crucial as digital environments become more prevalent. Previous studies lack consolidated insights and guidance for developing engaging experiences that foster ownership feelings, impacting technology design and user experience.
method_english: The authors utilized systematic literature review methodologies, compiling and analyzing existing studies on psychological ownership related to virtual objects and environments. This approach offers a comprehensive overview of theories and identifies factors affecting ownership perceptions in virtual contexts.
results_english: The review identified key theories such as self-investment and control, influencing psychological ownership in virtual spaces. Factors including immersive design, personalization, and interactivity were found to enhance ownership feelings, offering insights for creating engaging virtual experiences.
summary_japanese: この論文は、仮想オブジェクトと環境の心理的所有感に関する研究を体系的にレビューし、理論的枠組みと影響因子を示しています。
problem_japanese: デジタル環境の普及に伴い、仮想環境での心理的所有感の理解が重要になっています。しかし、従来の研究は統合された洞察や、所有感を促進する体験を開発するための指針が不足しています。
method_japanese: 著者は、仮想オブジェクトと環境に関連する心理的所有感の既存研究を体系的に収集・分析する手法を利用しました。この方法により、理論の包括的な概観と仮想環境での所有感に影響を与える要因を特定します。
results_japanese: 自己投資やコントロールなどの理論が仮想空間での心理的所有感に影響を与えることが判明しました。没入型デザインやパーソナライズ、インタラクティブ性が所有感を高める要因であることが示されています。

title: RemapVR: An Immersive Authoring Tool for Rapid Prototyping of Remapped Interaction in VR
authors: Luo, Tianren and Wu, Tong and Jiang, Chaoyong and Duan, Xinran and Lv, Jiafu and Li, Nianlong and Fan, Yachun and Han, Teng and Tian, Feng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: RemapVR is an immersive tool for rapidly prototyping interaction remapping in VR, enabling designers to explore novel interaction designs efficiently.
problem_english: Designers face challenges in prototyping novel interaction designs in VR environments due to the complexity and time-consuming process of implementing and testing remapped interactions efficiently.
method_english: RemapVR offers a visual scripting interface that allows designers to create and test interaction prototypes by remapping user inputs and outputs in VR, facilitating iterative exploration of interaction designs.
results_english: The study demonstrates RemapVR's efficacy in accelerating the prototyping process for interaction remapping, allowing designers to quickly iterate and refine VR interaction designs, leading to enhanced creativity and productivity.
summary_japanese: RemapVRはVRでの相互作用の迅速なプロトタイピングを可能にする没入型ツールです。
problem_japanese: VR環境における新しい相互作用デザインのプロトタイピングは、実装とテストが複雑で時間がかかるため、デザイナーにとって難しい課題です。
method_japanese: RemapVRはユーザー入力と出力をVRで再マッピングすることで、デザイナーが視覚的なスクリプティングで相互作用プロトタイプを作成・テストできるようにします。
results_japanese: RemapVRは相互作用のプロトタイピングを加速し、デザイナーが迅速にVRデザインを反復・改良することを促進し、創造性と生産性を向上させました。

title: The Effect of In-Car Agent Embodiment on Different Types of Information Delivery
authors: Ku, Bonhee and Kim, Chang-Min and Cho, Hyungjun and Park, Jisu and Nam, Tek-Jin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how in-car agent embodiment affects information delivery, comparing physical and virtual agents. It explores user preferences and understanding in real driving scenarios.
problem_english: In-car agents often present information to drivers, but the impact of their embodiment (physical or virtual) on information delivery and user experience is not well understood. Understanding these effects could improve in-car systems for safer and more effective communication.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach, involving real driving scenarios with participants. It compares the effects of different agent embodiments (physical versus virtual) on user preferences and information comprehension, using both qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis techniques.
results_english: The findings indicate that physical embodiments of in-car agents improve user trust and information retention compared to virtual embodiments, suggesting that tangible agents could enhance user interaction and effectiveness of information delivery in cars.
summary_japanese: この研究は、車内エージェントの具現化が情報提供にどのように影響するかを調査し、物理的および仮想的エージェントを比較します。
problem_japanese: 車内エージェントはしばしば運転者に情報を提示しますが、それらの具現化（物理的か仮想的か）が情報伝達やユーザー体験に与える影響は十分に理解されていません。この影響を理解することは、より安全で効果的な車内システムのコミュニケーションを向上させる可能性があります。
method_japanese: 本研究では、実際の運転シナリオと参加者を用いて、物理的および仮想的なエージェント具現化の影響をユーザーの選好と情報理解度について比較し、質的および量的データ収集と分析手法を使用します。
results_japanese: 物理的な具現化の車内エージェントは、仮想的なものよりもユーザーの信頼と情報保持を向上させることが示され、車中の情報伝達の効果を高める可能性があることを示唆しています。

title: Virtual Voyages: Evaluating the Role of Real-Time and Narrated Virtual Tours in Shaping User Experience and Memories
authors: Eagan, Lillian Maria and Young, Jacob and Bering, Jesse and Langlotz, Tobias
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper evaluates real-time and narrated virtual tours' effectiveness on user experience and memory formation comparing both methods.
problem_english: Virtual tours are increasingly popular, but little is known about how different formats, such as real-time or narrated experiences, impact users’ engagement and memory retention. This study aims to investigate these variations in user interactions.
method_english: The authors conducted a series of user studies, comparing real-time virtual tours with narrated ones, using surveys and memory tests to gauge participants' engagement and recall. Quantitative data analysis helped assess the impact of each format on user experience.
results_english: Results indicate narrated tours enhance memory retention over real-time ones due to structured storytelling. However, real-time tours offer increased interactivity and engagement, suggesting different formats are better suited to distinct user goals.
summary_japanese: 本論文はリアルタイムとナレーション付きバーチャルツアーがユーザー体験と記憶形成に与える効果を評価しています。
problem_japanese: バーチャルツアーは人気ですが、リアルタイムやナレーションの形式がユーザーの関与や記憶保持にどう影響するかは不明です。本研究はこれらの相違点を調査します。
method_japanese: リアルタイムツアーとナレーション付きツアーを比較するユーザー研究を行い、調査と記憶テストを用いて参加者の関与と記憶を評価し、定量的データ分析を行いました。
results_japanese: ナレーション付きツアーは構造化されたストーリーテリングにより記憶保持を強化し、リアルタイムツアーはインタラクティブ性と関与を促進することが示されました。

title: "All Day, Every Day, Listening to Trauma": Investigating Features of Digital Interventions for Empathy-Based Stress and Burnout
authors: Chau, Connie W. and Norton, Colleen and Kruzan, Kaylee Payne and Jacobs, Maia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates digital interventions to manage empathy-based stress and burnout. It identifies key features that can effectively aid individuals experiencing such conditions and proposes design considerations for future digital tools to improve user wellbeing.
problem_english: Professionals in trauma-focused roles experience chronic empathy-based stress and burnout, posing risks to their mental health and job performance. Current support systems are insufficient, lacking personalization and accessibility. Thus, there is a need to develop effective digital interventions that address these gaps, promoting well-being and resilience among affected individuals.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-methods study incorporating both qualitative interviews and quantitative surveys to gather insights from professionals experiencing empathy-based stress. They analyzed existing digital interventions, identifying effective elements and areas for improvement. This comprehensive approach provided a foundation for proposing design considerations tailored to enhance digital intervention efficacy.
results_english: The study identified key features for effective digital interventions, including personalization, accessibility, and scalability. Participants emphasized the importance of user-friendly interfaces and timely support. Recommendations for future digital tools include incorporating mindfulness, peer support, and adaptive technologies to cater to individual needs, contributing to reduced stress and improved resilience.
summary_japanese: 共感に基づくストレスとバーンアウトを管理するデジタル介入を調査し、有効な特徴を特定。将来のツール設計に役立つ考慮点を提案。
problem_japanese: トラウマ関連職では共感によるストレスとバーンアウトが慢性的に発生し、精神的健康と職務遂行に影響。既存支援システムは個別性とアクセス性に欠けるため、これらのギャップを埋める効果的なデジタル介入が必要。
method_japanese: 共感によるストレスを経験する専門家へのインタビューとアンケートを通じ、質的および量的にデータを収集。既存のデジタル介入の分析を通じて改善点を特定し、より効果的な介入の設計指針を提案。
results_japanese: 効果的なデジタル介入の特徴として個別化、アクセス性、拡張性が重要。ユーザーインターフェースと迅速なサポートが強調され、マインドフルネスやピアサポート、個別ニーズに応じた技術を提案。

title: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Research on Goals for Behavior Change
authors: Zhu, Jun and Lolla, Sruzan and Agnihotri, Meeshu and Asgari Tappeh, Sahar and Guluzade, Lala and Agapie, Elena and Sas, Corina
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper systematically reviews and analyzes research on behavior change goals, synthesizing findings to identify effective strategies and interventions for achieving successful behavior modifications.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding the most effective approaches, strategies, and interventions for setting and achieving behavior change goals, given the diverse methodologies and findings across existing research.
method_english: The authors conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis of existing literature on behavior change goals. They synthesized quantitative data from selected studies to evaluate and compare the effectiveness of different strategies and interventions.
results_english: The results highlight the most successful strategies and interventions for behavior change goals, revealing patterns and key factors contributing to successful behavior modifications across different contexts and populations.
summary_japanese: 行動変容目標に関する研究を体系的にレビューし、効果的な戦略と介入を明らかにしました。
problem_japanese: 行動変容目標を設定・達成するための最も効果的なアプローチ、戦略、介入を理解することが課題です。既存研究の多様な方法論と結果からこれを探ります。
method_japanese: 行動変容目標に関する既存文献を体系的にレビューし、定量データを統合して様々な戦略と介入法の効果を評価しました。
results_japanese: 行動変容目標における最も成功した戦略と介入を明らかにし、異なる文脈と集団における成功要因を示しました。

title: Customizing Emotional Support: How Do Individuals Construct and Interact With LLM-Powered Chatbots
authors: Zheng, Xi and Li, Zhuoyang and Gui, Xinning and Luo, Yuhan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This research explores how individuals design and interact with chatbots powered by large language models (LLMs) for personalized emotional support, focusing on the customization process and users' emotional well-being.
problem_english: The study examines the challenge of effectively customizing LLM-powered chatbots for providing personalized emotional support. It addresses issues related to users' diverse emotional needs and the difficulties in ensuring that chatbots can adapt to these requirements while maintaining users' emotional well-being.
method_english: The authors employ a qualitative research approach involving user interviews and interactive sessions to understand how individuals create and interact with customized LLM chatbots. They analyze user experiences to derive insights into the customization process and the effectiveness of emotional support provided.
results_english: Findings indicate that users can effectively customize LLM chatbots to meet their specific emotional needs, leading to significant improvements in emotional well-being. However, challenges remain in ensuring the chatbots maintain sensitivity and appropriateness in responses over time.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、大規模言語モデル(LLM)を活用したカスタマイズ可能な感情支援チャットボットの設計と利用を探る。
problem_japanese: LLMを活用したチャットボットのカスタマイズにおいて、多様な感情的ニーズに応じた個別支援を提供する課題を調査。ユーザーの感情的ニーズへの適応と感情的健康の維持の困難さに焦点を当てる。
method_japanese: 質的研究手法を用い、ユーザーとのインタビューやインタラクティブセッションを通じ、カスタマイズされたLLMチャットボットの利用体験を分析し、カスタマイズプロセスと感情支援の有効性に関する洞察を得る。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、ユーザーが特定の感情ニーズに適応可能なLLMチャットボットを効果的にカスタマイズでき、感情的健康が向上することを示すが、応答の感受性と適切性の継続的確保には課題が残る。

title: Relatedness Technologies: An Online Compendium and Systematic Review
authors: Wenhart, Christiane and Ringfort-Felner, Ronda and Wallbaum, Torben and Amidi, Maryam and Albers, Ruben and Hassenzahl, Marc
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents a systematic review and compendium of 'relatedness technologies,' exploring their role in enhancing social interactions through technology.
problem_english: Addressing the challenge of understanding and cataloging technologies that foster social relatedness is critical. Many existing technologies overlook or inadequately emphasize the importance of building meaningful connections, leading to a gap in the literature on technologies that effectively create and maintain social bonds.
method_english: The authors conducted a systematic review of existing literature, categorizing various relatedness technologies based on their functionalities, user demographics, and contexts of use. They created an online compendium for easy access, utilizing qualitative analysis to extract insights from studies reviewed.
results_english: Findings suggest that relatedness technologies significantly impact social connections, with diverse applications across personal and professional domains. The compendium serves as a valuable resource, offering researchers and practitioners insights into effective technologies for enhancing social relatedness.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、社会的相互作用を強化する「関連技術」の体系的レビューとコンペンジウムを提示します。
problem_japanese: 社会的関連性を促進する技術を理解し、カタログ化する課題に対応することは重要です。多くの既存技術は、意義のある人間関係の構築を重視していないか、適切に強調していないため、社会的絆を効果的に形成・維持できる技術に関する文献にはギャップがあります。
method_japanese: 著者は既存文献の体系的レビューを行い、機能やユーザー属性、使用状況に基づいて関連技術を分類しました。オンラインコンペンジウムを作成し、質的分析でレビューされた研究から洞察を抽出しました。
results_japanese: 関連技術が社会的なつながりに大きな影響を持つことが示され、個人および職業領域における多様な応用が確認されました。コンペンジウムは、社会的関連性を向上させるための有効な技術への洞察を提供する貴重なリソースとなります。

title: Squeeze Away the Worries: Exploring the Potential of Squeezable Interactions for Emotion Regulation for Desk Workers
authors: Zhou, Nianmei and Devleminck, Steven and Geurts, Lucca
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the potential of squeezable interactions in regulating emotions for desk workers, examining its effectiveness and feasibility in the context of human-computer interaction.
problem_english: Desk workers often face stress and anxiety, affecting their productivity and well-being. Traditional methods for emotion regulation may not be effectively integrated into the work environment. The study addresses the need for innovative, accessible, and effective solutions specifically designed to aid emotion regulation in desk work settings.
method_english: The researchers designed a series of squeezable prototypes to investigate their impact on emotion regulation for desk workers. They conducted experiments to evaluate the prototypes' effectiveness, gathering data on user experience and emotional responses, comparing results with other emotion regulation tools.
results_english: Findings demonstrated that squeezable interactions could serve as effective tools for emotion regulation among desk workers. Participants reported improved mood and reductions in stress levels when engaging with the prototypes, suggesting potential for integration into workplace settings.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、スクイーズ可能なインタラクションがデスクワーク中の感情調整にどのように寄与できるかを探り、その有効性を検証します。
problem_japanese: デスクワーカーはしばしばストレスや不安を抱え、生産性や健康を損なうことがあります。従来の感情調整方法は作業環境に効果的に組み込まれていない場合が多く、特にデスクワーク環境に合わせた革新的でアクセス可能かつ効果的な解決策が必要とされています。
method_japanese: 研究者は一連のスクイーズプロトタイプを設計し、デスクワーカーの感情調整に対する影響を調査。実験を通じてプロトタイプの有効性を評価し、他の感情調整ツールとの比較データを収集。
results_japanese: 結果は、スクイーズ可能なインタラクションが感情調整に効果的であることを示しました。参加者はプロトタイプを使用することで気分が良くなり、ストレスが軽減されたと報告し、職場への導入の可能性を示唆しました。

title: Toward Affective Empathy via Personalized Analogy Generation: A Case Study on Microaggression
authors: Ju, Hyojin and Lee, Jungeun and Yang, Seungwon and Ok, Jungseul and Hwang, Inseok
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores personalized analogy generation to foster affective empathy, particularly regarding microaggressions, aiming to improve emotional understanding and communication.
problem_english: Addressing microaggressions often lacks emotional empathy and understanding. Existing methods insufficiently convey the emotional impact of such experiences to those unfamiliar with them, hindering effective communication and emotional connection.
method_english: The method involves creating personalized analogies based on individuals' experiences to better convey the emotional impact of microaggressions, leveraging computational techniques to generate relatable scenarios for improved empathy and understanding.
results_english: Personalized analogies were shown to significantly enhance emotional understanding and empathy among individuals unfamiliar with microaggressions, leading to improved interpersonal communication and awareness of such issues.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、感情的共感を促進するために、特にマイクロアグレッションに関して、パーソナライズされた類似の生成を探ります。
problem_japanese: マイクロアグレッションへの対処は感情的共感と理解を欠くことが多く、従来の方法はこのような経験の感情的影響を伝えることが不十分であり、効果的なコミュニケーションと感情的なつながりを妨げている。
method_japanese: 個々の経験に基づいてパーソナライズされた類似を生成し、マイクロアグレッションの感情的影響をより良く伝える方法を採用。計算技術を利用して共感と理解を向上させるための共感的なシナリオを生成しています。
results_japanese: パーソナライズされた類似は、マイクロアグレッションに不慣れな個人の感情的理解と共感を大幅に向上させ、対人コミュニケーションとこの問題に関する認識を改善しました。

title: “I Want to Think Like an SLP”: A Design Exploration of AI-Supported Home Practice in Speech Therapy
authors: Dangol, Aayushi and Lewis, Aaleyah and Suh, Hyewon and Hong, Xuesi and Meadan, Hedda and Fogarty, James and Kientz, Julie A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores AI-supported systems in speech therapy, emphasizing improving home practice by mimicking Speech-Language Pathologists' (SLP) thinking and enhancing personalized experiences.
problem_english: The challenge addressed in this paper involves the limited effectiveness of current home practice solutions in speech therapy, which often lack personalization and the nuanced expertise of human Speech-Language Pathologists (SLP), crucial for effective therapy.
method_english: The authors design an AI-supported framework that creates tailored home practice plans by analyzing the nuanced decision-making processes of SLPs, leveraging AI technology to simulate expert-like adaptability and personalization in therapy routines.
results_english: The research indicates that the AI-supported approach successfully engages clients by mimicking expert SLP advice, enhances personalized therapy practices at home, and improves user satisfaction compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: 研究は、AIを用いた家庭での言語療法の向上を探求し、SLPの思考を模倣して個別化を強化します。
problem_japanese: 現在の言語療法の家庭練習ソリューションの限られた効果を改善することが本研究の課題です。それらは個別化や、人間のSLPの専門的知識に欠けています。
method_japanese: 著者は、AI技術を利用してSLPの意思決定プロセスを分析し、専門家のような適応性と個別化を持つ家庭練習計画を作成するAI支援の枠組みを設計しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、AI支援のアプローチがSLPの専門的アドバイスを模倣し、家庭での個別化された療法実践を強化し、従来の方法に比べてユーザー満足度を向上させることを示しました。

title: "Watch My Health, Not My Data": Understanding Perceptions, Barriers, Emotional Impact, \& Coping Strategies Pertaining to IoT Privacy and Security in Health Monitoring for Older Adults
authors: Saka, Suleiman and Das, Sanchari
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores older adults' perceptions of IoT privacy and security in health monitoring, identifying emotional impacts and coping strategies.
problem_english: The paper addresses privacy and security concerns related to IoT-based health monitoring systems for older adults, highlighting how these issues affect their willingness to adopt such technologies.
method_english: The researchers conducted qualitative interviews and focus groups with older adults to understand their perceptions, barriers, emotional impacts, and coping strategies concerning IoT privacy and security in health monitoring.
results_english: Findings reveal significant privacy concerns, emotional distress, and barriers to adopting IoT health monitoring. Participants expressed a preference for systems that prioritize health over data security.
summary_japanese: 高齢者の健康モニタリングにおけるIoTのプライバシー・セキュリティに関する認識を探り、感情的影響と対処法を明らかにする。
problem_japanese: 高齢者向けIoTベースの健康モニタリングシステムに関するプライバシーとセキュリティの問題を取り上げ、これらの問題が技術採用意欲に与える影響を強調する。
method_japanese: 研究者は高齢者との質的インタビューとフォーカスグループを実施し、IoT健康モニタリングに関する認識、障壁、感情的影響、対処法を特定した。
results_japanese: プライバシーに関する重大な懸念と感情的な苦痛、IoT健康モニタリングの採用障壁が明らかになった。参加者は健康を重視するシステムを好む。

title: Choose From a List: A User Study of Random Password Memorability
authors: Clark, Michael and Snow, Gregory L and Seamons, Kent
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the memorability of random passwords chosen from lists, aiming to assess their practicality and effectiveness for users. The researchers conducted a user study to evaluate how well users remember such passwords over time.
problem_english: The main problem addressed in this research is the trade-off between security and memorability in password systems. Random passwords are generally more secure but are hard for users to remember. The study aims to assess whether choosing from a list can improve memorability without compromising security.
method_english: The authors conducted a controlled user study where participants were asked to memorize and recall passwords that were randomly generated and selected from a list. Different list lengths and presentation methods were tested to measure the memorability of these passwords over a set time period.
results_english: The results showed that passwords selected from shorter lists were more memorable compared to those selected from longer lists, without a significant increase in security risk. Moreover, certain presentation methods improved memorability. These findings suggest feasible enhancements in password system design.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、リストから選択したランダムパスワードの記憶性を調査し、その実用性と有効性を評価します。
problem_japanese: この研究が取り組む主な課題は、パスワードシステムにおけるセキュリティと記憶性のトレードオフです。ランダムパスワードは一般に安全ですが、ユーザーには記憶しにくいです。リストからの選択が記憶性を向上させるか評価します。
method_japanese: リストから選択されたランダムパスワードを記憶し、想起するよう参加者に求めた制御されたユーザー研究を実施しました。記憶性を測定するために、リストの長さや提示方法を変えてテストしました。
results_japanese: 短いリストから選択されたパスワードのほうが長いリストからのものより記憶性が高いことがわかりました。また、一部の提示方法が記憶性を向上させることが示され、パスワードシステムの設計改善が示唆されました。

title: I Was Told to Install the Antivirus App, but I'm Not Sure I Need It: Understanding Smartphone Antivirus Software Adoption and User Perceptions
authors: Jin, Seyoung and Baek, Heewon and Lee, Uichin and Kim, Hyoungshick
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores smartphone antivirus software adoption by investigating user perceptions, motivations, and barriers. It employs mixed methods to identify factors influencing usage and satisfaction.
problem_english: The problem addressed is the uncertain need for smartphone antivirus apps despite their availability and recommendations, with users unclear about their efficacy and necessity. It raises questions about adoption barriers and perceptions affecting software usage.
method_english: The methods employed include surveys and interviews with smartphone users, combined with a quantitative analysis of antivirus software adoption rates. This mixed-method approach helps to understand user motivations and challenges in using antivirus apps.
results_english: The results indicate variable user perceptions of smartphone antivirus software's necessity. Adoption is often driven by external advice rather than perceived personal need, highlighting gaps in understanding and trust issues.
summary_japanese: この研究は、スマートフォンウイルス対策ソフトウェアの採用をユーザーの認識、動機、および障壁を調査することで探求しています。
problem_japanese: スマートフォンウイルス対策アプリの必要性は明確でないため、その効果や必要性についてユーザーが不明瞭な状況が問題となっている。採用時の障壁や認識が使用に影響を与えている。
method_japanese: 調査とインタビューを用いてスマートフォンユーザーを対象にし、ウイルス対策ソフトウェアの採用率を量的に分析する。混合方法により動機と困難を理解する。
results_japanese: 結果として、ウイルス対策ソフトの必要性に対するユーザーの認識が変動し、外部の助言により採用される場合が多い。理解と信頼にはギャップがあることが明らかになった。

title: Measuring Risks to Users' Health Privacy Posed by Third-Party Web Tracking and Targeted Advertising
authors: Zeng, Eric and Wu, Xiaoyuan and Ertmann, Emily N. and Huang, Lily and Johnson, Danielle F. and Mehendale, Anusha T. and Tang, Brandon T. and Zhukoff, Karolina and Adjei-Poku, Michael and Bauer, Lujo and Friedman, Ari B. and McCoy, Matthew S.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines third-party web tracking and targeted advertising's risks to users' health privacy, assessing the exposure and implications of health-related data breaches.
problem_english: The paper addresses the significant risks posed by third-party web tracking and targeted advertising on users' health privacy. Despite the crucial nature of this concern, there is limited understanding of how user health data is exposed, accessed, or potentially misused by these online entities.
method_english: The authors employed a multi-step approach, initially categorizing data from various health websites, then analyzing third-party tracking scripts. Finally, they simulated user interactions to evaluate potential privacy breaches and assess the extent of data exposure and misuse risks.
results_english: The study found that a substantial amount of users' health-related data is exposed to third-party trackers. The extent of data sharing and potential misuse was notably high, with several third-party entities accessing sensitive health information, raising significant privacy concerns.
summary_japanese: 本研究は第三者トラッキングとターゲティング広告がユーザーの健康プライバシーに与えるリスクを分析し、データ漏洩の影響を評価しています。
problem_japanese: 第三者ウェブ追跡とターゲティング広告がユーザーの健康プライバシーに与える大きなリスクに着目。この問題の重要性にもかかわらず、ユーザーの健康データがどのように露出、アクセス、悪用される可能性があるかの理解が不足している。
method_japanese: 初めに様々な健康関連サイトのデータを分類し、次に第三者によるトラッキングスクリプトを分析。さらにユーザー操作を模擬し、プライバシー侵害の可能性とデータ露出の範囲を評価した。
results_japanese: 多くのユーザーの健康関連データが第三者トラッカーに露出していることを発見。データ共有と悪用の可能性は高く、いくつかの第三者がデリケートな健康情報にアクセスしているという懸念が生まれている。

title: PrivCAPTCHA: Interactive CAPTCHA to Facilitate Effective Comprehension of APP Privacy Policy
authors: Zhang, Shuning and Yi, Xin and Li, Shixuan and Xing, Haobin and Li, Hewu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PrivCAPTCHA is an interactive tool enhancing users' understanding of app privacy policies, addressing the common issue of neglecting fine print.
problem_english: Users often skip or misunderstand app privacy policies due to their complex language or dull presentation. This ignorance may lead to privacy violations and uninformed data sharing, highlighting the need for improved presentation and comprehension tools.
method_english: PrivCAPTCHA integrates interactive challenges within privacy policies to effectively engage users, using them as a prerequisite for accessing certain app features. It aims to raise user awareness by blending comprehension tasks with conventional CAPTCHA mechanisms.
results_english: Initial studies show PrivCAPTCHA increases user awareness and understanding of privacy policies. It effectively retains user engagement and promotes informed consent, addressing the gap between presentation and comprehension among app users.
summary_japanese: PrivCAPTCHAは、ユーザーのアプリプライバシーポリシー理解を向上させる対話型ツールで、細かな情報を見逃す問題に取り組む。
problem_japanese: ユーザーは複雑な言語や退屈な呈示方法により、アプリプライバシーポリシーを読み飛ばしたり誤解することが多い。この無視はプライバシー侵害や無意識のデータ共有につながるため、改善策が求められる。
method_japanese: PrivCAPTCHAは、プライバシーポリシー内に参加型の課題を組み込み、ユーザーの関与を促進することで、特定アプリ機能へのアクセス時に理解を促進する。本手法は理解タスクとCAPTCHAを組み合わせる。
results_japanese: 初期研究により、PrivCAPTCHAはプライバシーポリシーへのユーザー認識度と理解度を向上させることが示された。ユーザーの関与を持続させ、情報に基づく同意を促進する。

title: Understanding and Improving User Adoption and Security Awareness in Password Checkup Services
authors: Oh, Sanghak and Baek, Heewon and Huh, Jun Ho and Kim, Taeyoung and Jeon, Woojin and Oakley, Ian and Kim, Hyoungshick
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study focuses on improving user adoption and security awareness in password checkup services by identifying factors influencing user behavior and proposing enhancements.
problem_english: Many users are unaware of compromised passwords, posing security risks. The challenge lies in increasing user adoption and awareness about password checkup services, enabling users to effectively manage and secure their passwords.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies to understand behavior and barriers in password checkup service adoption. They analyzed current services, user feedback, and security awareness, and developed improved strategies for enhancing user engagement and comprehension.
results_english: The study found key barriers to user adoption and security awareness in password checkup services. Proposed strategies increased user engagement, improved awareness, and resulted in more proactive password management behaviors among participants.
summary_japanese: 研究は、パスワードチェックサービスのユーザー採用とセキュリティ意識向上を目指し、影響要因の特定と改善策を提案する。
problem_japanese: 多くのユーザーが流出したパスワードについて認識不足であり、セキュリティリスクを抱える。課題は、パスワードチェックサービスの利用促進と意識向上にあり、ユーザーが効果的に管理・保護できるようにすることだ。
method_japanese: パスワードチェックサービスの採用における行動と障壁を理解するためユーザー調査を実施、現在のサービスやユーザーのフィードバック、セキュリティ意識を分析し、利用促進の戦略を開発した。
results_japanese: 研究により、ユーザーのサービス採用やセキュリティ意識における主要な障壁が判明した。提案された戦略は、ユーザーの関与度を高め、意識を向上させ、より積極的なパスワード管理行動を促進した。

title: “All Sorts of Other Reasons to Do It”: Explaining the Persistence of Sub-optimal IoT Security Advice
authors: van Harten, Veerle and Ganan, Carlos Hernandez and van Eeten, Michel and Parkin, Simon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates why IoT security advice remains sub-optimal. Factors influencing this persistence are uncovered through qualitative analysis of stakeholder discussions and guidance materials.
problem_english: The paper addresses the ongoing issue of inadequate IoT security advice, despite growing recognition of IoT vulnerabilities. This sub-optimal guidance persists due to complexities in stakeholder motivations, priorities, and communication, impacting effective security management.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative research methods, including stakeholder interviews and analysis of IoT-related guidance materials, to identify motivations and barriers preventing better security advice. This approach helps to uncover underlying reasons for the persistence of poor practices.
results_english: The study reveals that conflicting priorities and diverse motivations among stakeholders contribute to inadequate IoT security advice. Highlighting needs for better collaboration and understanding of stakeholder goals to enhance security practices.
summary_japanese: IoTセキュリティの助言が依然として不十分である理由を探求し、関係者の議論と指導資料の質的分析によって要因を明らかにする。
problem_japanese: IoTの脆弱性が認識されているにもかかわらず、依然として不十分なIoTセキュリティの助言が続いている問題に対処。この助言の最適化されない状況は、関係者の動機、優先事項、コミュニケーションの複雑さが影響し、効果的なセキュリティ管理を阻害している。
method_japanese: 質的研究方法を用い、関係者インタビューおよびIoT関連指導資料の分析を実施。セキュリティ助言改善を妨げる動機と障壁を特定し、劣悪な慣行が持続する根本原因を明らかにする。
results_japanese: 研究は関係者間の優先事項の相違と多様な動機が不十分なIoTセキュリティ助言に寄与していると明らかにした。セキュリティ実践を強化するための協力と関係者目標の理解の改善が必要であることを示す。

title: Access Denied: Meaningful Data Access for Quantitative Algorithm Audits
authors: Zaccour, Juliette and Binns, Reuben and Rocher, Luc
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the challenges and mechanisms of providing meaningful data access for quantitative algorithm audits. The authors propose frameworks to ensure effective auditing while protecting sensitive data.
problem_english: Quantitative algorithm audits require access to sensitive data, but balancing transparency with privacy protections is challenging. Current methods often fall short, either compromising privacy or limiting audit capabilities, necessitating new approaches to ensure both effective auditing and data protection.
method_english: The authors propose new frameworks and methodologies that prioritize both data privacy and audit capability. They advocate for controlled data access mechanisms, utilizing techniques like differential privacy and secure multi-party computations to facilitate audits without compromising sensitive information.
results_english: The proposed methodologies successfully provide a balance between data access for auditing and privacy protection. The frameworks offer promising solutions that empower auditors to assess algorithms effectively while safeguarding individual privacy, demonstrating potential for broader adoption in responsible algorithm auditing practices.
summary_japanese: データアクセスとアルゴリズム監査のバランスを図る方法を探究し、個人情報保護と効果的な監査の両立を提案します。
problem_japanese: 定量的アルゴリズム監査にはセンシティブなデータアクセスが必要ですが、透明性とプライバシーのバランスを取ることは困難です。現行の方法はしばしばプライバシーを侵害するか、監査能力を制限しており、新たなアプローチが必要です。
method_japanese: データプライバシーと監査能力を重視した新たな枠組みを提案。差分プライバシーやセキュアなマルチパーティ計算を活用した管理されたデータアクセスを提案し、センシティブ情報を守りつつ監査を可能にします。
results_japanese: 提案された方法は、データアクセスとプライバシー保護のバランスを成功裏に実現しました。この枠組みは、効果的な監査を可能にしつつ個人情報を保護する有望な解決策を提供し、広範な採用の可能性を示しています。

title: Dango: A Mixed-Initiative Data Wrangling System using Large Language Model
authors: Chen, Wei-Hao and Tong, Weixi and Case, Amanda and Zhang, Tianyi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Dango is a system integrating large language models to improve data wrangling by facilitating mixed-initiative interactions between users and the models.
problem_english: Data wrangling remains a challenging process due to its requirement for both domain expertise and complex tool interactions, making it inaccessible for non-experts and inefficient for data professionals.
method_english: Dango leverages large language models to enable mixed-initiative interactions, allowing users to initiate tasks with natural language inputs and receive contextual assistance, improving accessibility and efficiency in data wrangling.
results_english: Dango enhances user productivity in data wrangling tasks, showing significant reductions in task completion time and increased user satisfaction compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: Dangoは、大規模言語モデルを利用してデータ整形を改善し、ユーザーとモデル間の混合イニシアティブを促進するシステムです。
problem_japanese: データ整形は専門知識と複雑なツール操作が必要で、非専門家にはアクセスしづらく、データ専門家にとっても効率的ではありません。
method_japanese: Dangoは言語モデルを活用し、自然言語での入力によりユーザーがタスクを開始し、文脈に合わせた支援を受けることでデータ整形のアクセス性と効率を向上させます。
results_japanese: Dangoはデータ整形のタスクでユーザーの生産性を向上させ、従来法と比較してタスク完了時間短縮とユーザー満足度の向上を示しました。

title: Disentangling the Power Dynamics in Participatory Data Physicalisation
authors: Cazacu, Silvia and Panagiotidou, Georgia and Steenberghen, Therese and Moere, Andrew Vande
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates the power dynamics in participatory data physicalisation processes, examining how stakeholders engage and influence outcomes.
problem_english: The study addresses the gap in understanding the underlying power dynamics during participatory data physicalisation, as these dynamics can significantly affect stakeholder engagement and influence outcomes. Identifying these hidden factors is crucial for designing fairer and more inclusive participatory processes.
method_english: The authors utilized qualitative research methods, including interviews and workshops with participants involved in participatory data physicalisation projects, to identify and analyze power relationships and their implications on the process.
results_english: Findings indicate that power imbalances are prevalent and greatly affect engagement and outcomes. The study offers insights and guidelines for better managing these dynamics, aiming to enhance inclusivity and fairness in participatory data physicalisation processes.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、参加型データ物理化プロセスでの権力ダイナミクスを調査し、関係者の関与と影響を検討します。
problem_japanese: 参加型データ物理化の過程で生じる権力ダイナミクスの理解不足に着目。このダイナミクスは参加者の関与と成果に大きな影響を与えるため、これらを明らかにし公正で包括的なプロセス設計が必要とされる。
method_japanese: 著者らはインタビューやワークショップを通じ、参加型データ物理化プロジェクトでの力関係とその影響を識別し分析する質的研究手法を用いた。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、権力の不均衡が広範に存在し、関与と成果に大きく影響することを示しています。この研究は、包括性と公正性を向上させるためのガイドラインを提供します。

title: Management, Cooperation, and Sustainability: Unpacking the Data Practices of Housing Cooperatives
authors: Verma, Priyanka and Rifat, Mohammad Rashidujjaman and Sabie, Samar
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how housing cooperatives manage data practices to enhance cooperation and sustainability in housing management, focusing on efficient resource sharing and community involvement.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of effectively managing data practices in housing cooperatives, which is crucial for optimizing cooperation and sustainability. These cooperatives often face difficulties in ensuring shared resource management and active community participation, which can impair their overall effectiveness and sustainability.
method_english: The authors employ a mixed-methods approach, including qualitative case studies and data analysis, to investigate the data practices of housing cooperatives. They analyze how these practices influence cooperative management, community engagement, and sustainable resource use, drawing insights from multiple cooperative cases.
results_english: The study finds that effective data management practices in housing cooperatives lead to improved cooperation and sustainability. By involving community members in data-driven decisions, cooperatives achieve better resource allocation, enhanced community engagement, and heightened sustainability outcomes.
summary_japanese: 住宅協同組合の管理とデータ実践が協力と持続可能性を強化する方法を探る。
problem_japanese: 住宅協同組合における効果的なデータ管理の課題に取り組む。共有資源の管理と地域社会の参加が困難を伴い、協同組合の有効性と持続可能性が低下しがち。
method_japanese: 質的ケーススタディとデータ分析を組み合わせ、協同組合の事例から管理や資源利用への影響を探る方法を用いる。
results_japanese: データ管理の効果的実践は協力と持続可能性を向上させる。データ駆動の意思決定に地域社会を巻き込むことで、協同組合は資源配分やエンゲージメント、持続可能性で成果を上げる。

title: RidgeBuilder: Interactive Authoring of Expressive Ridgeline Plots
authors: Liu, Shuhan and Liu, Yangtian and Li, Junxin and Huang, Yanwei and Shangguan, Yue and Deng, Zikun and Weng, Di and Wu, Yingcai
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces RidgeBuilder, a tool for creating expressive ridgeline plots interactively. It enhances data visualization by enabling customized plot design.
problem_english: Current ridgeline plots often lack interactive capabilities and customization options, limiting their ability to effectively interpret complex data sets and hinders user engagement in data visualization tasks.
method_english: RidgeBuilder incorporates an interactive authoring environment, enabling users to manipulate parameters such as color, line thickness, and spacing in real-time. It combines these features with an intuitive design interface to enhance user control.
results_english: The study demonstrated that RidgeBuilder significantly improves user engagement and accuracy in data interpretation tasks. User feedback highlighted the tool's ease of use and its capabilities to create visually appealing plots.
summary_japanese: RidgeBuilderは、表現力豊かなリッジラインプロットを対話的に作成するツールです。データ可視化を強化し、カスタマイズを可能にします。
problem_japanese: 現在のリッジラインプロットにはインタラクティブ能力やカスタマイズの選択肢が欠け、複雑なデータセットの解釈が困難でユーザーのデータ可視化作業の参加が制限されています。
method_japanese: RidgeBuilderはインタラクティブな作成環境を取り入れ、色、線の太さ、間隔などをリアルタイムで操作可能にし、直感的なデザインインターフェースでユーザー制御を強化します。
results_japanese: RidgeBuilderはユーザーの参加とデータ解釈の正確性を向上させることを実証しました。ユーザーからは使いやすさと視覚的な魅力が高く評価されました。

title: StructVizor: Interactive Profiling of Semi-Structured Textual Data
authors: Huang, Yanwei and Miao, Yan and Weng, Di and Perer, Adam and Wu, Yingcai
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: StructVizor is an approach to interactively profile semi-structured textual data, facilitating insightful analyses through visualizations tailored for exploring complex data structures.
problem_english: Analyzing semi-structured textual data poses challenges due to its inherently complex and irregular nature, requiring flexible and effective tools for understanding and extracting meaningful insights from these datasets.
method_english: StructVizor utilizes interactive visualizations to allow users to explore and profile semi-structured textual data, providing customizable views and tools that adapt to various data structures to enhance user comprehension and analysis efficacy.
results_english: The application of StructVizor demonstrates improved efficiency in profiling semi-structured textual data, enabling users to easily navigate, analyze, and extract actionable insights, thus confirming the effectiveness of this interactive visualization approach.
summary_japanese: StructVizorは、半構造化テキストデータの直観的な分析を支援するためのインタラクティブなプロファイリング手法を提供します。
problem_japanese: 半構造化テキストデータの分析は、その複雑で不規則な性質のため、理解と意味のある洞察の抽出のための柔軟で効果的なツールを要求されます。
method_japanese: StructVizorは、インタラクティブな視覚化を用いて、ユーザーが半構造化テキストデータを探索・プロファイリングできるようにし、データ構造に応じたカスタマイズ可能なビューとツールを提供することで、理解と分析の効率を向上させます。
results_japanese: StructVizorの適用によって、半構造化テキストデータのプロファイリング効率が改善され、ユーザーが容易にデータを分析し、洞察を引き出すことができるようになり、このインタラクティブ視覚化アプローチの有効性が確認されました。

title: Unveiling High-dimensional Backstage: A Survey for Reliable Visual Analytics with Dimensionality Reduction
authors: Jeon, Hyeon and Lee, Hyunwook and Kuo, Yun-Hsin and Yang, Taehyun and Archambault, Daniel and Ko, Sungahn and Fujiwara, Takanori and Ma, Kwan-Liu and Seo, Jinwook
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper surveys methodologies for achieving reliable visual analytics using dimensionality reduction in high-dimensional data scenarios.
problem_english: High-dimensional data often complicates visual analytics due to challenges in preserving data reliability during dimensionality reduction, impacting the quality of insights drawn from visualizations.
method_english: The authors examine existing dimensionality reduction techniques, comparing their strengths and weaknesses, to identify strategies ensuring reliable analytics without compromising the integrity of data representations.
results_english: Insights from the survey highlight key considerations and best practices for applying dimensionality reduction, ensuring that visual analytics remain trustworthy and informative despite the complexities of high-dimensional data.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、高次元データのシナリオにおける次元削減を用いた信頼性のある視覚分析のための方法論を調査する。
problem_japanese: 高次元データは、次元削減によるデータの信頼性保持が難しく、視覚化から得られる洞察の質に影響を与え、視覚分析を複雑にする。
method_japanese: 著者は既存の次元削減技術を比較し、データ表現の整合性を損なわずに信頼性のある分析を保証する戦略を特定する。
results_japanese: 調査からの洞察は、次元削減を適用する際の主な考慮事項とベストプラクティスを示し、高次元データの複雑性にもかかわらず視覚分析の信頼性と情報性を確保する。

title: "Why do we do this?": Moral Stress and the Affective Experience of Ethics in Practice
authors: Rattay, Sonja and Vakkuri, Ville and Rozendaal, Marco C. and Shklovski, Irina
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates moral stress and the affective experience of ethical dilemmas faced by professionals in practice. It highlights ethical challenges and the emotional impact of decision-making.
problem_english: The study addresses the gap in understanding how professionals experience moral stress and ethical dilemmas in practice. It emphasizes the lack of research on the emotional impact of these experiences and the need to explore how such stress affects decision-making and ethical judgments.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative methods, including interviews and observations, to investigate the emotional and moral experiences of professionals. They analyze these experiences to understand how ethical dilemmas and moral stress manifest in practice and affect professionals' decision-making.
results_english: The findings reveal that moral stress significantly affects professionals' emotional and ethical outcomes. The study underscores the importance of addressing moral stress in practice, suggesting that support mechanisms and ethical guidelines can help professionals better navigate complex ethical dilemmas.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、専門家が直面する道徳的ストレスと倫理的課題の感情的影響を探求しています。
problem_japanese: この研究は、実践において専門家が経験する道徳的ストレスや倫理的ジレンマの理解におけるギャップに対処しています。これらの経験の感情的影響に関する研究が不足しており、ストレスが意思決定や倫理的判断に与える影響を探る必要性が強調されています。
method_japanese: 著者は質的調査方法（インタビューと観察）を用いて、専門家の感情的および道徳的経験を調査しています。倫理的ジレンマと道徳的ストレスが実践でどのように現れ、専門家の意思決定に影響を与えるかを理解するための分析を行います。
results_japanese: 結果は、道徳的ストレスが専門家の感情的および倫理的結果に大きく影響を与えていることを示しています。研究は、実践における道徳的ストレスへの対処の重要性を強調し、支援機構や倫理ガイドラインが専門家が複雑な倫理的ジレンマをより良くナビゲートできるようにすることを示唆しています。

title: A Feminist Care Ethics Toolkit for Community-Based Design: Bridging Theory and Practice
authors: Henriques, Ana O and Carter, Anna R. L. and Severes, Beatriz and Talhouk, Reem and Strohmayer, Angelika and Pires, Ana Cristina and Gray, Colin M. and Montague, Kyle and Nicolau, Hugo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a Feminist Care Ethics Toolkit for community-based design, aiming to bridge theoretical concepts with practical applications in human-computer interaction (HCI) and design fields.
problem_english: Many design processes lack consideration for care ethics, which is crucial for addressing diverse needs and ethical dilemmas in community-based design. The challenge lies in effectively integrating feminist care ethics into practical design processes, especially within HCI, to ensure inclusivity and attentiveness to those often marginalized.
method_english: The authors developed a toolkit grounded in feminist care ethics principles, designed to guide practitioners in community-based design. The toolkit provides a set of practices and guidelines, drawing from feminist care ethics theory, to help designers incorporate care-centric perspectives into their processes.
results_english: The application of the toolkit demonstrated enhanced awareness and incorporation of care ethics in design practices. It facilitated reflection and collaboration among designers and stakeholders, ultimately enriching the design process and outcomes by fostering inclusivity and ethical awareness.
summary_japanese: コミュニティベースのデザインにおけるフェミニストケア倫理キットを提案し、理論と実践を結びつける。
problem_japanese: 多くのデザインプロセスには、コミュニティベースのデザインにおいて多様なニーズや倫理的ジレンマに対応するために重要なケア倫理の考慮が欠けている。HCIにおいて、フェミニストケア倫理を効果的に実践に組み込むことが課題だ。
method_japanese: フェミニストケア倫理の原則を基にしたツールキットを開発し、コミュニティベースのデザインにおける実践者をガイドする。ケア中心の視点をプロセスに取り入れるための実践とガイドラインを提供する。
results_japanese: ツールキットによって、デザイン実務におけるケア倫理の意識と取り込みが強化された。デザイナーと関係者間の反省と協力を促進し、包摂性と倫理意識を高めることでデザインプロセスとその結果を豊かにした。

title: Design Courts: Workshops for Exploring Emerging Technology Ethics
authors: Primlani, Namrata and Blythe, Mark and Marshall, Justin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces Design Courts, innovative workshops designed to address ethical concerns surrounding emerging technologies through engaging discussions and activities.
problem_english: The rapid development of emerging technologies brings about complex ethical challenges that are often inadequately addressed due to a lack of structured methods for ethical exploration and discourse within technology design and implementation processes.
method_english: Design Courts are structured workshops that facilitate interactive engagement with ethical dilemmas in technology. Participants engage in role-play and debate to explore multiple perspectives and develop nuanced understandings of ethical issues associated with emerging technologies.
results_english: Participants in Design Courts reported increased understanding and awareness of ethical issues in technology. The workshops fostered richer dialogues and contributed to enhanced critical thinking about technology ethics, encouraging designers to integrate ethical considerations into their work.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、技術の倫理問題に対処するためのワークショップ「デザインコート」を紹介。
problem_japanese: 新興技術の急速な進展は複雑な倫理的課題を生むが、技術設計・実施における倫理探求の体系的手法が不足しており、十分に対処されていない。
method_japanese: デザインコートは参加者が役割演技と討論を通じて技術の倫理的課題を探求する体験型ワークショップで、多角的視点から技術の倫理問題を理解することを目指す。
results_japanese: デザインコートの参加者は、技術に関する倫理課題への理解が向上し、対話が深化し、設計に倫理的視点を取り入れることが奨励されたことが報告された。

title: Development of the Critical Reflection and Agency in Computing Index
authors: Padiyath, Aadarsh and Guzdial, Mark and Ericson, Barbara
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a new index to measure critical reflection and agency in computing education, offering insights into educational effectiveness and student engagement.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is the lack of reliable measures for critical reflection and agency in computing education, which hinders understanding how students perceive and engage with technology learning experiences.
method_english: The authors developed the index through iterative design, validated it via pilot studies with diverse computing students, and employed qualitative and quantitative methods to ensure reliability and relevance.
results_english: The index showed strong reliability and validity, providing educators with a valuable tool to assess transformative learning aspects and fostering an environment that promotes critical engagement with computing.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、コンピューティング教育における批判的反省とエージェンシーを測定する新たな指標を紹介します。
problem_japanese: コンピューティング教育における批判的反省とエージェンシーを信頼性高く測定する指標が不足しており、学生の学習体験の理解を妨げている問題に取り組んでいます。
method_japanese: 著者は、指標を反復的に設計し、多様なコンピューティング学生を対象としたパイロットスタディで検証し、質的および量的方法を用いて信頼性と妥当性を確保しました。
results_japanese: この指標は高い信頼性と妥当性を示し、教育者に変革的な学習の側面を評価する貴重なツールを提供し、コンピューティングへの批判的関与を促進する環境を育成します。

title: Ethics Reflexivity Canvas: Resourcing Ethical Sensitivity for HCI Educators
authors: Ahmadpour, Naseem and Pillai, Ajit G. and Zhang, Wendy Qi and Loke, Lian and Sachathep, Thida and Zhou, Zhaohua and Gough, Phillip
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces the Ethics Reflexivity Canvas to help HCI educators develop ethical sensitivity. It provides resources and a structured approach to reflect on ethical issues in HCI.
problem_english: Human-Computer Interaction education often lacks structured resources to help educators cultivate ethical sensitivity among students. There is a limited framework to guide educators in integrating ethical reflection into their curriculum effectively.
method_english: The authors developed the Ethics Reflexivity Canvas, a tool that guides educators through a structured reflection process, addressing ethical issues in HCI education. It includes activities, prompts, and resources designed to foster deeper ethical understanding.
results_english: The Ethics Reflexivity Canvas successfully engaged HCI educators in meaningful ethical reflection, leading to improved ethical sensitivity. Educators found it helpful and adaptable for integrating into curricula, enhancing discussions on ethical aspects.
summary_japanese: 論文では、HCI教育者の倫理的感性を向上させるための倫理的反省キャンバスを紹介。倫理問題について考える体系的な方法を提供。
problem_japanese: ヒューマンコンピュータインタラクション教育には、生徒の倫理的感性を育むための体系的なリソースが欠けている。倫理的反省を有効にカリキュラムに統合するためのフレームワークが限定されている。
method_japanese: 倫理的反省キャンバスを開発し、教育者がHCI教育の倫理問題を考える際の構造化された反省プロセスを案内するツールとして設計。活動やプロンプト、リソースを含む。
results_japanese: 倫理的反省キャンバスの活用で、HCI教育者は倫理的感性を向上させる意味深い反省を実践。教育者はカリキュラムへの統合に役立つと評価し、倫理的議論を深化させた。

title: Friction in Processual Ethics: Reconfiguring Ethical Relations in Interdisciplinary Research
authors: Garrett, Rachael and Brundell, Patrick and Castle-Green, Simon and Hawkins, Kat and Tennent, Paul and Zhou, Feng and Lampinen, Airi and H\"{o}\"{o}k, Kristina and Benford, Steve
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the concept of friction in the context of processual ethics within interdisciplinary research. It focuses on reconfiguring ethical relations to better address collaborative challenges.
problem_english: Interdisciplinary research often involves complex ethical challenges due to differing disciplinary norms, values, and practices. These variations can create friction which hinders effective collaboration and ethical integration. Addressing these frictions is crucial for fostering more harmonious and productive interdisciplinary work.
method_english: The study uses a qualitative approach to explore the dynamics of friction in ethical relations during interdisciplinary research collaborations. It includes case studies and interviews with researchers from diverse fields to identify and analyze ethical tension points and potential strategies for reconfiguration.
results_english: The findings highlight specific sources of friction in interdisciplinary work, such as conflicting ethical standards and communication barriers. The study proposes strategies for reconfiguring these relations, including enhanced dialogue, shared ethical frameworks, and adaptive negotiation mechanisms.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、プロセス倫理における摩擦の概念を探求し、学際研究における倫理的関係の再構築を目指します。
problem_japanese: 学際研究は、学問分野ごとの異なる倫理規範、価値観、実践による複雑な倫理的課題を伴うことが多い。これらの違いは摩擦を生み出し、効果的な協働と倫理的統合を妨げる要因となる。これらの摩擦への対処が、より調和的で生産的な学際的協働のために重要である。
method_japanese: ケーススタディと多様な分野の研究者へのインタビューによる定性的アプローチを用い、学際的研究での摩擦の力学を探討し、倫理的な緊張点と再構築戦略を分析。
results_japanese: 学際作業での摩擦の具体的要因、例として倫理基準の衝突やコミュニケーション障壁を特定。対話強化や共有倫理枠組み、適応交渉メカニズムの導入を提案。

title: Meaningful Engagement, Ethical Care, and Design Opportunities: An Ethnographic Study on Social Activities in Long-term Care
authors: Yuan, Shuai and Coghlan, Simon and Lederman, Reeva and Waycott, Jenny
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates meaningful engagement in social activities within long-term care through an ethnographic approach, highlighting design opportunities for ethical care technologies.
problem_english: There is a challenge in providing meaningful and ethically appropriate engagement in social activities for long-term care residents, which requires better understanding to develop effective design strategies for care technologies.
method_english: The authors used an ethnographic study approach, incorporating observations and interviews with residents and staff in long-term care facilities to explore the nature of social interaction and engagement.
results_english: Findings reveal the importance of personalized activities, ethical care considerations, and integrate technology design opportunities to enhance social engagement in long-term care environments.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、長期ケア内の社会活動における意味のある関与を民族誌的アプローチで調査し、倫理的なケア技術の設計機会を強調します。
problem_japanese: 長期ケア居住者に対する意味ある倫理的な社会活動の提供が困難であり、ケア技術の効果的なデザイン戦略の開発に向けた理解が求められる。
method_japanese: 著者らは長期ケア施設の居住者とスタッフを対象に、観察とインタビューを通じて社会的な相互作用と関与の性質を探る民族誌的研究手法を採用した。
results_japanese: 結果は、個別化された活動、倫理的ケアの考慮、および技術設計の機会を統合して長期ケア環境での社会的関与を強化することの重要性を示している。

title: "Comforting and Small Like a House Cat, Big and Intimidating Like a Bodyguard": How Women Perceive and Envision AI Companions as a New Harassment Mitigation Approach in Social VR
authors: Freeman, Guo and Schulenberg, Kelsea and Li, Lingyuan and Panchanadikar, Ruchi and McNeese, Nathan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores how women perceive AI companions as tools for harassment mitigation in social VR, likening them to house cats and bodyguards.
problem_english: Harassment in social VR platforms is a significant issue, particularly impacting women. Traditional mitigation strategies are often inadequate, leading to the exploration of innovative solutions like AI companions to enhance user safety and comfort.
method_english: The researchers conducted qualitative interviews with women users of social VR platforms to gather insights into their perceptions and visions of AI companions. They analyzed the data thematically to identify key patterns and perspectives.
results_english: Women envisioned AI companions as comforting yet protective entities, akin to house cats or bodyguards. These companions are seen as potential tools for enhancing virtual safety, addressing the inadequacies of existing harassment mitigation measures.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、女性がソーシャルVRでの嫌がらせ軽減のためのAI連携を家猫やボディガードのように捉えることを探求します。
problem_japanese: ソーシャルVRプラットフォームでの嫌がらせは特に女性にとって深刻な問題であり、従来の軽減策が不十分なため、新たな安全・安心の方法としてAI連携が模索されています。
method_japanese: 研究者たちはソーシャルVRプラットフォームの女性ユーザーに対して定性インタビューを行い、AI連携に対する認識やビジョンを収集し、主題分析を通じて主要なパターンを特定しました。
results_japanese: 女性はAI連携を、家猫のような安らぎとボディガードのような保護のある存在として想定しており、既存の嫌がらせ軽減策の不足を補う潜在的なツールと見なしています。

title: "Like a Love Language": Understanding Communication in Disabled LGBTQIA+ Romantic Relationships
authors: Crawford, Kirk Andrew and Hamidi, Foad
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores communication in disabled LGBTQIA+ romantic relationships, highlighting unique methods of communication. It focuses on understanding mutual support, identity validation, and relationship dynamics, offering insights into challenges and strategies within these relationships.
problem_english: Disabled LGBTQIA+ individuals face communication barriers in romantic relationships due to societal norms and personal circumstances. The paper addresses the need to understand how these individuals develop unique communication methods to support mutual understanding, navigate identity complexities, and foster relationships despite these challenges.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and surveys with disabled LGBTQIA+ individuals, gathering qualitative and quantitative data to explore communication methods. They utilized thematic analysis to identify patterns and strategies within relationships, focusing on how these methods aid relationship maintenance and identity expression among partners.
results_english: The study reveals that disabled LGBTQIA+ couples employ tailored communication strategies to support each other's emotional and physical needs. These methods enhance relationship satisfaction and identity validation. Findings emphasize the importance of flexible and adaptive communication approaches in overcoming relationship-specific challenges.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、障害のあるLGBTQIA+のロマンティックな関係におけるコミュニケーションを探求し、独自の方法を解明します。相互支援とアイデンティティの確認、関係の力学に焦点を当てます。
problem_japanese: 障害を持つLGBTQIA+の個人は、社会的規範や個人的事情によりロマンティックな関係においてコミュニケーション障壁に直面します。この研究は、相互理解のためのユニークなコミュニケーション方法の開発、およびアイデンティティの複雑さの解決方法を理解する必要性を扱います。
method_japanese: 著者は障害のあるLGBTQIA+の人々にインタビューと調査を実施し、定性的および定量的データを収集しました。テーマ分析を用いて関係性のパターンと戦略を特定し、これらの方法がどのように関係維持とアイデンティティ表現を支援するかを探求しました。
results_japanese: 調査によって、障害者のLGBTQIA+カップルは互いの感情的および身体的ニーズをサポートするための特別なコミュニケーション戦略を利用していることがわかりました。これらの方法は、関係の満足度とアイデンティティの確認を向上させました。結果は、関係固有の課題を克服するために柔軟で適応的なコミュニケーションアプローチの重要性を強調しています。

title: Child Centred Ethics (CCE): A Practical Framework for Enhanced Child Participation in HCI
authors: Read, Janet and Horton, Matthew and Fitton, Daniel and Sim, Gavin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces Child Centred Ethics (CCE) framework to enhance child participation in HCI, emphasizing ethical considerations. Results indicate improved child engagement and meaningful contribution in design processes.
problem_english: The problem addressed is the lack of effective child participation in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) design processes. Previous methods often neglected ethical considerations, reducing children's meaningful involvement and contribution.
method_english: The method involves developing and implementing a Child Centred Ethics (CCE) framework that focuses on enhancing ethical considerations in the HCI process. This includes prioritizing children's voices and ensuring meaningful involvement in design decisions.
results_english: The results demonstrated that using the Child Centred Ethics framework significantly improved child participation in HCI processes. Children engaged more actively, their contributions were more meaningful, and ethical considerations were better addressed.
summary_japanese: 子ども中心倫理(CCE)フレームワークを導入し、HCIにおける子どもの参加を強化。設計プロセスでの子どもの関与と貢献が向上。
problem_japanese: HCIデザインプロセスにおける子どもの効果的な参加が不足している点を指摘。従来の手法は倫理的配慮が欠けており、子どもの有意義な関与と貢献を減少させていた。
method_japanese: 子ども中心倫理(CCE)フレームワークを開発・実施し、設計プロセスでの倫理的配慮を強化。子どもの声を優先し、有意義な設計参加を促進。
results_japanese: CCEフレームワークの使用により、HCIプロセスでの子どもの参加が大幅に改善。子どもは積極的に関与し、貢献がより有意義に、倫理的配慮も改善された。

title: Designing for Resilience: Fostering Ponds of Stability with Computer Clubs in Palestine
authors: Mouratidis, Marios and Rosa Cardoso, Clara and Engelbutzeder, Philip and Tolmie, Peter and Aal, Konstantin Kosta and Wulf, Volker
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores how computer clubs in Palestine can act as 'ponds of stability', providing resilience amidst socio-political instability. It examines the role of these clubs in fostering community, skill development, and psychological support.
problem_english: Palestine faces significant socio-political instability, impacting the well-being and development opportunities for young people. There is a need to identify and implement community-based solutions that provide stability, support, and skill development to help individuals cope with ongoing challenges and build resilience.
method_english: The research employs ethnographic methods, including observations, interviews, and participatory workshops with members of computer clubs in Palestine. This approach allows for in-depth understanding of how these clubs operate, the challenges they face, and the support they provide to their members, particularly focusing on community building and resilience.
results_english: Findings reveal that computer clubs serve as vital support networks, offering a sense of normalcy and community. They facilitate skill development and psychological well-being, helping members cope with everyday challenges. The study highlights critical areas for improvement, ensuring these spaces continue to foster resilience effectively.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、パレスチナのコンピュータクラブがいかに安定の池となりうるかを探るもので、社会政治的な不安定性の中でのレジリエンスを提供する。
problem_japanese: パレスチナは社会政治的な不安定性に直面しており、若者の福祉や発展機会に影響を及ぼしている。このような課題を抱える中で、地域社会に根ざした安定した支援とスキル開発を提供する解決策が求められる。
method_japanese: パレスチナのコンピュータクラブの会員を対象に観察やインタビュー、参加型ワークショップなどの民族誌的手法を用い、クラブの運営方法、直面する課題、および提供する支援を深く理解する。
results_japanese: コンピュータクラブは重要な支援ネットワークとなり、スキル開発と心理的な安定を促進し、日々の課題に対処する助けとなっている。改善が必要な重要分野が示され、これらの場所がレジリエンスを効果的に育むことを確保するための方策が述べられている。

title: Imagining with the Body: Speculative Designs for Women's Embodied Empowerment in Feminist Self-Defense
authors: Nikolovska, Bojana and Normark, Maria and Sadowski, Helga
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores speculative design as a tool for enhancing women's empowerment through feminist self-defense practices, highlighting the embodied experience as central to this empowerment.
problem_english: The research addresses the gendered vulnerabilities women face and seeks ways to enhance their self-defense capabilities. Traditional approaches often overlook the embodied nature of empowerment, leaving a gap in effectively addressing women's safety and empowerment.
method_english: The authors use speculative design, focusing on the embodied practices of feminist self-defense, to explore new conceptualizations and methodologies that strengthen women's empowerment through enhanced awareness, bodily experience, and self-defense skills.
results_english: Results demonstrated that speculative design facilitated a deeper understanding of embodied empowerment, providing innovative approaches to self-defense that emphasize bodily awareness and proactive strategies tailored to women's specific needs.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、女性のフェミニスト自己防衛を通じたエンパワーメント向上のための投機的デザインを探求します。
problem_japanese: ジェンダーに特化した弱点に直面する女性の自己防衛能力を強化する方法を模索しています。従来のアプローチはエンパワーメントの具現的な側面を見落とし、女性の安全とエンパワーメントに効果的に対処する上でのギャップを生んでいます。
method_japanese: 著者らは投機的デザインを用いて、フェミニスト自己防衛の具現的な実践に焦点を当て、女性の自己防衛能力を強化し、意識や身体経験を重視する方法論を探ります。
results_japanese: 結果は、投機的デザインが具現的エンパワーメントの理解を深め、身体意識と女性特有のニーズに合わせた実践的戦略を強調する革新的な自己防衛アプローチを提供することを示しました。

title: In the Moment of Glitch: Engaging with Misalignments in Ethical Practice
authors: Garrett, Rachael and Hawkins, Kat and Brundell, Patrick and Castle-Green, Simon and Tennent, Paul and Zhou, Feng and Lampinen, Airi and H\"{o}\"{o}k, Kristina and Benford, Steve
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how ethical misalignments occur in collaborative interactions, proposing the concept of 'glitch moments.' These moments reveal discrepancies between expected and occurring practices, offering opportunities for reflection and adjustment.
problem_english: The paper identifies a challenge in maintaining ethical coherence across diverse collaborative environments in computing systems. Misalignments often surface as momentary occurrences, or 'glitch moments,' impacting ethical practices and necessitating innovative approaches to address them effectively.
method_english: The approach involves analyzing 'glitch moments' during interactions to uncover their underlying ethical misalignments. Researchers conducted in-depth observations and interviews within collaborative computing systems to identify these moments and understand their implications for ethical practice.
results_english: Findings demonstrate how 'glitch moments' serve as a catalyst for reflecting on and adapting ethical practices. The study provides insights into recognizing and leveraging these moments to improve alignment and coherence, contributing to enhanced ethical frameworks in collaborative contexts.
summary_japanese: 共同作業での倫理的な不一致を探り、期待と実際の行動の差異を明らかにする「グリッチ・モーメント」の概念を提案する。
problem_japanese: コンピューティングシステムにおける多様な共同作業環境にて倫理的一貫性を維持する課題を特定。不一致は「グリッチ・モーメント」として表れ、倫理実践に影響を及ぼし、新しい解決アプローチが必要となる。
method_japanese: 研究は「グリッチ・モーメント」を通じて倫理的な不一致を分析。コンピュートシステムの共同作業における観察とインタビューを通じてこれらの瞬間を特定し、倫理的実践への影響を理解する。
results_japanese: 研究結果は「グリッチ・モーメント」が倫理実践改善の触媒となり得ることを示す。これにより、共同作業の倫理的枠組みを強化するための有用な洞察が得られる。

title: Leaky Cups: Tinkering with Hydrofeminist Temporalities for HCI
authors: Key, Cayla and Gatehouse, Cally and Koepp, Stevie and Taylor, Nick
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores hydrofeminist temporalities within HCI, examining how leakiness as a concept can inform design practices. It discusses the intersection of feminist theories with temporal design, encouraging new approaches to HCI.
problem_english: The problem addressed is the lack of integration of feminist temporal perspectives in HCI design practices. This gap limits the potential for envisioning technologies that accommodate diverse, non-linear temporal experiences and narratives.
method_english: The authors employ a tinkering methodology, involving practical engagements with objects that embody 'leakiness.' They leverage hydrofeminist theories to guide these engagements, aiming to uncover new insights into temporal design within HCI systems.
results_english: The findings reveal that embracing leakiness fosters richer temporal understandings within HCI. The study suggests practical design interventions for technology systems to better accommodate complex, fluid temporalities, reflecting feminist insights.
