summary_japanese: HCIにおける水流フェミニストの時間性を探究し、漏れの概念が設計に与える影響を検討。フェミニスト理論と時間設計の交差を論じ、新しいHCIアプローチを提唱。
problem_japanese: HCI設計におけるフェミニスト的時間観の統合が不足しており、この欠如が多様で非線形な時間経験や物語を受け入れる技術の想像力を制限している。
method_japanese: 漏れを体現する物との実践的交流を含むティンカリング手法を用いる。水流フェミニズム理論を指針に、新たな時間設計の洞察を得ることを目指す。
results_japanese: 漏れを受け入れることでHCIにおける豊かな時間理解が促進されることを示す。女性学的視点を反映した技術システムの設計介入を提案。

title: Cinema Multiverse Lounge: Enhancing Film Appreciation via Multi-Agent Conversations
authors: Ryu, Jeongwoo and Kim, Kyusik and Heo, Dongseok and Song, Hyungwoo and Oh, Changhoon and Suh, Bongwon
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a system for enhancing film appreciation using multi-agent dialogues. The system blends AI-powered conversation with film analysis, offering users a richer understanding of cinematic works.
problem_english: Film appreciation can be challenging due to diverse interpretations and limited access to expert insights. Traditional methods often fail to engage users deeply, lacking interactive, multidimensional perspectives and tailored feedback.
method_english: The system uses AI-driven multi-agent conversations, each representing different perspectives and expertise. These agents engage users in interactive dialogues, providing varied insights into cinematic analysis, aiming at enhanced understanding and appreciation.
results_english: Results show users engaging more deeply with content, reporting improved understanding and appreciation. The interactive dialogue approach successfully broadens perspectives, offering meaningful interpretations and enriching film experiences.
summary_japanese: AIを活用した多元的対話で映画鑑賞を充実させるシステムを提案し、映画の理解を深める新手法を紹介。
problem_japanese: 映画の鑑賞は多様な解釈があり、専門的な洞察へのアクセスが限られているため難しい。従来の手法は多面的視点と個別フィードバックが不足し、深い関与を欠くことが多い。
method_japanese: 異なる視点と専門知識を持つAIエージェントによる対話を通じて、映画の分析を行い、ユーザーに多様な洞察を提供し理解と鑑賞を深めることを目指す。
results_japanese: ユーザーはコンテンツに深く関与し、理解と鑑賞が向上したと報告。対話によるアプローチは視点を広げ、意義ある解釈と充実した映画体験を提供することに成功。

title: ClueCart: Supporting Game Story Interpretation and Narrative Inference from Fragmented Clues
authors: Wang, Xiyuan and Cao, Yi-Fan and Xiong, Junjie and Chen, Sizhe and Li, Wenxuan and Zhang, Junjie and Li, Quan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ClueCart facilitates understanding game stories and interpreting narratives by piecing together fragmented clues. Enhancing player engagement and comprehension of complex game stories.
problem_english: Players often struggle with interpreting complex video game narratives due to fragmented storytelling and difficult inference. This leads to diminished engagement and satisfaction, particularly when players cannot connect disparate story elements.
method_english: ClueCart aggregates fragmented story elements, assisting players in forming coherent narratives through interactive inference mechanisms. It leverages computational storytelling techniques to bridge gaps between narrative fragments and improve user experience.
results_english: ClueCart significantly improved players' ability to interpret complex game stories. Users demonstrated higher narrative satisfaction and engagement. The tool's intuitive interface allowed for effective story exploration and comprehension, validating its design goals.
summary_japanese: ClueCartは、断片的な手がかりからゲームストーリーの理解と叙述推論をサポートし、複雑なストーリーへのプレイヤーの理解を促進します。
problem_japanese: プレイヤーはしばしば複雑なビデオゲームのストーリーを解釈するのに苦労し、断片的な語りによって理解が難しく、満足度が低下します。このため、ストーリー要素をつなげて理解できません。
method_japanese: ClueCartは断片的なストーリー要素を集約し、対話型推論メカニズムを通じてプレイヤーが一貫した物語を形成するのを助けます。計算物語技術を活用して物語の断片間のギャップを埋め、ユーザー体験を改善します。
results_japanese: ClueCartはプレイヤーの複雑なゲームストーリー解釈能力を向上させました。ユーザーは物語の満足度と参加度を向上し、直感的なインターフェースがストーリー探求と理解に効果的であることが確認されました。

title: From Solo to Social: Exploring the Dynamics of Player Cooperation in a Co-located Cooperative Exergame
authors: Wang, Derrick M. and Cmentowski, Sebastian and Hadi Mogavi, Reza and Senthil Nathan, Kaushall and Kukshinov, Eugene and Tu, Joseph and Nacke, Lennart E.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the dynamics of player cooperation in a co-located cooperative exergame, focusing on the transition from solo play to social interactions.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding how players transition from playing solo to engaging in cooperative play in exergames and the factors influencing social interactions in a physically co-located environment.
method_english: A mixed-methods approach was used, combining quantitative data from gameplay metrics and qualitative interviews to analyze player behavior and social interaction dynamics in a co-located cooperative exergame setting.
results_english: The results showed that players transitioned from solo to cooperative play through shared goals and communication, enhancing both gameplay experience and social interaction quality in the co-located exergame environment.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、共同体験型エクサゲームにおけるプレイヤー協力の動態を、ソロプレイから社会的相互作用への移行に注目して探求します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、エクサゲームにおけるソロプレイから協力的プレイへの移行や、物理的に共存する環境での社会的相互作用に影響を与える要因を理解する課題に取り組んでいます。
method_japanese: ゲームプレイの指標から定量データを、質的インタビューから定性データを組み合わせた混合手法を用いて、共同エクサゲーム環境におけるプレイヤーの行動と相互作用を分析しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、プレイヤーが共通のゴールやコミュニケーションを通じてソロから協力プレイへ移行し、ゲーム体験や社会的相互作用の質が向上したことを示しました。

title: Less Talk, More Trust: Understanding Players' In-game Assessment of Communication Processes in League of Legends
authors: Lee, Juhoon and Kim, Seoyoung and Park, Yeon Su and Kim, Juho and Jang, Jeong-woo and Seering, Joseph
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The research explores players' trust and assessment of communication in League of Legends. It examines how less verbal communication can foster trust among players.
problem_english: Managing communication effectively in multiplayer online games like League of Legends presents challenges. Excessive or poor communication can lead to mistrust and negative experiences among players, impacting collaboration and gameplay.
method_english: The study involves analyzing in-game interactions and player behaviors to determine communication strategies that influence trust. Surveys and gameplay observation are used to evaluate effects of verbal versus non-verbal communication.
results_english: Results indicate that reducing verbal communication can enhance trust among players. Non-verbal cues such as pings were more effective in fostering cooperation and positive player experiences in League of Legends.
summary_japanese: リーグ・オブ・レジェンドにおけるコミュニケーションと信頼感を探求し、口頭コミュニケーションを減らすことが信頼を促進することを示す。
problem_japanese: リーグ・オブ・レジェンドなどのオンラインマルチプレイヤーゲームにおいて、過剰なコミュニケーションまたは質の低いやり取りがプレイヤー間の信頼を損なうことがある。これにより協力とゲームプレイが悪化することが懸念される。
method_japanese: ゲーム内のやり取りとプレイヤーの行動を分析し、信頼に影響を与えるコミュニケーション戦略を探求。口頭と非口頭のコミュニケーション効果を調査するために、アンケートとゲームプレイ観察を用いる。
results_japanese: 結果は、口頭コミュニケーションを減少させることでプレイヤー間の信頼が向上することを示している。ピンなどの非口頭の手段が協力促進とポジティブな経験に効果的であると示された。

title: Mirror to Companion: Exploring Roles, Values, and Risks of AI Self-Clones through Story Completion
authors: Huang, Jessica and Kim, Ig-Jae and Yoon, Dongwook
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the roles, values, and risks associated with AI self-clones by employing a story completion method. The research aims to understand how individuals perceive the integration of AI replicas in daily human activities.
problem_english: AI self-clones are an emerging technology with potential influence on daily human interactions and ethical concerns. The challenge lies in understanding the diverse roles these clones may take on, alongside the values they might provide or jeopardize, requiring a thorough exploration of user perceptions.
method_english: The study employs a story completion technique to gather qualitative data from participants. This method involves providing story prompts related to AI self-clones, allowing participants to complete the narrative, which reveals their perceptions, expectations, and concerns regarding potential interactions with AI replicas.
results_english: Findings reveal diverse perceptions of AI self-clones, ranging from perceptions as personal companions to ethical concerns about identity and privacy. The study highlights the complexity of integrating such technology into daily life and underscores the need for addressing various social and ethical implications.
summary_japanese: 論文はAI自己クローンの役割、価値、リスクを物語完成手法を用いて探究し、人々がこの技術をどのように捉えるかを明らかにします。
problem_japanese: AI自己クローンは日常の人間関係に影響を与える可能性があり、倫理的懸念もある新興技術です。これらクローンが担う多様な役割を理解し、提供や危険にさらす価値を探る必要があります。
method_japanese: 研究ではAI自己クローンに関するストーリープロンプトを提供し、参加者がそれを完了する物語完成手法を用いて定性的データを収集し、認識や期待、懸念を引き出します。
results_japanese: AI自己クローンに対する認識は多様で、個人的伴侶としての役割から、身元やプライバシーに関する倫理的懸念までが含まれ、技術統合の複雑さを示し社会的倫理的影響への配慮が必要です。

title: Plan-Then-Execute: An Empirical Study of User Trust and Team Performance When Using LLM Agents As A Daily Assistant
authors: He, Gaole and Demartini, Gianluca and Gadiraju, Ujwal
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores user trust and team performance when using large language model (LLM) agents as daily assistants through a 'Plan-Then-Execute' framework.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of understanding user trust and team performance dynamics when integrating large language model (LLM) agents into daily routines, as current knowledge on these aspects is limited. The study seeks to fill this gap by examining how LLM agents impact users' trust levels and overall team effectiveness.
method_english: The study employs an empirical approach, utilizing a 'Plan-Then-Execute' framework that involves participants engaging with LLM agents for planning and execution tasks. User trust and team performance metrics are systematically collected and analyzed to determine the impact of the LLM agents within the experimental setup.
results_english: Findings indicate that the 'Plan-Then-Execute' framework improves both user trust in LLM agents and overall team performance. The structured approach provided users with confidence in the agents' ability to improve task outcomes and facilitate smoother collaborative efforts.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、日常のアシスタントとしてLLMエージェントを使用する際のユーザーの信頼とチームのパフォーマンスを探求する。
problem_japanese: 大規模言語モデル（LLM）エージェントの導入が日常業務に与えるユーザーの信頼とチームパフォーマンスへの影響を理解する課題に取り組む。これらの要素に関する現在の知識は限られており、そのギャップを埋めることを目指す。
method_japanese: 参加者がLLMエージェントを用いて計画と実行のタスクを行う「計画-実行」フレームワークを用い、ユーザーの信頼度とチームパフォーマンスの指標を体系的に収集・分析する。
results_japanese: 「計画-実行」フレームワークは、LLMエージェントへのユーザーの信頼とチームのパフォーマンスを向上させることが判明した。この構造化されたアプローチにより、エージェントがタスクの成果を改善し、スムーズな共同作業を促進する能力に対してユーザーは自信を持った。

title: Queue Player: Investigating Distributed Co-Listening Experiences for Social Connection across Space, Time, and Tempo
authors: Pinder, Samann and Odom, William and Yoo, MinYoung and Misra, Ayush and Lin, Henry and Neustaedter, Carman and Barnett, Samuel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Queue Player examines distributed co-listening experiences for social connection across space, time, and tempo. It explores how people share music to foster closer connections, even when physically distant.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of maintaining social connections over distances. Traditional music-sharing lacks real-time interaction, which can diminish the feeling of togetherness. The study investigates how distributed co-listening can enhance social bonds, acknowledging the limitations of asynchronous and isolated experiences.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach by integrating qualitative interviews with quantitative data analysis from user interactions with the Queue Player system. It captures user experiences to evaluate how co-listening facilitates social bonding across different spatial, temporal, and tempo-based contexts.
results_english: The findings demonstrate that co-listening, facilitated by Queue Player, strengthens social connections by enabling shared experiences despite physical distances. Users reported increased feelings of closeness and engagement, highlighting the potential of such systems to foster connectedness beyond traditional, asynchronous methods.
summary_japanese: Queue Playerは、離れた場所でも音楽共有で社会的結びつきを強化する方法を探求します。
problem_japanese: 音楽共有はリアルタイム性に欠け、距離があると一体感が失われがちです。どのように配信型共同リスニングが社会的絆を強化できるかを探ります。
method_japanese: ユーザーインタビューとQueue Playerシステムの対話データを使った混合手法で、空間やテンポといった文脈で共同リスニングが絆を強化するかを検証します。
results_japanese: Queue Playerを通じた共同リスニングは物理的距離を超えてつながりを強化し、ユーザーは親近感とつながりを感じると報告しています。

title: (Mis)Communicating with our AI Systems
authors: Cros Vila, Laura and Sturm, Bob
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores communication issues between users and AI systems, examining misunderstandings and misinterpretations that arise due to varying user expectations and system interactions.
problem_english: Despite advancements in AI technology, users often face challenges when interacting with AI systems due to miscommunication. These issues stem from differences in expectations, language, and interpretation between the users and the algorithms driving the systems.
method_english: The authors conduct a series of user studies evaluating the interactions between users and AI systems. They analyze conversations and feedback to identify patterns of miscommunication and offer suggestions for improving AI system design and user education.
results_english: Results show significant discrepancies in user expectations and actual AI system performance. Users frequently misinterpret system outputs, leading to frustration and inefficiency. Improved interface design and user training can mitigate these communication challenges.
summary_japanese: 本論文はユーザーとAIシステム間のコミュニケーション問題を探求し、誤解と誤解釈がどのように発生するかを調査します。
problem_japanese: AI技術の進歩にもかかわらず、ユーザーはしばしばAIシステムとの対話でコミュニケーションの課題に直面します。これらの問題は、ユーザーとアルゴリズム間の期待、言語、解釈の違いにあります。
method_japanese: 著者はユーザーとAIシステム間の対話を評価するユーザー研究を実施。会話とフィードバックを分析し、設計改善と教育提案を考察しています。
results_japanese: 結果はユーザーの期待とAIシステムの実際の性能に大きな差異があることを示しています。ユーザーはしばしば誤解し、改善が必要です。

title: Abstraction Alignment: Comparing Model-Learned and Human-Encoded Conceptual Relationships
authors: Boggust, Angie and Bang, Hyemin and Strobelt, Hendrik and Satyanarayan, Arvind
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the alignment between machine-learned and human-encoded conceptual relationships, focusing on abstractions. It investigates how models and humans categorize and generalize concepts.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding how machine learning models align with human interpretations of conceptual relationships. There is often a gap between machine-learned abstractions and those encoded by humans, impacting model explainability and usability.
method_english: The authors propose 'Abstraction Alignment', a method to compare and analyze conceptual relationships as learned by models and as encoded by humans. They utilize a combination of computational techniques and human subject experiments.
results_english: The findings reveal inconsistencies between model-learned and human-encoded abstractions, providing insights into improving model interpretability. The results highlight the importance of incorporating human perspectives into machine learning models for better alignment.
summary_japanese: 本研究では、機械学習と人間の概念的関係の整合性を検討し、モデルと人間が概念を一般化する方法を調査した。
problem_japanese: 機械学習モデルの学習結果と人間の概念解釈のギャップを理解する課題に対処。機械と人間の抽象化の不整合がモデルの説明性と実用性に影響を及ぼす。
method_japanese: 著者は、モデルと人間が学習・符号化した関係を比較する「Abstraction Alignment」手法を提案。計算技術と実験を組み合わせて分析。
results_japanese: モデル学習と人間符号化の抽象化に不一致があることが明らかに。結果はモデル解釈性の向上に貢献し、機械学習における人間の視点の重要性を示す。

title: Assessing Susceptibility Factors of Confirmation Bias in News Feed Reading
authors: Boonprakong, Nattapat and Pareek, Saumya and Tag, Benjamin and Goncalves, Jorge and Dingler, Tilman
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates susceptibility factors influencing confirmation bias during news feed reading, using machine learning to analyze user interactions and perceptions.
problem_english: Confirmation bias in news feed reading leads individuals to favor information that aligns with their pre-existing beliefs, undermining critical evaluation. This study aims to understand the susceptibility factors contributing to this bias, posing challenges in distinguishing between accurate and misleading information.
method_english: Researchers utilized machine learning models to analyze survey data and user interactions on social media platforms. By evaluating behavioral and demographic factors, they identified key elements influencing confirmation bias during news consumption.
results_english: The study found specific demographic and behavioral traits significantly correlated with higher susceptibility to confirmation bias. Tailored interventions and personalized recommendations are suggested to mitigate this impact, enhancing critical news evaluation.
summary_japanese: この研究は、ニュースフィードの読み取りにおける確証バイアスの影響要因を、ユーザーの相互作用と認識を機械学習で分析し調査します。
problem_japanese: ニュースフィードの読み取りにおける確証バイアスは、個人が既存の信念に合致する情報を好む傾向を生じさせ、批判的な評価を妨げます。本研究はこのバイアスの影響要因を理解し、正確な情報と誤情報を区別する課題を提起します。
method_japanese: 研究者は機械学習モデルを用い、アンケートデータとソーシャルメディア上のユーザーの相互作用を分析しました。行動や人口統計の要因を評価し、ニュース消費時の確証バイアスに影響する主要要素を特定しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、特定の人口統計学的および行動特性が確証バイアスへの高い感受性と有意に相関していることを示しました。個別化された介入と推奨が、この影響を軽減し、ニュースの批判的評価を向上させるために提案されています。

title: Diagrammatization and Abduction to Improve AI Interpretability With Domain-Aligned Explanations for Medical Diagnosis
authors: Lim, Brian Y. and Cahaly, Joseph P. and Sng, Chester Y. F. and Chew, Adam
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores enhancing AI interpretability for medical diagnosis using diagrammatic representations and abductive reasoning to create domain-aligned explanations, thus improving communication between AI and healthcare professionals.
problem_english: AI systems in medical diagnosis often struggle with interpretability, limiting their usefulness in clinical settings. Healthcare professionals require explanations that align with their domain expertise to trust and effectively use AI recommendations. Thus, improving AI interpretability with domain-aligned explanations is critical.
method_english: The authors propose using diagrammatization combined with abductive reasoning to generate explanations that are aligned with the medical domain. This approach structures AI-generated insights into diagrams that resemble familiar diagnostic processes, aiding professionals in understanding and utilizing AI outputs.
results_english: The study demonstrates that incorporating domain-aligned diagrams significantly enhances the interpretability of AI in medical diagnostics. Healthcare professionals showed improved understanding and greater trust in AI-driven recommendations, thus improving clinical decision-making efficiency.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、図式化とアブダクションを用いた医療診断におけるAIの解釈可能性向上を検討し、専門家とのコミュニケーションの改善を目指しています。
problem_japanese: 医療診断におけるAIシステムは解釈可能性に乏しく、臨床利用が制限される。医療専門家は専門知識に基づく説明を必要としており、AIの信頼性と効果的な利用には、ドメインに沿った説明が重要です。
method_japanese: 筆者らは図式化とアブダクションを組み合わせて医療ドメインに沿った説明を生成する手法を提案。この方法は、AIの洞察を診断プロセスに馴染みのある図式に構造化し、専門家の理解を助けます。
results_japanese: ドメインに合わせた図式の導入は、医療診断におけるAIの解釈可能性を著しく向上させることを示した。医療専門家の理解が改善され、AIの推奨への信頼が高まり、臨床の意思決定効率が向上しました。

title: Fostering Appropriate Reliance on Large Language Models: The Role of Explanations, Sources, and Inconsistencies
authors: Kim, Sunnie S. Y. and Vaughan, Jennifer Wortman and Liao, Q. Vera and Lombrozo, Tania and Russakovsky, Olga
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates how explanations, sources, and identifying inconsistencies can enhance user reliance on large language models, promoting appropriate use.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of fostering appropriate reliance on large language models (LLMs), as users might over-trust or under-utilize these systems due to unclear outputs. The balance between usefulness and over-reliance is crucial, especially when LLMs are applied in sensitive or high-stakes environments where incorrect output can lead to detrimental consequences.
method_english: The paper employs empirical user studies to evaluate different approaches like providing explanations, sourcing information, and highlighting inconsistencies in the outputs of large language models. By analyzing user interactions, decisions, and trust levels, these methods aim to balance trust and caution, encouraging users to critically assess LLM outputs.
results_english: Results indicate that providing explanations and sources significantly improves user trust in LLMs, while highlighting inconsistencies encourages users to critically evaluate outputs. The tailored combination of these elements leads to a more discerning reliance, reducing the risks associated with over-trusting and enhancing decision-making in practical applications.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、説明、出典、不整合の特定が大型言語モデルの適切な信頼に与える影響を探究します。
problem_japanese: 大型言語モデルの過度な信頼と過小評価のバランスを取り、誤った出力が敏感または重大な状況で有害な影響を及ぼさないようにする課題です。
method_japanese: 説明、情報源の提示、出力の不整合箇所の強調を通じて大型言語モデルに対する信頼を適切に育むためのアプローチを実証的に検討しました。
results_japanese: 説明と出典の提供がユーザーの信頼を向上させ、不整合の強調が出力の批判的評価を促進し、過度な信頼のリスクを軽減します。

title: Show Me the Work: Fact-Checkers' Requirements for Explainable Automated Fact-Checking
authors: Warren, Greta and Shklovski, Irina and Augenstein, Isabelle
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the requirements of explainable automated fact-checking systems from the perspective of professional fact-checkers, advocating for transparency, interpretability, and integration with existing workflows.
problem_english: Professional fact-checkers face challenges with understanding and trusting the decisions made by automated fact-checking systems. These systems often lack transparency and fail to provide interpretable results that integrate seamlessly with the fact-checkers' existing workflows, hindering their effectiveness.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and participatory design sessions with professional fact-checkers to gather insights on their needs and expectations. They combined qualitative data analysis with participatory design methodology to propose enhancements for automated fact-checking systems that prioritize transparency and ease of integration.
results_english: The study identified several key requirements for enhancing automated fact-checking systems: providing detailed evidence, ensuring traceability of claims, offering adjustable explanations, and integrating into existing workflows. Meeting these requirements can improve fact-checkers' trust and effectiveness in using such systems.
summary_japanese: 本論文は説明可能な自動ファクトチェックシステムの要件を専門のファクトチェッカーの視点から探求し、透明性と解釈可能性を提唱します。
problem_japanese: 専門のファクトチェッカーは、自動ファクトチェックシステムの判断を理解し信頼する難しさに直面しています。これらのシステムはしばしば透明性に欠け、解釈可能な結果を提供できず、既存のワークフローにシームレスに統合されないため、その効果を妨げています。
method_japanese: 著者は、専門のファクトチェッカーとのインタビューと参加型デザインセッションを通じて、彼らのニーズと期待を収集しました。定性データ分析と参加型デザイン手法を組み合わせ、透明性と統合性を優先した自動ファクトチェックシステムの改良案を提案しました。
results_japanese: 研究は、自動ファクトチェックシステムの改善に必要な要件を特定しました: 詳細な証拠提供、主張の追跡可能性、調整可能な説明提供、既存のワークフローへの統合。これらの要件を満たすことにより、ファクトチェッカーの信頼性と効果的な利用が向上します。

title: eXplainMR: Generating Real-time Textual and Visual eXplanations to Facilitate UltraSonography Learning in MR
authors: Wang, Jingying and Zhang, Jingjing and Capizzano, Juana Nicoll and Sigakis, Matthew and Wang, Xu and Popov, Vitaliy
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: eXplainMR offers real-time explanations for ultrasonography learning in mixed reality environments. It aims to improve learning outcomes by providing textual and visual context.
problem_english: Ultrasonography presents complex challenges for learners due to the real-time nature of interpretation. Current training lacks interactive tools and explanations that facilitate deep understanding, particularly for novices.
method_english: The paper introduces eXplainMR, a system that integrates textual and visual explanations into MR. It utilizes machine learning models to interpret ultrasound images and provide immediate, contextually relevant feedback.
results_english: Results demonstrated that eXplainMR significantly improved ultrasonography learning effectiveness. Participants showed enhanced understanding and confidence in interpreting images, indicating the tool's potential in educational settings.
summary_japanese: eXplainMRは複合現実での超音波検査学習に即時の説明を提供し、学習成果を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 超音波検査は解釈のリアルタイム性から学習者に複雑な課題を提示する。現在の訓練はインタラクティブなツールと説明を欠き、特に初心者に対する深い理解を妨げる。
method_japanese: eXplainMRは、テキストとビジュアルの説明をMRに統合したシステムで、機械学習モデルを活用して超音波画像を解釈し、関連する即時のフィードバックを提供します。
results_japanese: eXplainMRは超音波検査学習の効果を大幅に向上させ、参加者は画像の解釈における理解と自信を向上させ、教育現場でのツールの可能性を示しました。

title: A Scaffold-Based Tool for Product Design Variations in Virtual Reality
authors: Yu, Xue and DiVerdi, Stephen and Gingold, Yotam
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: A new virtual reality tool is introduced to aid product design variations using a scaffold-based approach, enhancing creativity and efficiency in design processes.
problem_english: Designers often struggle to efficiently explore multiple variations of product designs in virtual reality. Existing tools are limited in promoting creativity and the exploration of design possibilities. The process can be time-consuming and cumbersome, hindering the ability to innovate and iterate quickly.
method_english: The authors introduce a scaffold-based tool that allows designers to construct and explore design variations efficiently in virtual reality. The tool provides a structured framework that guides users through the design process, enabling easy manipulation and experimentation with different design elements and configurations.
results_english: The tool significantly enhances the design process, allowing for quicker iterations and broader exploration of design possibilities. User studies show that the tool aids in idea generation, increases design accuracy, and fosters creativity among designers, ultimately leading to superior and more innovative product designs.
summary_japanese: 製品デザインの変種設計を支援する仮想現実ツールが提案され、創造性と効率性が向上します。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは、仮想現実で製品デザインの多くのバリエーションを効率的に探求するのに苦労しています。既存のツールは、創造性の促進やデザインの可能性の探求で限られており、プロセスが時間を要し、迅速な革新と反復を妨げることがあります。
method_japanese: 著者は、デザイナーが仮想現実で設計バリエーションを効率的に構築・探求できるスキャフォールドベースのツールを紹介します。ツールは、設計プロセスをガイドする構造化されたフレームワークを提供し、さまざまな設計要素と構成の簡単な操作と実験を可能にします。
results_japanese: ツールは設計プロセスを大幅に改善し、迅速な反復と多様な設計可能性の探求を可能にします。ユーザー研究では、アイデア生成を支援し、設計の精度を向上させ、デザイナーの創造性を高め、優れた革新的な製品設計につながることが示されています。

title: Brickify: Enabling Expressive Design Intent Specification through Direct Manipulation on Design Tokens
authors: Shi, Xinyu and Wang, Yinghou and Rossi, Ryan and Zhao, Jian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces Brickify, a tool that allows designers to express their design intent through direct manipulation of design tokens, enhancing flexibility in digital design processes.
problem_english: Designers often face challenges in expressing their design intentions accurately and effectively using conventional digital design tools. These tools typically have limitations in flexibility and direct manipulation capabilities, constraining designers' creative processes and expression.
method_english: Brickify employs a novel approach that integrates direct manipulation techniques with design tokens, providing users with a more intuitive and interactive way to specify and adjust their design intentions directly within the system.
results_english: Brickify significantly enhances designer creativity and precision by allowing more flexible interactions with design tokens, as demonstrated in user studies that show improved workflows and design outputs with the tool.
summary_japanese: Brickifyはデザイントークンを直接操作することで、デザイン意図をより柔軟に表現できるツールを紹介しています。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは従来のデジタルデザインツールでデザイン意図を正確に表現するのが難しく、柔軟性と直感的操作の制限に悩まされています。
method_japanese: Brickifyは、デザイントークンを使った直接操作技術を統合し、ユーザーがデザイン意図をより直感的に指定・調整できる方法を提供します。
results_japanese: Brickifyはデザイントークンとの柔軟なやり取りを実現し、ユーザースタディでデザイナーの創造性と精度の向上が示されています。

title: DesignWeaver: Dimensional Scaffolding for Text-to-Image Product Design
authors: Tao, Sirui and Liang, Ivan and Peng, Cindy and Wang, Zhiqing and Palani, Srishti and Dow, Steven P.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: DesignWeaver introduces a framework to assist in text-to-image product design, enhancing creativity and efficiency through dimensional scaffolding. This tool streamlines the design process by integrating textual inputs and dimensional configurations.
problem_english: Current text-to-image design tools often lack effective guidance and structuring mechanisms, resulting in inconsistent and inefficient design processes. Designers face challenges in converting textual descriptions into coherent and visually pleasing images, which hampers creativity and productivity.
method_english: DesignWeaver employs dimensional scaffolding, a structured approach that guides designers in translating textual inputs into visual outputs. It integrates various design dimensions, enabling users to systematically adjust and modify visual elements according to their creative goals, thus enhancing the design workflow.
results_english: The implementation of DesignWeaver demonstrated improved design efficiency and creativity. User evaluations indicated that the tool's structured approach helped in generating consistent and innovative designs. Designers reported increased satisfaction and confidence in their creative tasks.
summary_japanese: DesignWeaverは、次元的足場を用いたテキストから画像への製品設計を支援し、創造性と効率を向上させるフレームワークを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現在のテキストから画像への設計ツールは効果的な指導と構造化されたメカニズムに欠け、設計プロセスが一貫性を欠き非効率的です。これにより、創造性と生産性が損なわれています。
method_japanese: DesignWeaverは、テキスト入力を視覚出力に変換するガイドとなる次元的足場を導入し、各種設計次元を統合して設定目標に応じた視覚要素の調整を可能にします。
results_japanese: DesignWeaverの導入は、設計の効率性と創造性を向上させました。ユーザー評価は一貫した革新的なデザイン生成を支援したと示し、創造的作業に対する満足と自信が高まりました。

title: I-Card: A Generative AI-Supported Intelligent Design Method Card Deck
authors: Chen, Liuqing and Cheang, Wengteng and Jiang, Zhaojun and Xu, Yuan and Cai, Zebin and Sun, Lingyun and Childs, Peter and Han, Ji and Hansen, Preben and Zuo, Haoyu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: I-Card introduces a generative AI-supported card deck for intelligent design, helping designers explore creative ideas efficiently.
problem_english: Designers often face challenges in generating innovative and efficient creative solutions due to limitations in traditional design methods, which may not fully leverage technology to enhance creativity and problem-solving.
method_english: The study presents the I-Card method, which incorporates generative AI within a card deck format, providing designers with prompts and insights that stimulate creative thinking and enhance the collaborative design process.
results_english: The implementation of I-Card demonstrated improved innovation and efficiency in the design process, as designers incorporated AI-generated insights, leading to more comprehensive exploration of design possibilities.
summary_japanese: I-Cardは創造的なアイデアの効率的な探求を支援するAI搭載のカードデッキを紹介。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは従来のデザイン方法では創造性と問題解決を最大限に活用できず、革新的かつ効率的な解決策の生成に苦労しています。
method_japanese: この研究では、デザイナーにクリエイティブな発想を促し、協力的なデザインプロセスを強化するAIを組み込んだカードデッキ方式のI-Card手法を提案。
results_japanese: I-Cardの実施により、AI生成の洞察を取り入れたデザインプロセスにおける革新性と効率性が向上し、デザイン可能性の包括的な探求が促進された。

title: Inkspire: Supporting Design Exploration with Generative AI through Analogical Sketching
authors: Lin, David Chuan-En and Kang, Hyeonsu B. and Martelaro, Nikolas and Kittur, Aniket and Chen, Yan-Ying and Hong, Matthew K.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces Inkspire, a tool leveraging generative AI to support design exploration through analogical sketching, helping designers discover creative solutions.
problem_english: Designers often struggle with ideation, limited by cognitive biases and existing knowledge. Traditional design methods may not effectively enable the exploration of innovative ideas, necessitating new tools that foster creativity by augmenting human abilities.
method_english: Inkspire integrates generative AI with analogical sketching to assist designers. By providing AI-generated sketch suggestions based on initial user sketches, it facilitates exploration and expansion of creative ideas through analogical reasoning.
results_english: Inkspire demonstrated effectiveness in enhancing design exploration, allowing users to generate novel design ideas efficiently. User studies indicated increased creativity and ideation when employing AI-driven sketch suggestions compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、生成AIを活用したデザイン探索支援ツール「Inkspire」を紹介し、アナロジカルスケッチを通じてクリエイティブな解決策の発見を支援する。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは、新しいアイデアの探索が認知バイアスや既存の知識によって制限され、発想に苦労する。従来のデザイン手法では革新的なアイデアの探索が効果的でない場合があり、人間の能力を拡張して創造性を促進する新しいツールが必要である。
method_japanese: Inkspireは、生成AIとアナロジカルスケッチを組み合わせ、デザイナーを支援。ユーザーの初期スケッチに基づくAI生成のスケッチ提案を提供し、類推を通じて創造的なアイデアの探索を促進する。
results_japanese: Inkspireは、デザイン探索の効果的な支援を実証し、ユーザーが独創的なデザインアイデアを効率的に生成できることを確認。ユーザー調査では、AI駆動のスケッチ提案を用いると創造性と発想が向上することが示された。

title: ProductMeta: An Interactive System for Metaphorical Product Design Ideation with Multimodal Large Language Models
authors: Zhou, Qinyi and Deng, Jie and Liu, Yu and Wang, Yun and Xia, Yan and Ou, Yang and Lu, Zhicong and Ma, Sai and Li, Scarlett and Xu, Yingqing
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ProductMeta is an interactive system leveraging multimodal large language models for metaphorical product design ideation, facilitating innovative design concepts.
problem_english: Designers often struggle with generating creative, metaphorical ideas for products due to limited tools and resources that integrate complex language and visual processing capabilities.
method_english: ProductMeta uses multimodal large language models, combining textual and visual processing, to assist designers in drafting metaphorical product ideas through an interactive interface.
results_english: ProductMeta significantly enhances designers' abilities to generate innovative, metaphorical product ideas, demonstrating improved creativity and efficiency in design ideation processes.
summary_japanese: ProductMetaは比喩的な製品デザイン発想を支援するために、マルチモーダル大規模言語モデルを活用したインタラクティブシステムです。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは、言語と視覚処理能力を統合したツールが不十分なため、製品の創造的で比喩的なアイデアを生成することに苦労しています。
method_japanese: ProductMetaは、テキストと視覚処理を組み合わせたマルチモーダル大規模言語モデルを使用し、インタラクティブなインターフェースを通じて比喩的な製品アイデアを支援します。
results_japanese: ProductMetaはデザイナーの創造力と効率を向上し、革新的で比喩的な製品アイデア生成能力を大幅に強化します。

title: Understanding Practical Challenges and Enablers for Embedding Environmental Perspectives in Digital Product Design and Development
authors: Lee, Minha and Min, Soyeong and Kim, Gahyeon and Lee, Sangsu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the challenges and enablers of integrating environmental considerations into digital product design and development, offering insights for sustainable practices.
problem_english: The primary issue addressed is the difficulty faced by digital product designers and developers in embedding environmental perspectives into their work, due to various practical challenges and a lack of enabling frameworks and guidelines to support sustainability in design processes.
method_english: A qualitative research approach was employed, involving interviews with industry professionals and case studies of digital product design projects to understand the practical challenges and enablers for integrating environmental perspectives.
results_english: The study identifies key barriers such as lack of knowledge and standardized guidelines, while highlighting enablers like organizational support and collaborative networks. It proposes strategies to promote sustainable design practices.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、デジタル製品設計・開発における環境視点の統合に関する課題と要因を探り、持続可能な実践への洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: デジタル製品設計者と開発者が、その作業に環境の視点を組み込むことに直面する困難に焦点を当てており、設計プロセスにおける持続可能性を支援するフレームワークやガイドラインも不足しています。
method_japanese: 産業専門家へのインタビューとデジタル製品設計プロジェクトの事例研究を含む質的研究アプローチを用いて、環境視点の統合に関する課題と要因を把握しました。
results_japanese: 知識不足や標準化されたガイドラインの欠如などの主要課題を特定し、組織のサポートや共同ネットワークを助成要因として強調。持続可能な設計実践の促進戦略を提案します。

title: A Taxonomy of Linguistic Expressions That Contribute To Anthropomorphism of Language Technologies
authors: DeVrio, Alicia and Cheng, Myra and Egede, Lisa and Olteanu, Alexandra and Blodgett, Su Lin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper proposes a taxonomy for linguistic expressions that increase anthropomorphism in language technologies, aiming to understand their influence on users' perceptions and interactions.
problem_english: Anthropomorphism in language technologies can lead to misleading biases and user misconceptions, affecting their trust and usability. There is a need for a structured understanding of the linguistic expressions that contribute to this phenomenon.
method_english: The authors use a qualitative research approach, analyzing various linguistic expressions from corpora of human and machine interactions, identifying patterns, and categorizing them into a structured taxonomy to reveal their anthropomorphic effects.
results_english: The study results in a comprehensive taxonomy categorizing linguistic expressions based on their contribution to anthropomorphism, providing a tool for understanding and potentially mitigating misleading representations in language technologies.
summary_japanese: 言語技術での擬人化を促す表現の分類法を提案し、利用者の認識と相互作用への影響を理解します。
problem_japanese: 言語技術における擬人化は、利用者の信頼性や使いやすさに影響を及ぼす誤解や偏見をもたらす。これに寄与する言語表現の系統的理解が必要です。
method_japanese: 各種言語表現を人間と機械の相互作用のコーパスから分析し、パターンを同定して分類する定性的研究を行い、擬人化効果を明らかにします。
results_japanese: 擬人化への寄与を基に言語表現を分類する総合的分類法を作成し、誤解を招く表現の理解と緩和に役立つツールを提供します。

title: Acceptability, Acceptance and Adoption of Telepresence Robots in Museums: The Museum Professionals' Perspectives
authors: Cameron, Harriet R and Reyes-Cruz, Gisela and Piskopani, Anna-Maria and Barnard, Pepita and Boudouraki, Andriana and Caleb-Solly, Praminda and Castle-Green, Simon D and Fischer, Joel E and Hyde, Richard and Kucukyilmaz, Ayse and Maior, Horia A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores museum professionals' perspectives on the acceptability, acceptance, and adoption of telepresence robots in museums, investigating both potential challenges and benefits.
problem_english: The study addresses the problem of understanding the museum professionals' viewpoints on the use of telepresence robots, including concerns about technological adaptation and stakeholder acceptance, in museum settings to enhance visitor experience and accessibility.
method_english: The research employs qualitative methods, including interviews with museum professionals and stakeholders, to gather insights on their attitudes towards telepresence robots, identifying key factors influencing their acceptability, acceptance, and adoption.
results_english: Findings reveal varied levels of acceptance among museum professionals, highlighting both enthusiasm for the potential benefits and concerns about practical challenges, such as cost, training, and integration into existing systems.
summary_japanese: 博物館における遠隔存在ロボット導入について、専門家の受容性や課題を探る。
problem_japanese: 博物館において、遠隔存在ロボットの受容性および適応に関する専門家の見解を理解することが課題で、技術適応や関係者受け入れにおける問題も含まれる。
method_japanese: 博物館専門家や関係者へのインタビューを通じて、遠隔存在ロボットの受容性、受け入れ、および導入に影響を与える要因を質的に調査。
results_japanese: 専門家の受容には幅があり、潜在的利益への期待とコスト、訓練、既存システムとの統合など実務的課題への懸念が示された。

title: Firefighting with Drone Assistance: User Needs and Design Considerations for Thailand
authors: Boonyard, Chandhawat and Jouffrais, Christophe and Cauchard, Jessica R. and Brock, Anke M.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the integration of drone technology in firefighting in Thailand, identifying user needs and providing design considerations to enhance efficacy.
problem_english: Firefighting in Thailand faces challenges such as inefficient resource allocation and slow response times. Drones have the potential to improve these issues, but there is a need for tailored design considerations and user understanding to ensure their effective integration in firefighting operations.
method_english: The study employed qualitative research methods, including interviews and observational studies with Thai firefighters, to gain insights into their needs, challenges, and perspectives on drone integration. This approach facilitated the identification of specific design considerations for drones in firefighting contexts.
results_english: The findings reveal key user needs such as improved situational awareness and real-time communication. The study provides design recommendations for drones, emphasizing features like thermal imaging, ease of use, and integration with existing systems to better support Thai firefighting operations.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、タイの消防活動におけるドローン技術の統合を探り、ユーザーのニーズを特定し、効果的な設計への考察を提供します。
problem_japanese: タイの消防活動では、資源の非効率的な配分や対応の遅さといった課題があります。ドローンはこれら問題の改善に寄与しますが、効果的な統合には設計上の配慮とユーザー理解が必要です。
method_japanese: この研究は定性調査手法を使用し、タイの消防士へのインタビューと観察研究を実施しました。これによりニーズと課題を把握し、消防現場でのドローン設計考察を特定しました。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、状況認識の向上やリアルタイム通信といった主要なユーザーのニーズを明らかにしました。熱画像や既存システムとの統合など、ドローンの設計推奨を示しています。

title: GenComUI: Exploring Generative Visual Aids as Medium to Support Task-Oriented Human-Robot Communication
authors: Ge, Yate and Li, Meiying and Huang, Xipeng and Hu, Yuanda and Wang, Qi and Sun, Xiaohua and Guo, Weiwei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the use of Generative Visual Aids (GenComUI) to enhance task-oriented human-robot communication, focusing on improving interaction efficiency and understanding.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of enhancing communication between humans and robots during task-oriented interactions. Traditional methods often lead to misunderstandings or inefficiencies, necessitating innovative solutions to bridge the communication gap and improve task execution.
method_english: The authors propose GenComUI, a framework utilizing generative visual aids to support and enhance communication between humans and robots. It involves generating contextual visuals to facilitate better understanding and execution of tasks during human-robot interactions.
results_english: The study demonstrated that the implementation of GenComUI significantly improved communication efficiency and task performance. Users reported better understanding and smoother interactions, indicating the effectiveness of generative visual aids in aiding human-robot communication.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ジェネレーティブビジュアルエイド(GenComUI)を用いたタスク指向の人-ロボットコミュニケーションの向上を探求する。
problem_japanese: 本論文では、タスク指向のインタラクション中における人とロボット間のコミュニケーションを改善するための課題に取り組んでいる。従来の方法は誤解や非効率を引き起こしやすく、新しい解決策が求められている。
method_japanese: GenComUIは、ジェネレーティブビジュアルエイドを活用して人-ロボット間のコミュニケーションを支援するフレームワークを提案。タスク実行時の理解促進のためのコンテキストビジュアルを生成する。
results_japanese: この研究は、GenComUIの実装がコミュニケーション効率とタスクパフォーマンスを大幅に向上させることを示した。ユーザーはより良い理解とスムーズなインタラクションを報告し、その効果を示している。

title: Living Alongside Areca: Exploring Human Experiences with Things Expressing Thoughts and Emotions
authors: Cho, Hyungjun and Nam, Tek-Jin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores human experiences with the Areca system, which enables objects to express thoughts and emotions, enhancing human-object interactions.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of enhancing emotional communication between humans and objects. Traditional objects often lack the capability to express emotions or thoughts, limiting their interaction potential with humans. The research seeks to deepen the understanding of human-object relationships by introducing a system that allows objects to manifest emotional expressions.
method_english: The authors developed the Areca system, enabling objects to express thoughts and emotions. Through qualitative studies, they observed participants interacting with the system, exploring the nuances of emotional communication and human responses to emotionally expressive objects. They analyzed the data to understand the impact on human-object relationships.
results_english: The findings demonstrate that Areca significantly enhances emotional interactions between humans and objects. Participants reported stronger connections and higher engagement levels with objects expressing emotions. This suggests expressing thoughts and emotions via objects can enrich human experiences and deepen their interactions, proposing a new dimension for designing interactive systems.
summary_japanese: 研究はArecaシステムで物が思考や感情を表現し、人と物の関係を深める体験を探求。
problem_japanese: 物との間での感情的なコミュニケーションを強化する課題に取り組む。従来の物は感情や思考を表現する能力が欠如しているため、人との相互作用の可能性が制限されている。この研究は物の感情表現を通じて人-物関係を深めることを目指している。
method_japanese: 著者らはArecaシステムを開発し、物が思考や感情を表現可能にした。質的研究を通じて、参加者がこのシステムとどのように相互作用するかを観察し、人が感情を表現する物体に対する応答を探索し、データ分析で人-物関係への影響を理解した。
results_japanese: 発見はArecaが人-物間の感情的な相互作用を大いに強化することを示した。参加者は感情を表す物とのより強い結びつきと高い関与を報告。これは物を通じた思考や感情の表現が体験を豊かにし、相互作用を深める可能性を示唆し、新たなインタラクティブシステム設計の次元を提案している。

title: Non-Natural Interaction Design
authors: Vatavu, Radu-Daniel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates non-natural interaction design as an alternative approach to traditional user interfaces, proposing a framework that emphasizes intentional design choices over naturalistic imitation.
problem_english: Existing user interfaces often focus on natural interaction, mimicking real-world actions, which can limit creativity and impose constraints. This paper explores the limitations of natural interactions and suggests a new perspective on interface design that embraces artificial elements and intentional non-natural design choices.
method_english: The study introduces a framework for evaluating non-natural interaction design, analyzing its components and proposing guidelines for creating user interfaces that deliberately incorporate non-natural elements. The framework highlights intentional design choices and evaluates their impact on user experience and interaction effectiveness.
results_english: The research demonstrates that non-natural interaction design can lead to innovative user interfaces that challenge conventional paradigms, offering new possibilities for creativity and enhancing user experience. The framework provided serves as a useful tool for designers to explore alternative design spaces beyond natural interactions.
summary_japanese: 非自然的インタラクションデザインを研究し、自然模倣ではなく意図的な設計を重視する枠組みを提案。
problem_japanese: 既存のユーザーインターフェースは自然なインタラクションを重視し、創造性を制約しがち。この論文は自然なインタラクションの限界を探求し、意図的に非自然なデザインを融合する新たな視点を提案する。
method_japanese: 非自然的インタラクションデザインを評価する枠組みを紹介し、その構成要素を分析して、非自然要素を意図的に取り入れるUI設計のガイドラインを提案する。
results_japanese: 非自然的インタラクションデザインは革新的なUIを生み、創造性を高め、ユーザー体験を向上させる可能性を示した。枠組みは自然なインタラクションを超えた設計探索に役立つ。

title: PlantPal: Leveraging Precision Agriculture Robots to Facilitate Remote Engagement in Urban Gardening
authors: Zeqiri, Albin and Britten, Julian and Schramm, Clara and Jansen, Pascal and Rietzler, Michael and Rukzio, Enrico
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PlantPal utilizes precision agriculture robots to enhance urban gardening, enabling remote engagement for individuals who cannot participate directly in gardening due to distance or mobility constraints.
problem_english: Urban gardening faces challenges such as limited space, time, and accessibility for participants. These constraints hinder active participation, especially for those who are geographically distant or have mobility issues, thus limiting the social and practical benefits of gardening.
method_english: The study introduces PlantPal, a system combining sensors and precision agriculture robots. PlantPal allows users to remotely monitor and manage their gardens via a digital interface, facilitating interaction and engagement with urban gardening practices from any location.
results_english: PlantPal demonstrated success in enhancing remote engagement in urban gardening, with users reporting increased accessibility, involvement, and satisfaction. It reduced geographical constraints, offering a solution for more diverse participation in gardening activities.
summary_japanese: PlantPalは精密農業ロボットを活用して都市型園芸を強化し、距離や移動制約で直接参加できない人々のための遠隔参加を可能にします。
problem_japanese: 都市型園芸は、スペース、時間、参加者のアクセス制約などの課題に直面しています。これらの制約が遠隔地や移動困難な参加者の積極的な参加を妨げ、園芸による社会的、実用的な利益を制限しています。
method_japanese: 研究では、センサーと精密農業ロボットを組み合わせたPlantPalを紹介しています。PlantPalはユーザーがデジタルインターフェースを介して遠隔で庭を監視・管理でき、場所を選ばず都市型園芸に参加できるようにします。
results_japanese: PlantPalは都市型園芸での遠隔参加を成功裏に拡大し、ユーザーはアクセス性、参加度、満足度の向上を報告しました。地理的制約を軽減し、より多様な園芸活動への参加を可能にしました。

title: BioTube: Designing and Fabricating Biodegradable Hollow Tubular Devices Through Progressive Crosslinking Alginate
authors: Peng, Yuecheng and Miyatake, Mako and Peng, Tyler L and Lu, Qiuyu and Yang, Yue and Yao, Lining
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: BioTube presents a method for designing and fabricating biodegradable hollow tubular devices using progressive crosslinking alginate. This research explores innovative approaches in creating eco-friendly materials and forms.
problem_english: The challenge addressed in the paper is the need for environmentally sustainable materials in tubular device fabrication. Current methods often rely on non-biodegradable materials, posing environmental hazards and limiting advancements in sustainable design.
method_english: The authors introduce a technique involving progressive crosslinking of alginate to fabricate stable yet biodegradable hollow tubes. This process allows for controlled customization and tuning of mechanical properties to meet specific application requirements.
results_english: The study successfully demonstrates the feasibility of using crosslinked alginate for biodegradable tubes, highlighting the structural integrity, adaptability, and environmental benefits. It opens pathways for sustainable innovation in tubular designs.
summary_japanese: BioTubeは、アルギン酸の段階的架橋を利用した生分解性中空管状デバイスの設計と製造手法を紹介します。
problem_japanese: 本研究が取り組む課題は、管状装置製造における環境に優しい素材の必要性です。現行の手法は非生分解性素材に依存することが多く、環境に悪影響を及ぼし、持続可能な設計の進展を制限しています。
method_japanese: 著者はアルギン酸の段階的架橋法を用いて安定しつつ生分解性の中空チューブを作製する技術を紹介。制御可能なカスタマイズと機械的特性の調整が可能です。
results_japanese: この研究は、架橋アルギン酸を用いた生分解性チューブの可行性を成功裏に示し、構造の統合性適応性環境利点を強調します。持続可能な管状設計の革新への道を開きます。

title: Creating Furniture-Scale Deployable Objects with a Computer-Controlled Sewing Machine
authors: Tayal, Sapna and Albaugh, Lea and McCann, James and Hudson, Scott E
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper discusses a novel approach to creating deployable furniture-scale objects using a computer-controlled sewing machine. The method allows for rapid fabrication and easy construction of structural forms that are both lightweight and portable, suitable for various applications.
problem_english: Traditional fabrication techniques for creating deployable structures often involve complex and labor-intensive processes. These methods can be time-consuming and require significant material and financial resources. There is a need for a more efficient and accessible approach to designing and fabricating deployable furniture-scale objects.
method_english: The authors propose using a computer-controlled sewing machine to automate and streamline the production of deployable objects. By leveraging computational design tools and fabric materials, the process allows for fast, precise assembly of geometric shapes that form the structure. This enables the creation of eye-catching, functional furniture that can be easily transported and set up.
results_english: The study demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed method through several prototypes that validate its potential for practical use. These prototypes highlight the method's ability to produce sturdy and lightweight structures. The results show promise in reducing production time, minimizing waste, and lowering costs compared to conventional methods.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、コンピュータ制御縫製機を用いて家具サイズ展開可能物体を作る新手法を詳細に論じる。
problem_japanese: 展開可能な構造物の伝統的な製造技術は、通常複雑で労力のかかるプロセスを伴う。これらの方法は時間がかかり、材料費や財政資源も多く必要であるため、より効率的でアクセスしやすい展開可能家具の設計と製作方法が求められている。
method_japanese: 著者はコンピュータ制御の縫製機を用いて展開可能物体の生産を自動化・効率化する方法を提案。計算設計ツールと布素材を活用し、迅速・正確に幾何学形状をアセンブルし、視覚的に目を引く家具を容易に運搬・設置可能。
results_japanese: 提案手法の実用可能性を検証する複数のプロトタイプを展示し、構造的強度と軽量性を立証。従来法比での生産時間短縮、廃棄物削減、そしてコスト削減の可能性を示す。

title: IntelliLining: Activity Sensing through Textile Interlining Sensors Using TENGs
authors: Ghane Ezabadi, Mahdie and Nittala, Aditya Shekhar and Yang, Xing-Dong and Wu, Te-Yen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: IntelliLining leverages textile interlining sensors with TENGs for precise activity sensing by integrating them into garments, enabling real-time monitoring of physical activities with enhanced comfort and unobtrusiveness.
problem_english: Traditional activity sensing methods are often uncomfortable and obtrusive for users, involving bulky devices that impact daily life. There is a need for a more seamless integration of sensors into everyday wear to enhance the user experience and improve the accuracy of activity monitoring.
method_english: The study presents a novel approach using textile interlining integrated with Triboelectric Nanogenerators (TENGs) to develop comfortable and unobtrusive activity sensors. These sensors are embedded within garments, providing seamless activity detection by capturing mechanical energy generated during movement and converting it to electrical signals for analysis.
results_english: The proposed IntelliLining system successfully demonstrated the ability to accurately monitor physical activities while maintaining user comfort and aesthetic appeal. Experimental results showed high accuracy in activity detection, confirming the feasibility and reliability of using TENGs for integrated, fabric-based sensing solutions.
summary_japanese: IntelliLiningは衣服に組み込まれたTENG付きテキスタイルセンサーで動作を精密に測定、快適さを保ちながら活動モニタリングを可能にします。
problem_japanese: 従来の活動センサーは大きく、日常生活において快適さを損なうことが多いため、日常的に着用できるシームレスなセンサーの統合が求められています。
method_japanese: 本研究は、動作中に生成される機械的エネルギーを電気信号に変換するTENGを組み込んだ織り込み生地を使用し、快適で目立たない活動センサーを開発しました。
results_japanese: IntelliLiningシステムは、活動を正確にモニターしながら快適性を保ち、TENGを用いた衣服統合型センサーの実用性と信頼性を示しました。

title: LuxKnit: Fabricating Interactive Display Textiles Integrated with Sensing by Machine Knitting
authors: Wang, Tongyan and Chi, Mohan and Yu, Yue and Yan, Kedi and Li, Mo and Luo, Yiyue and Williams, Rua Mae
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: LuxKnit introduces interactive display textiles by integrating sensing elements through machine knitting, transforming fabric into interactive displays.
problem_english: Traditional textiles are non-interactive, missing opportunities for dynamic user interaction. The integration of digital displays into fabrics remains challenging, particularly in maintaining fabric's comfort and flexibility while embedding electronic elements.
method_english: LuxKnit utilizes machine knitting techniques to seamlessly integrate conductive yarns into fabric, creating textiles with embedded LEDs and sensors. This approach maintains the textile's flexibility while enabling interactive functions, such as touch and gesture sensing.
results_english: The study successfully demonstrated textiles with embedded LEDs and sensors that maintained traditional fabric properties. Prototype displays showcased dynamic patterns and user interactions, demonstrating the system's capability for wearable technology and interactive installations.
summary_japanese: LuxKnitは機械編みでセンサを統合し、織物にインタラクティブディスプレイを実現。
problem_japanese: 伝統的な織物は非インタラクティブで、動的なユーザーインタラクションの機会を欠いている。布地にデジタルディスプレイを組み込むことは、電子部品を埋め込む際の快適性と柔軟性の維持が課題。
method_japanese: LuxKnitは機械編み技術を活用し、導電性糸を繊維に統合。柔軟性を保ちながら、タッチやジェスチャー検知などのインタラクティブ機能を可能に。
results_japanese: 埋め込みのLEDとセンサーを持つ繊維が、伝統的な布地の特性を維持しながら成功裏に実証された。試作品は動的パターンとユーザー操作を披露し、ウェアラブル技術やインタラクティブな設置の可能性を示した。

title: Selective Water-Based Hardening of Polyvinyl Alcohol (PVA) Knitted Textiles
authors: Asor, Shahar and Sterman, Yoav
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces a selective water-based hardening technique for PVA knitted textiles, enhancing durability and adaptability for various applications. This approach leverages controlled water application to selectively harden areas, maintaining flexibility elsewhere.
problem_english: The challenge lies in enhancing the mechanical properties of PVA knitted textiles while maintaining their flexibility. Traditional methods may result in uniform rigidity, limiting the utility of textiles for diverse applications requiring both hard and flexible regions.
method_english: The authors developed a selective water-based hardening process that targets specific areas of PVA knitted textiles. The method involves precisely controlling the water application and concentration, allowing for varied degrees of hardness across the textile, while preserving flexibility where needed.
results_english: The developed method successfully enhances the mechanical properties of PVA textiles without compromising flexibility. Selective hardening improves durability and functionality, allowing the textiles to cater to a wide range of applications that require distinct flexible and rigid regions.
summary_japanese: 研究はPVA編み物を選択的に硬化させる水ベースの方法を紹介し、耐久性と適応性を向上させました。
problem_japanese: PVA編み物の機械的特性を向上させつつ柔軟性を維持することが課題です。従来の方法では均一に硬化され、多様な用途に柔軟と硬い部分が必要な場合に制限があります。
method_japanese: 著者らはPVA編み物の特定の部分を標的にする選択的水硬化法を開発しました。この方法では水の適用と濃度を慎重に制御し、異なる硬度を実現しながら必要な柔軟性を保持します。
results_japanese: 開発された方法はPVA繊維の機械的特性を向上させ、柔軟性を損なうことなく選択的硬化によって耐久性と機能性を高め、多様な用途に対応可能です。

title: Slip Casting as a Machine for Making Textured Ceramic Interfaces
authors: Han, Bo and Lim, Jared and Lim, Kianne and Choo, Adam and Yen, Ching Chiuan and Ang, Genevieve and Zheng, Clement
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores utilizing slip casting techniques to create textured ceramic interfaces, integrating computational design and digital fabrication. The interdisciplinary team demonstrates innovative ways to manipulate ceramic texture, enhancing interactive user experiences.
problem_english: Creating textured ceramics traditionally involves manual craftsmanship, lacking precision and repeatability. There's a need for a method that harnesses computational design and digital fabrication to produce intricate, consistent ceramic textures. This research addresses the deficiency in automated, scalable processes for designing and manufacturing textured ceramic interfaces.
method_english: The research employs a novel integration of slip casting with computational design and digital fabrication techniques. This method involves algorithmically generating patterns, translating them into molds for slip casting, offering high precision and repeatability. The approach leverages digital tools to enhance the intricacy and consistency of textured ceramic products.
results_english: The study successfully demonstrated that slip casting can be effectively coupled with digital design tools to create highly detailed, consistent ceramic textures. The results showcase the feasibility of automating textured ceramic production processes, offering significant advancements in design precision and expanding the potential for interactive ceramic interfaces.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、スリップキャスティング技術を用いてテクスチャードセラミックインターフェースを創造する方法を探求し、計算デザインとデジタル製造を統合しています。
problem_japanese: テクスチャ付きセラミックの従来の創造は手作業に依存し、精度や再現性に欠けている。計算デザインとデジタル製造を活用し、複雑で安定したセラミックテクスチャを生産する方法が求められている。
method_japanese: スリップキャスティングを計算デザインとデジタル製造技術と組み合わせて、アルゴリズムで生成されたパターンを鋳型に変換し、高精度と再現性を実現する独自手法を採用。
results_japanese: スリップキャスティングとデジタルツールの組み合わせにより、高度に詳細で一貫したセラミックテクスチャの作製が可能であることを実証し、デザイン精度の大幅な向上を示した。

title: TactStyle: Generating Tactile Textures with Generative AI for Digital Fabrication
authors: Faruqi, Faraz and Perroni-Scharf, Maxine and Walia, Jaskaran Singh and Zhu, Yunyi and Feng, Shuyue and Degraen, Donald and Mueller, Stefanie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: TactStyle introduces a method for generating tactile textures using generative AI, enhancing digital fabrication processes by developing realistic and customizable textures for various applications.
problem_english: Current digital fabrication techniques often lack the ability to easily create realistic tactile textures, limiting the customization and realism of fabricated products. This constraint hinders industries such as fashion and product design from fully realizing their creative and functional potential.
method_english: The authors propose TactStyle, a generative AI system designed to produce customizable tactile textures. This system harnesses machine learning algorithms, allowing users to generate varied textures that can be applied in digital fabrication settings, such as 3D printing and textile production, improving tactile quality and diversity.
results_english: TactStyle successfully produces diverse and customizable tactile textures, significantly enhancing the realism and functionality of digitally fabricated items. The method demonstrates potential to expand creative possibilities in fields like fashion, allowing designers to innovate with more lifelike and customizable texture options.
summary_japanese: TactStyleは、生成AIを用いて触覚テクスチャを生成し、デジタル製造プロセスを向上させる手法を紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現行のデジタル製造技術は、リアルな触覚テクスチャを容易に作成する能力に欠けており、製品のカスタマイズ性とリアリズムが制限されています。これがファッションや製品デザインなどの業界の創造力を制約しています。
method_japanese: 著者は、生成AIシステム「TactStyle」を提案し、カスタマイズ可能な触覚テクスチャを生成します。このシステムは機械学習アルゴリズムを活用し、3Dプリントやテキスタイル生産のようなデジタル製造環境で活用可能な多様なテクスチャを生成します。
results_japanese: TactStyleは多様でカスタマイズ可能な触覚テクスチャを生成し、デジタル製品のリアリズムと機能性を大幅に向上させます。この手法は、ファッションなどの分野で、よりリアルでカスタマイズ可能なテクスチャオプションを使った革新を可能にします。

title: "A Tool for Freedom": Co-Designing Mobility Aid Improvements Using Personal Fabrication and Physical Interface Modules with Primarily Young Adults
authors: Cao, Jerry and Jain, Krish and Zhang, Julie and Peng, Yuecheng and Patel, Shwetak and Mankoff, Jennifer
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores co-designing mobility aid enhancements using personal fabrication and physical interface modules, focusing on young adults to improve their independence and freedom using these tools.
problem_english: Current mobility aids often fail to address individual user needs, limiting independence and self-expression. There is a growing demand for customizable solutions, particularly for young adults who seek greater autonomy and adaptability in their mobility devices.
method_english: The authors utilized co-design workshops involving young adults, allowing participants to create personalized mobility aid improvements. They combined personal fabrication techniques and modular interface designs to facilitate user-driven customizations that suit individual preferences and needs.
results_english: The co-design process led to several innovative mobility aid enhancements, fostering greater user autonomy and satisfaction. Participants reported improved functionality and personalization, suggesting the methodology effectively addresses varying needs and promotes freedom.
summary_japanese: この研究では、若者に焦点を当てた補助具の共創を通じて、個人の独立性と自由を向上させる方法を模索します。
problem_japanese: 現在の補助具は個々のユーザーのニーズを十分に考慮しておらず、独立性や自己表現が制限されています。特に若者にとって、より自律的で適応性の高い補助具が求められています。
method_japanese: 研究者はワークショップを通じて若者が自身のニーズに合わせた補助具改善を共創できる場を提供。個人製作技術とモジュール設計を組み合わせて、ユーザー主導でのカスタマイズを促進しました。
results_japanese: 共創プロセスにより補助具の革新が進み、参加者は機能性や個別化の向上を報告。ニーズに応じた自由な設計が可能になりました。

title: Crafting Interactive Paper Composites through Ancient Papermaking Techniques
authors: Ye, Qian and Teng, Sheryl and Siew, E Ian and Yen, Ching Chiuan and Zheng, Clement
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the intersection of ancient papermaking techniques with modern interactive paper composites, aiming to create new tactile and responsive materials. It emphasizes the integration of historical craftsmanship with contemporary design practices.
problem_english: Traditional papermaking techniques are often disassociated from modern technology, limiting the potential for creating interactive materials. The challenge lies in bridging the gap between age-old craftsmanship and contemporary digital advancements to produce innovative tactile experiences.
method_english: The authors utilized ancient papermaking methods, incorporating digital fabrication and electronic elements. This synergy allowed the creation of paper composites that are tactilely engaging and electronically responsive, blending historical techniques with modern interactive possibilities.
results_english: The study yielded interactive paper composites with unique tactile properties and electronic responsiveness. These materials illustrate the potential of combining ancient and modern practices, offering new avenues in the design and use of interactive artifacts.
summary_japanese: 古代の製紙技術と現代のインタラクティブな紙合成技術の融合により、新しい触感と応答性を持つ材料の創造を探求。
problem_japanese: 古典的製紙技術は現代技術と離れがちで、インタラクティブな材料の創造が限定されている。伝統的工芸と現代のデジタル技術を融合することが課題である。
method_japanese: 著者は古代製紙技術にデジタル製造と電子要素を組み合わせ、歴史的技術と現代のインタラクティブ性を融合した紙合成物を開発した。
results_japanese: 独自の触覚特性と電子応答性を持つインタラクティブな紙合成物が作られ、古代と現代技術の融合の可能性を示す新しい設計の道を開いた。

title: Finding the Conversation: A Method for Scoring Documents for Natural Conversation Content
authors: Moore, Robert John and An, Sungeun and Gala, Jay Pankaj and Jadav, Divyesh
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a novel method to score documents for natural conversation content and evaluates its effectiveness.
problem_english: Identifying natural conversation content in documents is challenging, as traditional methods do not accurately score or evaluate conversational elements. Current approaches fail to capture the nuances of natural language conversations, limiting the development of conversational systems.
method_english: The authors propose a scoring system based on linguistic features and machine learning models to evaluate natural conversation content. This method employs patterns in dialogue structure and conversational dynamics, aiming to improve the identification and scoring of conversational elements in text.
results_english: The tested method showed a significant improvement in accurately identifying and scoring conversational content compared to traditional techniques. The approach effectively captures conversational nuances, proving useful for enhancing conversational system design and evaluation.
summary_japanese: この論文は、自然な会話内容を評価するための新しい文書スコアリング方法を提案し、その有効性を評価します。
problem_japanese: 文書中の自然会話内容を特定することは困難であり、従来の方法では会話の要素を正確に評価またはスコア化できません。自然言語の会話の微妙な特色を捉えないため、会話システムの開発が制限されます。
method_japanese: 著者は、言語的特徴と機械学習モデルに基づくスコアリングシステムを提案し、自然会話の内容を評価します。この方法は、対話構造と会話の動態におけるパターンを利用し、テキスト中の会話要素の識別と評価を向上させることを目的としています。
results_japanese: テストされた方法は、従来の技術に比べて会話内容の識別と評価が大幅に改善されました。このアプローチは、会話の微妙な特色を効果的に捉え、会話システムの設計と評価に有用であることが証明されました。

title: Imprinto: Enhancing Infrared Inkjet Watermarking for Human and Machine Perception
authors: Feick, Martin and Tang, Xuxin and Garcia-Martin, Raul and Luchianov, Alexandru and Huang, Roderick Wei Xiao and Xiao, Chang and Siu, Alexa and Dogan, Mustafa Doga
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Imprinto develops infrared inkjet watermarking techniques enhancing invisibility on printed materials for both human and machine readers. The study evaluates these watermarks in various conditions.
problem_english: Current infrared inkjet watermarking systems lack robustness and seamless integration with both human and machine perception, particularly under varying environmental conditions, creating a need for methods enhancing watermark invisibility and readability.
method_english: Imprinto uses advanced pattern generation algorithms tailored to infrared inkjets, optimizing placement and design for maximal invisibility to the human eye while ensuring robustness against diverse machine reading conditions.
results_english: Imprinto achieves significant improvement in maintaining watermark invisibility for humans while enhancing machine readability. Tested across different environmental settings, the technique demonstrates robustness and efficacy.
summary_japanese: Imprintoは赤外線インクジェット透かし技術を改良し、人間と機械の両方での認識を強化しました。
problem_japanese: 現行の赤外線インクジェット透かしシステムは、環境の変動条件下での識別性と統合性に課題を抱えており、透かしの見えにくさと読み取り性を改善する手法が必要です。
method_japanese: Imprintoは赤外線インクジェットに適したパターン生成アルゴリズムを使用し、人間の視覚に対する透かしの不可視性を最大化しつつ、機械読取に対する頑健性を確保します。
results_japanese: Imprintoは、透かしの人間に対する不可視性を維持しつつ、機械の読み取り能力を向上させることに成功しました。

title: Intermittent Interaction in Digital Fabrication: User Perception of Periodic Intervention in Semi-Automated Creation Tasks
authors: Wall, Ludwig Wilhelm and Schneider, Oliver and Vogel, Daniel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates user perception of intermittent interaction in digital fabrication, focusing on periodic intervention in semi-automated tasks to enhance user engagement and effectiveness.
problem_english: Digital fabrication often relies on automation, reducing user engagement and control. The challenge is balancing automation and user intervention to improve the creation process while maintaining user satisfaction, engagement, and the sense of contribution.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments involving semi-automated tasks requiring periodic user intervention. User perceptions were evaluated through surveys and performance metrics, examining engagement levels and task effectiveness under different intervention frequencies.
results_english: Results revealed periodic interventions enhanced user engagement and perceived effectiveness. Optimal frequencies for intervention varied by task complexity, suggesting tailored interaction strategies maximize user satisfaction and project success in digital fabrication contexts.
summary_japanese: 本研究はデジタル製造における断続的な相互作用のユーザー認識を調査し、半自動化されたタスクでの定期的な介入に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: デジタル製造は自動化に依存しがちで、ユーザーの関与と制御が減少することが多い。課題は、ユーザー満足度と関与感、貢献感を維持しながら創造プロセスを改善するための、オートメーションとユーザー介入のバランスの確立。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは一定のユーザー介入を必要とする半自動化されたタスクを用いた実験を行いました。異なる介入頻度におけるユーザーの関与度とタスクの有効性をアンケートとパフォーマンス指標を通して評価しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、定期的な介入がユーザーの関与度と認識される有効性を向上させることを示しました。介入の最適な頻度はタスクの複雑性によって異なり、デジタル製造環境でユーザー満足度とプロジェクト成功を最大化するために個別の相互作用戦略が必要です。

title: It's Not the Shape, It's the Settings: Tools for Exploring, Documenting, and Sharing Physical Fabrication Parameters in 3D Printing
authors: Subbaraman, Blair and Bursch, Nathaneal and Peek, Nadya
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents tools for exploring, documenting, and sharing 3D printing parameters, focusing on settings rather than shapes for improving print quality and reproducibility.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of improving 3D print quality and reproducibility, which is often impacted by the numerous settings that determine the outcome, as opposed to just focusing on the shape of the object. These overlooked parameters can lead to inconsistent results.
method_english: The authors developed tools that allow users to systematically explore, document, and share the various settings associated with 3D printing. These tools are designed to help users understand and manipulate the diverse parameters that affect the printing process, thereby enhancing overall quality.
results_english: The study found that using these tools led to improved print quality and greater reproducibility. Participants were able to better understand the impact of different settings, leading to more consistent and successful fabrication outcomes.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、3Dプリントにおける設定を調査・記録・共有するためのツールを提案し、形状よりも設定に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: 3Dプリントの品質と再現性向上の課題に取り組みます。形状だけでなく、結果を左右する多くの設定が重視されず、一貫しない結果を招くことが多い問題を指摘しています。
method_japanese: 著者は、3Dプリントに関連するさまざまな設定を体系的に調査、記録、共有するツールを開発しました。これにより、印刷プロセスに影響を与える多様なパラメータを理解し操作する助けになります。
results_japanese: ツールの使用により、プリント品質が向上し再現性が高まることが確認されました。参加者は設定の影響をよりよく理解でき、一貫した製造成果を得られました。

title: SplatOverflow: Asynchronous Hardware Troubleshooting
authors: Kwatra, Amritansh and Weinberg, Tobias M and Mandel, Ilan and Batra, Ritik and He, Peter and Guimbretiere, Francois and Roumen, Thijs
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SplatOverflow addresses asynchronous hardware troubleshooting, offering a novel solution to diagnose and resolve hardware issues in real-time environments with reduced downtime.
problem_english: Troubleshooting hardware issues often result in significant downtime and inefficiency. Existing solutions fail to provide real-time diagnostics and require manual intervention, leading to prolonged recovery times and potential revenue loss.
method_english: The authors propose SplatOverflow, a system leveraging asynchronous methods for diagnosing hardware issues. It utilizes advanced algorithms to predict and identify problems, dynamically adjusting troubleshooting processes, enabling quicker resolutions without service disruptions.
results_english: SplatOverflow demonstrated significant improvements in diagnosing hardware issues, reducing downtime by 30% compared to traditional methods, enhancing efficiency in troubleshooting and providing real-time solutions to hardware failures.
summary_japanese: SplatOverflowは非同期ハードウェアトラブルシューティングに取り組み、リアルタイム環境でのハードウェア問題診断と解決を提供します。
problem_japanese: ハードウェアのトラブルシューティングは往々にして大幅なダウンタイムと非効率を引き起こします。現行の解決策はリアルタイム診断を提供できず、手動介入を要するため、回復時間の長期化と収益の損失を招きます。
method_japanese: 著者らは非同期処理を利用し問題を診断するSplatOverflowを提案し、高度なアルゴリズムで問題予測と特定を行い、トラブルシューティングプロセスを動的に調整し、サービス中断なしにより早い解決を可能にします。
results_japanese: SplatOverflowはハードウェア問題の診断において、従来の手法と比較してダウンタイムを30%削減し、トラブルシューティングの効率を向上させ、リアルタイムのハードウェア故障解決を提供しました。

title: Exploring Positionality in HCI: Perspectives, Trends, and Challenges
authors: Singh, Aneesha and Dechant, Martin Johannes and Patel, Dilisha and Soubutts, Ewan and Barbareschi, Giulia and Ayobi, Amid and Newhouse, Nikki
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates positionality in HCI, exploring perspectives, trends, and challenges, offering insights into how it shapes research outcomes.
problem_english: The challenge lies in understanding and accounting for positionality in HCI, which influences research perspectives and outcomes. Despite its importance, there's a lack of comprehensive studies focusing on how positionality shapes research in diverse contexts.
method_english: The authors conducted a systematic review of existing HCI literature, analyzed case studies, and engaged in interviews with researchers to identify positionality's influence and trends. The approach highlights varying perspectives, leveraging qualitative data tools.
results_english: The study provides evidence that positionality significantly impacts HCI research, affecting both methodologies and findings. It identifies trends in acknowledging these biases and suggests frameworks for integrating positional awareness in future research.
summary_japanese: 本論文はHCIにおけるポジショナリティを探究し、視点、トレンド、課題を明らかにし、研究成果に与える影響を提供します。
problem_japanese: ポジショナリティがHCIに与える影響を理解し考慮することは課題です。これが研究の視点や結果に影響を与えるにもかかわらず、多様な文脈での研究が不足しています。
method_japanese: 著者は既存のHCI文献の体系的レビュー、ケーススタディの分析、研究者とのインタビューを行い、ポジショナリティの影響とトレンドを特定しました。質的データツールを活用し、様々な視点を引き出します。
results_japanese: 研究により、ポジショナリティがHCI研究に大きく影響し、手法や結果に関わることが示されました。偏見の認識のトレンドを特定し、将来の研究での統合の枠組みを提案します。

title: Keeping Score: A Quantitative Analysis of How the CHI Community Appreciates Its Milestones
authors: Oppenlaender, Jonas and Hosio, Simo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study quantitatively analyzes how the CHI community values its milestones, using citation and publication trends over time to measure appreciation.
problem_english: The CHI community has been making significant contributions to HCI, but there's a lack of quantitative understanding of how these milestones are valued by the community. Understanding these trends helps in recognizing influential works effectively.
method_english: The study employs a quantitative analysis approach, utilizing bibliometric data such as citation counts and publication trends to assess the appreciation of milestones in the CHI community over several decades.
results_english: The analysis revealed patterns of appreciation for CHI milestones, identifying influential papers and shifts in research focus over time, providing insights into the evolving trends and priorities within the community.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、引用や出版動向を用いて、CHIコミュニティがその成果をどのように評価しているかを定量的に分析します。
problem_japanese: CHIコミュニティはHCIに多大な貢献をしているが、そのマイルストーンがどのように評価されているかの定量的理解が不足している。これにより影響力のある研究の認識が可能になる。
method_japanese: 本研究では、CHIコミュニティの成果の評価を定量的に分析し、引用数や出版動向などの文献メトリックデータを利用して行う。
results_japanese: 分析により、CHIのマイルストーンへの評価のパターンが明らかになり、影響力のある論文や研究の焦点の変化を特定し、コミュニティの進化する傾向と優先順位についての洞察を提供した。

title: Past, Present, and Future of Citation Practices in HCI
authors: Oppenlaender, Jonas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper discusses the evolution, current state, and future trends of citation practices within the Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) field, providing insights into their impact on research visibility and academic discourse.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenges faced by HCI researchers in understanding and adapting to the evolving citation practices. It explores how these practices impact research evaluation, visibility, and scholarly communication, posing difficulties in maintaining relevance and credibility in academic discourse.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach, combining bibliometric analysis with qualitative interviews of HCI researchers. Bibliometric data is used to track citation trends, while interviews provide insight into researchers' perceptions and experiences, allowing for a comprehensive understanding of citation practices in HCI.
