There is a need to explore how AI can be integrated into creative practices in ways that provoke critical reflection and novel artistic expressions. This also involves examining human-AI interactions in artistic processes.
method_english: The authors employed a practice-based research approach, designing interactions with AI-driven imaging systems they describe as 'provocative cameras'. These systems were engineered to challenge users’ assumptions and creative processes, resulting in new dynamics in the creation and interpretation of images through iterative experimentation and user feedback.
results_english: The study revealed that 'provocative cameras' can stimulate users to reconsider their creative approaches, offering unexpected insights into the role of AI in art. Participants engaged in reflective practices, rethinking authorship and embracing AI as a collaborative partner, which led to richer, more dynamic creative outcomes.
summary_japanese: AI駆動の「挑発的カメラ」との創造的相互作用を探り、従来の画像制作を挑戦。新たな芸術的洞察を触発。
problem_japanese: AIによる画像制作の役割が増大する中で、創造性や著作権の伝統的理解が挑戦されている。AIを創造的実践に組み込む方法を探り、批判的反省と新たな芸術表現を促す必要がある。
method_japanese: 実践に基づく研究アプローチを採用し、ユーザーの仮定や創造的プロセスに挑戦するよう設計されたAI駆動の画像システム「挑発的カメラ」との相互作用をデザイン。
results_japanese: 「挑発的カメラ」はユーザーに創造的アプローチを再考させ、AIを協力的なパートナーとして受け入れることで、新たな洞察と動的な創造的結果をもたらした。

title: GenColor: Generative Color-Concept Association in Visual Design
authors: Hou, Yihan and Zeng, Xingchen and Wang, Yusong and Yang, Manling and Chen, Xiaojiao and Zeng, Wei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: GenColor introduces a novel generative model for associating colors with concepts in visual design, enhancing creativity and aesthetics. It leverages large datasets and AI to propose color palettes aligned with thematic concepts.
problem_english: Designers face challenges in selecting color palettes that suitably convey thematic concepts due to the complex, subjective nature of color association. This process is often time-consuming and may lack coherence. Automating and augmenting this process can facilitate more efficient, creative design outcomes.
method_english: GenColor employs a generative model leveraging large datasets and creative AI techniques to generate color palettes aligned with predefined thematic concepts. It utilizes deep learning to understand and associate colors with concepts, enhancing the automation of color selection in design processes.
results_english: The evaluation demonstrated that GenColor effectively generated thematic color palettes that were well-received by designers for their coherence and creativity. The AI-assisted tool significantly reduced the time spent on color selection and improved the overall design quality and satisfaction.
summary_japanese: GenColorは視覚デザインにおける色と概念の関連付けを行う新しい生成モデルで、創造性と美観を向上させます。
problem_japanese: デザイナーは、テーマに合った色の選定が難しく、時間がかかり、一貫性に欠けることがあります。このプロセスを自動化し、補完することが求められます。
method_japanese: GenColorは、大規模データセットとクリエイティブAIを用いて、事前に定義されたテーマに合わせたカラーパレットを生成する生成モデルです。
results_japanese: 評価の結果、GenColorは一貫性と創造性のあるカラーパレットを生成し、デザイナーに高く評価され、色選定の時間を大幅に削減しました。

title: Reimagining Personal Data: Unlocking the Potential of AI-Generated Images in Personal Data Meaning-Making
authors: Park, Soobin and Kim, Hankyung and Lim, Youn-kyung
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the potential of AI-generated images for meaningful personal data interpretation, emphasizing new ways of using such data for personal insights and understanding.
problem_english: The main challenge addressed in this study is the underutilization of AI-generated images in personal data analysis for meaningful insights and personal understanding. Existing methods often lack depth in contextualizing personal data, missing opportunities for more profound meaning-making.
method_english: The authors propose a framework that integrates AI-generated images into personal data analysis, allowing users to visually interpret and contextualize their data. This approach leverages machine learning algorithms to generate personalized visual representations, aiming at enhancing user engagement and insight derivation.
results_english: The proposed framework successfully demonstrated improved user engagement and deeper personal insights when analyzing personal data. Users reported enhanced understanding and emotional connections with their data, indicating the value of AI-generated imagery in personal data interpretation and meaning-making.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、AI生成画像を用いて個人データを解釈し、新たな洞察や理解を得る可能性を探る。
problem_japanese: 本研究が取り組む主な課題は、個人データ分析におけるAI生成画像の活用不足である。既存の手法では個人データの文脈化が不十分であり、深い意義の創出が困難である。
method_japanese: AI生成画像を個人データ分析に組み込むフレームワークを提案。機械学習アルゴリズムで個別の視覚表現を生成し、ユーザーのデータ解釈と文脈化を支援する。
results_japanese: 提案したフレームワークは、個人データ分析においてユーザーの関与と洞察を向上させた。ユーザーはデータの理解と感情的なつながりが増したことを報告し、AI生成画像の価値が示された。

title: SketchFlex: Facilitating Spatial-Semantic Coherence in Text-to-Image Generation with Region-Based Sketches
authors: Lin, Haichuan and Ye, Yilin and Xia, Jiazhi and Zeng, Wei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SketchFlex introduces a region-based sketch mechanism to improve spatial-semantic coherence in text-to-image generation systems, enabling users to specify spatial layouts for semantic elements in generated images.
problem_english: Current text-to-image generation systems often struggle with ensuring spatial-semantic coherence, leading to images that do not accurately reflect the intended layout and relationships between semantic elements specified in the input text.
method_english: SketchFlex uses a novel technique allowing users to specify regions within sketches, guiding the placement and spatial layout of semantic elements. This enhances the coherence of resulting images by respecting the spatial intentions given in the sketches.
results_english: The system was evaluated and proved to generate images with significantly improved spatial-semantic coherence. Users found it easy to employ the region-based sketches, resulting in images that better matched their expectations compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: SketchFlexは、地域ベースのスケッチを用いてテキストから画像生成時の空間的意味的一貫性を向上させる方法を紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現在のテキストから画像への生成システムでは、空間的意味的一貫性を確保することが難しく、入力テキストの意図するレイアウトと意味要素の関係が画像に正確に反映されません。
method_japanese: SketchFlexは、ユーザーがスケッチ内で地域を特定し、意味要素の配置と空間レイアウトを導く新しい手法を使用し、生成された画像の一貫性を向上させます。
results_japanese: システムは評価され、空間的意味的一貫性が大幅に向上した画像を生成しました。ユーザーは地域ベースのスケッチを容易に利用でき、期待に合った画像が得られました。

title: Understanding User Perceptions and the Role of AI Image Generators in Image Creation Workflows
authors: Han, Shu-Jung and Fussell, Susan R.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates user perceptions and the integration of AI image generators into image creation workflows, highlighting both challenges and benefits.
problem_english: As AI image generators are increasingly used in creative workflows, understanding user perceptions and how these tools can enhance or hinder image creation processes is important. The paper addresses the lack of comprehensive understanding of users' experiences, challenges, and the perceived role of AI in their creative practices.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-methods study involving surveys and interviews with professional and amateur image creators. This approach aimed to gather comprehensive data on user experiences, preferences, and challenges faced when integrating AI image generators into their workflows.
results_english: The study finds that while AI image generators can enhance creative workflows by providing inspiration and reducing workload, users face challenges related to quality control, tool limitations, and the need for better integration features. Users appreciate tools that offer customization and improvements in user experience.
summary_japanese: 本論文はユーザーの認識とAI画像生成ツールの統合を調査し、課題と利点を強調しています。
problem_japanese: AI画像生成ツールが創造的ワークフローでますます使用される中で、ユーザーの認識とこれらのツールが画像制作プロセスをどのように向上または妨害するかを理解することが重要です。本論文は、ユーザーの体験、課題、および創造的実践におけるAIの役割に関する包括的理解の欠如に対処します。
method_japanese: 著者らはプロおよびアマチュアの画像制作者を対象に、調査とインタビューを行う混合的手法を使用しました。この手法により、AI画像生成ツールをワークフローに統合する際のユーザーの体験、好み、課題に関する包括的なデータを収集しました。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、AI画像生成ツールは創造的ワークフローを刺激し、作業負担を軽減できるが、品質管理やツールの制限、統合機能の必要性といった課題もあると判明しました。ユーザーはカスタマイズ可能でユーザー体験が向上するツールを評価しています。

title: HaloTouch: Using IR Multi-Path Interference to Support Touch Interactions with General Surfaces
authors: Xia, Ziyi and Huang, Xincheng and Fels, Sidney S and Xiao, Robert
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: HaloTouch proposes using infrared (IR) multi-path interference to enable touch interactions on general surfaces without the need for special hardware.
problem_english: Current touch interaction systems often rely on specialized hardware or surfaces, limiting their usability and accessibility. These systems can be costly and are not applicable for general-purpose surfaces. There is a need for a more universal solution to enable touch interaction on various surfaces without requiring exclusive technologies.
method_english: The proposed method, HaloTouch, utilizes infrared (IR) multi-path interference to detect touch points on general surfaces. This technique interprets IR signal variations caused by touch interactions, allowing the system to infer touch location without the need for additional touch-dedicated hardware.
results_english: HaloTouch successfully demonstrates the use of IR multi-path interference for touch detection on a variety of surfaces. The system effectively identifies touch points with high accuracy, showcasing its potential as a versatile and cost-effective solution for enabling touch interactions on general surfaces.
summary_japanese: HaloTouchは、赤外線多重経路干渉を用いて通常の表面でのタッチ操作を可能にする手法を提案。
problem_japanese: 現行のタッチ操作システムは特殊なハードウェアや専用表面に依存する場合が多く、そのために使用範囲やアクセス性が制限される。一般的な表面で使用可能な普遍的な解決策が必要とされている。
method_japanese: HaloTouchは赤外線多重経路干渉を利用し、通常の表面上でのタッチポイントを検出。この技術により、追加の専用ハードウェアなしでタッチ位置を推測できる。
results_japanese: HaloTouchは、さまざまな表面でのタッチ検出に成功。高精度でタッチポイントを特定し、一般表面でのタッチ操作を可能にする有効な手法を示した。

title: Mid-Air Gestures for Proactive Olfactory Interactions in Virtual Reality
authors: Li, Junxian and Wang, Yanan and Cui, Zhitong and Brooks, Jas and Yan, Yifan and Lou, Zhengyu and Li, Yucheng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores mid-air hand gestures for olfactory interactions in VR, aiming to enhance user experience by proactively controlling scent-related virtual environment elements.
problem_english: In virtual reality (VR) systems, olfactory interaction is limited compared to visual and auditory cues, reducing the immersive potential. Current VR lacks proactive olfactory controls, whereby users can intuitively manage scent dynamics. Addressing this gap is crucial for enhancing VR experiences.
method_english: Researchers developed a system integrating hand tracking and olfactory devices, enabling users to employ mid-air gestures to intuitively interact with scents in VR environments. The system anticipates user actions, providing real-time olfactory feedback.
results_english: The system demonstrated effectiveness in enhancing user engagement and immersion, with participants experiencing increased satisfaction and improved interaction dynamics, validated through user studies comparing traditional methods and gesture-based controls.
summary_japanese: 仮想現実における嗅覚インタラクションを強化するため、提案手法は空中ジェスチャーによる香り制御を研究します。
problem_japanese: 仮想現実システムでは、視覚や聴覚に比べて嗅覚インタラクションが制限されており、没入感が減少します。特にユーザーが直感的に香りを管理する積極的な嗅覚制御が不足していることが課題です。
method_japanese: ハンドトラッキングと嗅覚デバイスを統合したシステムを開発し、ユーザーが空中ジェスチャーでVR環境内の香りを直感的に操作できるようにしました。
results_japanese: 従来の方法と比較し、提案システムがユーザーの満足度と没入感を向上させる効果があることがユーザースタディで確認されました。

title: Online-EYE: Multimodal Implicit Eye Tracking Calibration for XR
authors: Hou, Baosheng James and Abramyan, Lucy and Gurumurthy, Prasanthi and Adams, Haley and Tosic Rodgers, Ivana and Gonzalez, Eric J and Patel, Khushman and Cola\c{c}o, Andrea and Pfeuffer, Ken and Gellersen, Hans and Ahuja, Karan and Gonzalez-Franco, Mar
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces Online-EYE, a method for implicit eye tracking calibration in XR systems using multimodal signals, aiming to improve user experience and interaction accuracy.
problem_english: Current XR systems often face challenges with eye tracking calibration, leading to inaccurate gaze estimations and suboptimal user experience. Explicit calibration processes can interrupt user interaction and are often cumbersome.
method_english: Online-EYE leverages implicit eye tracking calibration by using multimodal signals such as head orientation, VR controller inputs, and contextual interactions, allowing continuous calibration without interrupting user experience.
results_english: The evaluation of Online-EYE shows improved accuracy and reduced error rates in gaze estimation compared to traditional calibration methods, with seamless integration into user interactions in XR environments.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、XRシステムでの視線追跡校正を向上させるOnline-EYEを提案し、マルチモーダル信号を用いてユーザー体験と正確性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 現在のXRシステムは、視線追跡の校正に課題を抱えており、精度の低い注視推定やユーザー体験の悪化を招きます。明示的な校正プロセスは、ユーザーのインタラクションを中断することがあり、煩わしいことが多いです。
method_japanese: Online-EYEは、頭部の向きやVRコントローラーの入力、コンテキストの相互作用など、複数のモーダル信号を用いた暗黙の視線追跡校正を活用し、ユーザー体験を中断せずに継続的に校正を行います。
results_japanese: Online-EYEの評価により、伝統的な校正方法と比較して視線推定の精度が向上し、エラー率が低減し、XR環境でのユーザーインタラクションにスムーズに統合されることが示されました。

title: Palmpad: Enabling Real-Time Index-to-Palm Touch Interaction with a Single RGB Camera
authors: He, Zhe and Wang, Xiangyang and Shi, Yuanchun and Hsia, Chi and Liang, Chen and Yu, Chun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Palmpad introduces real-time index-to-palm touch interaction using a single RGB camera, enhancing user interfaces without additional hardware. This novel method detects touch points and gestures accurately at a low cost.
problem_english: Traditional touch interfaces require additional hardware and sensors to detect interactions, leading to high costs and complexity. There's a need for a low-cost, simple solution that allows for intuitive and precise finger-to-palm interactions in real-time.
method_english: The Palmpad system uses a single RGB camera combined with computer vision algorithms to recognize and map touch interactions on the palm. This approach enables real-time tracking and gesture detection without extra hardware.
results_english: Palmpad successfully detects index-to-palm interactions with high accuracy and responsiveness, demonstrating potential for enhancing user interfaces in various applications, especially where cost-effective touch solutions are needed.
summary_japanese: Palmpadは単一のRGBカメラを用いたリアルタイムインデックスから手のひらへのタッチインタラクションを導入し、ユーザーインターフェースを拡張します。
problem_japanese: 従来のタッチインターフェースは追加のハードウェアとセンサーを必要とし、高コストや複雑さを伴います。直感的で精密な指から手のひらへのリアルタイムインタラクションを低コストで実現する必要があります。
method_japanese: Palmpadシステムは単一のRGBカメラを使用し、コンピュータビジョンアルゴリズムで手のひら上のタッチインタラクションを認識およびマッピングします。この方法で追加ハードなしでリアルタイムトラッキングとジェスチャー検出を実現。
results_japanese: Palmpadは高精度・高応答性でインデックスから手のひらへのインタラクションを検出し、さまざまなアプリケーションでコスト効果の高いタッチソリューションの可能性を示しています。

title: PatternTrack: Multi-Device Tracking Using Infrared, Structured-Light Projections from Built-in LiDAR
authors: Kim, Daehwa and Xiao, Robert and Harrison, Chris
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: PatternTrack leverages built-in LiDAR infrared and structured-light to enable multi-device tracking, enhancing interactions across different devices seamlessly.
problem_english: Current device tracking methods face challenges such as high cost, complexity, and limited compatibility across multiple devices. These limitations restrict seamless interactivity and interoperability among various devices, hindering cohesive user experiences.
method_english: PatternTrack uses infrared and structured-light projections from built-in LiDAR sensors for cost-effective and precise multi-device tracking. The approach bypasses traditional complexities by utilizing the ubiquitous LiDAR technology embedded in modern devices to streamline interactions.
results_english: PatternTrack demonstrated robust tracking capabilities across various devices, offering seamless interactions with improved accuracy and reduced latency. Extensive testing confirmed the system's efficiency, making it a compelling solution for integrated device ecosystems.
summary_japanese: PatternTrackは、内蔵LiDARの赤外線と構造光を利用して、複数デバイスのトラッキングを実現し、シームレスな相互作用を促進します。
problem_japanese: 現在のデバイストラッキング手法は、コストが高く、複雑で、複数のデバイス間での互換性が限られているという課題があります。これらの制約がユーザー体験を阻害しています。
method_japanese: PatternTrackは、内蔵LiDARセンサーの赤外線と構造光を利用して、費用効果の高い正確な複数デバイストラッキングを実現します。現代デバイスに組み込まれたLiDAR技術を活用し、従来の複雑さを回避します。
results_japanese: PatternTrackは、様々なデバイス間で強力なトラッキング能力を示し、精度と応答性を向上させました。広範なテストにより、その効率性が確認されました。

title: Sketch2Terrain: AI-Driven Real-Time Terrain Sketch Mapping in Augmented Reality
authors: Xiao, Tianyi and Chen, Yizi and Zhong, Sailin and Kiefer, Peter and Krukar, Jakub and Kim, Kevin Gonyop and Hurni, Lorenz and Schwering, Angela and Raubal, Martin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Sketch2Terrain presents a novel AR tool that allows users to create terrain maps in real-time using AI. The system converts sketches into 3D terrains, enhancing user interaction with geographic space.
problem_english: Current AR tools for terrain mapping lack real-time interaction and intuitive user interfaces, limiting the ability to efficiently create and manipulate topographical data. These limitations hinder user engagement and prevent the seamless integration of virtual and physical environments.
method_english: The proposed method leverages deep learning and computer vision to interpret hand-drawn sketches in augmented reality. The system then translates these sketches into 3D terrain models on the fly, using a combination of neural networks and AR technologies to provide immediate visual feedback to the user.
results_english: Experimental results demonstrate that Sketch2Terrain significantly improves the speed and accuracy of terrain mapping. User studies suggest increased engagement and satisfaction, highlighting the system's capability to seamlessly integrate virtual terrains with the real world, enhancing both educational and practical applications.
summary_japanese: Sketch2TerrainはAIを用いてスケッチをリアルタイムで地形に変換するARツールで、地理空間のユーザー体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 現行のAR地形ツールはリアルタイムでのインタラクションや直感的操作性に乏しく、トポグラフィーデータの効率的な生成と操作が困難で、ユーザーの関与を阻害します。
method_japanese: 提案手法はディープラーニングとコンピュータビジョンを利用し、AR環境で手描きスケッチを解釈します。ニューラルネットワークとAR技術を組み合わせ、スケッチを即座に3D地形モデルに変換します。
results_japanese: Sketch2Terrainは地形マッピングの速度と精度を大幅に向上し、ユーザースタディではシステムにより仮想地形と現実世界をシームレスに統合する能力が評価されました。

title: Understanding Usability of VR Pointing Methods with a Handheld-style HMD for Onsite Exhibitions
authors: Abe, Yuki and Kusakabe, Kan and Choi, Myungguen and Sakamoto, Daisuke and Ono, Tetsuo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates VR pointing methods using handheld-style HMDs in onsite exhibitions, comparing usability and efficiency to enhance interactive experiences.
problem_english: The research addresses the lack of usability studies on VR pointing methods when using handheld-style Head-Mounted Displays (HMDs) in on-site exhibitions. Traditional VR systems may not align well with this context, potentially limiting user interaction and the overall experience. Understanding how different pointing methods perform in this environment is crucial for designing effective and engaging VR experiences.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies comparing different VR pointing methods with a handheld-style HMD in onsite exhibition settings. They evaluated the usability and performance metrics, gathering feedback through questionnaires and direct observation of user interactions. The study focused on quantifying task completion time, error rates, and user satisfaction to understand the suitability of various pointing methods in handling exhibition-specific tasks.
results_english: The study identified specific pointing methods that outperform others in terms of efficiency and user satisfaction within onsite exhibitions using handheld-style HMDs. The results show that methods utilizing intuitive hand gestures and simplified interface controls significantly lower task completion time and errors, enhancing overall user experience. These findings inform design guidelines for future VR exhibition applications.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、オンサイト展示における手持ち型HMDのVRポインティング手法を検討し、ユーザビリティと効率性を比較するものです。
problem_japanese: 本研究は手持ち型HMDを使用したオンサイト展示におけるVRポインティング手法のユーザビリティ研究の欠如に対処します。従来のVRシステムはこの文脈に適合しない可能性があり、ユーザーの相互作用と全体的な体験を制限する恐れがあります。異なるポインティング手法がこの環境でどのように機能するか理解することは、効果的かつ魅力的なVR体験の設計にとって重要です。
method_japanese: 著者はオンサイト展示における手持ち型HMDを使用した様々なVRポインティング手法を比較するユーザー研究を行いました。ユーザビリティとパフォーマンス指標を評価し、アンケートやユーザーインタラクションの直接観察を通じてフィードバックを収集しました。この研究は、展示特有のタスク管理における各ポインティング手法の適合性を理解するため、タスク完了時間とエラー率、ユーザー満足度の定量化に重点を置いています。
results_japanese: 本研究ではオンサイト展示における所定のポインティング手法が、手持ち型HMD使用時に効率性およびユーザー満足度で他を上回ることを確認しました。直感的な手のジェスチャーや簡素化されたインターフェース操作を利用した手法がタスク完了時間とエラーを大幅に低下させ、全体のユーザー体験を向上させることが分かりました。これらの知見は今後のVR展示アプリケーションの設計指針に資するものです。

title: "Put Your Hands Up": How Joint Attention Is Initiated Between Blind Children And Their Sighted Peers
authors: Jones, Katherine and Grayson, Martin and Morrison, Cecily and Leonards, Ute and Metatla, Oussama
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how joint attention is initiated between blind children and their sighted peers, highlighting unique strategies employed during interactions.
problem_english: Blind children often face challenges in initiating joint attention with sighted peers due to differing sensory capabilities. Understanding these interactions is critical to fostering inclusive and effective communication in educational and social settings.
method_english: The study uses observational techniques and qualitative analysis to examine interactions between blind and sighted children, identifying strategies employed to initiate joint attention.
results_english: Blind children use specific verbal cues and tactile methods to initiate joint attention, while sighted peers adapt by enhancing verbal communication and using touch to facilitate interaction.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、盲目の子供と視覚障害のない仲間の間での共同注意の開始方法を探ります。
problem_japanese: 盲目の子供は、視覚のある仲間との共同注意の開始において、異なる感覚能力のために課題に直面します。これらの相互作用の理解は、包括的で効果的なコミュニケーションの促進に重要です。
method_japanese: 盲目の子供と視覚障害のない子供の交流を観察し、言語化分析を通じて共同注意の開始に使用される戦略を探索します。
results_japanese: 盲目の子供は、共同注意を開始するために特定の言葉の合図や触覚的方法を使用し、視覚仲間は言葉の強化と触れ合いを通じて交流を促進します。

title: AACessTalk: Fostering Communication between Minimally Verbal Autistic Children and Parents with Contextual Guidance and Card Recommendation
authors: Choi, Dasom and Park, SoHyun and Lee, Kyungah and Hong, Hwajung and Kim, Young-Ho
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: AACessTalk is designed to enhance communication between minimally verbal autistic children and their parents with the use of contextual guidance and card recommendation strategies.
problem_english: Communication barriers between minimally verbal autistic children and their parents can significantly impact social interaction and emotional bonding, leading to challenges in understanding and accurately representing the children's needs, feelings, and intentions.
method_english: AACessTalk employs a context-aware system using AI to recommend communication cards based on environmental cues and past interactions, assisting parents in understanding and engaging with their children more effectively during communication attempts.
results_english: The system improved communication efficiency and satisfaction for both parents and children. Parents reported better understanding of their children's needs and intents, and children showed increased engagement and reduced frustration during communication.
summary_japanese: AACessTalkは文脈ガイドとカード推薦を用いて非言語自閉症児と親のコミュニケーションを促進します。
problem_japanese: 非言語自閉症児と親とのコミュニケーション障壁は社会的交流や感情的絆に影響を与え、子どものニーズや感情の理解に困難をもたらします。
method_japanese: AACessTalkはAIを使った文脈に基づくカード推薦システムで、環境や過去のやり取りを基に親が子どもと効果的にコミュニケーションを取れるよう支援します。
results_japanese: システムにより親子のコミュニケーション効率と満足度が向上しました。親は子どものニーズや意図を理解しやすくなり、子どもはコミュニケーション時の関与が増し、挫折感が減少しました。

title: Cultivating Computational Thinking and Social Play among Neurodiverse Preschoolers in Inclusive Classrooms
authors: Das, Maitraye and Tran, Megan and Ong, Amanda Chih-han and Kientz, Julie A. and Feldner, Heather
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores fostering computational thinking and social interaction among neurodiverse preschoolers in inclusive classrooms, using tailored educational activities and technology integration.
problem_english: Neurodiverse preschoolers, including those with developmental disorders, often face challenges in participating in computational thinking and social play activities. There is a lack of effective educational interventions and inclusive practices that simultaneously support their unique needs and promote engagement with peers in classroom settings.
method_english: The research involves designing and implementing educational activities that integrate computational thinking with social play, tailored specifically for neurodiverse preschoolers. Collaborative work with educators and specialists ensures that the activities meet developmental needs. The study includes observations and feedback sessions to iteratively refine the interventions.
results_english: The tailored interventions showed an increase in participation in computational and social play activities among neurodiverse preschoolers. Educators reported positive changes in peer interactions and the development of problem-solving skills. These findings suggest the potential for these strategies to enhance inclusive educational practices.
summary_japanese: 研究は、包括的な教室での神経多様性のある幼児における計算論的思考と社会的相互作用の育成を探求する。
problem_japanese: 発達障害を含む神経多様性のある幼児は、計算論的思考や社会的遊び活動に参加する際に課題があります。教室での同級生との関与を促進しながら、彼らの特有のニーズをサポートする効果的な教育介入と包括的な実践が不足しています。
method_japanese: 神経多様性のある幼児向けに計算論的思考と社会的遊びを融合した教育活動を設計し実施します。教育者や専門家と協力して発達ニーズに合致した活動を提供し、観察とフィードバックを通じて介入を改良します。
results_japanese: カスタマイズされた介入により、計算的及び社会的遊び活動への参加が増加しました。教育者からは、仲間との相互作用や問題解決能力の発展に関する成功報告がありました。

title: Exploring AI-Based Support in Speech-Language Pathology for Culturally and Linguistically Diverse Children
authors: Lewis, Aaleyah and Dangol, Aayushi and Suh, Hyewon and Olszewski, Abbie and Fogarty, James and Kientz, Julie A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the use of AI-based tools to support speech-language pathology for culturally and linguistically diverse children. It explores challenges and potential benefits in enhancing communication therapy through technology.
problem_english: Speech-language pathology faces challenges in effectively supporting culturally and linguistically diverse children due to the limited availability of relevant resources and tools. Current practices may not adequately address the unique linguistic and cultural needs of these populations.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-methods study involving surveys and interviews with speech-language pathologists. They examined the current technological tools available and assessed the potential for AI-based solutions to improve therapy outcomes for diverse children.
results_english: The study found that AI-based tools can better address the linguistic and cultural needs of diverse children, offering personalized and effective solutions. However, it also highlighted the necessity of continued research and development to overcome existing limitations and biases in AI technology.
summary_japanese: AI技術を用いて多文化・多言語の子供向けの言語療法を支援する可能性を探る研究です。
problem_japanese: 多文化・多言語の子供に対する言語療法支援は、関連リソースやツールの不足により課題があり、現行の方法ではこれらの子供の特有のニーズに応えきれていません。
method_japanese: 言語療法士への調査・インタビューを行い、現在のテクノロジーツールを分析し、AIを用いた解決策が多様な子供たちの療法効果の改善に役立つかを評価しました。
results_japanese: AIツールは、多様な子供たちの文化・言語ニーズに応じた個別対応を実現し得るが、AI技術の限界と偏りへの継続的な研究開発が必要です。

title: FluidTrack: Investigating Child-Parent Collaborative Tracking for Pediatric Voiding Dysfunction Management
authors: Moon, Junhyung and Lee, Sukhyun and Kim, Youngchan and Go, Juhee and Ku, Han Mo and Jung, Yeohyun and Hwang, Seonyeong and Lee, Bongshin and Lee, Yong Seung and Lee, Hyun-Kyung and Lee, Kyoungwoo and Choe, Eun Kyoung
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: FluidTrack explores a collaborative tracking system for managing pediatric voiding dysfunction, involving both children and parents. This study investigates how such collaboration can improve adherence and effectiveness in monitoring urinary behaviors.
problem_english: Current pediatric voiding dysfunction treatments often face challenges in adherence, as children and parents struggle to consistently monitor and report urinary behaviors. This lack of adherence can impede effective management and treatment of the condition.
method_english: This study introduces a collaborative tracking approach, FluidTrack, designed to enhance adherence by involving both children and parents in the monitoring of urinary behaviors. It combines a mobile application with interactive features to facilitate engagement and accurate data reporting.
results_english: The results indicate that FluidTrack's collaborative approach improves adherence and quality of data collection. Both children and parents reported that the system was user-friendly and facilitated better engagement in managing pediatric voiding dysfunction, leading to improved outcomes.
summary_japanese: FluidTrackは、小児排尿障害管理のための協働トラッキングシステムを探求し、子供と親のコラボレーションがモニタリングの効果を向上させる方法を研究する。
problem_japanese: 現在の小児排尿障害治療は、子供と親が排尿行動を継続的に監視・報告することに苦労し、遵守が課題となっている。この遵守の欠如は、効果的な管理と治療を妨げる可能性がある。
method_japanese: 本研究は、FluidTrackという協力型トラッキング手法を導入し、親子が共同で排尿行動をモニターすることで遵守を改善することを目指す。モバイルアプリを用いて、対話的機能を提供し、参加を促す。
results_japanese: FluidTrackの協力的アプローチは遵守性とデータ収集の質を向上させることが示された。子供と親の両方が使いやすさを感じ、排尿障害管理への関与が増し、結果が改善した。

title: Inclusive Avatar Guidelines for People with Disabilities: Supporting Disability Representation in Social Virtual Reality
authors: Zhang, Kexin and Spencer, Edward Glenn Scott and Manikandan, Abijith and Li, Andric and Li, Ang and Yao, Yaxing and Zhao, Yuhang
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study proposes inclusive avatar guidelines to enhance disability representation in social virtual reality, aiming to support and empower users with disabilities.
problem_english: Current virtual reality environments often lack proper representation and inclusivity for people with disabilities, which can lead to feelings of exclusion and misrepresentation. This study addresses the need for inclusive avatar design guidelines that empower users and reflect diverse disabilities accurately in social virtual reality.
method_english: The authors conducted a series of user studies with participants having various disabilities to gather insights on their experiences and preferences in virtual reality. Based on these findings, they developed guidelines for creating inclusive avatars to better represent disabilities in virtual environments.
results_english: The developed guidelines emphasize including diverse physical traits and assistive devices in avatar creation. Initial feedback from users with disabilities showed improved feelings of representation and comfort in virtual spaces, suggesting these guidelines can enhance inclusivity in virtual reality.
summary_japanese: 障がい者のための包摂的なアバターガイドラインを提案し、社会的VRでの障がい者の表現を支援する。
problem_japanese: 現行のVR環境では障がい者の適切な表現と包摂性が欠如しており、排除感や誤った表現につながることがある。この研究は、障がい者が社会的VRで正確に多様な障がいを反映するための包摂的アバター設計ガイドラインの必要性に対処する。
method_japanese: 様々な障がいを持つ参加者を対象にユーザー調査を行い、VRでの体験や好みに関する洞察を収集。その結果を基に、障がい者をより適切に表現するための包摂的アバター作成ガイドラインを策定した。
results_japanese: 多様な身体的特徴や補助装置を含むアバター作成ガイドラインを開発。障がい者からの初期フィードバックでは、VR空間での表現や快適さが向上し、これらのガイドラインがVRの包摂性を高めることが示唆された。

title: Shifting the Focus: Exploring Video Accessibility Strategies and Challenges for People with ADHD
authors: Jiang, Lucy and Ko, Woojin and Yuan, Shirley and Shende, Tanisha and Azenkot, Shiri
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores strategies and challenges in making video content more accessible for individuals with ADHD, examining the specific needs and limitations they face when engaging with video media.
problem_english: People with ADHD often face difficulties in focusing on video content due to distractions and information overload. Current video platforms do not adequately address these accessibility needs, leading to challenges in maintaining engagement and comprehension.
method_english: The study employs user-centered design methods, including interviews and usability testing with individuals with ADHD, to identify specific accessibility challenges and to create prototypes that enhance video accessibility through tailored interventions.
results_english: Prototypes developed in this study demonstrated improved focus and comprehension for users with ADHD. Key strategies included customizable playback features and interface modifications that reduce cognitive load and distractions, suggesting potential avenues for enhancing video accessibility.
summary_japanese: この論文では、ADHDの人々がビデオをより利用しやすくするための戦略と課題について探究しています。
problem_japanese: ADHDの人は、集中力の欠如や過剰な情報により、ビデオコンテンツに集中するのが難しい。現行のビデオプラットフォームはこうしたアクセシビリティのニーズに十分対応しておらず、エンゲージメントと理解を維持するのが困難な状況に。
method_japanese: インタビューやユーザビリティテストを用いてADHDの人に特有の課題を特定し、個別最適化されたインターフェースを通じてビデオのアクセシビリティを向上させるプロトタイプを作成。
results_japanese: 本研究で開発されたプロトタイプは、ADHDのユーザーの集中力と理解力を向上させた。カスタマイズ可能な再生機能や認知負荷を軽減するインターフェース変更が有効であることが示唆された。

title: Beyond the 'Unofficial Proxy' - Navigating Technology Support for Older Adults' Banking Activities with Close Others
authors: Barber, Polly and Soubutts, Ewan and Knowles, Bran and Singh, Aneesha
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores older adults' reliance on close others for technology support in banking, highlighting potential issues. It suggests improvements for systems to better accommodate joint task management.
problem_english: Older adults often depend on close others, like family, for assistance with technology in banking, risking information sharing and autonomy loss. This 'unofficial proxy' role may cause conflicts and inefficiencies.
method_english: Researchers conducted interviews and observations to understand how older adults manage banking activities with help from close others. They analyzed the interactions to identify challenges and potential improvements for banking systems.
results_english: Findings reveal tensions in shared banking tasks, where trust and control balance is vital. Suggested system improvements include features promoting co-management, enhancing user autonomy, and reducing dependency.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、高齢者が銀行活動における技術サポートを親しい人に依存する状況を探り、潜在的問題を指摘。共同作業管理を向上させる方法を提案。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は銀行における技術支援で家族など親しい他者に依存しやすく、情報漏洩や自立性低下のリスクがある。この「非公式代理」役は対立や非効率を招く可能性がある。
method_japanese: 研究者は高齢者が親しい他者の助けで銀行業務を管理する方法を理解するために、インタビューと観察を実施し、課題やシステムの改善点を分析。
results_japanese: 共同銀行業務での緊張を明らかにし、信頼と制御のバランスが重要と判明。共管理を促す機能や自立性を高め、依存を減らすシステム改善案を提示。

title: Cataloging Augmented, Ambivalent Transgender Futures: Designing Inclusive AR Technologies for Trans Communities Through Speculative, Participatory Zine-Making
authors: Khan, F. Ria and Brewster, Kat and DeGuia, Aloe and Starks, Denny L. and Manacop, Malaya and Mayworm, Samuel and Dillahunt, Tawanna R. and Haimson, Oliver L.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores designing inclusive augmented reality (AR) technologies for transgender communities through participatory zine-making. It aims to understand and catalog diverse transgender futures using speculative design methodologies.
problem_english: Transgender individuals often face exclusion in technology design due to lack of engagement with their lived experiences. AR technologies can empower these communities but often do not consider their specific needs, resulting in non-inclusive designs that fail to represent their diverse identities and aspirations.
method_english: The authors employed speculative participatory zine-making as a method to engage transgender community members. Participants shared their visions for augmented futures, utilizing zines as a medium to express complex identities. This approach fosters inclusive AR designs reflecting diverse transgender experiences and aspirations.
results_english: Results highlight the value of participatory zine-making in capturing and articulating diverse transgender futures. This method enabled the creation of AR prototypes that more accurately reflect and address the needs and aspirations of transgender communities, promoting inclusivity in technology design.
summary_japanese: 本研究では、参加型ZINE制作を通じてトランスジェンダーコミュニティのための包括的AR技術の設計を探求し、多様なトランスジェンダーの未来を理解・記録することを目指しています。
problem_japanese: トランスジェンダーの方々は、テクノロジーデザインにおいてしばしばその経験が活かされず排除されてしまいます。AR技術は彼らをエンパワーメントする可能性があるにも関わらず、通常彼らの特定のニーズが考慮されず、非包括的なデザインが生まれてしまい、多様なアイデンティティや未来を十分に表現できていません。
method_japanese: 著者らは、トランスジェンダーコミュニティのメンバーを巻き込み、参加型ZINE制作を手法として採用しました。参加者はZINEを媒体とし、複雑なアイデンティティを表現しながら拡張された未来のビジョンを共有しました。このアプローチは、多様なトランスジェンダーの経験と願望を反映した包括的なARデザインを育みます。
results_japanese: 結果は、参加型ZINE制作が多様なトランスジェンダーの未来を捉え、表現する価値を示しています。この手法は、トランスジェンダーコミュニティのニーズや願望をより正確に反映したARプロトタイプの作成を可能にし、技術デザインの包括性を促進します。

title: Challenges and Opportunities for the Design of Inclusive Social Media Experiences with LGBT+ Older Adults
authors: Zhu, Wenqi and Soubutts, Ewan and Wernersbach, Julia and Singh, Aneesha
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores challenges and opportunities in designing inclusive social media experiences for LGBT+ older adults. It identifies key barriers and proposes guidelines for more inclusive digital platforms.
problem_english: LGBT+ older adults often face unique challenges on social media platforms, including discrimination, lack of representation, and accessibility issues. These factors can lead to social isolation and reduced quality of digital engagement, highlighting the need for platforms to address inclusivity for this demographic.
method_english: The authors employed participatory design workshops with LGBT+ older adults to identify their needs and preferences. They used thematic analysis to evaluate the data, uncovering specific challenges and opportunities for creating more inclusive social media experiences tailored to this group's requirements.
results_english: The study revealed persistent barriers like discrimination and accessibility issues faced by LGBT+ older adults. Participants shared preferences for privacy features and community building. The research proposes guidelines to design social media platforms that foster inclusive environments for these users.
summary_japanese: この研究は、LGBT+高齢者のための社会的メディア体験の包括的設計における課題と機会を探究します。
problem_japanese: LGBT+高齢者は、社会的メディアプラットフォームでの差別、代表性の欠如、アクセシビリティの問題など、特有の課題に直面しています。これらの問題は社会的孤立やデジタル関与の質の低下を引き起こす可能性があり、包括性への対策が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者は、LGBT+高齢者を対象に参加型デザインワークショップを行い、ニーズと好みを特定しました。テーマ分析を用いてデータを評価し、このグループに適した社会的メディア体験を創出するための特定の課題と機会を明らかにしました。
results_japanese: 研究は、LGBT+高齢者が直面する差別やアクセシビリティ問題などの持続的な障壁を明らかにしました。参加者はプライバシー機能とコミュニティ構築の好みを共有し、包括的なプラットフォーム設計の指針が提案されています。

title: DysVis: A User-Centred Data Visualization System for Dyslexia Pre-screening
authors: Fung, Ka Yan and Lee, Lik Hang and Yuan, Linping and Fung, Kwong Chiu and Sin, Kuen Fung and Lui, Tze Leung Rick and Qu, Huamin and Song, Shenghui
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: DysVis is a data visualization tool designed to aid in the dyslexia pre-screening process, focusing on user-centric design for better usability and effectiveness in early identification.
problem_english: Dyslexia affects a significant portion of the population, yet current pre-screening processes are often inefficient and not user-friendly. There is a need for improved tools that leverage visualization to enhance the identification process and provide accessible solutions for educators and health professionals.
method_english: The DysVis system incorporates user-centered design principles, integrating data visualization techniques to create an accessible and efficient pre-screening tool for dyslexia. The system aims to streamline the identification process by providing clear visual indicators and user-friendly interfaces for effective usage by educators and healthcare providers.
results_english: The implementation of DysVis demonstrated significant improvement in the identification of dyslexia during preliminary evaluations. Users reported increased ease of use and better understanding of the data visualizations, indicating the system's potential to enhance early dyslexia recognition and facilitate further intervention measures.
summary_japanese: DysVisは、ディスレクシアの事前スクリーニングを支援するデータ可視化ツールで、ユーザー中心設計が特色です。
problem_japanese: ディスレクシアは多くの人に影響を及ぼすが、現行の事前スクリーニングプロセスは効率的でなく、使い勝手が悪い。視覚化を活用して識別プロセスを向上し、教育者や健康専門家にとってアクセス可能なソリューションが必要。
method_japanese: DysVisシステムはユーザー中心設計とデータ可視化技術を組み合わせ、ディスレクシアの効率的な事前スクリーニングを可能にします。教育者や医療提供者が使いやすいインターフェースを提供し、識別プロセスを効率化。
results_japanese: DysVisの導入は、ディスレクシア識別の向上を示しました。ユーザーは使いやすさが増し、データ可視化の理解が高まったと報告し、早期認識を促進する可能性を示唆しています。

title: ELMI: Interactive and Intelligent Sign Language Translation of Lyrics for Song Signing
authors: Yoo, Suhyeon and Truong, Khai N. and Kim, Young-Ho
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study introduces ELMI, an interactive system designed for translating song lyrics into sign language, enhancing inclusivity for the hearing-impaired community. It facilitates intelligent translation and user engagement.
problem_english: Hearing-impaired individuals face challenges enjoying music due to the lack of accessible sign language translations for song lyrics. Current solutions are insufficient, often needing manual interpretation that can be unfeasible for widespread accessibility.
method_english: ELMI leverages advanced AI algorithms to intelligently interpret song lyrics, converting them into sign language. It focuses on user interaction, allowing personal tweaking of translations. The system integrates real-time elements to optimize user experience.
results_english: ELMI has shown significant improvement in accessibility for the hearing-impaired. It offers customizable translations, resulting in increased user satisfaction. Feedback highlights its effectiveness in real-world applications, reflecting better engagement and inclusivity.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、歌詞を手話に翻訳するインタラクティブなシステムELMIを紹介し、聴覚障害者向けの包摂性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 聴覚障害者は、歌詞の手話翻訳が不足しているため、音楽を楽しむのが困難です。従来の解決策は不十分で、広範なアクセシビリティのためには手動の解釈が必要です。
method_japanese: ELMIは高度なAIアルゴリズムを活用して歌詞を手話に変換します。個人が翻訳を調整できるユーザーインタラクションを重視し、リアルタイム要素を統合します。
results_japanese: ELMIは聴覚障害者へのアクセシビリティを大幅に改善しました。カスタマイズ可能な翻訳を提供し、ユーザー満足度が向上しました。実生活での有効性が示され、包摂性が高まっています。

title: Promoting Comprehension and Engagement in Introductory Data and Statistics for Blind and Low-Vision Students: A Co-Design Study
authors: Fan, Danyang and Tomassetti, Olivia and Mouallem, Aya and Kim, Gene S-H and Patel, Shloke Nirav and Hwang, Saehui and Leader, Patricia and Sugrue, Danielle and Chen, Tristen and Ou, Darren Reese and Lee, Victor R and Balasubramanian, Lakshmi and Subramonyam, Hariharan and O'Modhrain, Sile and Follmer, Sean
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study focuses on enhancing comprehension and engagement in data and statistics education for blind and low-vision students via a co-design approach.
problem_english: Blind and low-vision students often face significant barriers in accessing data and statistics education due to a heavy reliance on visual materials. This limits their comprehension and engagement with the subject matter, resulting in inequitable educational outcomes and opportunities in related fields and careers.
method_english: The study employs a co-design approach, wherein educators, students with visual impairments, and specialists collaboratively develop innovative, non-visual instructional methods to improve engagement and comprehension in data and statistics education, testing prototypes to assess their effectiveness.
results_english: The co-designed instructional tools significantly improved comprehension and engagement levels among blind and low-vision students. Participants reported increased confidence and interest in data and statistics, suggesting the potential for broader educational improvements with these methods.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、共創設計手法を用いて、視覚障害学生のデータ・統計学の理解と関与を向上させることを目的としています。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害学生は、視覚材料に依存するデータ・統計教育において多くの障壁に直面し、理解と関与が制限されるため、不平等な教育結果や関連分野での機会が得にくいです。
method_japanese: 教育者、視覚障害学生、専門家が共同で革新的な非視覚的教授法を開発し、理解と関与を向上させるためのプロトタイプをテストして、その有効性を評価します。
results_japanese: 共同設計した教材は視覚障害学生の理解と関与を大幅に改善し、データ・統計への自信と興味が高まったことが示され、教育の幅広い改善に繋がる可能性が示唆されました。

title: Touching Experiences: How Older Adults Envision Ambient and Tangible Social Technology Through the Lens of Time
authors: Smith, Kersten and Sien, Sang-Wha and Dai, Jiamin and McGrenere, Joanna
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores how older adults perceive and imagine ambient and tangible social technology with respect to time, aiming to enhance user experience and accessibility.
problem_english: Older adults often struggle with adopting new technology, which can limit their social interaction and negatively impact their well-being. There's a need to understand how they envision such technologies over time to better design these systems to improve accessibility and usability.
method_english: The study used qualitative research methods, including interviews and focus groups, with older adults to gather insights into their perspectives on ambient and tangible social technology and how their views change over time.
results_english: The findings revealed diverse perceptions among older adults, influenced by their experiences and the passage of time. This highlights the need for adaptable and user-centered design in social technology to cater to their evolving needs.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、時間の観点から高齢者がどのように社会技術を想像し、理解するかを探り、ユーザー体験とアクセシビリティを向上させることを目指す。
problem_japanese: 高齢者は新技術の採用に悩むことが多く、その結果、社会的交流の機会が減少し、福祉に悪影響を及ぼす可能性がある。技術の利用における時間経過による理解と適応を重視した設計が求められている。
method_japanese: 本研究は、インタビューやフォーカスグループを用いた定性的調査を実施し、高齢者が周囲や具体的な社会技術に対する認識やその時間経過による変化を探った。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、高齢者の中で多様な認識があり、経験や時間の経過がそれに影響を与えることを示した。高齢者の変化するニーズに応じた適応可能でユーザー中心の設計が必要であることが強調された。

title: Bridging Borders, Breaking Biases: Envisioning Technologies to Support North Korean Defectors in South Korea
authors: Noh, Hayoun and Jo, Hyunah and Wang, Ge and Van Kleek, Max and Kang, Younah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This research explores technologies to aid North Korean defectors in South Korea, focusing on social integration and combating biases, aiming for improved societal inclusion and support.
problem_english: North Korean defectors face significant challenges integrating into South Korean society due to cultural differences, social biases, and a lack of tailored support systems. This issue is exacerbated by limited resources and understanding of defectors' unique needs, leading to difficulties in accessing education, employment, and social networks essential for their successful integration.
method_english: We conducted interviews with North Korean defectors and experts, analyzed existing technologies, and proposed new tech designs to support defectors. The focus was on addressing cultural barriers, fostering community connections, and counteracting biases through technology-informed interventions tailored to their specific needs.
results_english: Our proposed technology solutions, informed by direct feedback from defectors and stakeholders, highlight the potential for enhanced social support. These initiatives aim to break down barriers, improve access to resources, and foster a sense of belonging within the South Korean community, ultimately aiding successful integration.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、北朝鮮脱北者の社会統合と偏見克服を支援する技術を探求し、包摂的な社会支援を目指す。
problem_japanese: 北朝鮮脱北者は、文化的差異、社会的偏見、適切な支援システムの欠如により、韓国での社会統合に大きな課題を抱えています。この問題は、脱北者の教育、雇用、社会的ネットワークへのアクセスの難しさを生み、統合を妨げています。
method_japanese: 北朝鮮脱北者や専門家へのインタビューを実施し、現行技術を分析、新技術デザインを提案。文化的障壁への対応、コミュニティ連携、偏見対策を通じた技術インフォームド介入を目指す。
results_japanese: 脱北者や関係者からの直接のフィードバックを基にした提案技術ソリューションは、社会支援の可能性を示し、リソースへのアクセス改善、帰属意識の醸成を通じて韓国社会での統合成功を支援します。

title: Exploring the Experiences of Individuals Who are Blind or Low-Vision Using Object-Recognition Technologies in India
authors: India, Gesu and Robinson, Simon and Pearson, Jennifer and Morrison, Cecily and Jones, Matt
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the experiences of blind or low-vision individuals in India using object-recognition technologies, focusing on accessibility, usability, and social implications.
problem_english: Blind and low-vision individuals face numerous challenges in navigating the world. Although object-recognition technologies have the potential to aid them significantly, understanding their effectiveness, cultural influences, and socio-economic impact in India has not been thoroughly explored.
method_english: The study employed qualitative methods, including interviews and participatory design sessions with blind or low-vision individuals across India, to understand their experiences and expectations from current object-recognition technologies, identifying challenges and preferences.
results_english: Results indicated that while object-recognition technologies offer some benefits, they fall short in real-world scenarios due to accuracy issues, affordability, and limited awareness or accessibility. Cultural contexts and local needs were highlighted as crucial to improving these technologies.
summary_japanese: インドの視覚障害者が物体認識技術を利用する体験を調査し、アクセシビリティや社会的影響を考察した。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は物体認識技術による支援の潜在的利点があるが、インドにおける文化的影響や社会経済的影響を十分に理解されていない。
method_japanese: 視覚障害者を対象にインタビューや参加型デザインを行い、物体認識技術の期待と課題、文化的背景を把握した。
results_japanese: 技術の現実利用には限界があり、正確性やコストの課題を抱える。文化的背景や地域ニーズの重視が改良に不可欠と示された。

title: Initiating the Global AI Dialogues: Laypeople Perspectives on the Future Role of genAI in Society from Nigeria, Germany and Japan
authors: Hohendanner, Michel and Ullstein, Chiara and Onyekwelu, Bukola Abimbola and Katirai, Amelia and Kuribayashi, Jun and Babalola, Olusola and Ema, Arisa and Grossklags, Jens
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores perspectives on genAI's future role in society, gathering insights from laypeople in Nigeria, Germany, and Japan. It aims to initiate global dialogues on AI impact.
problem_english: Despite AI's growing influence, there is insufficient understanding of laypeople's perspectives on AI's societal role across different cultural contexts, hindering inclusive dialogue and informed decision-making about AI's future impacts.
method_english: The study employs qualitative interviews and surveys with laypeople from Nigeria, Germany, and Japan, analyzing diverse cultural perspectives to understand their views on AI's future societal roles and implications in these regions.
results_english: The findings reveal diverse and culturally influenced views on AI, highlighting a need for inclusive global dialogue. Common themes include concerns about AI's ethical implications, privacy issues, and its potential to shape future human interactions.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、AIの社会的役割についてナイジェリア、ドイツ、日本の一般人の視点を探求し、グローバルな対話を始めようとしています。
problem_japanese: AIの影響が増大しているにも関わらず、異なる文化的背景における一般人のAIに対する視点の理解が不足しており、包括的な対話やAIの未来の影響に関する意思決定が困難になっている。
method_japanese: ナイジェリア、ドイツ、日本の一般人を対象に質的インタビューと調査を実施し、これらの地域でのAIの未来の社会的役割に対する見解を文化的視点から分析します。
results_japanese: 結果はAIに対する多様で文化的に影響された見解を示し、グローバルな対話の必要性を強調しています。倫理的影響、プライバシーの懸念、未来の人間関係への影響が共通のテーマです。

title: Inter(sectional) Alia(s): Ambiguity in Voice Agent Identity via Intersectional Japanese Self-Referents
authors: Fujii, Takao and Seaborn, Katie and Steeds, Madeleine and Kato, Jun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the ambiguity in voice agent identities using intersectional Japanese self-referents, examining how different identity markers create nuanced interfaces.
problem_english: Voice agents often lack sophisticated identity representation, limiting their ability to reflect diverse human identities. This study investigates how intersectional self-referents can address these limitations and enhance user-agent interactions.
method_english: The authors conducted a qualitative study employing intersectional self-referents in Japanese, analyzing their impact on voice agent identity and user perception through experiments and surveys.
results_english: Findings indicate that using intersectional Japanese self-referents in voice agents can offer more nuanced identity representation, improving relatability and user satisfaction, albeit introducing certain ambiguities.
summary_japanese: 研究は声のエージェントのアイデンティティの曖昧さを日本の自称を使って探求し、多様なインターフェースの生成を分析します。
problem_japanese: 声のエージェントは通常、複雑なアイデンティティの表現が欠けており、多様な人間のアイデンティティを反映する能力が制約されています。本研究は交差的な自称がこれらの制約をどう解決するかを探究します。
method_japanese: 著者は日本語の交差的自称を用いた質的研究を実施し、エージェントのアイデンティティとユーザーの認識への影響を実験と調査を通じて分析しました。
results_japanese: 日本語の交差的自称を用いることでエージェントのアイデンティティ表現が改善され、ユーザーの親しみや満足度が向上することが示されたが、一部曖昧さも生じました。

title: Investigating the Capabilities and Limitations of Machine Learning for Identifying Bias in English Language Data with Information and Heritage Professionals
authors: Havens, Lucy and Bach, Benjamin and Terras, Melissa and Alex, Beatrice
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the potential and limitations of machine learning in recognizing bias in English language data, engaged with information and heritage professionals.
problem_english: There is increasing concern about biases present in digital data collections. The existing methods to identify these biases often fall short, especially when analyzing complex heritage datasets and ensuring interpretability for professionals in the field.
method_english: The researchers utilize machine learning techniques in collaboration with information and heritage experts. They develop tools to identify biases by combining machine learning algorithms with feedback and insights from domain professionals, ensuring that the tools are both accurate and practically applicable.
results_english: The study reveals that while machine learning offers valuable insights into bias detection, its limitations highlight the need for professional expertise. Feedback from domain experts proved crucial in interpreting outputs and improving algorithm transparency, emphasizing a hybrid approach for effective bias identification.
summary_japanese: この研究は、情報と遺産の専門家と共に、英語データにおけるバイアス識別における機械学習の可能性と限界を調査。
problem_japanese: デジタルデータのバイアスがますます懸念されている。このバイアスを識別する既存の方法は、特に複雑な遺産データセットの解析やプロの解釈性の確保において不十分である。
method_japanese: 研究者は、情報と遺産の専門家と協力し、機械学習手法を利用する。アルゴリズムに専門家のフィードバックを組み込むことで、バイアス識別ツールを開発する。
results_japanese: 研究は、機械学習がバイアス検出に役立つが、限界もあり、専門家のフィードバックが重要であると示した。アルゴリズムの透明性と出力の改善に専門家の意見が不可欠であると強調。

title: Perspectives on Mixed-Ability Competition
authors: Trindade, Pedro and Guerreiro, Jo\~{a}o and Rodrigues, Andr\'{e}
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the dynamics and challenges of mixed-ability competitions, proposing new frameworks to enhance inclusivity and fairness among participants of varying skill levels.
problem_english: Mixed-ability competitions often struggle with inclusivity and fairness, as participants with differing skill levels might face challenges in equal participation and recognition. Traditional competition models can inadvertently favor individuals with higher abilities, leading to imbalanced experiences.
method_english: The authors propose innovative frameworks that reorganize competitive structures, creating adaptive systems that accommodate varying abilities through modified rules, scoring systems, and inclusive design principles to ensure equitable participation.
results_english: Implementing these frameworks has demonstrated improved participant satisfaction, increased sense of fairness, and enhanced inclusivity in mixed-ability settings. The new approach fosters an environment where diverse skill levels can coexist and compete equitably.
summary_japanese: 本論文は異なる能力の参加者が共存し公平に競技できる枠組みを提案し、混合能力競技の課題を探求する。
problem_japanese: 混合能力競技はしばしば異なるスキルレベル間の公平性と包括性に課題があり、高能力者が優遇される伝統的モデルでは競技体験が不均衡になることがある。
method_japanese: 筆者は適応的で公正な参加を確保するため、ルールや得点システムを修正し、インクルーシブな設計原則を用いた競技構造再編の革新的枠組みを提案。
results_japanese: これらの枠組みの導入で参加者の満足度や公平性が向上し、多様なスキルレベルが共存し競争できる環境が実現した。

title: The Future Is Rosie?: Disempowering Arguments About Automation and What to Do About It
authors: Riek, Laurel D. and Irani, Lilly
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper critiques common arguments surrounding automation's future impact, emphasizing its disempowering aspects and proposing solutions to counteract them through informed design and policy approaches.
problem_english: The authors highlight how discourse around automation often centers on inevitability, fostering a narrative that disempowers workers and reduces the complexity of human labor. This creates barriers to meaningful intervention and the imagining of alternate futures where labor and technology coexist beneficially.
method_english: Riek and Irani use critical analysis of media narratives and expert interviews to dissect common automation arguments. They also propose a framework for empowering stakeholders through participatory design and policy interventions, focusing on creating equitable technology futures.
results_english: The study identifies prevalent disempowering narratives in automation discussions and provides actionable strategies for stakeholders. These involve reshaping technologies through inclusive design practices, advocating for policy changes, and fostering collaborative dialogue between technologists and affected workers.
summary_japanese: この論文はオートメーションに関する一般的な議論を批判し、無力化する側面に焦点を当て、情報に基づいた設計と政策のアプローチで対策を提案します。
problem_japanese: 著者は、オートメーションに関する言説がしばしば必然性に焦点を当て、労働者の無力化を助長し、人間の労働の複雑さを見逃していると指摘します。これにより労働と技術が共存する未来の想像を阻害します。
method_japanese: 著者はメディアの言説と専門家インタビューを通じてオートメーションに関する議論を分析し、共同デザインと政策介入による公平な技術未来を創造するための枠組みを提案します。
results_japanese: 研究はオートメーション議論の中で一般的な無力化の言説を特定し、技術のインクルーシブデザインでの再構築や政策変更、技術者と労働者の対話促進などの対策を提示します。

title: Exploring the Design of Human Speech Indicators to Enhance Waiting Experience in Voice User Interface
authors: Li, Wenan and Yu, Junnan and Zhou, Yehong and Shi, Jinlei and You, Weitao and Zhou, Zhibin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the design of human speech indicators to improve user experience during waiting periods in voice user interfaces (VUIs).
problem_english: Users often experience frustration and uncertainty during waiting periods in voice user interfaces (VUIs). Traditional loading signals are insufficient to effectively communicate progress, leading to negative user experiences and decreased satisfaction with VUIs.
method_english: Researchers developed various human speech indicators designed to convey waiting status and progress more intuitively. These indicators were tested with users to evaluate their effectiveness in enhancing the waiting experience by reducing perceived wait time and improving user satisfaction.
results_english: The study found that human speech indicators significantly enhanced the waiting experience, reducing perceived wait times and increasing user satisfaction. These indicators provided clear progress updates and a sense of engagement during waiting periods in voice user interfaces.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、音声ユーザインタフェースでの待機時間中に利用者体験を向上させるための人間の音声指標の設計を探ります。
problem_japanese: 音声ユーザーインターフェース(VUI)における待機時間中、ユーザーはしばしば苛立ちや不安を感じます。従来のロード信号では進捗を効果的に伝えることができず、ユーザー体験が悪化し満足度が低下します。
method_japanese: 研究者は、待機状況と進行状況をより直感的に伝えるための様々な人間の音声指標を開発しました。これらの指標は、知覚された待機時間を短縮し、ユーザー満足度を向上させる効果を評価するためにユーザーにテストされました。
results_japanese: 研究により、人間の音声指標が大幅に待機体験を向上させ、知覚された待機時間を短縮し、ユーザー満足度を高めることが確認されました。これらの指標は、音声ユーザーインターフェースにおいて、待機時間中に明確な進捗の更新と関与感を提供しました。

title: Exploring the Impacts of HEXACO Personality Traits on Text Composition and Transcription
authors: Srabonee, Jannatul Ferdous and Alharbi, Ohoud Mosa and Stuerzlinger, Wolfgang and Arif, Ahmed Sabbir
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how HEXACO personality traits affect text composition and transcription tasks, revealing potential relationships between personality and efficiency in these activities.
problem_english: Understanding how personality traits influence text composition and transcription is crucial, yet previous research has not adequately considered the effects of HEXACO personality traits on these activities.
method_english: Participants were assessed for HEXACO personality traits and engaged in text composition and transcription tasks, with performance metrics collected to evaluate the correlation between personality and task efficiency.
results_english: The study found that specific HEXACO traits significantly influenced text task performance, suggesting personality traits play a role in task efficiency, providing insights into personalized technology design.
summary_japanese: 本研究はHEXACO性格特性がテキスト作成と転写に与える影響を探り、性格と効率の関係を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 性格特性がテキスト作成と転写に与える影響を理解することが重要であり、従来の研究ではHEXACO性格特性の影響を十分に考慮していません。
method_japanese: 参加者のHEXACO性格特性を評価し、テキスト作成と転写のタスクを行わせ、性格と効率の相関を評価するためのパフォーマンスを収集しました。
results_japanese: 特定のHEXACO特性がテキストタスクのパフォーマンスに重要な影響を与えることが判明し、性格特性が個別技術設計における効率に役割を果たすことを示します。

title: FreeForm: Flexibly Augmenting Formulas with Synchronized Markup and Graphical Edits
authors: Tao, Jeffrey and Yan, Litao and Shi, Jessica and Ginsberg, Mia and Head, Andrew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: FreeForm introduces a system to flexibly augment mathematical formulas with synchronized markup and graphical edits, enhancing understanding and communication among users.
problem_english: Existing tools for mathematical formulas often lack flexibility in allowing synchronized, non-disruptive augmentations through markup and graphical edits, limiting effective collaboration and communication in educational or professional settings.
method_english: FreeForm provides a user-friendly interface where mathematical formulas can be dynamically edited with markup and graphical annotations, maintaining synchronization with original formulas while allowing intuitive augmentations according to user needs.
results_english: The system improves collaborative efforts in understanding and discussing mathematical expressions by enabling flexible synchronized augmentations, demonstrating enhanced communication efficiency through user studies involving educational and professional contexts.
summary_japanese: FreeFormは数式を柔軟に拡張し、同期されたマークアップとグラフィカル編集を提供するシステムを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 既存の数式ツールは、マークアップとグラフィカル編集を通じた同期された柔軟な拡張を許可せず、教育や専門的な場における効果的なコラボレーションやコミュニケーションが制限されています。
method_japanese: FreeFormはユーザーが数式を動的に編集できるインターフェースを提供し、元の数式と同期を保ちながら、ユーザーのニーズに合わせて直感的な拡張を可能にします。
results_japanese: システムはユーザー研究で教育および専門的な状況を含むコミュニケーションの効率を向上させ、柔軟で同期された拡張を通じて数式理解と議論を改善します。

title: Leveraging Multimodal LLM for Inspirational User Interface Search
authors: Park, Seokhyeon and Song, Yumin and Lee, Soohyun and Kim, Jaeyoung and Seo, Jinwook
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores using multimodal large language models (LLMs) for enhancing inspirational user interface (UI) searches. It aims to improve the retrieval of UI design inspirations by integrating various data modalities.
problem_english: Designers often struggle with finding inspirational user interfaces (UI) due to the overwhelming amount of data and lack of efficient search tools. Current methods primarily rely on text-based searches, which can miss out on visual and interactive elements important for UI inspiration.
method_english: The method involves leveraging multimodal large language models (LLMs) that integrate textual, visual, and interactive data for more comprehensive UI searches. This approach enhances search capabilities by using advanced data embedding techniques and multimodal analysis to improve the retrieval of meaningful UI designs.
results_english: The study demonstrates significant improvements in finding inspirational UIs using the proposed multimodal LLMs. The approach allows designers to explore a richer variety of UI designs, considering both textual descriptions and visual elements, leading to enhanced creative exploration.
summary_japanese: この研究は、マルチモーダルLLMを用いたUIデザインのインスピレーション検索の改善を探求します。
problem_japanese: デザイナーはUIのインスピレーションを見つける際、膨大なデータと効果的な検索ツールの不足に悩まされている。現在の方法は主にテキストベースの検索に依存しており、重要な視覚要素や対話的要素を見逃しがちである。
method_japanese: テキスト、視覚、対話的データを統合したマルチモーダルLLMを活用し、UI検索を包括的に補完します。このアプローチはデータ埋め込み技術とマルチモーダル分析を用いてUIデザインの意味深い検索を強化します。
results_japanese: 提案されたマルチモーダルLLMを使用することで、インスピレーションとなるUIの検索能力が大幅に向上しました。これにより、デザイナーはより多くのテキストと視覚要素を考慮し、創造的探求が強化されました。

title: Toward Human-Quantum Computer Interaction: Interface Techniques for Usable Quantum Computing
authors: Kim, Hyeok and Jeng, Mingyoung Jessica and Smith, Kaitlin N
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores interface techniques for improving human-computer interaction with quantum computers, focusing on usability and accessibility to make quantum computing more accessible to diverse users.
problem_english: Despite the rising interest and potential of quantum computing, current interfaces lack user-friendliness and accessibility for non-expert users. Existing systems require advanced knowledge of quantum mechanics and programming, presenting a barrier to broader adoption and democratization of quantum computing technology.
method_english: The authors propose a set of interface techniques designed to simplify the interaction between humans and quantum computers. These techniques include visual representation tools and user-friendly coding environments that aim to lower the learning curve and make quantum computing more accessible to a wider audience.
results_english: The study demonstrates that the proposed interface techniques significantly enhance usability and user satisfaction for quantum computing tasks. The tools improved user understanding and interaction efficiency, making it easier for non-experts to utilize quantum computation capabilities, leading to broader engagement and potential innovation.
summary_japanese: 本論文は量子コンピュータとのインターフェース技術を探求し、使いやすさやアクセシビリティ向上を目指します。
problem_japanese: 量子コンピューティングの興味と可能性が高まる中、現行インターフェースは非専門家にとって使い勝手が悪く、高度な知識が求められるため、普及の妨げとなっている。
method_japanese: 著者はユーザーと量子コンピュータの相互作用を簡素化するためのインターフェース技術を提案。視覚的表現ツールや使いやすいコーディング環境を含み、学習曲線を低くすることを目指します。
results_japanese: 提案されたインターフェース技術は、量子コンピュータ作業の使いやすさとユーザー満足度を大幅に向上させ、非専門家が量子計算の可能性を利用しやすくしました。

title: Understanding Break-ability through Screen-based Affordances
authors: Grafton, Richard and Metatla, Oussama and Roudaut, Anne
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the concept of break-ability in screen interfaces, exploring how users perceive and interact with their fragility, aiming to enhance usability and design principles.
problem_english: Understanding how users interact with screen interfaces regarding their perceived fragility is crucial. It's unclear how users navigate the balance between delicate interfaces and effective usability, which demands exploration to improve design practices.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies involving interactive tasks with variable screen fragility settings, measuring users' perceptions and interactions across different affordances to understand break-ability and usability impacts.
results_english: Results showed that users' perceptions of screen fragility significantly influenced their interaction patterns and usability experiences. The study identified key design elements that can make interfaces more intuitive despite inherent fragility.
summary_japanese: 画面インターフェースの破壊可能性を探る本研究は、ユーザーの認識と設計原則向上を目指しています。
problem_japanese: ユーザーが画面インターフェースの破損可能性をどのように認識し操作するかを理解することは重要です。壊れやすいインターフェースと効果的なユーザビリティとのバランスを理解することは設計改善に不可欠です。
method_japanese: 著者は、様々な画面の破壊可能性設定でのユーザー研究を行い、ユーザーの認識と操作を測定し、破壊可能性とユーザビリティへの影響を理解しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、画面の破損可能性に対するユーザーの認識が操作パターンとユーザビリティ体験に大きな影響を与え、直感的なインターフェース設計要素を特定しました。

title: Understanding How Psychological Distance Influences User Preferences in Conversational versus Web Search
authors: Yang, Yitian and Tan, Yugin and Lin, Yang Chen and King, Jung-Tai and Liu, Zihan and Lee, Yi-Chieh
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores how psychological distance impacts user preference for conversational and web search. It provides insights into whether users are inclined towards one mode over the other based on psychological factors.
problem_english: Despite the increasing popularity of conversational search interfaces, little research has been conducted on understanding how psychological distance affects user preferences for conversational versus traditional web search methods. This gap hinders the design and improvement of user-centered search systems that cater to diverse psychological states and needs.
method_english: The study conducts a series of user experiments using varied search tasks designed to represent different levels of psychological distance. It then measures user preferences for conversational versus web-based search, analyzing the effect of psychological distance on these preferences through quantitative and qualitative data collection.
results_english: Results indicate that users prefer conversational search for tasks perceived as psychologically distant, while web search is favored for tasks seen as psychologically close. This preference shift is attributed to the conversational interface's ability to provide a more engaging experience for abstract tasks, offering insights for designing better search systems.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、心理的距離が会話型とウェブ検索へのユーザーの好みにどのように影響するかを探究しています。
problem_japanese: 会話型検索インターフェースの人気が高まっているにもかかわらず、心理的距離が会話型検索と従来のウェブ検索のユーザーの好みにどのように影響するかを理解する研究は少ないです。このギャップは、さまざまな心理状態とニーズに対応するユーザー中心の検索システムの設計と改善を妨げます。
method_japanese: 心理的距離の異なるレベルを表すよう設計されたさまざまな検索タスクを用いて一連のユーザー実験を行います。そして、会話型検索とウェブ検索の好みを測定し、これらの好みに心理的距離が与える影響を定量的および定性的なデータ収集を通じて分析します。
results_japanese: 心理的に遠いと感じるタスクで会話型検索が好まれる結果が示され、反対に心理的に近いタスクではウェブ検索が好まれます。これは、抽象的なタスクに対して会話型インターフェースがより魅力的な体験を提供するためです。

title: A Reflective Journey for Individuals with Intellectual Disabilities: Rediscovering Competency Through AI-Enhanced Iron Beads Crafting
authors: Chen, Sifan and Peng, Danyang and Barbareschi, Giulia and Chen, Dunya and Sato, Chihiro
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the use of AI-enhanced iron beads crafting to help individuals with intellectual disabilities rediscover their competencies and boost self-esteem through personalized creative activities.
problem_english: Individuals with intellectual disabilities often face challenges in recognizing their personal competencies and maintaining self-esteem due to societal stereotypes and limited opportunities to engage in meaningful, creative activities tailored to their abilities.
method_english: The research involves developing a crafting system using AI to enhance the process of creating with iron beads, tailoring activities to individual abilities and interests. It focuses on personalizing the crafting experience to better support self-discovery and competency recognition.
results_english: The AI-enhanced crafting system showed positive impacts on participants' self-esteem and competency recognition. Participants engaged more confidently in creative processes, with the system providing personalized guidance and feedback, effectively supporting their journey of self-discovery.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、知的障害者がAIを活用したアイロンビーズ制作を通じて能力を再発見し、自己肯定感を高める方法を探求する。
problem_japanese: 知的障害者は社会的なステレオタイプや、限られた能力に合わせた創造的活動の機会の不足により、自身の能力を認識し自己肯定感を維持することが難しいことが多い。
method_japanese: AIを用いたアイロンビーズ制作システムを開発し、個々の能力と興味に合わせた活動により、創造的体験を個別化し、自己発見と能力の認識を支援する。
results_japanese: AI強化制作システムは、参加者の自己肯定感と能力認識に良好な影響を与えることを示した。個別化された指導とフィードバックにより、参加者は創造的プロセスにより自信を持って取り組んだ。

title: AutoPBL: An LLM-powered Platform to Guide and Support Individual Learners Through Self Project-based Learning
authors: Zhu, Yihao and Ye, Zhoutong and Yuan, Yichen and Tang, Wenxuan and Yu, Chun and Shi, Yuanchun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents AutoPBL, a platform powered by large language models (LLMs) designed to assist individual learners in project-based self-learning, enhancing personalization and guidance.
problem_english: Self-directed project-based learning can be challenging due to lack of structure and guidance. Many learners struggle to define clear learning objectives, manage tasks, and find relevant resources for completing their projects efficiently.
method_english: AutoPBL utilizes large language models to offer personalized guidance and support in project-based learning, enabling learners to establish clear objectives, organize tasks, locate resources, and receive real-time feedback to enhance their learning experiences.
results_english: The platform demonstrated significant improvements in learners' ability to manage self-directed learning, with enhanced skills in task management, objective setting, and resource utilization thanks to the LLM-guided personalized support.
summary_japanese: AutoPBLは、LLMを用いて個別学習者を支援するプロジェクトベースの学習プラットフォームです。
problem_japanese: プロジェクトベースの自律学習は、構造や指導の欠如から困難を伴う。多くの学習者は、明確な目標設定、タスク管理、関連リソースの発見に苦労している。
method_japanese: AutoPBLはLLMを活用し、学習を支援。学習者が目標設定、タスク管理、リソース位置特定、リアルタイムフィードバックを得ることで学習体験を強化する。
results_japanese: プラットフォームは学習者の自律学習管理能力を向上させ、LLMの個別指導によりタスク管理や目標設定、リソース活用が改善されました。

title: DBox: Scaffolding Algorithmic Programming Learning through Learner-LLM Co-Decomposition
authors: Ma, Shuai and Wang, Junling and Zhang, Yuanhao and Ma, Xiaojuan and Wang, April Yi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: DBox uses a learner-LLM co-decomposition approach to scaffolding algorithmic programming learning, enhancing understanding through collaborative problem-solving between learners and large language models.
problem_english: Learners often struggle with algorithmic programming due to the complexity and abstract nature of problems involved. Traditional teaching methods might not sufficiently cater to individual learning needs, resulting in difficulties understanding and solving algorithmic problems effectively.
method_english: The method involves a learner-LLM co-decomposition approach where learners and large language models collaboratively break down complex algorithmic programming tasks into smaller, manageable sub-problems, thereby facilitating incremental learning and understanding.
results_english: The study demonstrated that the co-decomposition method significantly improved learners' abilities to solve algorithmic problems, increased their confidence in handling complex tasks, and provided personalized learning support through interaction with large language models.
summary_japanese: DBoxは、学習者とLLMの共同分解法でアルゴリズム教育を支援し、問題解決を通じて理解を深める。
problem_japanese: アルゴリズムプログラミングはその複雑さゆえに理解が難しく、従来の教育方法では個々の学習ニーズに対応しづらく、効果的な問題解決が困難。
method_japanese: 学習者とLLMが共同でアルゴリズム的な課題を細分化し、小さなサブ問題として扱うことで、段階的な学習を支援する手法を用いる。
results_japanese: 共同分解法で学習者の問題解決能力が向上し、複雑タスクへの自信が増し、LLMとの対話で個別サポートが実現した。

title: Embracing Social Justice within a Computing Curriculum to Foster Social Change
authors: Thompson, Gabriella and Dombrowski, Lynn and Smith, Angela D. R.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses integrating social justice principles in computing curricula to drive societal change, aiming to educate students on the societal impacts of technology.
problem_english: The study addresses the issue that computing education often overlooks social justice, which limits students' understanding of the broader societal impact and ethical implications of technology, failing to equip them for future challenges.
method_english: The authors propose a curriculum framework that integrates social justice principles with computing education. This involves case studies, interdisciplinary approaches, and collaboration with diverse stakeholders to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of computing's societal role.
results_english: Implementing the proposed curriculum resulted in heightened student awareness of social justice issues, improved critical thinking about technology's impact, and increased engagement in discussions on ethical technology design.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、社会正義の原則を計算カリキュラムに統合し、学生が技術の社会的影響を理解することを目指している。
problem_japanese: 計算教育では社会正義がしばしば見過ごされており、学生が技術の社会的影響や倫理的側面を理解する能力が不足し、将来の課題に対応する準備が不十分であるという課題がある。
method_japanese: 著者らは社会正義の原則を計算教育に組み込んだカリキュラム枠組みを提案し、事例研究、学際的アプローチ、多様な利害関係者との協力を含める。
results_japanese: 提案されたカリキュラムの実施は、学生の社会正義問題への意識の向上、技術の影響に関する批判的思考の向上、倫理的デザインの議論への積極的な参加をもたらした。

title: Enhancing the Educational Potential of Online Movement Videos: System Development and Empirical Studies with TikTok Dance Challenges
authors: Blanchet, Jules Brooks and Hillis, Megan E. and Lee, Yeongji and Shao, Qijia and Zhou, Xia and Balkcom, Devin and Kraemer, David J. M.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores enhancing educational use of online movement videos, focusing on TikTok dance challenges. It includes system development and empirical studies to assess educational effectiveness.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of utilizing online movement videos, such as TikTok dance challenges, for educational purposes. These videos have potential for learning physical movements but require effective systems and methodologies to enhance their educational utility and engagement.
