method_english: The researchers developed a system that integrates educational elements into TikTok dance challenges. They employed empirical studies to assess the effectiveness of this system in improving educational outcomes and engaging users in meaningful learning experiences through interactive and motivating video content.
results_english: The study found that the developed system enhanced the educational value of TikTok dance challenges. Participants showed improved learning of physical movements and increased engagement. Additionally, the integration of educational elements facilitated deeper understanding and retention of content, highlighting potential for broader educational applications.
summary_japanese: 本研究はTikTokダンスチャレンジを用いて、オンラインムーブメント動画の教育的利用の向上を探る。
problem_japanese: TikTokダンスチャレンジ等のオンラインムーブメント動画を教育目的で活用する課題を探る。これらの動画は身体動作学習の可能性を秘めているが、その教育的効果とユーザーのエンゲージメントを高めるシステムと手法が必要だ。
method_japanese: 研究者はTikTokダンスチャレンジに教育要素を統合したシステムを開発し、教育成果の向上と利用者の意味ある学習体験への関与を評価するために実証研究を行った。
results_japanese: 開発されたシステムはTikTokダンスチャレンジの教育的価値を高めた。参加者は身体動作の学習が向上し、エンゲージメントも増加した。教育要素の統合により、内容の理解と記憶が深化した。

title: From Locked Rooms to Open Minds: Escape Room Best Practices to Enhance Reflection in Extended Reality Learning Environments
authors: Kleinman, Erica and Jahani, Rana and McGivney, Eileen and Kosa, Mehmet and Cooper, Seth and Harteveld, Casper
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the intersection between escape rooms and extended reality (XR) to enhance reflective learning, offering insights and best practices.
problem_english: Traditional learning environments often lack engagement and reflection. XR offers immersive experiences, yet fails to consistently integrate reflection. The paper addresses how escape rooms can serve as catalysts for reflective learning within XR contexts.
method_english: The authors investigate escape room mechanics, adapt them into XR processes, and develop guidelines to stimulate reflection through narrative-driven puzzles and collaborative problem-solving, fostering deeper engagement and learning.
results_english: Experiments demonstrated that integrating escape room features into XR enhanced reflective thinking, collaborative skills, and learner engagement. Participants reported increased satisfaction, suggesting potential for widespread educational applications.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、脱出ゲームと拡張現実（XR）を利用し、反射学習を促進する方法とベストプラクティスを探求しています。
problem_japanese: 従来の学習環境はエンゲージメントや反射が不足しており、XRは没入体験を提供するが、反射の統合が不十分。この論文は脱出ゲームがXR内で反射学習を促す可能性を探ります。
method_japanese: 著者は脱出ゲームの仕組みをXRプロセスに適応し、物語駆動型パズルや協力的問題解決を通じて反射を促進するガイドラインを作成しました。
results_japanese: 実験により、XRに脱出ゲームの要素を組み込むことで反射的思考、協力能力、学習者のエンゲージメントが向上することが確認され、参加者の満足度も増し、教育への広範な応用可能性が示唆されました。

title: MILESTONES: The Design and Field Evaluation of a Semi-Automated Tool for Promoting Self-Directed Learning Among Online Learners
authors: Chaudhury, Rimika and Huffman, Courtenay and Kwan, Isabelle and Deol, Gurnoor S. and Dhillon, Supreet and Chilana, Parmit K
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents MILESTONES, a tool to support online learners in self-directed learning by providing semi-automated assistance. The design emphasizes promoting effective learning strategies and engagement through structured guidance.
problem_english: Online learners often struggle with self-directed learning due to a lack of structured guidance and support, which can lead to disengagement and ineffective learning. Existing platforms do not adequately address the need for tools that encourage self-regulation and motivation for learners to effectively manage their learning paths.
method_english: MILESTONES was designed as a semi-automated tool to provide structured learning assistance. It was implemented through a combination of user interface design elements and algorithmic support to help learners set, track, and achieve personalized learning goals, thereby promoting self-directed learning behaviors and engagement.
results_english: Field evaluations showed that MILESTONES effectively supported self-directed learning among users. Participants reported increased motivation and better organization of their learning activities, leading to improved engagement and educational outcomes compared to traditional, unstructured online learning experiences.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、オンライン学習者の自主学習を支援するツールMILESTONESを紹介し、設計と評価を通じて学習エンゲージメントを促進します。
problem_japanese: オンライン学習者はしばしば構造化されたガイダンスが不足し、自主学習が難しくなることがあり、結果として学習の非効率とエンゲージメントの低下を招くことが課題です。
method_japanese: MILESTONESは、学習者が個々の学習目標を設定、追跡、達成するための構造的支援を提供する半自動ツールとして設計され、UIデザインとアルゴリズムを組み合わせて学習を促します。
results_japanese: フィールド評価の結果、MILESTONESはユーザーの自主学習を効果的に支援し、学習の動機付けや活動の組織化を改善し、学習成果を向上させることが示されました。

title: Curious Shorts: Curiosity-Driven Exploration and Learning on Short-Form Video Platforms
authors: Tan, Felicia Fang-Yi and Ram, Ashwin and Messerschmidt, Moritz Alexander and Dissanayake, Hasini Amanda and Nanayakkara, Suranga
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

title: Generative Role-Play Communication Training in Virtual Reality for Autistic Individuals: A Study on Job Coach Experiences in Vocational Training Programs
authors: Li, Ziming and Babar, Pinaki Prasanna and Peiris, Roshan L
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the use of virtual reality in role-play communication training for autistic individuals in vocational programs, focusing on job coach experiences.
problem_english: Autistic individuals often face challenges in communication skills vital for employment, leading to lower job retention and success rates. Traditional training methods may not effectively address these needs, prompting the exploration of innovative solutions such as virtual reality-based training.
method_english: The study utilizes a generative role-play approach within virtual reality environments, allowing autistic individuals to practice and enhance their communication skills. It focuses on integrating job coach perspectives to tailor program content towards real-world vocational scenarios and challenges.
results_english: Findings show that VR-enhanced role-play training significantly improves communication skills of autistic individuals in vocational settings. Job coaches reported enhanced engagement and effective learning outcomes, contributing to better preparedness for workplace interactions.
summary_japanese: 自閉症者の職業訓練における役割演技コミュニケーショントレーニングにVRを使った研究。
problem_japanese: 自閉症者は雇用に必要なコミュニケーションスキルに課題があり、仕事維持や成功率が低いです。従来の訓練法では十分に対応できないため、VRを用いた革新的な訓練法の発展が求められている。
method_japanese: VR環境での役割演技アプローチを自閉症者向けに使用し、コミュニケーション能力向上を目指す。ジョブコーチの視点を取り入れ実際の職業シナリオと課題に合わせたプログラム構築に注力。
results_japanese: VRによる役割演技訓練は職業訓練中の自閉症者のコミュニケーション能力を大幅に向上させた。ジョブコーチは効果的な学習成果と職場での交流準備に貢献すると報告された。

title: It's a Match - Enhancing the Fit between Users and Phishing Training through Personalisation
authors: Sch\"{o}ni, Lorin and Roch, Neele and Sievers, Hannah and Strohmeier, Martin and Mayer, Peter and Zimmermann, Verena
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores enhancing phishing training effectiveness by adapting it to individual user attributes and preferences, aiming to increase user engagement and training outcomes.
problem_english: Current phishing training programs often lack personalisation, leading to decreased user engagement and less effective learning outcomes. The challenge lies in tailoring training content to better match individual user needs and characteristics.
method_english: The authors propose a personalised phishing training approach that adjusts content based on user profiles, preferences, and characteristics. This involves assessing user attributes and dynamically adapting training content accordingly.
results_english: The study shows that personalised phishing training significantly improves user engagement and retention rates compared to generic training methods. Tailored content leads to better understanding and application of training lessons.
summary_japanese: 論文ではフィッシング訓練の効果を個々のユーザーの属性と好みに合わせて向上させることを探究している。
problem_japanese: 現行のフィッシング訓練プログラムは個別化が不十分であり、ユーザーの関与が減少し効果が低下することがある。課題は個々のユーザーに合った訓練内容を提供することである。
method_japanese: 著者はユーザープロフィールや好みに基づいて訓練内容を調整する個別化フィッシング訓練を提案し、ユーザーの属性を評価し動的にコンテンツを適応させている。
results_japanese: 研究は個別化されたフィッシング訓練がユーザーの関与と定着率を改善することを示しており、調整されたコンテンツがより良い理解と訓練の応用につながる。

title: Scaffolding Empathy: Training Counselors with Simulated Patients and Utterance-level Performance Visualizations
authors: Steenstra, Ian and Nouraei, Farnaz and Bickmore, Timothy
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a training system using simulated patients and performance visualizations to improve counselors' empathy skills during sessions.
problem_english: Counselors often struggle to effectively convey empathy during client interactions. Traditional training methods may not adequately prepare them for real-world scenarios, leading to suboptimal client outcomes. Enhancing counselors' ability to empathize can significantly improve therapeutic relationships and treatment effectiveness.
method_english: The authors developed an interactive training system that employs simulated patients and provides real-time utterance-level performance visualizations. This system allows counselors to practice and receive feedback on their empathetic communication skills in a controlled environment, facilitating the iterative improvement of their techniques.
results_english: The system was tested with counseling trainees, demonstrating significant improvements in empathy expression. Participants showed increased awareness of their empathetic behaviors and reported greater confidence in their counseling abilities, suggesting the system's practical application in professional training settings.
summary_japanese: 本稿は、共感スキル向上のための模擬患者とパフォーマンスビジュアライズを用いたカウンセラー訓練システムを紹介します。
problem_japanese: カウンセラーはクライアントとのやり取りで共感をうまく伝えるのが難しく、従来のトレーニング方法は実世界でのシナリオに十分に対応しきれず、クライアントの最適な結果を得られないことがあります。
method_japanese: 著者らは模擬患者と発話レベルのリアルタイムパフォーマンスビジュアライゼーションを用いた対話型訓練システムを開発し、カウンセラーが共感的コミュニケーションスキルを練習しフィードバックを受けられる仕組みを提供します。
results_japanese: システムはカウンセリング実習参加者に試験され、共感表現の改善が示されました。参加者は自らの共感行動への認識が高まり、カウンセリング能力への自信が向上したことが観察されました。

title: Stop the Clock - Counteracting Bias Exploited by Attackers through an Interactive Augmented Reality Phishing Training
authors: Sch\"{o}ni, Lorin and Strohmeier, Martin and Sluganovic, Ivo and Zimmermann, Verena
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses mitigating bias in phishing attacks using interactive augmented reality training to enhance users' threat recognition skills.
problem_english: Phishing attacks exploit cognitive biases, making it difficult for individuals to identify threats effectively. Current training methods may not address these psychological factors adequately, leading to continued vulnerability.
method_english: The study developed an augmented reality training platform that simulates phishing scenarios, allowing users to interact and practice threat recognition in a controlled environment, with real-time feedback to improve their skills.
results_english: The interactive augmented reality training showed significant improvement in users' ability to detect phishing attacks compared to traditional training methods, demonstrating the effectiveness of immersive and engaging learning experiences.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、フィッシング攻撃におけるバイアスを、インタラクティブな拡張現実トレーニングで緩和する方法を探る。
problem_japanese: フィッシング攻撃は認知バイアスを利用しており、個人が効果的に脅威を識別するのが難しい。現行のトレーニング方法ではこれらの心理的要因に十分対応できず、脆弱性が続く。
method_japanese: 拡張現実トレーニングプラットフォームを開発し、ユーザーがフィッシングシナリオをシミュレートされた環境で実践し、リアルタイムのフィードバックを受けて脅威識別能力を向上。
results_japanese: インタラクティブな拡張現実トレーニングは、従来の方法と比べてフィッシング攻撃の検出能力を大幅に向上させた。

title: The Impact of Observer Presence on Trainees' Mental States and Performance in Remote Military Training with Virtual Humans in Mixed Reality Environment
authors: Park, JunSeo and Yang, Yechan and Kim, Gerard Jounghyun and Kim, Hanseob
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how observer presence affects the mental states and performance of trainees in remote military training using virtual humans in a mixed reality environment.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of understanding how the presence of observers impacts trainees' mental states and performance during remote military training. With the increasing use of virtual humans and mixed reality environments, it's crucial to determine the psychological effects on trainees, and how these effects influence training outcomes, which are not well-explored.
method_english: The researchers employed a controlled experimental design using virtual humans in a mixed reality setting. They varied the presence of observers to evaluate the impact on trainees' mental states and performance metrics. Data were collected through psychological questionnaires and performance assessments, comparing scenarios with and without observers to determine significant differences.
results_english: The study found that observer presence significantly influenced trainees' anxiety and stress levels, negatively impacting performance. Trainees in observer-present conditions showed heightened arousal, which detracted from task focus. The research provides insights into managing observer dynamics in remote training setups involving virtual humans.
summary_japanese: この研究は、観察者の存在が、バーチャルヒューマンを用いた混合現実環境での遠隔軍事訓練における研修生の精神状態とパフォーマンスに与える影響を調査しています。
problem_japanese: 本研究では、観察者の存在が研修生の精神状態やパフォーマンスに与える影響を理解する課題に取り組んでいます。バーチャルヒューマンや混合現実環境の利用が増加する中で、研修生への心理的影響とその影響がどのように訓練成果に影響するかは十分に探求されていません。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは、仮想人間を使用した混合現実環境で、観察者の存在を変えて研修生の精神状態とパフォーマンスに対する影響を評価する実験を行いました。心理的質問票とパフォーマンス評価を通じてデータを収集し、観察者の有無で比較しました。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、観察者の存在が研修生の不安やストレスレベルに大きな影響を与え、パフォーマンスに悪影響を及ぼすことが判明しました。観察者がいる条件では、研修生は興奮が高まり、タスクへの集中が妨げられました。

title: Visual Augmentations for Ultrasound Assessment Training of Medical Students
authors: Djern\ae{}s, Helena B\o{}jer and Jacobsen, Rune M\o{}berg and Hosio, Simo and van Berkel, Niels
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines the use of visual augmentations to enhance ultrasound training for medical students, aiming to improve their diagnostic accuracy and learning efficiency.
problem_english: Medical students often struggle with mastering ultrasound assessments due to the complexity and variability of interpreting sonographic images. Current training methods lack real-time feedback, limiting students' ability to improve diagnostic skills quickly.
method_english: The study introduced visual augmentation technology that overlays additional information onto ultrasound images in real-time. This innovative system provides instant feedback, guides students during practice sessions, and helps bridge their knowledge gaps rapidly.
results_english: Students using the augmented system showed quicker learning curves and enhanced diagnostic accuracy compared to traditional training methods. Visual augmentations effectively improved students' ability to interpret ultrasound images correctly.
summary_japanese: 医学部生の超音波評価トレーニングのための視覚的拡張技術を検討し、診断精度と学習効率の改善を目的とする。
problem_japanese: 医学部生は、超音波画像の解釈の複雑さと変動性のため、マスターするのに苦労する。現在のトレーニング方法では、リアルタイムフィードバックが不足しており、診断技能の迅速な改善が困難である。
method_japanese: 超音波画像にリアルタイムで追加情報を重ねる視覚的拡張技術を導入。革新的なシステムで瞬時のフィードバックを提供し、練習中に学生を誘導し、知識のギャップを迅速に埋める。
results_japanese: 拡張システムを使用した学生は、従来の方法と比較して、学習曲線が速く、診断精度が向上。視覚的拡張により画像の解釈能力が向上。

title: 3HANDS Dataset: Learning from Humans for Generating Naturalistic Handovers with Supernumerary Robotic Limbs
authors: Saberpour Abadian, Artin and Liao, Yi-Chi and Otaran, Ata and Dabral, Rishabh and Muehlhaus, Marie and Theobalt, Christian and Schmitz, Martin and Steimle, J\"{u}rgen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The 3HANDS dataset enables teaching robotic limbs human-like handovers using data captured from human interactions, addressing a crucial challenge in human-robot collaboration.
problem_english: Existing robotic systems struggle to perform naturalistic handovers, crucial for seamless human-robot collaboration. Current methods lack human-like dexterity and adaptability, hindering their integration into daily human life.
method_english: The study introduces the 3HANDS dataset, capturing detailed interactions between human participants. Utilizing this dataset, the authors train supernumerary robotic limbs to perform handovers with human-like dexterity and naturalism.
results_english: Trained using the 3HANDS dataset, supernumerary robotic limbs demonstrated improved handover accuracy, adaptability, and human-like behavior, showcasing the potential for enhanced human-robot collaboration.
summary_japanese: 3HANDSデータセットは、人間の相互作用データを用いてロボットの自然な受け渡しを実現します。
problem_japanese: 既存のロボティック システムは、人間のデイリーライフへの統合を難しくしている、人間のような器用さや適応力を欠いています。
method_japanese: 3HANDSデータセットを導入し、人間同士の詳細な相互作用を収集。これを用いて自然な受け渡しを可能にするロボットを訓練しました。
results_japanese: 3HANDSを使用したロボットは、受け渡し精度と適応力が向上。人間のような動作を示し、人間-ロボットの協働を強化します。

title: Crossmodal Interactions in Human-Robot Communication: Exploring the Influences of Scent and Voice Congruence on User Perceptions of Social Robots
authors: Chang, Fangyuan and Chen, Bingliang and Zhang, Xingguo and Sheng, Lin and Zhu, Dian and Zhao, Jianan and Gu, Zhenyu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores how scent and voice congruence influence user perceptions of social robots, analyzing crossmodal interactions in human-robot communication.
problem_english: The study investigates how discrepancies between sensory modalities, specifically scent and voice, affect user perceptions of social robots. The researchers aim to understand if and how congruent crossmodal interactions improve user experiences and acceptance of robots by mitigating any potential perceptual dissonance.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments using social robots with varying combinations of scent and voice congruence. Participants interacted with these robots, and their perceptions were assessed through surveys to gauge the impact of these crossmodal interactions on user experience and acceptance.
results_english: Findings suggest that congruent scent and voice pairings enhance user perception of social robots, leading to improved user experience and higher acceptance. Participants responded more positively to aligned sensory cues, indicating these interactions play a critical role in perception.
summary_japanese: 香りと音声の一致が社会的ロボットに対するユーザーの認識に与える影響を探り、相互作用を分析した研究。
problem_japanese: 感覚モダリティ、不一致がロボットに対するユーザー認識にどのように影響するかを研究。この研究は、感覚不一致がもたらす可能性のある認知的混乱を軽減し、ユーザー体験と受け入れをどのように向上させるかを検討。
method_japanese: 社会的ロボットを用いて、香りと音声が一致した条件下での実験を実施。参加者の認識を調査し、相互作用の影響を評価しました。
results_japanese: 香りと音声の一致がユーザー認識を向上させることを示唆。参加者は整合性の取れた感覚刺激に対し、より肯定的に反応しました。

title: Investigating LLM-Driven Curiosity in Human-Robot Interaction
authors: Leusmann, Jan and Belardinelli, Anna and Haliburton, Luke and Hasler, Stephan and Schmidt, Albrecht and Mayer, Sven and Gienger, Michael and Wang, Chao
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores how Large Language Model (LLM)-driven curiosity can enhance human-robot interaction. It investigates mechanisms to integrate curiosity aspects into robotic systems to improve engagement and effectiveness.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of effectively integrating LLM-driven curiosity into human-robot interaction systems. The aim is to enhance the robot's ability to engage users and adapt its behavior based on user interactions, thus improving overall interaction quality.
method_english: Researchers developed a framework that incorporates LLMs to drive curiosity in robots. They used experimental setups involving simulated human-robot interactions to test different mechanisms of curiosity and measured engagement and adaptiveness.
results_english: Results indicate that LLM-driven curiosity positively impacts human-robot interaction by increasing engagement and adaptiveness. Robots using curiosity-based mechanisms showed improved interaction quality and user satisfaction, confirming the approach's effectiveness.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、LLMによる好奇心が人とロボットの相互作用を強化する方法を探ります。好奇心をロボットシステムに統合し、エンゲージメントと効果を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 本論文は、LLMによる好奇心を効果的に人とロボットの相互作用システムに統合する課題に取り組んでいます。ロボットがユーザーを引き付け、行動を調整し全体的な相互作用の質を向上させることを目指しています。
method_japanese: 研究者らはLLMを活用してロボットに好奇心を促進する枠組みを開発しました。シミュレーションによる人とロボットの対話実験を通じて好奇心のさまざまなメカニズムを試験し、エンゲージメントと適応性を測定しました。
results_japanese: 結果として、LLMによる好奇心が人とロボットの相互作用においてエンゲージメントと適応性を向上させることが確認されました。好奇心を促進するメカニズムを使用したロボットは、相互作用の質とユーザー満足度を向上させ、その効果が確認されました。

title: Playing with Robots: Performing Arts Techniques for Designing and Understanding Robot Group Movement
authors: Madill, Philippa and Newton, Matthew and Zhao, Huanjun and Lian, Yichen and McKendrick, Zachary and Finn, Patrick and Nittala, Aditya Shekhar and Sharlin, Ehud
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores techniques from performing arts to design and understand group movement of robots. By combining art and technology, the authors aim to create more cohesive and visually appealing robot group movements.
problem_english: Current robotic group movement lacks natural and aesthetically pleasing coordination, often appearing mechanical and disjointed. This paper highlights the need for improved design frameworks to facilitate smooth, coordinated, and expressive robot group movements that mimic natural group dynamics.
method_english: The authors integrate performing arts techniques such as choreography, theater, and dance into robotic group design. By collaborating with performing artists and using motion capture technology, they develop frameworks to enhance the expressiveness and cohesiveness of robot group dynamics.
results_english: The incorporation of performing arts techniques results in increased expressiveness and fluidity of robot group movements. Evaluations show improved coordination, aesthetic appeal, and a more natural appearance, demonstrating the effectiveness of integrating artistic approaches into robotic systems.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ロボット群の動きをデザインし理解するために、舞台芸術の技術を探求します。
problem_japanese: 現在のロボット群の動きは自然で美的というよりも、機械的かつぎこちない。より滑らかで協調的かつ表現豊かな動きを生み出すデザインフレームワークの必要性を強調します。
method_japanese: 演劇、ダンスなどの芸術技法をロボット群設計に取り入れ、モーションキャプチャ技術を使用し、ロボット群の動きを向上させるフレームワークを開発します。
results_japanese: 芸術技法の導入により、ロボット群の動きに表現力と流動性が増し、評価では協調性や美しさ、自然な外観が改善されました。

title: Promises, Promises: Understanding Claims Made in Social Robot Consumer Experiences
authors: Gunawan, Johanna and Gillespie, Sarah Elizabeth and Choffnes, David and Hartzog, Woodrow and Wilson, Christo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates promises made to consumers about social robots and examines the realities versus expectations in user experiences with these devices.
problem_english: Consumers often encounter exaggerated claims about social robots' capabilities, leading to misconceptions. This discrepancy can result in disappointment and reduced trust in these technologies, affecting adoption and user satisfaction rates.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative analysis using consumer reviews and advertisements for social robots. They identified common claims and compared them with user experiences to evaluate the gap between promises and actual performance.
results_english: The study found that many social robot advertisements exaggerate their capabilities. Users often reported unmet expectations, primarily in emotional and interactive functionalities, which leads to dissatisfaction and decreased trust in such technology.
summary_japanese: この論文はSocialロボットの消費者への約束と実際のユーザー体験を調査し、期待とのギャップを検討します。
problem_japanese: 消費者はSocialロボットの能力に関する誇張された主張にしばしば遭遇し、誤解が生じます。このギャップは失望と技術への信頼低下を引き起こし、普及と満足度に影響を与えます。
method_japanese: 著者はSocialロボットの消費者レビューと広告を用いて質的分析を実施。一般的な主張を特定し、実際のユーザー体験と比較して約束と実際の性能のギャップを検証しました。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、多くのSocialロボット広告がその能力を誇張していることが判明。ユーザーは感情的・インタラクティブ機能の期待が満たされず不満を報告し、技術への信頼が低下しました。

title: SafeSpect: Safety-First Augmented Reality Heads-up Display for Drone Inspections
authors: Xu, Peisen and Garcia, J\'{e}r\'{e}mie and Ooi, Wei Tsang and Jouffrais, Christophe
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SafeSpect is an AR heads-up display designed to enhance safety during drone inspections by providing real-time contextual information. It addresses risks associated with loss of visual contact or situational awareness.
problem_english: Drone inspections often pose safety risks due to loss of visual contact and situational awareness, potentially leading to accidents or ineffective inspections. There's a need for technologies that can mitigate these issues by providing better real-time data visibility and situational understanding.
method_english: SafeSpect integrates AR technology to project essential information onto a heads-up display, allowing operators to maintain visual contact with drones while accessing critical data. It enhances situational awareness through augmented reality overlays that show real-time information directly in the user's field of view.
results_english: The implementation of SafeSpect showed significant improvements in safety and situational awareness during drone inspections. Participants reported enhanced visual contact with drones and better information access, leading to more efficient and safer inspection procedures.
summary_japanese: SafeSpectはドローン点検の安全性向上のため、AR技術を用いた視覚表示を提供し、リアルタイム情報を表示します。
problem_japanese: ドローン点検において、視覚的接触の喪失や状況認識の欠如が事故や点検の効果不全を招くことがあります。これを解決するための技術が求められています。
method_japanese: SafeSpectはAR技術を活用し、重要情報を視覚表示にプロジェクション。オペレーターがドローンを視認しつつ必要データへのアクセスを可能にし、状況認識を向上します。
results_japanese: SafeSpectの導入により、安全性と状況認識が向上しました。参加者はドローンへの視覚的接触が改善され、効率的かつ安全な点検が可能になりました。

title: Signaling Human Intentions to Service Robots: Understanding the Use of Social Cues during In-Person Conversations
authors: Lyu, Hanfang and Wang, Xiaoyu and Zhang, Nandi and Ma, Shuai and Zhu, Qian and Luo, Yuhan and Tsung, Fugee and Ma, Xiaojuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how humans signal intentions to service robots using social cues during in-person conversations, proposing methods to enhance robots' interpretive capabilities.
problem_english: Service robots often struggle to accurately interpret human intentions, especially from social cues during face-to-face interactions, limiting their effectiveness and user experience.
method_english: Researchers investigated various social cues like gestures and facial expressions, analyzing their role in human-robot interaction through controlled experiments to guide robotic systems in understanding context and intent.
results_english: Findings indicate that robots equipped with systems interpreting specific social cues, such as body language and tone, perform better in recognizing human intentions, enhancing interaction quality.
summary_japanese: この研究は、対面会話での社会的手がかりを用いて、サービスロボットに人間の意図を伝える方法を探求し、ロボットの解釈能力向上を提案する。
problem_japanese: サービスロボットは対面での社会的手がかりから人間の意図を正確に解釈することが困難であり、効果やユーザー体験を制限している。
method_japanese: 研究者はジェスチャーや表情などの社会的手がかりを調査し、制御された実験を通じて文脈と意図を理解するためのロボットシステムへの指針を分析した。
results_japanese: 特定の社会的手がかり（身体言語やトーンなど）を解釈するシステムを装備したロボットが、人間の意図をよりよく認識し、インタラクションの質を向上させることが示された。

title: Cross, Dwell, or Pinch: Designing and Evaluating Around-Device Selection Methods for Unmodified Smartwatches
authors: Kim, Jiwan and Son, Jiwan and Oakley, Ian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores methods for interacting with smartwatches using gestures performed around the device, focusing on Cross, Dwell, and Pinch interactions for intuitive and efficient user input.
problem_english: Wearable devices such as smartwatches need intuitive and efficient interaction methods that do not require modifications to existing hardware. Around-device interactions might offer a solution, but need careful design and evaluation.
method_english: The authors designed and evaluated three around-device interaction methods: Cross, Dwell, and Pinch. These gestures allow users to perform input actions without modifying the smartwatch hardware, promising a natural user experience.
results_english: The study found that all three interaction techniques are viable for smartwatches, with variations in task efficiency and user satisfaction. Pinch gestures showed potential for high precision while Cross and Dwell were noted for ease of use.
summary_japanese: 本論文はスマートウォッチ周辺でのジェスチャーを用いた入力方法を探求し、クロス、ドウェル、ピンチのインタラクションが直感的で効率的な入力を提供することを示します。
problem_japanese: ウェアラブルデバイス、特にスマートウォッチは、既存のハードウェアを改造せずに直感的で効率的な操作方法を必要としています。周辺装置インタラクションは有望ですが、慎重な設計と評価が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは三つの周辺装置インタラクション、クロス、ドウェル、ピンチを設計し評価しました。これらのジェスチャーはスマートウォッチハードウェアの改造を必要とせず、自然なユーザー体験を提供します。
results_japanese: 研究は、三つのインタラクション技術がスマートウォッチに適用可能であることを示しました。ピンチジェスチャーは高精度性があり、クロスとドウェルは使いやすさで評価されました。

title: FingerGlass: Enhancing Smart Glasses Interaction via Fingerprint Sensing
authors: Xu, Zhanwei and Pei, Haoxiang and Feng, Jianjiang and Zhou, Jie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: FingerGlass integrates fingerprint sensing into smart glasses, enhancing user interaction. It addresses current limitations in hands-free device use and offers a seamless interface for various applications.
problem_english: Existing smart glasses face significant limitations in user interaction, primarily due to the lack of an intuitive or seamless input method. Current solutions either require additional devices or interrupt the user's hands-free experience, resulting in inefficiency and inconvenience for the user.
method_english: FingerGlass employs integrated fingerprint sensors within the smart glasses frames to enable direct user interaction. The method leverages biometric technology to provide secure, intuitive control of applications without requiring extra devices, maintaining a hands-free experience.
results_english: The implementation of FingerGlass improved user interaction significantly, enabling precise control and enhancing security with fingerprint authentication. User studies demonstrated increased efficiency and a preference for this method over traditional interaction techniques.
summary_japanese: FingerGlassはスマートグラスに指紋センサーを統合し、ユーザーの操作性を向上させます。各種アプリケーションにシームレスなインターフェースを提供します。
problem_japanese: 現在のスマートグラスは、直感的かつシームレスな入力方法がないため、ユーザー操作が制限されています。従来のソリューションは追加デバイスを要し、ハンズフリー体験を妨げます。
method_japanese: FingerGlassは、スマートグラスのフレームに指紋センサーを統合することにより、直接的なユーザー操作を可能にします。生体認証技術を活用して、追加デバイスなしでの直感的操作を実現します。
results_japanese: FingerGlassの導入により、ユーザー操作が大幅に向上し、指紋認証によるセキュリティ強化が実現しました。ユーザー調査では、この方法が従来の技術よりも効率的であると評価されました。

title: How your Physical Environment Affects Spatial Presence in Virtual Reality
authors: van Gemert, Thomas and Knibbe, Jarrod and Velloso, Eduardo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how different physical environments impact users' sense of spatial presence in virtual reality, offering insights for optimizing VR experiences.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of understanding how various physical environments influence the user's sense of spatial presence when experiencing virtual reality, which is crucial for enhancing immersion and user experience in VR applications.
method_english: The researchers conducted experiments where participants were exposed to VR experiences in different physical settings, measuring their spatial presence using established VR presence scales and gathering qualitative feedback through interviews.
results_english: The results indicated that the physical environment significantly affects spatial presence in VR. Specific features like room size and ambient conditions played roles in enhancing or diminishing the immersive experience, suggesting design considerations for VR setup.
summary_japanese: 研究は物理環境がVRでの空間的プレゼンスにどのように影響するかを調べ、VR体験の最適化の洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: この研究は、さまざまな物理環境がVR体験中のユーザーの空間的プレゼンスにどのように影響するかを理解する重要性に取り組んでいます。これはVRアプリケーションの没入感とユーザー体験を向上させるために不可欠です。
method_japanese: 研究者たちは、異なる物理的設定で被験者にVR体験を提供し、既存のVRプレゼンス尺度を用いて空間的プレゼンスを測定し、インタビューを通じて定性的フィードバックを収集しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、物理環境がVRでの空間的プレゼンスに大きな影響を与えることを示しました。部屋の大きさや周囲の条件などの特定の要素が没入体験を強化または減少させる役割を果たし、VRセットアップの設計への示唆を提供します。

title: InterFACE: Establishing a Facial Action Unit Input Vocabulary for Hands-Free Extended Reality Interactions, From VR Gaming to AR Web Browsing
authors: Wilson, Graham and McCready, Jamie and Freeman, Euan and Mathis, Florian and Russell, Harvey and McGill, Mark
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: InterFACE presents a facial action unit vocabulary for hands-free XR interactions, enhancing VR and AR usability. It introduces practical interactions for varied activities like gaming and web browsing.
problem_english: As the use of Extended Reality (XR) technologies expands, hands-free interaction methods become crucial, especially for users with physical limitations or when hands are occupied. Current XR systems lack effective and intuitive interaction models, particularly utilizing facial expressions, which limits potential user populations and scenarios.
method_english: InterFACE develops a vocabulary based on facial action units, allowing users to interact with XR environments using subtle facial expressions. This vocabulary is mapped to typical XR interactions, enabling efficient control and navigation tailored to gaming and browsing contexts, among others.
results_english: The study demonstrated that users could reliably use facial action units for XR interaction, leading to efficient, hands-free control. User evaluations showed improved accessibility and intuitiveness, with positive feedback indicating potential for wider adoption and application in diverse XR scenarios.
summary_japanese: InterFACEは顔の動作単位を用いたXR操作の語彙を確立し、VRおよびARの利便性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: XR技術の普及に伴い、特に手が塞がっている状況や身体的制約を持つユーザーにとって、ハンズフリーのインタラクション手法が重要となっています。しかし、現在のXRシステムは効果的かつ直感的な操作モデル、特に顔の表情を利用したものを欠いています。
method_japanese: InterFACEは顔の動作単位に基づく語彙を開発し、ユーザーが微妙な表情を使ってXR環境と対話できるようにします。この語彙は、ゲームやブラウジングなどの状況に合わせたXR操作にマッピングしています。
results_japanese: 研究により、ユーザーが顔の動作単位を使って効率的にXRを操作できることが示されました。評価ではアクセシビリティと直感性が向上し、幅広い採用とXRシナリオへの応用可能性が示されました。

title: MotionBlocks: Modular Geometric Motion Remapping for More Accessible Upper Body Movement in Virtual Reality
authors: Wentzel, Johann and Luz, Alessandra and Mott, Martez E and Vogel, Daniel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: MotionBlocks presents a modular system for geometric motion remapping to enhance accessibility for users with limited upper body mobility in VR. This research aims to foster inclusivity in virtual environments.
problem_english: Virtual reality often demands full upper body movement, which can be challenging for individuals with limited mobility. Current VR systems lack accessible motion remapping solutions, limiting experiences for users who cannot perform required physical movements, thus creating accessibility barriers in an increasingly digital world.
method_english: The study introduces MotionBlocks, a customizable framework that allows users to adjust geometric motion remapping for VR experiences. It incorporates modular components adaptable to individual needs, offering a tailored virtual interaction by mapping limited physical movements to broader in-game actions.
results_english: Testing MotionBlocks demonstrated improved accessibility for users with limited upper body mobility, allowing them to engage more fully in VR experiences. The modular approach effectively mapped simple movements to complex actions, enhancing user interaction without sacrificing the virtual experience.
summary_japanese: MotionBlocksはVRでの上半身運動をリマップし、障害者のアクセスを改善するシステムを提案します。仮想環境での包摂性を促進します。
problem_japanese: 多くのVRシステムは、上半身の制限された動作を持つ個人には難しい身体動作を要求します。そのため、これらのユーザーが完全な体験をするのが難しく、デジタル体験のアクセシビリティの障壁となっています。
method_japanese: MotionBlocksは、VR体験のモーションリマッピングをカスタマイズ可能なフレームワークとして提供され、個々のニーズに応じてモジュラーコンポーネントを組み合わせることで、物理的な動きが制限されたユーザーのためのバーチャル体験を調整します。
results_japanese: MotionBlocksのテストにより、上半身の動きが制限されたユーザーのVRへのアクセスが向上し、少ない動作で複雑なアクションを実行できることが証明されました。

title: Over the Mouse: Navigating across the GUI with Finger-Lifting Operation Mouse
authors: Kim, YoungIn and Yun, Yohan and Kim, Taejun and Lee, Geehyuk
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a novel mouse design allowing GUI navigation through finger-lifting gestures, enhancing user interaction by reducing wrist movement.
problem_english: Traditional computer mice require significant wrist movement and can lead to discomfort over extended periods of use. The challenge is to develop a more ergonomic and efficient method for navigating graphical user interfaces that reduces strain and increases interaction efficiency.
method_english: The authors designed a mouse prototype that uses finger-lifting gestures for interaction. This design evaluates user comfort and navigation efficiency through user studies comparing it with traditional mice to determine its impact on wrist movement and interaction fluidity.
results_english: User studies indicated that the finger-lifting operation mouse reduced wrist movement, leading to enhanced comfort during use. Participants reported improved interaction efficiency, suggesting the design as a viable alternative for conventional mouse interfaces.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、指の持ち上げ操作でGUIをナビゲートする新しいマウスデザインを提案し、ユーザーの手首の動きを減らして相互作用を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 従来のコンピューターマウスでは手首の動きが多く、長時間の使用で不快感を生むことが課題です。手首への負担を減らしインタラクションを効率化する、より人間工学的で効率的なGUIナビゲーション方法の開発が求められます。
method_japanese: 著者らは指の持ち上げジェスチャーで操作するマウスプロトタイプを設計しました。ユーザー研究を通じて伝統的なマウスと比較し、手首の動きやインタラクション流動性への影響を評価します。
results_japanese: ユーザー研究では、指の持ち上げ操作マウスが手首の動きを減少させ、使用中の快適性を向上させることを示しました。参加者はインタラクション効率の向上を報告し、従来型マウスの代替となる可能性が示唆されました。

title: Reel Feel: Rich Haptic XR Experiences Using an Active, Worn, Multi-String Device
authors: DeVrio, Nathan and Harrison, Chris
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This research introduces an active, worn, multi-string device to enhance haptic experiences in XR environments, enabling users to feel diverse textures and forces. The device offers detailed real-time feedback.
problem_english: Existing XR systems lack the ability to deliver rich, nuanced haptic feedback, which is crucial for more immersive and engaging user experiences. Traditional methods are often limited in feedback variety and intensity.
method_english: The authors developed a novel multi-string device worn by users that actively adjusts tension and length of strings to simulate various haptic sensations. This setup allows real-time control and detailed feedback in XR environments.
results_english: The device significantly improved users' perception of haptic feedback in XR settings, providing a wider range of textures and forces. User testing demonstrated enhanced immersion and engagement compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: この研究では、XR環境での触覚体験を向上させるための多弦デバイスを紹介し、多様な質感と力を体感可能とする。
problem_japanese: 既存のXRシステムでは、豊かで微細な触覚フィードバックを提供できず、ユーザー体験の没入感が欠如している。従来の手法はフィードバックの種類や強度が制限されている。
method_japanese: 著者らは、XR環境で様々な触覚をシミュレートするために、ユーザーが装着する多弦デバイスを開発し、弦の張力と長さをリアルタイムで調整する。
results_japanese: デバイスは、XR環境での触覚フィードバックの感知力を著しく向上させ、従来の手法と比較して没入感と関与性が向上した。

title: Evaluating In-Car Tasks’ Distraction Effects with Drive-In Lab
authors: Kujala, Tuomo and Sarkar, Abhishek
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines distraction effects of in-car tasks using a Drive-In Lab. It highlights the potential risks posed by rising in-car technologies on driver attention and safety.
problem_english: As in-car technologies evolve, they provide drivers with more interaction opportunities, potentially increasing distraction levels. This research addresses the challenge of evaluating how these technologies impact driver attention and pose safety risks.
method_english: The study utilized a 'Drive-In Lab' setup to simulate real driving conditions. Participants were tasked with performing various in-car activities, and their distraction levels were measured via behavioral and cognitive assessments.
results_english: The findings indicated that some in-car tasks significantly distract drivers, affecting their reaction times and cognitive processing. These results underscore the necessity for industry standards in designing safer in-car interfaces.
summary_japanese: ドライブインラボを用いて、車内タスクの注意散漫効果を調査。車内技術の進化が運転者の注意力と安全性に与える影響を強調。
problem_japanese: 車内技術の進化に伴い、運転者に提供されるインタラクションが増えるが、それが注意散漫を増加させる可能性あり。この技術が運転者の注意に及ぼす影響と安全リスクを評価する課題に対応。
method_japanese: リアルな運転条件を模擬するドライブインラボを使用。参加者に様々な車内活動を行わせ、行動および認知評価を通じて注意散漫レベルを測定。
results_japanese: 一部の車内タスクが運転者を大いに散漫にし、反応時間や認知処理に影響を及ぼすことが判明。安全な車内インターフェース設計に関する業界標準の必要性を強調。

title: HAI-AR: Exploring Hand-Anchored Interfaces in Augmented Reality while Walking
authors: Jannat, Marium-E- and Phan, Ngan and Chadha, Anmol and Katsuragawa, Keiko and Hasan, Khalad
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores hand-anchored interfaces in augmented reality (AR) to enhance user interaction while walking. By anchoring user interfaces to hands, the research aims to design a user-friendly and effective AR experience.
problem_english: The challenge lies in designing AR interfaces that maintain usability and effectiveness while users are in motion, such as walking. Traditional AR interfaces can require significant attention and dexterity, which may not be feasible when the user's mobility needs are considered.
method_english: The method involves developing and testing hand-anchored AR interfaces that allow users to interact with virtual elements seamlessly while moving. The study employs usability testing and user feedback to refine and validate these interactive designs.
results_english: The findings suggest that hand-anchored AR interfaces improve user interaction and satisfaction while in motion. Users found the interfaces more intuitive and less intrusive than traditional models, showing promise for more effective AR applications in dynamic environments.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、歩行中のユーザー体験を向上させるための手アンカー型ARインターフェースを探求します。
problem_japanese: 移動中のユーザーにとっても使いやすく効果的なARインターフェース設計が課題。従来のARは注意力や器用さを要求し、動きながらの使用には不適。
method_japanese: 手アンカー型ARインターフェース開発し、移動中にシームレスなバーチャル要素操作を実現。ユーザビリティテストとフィードバックで改善と検証を行う。
results_japanese: 手アンカー型ARインターフェースは移動中のユーザー操作と満足度を向上。より直感的で侵襲性が低く、動的環境での効果的なアプリの可能性を示す。

title: QCM: A Curvature Manipulation Method to Suppress Discomfort in Redirected Walking
authors: Bao, Xiyu and Lv, Gaorong and Bian, Yulong and Gai, Wei and Xin, Shiqing and Luan, Hongqiu and Ma, Xiaojuan and Yang, Chenglei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces QCM (Curvature Manipulation Method) designed to reduce discomfort in redirected walking, enhancing VR experiences. It involves optimizing curvature paths for seamless interaction within limited physical spaces.
problem_english: Redirected walking in VR often leads to discomfort due to unnatural movements and space limitations. This problem hampers users' immersive experience and can cause disorientation or motion sickness, necessitating techniques to minimize these effects while ensuring spatial navigation fluidity.
method_english: QCM manipulates curvature paths within physical spaces in VR to minimize discomfort. This method dynamically adjusts curvature based on real-time user movement, ensuring natural transitions and maintaining a consistent sense of presence without compromising user experience or spatial awareness.
results_english: The QCM method successfully reduced discomfort in VR redirected walking, outperforming existing techniques. Experimental results demonstrated improved user experience in spatial navigation with smoother transitions and minimal perceived disorientation, evident in increased usability metrics and lower discomfort scores.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、QCM（曲率操作法）を紹介し、それによりVR歩行の不快感を軽減し、体験を向上させます。
problem_japanese: VRにおける歩行は、不自然な動きと空間の制限により、しばしば不快感を引き起こします。この問題は没入体験を妨げ、方向感覚の喪失や動揺を引き起こす可能性があるため、これを最小限に抑える技術が必要です。
method_japanese: QCMは、実際のユーザーの動きに基づきリアルタイムで曲率を調整し、自然な遷移を実現しつつ、VRでの不快感を軽減する手法です。空間認識を損なわずに一貫した没入感を維持します。
results_japanese: QCMは、VR歩行での不快感を効果的に軽減し、既存技術を上回る成果を示しました。実験結果により、移動中のスムーズな遷移と方向感覚の喪失が少ないことが確認され、使いやすさと不快感の評価が改善されました。

title: RedirectedStepper: Exploring Walking-In-Place Locomotion in VR Using a Mini Stepper for Ascents
authors: Le, Quang-Tri and Huynh, Duc-Nham and Tran, Tanh Quang and Fjeld, Morten and Stuerzlinger, Wolfgang and Zank, Markus and Tran, Minh-Triet and Le, Khanh-Duy
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: RedirectedStepper investigates the use of a mini stepper for walking-in-place in VR, focusing on ascent mechanics. It aims to enhance the realism and immersion in virtual environments.
problem_english: Virtual Reality (VR) environments often struggle to provide realistic and immersive locomotion experiences, especially during ascent scenarios. Current VR locomotion techniques frequently lack the physical realism that users crave, potentially hindering user experience.
method_english: The study used a mini stepper to simulate walking-in-place to address ascent locomotion challenges in VR. By integrating the stepper's physical feedback with virtual environments, the research aimed to create a more realistic and immersive walking experience in VR.
results_english: The use of the mini stepper was found to significantly improve realism and perceived immersion during VR locomotion, especially in ascents. Users responded positively, noting improved physical interaction and engagement within the virtual environment.
summary_japanese: RedirectedStepperは、VRでの登坂時の歩行体験を向上するため、ミニステッパー使用を検討しました。
problem_japanese: VR環境では、特に登坂時の歩行が現実的で没入感のある体験を提供することが難しく、ユーザーの体験に影響を及ぼす可能性があります。
method_japanese: ミニステッパーを使用してVRでの歩行を模擬し、VR登坂時の歩行体験の課題を解決することを試みます。
results_japanese: ミニステッパーを使用することで、VR内の歩行体験の現実性や没入感が向上し、ユーザーの反応は好評でした。

title: SeeThroughBody: Mitigating Occlusion through Body Transparency to Enhance Foot-Floor Touch Interaction
authors: Shih, Meng Ting and Chou, Chun-Jui and Mi, Tzu-Wei and Chan, Liwei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: SeeThroughBody enhances foot-floor interaction by making users' bodies transparent. This mitigates occlusion issues, improving user experience and interaction precision.
problem_english: Traditional interfaces often struggle with occlusion issues, where users' bodies block the view of the interaction area, particularly during foot-floor interactions. This obstruction can lead to a decrease in interaction precision and user experience.
method_english: The research introduces a technique that uses body transparency to reduce occlusion. By rendering the user's body as semi-transparent in the virtual environment, users can better see and interact with the floor area, thereby improving visibility and interaction precision.
results_english: The application of body transparency significantly enhanced user experience and interaction precision in foot-floor tasks. It allowed better visibility of the interaction area, reducing mistakes and improving performance metrics in user studies.
summary_japanese: SeeThroughBodyはユーザーの体を透明にし、足と床のインタラクションを向上させ、遮蔽問題を軽減します。
problem_japanese: 従来のインターフェイスは、ユーザーの体がインタラクションエリアを遮ってしまう遮蔽問題に悩まされ、特に足と床のインタラクションで精度や体験が低下します。
method_japanese: この研究では、体を半透明化して遮蔽を減らす手法を導入。ユーザーの体を仮想環境で半透明に表示し、床エリアの視認性とインタラクション精度を向上。
results_japanese: 身体の透明化は、足と床のタスクにおけるユーザー体験と精度を大幅に向上させ、視認性が改善し誤りが減少する結果が得られました。

title: The Walking Meditation Mat: Leveraging Targeted Heat Sensation to Guide Attention Inward
authors: Dublin, Tamar and Zuckerman, Oren
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces a walking meditation mat using targeted heat sensations to enhance inward attention during meditation. It aims to improve focus and mindfulness by providing sensory feedback. The mat is evaluated through user experiments, showcasing promising results in user experience and attention enhancement.
problem_english: Traditional meditation practices can sometimes be challenging due to distractions and difficulty in maintaining focus. This research addresses the need for supportive technologies that can help practitioners stay grounded and attentive during meditation sessions, thereby facilitating deeper mindfulness and concentration.
method_english: The researchers designed a meditation mat incorporating heating elements strategically placed to deliver focused thermal stimulation. The intensity and location of heat can be controlled based on user requirements, guiding attention inward. The effectiveness of the mat was tested through experimental trials with meditation practitioners.
results_english: The walking meditation mat demonstrated a positive impact in enhancing users’ inward attention during meditation. Participants reported improved focus and overall mindfulness, feeling more immersed in their practice. Quantitative and qualitative measures showed increased sense of presence and reduced distraction levels.
summary_japanese: 研究は、瞑想中に内向きの注意を強化するための歩行瞑想マットを紹介。それは感覚フィードバックを提供し、集中力とマインドフルネスを改善することを目指す。
problem_japanese: 従来の瞑想は、集中維持が難しく、注意散漫になることがある。瞑想中に集中力を向上させ、内的な注意をサポートできる技術の必要性がある。
method_japanese: 研究者はヒーティング要素を組み込んだ瞑想マットを設計。ユーザーの要求に基づき熱の強度と位置を制御可能で、注意を内向きに導く。瞑想者との実験でその効果をテスト。
results_japanese: 歩行瞑想マットは、瞑想中の内向きの注意を促進する効果を示し、参加者は集中力と全体的なマインドフルネスの向上を報告した。定量・定性的な評価で注意散漫の軽減が確認された。

title: VibWalk: Mapping Lower-limb Haptic Experiences of Everyday Walking
authors: Ying-Lei, Shih and Tang, Dongxu and Hu, Weiming and Yoon, Sang Ho and Shao, Yitian
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces VibWalk, a system to map haptic experiences of lower-limb sensations during walking. It aims to enhance virtual environments by simulating realistic walking sensations.
problem_english: Current virtual reality experiences often lack realistic lower-limb haptic sensations. This deficiency limits the immersive potential, as existing systems fail to adequately replicate the physical experiences associated with walking in real environments.
method_english: VibWalk leverages advanced haptic feedback technology, mapping real-world walking experiences into tactile sensations for users' lower limbs. The system uses sensor data to recreate these sensations in virtual environments, enhancing realism by simulating various walking surfaces and conditions.
results_english: The study demonstrates that VibWalk significantly enhances users' sense of presence and realism in virtual environments. User evaluations indicate improved satisfaction and a more immersive experience, validating the system's effectiveness in replicating real-world walking sensations.
summary_japanese: VibWalkは歩行時の下肢触覚体験をマッピングするシステムで、仮想環境の現実感を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 現行のVR体験では、歩行に関連するリアルな触覚感覚が欠けており、既存システムは現実の歩行体験を再現できていないため、没入感が限られている。
method_japanese: VibWalkは先進的な触覚フィードバック技術を使用し、現実の歩行体験を下肢の触覚としてユーザーに再現。センサーデータを用い仮想環境に多様な地面や条件の歩行感をシミュレートします。
results_japanese: VibWalkは仮想環境での存在感・リアリズムを大幅に向上。ユーザー評価では満足度と没入感の向上が示され、現実の歩行体験の再現性が確認されました。

title: "Piecing Data Connections Together Like a Puzzle": Effects of Increasing Task Complexity on the Effectiveness of Data Storytelling Enhanced Visualisations
authors: Milesi, Mikaela Elizabeth and Mejia-Domenzain, Paola and Brandl, Laura and Echeverria, Vanessa and Jin, Yueqiao and Gasevic, Dragan and Tsai, Yi-Shan and K\"{a}ser, Tanja and Martinez-Maldonado, Roberto
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the impact of task complexity on the effectiveness of data storytelling enhanced visualizations in facilitating understanding of data connections.
problem_english: Data visualization methods are crucial for interpreting complex information, but as tasks increase in complexity, these visualizations may become less effective. The study aims to understand how data storytelling enhanced visualizations can help maintain effectiveness despite increasing task complexity.
method_english: The research involved experimenting with various levels of task complexity and comparing traditional data visualizations to data storytelling enhanced visualizations to assess their effectiveness in conveying data insights.
results_english: Data storytelling enhanced visualizations improved comprehension in complex tasks compared to traditional methods, suggesting their potential for better conveying intricate data narratives.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、タスクの複雑さがデータストーリーテリング強化ビジュアライゼーションの効果に与える影響を調査。
problem_japanese: データビジュアライゼーションは複雑な情報の解釈に重要であるが、タスクの複雑さが増すと効果が低下する可能性がある。データストーリーテリング強化ビジュアライゼーションが効果を保つ方法を探る。
method_japanese: 実験を通じてタスクの複雑さを変えつつ、伝統的なビジュアライゼーションとストーリーテリング強化ビジュアライゼーションの効果を比較。
results_japanese: 複雑なタスクにおいて、ストーリーテリング強化ビジュアライゼーションが理解度を向上し、複雑なデータの物語を伝える可能性を示す。

title: Augmenting Realistic Charts with Virtual Overlays
authors: Shi, Yao and Li, Boyan and Luo, Yuyu and Chen, Lei and Tang, Nan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study introduces a method to enhance real-world charts using augmented reality overlays, improving information presentation and comprehension.
problem_english: Traditional charting methods often lack interactive features and can be limiting in their capacity to convey complex data effectively. Users may struggle with engaging with static data representations, which can hinder accurate understanding and decision-making.
method_english: The authors propose an augmented reality system that overlays virtual elements onto physical charts. This approach leverages AR technologies to provide interactive and dynamic annotations, allowing users to explore and understand data in a more intuitive and engaging manner.
results_english: The augmented reality overlays significantly enhanced users' ability to interpret and interact with complex data sets. User tests demonstrated increased engagement and a deeper understanding, leading to more informed decisions compared to traditional charting methods.
summary_japanese: 研究は、現実のチャートを拡張現実のオーバーレイで強化し、情報の提示と理解を改善する手法を紹介します。
problem_japanese: 従来のチャート方法はインタラクティブな特徴が不足していることがあり、複雑なデータを効果的に伝える能力に限界があります。ユーザーは静的データの表現に対しての関与が難しい場合があり、理解や意思決定の錯誤を招く可能性があります。
method_japanese: 著者は、物理的なチャートに仮想要素を重ねる拡張現実システムを提案します。この手法はAR技術を利用してインタラクティブで動的な注釈を提供し、より直感的で魅力的な方法でデータを探求・理解できるようにします。
results_japanese: 拡張現実のオーバーレイは、ユーザーの複雑なデータセットを解釈し、操作する能力を大幅に向上させました。ユーザーテストにより、従来のチャート方法に比べ、関与度と理解が増し、より情報に基づいた決定が可能になったことが示されました。

title: Intra, Extra, Read all about it! How Readers Interpret Visualizations with Intra- and Extratextual Information
authors: Burns, Alyxander and Gonzalez-Vazquez, Claudia
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how readers interpret visualizations that include both intra- and extratextual information, revealing cognitive and perceptual interactions during the reading process.
problem_english: Readers often encounter visualizations embedded with intra- and extratextual information, yet how they interpret and integrate these data sources is unclear, complicating effective communication through visual media.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments using eye-tracking to assess how participants engage with and interpret visualizations containing intra- and extratextual information, analyzing gaze patterns and comprehension outcomes.
results_english: The results indicate that readers actively integrate intra- and extratextual information, with gaze patterns revealing varied cognitive strategies based on visualization complexity and content. Better interpretive outcomes were observed among readers using holistic approaches.
summary_japanese: この研究は、読者が内外の情報を含む視覚化をどのように解釈するかを検証し、読み取りプロセス中の認知的相互作用を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 読者が内外の情報を埋め込んだ視覚化に遭遇する際、これらのデータ源をどのように解釈し統合するかは不明であり、効果的な視覚メディアによるコミュニケーションを複雑にします。
method_japanese: 著者は視線追跡実験を行い、参加者が内外の情報を含む視覚化にどのように関与し解釈するかを評価し、視線パターンと理解結果を分析しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、読者が内外の情報を積極的に統合することを示し、視線パターンが視覚化の複雑さに基づいた認知戦略の多様性を明らかにしています。包括的なアプローチを使用する読者ではより良い解釈結果が観察されました。

title: Sequential Visual Cues from Gaze Patterns: Reasoning Assistance for Bar Charts
authors: Schlieder, Antonia and Rummel, Jan and Albers, Peter and Sadlo, Filip
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents a method using gaze patterns as sequential visual cues to assist reasoning with bar charts, proposing novel visualization techniques to improve understanding and interpretation.
problem_english: Understanding and interpreting bar charts can be challenging, especially when complex patterns and data interrelationships are present. Existing methods may not adequately support reasoning and comprehension, particularly for users with diverse expertise levels.
method_english: The authors propose using gaze pattern analysis as sequential visual cues to enhance reasoning in bar chart interpretation. They develop visualization techniques that map gaze behavior onto the chart, providing context-driven insights tailored to user interactions.
results_english: The study demonstrated that employing sequential visual cues derived from gaze patterns improved users' reasoning processes and comprehension of bar chart data, indicating enhanced performance compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: 本研究は視線パターンを用いた逐次視覚キューで棒グラフの推論支援を提案し、新たな可視化技術で理解を向上させる。
problem_japanese: 棒グラフの理解や解釈は、特に複雑なパターンやデータの関係がある場合に困難を伴う。既存の方法は多様な専門性を持つユーザーの推論と理解を十分にサポートしていない可能性がある。
method_japanese: 著者は視線パターン分析を逐次視覚キューとして用い、棒グラフ解釈の推論を強化することを提案。視線行動をグラフにマッピングして、ユーザーのインタラクションに合わせたコンテクスト駆動の洞察を提供する技術を開発。
results_japanese: 視線パターンから派生した逐次視覚キューの利用は、ユーザーの推論過程と棒グラフデータの理解を向上させ、従来法に比べてパフォーマンスが向上することを示した。

title: The Interaction Geography Slicer: Designing Exploratory Spatial Data Visualization Tools for Teachers' Reflective Practice
authors: Shapiro, Ben Rydal and Metts, Elizabeth C and Zhao, Edwin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents the Interaction Geography Slicer, a tool designed to aid teachers in visualizing spatial data for reflective practice, enhancing their understanding of classroom interactions and spatial dynamics.
problem_english: Teachers often struggle with gaining insights into spatial interactions within classrooms, which limits their ability to reflect on and improve teaching practices. Traditional tools may not effectively visualize complex spatial and interactional patterns crucial for reflective practice.
method_english: The study introduces the Interaction Geography Slicer, an exploratory spatial data visualization tool. It allows teachers to interactively explore spatial data, offering insights into classroom dynamics through configurable visualizations, making it easier to identify patterns and reflect on teaching practices.
results_english: The tool provides teachers with visualization functionalities that enable better understanding of spatial interaction patterns in the classroom. Teachers reported increased reflective insights into their teaching practices and new ways to reconfigure classroom setup and teaching strategies.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、教師の反省的実践を支援するための空間データ可視化ツールであるInteraction Geography Slicerを紹介し、教室の相互作用と空間ダイナミクスの理解を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 教師は教室内の空間的相互作用の洞察を得るのに苦労することが多く、その結果、教育実践の反省と改善が制限されます。従来のツールは、反省的実践に重要な空間的および相互的なパターンを効果的に可視化できない場合があります。
method_japanese: 研究は、教室ダイナミクスへの洞察を提供し、教師が視覚化を構成し、教育実践のパターンを特定して反省しやすくする、インタラクティブな空間データを探ることができるInteraction Geography Slicerというツールを紹介します。
results_japanese: このツールにより教師は教室内の空間的相互作用パターンをより理解できるようになりました。教師は、教育実践への反省的洞察が増加し、教室設定や教育戦略を再構成する新しい方法を見いだしました。

title: Toward Filling a Critical Knowledge Gap: Charting the Interactions of Age with Task and Visualization
authors: While, Zack and Sarvghad, Ali
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the interplay between age, task, and visualization to address knowledge gaps in how aging influences interaction with digital visualizations.
problem_english: A critical knowledge gap exists in understanding how age affects interactions with digital visualizations, especially given varying task demands. This hinders the creation of age-inclusive technology and compromises the effectiveness and accessibility of digital content for diverse age groups.
method_english: Using mixed-methods research, the authors conducted experiments to study interactions between age, task type, and visualization complexity. They used quantitative analyses to identify patterns and qualitative approaches to gain deeper insights into user behaviors and preferences across different age groups.
results_english: Older participants showed decreased efficiency in complex tasks with intricate visualizations, while younger users were more adept. Simplified visualizations improved task performance across all age groups, highlighting the need for age-considerate interfaces.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、年齢、タスク、視覚化の相互作用を調査し、高齢化がデジタル視覚化との相互作用に与える影響を解明する。
problem_japanese: 年齢がデジタル視覚化との相互作用に与える影響に関する重要な知識ギャップが存在し、タスクの要求が異なる状況では特に問題がある。このギャップは年齢に配慮した技術の創造を妨げ、多様な年齢層に対するデジタルコンテンツの有効性とアクセシビリティを損なう。
method_japanese: 著者は混合研究法を用いて、年齢、タスクの種類、視覚化の複雑さとの相互作用を研究する実験を行った。定量分析でパターンを特定し、定性的方法で異なる年齢層のユーザー行動と好みの深層への洞察を得た。
results_japanese: 高齢参加者は複雑な視覚化のタスクで効率が低下し、若年層はより巧みに対応できた。簡略化された視覚化はすべての年齢層でタスクパフォーマンスを向上させ、年齢に配慮したインターフェースの必要性を強調した。

title: Visualization Guardrails: Designing Interventions Against Cherry-Picking in Interactive Data Explorers
authors: Lisnic, Maxim and Cutler, Zach and Kogan, Marina and Lex, Alexander
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces intervention techniques called 'visualization guardrails' to prevent cherry-picking in data exploration tools, aiming to enhance data analysis transparency and reliability.
problem_english: Users interacting with data often cherry-pick to support preconceived hypotheses, leading to biased analysis results. This undermines the authenticity and reliability of data-driven decision-making processes, necessitating solutions to mitigate such biases in interactive data exploration tools.
method_english: Visualization guardrails are designed to proactively guide users towards unbiased data analysis by highlighting overlooked data patterns, surfacing counter-evidence, and offering contextual insights, all within the interactive data exploration environment.
results_english: Evaluation of visualization guardrails showed a significant reduction in cherry-picking behavior, improved user understanding of data context, and enhanced decision-making quality by facilitating a more impartial exploration of data landscapes.
summary_japanese: 本論文はデータ探索ツールにおけるチェリーピッキング防止のための介入技術「視覚化ガードレール」を紹介し、データ分析の透明性と信頼性を高めます。
problem_japanese: データを扱うユーザーは、先入観を支持するためにチェリーピッキングを行い、分析結果のバイアスを引き起こします。これにより、データ駆動型の意思決定プロセスの信頼性が損なわれ、インタラクティブデータ探索ツールでのバイアス軽減が必要です。
method_japanese: 視覚化ガードレールは、見過ごされたデータパターンを強調し、反証を浮き彫りにし、文脈的な洞察を提供して、偏りのないデータ分析を促進するよう設計されています。
results_japanese: 視覚化ガードレールの評価により、チェリーピッキング行動が大幅に減少し、データの文脈理解が向上し、より公平なデータ探索を通じて意思決定の質が向上しました。

title: A Systematic Review of Fitts' Law in 3D Extended Reality
authors: Amini, Mohammadreza and Stuerzlinger, Wolfgang and Teather, Robert J and Batmaz, Anil Ufuk
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper reviews Fitts' law's application in 3D extended reality environments, emphasizing its relevance, challenges, and adaptations required for accurate performance predictions.
problem_english: The challenge is to apply Fitts' law, traditionally used in 2D tasks, to 3D extended reality environments where additional dimensions and interaction dynamics make accurate performance prediction complex and uncertain.
method_english: A systematic review of literature on Fitts' law applications in 3D extended reality was conducted, analyzing studies to identify adaptations and challenges in predictive modeling for user interaction speed and accuracy.
results_english: The review reveals frequent experimental variances to accommodate 3D interactions, including additional variables and adjustments in Fitts' parameters, illustrating both successes and areas needing further research and adaptation.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、3D拡張現実環境でのフィッツの法則の適用を見直し、その関連性、課題、正確な性能予測に必要な適応を強調します。
problem_japanese: 伝統的に2Dタスクで使用されるフィッツの法則を3D拡張現実環境に適用することが挑戦です。追加次元と相互作用力学が性能予測を複雑で不確実にします。
method_japanese: フィッツの法則の3D拡張現実内適用に関する文献の体系的レビューを行い、研究を分析してユーザーの操作速度と精度の予測モデル化における適応と課題を特定しました。
results_japanese: レビューは、3D相互作用のための実験的な変更を頻繁に示し、追加の変数とフィッツのパラメータの調整が成功とさらなる研究と適応の必要な領域を示しています。

title: Ad-Blocked Reality: Evaluating User Perceptions of Content Blocking Concepts Using Extended Reality
authors: Katins, Christopher and Strecker, Jannis and Hinrichs, Jan and Knierim, Pascal and Pfleging, Bastian and Kosch, Thomas
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores user perceptions of content blocking technologies in extended reality environments. It examines how such technologies, similar to ad-blockers, impact user experience and privacy concerns in XR settings.
problem_english: The research addresses the growing concern of intrusive advertising and unregulated content display in extended reality environments. Current XR platforms lack effective content control mechanisms, leading to potential privacy issues and poor user experience, necessitating a study on user perceptions and impacts of content blocking in XR.
method_english: The study utilized a mixed-methods approach, combining qualitative interviews and quantitative surveys with XR users. Participants experienced controlled XR environments with and without content blocking. Feedback was collected on their perceptions of usability, user experience, and privacy. This approach helped in understanding the nuances of user interactions with content-blocking features in XR.
results_english: The results indicated a positive reception of content blocking in XR environments. Users reported enhanced privacy and reduced distraction, leading to an improved overall experience. However, the necessity for customizable and user-controlled features was emphasized, highlighting concerns about overly restrictive environments potentially impacting freedom of use and content access.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、拡張現実環境でのコンテンツブロッキング技術に対するユーザーの認識を探る。XRでのユーザー体験やプライバシーへの影響を調査。
problem_japanese: 拡張現実環境における広告やコンテンツ表示の制御不足がプライバシー問題やユーザー体験の低下を引き起こしている。XRにおけるコンテンツブロッキングのユーザー認識とその影響を研究する必要がある。
method_japanese: 質的インタビューと量的調査を組み合わせた手法。参加者はコンテンツブロッキングの有無で制御されたXR環境を体験し、使いやすさ、ユーザー体験、プライバシーに関するフィードバックを収集。
results_japanese: 結果は、XR環境におけるコンテンツブロッキングがプライバシーの向上と注意散漫の削減に役立ち、全体的な体験が改善されると示唆。ユーザー制御のカスタマイズ機能の必要性も強調。

title: AlphaPIG: The Nicest Way to Prolong Interactive Gestures in Extended Reality
authors: Li, Yi and Fischer, Florian and Dwyer, Tim and Ens, Barrett and Crowther, Robert and Kristensson, Per Ola and Tag, Benjamin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: AlphaPIG is a novel framework designed to extend interactive gestures in extended reality (XR) environments, enabling more fluid and natural user interactions.
problem_english: In extended reality environments, users often encounter limitations in the fluidity and naturalness of interactive gestures. Existing systems struggle to effectively prolong gestures, leading to constrained user experiences and reduced satisfaction.
method_english: The AlphaPIG framework utilizes an adaptive gesture recognition system that combines machine learning algorithms with user feedback mechanisms to dynamically extend and enhance gesture interactions in XR platforms.
results_english: AlphaPIG significantly improves the fluidity and naturalness of gestures in XR environments, resulting in enhanced user experiences. Empirical evaluations demonstrate marked improvements in user satisfaction and interaction efficiency.
summary_japanese: AlphaPIGは、拡張現実環境におけるインタラクティブジェスチャーを拡張する新しいフレームワークです。
problem_japanese: 拡張現実環境では、ユーザーはしばしばジェスチャーの流動性や自然さに制限を感じる。既存システムはジェスチャーの延長に苦労し、制約されたユーザー体験を生む。
method_japanese: AlphaPIGフレームワークは、機械学習アルゴリズムとユーザーフィードバックを組み合わせ、ダイナミックにジェスチャーを拡張する。
results_japanese: AlphaPIGは、XR環境でのジェスチャーの流動性と自然性を大幅に向上し、ユーザー体験を向上させる。評価結果は満足度と効率の向上を示す。

title: Educator Perceptions of XRAuthor: An Accessible Tool for Authoring Learning Content with Different Immersion Levels
authors: Shen, Songjia and Tan, Chek Tien and Chen, Hsiang-Ting and Raffe, William L and Leong, Tuck Wah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores educator perceptions of XRAuthor, a tool for creating educational content with varying immersion levels. It analyzes its accessibility and efficacy in different teaching contexts.
problem_english: Educators face challenges in integrating immersive technologies into curricula due to complexity and a lack of accessible tools. This study aims to address these issues by examining XRAuthor’s ability to support diverse immersion levels in educational content creation.
method_english: The researchers conducted a qualitative study involving interviews and workshops with educators. Participants used XRAuthor to create content, and their experiences and feedback were analyzed to assess the tool's usability and effectiveness.
results_english: The findings reveal that educators appreciate XRAuthor’s accessibility and flexibility in creating content with different immersion levels, though some desired more intuitive interfaces. The tool was generally effective in enhancing engagement and learning.
summary_japanese: 教育現場でのXRAuthorの浸透度に関する教育者の認識を調査し、そのアクセスしやすさと効果を分析する研究です。
problem_japanese: 教育者は複雑さとアクセス可能なツールの不足により、没入型技術のカリキュラムへの統合に課題があります。この研究はXRAuthorが異なる没入レベルで教育コンテンツの作成を支援する能力を検証することを目的としています。
method_japanese: 研究者は教育者へのインタビューとワークショップを行い、参加者はXRAuthorを使用してコンテンツを作成しました。彼らの経験とフィードバックを分析し、ツールの使いやすさと効果を評価しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、教育者がXRAuthorのアクセス性と多様な浸透レベルでのコンテンツ作成の柔軟性を評価していることを示しましたが、より直感的なインターフェースを望む声もありました。ツールは概ね関与と学習の向上に効果的でした。

title: On-body Icons: Designing a 3D Interface for Launching Apps in Augmented Reality
authors: Tsimbalistaia, Uliana and Berger, Caroline and Gellersen, Hans and Manakhov, Pavel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the development of a 3D interface called On-body Icons, to facilitate launching applications in augmented reality by interacting with virtual elements positioned on the user's body.
problem_english: Current augmented reality interfaces lack efficient methods for quick app launching, requiring either complex gestures or cumbersome menus. This impedes seamless interaction, and thus, there is a need for more intuitive approaches that integrate smoothly with user movements and perspectives.
method_english: On-body Icons interface was designed using 3D modeling techniques that place virtual icons directly on the user's body, allowing for intuitive, gesture-based interactions. Usability tests and prototype iterations helped refine the system for better ergonomic interaction and seamless integration into the AR environment.
results_english: Results demonstrate increased efficiency and ease of app launching compared to traditional AR methods. Participants noted improved intuitiveness and quicker access, thanks to the body-related positioning and gesture-based control system, enhancing the overall AR experience.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、体上のアイコンを活用し、ユーザーの体に位置する仮想要素を使ってARでアプリを起動する3Dインターフェースを提案する。
problem_japanese: 現在のARインターフェースは効率的なアプリ起動方法に欠けており、複雑なジェスチャーや煩雑なメニューが必要で、円滑な操作が困難である。ユーザーの動きや視点と統合した直感的なアプローチが求められている。
method_japanese: 3Dモデリング技術を用いてユーザーの体に仮想アイコンを配置し、直感的なジェスチャーによる操作を可能にするOn-body Iconsインターフェースを設計した。ユーザビリティテストとプロトタイプの反復でシステムを改善した。
results_japanese: 従来のAR方法と比べてアプリ起動の効率と容易さが向上した。参加者は体関連位置とジェスチャー制御システムによる迅速なアクセスを評価し、AR体験全体が向上したと述べた。

title: Transparent Barriers: Natural Language Access Control Policies for XR-Enhanced Everyday Objects
authors: Taninaka, Kentaro and Jain, Rahul and Shi, Jingyu and Takashio, Kazunori and Ramani, Karthik
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces natural language access control policies for XR-enhanced objects, offering a more intuitive security layer. The approach simplifies interaction with everyday objects by employing language-based rules for user access control.
problem_english: Current XR-enhanced everyday objects lack an intuitive and user-friendly way to manage access control. Traditional methods are often technical and cumbersome for non-expert users, causing potential security vulnerabilities. This paper addresses the need for more accessible and effective methods to manage these controls.
method_english: The authors propose a method using natural language processing for defining and enforcing access control policies. This involves translating user-defined language rules into executable security measures, providing a more intuitive, flexible, and user-friendly approach to access management in XR-enhanced environments.
results_english: The method demonstrates improved usability and flexibility in managing access controls for XR-enhanced objects. It was shown to effectively interpret and implement natural language policies, significantly enhancing user experience by simplifying the management of security measures without technical knowledge demands.
summary_japanese: XR拡張オブジェクトの自然言語によるアクセス制御ポリシーを導入し、安全性を向上させる手法を提案。
problem_japanese: 現在のXR拡張日用品ではアクセス制御が直感的でなく、技術的で扱いにくいため、セキュリティ上の脆弱性が生じる可能性がある。よりアクセスしやすく効果的な管理方法が必要である。
method_japanese: 自然言語処理を用いてアクセス制御ポリシーを定義・実施する方法を提案。ユーザー定義ルールを安全策に変換し、直感的で柔軟な管理を可能にする。
results_japanese: 提案手法は、XRオブジェクトのアクセス管理での使いやすさと柔軟性を向上。自然言語ポリシーの解釈と実施が効果的で、技術知識不要でセキュリティ管理が簡便になることを示した。

title: AiGet: Transforming Everyday Moments into Hidden Knowledge Discovery with AI Assistance on Smart Glasses
authors: Cai, Runze and Janaka, Nuwan and Kim, Hyeongcheol and Chen, Yang and Zhao, Shengdong and Huang, Yun and Hsu, David
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: AiGet revolutionizes knowledge discovery by leveraging AI in smart glasses to identify, process, and present hidden insights from everyday moments.
problem_english: In daily life, valuable insights are often overlooked or lost in mundane activities, limiting the discovery of actionable knowledge. Existing technology fails to assist users in harnessing these insights effectively, particularly in real-time.
method_english: AiGet utilizes AI-powered smart glasses equipped with sensors and processors for real-time data analysis, transforming everyday visual and auditory information into structured insights, enhancing personal and professional decision-making.
results_english: AiGet demonstrated significant improvement in information capture and insight generation compared to traditional methods, enabling users to identify and utilize hidden knowledge, thereby increasing efficiency and decision-making capabilities.
summary_japanese: AiGetはAIを活用したスマートグラスを通じて日常の瞬間から隠れた知識を発見する方法を改革します。
problem_japanese: 日常生活で貴重な洞察が単調な活動の中で見過ごされ、実用的な知識の発見が制限されます。現行技術はこれらの洞察をリアルタイムで効果的に活用する支援が不足しています。
method_japanese: AiGetはAI搭載のスマートグラスを使用し、センサーとプロセッサでリアルタイムにデータを分析し、日常の視覚および聴覚情報を構造化された洞察に変換します。
results_japanese: AiGetは伝統的な方法と比較して情報捕捉と洞察生成を大幅に向上させ、隠れた知識の特定と活用を可能にし、効率と意思決定能力を高めました。

title: CoKnowledge: Supporting Assimilation of Time-synced Collective Knowledge in Online Science Videos
authors: Zhang, Yuanhao and Wang, Yumeng and Wang, Xiyuan and He, Changyang and Huang, Chenliang and Ma, Xiaojuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CoKnowledge aids in assimilating time-synced collective knowledge in online science videos, enhancing learning by providing context-aware annotations linked to video content.
problem_english: Online science videos offer a wealth of information but can be challenging for learners to assimilate due to the lack of context and support for understanding complex concepts. This challenge is exacerbated by the absence of integrated systems to link video content with relevant collective knowledge.
method_english: CoKnowledge integrates time-synced annotations with online videos, offering context-rich insights and facilitating the comprehension of complex scientific content. The system aggregates community-contributed knowledge and contextually presents it to learners as they navigate through the video timeline.
results_english: The implementation of CoKnowledge demonstrated improved comprehension and engagement among learners interacting with online science videos. Users reported enhanced understanding of complex topics, attributed to the time-synced, context-aware annotations provided by the system.
summary_japanese: CoKnowledgeは、オンライン科学動画での時同期集合知の同化を支援し、文脈認識注釈で学習を向上させます。
problem_japanese: オンライン科学動画は豊富な情報を提供しますが、文脈や支援が不足しているため、複雑な概念の理解が難しいという課題があります。動画コンテンツと関連する集合知を結びつけるシステムの欠如が問題を悪化させています。
method_japanese: CoKnowledgeは、オンライン動画に時同期注釈を統合し、文脈豊かな洞察を提供して科学コンテンツの理解を促します。システムはコミュニティの知識を集約し、動画の進行に合わせて学習者に提示します。
results_japanese: CoKnowledgeの実装は、オンライン科学動画を参照する学習者の理解と関与を向上させることが示されました。ユーザーは、システムが提供する文脈意識的な注釈のおかげで複雑な話題の理解が深まったと報告しました。

title: Exploring the Design Space of Real-time LLM Knowledge Support Systems: A Case Study of Jargon Explanations
authors: Liu, Yuhan and Shah, Aadit and Ackerman, Jordan and Saha, Manaswi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates real-time LLM systems for jargon explanation. It explores the design space and offers solutions to enhance understanding in different contexts, focusing on user experience and adaptability.
problem_english: Understanding jargon is challenging for many individuals, particularly in specialized fields. Real-time LLM-based systems need to provide accurate, context-aware explanations to enhance user understanding without disrupting their ongoing tasks or learning process.
