It enables researchers to gain a deeper understanding of human-computer interactions, facilitating more informed interpretations and decisions in research.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、人間とコンピュータの対話研究において、探索的視覚分析を用いてトランスクリプトを解析する手法を検討した。
problem_japanese: 人間とコンピュータの対話研究において、大量のトランスクリプトデータの分析は重要な課題である。従来の手法では複雑な対話パターンを効率的に捉えきれず、意味のある洞察を引き出す能力が制限されている。
method_japanese: 視覚分析に基づくインタラクティブでカスタマイズ可能な新しい分析手法を提案し、トランスクリプトデータの複雑な対話パターンを詳細に明らかにすることを目的としている。
results_japanese: 提案手法は、従来法で見逃されがちな対話パターンを明確にし、研究者が人間-コンピュータ間の相互作用を深く理解できるようになり、研究における解釈と決断に役立つ。

title: GistVis: Automatic Generation of Word-scale Visualizations from Data-rich Documents
authors: Zou, Ruishi and Tang, Yinqi and Chen, Jingzhu and Lu, Siyu and Lu, Yan and Yang, Yingfan and Ye, Chen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: GistVis automatically generates succinct word-scale visualizations from data-rich documents, enhancing user comprehension and interaction by embedding relevant visual information directly within the text, aiding quicker understanding.
problem_english: Navigating and comprehending data-rich documents is challenging, as users often face difficulty in extracting meaningful insights due to the lack of integration of relevant visual information with the text, leading to inefficiencies in understanding.
method_english: GistVis employs an algorithmic approach to identify key data points and their relationships within documents and automatically generates corresponding compact visualizations to be embedded directly within the text, facilitating better information comprehension.
results_english: The implementation of GistVis demonstrated improved comprehension and user interaction with data-rich content by embedding visualizations directly in text, thereby aiding quicker understanding and more efficient navigation of complex documents.
summary_japanese: GistVisはデータ豊富な文書から自動で要約的なビジュアライゼーションを生成し、理解を助ける。
problem_japanese: データ豊富な文書の理解は困難であり、関連する視覚情報がテキストと統合されていないため、ユーザーは効率的な洞察抽出に苦労する。
method_japanese: GistVisは文書内の重要なデータポイントの関係を特定し、それに基づくコンパクトなビジュアライゼーションを自動生成し、テキスト内に埋め込む手法を採用。
results_japanese: GistVisの導入により、テキスト内にビジュアライゼーションを埋め込むことで、データ理解が向上し、文書の複雑な内容へのナビゲーションが効率化した。

title: The Social Construction of Visualizations: Practitioner Challenges and Experiences of Visualizing Race and Gender
authors: Dhawka, Priya and Dasgupta, Sayamindu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the challenges faced by practitioners when visualizing race and gender. It highlights the social construction of these visualizations and how practitioners navigate these complexities in their work.
problem_english: The paper identifies the issue of visualizing race and gender as inherently sensitive and complex due to their social construction. It addresses the challenges practitioners face in accurately and ethically representing these categories while avoiding stereotypes, biases, and misrepresentations.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative investigations with practitioners involved in visualizing race and gender. They used interviews and case studies to gather in-depth insights into the challenges and experiences faced by the participants when working with these socially constructed categories.
results_english: The study reveals multiple challenges including balancing accuracy with ethical representation, handling data sensitivity, and confronting inherent biases in data sources. The findings underscore the necessity for critical engagement and reflexivity in the visualization process.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、人種とジェンダーの視覚化における課題と社会的構築について探究し、実務者の経験を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 本稿は、人種とジェンダーを視覚化する際の敏感で複雑な問題に取り組みます。これらの社会的に構築されたカテゴリを正確かつ倫理的に表現する際、ステレオタイプや偏見、誤表現を避けることが課題です。
method_japanese: 人種とジェンダーを視覚化する実務者との質的調査を実施。インタビューやケーススタディを通じて、参加者が直面する困難や経験を深く掘り下げて明らかにしました。
results_japanese: 研究は、正確さと倫理的表現のバランスやデータ感度の取り扱い、データソースの内在的バイアスの対処など、多くの課題を明らかにしました。視覚化過程における批判的な関与と内省の必要性を強調します。

title: Uncovering How Scatterplot Features Skew Visual Class Separation
authors: Bae, S. Sandra and Fujiwara, Takanori and Tseng, Chin and Szafir, Danielle Albers
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates how scatterplot features influence visual perception of class separation, highlighting biases that can affect interpretation and decision-making.
problem_english: Scatterplots are commonly used for visualizing data distributions and class separation. However, users may perceive class separation inaccurately due to scatterplot features, leading to biased interpretations and potentially flawed decisions. Understanding these influences is crucial for enhancing data visualization reliability.
method_english: The authors employ a series of controlled user studies to assess how various scatterplot features (e.g., point size, opacity) affect users’ perception of class separation. They analyze participants’ accuracy in distinguishing class boundaries and develop guidelines to mitigate perceptual biases.
results_english: The study reveals that certain scatterplot features significantly distort users' perception of class separation. Features like opacity and point overlap can lead to misinterpretation of data, suggesting a need for visualization guidelines to reduce perceptual bias and improve data interpretation accuracy.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、散布図の特徴がクラス分離の視覚認識に与える影響を調査し、解釈や意思決定に影響を及ぼす偏りを明らかにします。
problem_japanese: 散布図はデータ分布やクラス分離の視覚化に用いられる。しかし、散布図の特徴によりユーザーがクラス分離を誤認識し、解釈の偏りや誤った決定を招く可能性がある。この影響を理解することは、データ視覚化の信頼性向上に不可欠です。
method_japanese: 著者は、散布図の特徴（例：点のサイズや不透明度）がユーザーのクラス分離の認識に与える影響を評価するために制御されたユーザー調査を行い、偏りを軽減するためのガイドラインを開発します。
results_japanese: 研究により、特定の散布図の特徴がクラス分離の認識を著しく歪めることが判明しました。不透明度や点の重なりはデータの誤解を招く可能性があり、偏りを減らし、データ解釈の正確性を向上させる視覚化ガイドラインが必要です。

title: ZuantuSet: A Collection of Historical Chinese Visualizations and Illustrations
authors: Mei, Xiyao and Zhang, Yu and Yang, Chaofan and Shi, Rui and Yuan, Xiaoru
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ZuantuSet is a curated collection of historical Chinese visualizations and illustrations, providing a comprehensive resource for researchers and enthusiasts exploring traditional Chinese information representation.
problem_english: The study identifies a lack of accessible resources for researchers and enthusiasts interested in historical Chinese visualizations. This gap hinders deeper exploration and understanding of traditional Chinese methods of information representation used in various disciplines.
method_english: The authors have compiled and curated a collection of historical Chinese visualizations and illustrations. They have categorized and annotated these artifacts, making them accessible for research and study, facilitating a deeper understanding of traditional Chinese information representation.
results_english: ZuantuSet provides an organized repository of historical visual artifacts, enhancing accessibility for scholars and enthusiasts. It aids in studying traditional Chinese visualization techniques, allowing further research and insights into historical methods of information representation and their implications.
summary_japanese: ZuantuSetは歴史的な中国の視覚資料のコレクションで、研究者や愛好家に伝統的な情報表現の探索資源を提供します。
problem_japanese: 研究者や愛好家にとって歴史的な中国の視覚資料のアクセスが限られており、伝統的な中国の情報表現方法の理解が難しい状況があります。
method_japanese: 歴史的な中国の視覚資料を収集し、分類・注釈を付けて提供することで、研究や学びの場でのアクセスを容易にします。
results_japanese: ZuantuSetは歴史的視覚作品を整理し、学者や愛好家のアクセスを容易にし、伝統的な中国の視覚化技術の研究を支援します。

title: Designing Physical Interactions with Triboelectric Material Sensing
authors: Liu, Xin and Lee, Chengkuo and Zheng, Clement and Yen, Ching Chiuan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores designing physical interactions using triboelectric material sensing, addressing key challenges and demonstrating potential applications.
problem_english: The challenge is to effectively leverage triboelectric material sensing for developing innovative physical interactions, as current applications are often limited and not fully explored in interactive situations.
method_english: The authors propose a framework using triboelectric materials to create novel sensing systems, integrating advanced materials with interactive computing to enable new forms of interaction and user engagement.
results_english: The study successfully demonstrates prototypes that utilize triboelectric materials for various interactive applications, highlighting the versatility and efficiency of these materials in designing novel physical interactions.
summary_japanese: 本論文はトライボ電気材料を用いた物理的インタラクション設計を探求し、課題と応用の可能性を示す。
problem_japanese: 課題は、現行の応用が限定的でインタラクティブな状況で十分に活用されていないトライボ電気材料感知を効果的に活用し、革新的な物理的インタラクションを開発することである。
method_japanese: 著者は、先進材料とインタラクティブコンピューティングを統合し、新たなインタラクションとユーザーエンゲージメントを可能にするトライボ電気材料による新しい感知システムの枠組みを提案している。
results_japanese: 研究は、トライボ電気材料を用いたインタラクティブ応用例のプラットフォームを成功裏に示し、これらの材料が新しい物理的インタラクションの設計において多様性と効率性を持つことを強調した。

title: From Operation to Cognition: Automatic Modeling Cognitive Dependencies from User Demonstrations for GUI Task Automation
authors: Yin, Yiwen and Mei, Yu and Yu, Chun and Li, Toby Jia-Jun and Jadoon, Aamir Khan and Cheng, Sixiang and Shi, Weinan and Chen, Mohan and Shi, Yuanchun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper proposes a method to automatically model cognitive dependencies from user demonstrations for GUI task automation, aiming to enhance efficiency and accuracy in task execution.
problem_english: Existing GUI task automation techniques often lack the ability to understand complex cognitive dependencies involved in user tasks, leading to inefficiencies and inaccuracies. This paper addresses the challenge of enabling systems to better comprehend and mimic human cognitive processes during task automation.
method_english: The approach involves using machine learning algorithms to capture and model cognitive dependencies from user demonstrations. This method allows for the automation system to infer and replicate the cognitive steps a user takes, thereby improving task execution precision and effectiveness.
results_english: The proposed method showed significant improvements in capturing and reproducing user cognitive dependencies in task automation, leading to enhanced system performance in terms of accuracy and efficiency during experimental evaluations.
summary_japanese: ユーザーデモンストレーションから認知依存関係を自動でモデル化し、GUIタスクの自動化を向上させる手法を提案。
problem_japanese: 従来のGUIタスク自動化技術は、ユーザータスクに含まれる複雑な認知依存関係を理解する能力に欠け、効率性と正確性に問題がある。本研究はこの課題に取り組む。
method_japanese: 機械学習アルゴリズムを利用して、ユーザーデモンストレーションから認知依存関係を捉えモデル化し、ユーザーの認知ステップを模倣することで正確性を向上。
results_japanese: 提案手法はタスク自動化における認知依存関係の把握と再現を改善し、精度と効率性の両面で優れた性能を実験で示した。

title: FusionProtor: A Mixed-Prototype Tool for Component-level Physical-to-Virtual 3D Transition and Simulation
authors: Zhang, Hongbo and Chen, Pei and Xie, Xuelong and Jiang, Zhaoqu and Wu, Yifei and Li, Zejian and Chen, Xiaoyu and Sun, Lingyun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: FusionProtor introduces a tool for transitioning physical components to virtual 3D models and simulating their interactions, improving design and testing processes.
problem_english: The challenge in component-level engineering design lies in the difficulty of transitioning physical structures into virtual prototypes for testing, leading to inefficiencies in design iteration and evaluation processes.
method_english: FusionProtor utilizes mixed-prototype technology combining physical scanning with virtual modeling techniques. This enables seamless transition and interaction simulation between physical components and their virtual counterparts in design workflows.
results_english: FusionProtor significantly enhances design efficiency by reducing the time required for virtual prototype creation and testing, facilitating quicker iteration cycles and allowing more accurate simulations of component interactions.
summary_japanese: FusionProtorは、物理部品を仮想3Dモデルに移行しシミュレーションするツールを提供し、設計とテストプロセスを改善します。
problem_japanese: 部品レベルの工学設計では、物理構造を仮想試作品に変換してテストすることが困難であり、設計の反復と評価プロセスに非効率性が生じます。
method_japanese: FusionProtorは、物理スキャンと仮想モデリング技術を組み合わせた混合プロトタイプ技術を利用し、物理部品とその仮想対応物間の設計ワークフロー内でのシームレスな移行と相互作用シミュレーションを可能にします。
results_japanese: FusionProtorは仮想試作品作成とテストに必要な時間を大幅に短縮し、設計の反復サイクルを速め、部品間の相互作用をより正確にシミュレーションできるようにします。

title: Generative and Malleable User Interfaces with Generative and Evolving Task-Driven Data Model
authors: Cao, Yining and Jiang, Peiling and Xia, Haijun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents generative and malleable user interfaces, powered by task-driven data models that evolve over time to better fit user needs.
problem_english: Traditional user interfaces lack flexibility and adaptability, often requiring manual customization to fit specific tasks. This rigidity limits user productivity and hinders the efficient completion of evolving tasks.
method_english: The authors propose a generative system that automatically adjusts user interfaces based on a dynamic data model. This model evolves by learning from user interactions, ensuring that interfaces remain relevant and useful as tasks change.
results_english: The system was tested and showed significant improvements in adaptability and efficiency, allowing users to perform tasks with less friction. User satisfaction and productivity increased alongside interface usability.
summary_japanese: タスク駆動のデータモデルが進化する生成的で柔軟なユーザーインターフェースを提案。
problem_japanese: 従来のユーザーインターフェースは柔軟性が欠如しており、特定のタスクに合わせるために手動でカスタマイズが必要となり、ユーザの生産性が制限される。
method_japanese: 著者は、ユーザーのインタラクションから学び進化する動的データモデルに基づき、ユーザーインターフェースを自動的に調整する生成システムを提案。
results_japanese: システムは適応力と効率性を顕著に向上させ、ユーザは摩擦なくタスクを実行できた。ユーザ満足度と生産性が向上。

title: Interaction Substrates: Combining Power and Simplicity in Interactive Systems
authors: Mackay, Wendy E. and Beaudouin-Lafon, Michel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces Interaction Substrates, a framework for designing interactive systems that enhance both power and simplicity. It provides a unified approach that combines user interface components seamlessly.
problem_english: Interactive systems often struggle to balance power and simplicity, leading to either overly complex interfaces or limited functionalities. This paper addresses this issue by proposing a framework that integrates both aspects cohesively.
method_english: The authors propose Interaction Substrates, a novel framework that merges powerful functionalities with simple interfaces. It emphasizes modular design and seamless integration of components to enhance user experience.
results_english: Interaction Substrates successfully demonstrate improved user satisfaction and reduced complexity in interactive systems. The framework has shown to enhance both usability and functionality across various applications.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、相互作用基盤を提案し、強力さとシンプルさを兼ね備えた対話型システム設計のフレームワークを紹介しています。
problem_japanese: 対話型システムは強力さとシンプルさのバランスが難しく、複雑すぎるインターフェースか制限された機能のどちらかに偏りがちです。この問題に統合的な解決策を提案します。
method_japanese: 著者は、相互作用基盤という新しいフレームワークを提案し、強力な機能とシンプルなインターフェースを統合します。モジュラー設計とコンポーネントのシームレスな統合を強調します。
results_japanese: 相互作用基盤は、対話型システムのユーザー満足度向上と複雑性の軽減に成功しました。フレームワークは、様々なアプリケーションでの使いやすさと機能性を向上させました。

title: Malleable Overview-Detail Interfaces
authors: Min, Bryan and Chen, Allen and Cao, Yining and Xia, Haijun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces "Malleable Overview-Detail Interfaces" that enhance user interaction by enabling flexible adjustment of overview and detail views in digital displays, aiming for improved usability.
problem_english: Users often face the challenge of balancing between overview and detail when navigating complex information spaces. Traditional interfaces are typically rigid, not allowing for smooth transitions or adjustments, which can hinder user efficiency and experience.
method_english: The authors propose a new interface design that allows users to dynamically adjust the scale and level of detail presented on a screen. This involves implementing controls that let users flexibly shift between overview and detail, offering a more intuitive interaction.
results_english: User testing revealed that malleable interfaces lead to better task performance and user satisfaction compared to traditional fixed-interface designs. The study indicated a significant improvement in efficiency and ease of use for participants.
summary_japanese: 本論文では「可変オーバービュー・ディテールインタフェース」を提案し、ユーザ操作性を向上させる構成を可能にすると紹介しています。
problem_japanese: ユーザは複雑な情報空間で概要と詳細のバランスを取る難しさに直面します。従来のインターフェースは通常固定的で、スムーズな移行や調整を許さず、効率性や体験を妨げます。
method_japanese: ユーザが画面に表示されるスケールと詳細レベルを動的に調整できるインターフェース設計を提案。オーバービューと詳細表現を柔軟に切り替える直感的な操作を実現します。
results_japanese: ユーザテストでは、可変インターフェースが従来の固定インターフェースに比べてタスクパフォーマンスとユーザ満足度を向上させることが示され、効率性と使いやすさの向上が確認されました。

title: XR-penter: Material-Aware and In Situ Design of Scrap Wood Assemblies
authors: Iyer, Ramya and Dogan, Mustafa Doga and Larsson, Maria and Igarashi, Takeo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: XR-penter introduces a novel XR-based system for designing scrap wood assemblies, enabling users to create structures that adapt to material constraints in real time.
problem_english: Designing with scrap wood is challenging due to irregular shapes and sizes, requiring improvisation and real-time adaptation. Traditional tools lack the integration necessary to consider material constraints during the design process, limiting creativity and efficiency in assembling structures.
method_english: The XR-penter system combines augmented reality with a material-aware design tool that allows users to visualize and adjust scrap wood assemblies in situ. It incorporates real-time feedback on material compatibility, stability, and aesthetics to assist users throughout the design process.
results_english: The XR-penter system improves user satisfaction and design efficiency by facilitating real-time adjustments and enhancing the overall creative process. Users reported a significant increase in confidence and ability to construct coherent assemblies using scrap wood materials.
summary_japanese: XR-penterはXR技術を活用し、スクラップ木材を用いたデザインを容易にし、素材の制約に適応した構造を実現するシステムです。
problem_japanese: スクラップ木材を用いたデザインは、不規則な形状とサイズのため即興とリアルタイム適応が必要です。従来のツールは設計中に材料の制約を考慮する統合が不足しており、創造性や効率が制限されます。
method_japanese: XR-penterシステムは拡張現実と素材認識設計ツールを統合し、ユーザーが現場でスクラップ木材の構造を視覚化し調整できるようにします。素材の適合性、安定性、美観に対するリアルタイムフィードバックを提供します。
results_japanese: XR-penterシステムは、リアルタイム調整を可能にすることでユーザーの満足度と設計効率を向上させ、スクラップ木材を用いた組み立てにおける自信と能力を大幅に高めました。

title: Does Care Lead to Bonds? Exploring the Relationship Between Human Caregiving for Robots and Human-Robot Bonding
authors: Xu, Jiaxin and Zhang, Chao and Cuijpers, Raymond H. and IJsselsteijn, Wijnand A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates whether human caregiving towards robots fosters a bonding relationship between humans and robots using experimental methods.
problem_english: As robots become increasingly prevalent in our lives, understanding the dynamics between human care for robots and potential emotional bonding is essential. Existing research indicates that caregiving can strengthen bonds between humans; however, whether similar effects occur with robots remains largely unexplored.
method_english: This study employs experimental scenarios in which human participants engage in caregiving tasks for robots. The research evaluates the participants' emotional responses and perceived relational bonding towards the robots through structured questionnaires and observational analysis.
results_english: The findings reveal a significant correlation between caregiving actions and increased emotional bonding from humans towards robots. Participants reported higher levels of emotional attachment and perceived connection with robots after engaging in care-related tasks, suggesting caregiving enhances human-robot bonding.
summary_japanese: 人がロボットに世話をすることと人ロボット間の絆が形成されるかを実験的に調査。
problem_japanese: ロボットが生活の中で増加する中で、ロボットへの人間のケアと感情的な絆が形成されるかを理解することが重要。人間同士の絆はケアによって強化されるが、ロボットとの関係にも同様の効果があるかは不明。
method_japanese: 人がロボットにケアを行う実験状況を作り、参加者の感情的反応と関係の形成をアンケートと観察で評価。
results_japanese: 結果は、ケア行動がロボットへの感情的な絆の増加に関連していると示した。参加者は、ケア後にロボットへの愛着やつながりをより強く感じた。

title: Leveling Up Together: Fostering Positive Growth and Safe Online Spaces for Teen Roblox Developers
authors: Choi, Yubin and Choi, Jeanne and Seering, Joseph
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how teen Roblox developers can grow positively and create safe online spaces. It examines existing challenges and provides insights for enhancing support and fostering community growth.
problem_english: Teen Roblox developers face challenges in balancing skill development and maintaining safe online spaces. These challenges include coping with negative interactions and ensuring personal growth while navigating a complex digital landscape. The study seeks to address these by understanding the dynamics of online developer communities and the factors affecting positive development.
method_english: The researchers conducted qualitative interviews and surveys with teen Roblox developers to gather insights into their experiences and challenges. They analyzed the data to identify common themes and factors influencing positive growth and safety perceptions. The study used thematic analysis to understand community dynamics and offer actionable recommendations for improvement.
results_english: The findings highlight key areas for improvement in facilitating positive growth, including community support, mentorship, and safety measures. The study identified factors that promote safe spaces and developer confidence, suggesting enhancements to existing support systems. These recommendations aim to help teen developers thrive in their online communities.
summary_japanese: 本研究では、ティーンRoblox開発者の成長と安全なオンライン空間の創造を探ります。既存の課題を分析し、支援強化とコミュニティ成長を促進する洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: ティーンのRoblox開発者は、スキル成長と安全なオンライン空間の維持のバランスで課題に直面します。否定的なインタラクションへの対処や、複雑なデジタル環境での個人的成長が求められます。この研究は、オンライン開発者コミュニティの動態と、ポジティブな発展を妨げる要因を理解することを目指しています。
method_japanese: 研究者はティーンのRoblox開発者に対して定性インタビューと調査を実施し、その経験と課題を収集しました。データを分析し、ポジティブな成長と安全性認識に影響を及ぼす共通テーマと要因を特定しました。テーマ分析を用いてコミュニティの動態を理解し、改善への具体的な推奨を提供します。
results_japanese: 研究結果は成長促進のための改善分野を明らかにし、コミュニティサポート、メンターシップ、安全対策が含まれます。開発者の自信と安全空間を促進する要因を特定し、既存のサポートシステムの改善を提案すします。これらの推奨は、ティーン開発者がオンラインコミュニティで成功するのを支援します。

title: Peerspective: A Study on Reciprocal Tracking for Self-awareness and Relational Insight
authors: Lee, Kwangyoung and Jung, Yeohyun and Jung, Gyuwon and Lu, Xi and Hong, Hwajung
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores reciprocal tracking systems to enhance self-awareness and relational insight, evaluating their efficacy through experimental design and usability testing.
problem_english: The challenge addressed by this study is the lack of effective systems for enhancing self-awareness and improving relational insights among individuals, particularly in digital environments where interactions are often impersonal, leaving individuals with little feedback on their own behaviors and relationships.
method_english: Researchers developed a reciprocal tracking system, designed experiments, and conducted usability tests to evaluate how these systems influence self-awareness and relational understanding. Participants interacted with the system, and their experiences were analyzed through quantitative and qualitative metrics.
results_english: The study found that reciprocal tracking systems significantly improve self-awareness and relational insight among users. Participants reported increased understanding of personal behavior patterns and relationships, and the usability tests showed high satisfaction and engagement with the system.
summary_japanese: 本研究は自己認識と関係性洞察を向上させる相互追跡システムを探求し、その効果を実験とユーザビリティテストで評価した。
problem_japanese: 本研究が取り組む課題は、個人の自己認識を高め、デジタル環境での関係性の洞察を改善する効果的なシステムが不足していることである。特に、デジタルなやりとりが多く、個人の行動や関係についてのフィードバックが不足していることが指摘されている。
method_japanese: 研究者は相互追跡システムを開発し、実験を設計し、ユーザビリティテストを実施して、これらのシステムが自己認識と関係理解に与える影響を評価した。参加者はシステムと対話し、その経験が定量的および定性的な指標を通じて分析された。
results_japanese: 相互追跡システムはユーザーの自己認識と関係洞察を大幅に向上させることが確認された。参加者は個人の行動パターンと関係の理解が深まったと報告し、ユーザビリティテストでは高い満足度とシステムへの関与が示された。

title: Realism Drives Interpersonal Reciprocity but Yields to AI-Assisted Egocentrism in a Coordination Experiment
authors: Shirado, Hirokazu and Shimizu, Kye and Christakis, Nicholas A and Kasahara, Shunichi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines the impact of realism and AI assistance on communication and decision-making in coordination tasks, revealing that AI-assisted egocentrism can disrupt interpersonal reciprocity.
problem_english: Researchers investigated how realism affects interpersonal reciprocity in communication and decision-making contexts. They aimed to determine whether AI assistance introduces egocentrism, disrupting the reciprocal nature of interpersonal interactions in coordination tasks. The study sought to explore the balance between human realism driving effective coordination and potential negative impacts introduced by AI systems.
method_english: The authors conducted a coordination experiment involving participants in communication and decision-making tasks. The study compared scenarios with varying levels of realism and introduced AI assistance to observe its impact. Metrics were established to assess changes in behavior, focusing on interpersonal reciprocity and egocentrism induced by AI. The approach allowed for quantitative analysis of behavioral shifts.
results_english: Findings revealed that while realism facilitated interpersonal reciprocity, the introduction of AI-assisted decision-making led to noticeable egocentrism. Participants using AI assistance exhibited reduced reciprocal tendencies, prioritizing self-interest. This shift underscored the potential for AI technologies to alter fundamental interpersonal interaction dynamics, highlighting the importance of designing AI systems that foster collaboration.
summary_japanese: リアリズムとAI支援が協調タスクにおける意思決定に及ぼす影響を調査し、AI支援による自己中心性が対人的互恵性を阻害することを示しました。
problem_japanese: 研究は、リアリズムが対人的互恵性に与える影響を調査し、AI支援が自己中心性を導入するか、協調タスクにおける対人相互作用を乱すかを究明しました。人間のリアリズムとAIシステムの潜在的な負の影響のバランスを探求します。
method_japanese: 参加者を対象にした協調実験で、異なるリアリズムレベルとAI支援によるシナリオを比較した。行動の変化を分析するために、対人的互恵性とAIに起因する自己中心性に注目した指標を設定した。
results_japanese: リアリズムは対人的互恵性を促進する一方、AI支援による意思決定は自己中心性を増加させました。AI使用者は相互的傾向が低下し、自己利益を優先しました。これにより、AIが対人交流の基本を変化させ得ることが示されました。

title: The Design Space for Online Restorative Justice Tools: A Case Study with ApoloBot
authors: Doan, Bich Ngoc (Rubi) and Seering, Joseph
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a case study of ApoloBot, an online tool for facilitating restorative justice. The authors explore design spaces specific to online environments, offering insights into potential efficacy and limitations in conflict resolution.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of applying restorative justice principles in online environments, where traditional face-to-face communication is not possible. The complexity arises from establishing trust, accountability, and a space for constructive dialogue digitally, while maintaining fairness and impartiality.
method_english: A case study approach was used to analyze ApoloBot, an online restorative justice tool. The authors examined user interactions and design elements to understand how these components can support restoring dialogue and understanding in online conflict situations, offering a framework for evaluating effectiveness.
results_english: The study found that specific design features, such as anonymity and structured dialogue flows, were crucial in facilitating effective conflict resolution online. These elements helped participants feel safe and encouraged them to engage more openly in restorative processes, highlighting the potential of digital platforms in justice practices.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、オンライン回復的正義ツールApoloBotのケーススタディを通じてデザインスペースを検討し、オンライン環境における可能性と限界を提示します。
problem_japanese: オンライン環境での回復的正義の適用は課題であり、対面ではなくデジタル空間で信頼、責任、建設的対話の場を確立する複雑さがある。この中で、公平性と中立性を維持する必要があります。
method_japanese: ケーススタディアプローチを採用し、オンライン回復的正義ツールであるApoloBotを分析しました。ユーザーのインタラクションとデザイン要素を検証し、オンライン対立解決のためのフレームワークを提供しました。
results_japanese: 特定のデザイン機能、例えば匿名性や構造化された対話フローが、オンラインでの効果的な紛争解決に重要であることが判明しました。これにより参加者が安心感を持ち、よりオープンに取り組むことが促進されました。

title: The Gulf of Interpretation: From Chart to Message and Back Again
authors: Knoll, Christian and M\"{o}ller, Torsten and Gregory, Kathleen and Koesten, Laura
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the 'Gulf of Interpretation' in data visualization, focusing on how users interpret charts and messages. It proposes strategies to bridge gaps and improve comprehension.
problem_english: Data visualizations often suffer from a 'Gulf of Interpretation,' where there is a disconnect between the information conveyed by charts and the user's understanding. This gap can lead to misinterpretation and inefficiency in communication. Addressing this gulf is crucial for effective data presentation.
method_english: The authors employ a combination of user studies and theoretical analysis to investigate how users perceive and interpret data visualizations. They propose strategies, including interactive elements and tailored user training, to help close the interpretation gap.
results_english: The study found that providing interactive elements and user-specific training significantly reduces the 'Gulf of Interpretation,' leading to better user comprehension and more accurate data interpretation, thus enhancing overall communication efficiency.
summary_japanese: 本稿はデータ可視化の「解釈のギャップ」に注目し、ユーザーの理解を向上させるための戦略を提示します。
problem_japanese: データ可視化では、チャートが伝える情報とユーザーの理解にギャップが生じることが多く、誤解を招く恐れがあります。この「解釈のギャップ」を埋めることが効果的なコミュニケーションには重要です。
method_japanese: ユーザー研究と理論分析を組み合わせ、データ可視化の解釈を調査。インタラクティブ要素やユーザー特化の訓練を提案し、解釈のギャップを縮小する手法を探ります。
results_japanese: インタラクティブ要素とユーザー特化訓練の導入が「解釈のギャップ」を縮小し、ユーザーの理解を向上させ、正確なデータ解釈が可能となり、コミュニケーション効率が向上しました。

title: Virtual Solidarity, Concrete Care: A Review of Mutual Aid Online
authors: Sackitey, Darley and Sachdev, Hiya Ashish and Parker, Andrea G
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper reviews online mutual aid initiatives, exploring how these digital platforms facilitate community support, solidarity, and care during crises such as pandemics or economic upheavals.
problem_english: While mutual aid has long existed in physical communities, its online implementation raises challenges. These include maintaining authenticity, addressing digital divide issues, and ensuring equitable access and engagement while fostering genuine community connection and trust.
method_english: The authors utilize a mixed-methods approach combining qualitative analysis of case studies with interviews. They assess online mutual aid platforms to understand their effectiveness, challenges, and roles in community building and support during times of crisis.
results_english: Findings indicate that online mutual aid platforms can effectively foster community engagement and support. However, they must address challenges such as digital literacy disparities and ensuring equitable participation to enhance community reliance and genuine solidarity.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、オンライン相互援助の活動を評価し、危機的状況でのコミュニティ支援と連帯を探求する。
problem_japanese: 物理的なコミュニティでの相互援助は長年存在してきたが、オンラインでの実施には課題がある。これには、真正性の維持、デジタル格差問題、公平なアクセスと関与の保証、コミュニティの繋がりと信頼育成が含まれる。
method_japanese: 著者はケーススタディの質的分析とインタビューを組み合わせた混合手法を用いる。危機でのコミュニティ形成と支援を理解するため、オンライン相互援助プラットフォームを評価する。
results_japanese: 分析により、オンライン相互援助プラットフォームがコミュニティの関与と支援を促進することが判明。しかし、デジタルリテラシーの格差や公平な参加の保証が必要で、コミュニティ依存と真の連帯を強化する必要がある。

title: "But I Won't Say That It Was Bad Seeing a Real Vagina": Understanding Perspectives toward Learning Sensitive-Critical Health Topic
authors: Moin, Sara and Belani, Manshul and Singh, Pragya and Phutela, Nishtha and Singh, Pushpendra
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates perspectives on teaching sensitive health topics, especially focusing on the exposure to real-life anatomical illustrations in educational settings.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of effectively teaching sensitive health topics, such as reproductive health, where exposure to real anatomical images can provoke uncomfortable reactions and cultural sensitivities in educational contexts.
method_english: The study employed qualitative methods, including interviews and surveys with students and educators, to gather insights on their experiences and perceptions about learning and teaching sensitive health topics, particularly regarding the use of real anatomical visuals.
results_english: The findings indicate that while some participants experienced discomfort, real anatomical illustrations were ultimately found to enhance understanding and awareness, suggesting the importance of addressing cultural sensitivities and educational approaches effectively.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、敏感な健康テーマの教育における観点を探り、特に実際の解剖図の露出に焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、実際の解剖図の露出が不快な反応や文化的感受性を引き起こす可能性がある教育環境において、生殖健康などの敏感な健康テーマを効果的に教える課題に取り組んでいます。
method_japanese: 本研究は、質的手法を用い、学生や教育者へのインタビューとアンケートを通じて、特に実際の解剖図の使用に関する敏感な健康テーマの学習・教育体験に関する洞察を収集しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、参加者の一部が不快感を経験しつつも、実際の解剖図が理解と認識を向上させるとされ、文化的感受性と教育手法を効果的に扱う重要性を示唆しています。

title: ASHABot: An LLM-Powered Chatbot to Support the Informational Needs of Community Health Workers
authors: Ramjee, Pragnya and Chhokar, Mehak and Sachdeva, Bhuvan and Meena, Mahendra and Abdullah, Hamid and Vashistha, Aditya and Nagar, Ruchit and Jain, Mohit
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ASHABot is a chatbot powered by LLMs to address the informational needs of community health workers, aiding their decision-making for improved healthcare interventions.
problem_english: Community health workers often face challenges in accessing timely and relevant information crucial for informed decision-making in healthcare interventions. Existing support systems are often inadequate, leading to inefficiencies and potential mismanagement in healthcare delivery, especially in resource-constrained environments.
method_english: ASHABot utilizes large language models (LLMs) to provide community health workers with a responsive and informative chatbot interface. The system is designed to process natural language queries and deliver contextually relevant information, aiding in the rapid and informed decision-making necessary for effective healthcare interventions.
results_english: The implementation of ASHABot demonstrates increased efficiency and accuracy in retrieving relevant health information for community health workers. The chatbot's performance has been positively evaluated, showing promise in supporting informed decision-making and enhancing healthcare delivery in field operations.
summary_japanese: ASHABotは、コミュニティヘルスワーカーの情報ニーズに応えるLLM搭載チャットボットで、医療介入の意思決定を支援します。
problem_japanese: コミュニティヘルスワーカーは、医療介入における意思決定に必要な情報を迅速かつ適切にアクセスすることが困難です。現行の支援システムは不十分で、特にリソースが限られた環境では非効率や誤った管理が生じています。
method_japanese: ASHABotは大規模言語モデルを活用し、コミュニティヘルスワーカーに応じた情報提供をするチャットボットです。自然言語クエリを処理し、医療介入に必要な情報を迅速に提供します。
results_japanese: ASHABotの導入により、ヘルスワーカーへの関連情報取得効率と精度が向上しました。意思決定支援ツールとしての評価は高く、現場の医療提供を強化します。

title: An Evaluation of Spatial Anchoring to position AR Guidance in Arthroscopic Surgery
authors: Acherki, Chaymae and Nigay, Laurence and Roy, Quentin and Salque, Thibault
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study evaluates spatial anchoring of AR guidance in arthroscopic surgery. Researchers examine anchoring methods to enhance precision and workflow, facilitating improved surgical outcomes.
problem_english: Arthroscopic surgery requires precise navigation and orientation. Traditional methods can be hindered by physical and mental challenges, leading to potential errors and inefficiencies. Establishing clear spatial anchors in AR can improve surgical precision.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments using various spatial anchoring techniques integrated with augmented reality in simulated arthroscopic settings. They analyzed the effectiveness of these techniques on user navigation, accuracy, and workflow improvement.
results_english: The study found that certain spatial anchoring techniques improved user accuracy and navigation while potentially reducing mental workload. These results indicate the benefits of AR guidance with effective spatial anchoring in arthroscopic surgery.
summary_japanese: 本研究は関節鏡手術におけるARガイダンスの空間アンカーを評価し、手術の精度とワークフロー改善に寄与する方法を検討した。
problem_japanese: 関節鏡手術は精密な操作と位置決めが要求されるが、従来の方法は身体的及び精神的負担による誤作動や非効率を招く可能性がある。ARにおける明確な空間アンカーの確立が精度向上に寄与する。
method_japanese: シミュレーション環境で様々な空間アンカー技術をARに統合し、ユーザーのナビゲーション、精度、ワークフロー改善効果を検証した。
results_japanese: 特定の空間アンカー技術がユーザーの精度とナビゲーションを向上させ、精神的負荷を軽減する可能性が示された。これにより関節鏡手術における効果的なARガイダンスの利点が示された。

title: Exploring the Remapping Impact of Spatial Head-hand Relations in Immersive Telesurgery
authors: Luo, Tianren and Zhou, Ke and Wang, Pengxiang and Chang, Shuting and Chen, Gaozhang and Zhang, Hechuan and Tan, Xiaohui and Wang, Qi and Han, Teng and Tian, Feng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the impact of spatial remapping between head-hand relations in immersive telesurgery. The research investigates how spatial configurations affect surgical performance and proposes solutions enhancing teleoperation efficiency.
problem_english: In immersive telesurgery, spatial mismatches between a surgeon's head movements and hand actions can negatively impact surgical performance. Understanding these spatial head-hand relations is vital for optimizing remote surgery systems and improving precision and outcomes.
method_english: The authors conducted a series of experiments involving immersive virtual environments to simulate telesurgery. They employed various head-handed spatial configurations to measure their effects on performance metrics such as precision, reaction time, and error rates.
results_english: Results demonstrated that specific spatial configurations significantly affect performance, with optimal configurations enhancing precision and reducing errors in telesurgical tasks. The study provides insights for designing better immersive telesurgery interfaces and systems.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、多様な空間構成が遠隔手術のパフォーマンスに与える影響を調査し、効率向上のための解決策を提案します。
problem_japanese: 没入型遠隔手術における術者の頭部と手の動作の空間的不一致が、手術のパフォーマンスに悪影響を及ぼす可能性があります。これらの空間的な頭部-手の関係を理解することが、遠隔手術システムの最適化や精度の向上に不可欠です。
method_japanese: 仮想環境で遠隔手術をシミュレーションし、頭部-手の空間配置が精度や反応時間、誤り率に与える影響を測定する実験を行いました。
results_japanese: 特定の空間構成がパフォーマンスに大きく影響し、最適構成が精度を高め、誤りを減少させることを示しました。没入型遠隔手術の設計に有用な知見が示されました。

title: Investigating the Benefits of Physical Models for Anatomical Education in Augmented Reality
authors: Wragg, Matthew and Sengupta, Raj and Cazzola, Dario and Alexander, Jason
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the advantages of using physical models in augmented reality for anatomical education, focusing on enhancing understanding and retention of anatomical knowledge among students.
problem_english: The traditional anatomical education methods often lack interactivity and engagement, leading to poor retention and understanding of complex anatomical structures. This problem is exacerbated in digital learning environments where the absence of tactile feedback limits spatial understanding, making it difficult for students to grasp and retain the knowledge effectively.
method_english: The study employed augmented reality tools integrated with physical models to create an interactive learning environment. Students were exposed to augmented reality applications that overlay digital anatomical structures onto physical models, providing both visual and tactile feedback to enhance spatial understanding and retention of anatomical information.
results_english: The integration of augmented reality with physical models significantly improved students’ understanding and retention of anatomical structures compared to traditional methods. The tactile and visual stimuli provided by this approach enhanced their spatial learning, making the comprehension processes faster and more effective, thereby proving the efficacy of this educational method.
summary_japanese: 物理モデルを用いたAR教育の利点を探り、解剖学知識の理解と保持を強化する。
problem_japanese: 従来の解剖学教育はインタラクティブ性に欠け、複雑な構造の理解と保持が難しい。デジタル学習環境では触覚フィードバックがなく、空間理解が困難で学習効果が下がる問題がある。
method_japanese: ARツールを物理モデルと統合し、視覚的および触覚的フィードバックを提供するインタラクト学習環境を構築。デジタル構造と物理モデルを重ね、空間理解と知識の定着を促進。
results_japanese: ARと物理モデルの統合は学生の理解と記憶保持を改善。触覚と視覚の刺激により空間学習が強化され、効果的な教育法であることが示された。

title: Patient Handover in the Emergency Department Is Not Just a Point Event: Insights for Designing Information Support Tools
authors: Ambe, Aloha Hufana and Salisbury, Isaac and Grundgeiger, Tobias and Bodnar, Daniel and Rothwell, Sean and Brown, Nathan and Sanderson, Penelope and Matthews, Ben
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores emergency department patient handovers, highlighting them as processes rather than single events, and provides insights for designing effective information support tools.
problem_english: Emergency department patient handovers are often treated as isolated events rather than ongoing processes. This view limits the effectiveness of information support tools which need to accommodate the dynamic and continuous nature of handovers for improved healthcare delivery.
method_english: The authors conducted a field study in an emergency department, observing handover practices and interactions. They collected data through interviews and video recordings, analyzing the processes and challenges faced during handovers to suggest improvements for information support tools.
results_english: Findings revealed that handovers involve multiple stages and interactions, requiring tools that support the continuous and dynamic nature of information exchange. Insights emphasize designing tools that facilitate real-time access and sharing of patient data across different stages of handovers.
summary_japanese: 研究は、救急科の患者引き継ぎをイベントでなくプロセスとし、情報支援ツール設計への洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 救急科の患者引き継ぎが単一イベントとして処理され、情報支援ツールの効果性が低減されています。ダイナミックかつ継続的な引き継ぎプロセスへの対応が必要です。
method_japanese: 著者は救急科でフィールド研究をし、引き継ぎの実践と対話を観察しました。インタビューとビデオ録画でデータを収集し、手段の改善案を提示しています。
results_japanese: 結果は、引き継ぎが多段階かつ対話を伴い、リアルタイムでのデータ共有を助けるツールが必要であることを示します。

title: Who is Trusted for a Second Opinion? Comparing Collective Advice from a Medical AI and Physicians in Biopsy Decisions After Mammography Screening
authors: Detjen, Henrik H.J. and Densky, Lars and von Kalckreuth, Niklas and Kopka, Marvin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines trust in second-opinion advice from medical AI and physicians for biopsy decisions post-mammography screening, comparing perceptions and decisions.
problem_english: Physicians often seek second opinions for biopsy decisions after mammography screenings due to the complexity and high stakes involved. The challenge is understanding whether medical AI or human doctors are more trusted in offering these second opinions, and how this trust can impact decision-making in medical settings.
method_english: The study conducted a comparative analysis involving participants evaluating second-opinion advice from both a medical AI system and human physicians in biopsy decision-making. Participants' trust levels, advice adherence, and decision-making outcomes were measured and compared across both sources using quantitative and qualitative data.
results_english: Results showed differing levels of trust in medical AI versus human physician advice, with varied adherence to the recommendations based on the source. Participants demonstrated distinct patterns in accepting advice, influenced by perceived expertise, reliability, and the contextual integrity of the AI and human inputs.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、マンモグラフィ検診後の生検判断における医療AIと医師の信頼性を比較した。
problem_japanese: マンモグラフィ検診後の生検判断では、複雑さや重大さからしばしばセカンドオピニオンが求められる。医療AIと医師のどちらが信頼されるかを理解し、その信頼が医療現場の意思決定にどう影響するかが課題である。
method_japanese: 研究は、医療AIシステムと医師からのセカンドオピニオンを評価する参加者の比較分析を実施した。信頼レベル、アドバイスへの従順性、意思決定の結果が量的・質的データで比較された。
results_japanese: 医療AIと人間の医師のアドバイスに対する信頼レベルに違いが見られ、信頼源に基づく推奨事項の遵守が異なる。参加者は、専門性、信頼性、AIと人間の入力の文脈的整合性によって受諾パターンが異なった。

title: A Systematic Literature Review to Characterize Asymmetric Interaction in Collaborative Systems
authors: Br\'{e}hault, Victor and Dubois, Emmanuel and Prouzeau, Arnaud and Serrano, Marcos
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper conducts a systematic literature review to understand asymmetric interactions in collaborative systems, identifying key features, challenges, and design considerations for these systems.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding and characterizing asymmetric interactions within collaborative systems, which can involve varying roles, tasks, and access levels among users. This complexity often leads to difficulties in designing effective and equitable interaction frameworks.
method_english: The authors performed a systematic literature review of existing research, analyzing a broad selection of papers to identify patterns, categorizations, and insights into how asymmetric interactions are structured and leveraged in collaborative systems.
results_english: The review identified several key features and challenges of asymmetric interactions, offering insights into how they can be optimized. It provides a comprehensive categorization of interaction types and highlights the importance of careful design in fostering effective collaboration.
summary_japanese: 非対称的なインタラクションの特徴や設計上の考慮点を明らかにするため、共同システムの文献レビューを行った。
problem_japanese: 共同システムにおける非対称的なインタラクションの理解と特性化が課題であり、異なる役割やタスク、アクセスレベルが設計の複雑さを引き起こす。
method_japanese: 文献レビューを通じて既存研究を分析し、共同システムにおける非対称的インタラクションのパターンと洞察を得た。
results_japanese: 非対称的インタラクションの特徴と課題を特定し、効果的な協力のためにその設計の重要性を示した。

title: Are We On Track? AI-Assisted Active and Passive Goal Reflection During Meetings
authors: Chen, Xinyue and Tankelevitch, Lev and Vanukuru, Rishi and Scott, Ava Elizabeth and Panda, Payod and Rintel, Sean
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores AI-assisted active and passive goal reflection during meetings. It examines how these technologies can support goal alignment and productivity by providing real-time feedback and reflection prompts.
problem_english: Meetings often suffer from a lack of clear goal alignment and productivity, leading to inefficient outcomes. Existing tools lack real-time feedback mechanisms to help participants stay on track with meeting objectives.
method_english: The research investigates AI systems that offer active goal reflection through real-time prompts and passive reflection through post-meeting analysis. It incorporates feedback loops and participant engagement features to enhance meeting outcomes and goal alignment.
results_english: The study reveals that AI-assisted goal reflection tools can significantly improve meeting outcomes by providing actionable insights and fostering better goal alignment. Participants reported increased awareness and productivity when these technologies were implemented during meetings.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、会議中にAIが支援する能動的・受動的目標反省について探究し、リアルタイムのフィードバックと反省の促進を提供する方法を模索する。
problem_japanese: 会議はしばしば目標の整合性や生産性の欠如に悩まされ、非効率的な結果を招く。既存のツールは、参加者が会議の目的に沿って進行するためのリアルタイムのフィードバック機能を欠いている。
method_japanese: 研究は、リアルタイムの促進を通じて能動的な目標反省を提供し、会議後の分析を通じて受動的な反省を提供するAIシステムを調査し、フィードバックループと参加者の関与機能を組み込む。
results_japanese: AI支援の目標反省ツールが会議の結果を改善し、目標の整合性を促進することを明らかにし、参加者はこれらの技術の導入により意識と生産性が向上したと報告した。

title: Co-Designing Multimodal Tools for Radically Mobile Hybrid Meetings
authors: Kleinau, Julia and Gr\o{}nb\ae{}k, Jens Emil Sloth and Hoggan, Eve
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the co-design of multimodal tools to facilitate radically mobile hybrid meetings, addressing challenges of mobility and interaction in diverse meeting environments.
problem_english: The challenge lies in enabling effective interaction and communication in radically mobile environments, where participants may be on the move and using different devices, creating a need for multimodal tools suited for dynamic contexts.
method_english: The authors use a co-design approach involving stakeholders from various sectors to develop and evaluate multimodal tools, incorporating feedback and iterative design processes to address the unique needs of radically mobile hybrid meetings.
results_english: The study resulted in prototypes that improved interaction quality in mobile contexts, showing promise for enhancing participation and collaboration in diverse environments, although further refinement is suggested for optimal usability.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、移動性と相互作用の課題に対処するための先進的なモバイルハイブリッド会議用のマルチモーダルツールの共同設計を探求します。
problem_japanese: 参加者が移動中で異なるデバイスを使用する場合でも効果的な対話とコミュニケーションを可能にすることが重要であり、動的な文脈に適したマルチモーダルツールの必要性があります。
method_japanese: 著者は多様なセクターのステークホルダーを巻き込んで共同設計を行い、フィードバックと反復設計プロセスを取り入れて、先進的なモバイルハイブリッド会議のニーズに対応します。
results_japanese: プロトタイプは移動環境での対話品質を向上させ、多様な環境での参加と協力を強化する可能性を示しましたが、最適な使いやすさのためにはさらなる改善が必要です。

title: Manifesting Architectural Subspaces with Two Mobile Robotic Partitions to Facilitate Spontaneous Office Meetings
authors: Balc\i{}, Ozan and Poncelet, Stien and Nguyen, Alex Binh Vinh Duc and Vande Moere, Andrew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the use of two mobile robotic partitions to create temporary architectural subspaces in offices, promoting spontaneous meetings. The system adapts to office dynamics and user needs, enhancing collaboration and flexibility.
problem_english: The challenge in modern office environments is to balance openness with the need for privacy and collaboration. Fixed walls often hinder adaptability and spontaneity, leading to a need for flexible partition systems that can quickly respond to changing office dynamics and facilitate impromptu meetings.
method_english: The authors developed two mobile robotic partitions capable of autonomously navigating and rearranging office space configurations. The system uses sensors and algorithms to detect user presence and preferences, creating temporary subspaces that foster spontaneous meetings while maintaining openness and adaptability.
results_english: The implementation of robotic partitions resulted in increased frequency and improved quality of spontaneous meetings. Users reported higher satisfaction and perceived flexibility in the office environment, demonstrating the effectiveness of this system in enhancing collaborative dynamics without compromising openness or privacy.
summary_japanese: 本研究はオフィスでの自発的な会議を促進するために移動式ロボットパーティションを活用する手法を提案します。
problem_japanese: 現代のオフィス環境では、開放性とプライバシーやコラボレーションの必要性を両立させることが課題です。固定壁は適応性と自発性を妨げるため、柔軟に反応できるパーティションシステムが求められています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、オフィス空間の構成を自律的にナビゲートし再構成する2つの移動ロボットパーティションを開発しました。センサーとアルゴリズムを用いてユーザーの存在と好みを検出し、臨時のサブスペースを作成します。
results_japanese: ロボットパーティションの導入により自発的な会議の頻度と質が向上。ユーザーは高い満足度とオフィス環境の柔軟性を感じ、オープン性やプライバシーを損なうことなく協力的なダイナミクスを強化する効果を示しました。

title: MiniMates: Miniature Avatars for AR Remote Meetings within Limited Physical Spaces
authors: Kiuchi, Akihiro and Wieland, Jonathan and Igarashi, Takeo and Lindlbauer, David
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: MiniMates explores miniature avatars for AR remote meetings in confined spaces. By shrinking avatars, the system enhances interaction and spatial flexibility, facilitating efficient communication.
problem_english: Conventional AR remote meeting systems often struggle in limited physical spaces, restricting user interaction and placement flexibility. Users find it challenging to manage spatial constraints while maintaining effective communication in collaborative environments.
method_english: The MiniMates system utilizes miniature avatars, significantly reducing their size in augmented reality environments. This approach allows for greater spatial maneuverability, enabling users to optimize the arrangement of avatars while preserving the effectiveness of non-verbal cues and communication.
results_english: The MiniMates system demonstrated improved spatial adaptability in limited spaces, enabling efficient digital meetings. Participants reported enhanced engagement and better management of space, resulting in effective interactions even within constrained environments.
summary_japanese: MiniMatesは、限定空間でのAR遠隔会議用ミニチュアアバターを探求。アバターを小型化し、対話と空間の柔軟性を向上させ、効率的なコミュニケーションを促進。
problem_japanese: 従来のAR遠隔会議システムは限られた物理的空間で問題が生じやすく、ユーザーの対話と設置の柔軟性を制限する。狭い環境での効果的なコミュニケーションの維持が困難。
method_japanese: MiniMatesシステムは、拡張現実環境でアバターを小型化し、空間の操作性を向上。アバターの配置の最適化を可能にし、非言語的なキューとコミュニケーションの効果を維持。
results_japanese: MiniMatesシステムは、限定空間での会議において空間適応性を向上させ、効率的なデジタル会議を実現。参加者は空間の管理がしやすくなり、狭い環境でも効果的な交流が可能に。

title: Observe, Ask, Intervene: Designing AI Agents for More Inclusive Meetings
authors: Houtti, Mo and Zhou, Moyan and Terveen, Loren and Chancellor, Stevie
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study proposes AI agents to enhance meeting inclusivity by observing dynamics, asking insightful questions, and directly intervening when necessary. The agents aim to ensure equitable participation and decision-making during meetings.
problem_english: Meetings often suffer from unequal participation and decision-making due to domineering voices, marginalization of certain attendees, and lack of structured facilitation. This creates challenges in achieving inclusivity and equitable contributions from all participants, impacting organizational success.
method_english: The authors developed multi-agent AI systems that observe meetings, ask strategic questions, and intervene to promote inclusivity. They included features to identify dominant voices, encourage quieter participants, and balance contributions, tested through simulations and user feedback.
results_english: The AI agents improved meeting inclusivity by fostering balanced participation and decision-making. Initial tests demonstrated successful interventions, and users reported increased satisfaction. The agents showed promise in managing group dynamics and enhancing overall meeting effectiveness.
summary_japanese: 会議の包摂性を向上するためにAIエージェントを提案。会議の動向を観察し、洞察に満ちた質問を行い、必要に応じて介入することで、公平な参加と意思決定を促進。
problem_japanese: 会議では支配的な声や参加者の不平等な扱い、構造化された進行の欠如が原因で、参加と意思決定の不均衡が生じる。これは組織の成功に影響を与えるため、全参加者の公平な貢献の達成が課題。
method_japanese: 会議の観察、戦略的質問、包摂性促進のための介入を行うマルチエージェントAIシステムを開発。支配的な声を識別し静かな参加者を奨励、貢献を均衡させる機能を含め、シミュレーションとユーザーフィードバックでテスト。
results_japanese: AIエージェントは参加と意思決定の均衡を促進し包摂性を改善。初期テストで成功した介入が示され、ユーザーは満足度向上を報告。グループダイナミックス管理と会議の効果向上に有望性を示した。

title: Understanding Cyber Hostility, Gossip, Exclusion, and Social Support in Remote and Hybrid Work Settings: Benefits and Challenges of Remote Work
authors: Jamieson, Jack and Akahori, Wataru and Yamashita, Naomi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores cyber hostility, gossip, exclusion, and social support in remote and hybrid work settings. It identifies the benefits and challenges associated with remote work environments and offers insights into mitigating negative interactions.
problem_english: As organizations increasingly adopt remote and hybrid work models, challenges such as cyber hostility, gossip, exclusion, and insufficient social support can impact employee well-being and organizational culture. Understanding these dynamics is crucial for developing strategies to foster supportive and inclusive remote work environments.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and surveys with employees working in remote and hybrid settings to gather insights into their experiences with cyber hostility, gossip, exclusion, and social support. They analyzed the data to identify patterns and propose strategies to enhance remote work culture.
results_english: The study found that while remote work offers flexibility, it can lead to social isolation and cyber hostility. However, introducing structured social support mechanisms and clear communication protocols can mitigate negativity and foster positive interactions, enhancing employee satisfaction and productivity.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、リモートおよびハイブリッド勤務環境におけるサイバー敵意、ゴシップ、排除、社会的支援を探求し、課題への対処法を提案する。
problem_japanese: リモートやハイブリッド勤務モデルが普及する中、サイバー敵意やゴシップ、排除、社会的支援の不足が雇用者の福祉と組織文化に悪影響を及ぼす可能性がある。この動態を理解することは、支援的かつ包括的なリモートワーク環境を育むための戦略を策定する上で重要である。
method_japanese: 著者は、リモートおよびハイブリッド環境で働く従業員へのインタビューと調査を行い、サイバー敵意やゴシップ、排除、社会的支援の経験についての洞察を収集し、分析することで改善策を提案した。
results_japanese: 本研究は、リモートワークが柔軟性を提供する一方で、社会的孤立やサイバー敵意を招く可能性があることを発見した。しかし、構造的な社会支援の仕組みと明確なコミュニケーション手順を導入することで、否定的な影響を緩和し、従業員の満足度と生産性を向上できる。

title: "I spent 14 hours debugging just one assignment": Toward Computer-Mediated Personal Informatics for Computer Science Student Mental Health
authors: Chandrasekaran, Aishwarya and Bielicke, London and Shah, Diya and Janakiraman, Harisha and Mauriello, Matthew Louis
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the impact of computer science assignments on student mental health, proposing a computer-mediated personal informatics approach to improve coping methods and reduce stress.
problem_english: Computer science students often experience significant stress due to complex assignments and prolonged debugging sessions, leading to adverse effects on mental health. Current strategies to address this stress are often inadequate, necessitating the development of effective interventions.
method_english: The researchers propose a computer-mediated personal informatics system designed specifically for computer science students. This system tracks debugging time and stress levels, aiming to provide insights and strategies for improved management of mental health challenges.
results_english: The study found that integrating personal informatics tools enabled students to better understand their debugging habits and stress triggers. It facilitated the development of tailored stress management strategies, contributing to improved mental health outcomes among students.
summary_japanese: この研究は、コンピュータ科学課題が学生のメンタルヘルスに与える影響を探り、ストレス軽減のための情報学アプローチを提案します。
problem_japanese: コンピュータ科学の学生は、複雑な課題と長時間のデバッグセッションにより重大なストレスを経験し、それが精神健康に悪影響を及ぼす場合があります。現行の対策は十分でなく、効果的な介入が必要です。
method_japanese: 研究者は、コンピュータ科学学生用に設計された個人情報学システムを提案し、デバッグ時間とストレスレベルを追跡し、精神的課題管理の改善を目指します。
results_japanese: 個人情報学ツールの統合により、学生はデバッグ習慣やストレスの原因をより理解し、ストレス管理戦略の開発が可能となり、精神健康の改善に寄与しました。

title: Affective Interactions in Therapeutic Virtual Reality: A Critical Perspective
authors: Ahmadpour, Naseem and Waycott, Jenny
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the role of affective interactions in therapeutic virtual reality, offering a critical perspective on their effectiveness and ethical considerations.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding how affective interactions in therapeutic virtual reality can be both beneficial and ethically complicated, considering their potential to influence emotions and behavior in medical therapy settings.
method_english: The authors conduct a critical analysis of existing literature and case studies, focusing on the mechanisms and ethical implications of affective interactions in therapeutic virtual reality environments. They consider diverse perspectives and scenarios.
results_english: The analysis reveals both benefits and ethical concerns associated with affective interactions in therapeutic virtual reality, emphasizing the need for careful design and implementation to maximize positive outcomes while mitigating risks.
summary_japanese: 本論文はセラピー用VRにおける感情的相互作用の役割を批判的視点で検討し、その効果と倫理的課題に焦点を当てる。
problem_japanese: セラピー用VRにおける感情的相互作用が、医療の場で感情や行動に影響を与える可能性があるという、一方で有益でありながら倫理的に複雑な課題を扱う。
method_japanese: 感情的相互作用のメカニズムと倫理的側面に着目し、既存の文献と事例研究を用いて批判的分析を行い、多様な視点とシナリオを考慮する。
results_japanese: 感情的相互作用には利点と倫理的懸念があることが判明し、リスクを軽減しつつポジティブな成果を最大化する慎重な設計と実施が必要とされる。

title: CounselAR: Exploring How AR Filters Facilitate Online Psychotherapy In the Wild With South Korean Young Adults
authors: Noh, Hayoun and Chishti, Salman Muin Kayser and Jo, Hyunah and Newhouse, Nikki and Kim, Songi and Van Kleek, Max and Kang, Younah
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the role of augmented reality (AR) filters in enhancing online psychotherapy experiences for South Korean young adults, focusing on how these filters can improve user engagement and therapeutic outcomes.
problem_english: Online psychotherapy presents challenges such as limited emotional cues and engagement. South Korean young adults, who are tech-savvy but face high mental health stigma, need innovative solutions to make these virtual sessions more effective and comfortable.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach, including semi-structured interviews and a longitudinal survey, to assess the impact of AR filters on psychotherapy sessions for South Korean young adults and measure their influence on engagement and therapeutic outcomes.
results_english: Findings demonstrate that AR filters can significantly enhance the therapeutic relationship by offering emotional expression and personalization, leading to improved engagement and therapeutic outcomes in online psychotherapy among South Korean young adults.
summary_japanese: 韓国の若年層を対象に、ARフィルターがオンライン精神療法の体験を向上させる役割を調査し、ユーザーの関与や治療結果を改善する可能性を示す。
problem_japanese: オンライン精神療法では、感情的な指標や関与が制限されるという課題があります。技術に精通しながらも精神的健康に対するスティグマが高い韓国の若者にとって、これらの課題を克服し快適にする革新的な解決策が必要です。
method_japanese: 韓国の若年層を対象に、ARフィルターが精神療法セッションに与える影響を評価するため、混合手法アプローチを採用し、半構造化インタビューと縦断調査を実施し、フィルターが関与や治療結果に与える影響を測定。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、ARフィルターが感情表現とパーソナライズを提供することで治療関係を大幅に強化し、韓国の若年層のオンライン精神療法の関与と治療結果を改善することができることを示しています。

title: CounterStress: Enhancing Stress Coping Planning through Counterfactual Explanations in Personal Informatics
authors: Jung, Gyuwon and Lee, Uichin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces CounterStress, a tool that uses counterfactual explanations to improve stress coping strategies in personal informatics systems, enhancing users' understanding of stress triggers and responses.
problem_english: Personal informatics systems often fall short in helping users effectively understand and manage stress. Users struggle with recognizing the causes of their stress and determining effective strategies for coping due to limited insights provided by current systems.
method_english: CounterStress employs counterfactual explanations to provide users with 'what-if' scenarios, allowing them to explore how different actions or circumstances could alter their stress levels. This approach aims to enhance understanding and improve planning for stress management.
results_english: The study demonstrates that users of CounterStress develop better insights into their stress patterns and coping mechanisms. Users report feeling more empowered to manage stress effectively and appreciate the system's ability to present actionable strategies through counterfactual analyses.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、CounterStressを提案し、ストレス対処戦略を向上させ、ユーザーの理解を促進する個人情報分析システムを紹介します。
problem_japanese: 個人情報分析システムは、ユーザーがストレスの原因を理解し対処するのに効果的な支援を提供できていません。現在のシステムでは、ストレス管理に効果的な戦略を見つけるための洞察が限られています。
method_japanese: CounterStressは、カウンターファクトな説明を使用して、「もし～なら」というシナリオを提供し、異なる行動や状況がストレスレベルに与える影響を探ることで、ストレス管理の理解と計画を向上させることを目的としています。
results_japanese: 研究は、CounterStressユーザーがストレスパターンや対処方法への洞察を向上させていることを示しています。ユーザーはストレス管理に対する自信を高め、対処可能な戦略を提示するシステムの能力を評価しています。

title: Healing Through Stories: Co-designing Digital Mental Health with Asian Americans
authors: Bautista, Justine Rose and Wong, Novia and Reddy, Madhu and Schueller, Stephen M.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores co-designing digital mental health solutions tailored for Asian Americans, leveraging storytelling for healing.
problem_english: Asian Americans often face unique mental health challenges due to cultural stigmas and limited access to culturally sensitive resources. Traditional systems may not adequately address these needs, necessitating culturally appropriate digital interventions that can better support mental health in this community.
method_english: The study utilizes a co-design methodology, engaging Asian American participants in the design process. This approach incorporates storytelling elements to create digital mental health tools that are culturally relevant and resonate with users’ experiences, ensuring their mental health needs are effectively addressed.
results_english: The co-designed digital mental health tools demonstrate increased cultural relevance and user engagement among Asian Americans. The inclusion of storytelling enhances the tools’ effectiveness by fostering emotional connection and empathy, ultimately improving their mental health outcomes.
summary_japanese: アジア系アメリカ人向けに共同設計されたデジタルメンタルヘルスソリューションを物語の力を借りて探求。
problem_japanese: アジア系アメリカ人は文化的スティグマと文化に配慮した資源へのアクセスの制限のため、ユニークなメンタルヘルスの課題に直面しています。従来のシステムではこれらのニーズを適切に満たせないため、文化的に適切なデジタル介入が必要です。
method_japanese: 共同設計手法を利用し、アジア系アメリカ人参加者をデザインプロセスに参加させます。この方法は、物語要素を取り入れ、ユーザーの経験に共感し、文化的に関連性のあるデジタルメンタルヘルスツールを作成します。
results_japanese: 共同設計されたデジタルメンタルヘルスツールは、アジア系アメリカ人の間で文化的関連性とユーザーエンゲージメントを高めました。物語の導入は感情的なつながりと共感を促進し、メンタルヘルス改善に効果的です。

title: Social Simulation for Everyday Self-Care: Design Insights from Leveraging VR, AR, and LLMs for Practicing Stress Relief
authors: Fang, Anna and Chhabria, Hriday and Maram, Alekhya and Zhu, Haiyi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores using VR, AR, and LLMs for creating social simulations to practice stress relief techniques in everyday self-care scenarios.
problem_english: Many individuals struggle with effective self-care and stress management in daily life. Traditional methods often lack adaptability and personalization, making it difficult for people to consistently practice and benefit from stress relief techniques, leading to a growing need for innovative solutions that leverage technology for personalized and engaging self-care experiences.
method_english: The authors designed immersive social simulations using virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and large language models (LLMs). These simulations provide a personalized stress relief experience, adapting to user preferences and offering real-time feedback in various everyday scenarios. The study involved prototype development and user testing to evaluate effectiveness and usability.
results_english: The study found that VR, AR, and LLMs can effectively enhance self-care by providing personalized and engaging stress relief simulations. Users reported increased motivation and better stress management strategies, leading to improved overall well-being. The approach shows promise for addressing challenges in maintaining consistent self-care practices.
summary_japanese: VR、AR、LLMsを活用し、日常的な自己ケアのシナリオでストレス緩和技術を練習する社会的シミュレーションの可能性を探る。
problem_japanese: 多くの人々が日常生活において効果的な自己ケアやストレス管理に苦労する。従来の方法は適応性や個別化に欠け、一貫してストレス軽減技術を実践することが難しいため、個人に合った革新的な技術を活用した自己ケア体験が求められている。
method_japanese: 著者らはVR、AR、LLMsを活用して没入型の社会的シミュレーションを設計。ユーザーの好みに応じたストレス緩和体験を提供し、日常のシナリオでリアルタイムフィードバックを提供。プロトタイプ開発とユーザーテストを通して効果と使いやすさを評価。
results_japanese: 研究では、VR、AR、LLMsが個別化された魅力的なストレス緩和シミュレーションにより自己ケアを効果的に強化できることを発見。ユーザーはモチベーションが向上し、より良いストレス管理戦略を報告し、全体的な幸福感が向上。

title: The Dual Model for Everyday Stress Technology: Understanding the Lived Experience of Data-Driven Stress
authors: Hodd\o{} Bak\r{a}s, Sigrid and Wo\'{z}niak, Miko\l{}aj P. and Herstad, Jo and Wo\'{z}niak, Pawe\l{} W. and Niess, Jasmin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a dual model for understanding everyday stress through data-driven technology. It emphasizes individuals' lived experiences and offers insights into managing stress with technological tools.
problem_english: The research identifies the complexities involved in understanding the lived experience of stress through the lens of data-driven technologies. The increased reliance on these technologies may not account for the subjective nature of stress and its individual variations.
method_english: The study employs qualitative methodologies, including interviews and user studies, to gather in-depth insights from participants. This approach ensures a comprehensive understanding of personal experiences with stress technology, and integrates them into the proposed dual model framework.
results_english: Findings reveal that while data-driven stress technologies offer valuable insights, they may oversimplify personal stress experiences. The dual model enhances the understanding of these experiences by accounting for subjective nuances and provides guidance on more effective stress management strategies.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、データ駆動型技術による日常ストレス理解の二元モデルを提案し、個々の体験に注目します。
problem_japanese: 研究は、データ駆動型技術を通じたストレスの体験理解の複雑さを指摘し、技術が主観的なストレスの多様性を十分に考慮しない可能性を示します。
method_japanese: 質的手法を用い、インタビューやユーザースタディを通じて参加者から詳細な洞察を得る。このアプローチは、ストレス技術に関する個人的体験を包括的に理解し、提案された二元モデルに統合します。
results_japanese: データ駆動ストレス技術は貴重な洞察を提供しますが、個々のストレス体験を単純化しがちです。二元モデルは主観的なニュアンスを考慮し、より効果的なストレス管理戦略を導きます。

title: AI on My Shoulder: Supporting Emotional Labor in Front-Office Roles with an LLM-based Empathetic Coworker
authors: Das Swain, Vedant and Zhong, Qiuyue "Joy" and Parekh, Jash Rajesh and Jeon, Yechan and Zimmermann, Roy and Czerwinski, Mary P and Suh, Jina and Mishra, Varun and Saha, Koustuv and Hernandez, Javier
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study introduces an AI coworker using LLM to aid emotional labor in front-office roles, enhancing empathetic communication and stress management.
problem_english: Front-office employees face challenges in managing emotional labor, often leading to stress and burnout. There is a need for supportive tools that assist in empathetic interactions while improving overall well-being.
method_english: The authors developed an AI system incorporating advanced LLM to serve as an empathetic coworker, facilitating better communication and stress alleviation during emotional labor tasks in front-office settings.
results_english: The LLM-based AI coworker proved effective in relieving stress and enhancing empathetic communication, yielding improved job satisfaction and emotional well-being among front-office employees.
summary_japanese: この研究は、フロントオフィスの役割における感情労働を支援するためのLLMを用いたAI同僚を紹介します。
problem_japanese: フロントオフィスの従業員は感情労働の管理に苦労し、ストレスやバーンアウトにつながることが多いです。共感的な対応を支援し、全体的な幸福を向上させるツールが必要です。
method_japanese: 著者らは、高度なLLMを組み込んだAIシステムを開発し、フロントオフィスの感情労働タスクにおけるコミュニケーションとストレス軽減を促進します。
results_japanese: LLMベースのAI同僚は、ストレス緩和と共感的なコミュニケーションの向上に効果があり、従業員の満足度と感情的健康が改善しました。

title: Cyberoception: Finding A Painlessly-Measurable New Sense In The Cyberworld Towards Emotion-awareness In Computing
authors: Okoshi, Tadashi and Gao, Zexiong and Tan, Yi Zhen and Karasawa, Takumi and Miki, Takeshi and Sasaki, Wataru and Balan, Rajesh Krishna
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper introduces 'Cyberoception', a new concept aimed at enabling emotion-awareness in computing by leveraging painless and measurable senses in cyberspace.
problem_english: Current computing systems lack robust methods to effectively understand human emotions in real-time. This limitation hampers the development of truly empathetic and responsive computing systems, which are necessary for more intuitive user interactions and better user experience.
method_english: The authors propose a novel framework called 'Cyberoception', which aims to utilize measurable and non-invasive methods within the digital domain to detect and interpret user emotions accurately. This approach involves integrating various data sources and computational techniques to enhance emotional awareness.
results_english: The study demonstrates that 'Cyberoception' can significantly improve emotion recognition accuracy without compromising user comfort or requiring intrusive data collection methods. This advancement holds potential for improving user experiences in various computing applications.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、痛みなく計測可能なサイバースペースの新感覚「サイバーレセプション」で感情認識を可能にする概念を紹介します。
problem_japanese: 現行のコンピューティングシステムは、リアルタイムで人間の感情を効果的に理解するための堅牢な方法に欠けており、より直感的なユーザーインタラクションと優れたユーザー体験に必要な真に共感するシステムの開発が妨げられています。
method_japanese: 著者は、デジタル領域で測定可能かつ非侵襲的な方法でユーザーの感情を正確に検出・解釈する「サイバーレセプション」という新しいフレームワークを提案します。このアプローチは、様々なデータソースと計算技術を統合して感情認識を強化します。
results_japanese: 研究は、ユーザーの快適さを損なわず、侵襲的なデータ収集を必要とせずに感情認識精度が大幅に向上することを示しています。この進展は、さまざまなコンピューティングアプリケーションにおいてユーザー体験を向上させる可能性を秘めています。

title: Designing Daily Supports for Parent-Child Conversations about Emotion: Ecological Momentary Assessment as Intervention
authors: Ibrahim, Seray B and Klasnja, Predrag and Gross, James J. and Slovak, Petr
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores using ecological momentary assessment (EMA) to enhance parent-child emotional conversations. It provides insights into designing daily supports for such interactions, promoting emotional understanding and well-being.
problem_english: Parents often struggle to communicate effectively about emotions with their children, impacting emotional development and well-being. Traditional methods lack real-time context and adaptability, necessitating innovative approaches to support meaningful emotional dialogues in everyday situations.
method_english: The research leverages ecological momentary assessment (EMA) as an intervention tool. EMA technology captures real-time data on emotional experiences and uses these insights to design tailored daily supports that facilitate better emotional conversations between parents and children.
results_english: The study demonstrates EMA's efficacy in improving parental awareness and communication of emotions with children. Participants using EMA-based supports reported enhanced emotional conversations, leading to improved emotional understanding and stronger parent-child connections.
summary_japanese: この論文では、親子間の感情的対話を強化するために生態学的瞬間評価(EMA)を使用することを探求しています。
problem_japanese: 親は子供と感情について効果的に話すのに苦労しがちであり、これが感情の発達と幸福に影響を与えます。従来の方法にはリアルタイムでの対応力が欠けており、日常における心の対話をサポートする革新的な手法が必要です。
method_japanese: この研究は介入手段として生態学的瞬間評価(EMA)を活用しています。EMAは感情体験のリアルタイムデータを収集し、親子間の感情的な対話を促進するためのカスタマイズされた日常的サポートを設計します。
results_japanese: 研究の結果、EMAを用いたサポートの利用者は感情的対話の改善を報告し、感情理解と親子間の関係強化が認められました。

title: Promoting Prosociality via Micro-acts of Joy: A Large-Scale Well-Being Intervention Study
authors: Goel, Hitesh and Park, Yoobin and Liou, Jin and Guevarra, Darwin A and Callahan, Peggy and Smith, Jolene and Yao, Bingsheng and Wang, Dakuo and Liu, Xin and McDuff, Daniel and Elhadad, Noemie and Simon-Thomas, Emiliana and Epel, Elissa and Xu, Xuhai
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines a large-scale intervention aimed at promoting prosocial behaviors through micro-acts of joy, analyzing its impacts on well-being and social connections.
problem_english: Many people struggle with maintaining well-being and strong social connections in modern society. Research suggests that prosocial behaviors enhance social bonds and personal happiness, but scalable methods to promote such behaviors remain largely unexplored.
method_english: The researchers conducted a large-scale intervention, encouraging participants to perform micro-acts of joy. These small actions were designed to foster prosocial behavior and were monitored through self-reported questionnaires and social connectivity metrics.
results_english: The intervention led to significant improvements in participants' self-reported well-being and prosocial behaviors. Increased social connections and positive feelings were linked with the frequency of micro-acts of joy performed by participants.
summary_japanese: 微細な喜びの行為を通じて向社会性を促進し、幸福感や社会的つながりへの影響を分析する大規模介入研究。
problem_japanese: 現代社会で多くの人が幸福感や強い社会的つながりを維持することに苦労している。向社会的行動は社会的結束や個人の幸福を高めるが、その促進方法の拡張可能性が未探究である。
method_japanese: 研究者は微細な喜びの行為を参加者に奨励する大規模介入を実施。これらの行動は自己報告によるアンケートと社会的接続性指標を用いて監視された。
results_japanese: 介入は自己報告による幸福感と向社会的行動の改善をもたらした。微細な喜びの行為の頻度は社会的接続と肯定的感情の増加に関連していた。

title: The Benefits of Prosociality towards AI Agents: Examining the Effects of Helping AI Agents on Human Well-Being
authors: Zhu, Zicheng and Tan, Yugin and Yamashita, Naomi and Lee, Yi-Chieh and Zhang, Renwen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the potential benefits of prosocial behavior towards AI agents, focusing on how helping AI can positively impact human well-being.
problem_english: With the increasing interaction between humans and AI agents, understanding the psychological and emotional effects of prosocial behavior towards AI agents on human well-being is crucial. Are there tangible benefits that lead to improved well-being when humans assist AI agents?
method_english: The study employs experimental methods to assess the psychological effects on human participants when they engage in prosocial actions, such as providing support or assistance, towards AI agents, measuring various well-being indicators.
results_english: The findings indicate that prosocial behavior towards AI leads to increased feelings of purpose and satisfaction among humans. Participants who assisted AI agents reported higher levels of emotional well-being and perceived meaning in their interactions.
summary_japanese: AIへの利他的行動が人間の幸福に与える影響を探る研究。AIへの助けが人間の幸福感に良い影響を与える可能性を示唆。
problem_japanese: 人間とAIエージェントの相互作用が増える中で、AIへの利他的な行動が人間の幸福に与える心理的・感情的な影響を理解することが重要である。人間がAIを支援することで得られる実際の幸福向上の効果はあるか。
method_japanese: AIを助けるなどの利他行動を取った際の心理的影響を、実験的手法で検証し、様々な幸福指標を測定。参加者の利他行動が与える効果を評価。
results_japanese: AIへの利他行動は人間の目的意識と満足感を高めることがわかった。参加者はAIを支援することで感情的幸福と交流の意味をより高く報告した。

title: The Cruel Optimism of Tech Work: Tech Workers' Affective Attachments in the Aftermath of 2022-23 Tech Layoffs
authors: So, Samuel and Sou, Vannary and Munson, Sean A. and Ghoshal, Sucheta
