problem_japanese: 開発者は、振動触覚フィードバックシステムを設計する際、その複雑性と多様な触覚体験を同時に提供可能にするためのモジュール性やスケーラビリティを実現する困難に直面しています。
method_japanese: VibraForgeは、柔軟なモジュラー部品とソフトウェアインターフェースを提供し、開発者が簡単にスケーラブルな振動触覚システムを設計・実装できるようにします。
results_japanese: VibraForgeは、多様な触覚体験を実証し、そのスケーラビリティとモジュール性を証明し、複雑な振動触覚フィードバックシステムの設計を簡素化しました。

title: Generating Highlight Videos of a User-Specified Length using Most Replayed Data
authors: Kim, Minsun and Lee, Dawon and Noh, Junyong
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents a method for generating highlight videos of specified lengths using data on most replayed segments, optimizing user experience and video engagement.
problem_english: Current highlight video generation lacks customizability and effectiveness in capturing the most engaging video segments. Existing methods often fail to consider user preferences for video length, leading to varying user satisfaction levels.
method_english: The proposed method uses meta-data from most replayed video segments to tailor highlight videos to a user-specified length, employing machine learning techniques to identify impactful segments and optimize user engagement.
results_english: The results demonstrate that this approach successfully creates highlight videos that match user-specified lengths, significantly enhancing user satisfaction by focusing on the most engaging content based on replay data.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、指定された長さのハイライト動画を、最も再生されたセグメントのデータを用いて生成する方法を提案します。
problem_japanese: 現在のハイライト動画生成はカスタマイズ性に欠け、最も魅力的なセグメントを効果的に捉えられない。既存手法は動画の長さに対するユーザーの好みを考慮せず、満足度のばらつきを生む。
method_japanese: 提案手法は、最も再生された動画セグメントのメタデータを使用し、ユーザーが指定する長さに合わせたハイライト動画を生成する。機械学習により効果的なセグメントを特定し、ユーザーエンゲージメントを最適化する。
results_japanese: このアプローチは、ユーザー指定の長さに合わせたハイライト動画を作成し、再生データに基づいて最も魅力的な内容を集中させることで、ユーザーの満足度を大幅に向上させることを示した。

title: More Than 'ticking-a-box': The Affordances of Short-form Video for Community Reporting to Government
authors: Bartindale, Tom and Cleever, Cassandra and Moran, Claire and Angelucci, Margherita and Varghese, Delvin and Olivier, Patrick
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores short-form videos' potential in community reporting and government interactions. It examines how these videos enhance communication, transparency, and public engagement in civic processes.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is finding effective methods for communities to engage with government bodies. Traditional reporting mechanisms are insufficient for efficient, transparent communication, highlighting the need for innovative tools to improve public engagement and reporting.
method_english: The authors employed a mixed-methods approach, combining qualitative interviews, surveys with community members, and analysis of short-form video content used for reporting. They assessed video efficacy in conveying community issues to government entities.
results_english: Findings suggest short-form videos offer enhanced communication and engagement, providing a compelling, transparent medium for community reporting. These videos can facilitate better understanding and response from government bodies toward community concerns.
summary_japanese: 短編動画が共同体の報告と政府との関係において持つ可能性を探り、コミュニケーションや透明性、公共参加を強化する方法を検討する。
problem_japanese: 共同体が政府機関と効果的に関わるための手段を見つけることが課題である。従来の報告メカニズムでは効率的な透明性のあるコミュニケーションが不十分であり、公共参加と報告を改善する革新的なツールが求められている。
method_japanese: 著者は質的インタビューと共同体メンバーへの調査、および報告で使用される短編動画コンテンツの分析を組み合わせた混合手法を採用し、政府機関への共同体問題の伝達における動画の有効性を評価した。
results_japanese: 短編動画はコミュニケーションと参加を強化し、共同体報告において説得力のある透明な媒体を提供することを示唆する。これにより、政府機関が共同体の懸念をよりよく理解し対応できる可能性がある。

title: ProTAL: A Drag-and-Link Video Programming Framework for Temporal Action Localization
authors: He, Yuchen and Lv, Jianbing and Cheng, Liqi and Meng, Lingyu and Deng, Dazhen and Wu, Yingcai
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ProTAL is a novel drag-and-link video programming framework developed for improving temporal action localization tasks, presented at CHI 2025.
problem_english: Existing tools for temporal action localization are often limited in functionality, usability, and require expertise in programming. This makes it difficult for non-experts to engage in complex video analysis tasks, hindering their access to powerful computational tools for temporal understanding.
method_english: The framework allows users to intuitively label and link sequential actions within video content using a drag-and-link interface. It supports non-expert users in temporal action localization by providing a visual, programming-free environment for action annotation and linking, integrating machine learning feedback.
results_english: ProTAL enhances user experience by significantly reducing the effort and expertise required for precise temporal action localization. Through user studies, it was shown to improve annotation speed and accuracy, allowing even non-experts to effectively manage complex video analysis tasks.
summary_japanese: ProTALは、時系列アクションローカリゼーションを改善するための新しいドラッグ＆リンクビデオプログラミングフレームワークです。
problem_japanese: 従来のツールは機能性、使いやすさに限界があり、プログラミングの専門知識を必要とするため、非専門家が動画分析に参加するのは容易ではありません。
method_japanese: このフレームワークは、ドラッグ＆リンクインターフェイスを使って、ユーザーが直感的にビデオ内のアクションをラベル付けしリンクすることを可能にします。
results_japanese: ProTALは、アノテーションの速度と正確性を改善し、非専門家でも複雑な動画分析を効果的に処理できることがユーザースタディで示されました。

title: Underground AI? Critical Approaches to Generative Cinema through Amateur Filmmaking
authors: Halperin, Brett A. and Ru\'{\i}z, Diana Flores and Rosner, Daniela K.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines critical approaches to generative cinema through the lens of amateur filmmaking, exploring how underground AI tools can democratize film creation and challenge traditional storytelling forms.
problem_english: The paper addresses the issue of accessibility and creativity in filmmaking, where traditional cinema is dominated by professional studios with large budgets. It explores how emerging generative AI tools can democratize the process by allowing amateur filmmakers to create films with limited resources, potentially disrupting conventional storytelling.
method_english: The methodology involves analyzing the application of generative AI technologies in amateur filmmaking, evaluating how these tools enable novel narrative forms and creative processes. The study engaged with filmmakers using underground AI tools, conducting interviews, and observing their creative workflows to understand how these technologies impact film production.
results_english: Results indicate that generative AI tools empower amateur filmmakers, providing new opportunities for storytelling that defy conventional cinematic norms. These tools facilitate creative independence, allowing filmmakers to explore diverse narratives. However, the democratization of filmmaking also raises questions about originality and the socio-cultural implications of AI-generated content.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、アマチュア映画制作を通じて生成的映画への批判的アプローチを探り、アンダーグラウンドAIが映画制作を民主化する方法を考察します。
problem_japanese: 従来の映画制作は、予算が多くプロスタジオが支配するという問題を抱えています。本論文は、生成的AIツールがアマチュア映画制作者に、限られたリソースで創作の機会を提供し、従来の物語を覆す可能性を探ります。
method_japanese: 生成的AI技術をアマチュア映画制作に適用し、これらのツールがどのように新しい物語形式や創作過程を可能にするかを分析しました。AIツールを使用する映画制作者へのインタビューと製作過程の観察を行いました。
results_japanese: 生成的AIはアマチュア映画作家に力を与え、多様な物語の探求を可能にしますが、創作の独立性を促進する一方で、オリジナリティやAI生成コンテンツの社会文化的影響について議論を呼びました。

title: VidSTR: Automatic Spatiotemporal Retargeting of Speech-Driven Video Compositions
authors: Yang, Joshua Kong and Leake, Mackenzie and Huang, Jeff and DiVerdi, Stephen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: VidSTR introduces an automated technique for spatiotemporally retargeting speech-driven video compositions, enhancing video editing efficiency and effectiveness through intelligent adjustments.
problem_english: Creating spatiotemporally consistent video compositions driven by speech is complex and time-consuming. Traditional video editing tools are insufficient for automatic adjustments, requiring expertise and significant manual effort, thus limiting accessibility and scalability in content creation.
method_english: VidSTR employs a blend of machine learning algorithms focusing on speech and video synchronization. It intelligently adjusts the video's spatial and temporal components, allowing for seamless integration of speech-driven video elements while maintaining natural rhythm and coherence.
results_english: The application of VidSTR demonstrates enhanced efficiency and effectiveness in spatiotemporal retargeting, reducing the time needed for video composition and producing more visually appealing results that sync accurately with speech-driven cues.
summary_japanese: VidSTRはスピーチ駆動のビデオ編集を効率化する自動的な手法を提案し、編集の効果を向上させます。
problem_japanese: スピーチに基づく時空間的に一貫したビデオ作成は、従来のツールでは自動化が困難で、専門知識と多大な手動調整が必要になります。
method_japanese: VidSTRは機械学習を活用し、音声とビデオの同期を図り、自然なリズムを保ちながら時空間調整を行います。
results_japanese: VidSTRの導入により、スピーチ駆動ビデオの効率的な編集が可能となり、時間を削減し視覚的にも優れた結果が得られました。

title: VideoDiff: Human-AI Video Co-Creation with Alternatives
authors: Huh, Mina and Li, Ding and Pimmel, Kim and Shin, Hijung Valentina and Pavel, Amy and Dontcheva, Mira
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: VideoDiff is a tool that enhances joint human-AI video creation by offering multiple alternative video edits, allowing creators to explore diverse creative directions efficiently.
problem_english: The challenge in video production is efficiently generating and exploring a wide range of creative possibilities. Existing tools often don't offer enough flexibility for creators to effortlessly explore alternative video edits and determine which best suits their storytelling intents.
method_english: The authors introduce VideoDiff, which integrates AI to assist creators by automatically generating multiple alternative video edits. This tool provides a variety of edits that creators can choose from, compare, and further refine, streamlining the creative process and enhancing flexibility in storytelling.
results_english: VideoDiff was evaluated through user studies, which showed that participants found it effective in broadening their creative exploration. It enabled them to quickly compare different creative directions, improving the efficiency and satisfaction of the video editing process.
summary_japanese: VideoDiffは、人とAIの共同ビデオ制作を向上させ、多様な編集オプションを提供し、効率的に創造的方向性を探求可能にするツールです。
problem_japanese: 動画制作の課題は、効率的に幅広い創造的可能性を探ることです。既存ツールは、多様な編集を容易に探索し、物語に最適なものを判断する柔軟性を提供することに制約があります。
method_japanese: 著者らは、多様なビデオ編集を自動的に生成するAIを統合したVideoDiffを発表。クリエイターは選択や比較、さらなる改良が可能で、創作過程の柔軟性を強化します。
results_japanese: VideoDiffをユーザースタディで評価したところ、参加者は創造的探求を広げる手段として有効と感じ、編集プロセスの効率と満足度が向上したと評価されました。

title: Where is the Boundary? Understanding How People Recognize and Evaluate Generative AI-extended Videos
authors: Wang, Ke and Lin, Lehao and Abdallah, Maha and Cai, Wei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines how individuals recognize and assess videos expanded by generative AI, exploring the challenges in distinguishing between original and AI-generated content.
problem_english: As generative AI increasingly integrates with video content, it becomes challenging for viewers to distinguish between authentic and AI-generated segments. This paper addresses the need to understand the boundaries in recognizing and evaluating AI-extended videos, posing implications for content authenticity and viewer perception.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments with participants who evaluated AI-extended videos, analyzing their ability to distinguish original content from AI-generated parts. The study uses qualitative and quantitative methods to assess recognition accuracy and the criteria used by viewers for evaluation.
results_english: The findings reveal that participants struggle to accurately identify AI-generated video segments. Factors such as video quality, familiarity with the genre, and explicit cues impacted recognition. The study provides insights into improving viewers' ability to discern AI-extended content in videos.
summary_japanese: 本論文は生成AIによって拡張されたビデオをどのように認識し評価するかを考察し、オリジナルとAI生成コンテンツの区別の課題を探る。
problem_japanese: 生成AIがビデオコンテンツに統合される中で、視聴者がオリジナルとAI生成セグメントを区別するのが困難になる問題がある。本稿はAI拡張ビデオを認識・評価する境界を理解する必要性に焦点を当て、コンテンツの真正性と視聴者の認識に影響を与える。
method_japanese: 著者らは参加者によるAI拡張ビデオの評価実験を行い、オリジナルとAI生成部分を区別する能力を分析。質的・量的手法を用いて認識の正確性と視聴者が用いる評価基準を評価する。
results_japanese: 結果として、参加者はAI生成部分の正確な識別に苦労していることが判明。ビデオ品質、ジャンルへの親しみ、明示的な手がかりが認識に影響。ビデオのAI拡張コンテンツを識別する能力向上に関する洞察を提供する。

title: A Concept at Work: A Review of Motivations, Operationalizations, and Conclusions in VR Research about Presence
authors: Xiao, Cleo and Yu, Difeng and Hornb\ae{}k, Kasper and Bergstr\"{o}m, Joanna
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper reviews virtual reality (VR) presence, emphasizing varying motivations, operationalizations, and conclusions in research. It highlights presence's critical role in enhancing immersive experiences and aligns VR technologies for improved user engagements.
problem_english: Research on presence in VR is fragmented, with diverse motivations and operationalizations leading to inconclusive findings. The lack of standardized methods complicates understanding presence's impact on user experience and technological advancements.
method_english: The paper systematically examines VR literature focusing on presence, classifying and evaluating different research motivations and methods. It uses these analyses to build a cohesive understanding and proposes pathways for harmonizing future presence studies.
results_english: The review identifies key trends in motivations and operationalizations and suggests a unified framework for future VR presence research. This can aid in developing standard methodologies, leading to better insights into presence's effect on VR experiences.
summary_japanese: VR研究におけるプレゼンス概念をレビューし、動機と操作法、結論の多様性を強調。没入体験向上のためのプレゼンスの重要性を示す。
problem_japanese: VRのプレゼンス研究は断片的で、多様な動機と方法論が結論の不一致を招いている。標準化された手法の欠如がユーザー体験への影響理解を難しくしている。
method_japanese: VRの文献を体系的に分析し、プレゼンスに関する研究の動機や手法を分類・評価。統一的な理解構築と今後のプレゼンス研究の調和への道筋を提案する。
results_japanese: レビューは動機と方法の主要な傾向を特定し、未来のプレゼンス研究の統一フレームワークを提案。標準手法の開発支援により、VR体験へのプレゼンスの影響をよりよく理解する手助けとなる可能性。

title: Awareness in Collaborative Mixed-Visual Ability Tangible Programming Activities
authors: Rocha, Filipa and Sim\~{a}o, Hugo and Nogueira, Jo\~{a}o and Neto, Isabel and Guerreiro, Tiago and Nicolau, Hugo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores awareness in collaborative mixed-visual ability tangible programming activities, aiming to improve inclusion and interaction dynamics among participants with different visual capacities.
problem_english: The current programming activities lack effective strategies to accommodate participants with mixed visual abilities, leading to challenges in maintaining awareness and facilitating equitable collaboration, ultimately impacting the learning experience.
method_english: The authors developed and tested a tangible programming platform designed to support collaboration between individuals with varying visual abilities, incorporating tactile elements and auditory feedback to enhance awareness and interactive engagement.
results_english: The results showed enhanced awareness and improved interaction dynamics among participants, demonstrating that the tangible programming approach effectively supports mixed-visual ability collaboration, fostering a more inclusive learning environment.
summary_japanese: 異なる視覚能力を持つ参加者が協力するプログラミング活動での気づきを探り、インクルージョンと相互作用の改善を目指す。
problem_japanese: 現行のプログラミング活動は異なる視覚能力を持つ参加者間の協力に効果的な戦略が欠如しており、気づきと公平な協力の促進が難しく学習体験に影響を及ぼしている。
method_japanese: 著者は、視覚能力が異なる個人間の協力を支援することを目的とした触覚要素と音声フィードバックを組み込んだ物理的プログラミングプラットフォームを開発し、テストした。
results_japanese: 結果は、参加者間の気づきが向上し、相互作用の動態が改善されたことを示し、混合視覚能力協力を効果的に支援し、より包括的な学習環境を促進することを示した。

title: Illusion Spaces in VR: The Interplay Between Size and Taper Angle Perception in Grasping
authors: Zhang, Jian and Johal, Wafa and Knibbe, Jarrod
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines size and taper angle perception in VR environments. The authors study the illusion effects in virtual reality grasping tasks and their implications for object design.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of accurately perceiving size and taper angle in virtual reality environments. These perceptual inaccuracies affect user interaction in VR, particularly concerning grasping tasks.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments in VR, varying objects' sizes and taper angles. They recorded participants' responses and measured perceptual effects on grasping, analyzing data for insights into illusion space consequences.
results_english: Results showed that size and taper angle perception in VR is significantly altered, affecting grasping tasks. Notably, these perceptual changes can be leveraged to design more efficient and intuitive VR interfaces.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、VR環境におけるサイズとテーパー角の知覚を調査し、仮想現実での掴みタスクの錯覚効果とその影響を研究しています。
problem_japanese: VR環境でのサイズとテーパー角の正確な知覚が課題である。これらの知覚の不正確性は、特にVR内での掴みタスクにおけるユーザーのインタラクションに影響を与える。
method_japanese: 著者らはVR内で実験を行い、オブジェクトのサイズとテーパー角を変化させた。参加者の反応を記録し、掴み動作における知覚効果を測定し、錯覚空間の影響に関する洞察を分析した。
results_japanese: 結果は、VRでのサイズとテーパー角の別の知覚が掴みタスクに影響することを示した。これらの知覚の変化を利用して、より効率的で直感的なVRインターフェースの設計が可能である。

title: Immersive Biography: Supporting Intercultural Empathy and Understanding for Displaced Cultural Objects in Virtual Reality
authors: Zhao, Ke and Chen, Ruiqi and Zhang, Xiaziyu and Wang, Chenxi and Chen, Siling and Wang, Xiaoguang and Wang, Yujue and Tong, Xin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores using virtual reality to foster intercultural empathy and understanding for displaced cultural objects, enhancing educational experiences by immersing users in historical biographies that provide contextual significance and emotional resonance.
problem_english: Cultural artifacts are often displaced from their origin, losing context and significance in foreign settings. This detachment hinders individuals from fully understanding and empathizing with the cultural heritage of these objects, making it essential to reconnect them with their cultural narratives.
method_english: The authors developed a VR platform that immerses users in interactive historical biographies of cultural objects. This experience includes storytelling, audio-visual elements, and interactive tasks designed to convey cultural context and evoke emotional engagement with the object's history.
results_english: The VR platform significantly increased users' empathy and understanding for displaced cultural artifacts. It allowed individuals to engage more deeply with the cultural context and significance of the objects, improving their appreciation and emotional connection to the heritage.
summary_japanese: この研究は、バーチャルリアリティを使って文化遺産に対する共感と理解を向上させる方法を探求しています。
problem_japanese: 文化的な遺物はしばしばその起源から離れ、外国の環境でその文脈と重要性を失っています。この切断は、個人がこれらの物の文化遺産を完全に理解し共感することを妨げています。
method_japanese: 作者は、文化的物体の歴史的伝記にユーザーを没入させるVRプラットフォームを開発しました。この体験は、ストーリーテリング、視覚・聴覚要素、歴史の文脈を伝えるためのインタラクティブなタスクを含んでいます。
results_japanese: VRプラットフォームは、移動した文化遺物への共感と理解を大幅に高めました。ユーザーは文化的な文脈と物の重要性により深く関わることができ、遺産への感謝と感情的なつながりを向上させました。

title: ReMirrorFugue: Examining the Emotional Experience of Presence and (Illusory) Communications Across Time
authors: Xiao, Xiao and Noh, Hayoun and Lefevre, Adrien and Li, Lucy and McKee, Holly and Algargoosh, Alaa and Ishii, Hiroshi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ReMirrorFugue explores emotional experiences induced by presence and illusory communication across time through an interactive art installation, aiming to evoke nostalgia and contemplation.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of creating meaningful interactions with digital systems by examining how presence and temporally displaced communication can evoke emotional connections and reflections, enhancing human-computer interaction experiences.
method_english: The authors designed an interactive installation, ReMirrorFugue, allowing users to engage with reflected videos of past interactions, blending visual and auditory feedback to induce introspection and emotional connection with self and others through time.
results_english: Findings indicate that users experience heightened emotions and introspective states when interacting with the installation, suggesting that mirrored interactions and temporally displaced communications effectively evoke nostalgia and self-reflection, enhancing user engagement and emotional depth.
summary_japanese: ReMirrorFugueは、時間を超えた存在感と幻想的なコミュニケーションによる感情体験を探ります。
problem_japanese: デジタルシステムとの意味のあるインタラクションを創出する課題を探り、時間を超えたコミュニケーションが感情的なつながりと内省をどう喚起するかを検証します。
method_japanese: 著者らは、過去のインタラクションの動画を反映させるインスタレーション、ReMirrorFugueを設計し、視覚と聴覚のフィードバックを融合させ、自己や他者との時間を超えた感情的なつながりを誘発します。
results_japanese: 結果は、利用者が共鳴する感情を強化し、内省的状態を引き起こすことを示唆し、感傷と自己反省を効果的に引き出し、利用者の関与と感情の深みを増します。

title: The Fidelity-based Presence Scale (FPS): Modeling the Effects of Fidelity on Sense of Presence
authors: Belga, Jacob and Skarbez, Richard and Hmaiti, Yahya and Chen, Eric J and McMahan, Ryan P. and LaViola, Joseph J.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces the Fidelity-based Presence Scale (FPS), examining how fidelity influences the sense of presence in virtual environments and proposing a model to predict presence based on fidelity factors.
problem_english: Existing measures of presence often overlook the nuanced effects of fidelity in virtual environments, leading to inconsistent assessments of presence. The study aims to address these gaps by developing a model that accurately captures how fidelity levels affect the user's sense of presence.
method_english: The authors propose the Fidelity-based Presence Scale (FPS), which comprehensively analyzes fidelity dimensions in virtual environments. The model is validated through user studies examining variables such as visual fidelity, interactivity, and audio quality, correlating these factors to the sense of presence.
results_english: Results from user studies show a strong correlation between fidelity levels and the sense of presence. The FPS model provides a reliable prediction for presence across varied fidelity conditions, thus enhancing the understanding of presence in virtual environments.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、仮想環境における忠実度が存在感に与える影響を探り、忠実度に基づく存在感予測モデルFPSを提案する。
problem_japanese: 既存の存在感測定は仮想環境における忠実度の影響を十分に考慮しておらず、存在感の評価が一致しないことがある。この問題に対し、本研究では忠実度がユーザーの存在感に及ぼす影響を正確に捉えるモデルを開発する。
method_japanese: 著者らは仮想環境内の忠実度を包括的に分析するFPSを提案。視覚の忠実度やインタラクティブ性、音声品質などの変数を検証し、これらが存在感に与える影響を調査する。
results_japanese: ユーザー研究の結果、忠実度と存在感の間に強い相関が認められた。FPSモデルは多様な忠実度条件において存在感予測の信頼性を提供し、仮想環境での存在感理解を向上させる。

title: When Do We Feel Present in a Virtual Reality? Towards Sensitivity and User Acceptance of Presence Questionnaires
authors: Degenhard, Annalisa and Askari, Ali and Rietzler, Michael and Rukzio, Enrico
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores factors influencing presence in virtual reality environments, aiming to enhance sensitivity and user acceptance of presence questionnaires.
problem_english: Virtual reality presence questionnaires are essential for evaluating immersive experiences, but existing measures often lack sensitivity and are not universally accepted by users. Improving these tools could lead to better design and development of VR systems.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments comparing various presence questionnaires across different VR settings, focusing on user responses and the impact of environmental variables to identify more sensitive and acceptable measures.
results_english: The study revealed that certain questionnaires are more sensitive to changes in VR environments and better accepted by users, suggesting a need for standardized, customizable presence measurement tools.
summary_japanese: VR環境における臨場感に影響する要因を探求し、アンケートの感度と受容性向上を目指す。
problem_japanese: VRの臨場感評価に欠かせないアンケートは、感度が低く、利用者に広く受け入れられていない。これを改善し、VRシステムの設計と開発を向上させる必要がある。
method_japanese: 様々なVR環境で異なるアンケートを比較する実験を行い、環境変数の影響と利用者の反応を調査し、より適した測定法を特定した。
results_japanese: VR環境の変化に敏感で受容性の高いアンケートがあることが判明し、標準化されたカスタマイズ可能な測定ツールの必要性が示唆された。

title: A Multimodal Approach for Targeting Error Detection in Virtual Reality Using Implicit User Behavior
authors: Sendhilnathan, Naveen and Zhang, Ting and Bethge, David and Nebeling, Michael and Grossman, Tovi and Jonker, Tanya R.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper presents a novel approach using multimodal inputs to detect targeting errors in virtual reality based on implicit user behavior, offering enhancements in user interaction accuracy.
problem_english: Detecting targeting errors in virtual reality (VR) environments is crucial for improving user experience and performance. Traditional methods primarily rely on explicit user feedback or basic input methods, which can be intrusive and less accurate. There is a need for a more effective and non-intrusive approach to accurately detect targeting errors based on user behavior in VR.
method_english: The authors develop a multimodal approach that integrates various implicit user behaviors such as gaze, gesture, and motion data to predict targeting errors in VR. They utilize advanced machine learning algorithms to process and analyze these multimodal inputs, ensuring the system is responsive and accurate in real-time scenarios.
results_english: The proposed multimodal approach significantly enhances the accuracy of targeting error detection in VR environments compared to traditional methods. The study's results demonstrate the system's potential to improve user interaction by providing more seamless and precise feedback, ultimately leading to a better overall user experience in VR applications.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、マルチモーダル入力を用いてVRにおけるターゲットエラーを検出する新手法を提案し、ユーザーインタラクションの精度向上を図る。
problem_japanese: VR環境でのターゲットエラー検出はユーザー体験とパフォーマンス向上に不可欠である。従来の方法は主にユーザーの明示的なフィードバックや基本的な入力手段に依存しており、侵襲的で精度が低い場合がある。ユーザー行動に基づく非侵襲的で精度の高い検出方法が必要である。
method_japanese: 著者らは視線、ジェスチャー、動きデータなどのユーザーの暗黙の行動を統合し、VRでのターゲットエラーを予測するマルチモーダルアプローチを開発する。先進的な機械学習アルゴリズムを使用して、これらの様々な入力をリアルタイムで処理・分析する。
results_japanese: 提案されたマルチモーダルアプローチは、従来の方法と比べてVR環境でのターゲットエラー検出の精度を大幅に向上させる。研究の結果は、ユーザーインタラクションの改善とVRアプリケーション全体のユーザー体験向上の可能性を示している。

title: Estimating the Effects of Encumbrance and Walking on Mixed Reality Interaction
authors: Li, Tinghui and Velloso, Eduardo and Withana, Anusha and Sarsenbayeva, Zhanna
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates the effects of physical encumbrance and walking on user interaction in mixed reality environments. By evaluating interaction techniques under these conditions, insights can inform the design of more effective MR interfaces.
problem_english: Mixed Reality (MR) technology requires users to perform tasks in physical spaces, often constrained by environmental factors like walking and carrying items. These encumbrances can affect user interaction with MR systems. Understanding how such factors impact interaction can guide the development of more intuitive and ergonomic MR systems, improving user experience and usability.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-method approach, combining quantitative measures of user performance with qualitative feedback. Participants were tasked with completing MR interaction tasks while experiencing varying levels of encumbrance and walking. Data were analyzed to assess impacts on task performance, identifying trends and user challenges.
results_english: Results indicated significant effects of both walking and encumbrance on interaction efficiency and user experience in mixed reality environments. The findings underscore the necessity for adaptive MR systems that mitigate these effects, enhancing interaction ease and accuracy. Suggestions were made for MR design improvements to accommodate real-world user conditions.
summary_japanese: 物理的な負荷と歩行がMR環境でのユーザー操作に与える影響を調査し、より効果的なMRインターフェース設計の指針を提供。
problem_japanese: MR技術は物理空間でのタスク遂行を必要とし、歩行や持ち物による負荷がユーザー操作に影響を及ぼすことがある。こうした要因が操作に与える影響を理解することで、直感的で人間工学に適したMRシステムの開発が促進される。
method_japanese: 定量的なユーザーパフォーマンス測定と定性的なフィードバックを組み合わせた混合法を使用。参加者はさまざまな負荷と歩行下でMR操作タスクを実施し、その影響をデータ分析で評価。
results_japanese: 歩行と負荷がMR環境での操作効率とユーザー体験に大きく影響することを示した。これらを軽減する適応型MRシステムの必要性を提案し、操作性の向上策を提示。

title: Exploring Joint Effects of Locomotion Continuity and Wayfinding Assistance in Non-Embodied VR Game Navigation
authors: Niu, Ruowen and Zheng, Ruishen and Liang, Chen and Liu, Minghui
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores the interactions between locomotion continuity and wayfinding assistance in non-embodied VR game navigation, analyzing user experiences to enhance efficiency and experience.
problem_english: Navigating virtual environments can be challenging without physical embodiment, impacting user experience and efficiency. The study examines how locomotion continuity and wayfinding assistance interact to influence users' navigation in VR games, aiming to optimize these experiences.
method_english: Researchers conducted controlled experiments in VR games using various setups of locomotion and wayfinding assistance. Data collected on user navigation performance and experience were analyzed to evaluate interaction effects and identify optimal configurations.
results_english: The study found significant joint effects between locomotion continuity and wayfinding assistance. Certain combinations enhanced user navigation, improving both efficiency and experience, suggesting optimized configurations for VR environments.
summary_japanese: VRゲームのナビゲーションにおける歩行の連続性と道案内支援の相互作用を探り、ユーザー体験の効率と質を向上させる研究。
problem_japanese: 仮想環境でのナビゲーションは物理的な身体化がない場合、ユーザー体験や効率に影響を与える。研究ではVRゲームでの歩行の連続性と道案内支援がどのように相互作用し、ナビゲーションを最適化するかを探る。
method_japanese: 研究者はVRゲームで歩行と道案内支援の異なるセットアップを使用した制御実験を実施。ユーザーのナビゲーション性能と体験に関するデータを分析し、最適な設定を特定。
results_japanese: 歩行の連続性と道案内支援の間に有意な相互作用があることを発見。特定の組み合わせがユーザーのナビゲーションを向上させ、効率と体験を改善することが示唆された。

title: HeadTurner: Enhancing Viewing Range and Comfort of using Virtual and Mixed-Reality Headsets while Lying Down via Assisted Shoulder and Head Actuation
authors: Wu, En-Huei and Cheng, Po-Yun and Hsu, Che-Wei and Han, Cheng Hsin and Lee, Pei Chen and Fan, Chia-An and Kuo, Yu Chia and Hu, Kai-Jing and Chen, Yu and Chen, Mike Y.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: HeadTurner aims to enhance the viewing comfort and range for VR/MR headset users while lying down. It utilizes assisted shoulder and head actuation to address physical constraints and discomforts.
problem_english: Virtual and mixed-reality headsets often face challenges in user comfort and viewing range limitations, especially when users are in a lying position. This discomfort stems from the imbalance and constraints posed by current headset designs, which are not optimized for recumbent usage.
method_english: The study introduces assisted shoulder and head actuation systems specifically designed for lying down. These systems adjust the headset's position dynamically, aligning it to the user's posture and reducing strain on the neck and shoulders, enhancing user comfort and maximizing the viewing range.
results_english: The implementation of HeadTurner led to significant improvements in user comfort and extended the viewing range of VR/MR headsets during lying down sessions. Users reported reduced neck and shoulder strain and a more immersive experience, demonstrating the system's effectiveness.
summary_japanese: HeadTurnerは、VR/MRヘッドセット使用者にとっての快適さと視野範囲を向上させる技術で、肩と頭のアシスト駆動を利用。
problem_japanese: VR/MRヘッドセットは横になった状態での使用における快適性と視野範囲の制限に課題がある。これらの不快感は、現行デザインが寝転び状態に最適化されていないことから生じる。
method_japanese: この研究では、横になった状態に特化した肩と頭のアシスト駆動システムを導入。これにより、ヘッドセットの位置を動的に調整し、ユーザーの姿勢に合わせて首と肩のストレスを軽減する。
results_japanese: HeadTurnerの実装により、横になった時のVR/MRヘッドセットの使用でユーザーの快適さが向上し、視野範囲が拡大。ユーザーは肩や首の負担軽減を報告し、効果が実証された。

title: Juggling Extra Limbs: Identifying Control Strategies for Supernumerary Multi-Arms in Virtual Reality
authors: Zhou, Hongyu and Kip, Tom and Dong, Yihao and Bianchi, Andrea and Sarsenbayeva, Zhanna and Withana, Anusha
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines control strategies for virtual reality-based supernumerary multi-arm systems, unveiling novel insights regarding user interactions and challenges in managing extra limbs and their behavioral effects.
problem_english: There is limited understanding of how to effectively control supernumerary limbs in virtual environments, particularly when users need to manage multiple extra arms simultaneously. This study aims to explore strategies to overcome the challenges posed by these virtual extensions.
method_english: The researchers conducted VR experiments, employing different control strategies for handling supernumerary multi-arm systems. Participants interacted with tasks requiring coordination of additional limbs, allowing analysis of strategy effectiveness and user behavior patterns.
results_english: The study found that intuitive control strategies significantly improved task performance when managing extra virtual limbs. Insights from user behavior analysis assisted in refining control mechanisms, enhancing the user experience and interaction in virtual environments.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、VRにおける超数腕システムの制御戦略を検証し、追加の腕の管理に関するユーザーの相互作用を明らかにする。
problem_japanese: 仮想環境での超数肢の効果的な制御方法に関する理解は限られており、特に複数の追加腕を同時に管理する際の困難がある。本研究はこれらの課題を解決する戦略を探求する。
method_japanese: 研究者はVR実験を実施し、超数腕システムの制御戦略を使用して追加の肢を調整するタスクでの参加者の行動を分析し、効果を評価した。
results_japanese: 直感的な制御戦略が追加の仮想肢を管理する際のタスク性能を大幅に向上させることが判明した。ユーザー行動の分析が制御メカニズムの最適化に役立った。

title: Modes of Interaction with Navigation Apps
authors: Jung, Ju Yeon and Steinberger, Tom
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines diverse user interaction modes with navigation apps, aiming to enhance usability and user satisfaction. The study identifies factors influencing preferences and introduces novel interaction techniques.
problem_english: Current navigation apps often lack adaptability to diverse user needs, leading to compromised usability and satisfaction. Limited interaction modes may not cater to different contexts or preferences, necessitating an exploration of new modes for improved user experience.
method_english: The study employs a mixed-methods approach involving user surveys, observational studies, and prototype testing. These methods allow for comprehensive analysis of user behavior and preferences, leading to the development and evaluation of innovative interaction techniques for navigation apps.
results_english: The findings reveal that users prefer customizable interaction modes. Novel techniques developed showed enhanced usability and user satisfaction compared to traditional methods. These insights can guide the design of future navigation apps to better meet diverse user needs.
summary_japanese: 本論文はナビアプリの多様なユーザーインタラクションモードを探究し、利用性と満足度向上を目指す。影響要因を特定し、新しい技術を紹介。
problem_japanese: 現在のナビゲーションアプリは多様なユーザーニーズに適応できず、使い勝手と満足度が低下する。限定されたインタラクションモードは異なるコンテキストや嗜好に対応できないため、新しいモードの模索が必要。
method_japanese: ユーザー調査、観察研究、プロトタイプテストを用いた混合手法で研究。ユーザーの行動と嗜好を総合的に分析し、新技術の開発と評価を行う。
results_japanese: 調査結果から、ユーザーはカスタマイズ可能なモードを好むことが判明。新技術は従来よりも使いやすく、満足度が向上し、将来の設計に役立つ可能性あり。

title: On the Go with AR: Attention to Virtual and Physical Targets while Varying Augmentation Density
authors: Kim, You-Jin and Kumaran, Radha and Luo, Jingjing and Bullock, Tom and Giesbrecht, Barry and H\"{o}llerer, Tobias
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the influence of augmented reality (AR) density on users' attention to both virtual and physical targets while on the move. The findings aim to better understand the interaction between AR density and user attention, enhancing AR usability.
problem_english: Augmented reality (AR) applications often struggle with balancing the density of virtual information with users' ability to attend to both virtual and physical environments effectively. Understanding how AR density influences user attention is crucial for improving AR usability on the go.
method_english: The research conducted experiments where participants navigated environments with varying AR density levels. Attention allocation to virtual and physical targets was measured using eye-tracking technology, providing insights into how different densities impact user focus and interaction in AR settings.
results_english: Results showed that higher AR densities can overwhelm users, leading to decreased attention to physical targets. Conversely, lower densities may promote balanced attention distribution. The study offers guidance on optimizing AR density to enhance user experience and maintain effective interactions with both virtual and physical targets.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、移動中にAR密度が仮想および物理的ターゲットへの注意に与える影響を調査し、ARの操作性向上を目指します。
problem_japanese: ARアプリケーションは、仮想情報の密度をユーザーの注視能力とバランスを取ることがしばしば困難です。AR密度がユーザーの注意にどのように影響するかを理解することが重要です。
method_japanese: 参加者が異なるAR密度環境を移動する実験を行い、視線追跡技術で仮想と物理的ターゲットへの注意配分を測定し、異なる密度の影響を分析しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、高密度のARがユーザーを圧倒し物理的ターゲットへの注意を減少させることを示しましたが、低密度はバランスの良い注意配分を促進します。研究はAR密度の最適化指針を提供します。

title: "What Would I Want to Make? Probably Everything": Practices and Speculations of Blind and Low Vision Tactile Graphics Creators
authors: Clepper, Gina and McDonnell, Emma J. and Findlater, Leah and Peek, Nadya
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates practices and speculations of blind and low vision tactile graphics creators, aiming to understand their needs and aspirations to design effective tactile graphics.
problem_english: Blind and low vision individuals face challenges in accessing visual information. Tactile graphics can bridge this gap, but the creation process lacks insights into what creators need and aspire to make for effective design.
method_english: The study involves qualitative interviews and workshops with blind and low vision tactile graphics creators to gather insights into their creative practices, preferences, challenges, and aspirations for making tactile graphics.
results_english: Results show a variety of creative strategies, collaborative practices, and tools used by creators. Findings suggest the need for design tools accommodating different styles and fostering community collaboration to enhance tactile graphic design.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、視覚障害者の触覚グラフィック作成者の実践と将来の展望を調査し、有効なデザインを理解することを目的としています。
problem_japanese: 視覚障害者は視覚情報へのアクセスに困難を抱えています。触覚グラフィックはそのギャップを埋める可能性がありますが、作成プロセスにおいて、効果的なデザインをするために創作者が必要とする洞察が欠けています。
method_japanese: 視覚障害者の触覚グラフィック作成者に対する定性インタビューとワークショップを通じ、彼らの創造的実践、好み、課題、制作への展望を収集しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、創作者による多様な創造戦略、共同実践、使用ツールを示しました。スタイルに応じたデザインツールやコミュニティコラボレーションの強化が必要とされることが示唆されています。

title: How Users Who are Blind or Low Vision Play Mobile Games: Perceptions, Challenges, and Strategies
authors: Ran, Zihe and Li, Xiyu and Xiao, Qing and Fan, Xianzhe and Li, Franklin Mingzhe and Wang, Yanyun and Lu, Zhicong
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study explores the experiences of blind or low vision users when playing mobile games, identifying challenges and strategies used to enhance their gaming experience.
problem_english: Despite the growing mobile gaming industry, there is limited accessibility for blind or low vision users. These players face significant challenges due to a lack of inclusive game design, hindering their experience and participation in gaming. Understanding their unique needs and strategies to overcome these barriers is essential.
method_english: The study employed qualitative research methods, including semi-structured interviews and surveys with blind or low vision users. Data collection focused on understanding their gaming habits, challenges faced, and strategies utilized to navigate these challenges to gain insights into their gaming experiences.
results_english: The findings revealed various challenges, such as inaccessible interfaces and inadequate sound design. Participants shared strategies like using screen readers and external audio cues to improve gameplay. The study highlights the need for more inclusive game design to accommodate blind or low vision users effectively.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、視覚障害者がモバイルゲームをする際の体験を探り、課題と戦略を明らかにします。
problem_japanese: モバイルゲーム業界の成長にもかかわらず、視覚障害者向けのアクセシビリティが限られています。インクルーシブなゲームデザインが不足しており、彼らの体験と参加が妨げられています。これらの課題を克服するためのニーズと戦略を理解することが重要です。
method_japanese: 半構造化インタビューとアンケートを用いて視覚障害者からデータを収集しました。データ収集は、彼らのゲーム習慣、直面する課題、課題を乗り越えるための戦略に焦点を当て、彼らのゲーム体験に関する洞察を得ることに集中しました。
results_japanese: 調査結果では、視覚障害者が直面する課題として、インターフェースのアクセシビリティ不足や音響設計の不十分さが浮き彫りにされました。参加者はスクリーンリーダーや外部音声を使ったゲームプレイ改善策を共有しました。

title: I-Scratch: Independent Slide Creation With Auditory Comment and Haptic Interface for the Blind and Visually Impaired
authors: Kim, Gyeongdeok and Lim, Chungman and Park, Gunhyuk
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: I-Scratch is a novel tool designed to assist blind and visually impaired individuals in creating slides independently using auditory comments and a haptic interface.
problem_english: The primary issue addressed by this research is the lack of accessible slide creation tools that enable blind and visually impaired individuals to independently create, edit, and present slide content, which is critical for academic and professional success.
method_english: The I-Scratch system integrates auditory comments with a haptic interface, enabling users to input and organize slide content through tactile feedback and voice guidance, improving their ability to independently create presentation materials.
results_english: Results demonstrate that I-Scratch significantly enhances the ability of blind and visually impaired users to create slides independently, reducing the reliance on sighted assistance and increasing accessibility in professional and academic environments.
summary_japanese: I-Scratchは視覚障害者が音声コメントと触覚インターフェースを用いて独自にスライドを作成できる新しいツールです。
problem_japanese: 研究が取り組む課題は、視覚障害者がスライドを独立して作成・編集・提示する機能を持つアクセシブルなツールの不足であり、学術的および職業的成功に不可欠です。
method_japanese: I-Scratchシステムは音声コメントと触覚インターフェースを統合し、ユーザーが触覚フィードバックと音声ガイドを通じてスライド内容を入力・整理する能力を向上させます。
results_japanese: I-Scratchは視覚障害者のスライド独立作成能力を向上させ、視覚支援への依存を減少し、専門的・学術的環境でのアクセシビリティを高めます。

title: Light My Way: Developing and Exploring a Multimodal Interface to Assist People With Visual Impairments to Exit Highly Automated Vehicles
authors: Meinhardt, Luca-Maxim and Weilke, Lina Madlin and Elhaidary, Maryam and von Abel, Julia and Fink, Paul D. S. and Rietzler, Michael and Colley, Mark and Rukzio, Enrico
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study introduces a multimodal interface to aid visually impaired individuals in exiting automated vehicles. It evaluates the system's effectiveness in enhancing accessibility and navigation.
problem_english: Highly automated vehicles pose exit challenges for visually impaired people, potentially hindering their adoption and reducing accessibility. Addressing these challenges requires designing intuitive interfaces that support safe and efficient navigation during vehicle exiting.
method_english: Developing a multimodal interface employing auditory, tactile, and gestural cues to assist visually impaired users in safely exiting highly automated vehicles. The interface's efficacy is tested through experimental trials with feedback from participants.
results_english: Experimental results indicate improved exit experiences for visually impaired users, highlighting the multimodal interface's potential in enhancing accessibility and navigation within highly automated vehicles.
summary_japanese: 視覚障害者が自動車から安全に降りられるようにするマルチモーダルインターフェースを開発し、その有効性を評価した。
problem_japanese: 自動車からの降車は視覚障害者にとって困難であり、これが普及の妨げやアクセスの制限につながる可能性があるため、直観的なインターフェース設計が必要とされている。
method_japanese: 視覚障害者が自動車から安全に降りるために聴覚、触覚およびジェスチャーによる支援を行うマルチモーダルインターフェースを開発し、実験と参加者からのフィードバックで有効性をテストした。
results_japanese: 実験結果から、マルチモーダルインターフェースは視覚障害者の降車体験を改善し、アクセスとナビゲーションを向上させる可能性があることが示された。

title: ScreenAudit: Detecting Screen Reader Accessibility Errors in Mobile Apps Using Large Language Models
authors: Zhong, Mingyuan and Chen, Ruolin and Chen, Xia and Fogarty, James and Wobbrock, Jacob O.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: ScreenAudit leverages large language models to detect screen reader accessibility errors in mobile apps, enhancing inclusivity for users with disabilities.
problem_english: The challenges of detecting accessibility errors in mobile apps often lead to screen reader barriers for people with disabilities, hindering their app usage and leading to exclusion from digital ecosystems.
method_english: ScreenAudit employs large language models to analyze mobile app interfaces, identifying screen reader accessibility discrepancies by simulating app interaction and evaluating element descriptions.
results_english: ScreenAudit successfully identified multiple screen reader accessibility errors across various mobile apps, demonstrating its capability to enhance app inclusivity and mitigate barriers faced by people with disabilities.
summary_japanese: ScreenAuditは、LLMを活用してモバイルアプリのスクリーンリーダーアクセシビリティエラーを検出し、障害者のインクルーシビティを強化します。
problem_japanese: モバイルアプリにおけるアクセシビリティの欠陥検出は困難であり、障害者によるアプリ利用の障壁となり、デジタルエコシステムからの排除を招く。
method_japanese: ScreenAuditはLLMを使用してモバイルアプリのインターフェースを分析し、アプリの対話をシミュレーションして要素の説明を評価しながらスクリーンリーダーの不一致を特定します。
results_japanese: ScreenAuditは多くのモバイルアプリでのスクリーンリーダーアクセシビリティエラーを成功裏に特定し、障害者が直面する障壁を軽減することでアプリのインクルーシビティを強化する能力を示しました。

title: The Impact of Generative AI Coding Assistants on Developers Who Are Visually Impaired
authors: Flores-Saviaga, Claudia and Hanrahan, Benjamin V. and Imteyaz, Kashif and Clarke, Steven and Savage*, Saiph
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the impact of generative AI coding assistants on visually impaired developers, focusing on their experiences, challenges, and enhancements in accessibility and coding efficiency.
problem_english: There is limited research on how generative AI coding assistants affect developers who are visually impaired. Traditional coding practices present accessibility challenges for these developers, necessitating an understanding of how such AI tools can support their coding activities and improve their productivity and accessibility in the software development field.
method_english: The study utilized qualitative methods, including interviews and observational studies, with visually impaired developers who use generative AI coding assistants. It aimed to capture detailed experiences, challenges, and any improvements in their coding efficiency and accessibility, providing insights into their interaction with these AI tools.
results_english: The findings indicate that generative AI coding assistants positively impact visually impaired developers by enhancing code completion efficiency and reducing cognitive load. However, some accessibility barriers remain, necessitating further refinement of these tools to fully cater to the specific needs of visually impaired developers.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、生成AIコーディングアシスタントが視覚障害を持つ開発者に与える影響を、体験、課題、効率向上に焦点を当てて検討した。
problem_japanese: 生成AIコーディングアシスタントが視覚障害のある開発者に与える影響に関する研究は限られている。従来のコーディング手法はこれらの開発者にアクセスの課題をもたらし、AIツールがどのようにコーディング活動を支え、効率とアクセシビリティを向上させるかの理解が必要である。
method_japanese: 研究は、生成AIコーディングアシスタントを利用する視覚障害を持つ開発者に対するインタビューや観察研究などの質的手法を使用し、効率やアクセシビリティの向上、およびこれらのAIツールとのやり取りについて深い洞察を提供した。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、生成AIコーディングアシスタントがコードの完成効率を向上させ、認知負荷を軽減することで視覚障害のある開発者にとってプラスの影響を持つことを示した。しかし、一部のアクセシビリティの障壁が残っており、これらのツールのさらなる改良が必要である。

title: The Sky is the Limit: Understanding How Generative AI can Enhance Screen Reader Users' Experience with Productivity Applications
authors: Perera, Minoli and Ananthanarayan, Swamy and Goncu, Cagatay and Marriott, Kim
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores how generative AI can improve screen reader users' experience with productivity applications by overcoming existing accessibility challenges and enhancing functionality.
problem_english: Screen reader users face significant challenges in using productivity applications due to inadequacies in current accessibility features. These limitations hinder their efficiency and ability to fully interact with digital content, creating barriers to workflow and productivity.
method_english: The study employs user-centered design and prototyping to integrate generative AI models into productivity applications. It focuses on understanding user needs and iteratively testing AI-enhanced features to evaluate their impact on accessibility for screen reader users.
results_english: The integration of generative AI improves interaction experiences for screen reader users, leading to enhanced accessibility, more efficient workflows, and a broader range of functionalities within productivity applications.
summary_japanese: この論文は、生成AIがスクリーンリーダーユーザーの生産性アプリの体験を改善する方法を探る。
problem_japanese: スクリーンリーダーユーザーは、現在のアクセシビリティ機能の不十分さにより生産性アプリの使用に課題を抱えており、効率の低下やデジタルコンテンツへの完全なアクセスが妨げられている。
method_japanese: ユーザー中心設計とプロトタイピングを用いて生産性アプリに生成AIモデルを統合し、ユーザーのニーズを理解しつつ、AI機能の影響を評価する。
results_japanese: 生成AIの統合によりスクリーンリーダーユーザーの対話体験が向上し、生産性アプリでのアクセシビリティと効率的な作業フローが強化される。

title: AVEC: An Assessment of Visual Encoding Ability in Visualization Construction
authors: Ge, Lily W. and Cui, Yuan and Kay, Matthew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces AVEC, a tool to evaluate visual encoding skills in visualization tasks. It measures an individual's ability to translate data into visual representations.
problem_english: Current visualization tools lack comprehensive methods to assess individuals' capabilities in visual encoding. This gap hinders personalized feedback and development in visual data representation skills, leading to potential inefficiencies in understanding and leveraging visualization tools effectively.
method_english: AVEC utilizes a series of visualization construction tasks that require participants to apply visual encoding skills. The tool provides dynamic feedback based on performance, allowing for a tailored assessment of skills. This method offers insights into strengths and weaknesses in visual encoding abilities.
results_english: The study demonstrates AVEC's effectiveness in evaluating visual encoding skills with a high degree of accuracy. Participants received meaningful feedback that helped identify specific areas for improvement. The tool showed potential for use in educational settings to enhance visualization literacy.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、視覚エンコーディング能力を評価するツールAVECを紹介します。データを視覚的に表現する能力を測定します。
problem_japanese: 現行の視覚化ツールは視覚エンコーディング能力を総合的に評価する方法が不足しており、個々へのフィードバックや視覚データ表現技術の向上が困難で、ツールの効果的な理解と利用が困難です。
method_japanese: AVECは視覚エンコーディングスキルを要求する視覚化構築タスクを活用。パフォーマンスに基づく動的なフィードバックを提供し、スキルの強みと弱点を分析する。
results_japanese: AVECは視覚エンコーディングスキルを正確に評価。参加者は改善が必要な特定分野を認識する有意義なフィードバックを受けた。教育での視覚化リテラシー向上の可能性を示す。

title: Chartist: Task-driven Eye Movement Control for Chart Reading
authors: Shi, Danqing and Wang, Yao and Bai, Yunpeng and Bulling, Andreas and Oulasvirta, Antti
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Chartist introduces task-driven eye movement control to enhance chart reading efficiency. It uses a computational model that learns optimal eye movement strategies based on task requirements.
problem_english: Traditional chart reading relies heavily on the reader's inherent visual strategies, which may not align with the task's requirements, leading to inefficiencies. Existing methods lack the capability to adaptively control eye movements tailored to specific tasks, resulting in suboptimal performance during data interpretation.
method_english: The authors propose Chartist, a system employing a computational model that predicts optimal eye movements for specific chart reading tasks. The model is trained using machine learning to understand and adapt to various task demands, thereby guiding the reader's focus through precise gaze control mechanisms.
results_english: Chartist demonstrated significantly improved efficiency in chart interpretation by aligning eye movements with task demands. User studies show enhanced accuracy and reduced cognitive load compared to traditional methods, establishing the model's effectiveness in optimizing task-driven visual analyses.
summary_japanese: Chartistは、タスクに応じた視線制御でチャート読み取り効率を向上させる手法を提案します。
problem_japanese: 従来のチャート読み取りは、読者の視覚戦略に依存しており、タスクの要求と一致せず効率が悪いことがあります。現在の方法は、特定タスクに合わせた視線制御が欠如しており、データ解釈で最適なパフォーマンスを発揮できません。
method_japanese: チャーティストは、特定のチャート読み取りタスクに対する最適な視線移動を予測する計算モデルを用いる。モデルは機械学習を用いて訓練され、様々なタスク要件に適応して読者の注視を制御します。
results_japanese: チャーティストは、タスクに応じた視線制御によりチャート解釈の効率を大幅に改善した。従来の方法に比べ、精度が向上し認知負荷が軽減されたことが利用者研究で確認され、モデルの効果が証明されました。

title: How Visualization Designers Perceive and Use Inspiration
authors: Baigelenov, Ali and Shukla, Prakash and Parsons, Paul
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how visualization designers understand and use inspiration in their creative processes, focusing on methods and sources of inspiration in design.
problem_english: Understanding how visualization designers perceive and utilize inspiration is crucial for enhancing their creative processes. However, there is limited insight into the specific methods and sources designers employ, which restricts our ability to support their creative work effectively.
method_english: The researchers conducted qualitative interviews with professional visualization designers to investigate their experiences and strategies for seeking and applying inspiration. This method helped uncover personal and contextual factors influencing designers’ inspiration usage.
results_english: The study found that visualization designers use a variety of inspiration sources, both digital and physical. They emphasize the importance of context and relevance in selecting inspiration sources and reported using inspiration to enhance creativity and solve design challenges.
summary_japanese: 研究は、視覚化デザイナーがインスピレーションを創造過程でどのように理解し利用するかを探ります。
problem_japanese: 視覚化デザイナーがインスピレーションを認識し活用する方法を理解することは、彼らの創造的プロセスを改善するために重要です。ただし、具体的な方法や情報源に関する洞察が限定されており、効果的な支援が妨げられています。
method_japanese: 研究者は視覚化デザインの専門家に対して質的インタビューを行い、彼らのインスピレーションの探求と適用方法に関する経験を調査しました。この手法により、個人的およびコンテクスト要因が明らかになりました。
results_japanese: 視覚化デザイナーは、デジタルおよび物理的な多様なインスピレーション源を使用します。インスピレーション源の選定には、文脈と関連性が重要とされ、創造性の向上やデザイン課題の解決に役立てられていることがわかりました。

title: Libra: An Interaction Model for Data Visualization
authors: Zhao, Yue and Wang, Yunhai and Luo, Xu and Wang, Yanyan and Fekete, Jean-Daniel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Libra proposes an interaction model for data visualization, improving user engagement and interpretability. By providing intuitive interface techniques, it aims to enhance dynamic data exploration and manipulation.
problem_english: The challenge in data visualization lies in creating interfaces that are both engaging and intuitive, allowing users to interpret and manipulate complex data sets effectively. Current models often fail to address dynamic interaction needs, impeding efficient data exploration.
method_english: Libra introduces a novel interaction model that leverages intuitive visual and interactive techniques, enabling users to dynamically explore and manipulate data. It focuses on improving user experience by integrating context-aware functionalities and adaptive visualization strategies.
results_english: The evaluation of Libra demonstrates significant improvements in user engagement and data interaction efficiency, enabling more accurate data interpretation and decision-making. User studies show enhanced satisfaction and reduced cognitive load during data exploration tasks.
summary_japanese: Libraはデータ視覚化の新しいインタラクションモデルを提案し、ユーザーエンゲージメントと解釈可能性を向上させることを目的としています。
problem_japanese: データ視覚化における課題は、ユーザーが複雑なデータセットを効果的に解釈・操作できるような、直感的で魅力的なインタフェースを設計することです。
method_japanese: Libraは直感的な視覚およびインタラクティブ手法を用いた新しいインタラクションモデルを導入。ユーザー体験を向上させるため、コンテキスト対応機能と適応視覚化戦略を統合。
results_japanese: Libraの評価では、ユーザーエンゲージメントとデータインタラクション効率の向上が確認され、データ解釈と意思決定においてより正確な結果をもたらすことが示されました。

title: Lost in Magnitudes: Exploring Visualization Designs for Large Value Ranges
authors: Batziakoudi, Katerina and Cabric, Florent and Rey, St\'{e}phanie and Fekete, Jean-Daniel
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores visualization designs for effectively presenting data with large value ranges, addressing challenges in human perception and comprehension.
problem_english: Visualizing data with large value ranges poses significant challenges due to human perception limitations, making it difficult for users to accurately interpret such data representations.
method_english: The authors examine various visualization techniques, employing both qualitative and quantitative assessments to evaluate their effectiveness in representing data with large value ranges.
results_english: Results indicate that specific visualization designs can enhance user comprehension and accuracy when interpreting large value ranges, highlighting the importance of tailored visualization techniques.
summary_japanese: 大きな値の範囲を含むデータの視覚化デザインを探求し、人間の知覚と理解の課題に対処する。
problem_japanese: 大きな値の範囲を持つデータの視覚化は、人間の知覚の限界により、データの正確な解釈が困難となる重大な課題を提起する。
method_japanese: 著者は様々な視覚化技術を検討し、定性的評価と定量的評価を用いて、大きな値の範囲を持つデータの表現力を評価した。
results_japanese: 結果は、大きな値の範囲を解釈する際のユーザーの理解と正確性を向上させる特定の視覚化デザインの重要性を示している。

title: Seeing Eye to AI? Applying Deep-Feature-Based Similarity Metrics to Information Visualization
authors: Long, Sheng and Chatzimparmpas, Angelos and Alexander, Emma and Kay, Matthew and Hullman, Jessica
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores using deep-feature-based similarity metrics, typically employed in image recognition, for evaluating information visualization designs to identify perceptual similarities.
problem_english: The challenge is that traditional methods for evaluating visualization designs mainly rely on manual inspection or user studies, which can be time-consuming and not scalable. There's a need for automated methods to evaluate perceptual similarities between visualizations efficiently.
method_english: The authors apply deep-feature-based similarity metrics, commonly used in image recognition, to the field of information visualization. This involves leveraging deep neural networks to automatically compute perceptual similarities between different visualization designs.
results_english: The study shows that deep-feature-based similarity metrics can effectively identify perceptual similarities in visualization designs, correlating well with human judgments, and offer a scalable, automated alternative to traditional evaluation methods.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、画像認識で使用される深層特徴ベースの類似性メトリクスを活用し、情報可視化設計の評価に適用する手法を探求します。
problem_japanese: 従来の可視化設計の評価方法は主に手動検査やユーザー調査に依存しており、時間がかかり、スケーラブルではありません。視覚化間の知覚的類似性を効率的に評価する自動手法が求められています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、情報可視化の分野において、画像認識で一般的な深層特徴ベースの類似性メトリクスを適用します。これは、異なる可視化設計間の知覚的類似性を自動的に計算するためにディープニューラルネットワークを活用するものです。
results_japanese: 研究により、深層特徴ベースの類似性メトリクスが視覚化設計の知覚的類似性を効果的に特定でき、人間の判断とよく相関し、従来の評価方法に対するスケーラブルで自動化された代替手法を提供することが示されました。

title: Seeing Through the Overlap: The Impact of Color and Opacity on Depth Order Perception in Visualization
authors: Meng, Zhiyuan and Yang, Yunpeng and Zeng, Qiong and Lu, Kecheng and Lu, Lin and Tu, Changhe and Yang, Fumeng and Wang, Yunhai
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates how color and opacity affect depth order perception in visualizations. Experiments were conducted to understand user judgments on depth order, revealing significant influences of color and opacity settings on perception accuracy.
problem_english: Determining depth order in visualizations is often complicated by overlapping elements. The problem is exacerbated by variations in color and opacity, which can mislead users. Understanding the impact of these visual features is crucial for designing effective visualizations that aid accurate depth order perception.
method_english: The authors conducted controlled experiments to evaluate user perception of depth order in various visualization settings. They manipulated color and opacity of overlapping elements and analyzed how these factors affected participants' judgments about which element was in front or behind. Data was collected and statistically analyzed for accuracy and perception trends.
results_english: Results showed that both color and opacity significantly influence depth order perception. Certain color combinations and opacity levels improved accuracy, allowing users to correctly identify the front element more often. The findings suggest design recommendations for visualizations that enhance depth perception accuracy.
summary_japanese: 色と不透明度が視覚化における深さ順序認識に与える影響を研究し、正確な認識に重要な影響があることを発見しました。
problem_japanese: 視覚化における重なった要素の深さ順序を判断するのは困難であり、色や不透明度の変化は誤解を招く可能性があります。これらの視覚的特徴の影響を理解することは、正確な順序認識を支援する効果的な視覚化の設計にとって重要です。
method_japanese: 著者は、色と不透明度を操作して、さまざまな視覚化設定でのユーザーの深さ順序認識を評価するために制御実験を行いました。データを収集し、参加者の判断の正確性と認識傾向を統計的に分析しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、色と不透明度の両方が深さ順序認識に大きな影響を与えることを示しました。特定の色の組み合わせと不透明度レベルが正確性を向上させ、前の要素を正確に識別できました。視覚化設計への提言を示しています。

title: A Novel Lens on Metacognition in Visualization
authors: Chen, Mengyu and Yang, Andrew and Min, Seungchan and Hamilton, Kristy A and Wall, Emily
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores a new approach to understanding metacognition in data visualization, emphasizing how individuals reflect on and adjust their cognitive strategies when interpreting complex graphics.
problem_english: Metacognition in visualization is underexplored, and understanding how individuals apply their cognitive strategies when interpreting visual data remains unclear. The lack of insights into metacognitive processes in this context hampers the development of more effective visualization tools.
method_english: The authors employ a mixed-methods approach combining qualitative interviews with quantitative eye-tracking data to analyze users’ metacognitive processes while interacting with various visualizations, aiming to identify strategies that enhance comprehension.
results_english: The study reveals key insights into metacognitive strategies used in visualization, including self-questioning and adaptive strategy shifts. These findings contribute to developing better visualization tools that can support users' metacognitive processes more effectively.
summary_japanese: 本論文はデータ視覚化におけるメタ認知の新しいアプローチを探究し、複雑な図を解釈する際の認知戦略への反映と調整を強調します。
problem_japanese: 視覚化におけるメタ認知は十分に研究されておらず、視覚データを解釈する際の認知戦略の適用方法が不明確であるため、効果的な視覚化ツールの開発が妨げられています。
method_japanese: 著者らは、視覚化との対話中にユーザーのメタ認知プロセスを分析するために、質的インタビューと量的な視線追跡データを組み合わせた混合方法を採用し、理解を向上させる戦略を特定します。
results_japanese: 研究は視覚化で使用されるメタ認知戦略の洞察を明らかにし、これには自己質問や戦略適応のシフトが含まれる。これらの発見は、ユーザーのメタ認知プロセスをより効果的にサポートする視覚化ツールの開発に貢献します。

title: Comparing Native and Non-native English Speakers' Behaviors in Collaborative Writing through Visual Analytics
authors: Chen, Yuexi and Xiao, Yimin and Zinat, Kazi Tasnim and Yamashita, Naomi and Gao, Ge and Liu, Zhicheng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates the collaborative writing behaviors of native and non-native English speakers using visual analytics techniques.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding differences in collaborative writing behaviors between native and non-native English speakers, highlighting the importance of identifying these differences to enhance communication and collaboration processes.
method_english: Visual analytics were utilized to analyze collaborative writing sessions, enabling the identification of behavioral patterns and interactions among native and non-native English speakers during the writing process.
results_english: The analysis revealed distinct collaborative behaviors between the groups, such as communication dynamics and task involvement, highlighting the need for customized strategies to facilitate effective collaboration tailored to speaker proficiency.
summary_japanese: 視覚分析を用いて英語母語話者と非母語話者の共同執筆行動を比較した研究。
problem_japanese: 英語母語話者と非母語話者の共同執筆行動の違いを理解することが重要であり、コミュニケーションとコラボレーションの改善が求められる。
method_japanese: 視覚分析を用い、執筆中の母語話者と非母語話者の行動パターンや相互作用を特定する分析が行われた。
results_japanese: グループ間の協力行動やコミュニケーションの違いが明らかとなり、話者の能力に応じた協力戦略の必要性が示された。

title: Confirmation Bias: The Double-Edged Sword of Data Facts in Visual Data Communication
authors: Li, Shiyao and Davidson, Thomas James and Xiong Bearfield, Cindy and Wall, Emily
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates confirmation bias in visual data communication, focusing on how data facts can both enhance and impair understanding. The authors propose methods to mitigate biases, aiming for more effective communication.
problem_english: Confirmation bias in visual data communication can lead to misinterpretations and reinforce pre-existing beliefs. The challenge lies in designing visualizations that effectively convey data without amplifying biases, as current methods may unintentionally highlight subjective insights.
method_english: The authors conduct experiments using controlled visualizations with varied presentation styles to measure the impact on audience perception. They use surveys and cognitive tests to gather data on how different visualization techniques influence understanding and bias retention.
results_english: Findings indicate that certain visualization styles can significantly reduce confirmation bias, improving audience understanding. Strategies such as neutral color schemes and layered information can help mitigate biases, enhancing the clarity and objectivity of data presented visually.
summary_japanese: 本論文は視覚データコミュニケーションにおける確証バイアスを検討し、データの事実が理解を助けたり妨げたりすることに焦点を当てています。
problem_japanese: 視覚データコミュニケーションにおける確証バイアスは、誤解や既存の信念を強化する原因となります。効果的にデータを伝達しつつバイアスを増幅しない視覚化の設計が課題です。
method_japanese: 著者は、視覚化の様式を変えて統制された実験を行い、聴衆の認識に与える影響を測定します。アンケートや認知テストで視覚化技術が理解とバイアス保持に与える影響を調査します。
results_japanese: 特定の視覚化スタイルが確証バイアスを著しく低減し、理解を向上させることを示します。中立色の使用や情報層化がバイアス軽減に役立ち、視覚的に提示されたデータの明確性と客観性を高めます。

title: Data at Hand: Exploring the Tactile Perception of Data Physicalizations
authors: Offenhuber, Dietmar and Perovich, Laura J and Rogowitz, Bernice
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines the tactile perception of data physicalizations, highlighting the role of touch in understanding complex data. By employing experimental methodologies, the authors assess how tactile interactions can enhance data comprehension and user experience.
problem_english: The increasing complexity of data presents challenges in visualization, as traditional methods often fail to convey multidimensional information intuitively. This research addresses the gap in understanding how tactile interaction with physical representations of data (data physicalizations) can improve comprehension and engagement.
method_english: The authors conducted a series of user studies involving different tactile data physicalizations. Participants interacted with these physical models while their comprehension and engagement levels were assessed through tasks designed to evaluate understanding and retention of data insights.
results_english: The findings indicate that tactile interaction significantly enhances understanding of complex data sets. Participants reported improved engagement and were able to better retain information. The study highlights the potential of integrating tactile elements into data representation, advocating for broader applications.
summary_japanese: データの身体化の触覚的認識を調査し、触覚がデータ理解に与える影響を分析。手法を通じて触覚の重要性を示す。
problem_japanese: データの複雑さが増す中、従来の視覚化手法では多次元情報の直感的な伝達が困難。本研究はデータ身体化の触覚的相互作用が理解と関与を向上できるかを探る。
method_japanese: 異なる触覚的データ身体化に関するユーザー研究を実施。参加者は物理モデルを操作し、データ洞察の理解と記憶を評価するタスクでその理解と関与度を測定。
results_japanese: 触覚的な操作が複雑なデータ集合の理解を大幅に向上させた。参加者はより良い関与と情報保持を報告し、触覚要素のデータ表現への統合の可能性を示す。

title: The Anatomy of a Plea: How Uncertainty, Visualizations \& Individual Differences Shape Plea Bargain Decisions
authors: Bancilhon, Melanie and Ottley, Alvitta and Jordan, Andrew
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates how uncertainty, visualizations, and individual differences affect plea bargain decisions. It explores the relationship between these factors and decision-making in the context of the legal system.
problem_english: Despite its ubiquity, plea bargaining remains poorly understood, particularly in how external factors like uncertainty, visualizations, and individual differences influence the decisions of defendants. A better understanding of these influences is crucial to ensure fair legal processes.
method_english: The study employs experimental and statistical methodologies, utilizing simulations and decision-making scenarios to gauge the impact of uncertainty, visualizations, and individual differences in the context of plea bargaining decisions.
results_english: Findings indicate that visualizations can significantly alter perceptions of uncertainty, affecting decision outcomes. Individual differences, such as cognitive style, also impact how these visualizations are interpreted and subsequently influence plea decisions.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、不確実性、可視化、個人差が訴訟取引決定に与える影響を探求します。これらの要素と意思決定との関係を解明します。
problem_japanese: 訴訟取引は広く行われていますが、特に不確実性、可視化、個人差などの外部要因が被告の決定にどう影響するかは十分に理解されていません。公平な法的過程にはこれらの理解が必要です。
method_japanese: 本研究は不確実性、可視化、個人差が訴訟取引決定に与える影響を測定するため、実験と統計的手法を用いてシミュレーションと意思決定シナリオを実施しました。
results_japanese: 視覚化は不確実性の認識を大幅に変化させ、決定結果に影響を与えることが判明しました。また、個人の認知スタイルがこれらの視覚化の解釈方法に影響を与え、訴訟取引の決定に影響を与えました。

title: "Did you sleep well?": A Multimodal Sleep Diary for Sustained Self-Reporting by Children
authors: Chen, Shanshan and Hu, Jun and van Iterson, Hannah Christina and Fang, Ning and Markopoulos, Panos
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper presents a multimodal sleep diary aimed at enhancing sleep self-reporting among children. It incorporates various interactive elements to encourage sustained participation.
problem_english: Existing sleep diaries often fail to engage children consistently, impacting the reliability of self-reported sleep data. There's a need for tools that sustain children's interest and participation for accurate sleep monitoring.
method_english: The authors developed a multimodal sleep diary utilizing interactive elements like games, visual aids, and storytelling to engage children. It encourages self-reporting by integrating child-friendly interfaces and personalized feedback mechanisms.
results_english: The study found that children consistently used the sleep diary, demonstrating improved self-reporting accuracy and engagement. The multimodal approach effectively sustained children's interest compared to traditional methods.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、子供の自発的な睡眠報告を促進するためのマルチモーダル睡眠日記を提案します。
problem_japanese: 従来の睡眠日記は子供が継続的に使用しないことが多く、自発的な睡眠データの信頼性に影響を与えていました。子供の興味と参加を持続させ、正確な睡眠監視を行うためのツールが求められています。
method_japanese: 著者は、ゲームや視覚補助、ストーリーテリングのようなインタラクティブ要素を活用したマルチモーダル睡眠日記を開発しました。子供向けインターフェースと個別フィードバックの仕組みで自発的報告を促します。
results_japanese: 研究により、子供たちはこの睡眠日記を継続的に使用し、自発的報告の精度とエンゲージメントが向上したことがわかりました。マルチモーダル手法は従来の方法と比べて子供の興味を効果的に維持しました。

title: "You Go Through So Many Emotions Scrolling Through Instagram": How Teens Use Instagram To Regulate Their Emotions
authors: Davis, Katie and Landesman, Rotem and Yoon, Jina and Kim, JaeWon and Munoz Lopez, Daniela E and Magis-Weinberg, Lucia and Hiniker, Alexis
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how teenagers use Instagram to manage their emotions, highlighting the diverse emotional experiences they encounter on the platform. The research presents how Instagram serves as a tool for emotional regulation among teens.
problem_english: The paper investigates the emotional impact of Instagram on teenagers, focusing on how the platform influences their emotional regulation. Despite Instagram's popularity, its effects on teen emotions are not fully understood, raising concerns about mental health implications.
method_english: Researchers conducted a mixed-method study combining surveys and interviews with teenagers. The surveys measured emotional experiences, while interviews provided in-depth insights into personal Instagram use and emotional regulation strategies.
results_english: Findings indicate that Instagram acts as both a positive and negative force on teen emotions. It offers distraction and validation during low moods but can exacerbate negative feelings in other contexts, indicating a complex relationship between Instagram use and emotional health.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ティーンエイジャーがInstagramを使って感情を調整する方法を調査し、プラットフォーム上でのさまざまな感情体験を明らかにした。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、ティーンエイジャーに対するInstagramの感情的影響を探求し、プラットフォームが感情調整に与える影響に焦点を当てる。Instagramの人気にもかかわらず、感情への影響は完全に理解されていない。
method_japanese: 調査とインタビューを組み合わせた混合手法研究で、ティーンエイジャーの感情体験を測定し、Instagramの個人的な使用法と感情調整の戦略を深く掘り下げた。
results_japanese: 結果は、Instagramがティーンの感情に対してプラスとマイナスの両面を持つことを示す。気分が落ち込んでいる時には気晴らしや承認を提供するが、他の状況では否定的感情を悪化させる場合もあり、複雑な関係が示唆される。

title: Beyond the Circadian Rhythm: Variable Cycles of Regularity Found in Long-Term Sleep Tracking
authors: Chung, Ji Won and Yuan, Robin and Zitting, Kirsi-Marja and Chen, Jiahua and Xu, Neil and Daskalova, Nediyana and Huang, Jeff
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates sleep patterns beyond circadian rhythms by analyzing long-term sleep tracking and identifies variable cycles of regularity in sleep behaviors.
problem_english: Understanding sleep patterns is often limited to circadian rhythms, neglecting the complex, variable nature of real-life sleep behaviors. Long-term analysis is needed to uncover these overlooked aspects and improve health insights.
method_english: The research utilized extensive long-term sleep tracking data to identify and analyze variable cycles of regularity in sleep behaviors beyond circadian patterns, leveraging advanced computational methods for detailed analysis.
results_english: Findings reveal diverse non-circadian regularity cycles in sleep patterns, highlighting previously unrecognized complexities. These insights can potentially lead to improved personalized health interventions and technologies.
summary_japanese: 研究は概日リズムを超えた睡眠パターンを長期追跡で分析し、変動する規則性の周期を特定した。
problem_japanese: 睡眠パターンへの理解は概日リズムに限定され、本来の複雑で変動する実際の睡眠行動を見落としがちで、長期的な分析が必要とされる。
method_japanese: 長期の睡眠追跡データを用いて、概日パターンを超えた変動する規則性の周期を特定し、高度な計算手法で詳細に分析した。
results_japanese: 非概日性のさまざまな周期を睡眠パターンで特定し、未認識の複雑さを明らかにした。これらは個別健康介入の改善に寄与し得る。

title: Exploring Modular Prompt Design for Emotion and Mental Health Recognition
authors: Kim, Minseo and Kim, Taemin and Vo, Thu Hoang Anh and Jung, Yugyeong and Lee, Uichin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores modular prompt design to enhance emotion and mental health recognition accuracy, offering a systematic approach to build and test prompts using natural language processing models.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of accurately recognizing emotions and mental health statuses using natural language processing (NLP) models. Current approaches often suffer from limitations in adaptability and performance, leading to inadequate results. There is a need for a systematic framework to design prompts that can improve the recognition capability and accuracy of these models.
method_english: The authors propose a modular prompt design framework that involves decomposing prompts into reusable components. These components can be systematically combined and tested to optimize the performance of emotion and mental health recognition models. The framework allows researchers to experiment with various prompt combinations, assess their effectiveness, and identify configurations that yield the best recognition outcomes.
results_english: The study demonstrates that using the modular prompt design framework enhances the recognition accuracy of emotion and mental health statuses. Empirical evaluations show improved model performance, indicating the framework's effectiveness in identifying optimal prompt configurations. This approach provides a promising solution to overcoming current limitations in NLP-based emotion and mental health recognition.
summary_japanese: 本論文は感情とメンタルヘルス認識精度向上のため、モジュラー提示設計を探求し、自然言語処理モデルでのプロンプト設計とテストの体系的アプローチを提供します。
problem_japanese: 本研究は、自然言語処理(NLP)モデルを用いた感情およびメンタルヘルス状態の正確な認識の課題に取り組んでいます。現在のアプローチは適応性と性能に限界があり、十分な結果をもたらさないことが多いです。
method_japanese: 著者はプロンプトを再利用可能な構成要素に分解するモジュラープロンプト設計フレームワークを提案し、異なる構成で評価します。
results_japanese: モジュラープロンプト設計は感情とメンタルヘルス認識の精度を向上させることを実証。実証評価でモデル性能向上を確認、最適なプロンプト構成を特定可能。

title: Feasibility and Utility of Multimodal Micro Ecological Momentary Assessment on a Smartwatch
authors: Le, Ha and Potter, Veronika and Lakshminarayanan, Rithika and Mishra, Varun and Intille, Stephen
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores the viability of multimodal micro ecological momentary assessments (microEMAs) using smartwatches, examining user experience and collecting behavioral data in naturalistic settings.
problem_english: Traditional ecological momentary assessments (EMAs) rely heavily on self-reporting, which may miss nuanced behavioral contexts and require constant user input, potentially affecting data quality and participant compliance.
method_english: A novel microEMA system was developed for smartwatches that uses passive data collection along with brief, timely self-reports. It enables detailed real-time tracking of behavioral and physiological parameters in natural environments.
