results_english: The study finds that the smartwatch-based microEMA system is feasible and provides valuable insights into participants' behavioral patterns, improving data accuracy without significant participant burden or compliance issues.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、スマートウォッチを用いた多元的マイクロEMAの実行可能性を探り、自然環境での行動データ収集とユーザー体験を検証します。
problem_japanese: 従来のEMAは自己報告に依存し、微妙な行動の文脈を見逃す可能性があり、ユーザーの入力が常に必要であり、データの質や参加者の順守に影響を及ぼす可能性があります。
method_japanese: スマートウォッチ用の新しいマイクロEMAシステムを開発し、自然環境での行動や生理的パラメータをリアルタイムで詳細に追跡するためにパッシブデータ収集と簡潔な自己報告を組み合わせます。
results_japanese: スマートウォッチベースのマイクロEMAシステムは実行可能で、参加者の行動パターンを改善しながらデータ精度向上に役立つことが分かり、参加者への負担や順守問題もありませんでした。

title: Foody Talk: Exploring Opportunities for Conversational Food Journaling
authors: Silva, Lucas M. and Lu, Xi and Liang, Emily X. and Epstein, Daniel A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: Foody Talk investigates conversational food journaling, aiming to assist users in maintaining accurate dietary records and health monitoring through interactive dialogues with AI systems.
problem_english: Traditional food journaling is cumbersome, often neglected by users due to its time-consuming nature. There is a need for an engaging method that encourages consistent dietary tracking and helps improve individuals' health outcomes.
method_english: The study introduces Foody Talk, a conversational system that leverages AI to enable users to log their meals through natural language dialogues. The approach integrates user preferences to make food journaling more intuitive and engaging.
results_english: Foody Talk demonstrated improved user engagement and accuracy in food journaling, facilitating better dietary tracking. It achieves this by enabling effective interaction through personalized conversational methods, enhancing user experience and health monitoring.
summary_japanese: Foody Talkは会話型食事記録を探求し、AI対話を通じて正確な食事記録と健康管理を支援します。
problem_japanese: 従来の食事記録は面倒で時間がかかり利用者に敬遠されがちです。一貫した食事の追跡を促し、健康への改善を図る方法が必要です。
method_japanese: 本研究は、自然言語対話を介して食事を記録できるAIを活用した会話システムFoody Talkを紹介します。利用者の好みを取り入れ、直感的で魅力的な食事記録を目指します。
results_japanese: Foody Talkは食事記録の精度と利用者の関与を向上させ、個々に適した会話手法で効果的なインタラクションを実現し、ユーザー体験と健康管理を促進しました。

title: Intimate Data Sharing: Enhancing Transparency and Control in Fertility Tracking
authors: Hudig, Anna Ida and Singh, Jatinder
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper addresses fertility tracking app concerns by enhancing transparency and user control over data sharing. It proposes mechanisms for users to understand, manage, and restrict access to their intimate data.
problem_english: Fertility tracking apps lack transparency in how intimate data is shared and who has access to it, raising privacy concerns. Users find it challenging to understand and control data-sharing settings, leading to potential misuse of sensitive information.
method_english: The authors propose designing mechanisms that provide clear data sharing policies and intuitive interfaces for managing consent. They focus on empowering users to easily understand, monitor, and control how their intimate data is shared, enhancing trust and privacy.
results_english: The study shows that improved transparency and control mechanisms can increase users' trust in fertility tracking apps. Users felt more confident in managing their intimate data, leading to more informed and deliberate sharing decisions.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、フェルティリティトラッキングアプリの透明性とデータ共有の制御を向上させ、ユーザーのプライバシーを強化する方法を提案します。
problem_japanese: フェルティリティトラッキングアプリは、データ共有の透明性が不足し、誰がアクセスするかが不明確であり、プライバシーの懸念を引き起こしています。ユーザーはデータ共有の設定を理解し制御するのが難しく、敏感情報の誤用の可能性があります。
method_japanese: 明確なデータ共有ポリシーを提供し、同意管理の直感的なインターフェースを設計するメカニズムを提案。ユーザーがデータ共有を理解し制御しやすくし、信頼とプライバシーを強化します。
results_japanese: 研究により、透明性と制御メカニズムの向上がフェルティリティトラッカーの信頼を高めることが示されました。ユーザーはデータ管理に自信を持ち、情報に基づいた共有が可能になりました。

title: "I Don't Know Why I Should Use This App": Holistic Analysis on User Engagement Challenges in Mobile Mental Health
authors: Jin, Seungwan and Kim, Bogoan and Han, Kyungsik
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study analyzes user engagement challenges in mobile mental health apps, examining factors influencing user attitudes and persistence.
problem_english: Many users cannot sustain engagement with mobile mental health applications despite their potential benefits. The study identifies barriers such as lack of motivation and unclear app functionalities as significant deterrents to long-term use.
method_english: The research involves mixed-method data collection, including surveys and interviews with app users, to holistically understand engagement issues. The analysis focuses on behavioral patterns and user feedback to pinpoint specific challenges.
results_english: Findings reveal that users often discontinue use due to perceived lack of immediate value, complexity of app interface, and insufficient personalization. Recommendations for enhancing features to improve user retention are provided.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、モバイルメンタルヘルスアプリのユーザーエンゲージメントの課題を分析し、影響要因を検討します。
problem_japanese: モバイルメンタルヘルスアプリの潜在的な利点にも関わらず、多くのユーザーはエンゲージメントを持続できません。動機欠如やアプリ機能の不明瞭さが長期使用の主要な障害として識別されました。
method_japanese: 調査は、アプリユーザーへのアンケートやインタビューを含む混合手法を用いて、エンゲージメントの問題を包括的に把握します。行動パターンとユーザーフィードバックに焦点を当てて、具体的な課題を特定します。
results_japanese: 調査結果では、即時価値の欠如、インターフェースの複雑さ、パーソナライズの不十分さが使用中断の主な理由として明らかになり、ユーザー維持率向上のための提案が行われました。

title: Designing Technologies for Value-based Mental Healthcare: Centering Clinicians' Perspectives on Outcomes Data Specification, Collection, and Use
authors: Adler, Daniel A. and Yang, Yuewen and Viranda, Thalia and Van Meter, Anna R. and McGinty, Emma Elizabeth and Choudhury, Tanzeem
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores technologies' role in value-based mental healthcare, emphasizing clinicians' views on outcome data specification, collection, and use for improved care delivery.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of optimizing technology for value-based mental healthcare, focusing on how clinicians perceive and utilize outcome data, which is crucial for enhancing treatment quality and effectiveness.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative research involving interviews and surveys with mental health clinicians to gain insights on their perspective regarding technology's role in outcome data specification, collection, and usage processes.
results_english: Results highlighted clinicians' needs for better data integration, customizable tools, and enhanced training to effectively use outcome data, improving treatment planning and patient care processes.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、価値に基づくメンタルヘルスケアにおける技術の役割を探求し、結果データの仕様、収集、利用について臨床医の視点を強調する。
problem_japanese: 臨床医が結果データをどのように認識し活用するかに焦点を当て、価値に基づくメンタルヘルスケアの技術の最適化を課題としています。
method_japanese: 質的研究を行い、技術が結果データの仕様、収集、使用プロセスにおける役割について臨床医の視点を得るためインタビューと調査を実施した。
results_japanese: 臨床医のニーズとして、データ統合の改善、カスタマイズ可能なツール、結果データの効果的利用には技術訓練の向上が必要であることが明らかになった。

title: Exploring Alternative Socio-Technical Systems for Careful Data Work in Recovery Contexts
authors: Claisse, Caroline and Osborne, Alison K and Sillence, Elizabeth and Glascott, Angela and Cameron, Alisdair S and Durrant, Abigail C
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores socio-technical systems for data work in recovery contexts, proposing alternatives to existing models for more careful and ethical data management.
problem_english: The paper addresses challenges in current socio-technical systems regarding data work in recovery contexts, focusing on the need for more careful, ethical, and user-centered approaches to data management and recovery.
method_english: The authors propose alternative socio-technical models, examining them through user-centered design methodologies, participatory workshops, and case studies, aiming to address ethical concerns and improve data management practices.
results_english: The study reveals promising alternative socio-technical systems that improve upon current data management practices, emphasizing ethical considerations and user-centered approaches, highlighting the need for more thoughtful frameworks in recovery contexts.
summary_japanese: この論文は、回復状況におけるデータ処理のための社会技術システムを探り、既存モデルに代わるより慎重で倫理的なデータ管理を提案します。
problem_japanese: 論文は回復コンテキストでのデータ作業における既存社会技術システムの課題に注目。より慎重で倫理的かつユーザー中心のデータ管理と回復が必要とされる。
method_japanese: 著者は、ユーザー中心のデザイン手法や参加型ワークショップ、ケーススタディを通じて代替社会技術モデルを提案し、倫理的課題を解決しデータ管理の改善を目指す。
results_japanese: 研究では、回復状況におけるデータ管理慣行を改善する有望な代替社会技術システムが明らかになり、倫理的配慮とユーザー中心のアプローチが強調される。

title: Like Adding a Small Weight to a Scale About to Tip: Personalizing Micro-Financial Incentives for Digital Wellbeing
authors: Jang, Sueun and Seo, Youngseok and Choi, Woohyeok and Lee, Uichin
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores the impact of personalized micro-financial incentives on digital wellbeing. It examines how tailored incentives can influence user behavior and improve digital health by leveraging behavioral economics principles.
problem_english: Excessive screen time and poor digital habits are pervasive, threatening digital wellbeing. Standard interventions often fail due to their generic nature, lacking personalization which can lead to poor user engagement and motivation to change behaviors.
method_english: Researchers developed a personalized incentive mechanism, incorporating user-specific preferences and behaviors. By utilizing machine learning algorithms, they tailored micro-financial rewards to motivate healthier digital habits, enhancing engagement and effectiveness of interventions compared to one-size-fits-all solutions.
results_english: The personalized approach significantly improved user engagement and reduced screen time. Empirical results demonstrated that tailored incentives led to a more substantial behavioral change, highlighting the effectiveness and practicality of personalization in health interventions.
summary_japanese: 個別化されたマイクロ金融インセンティブがデジタルウェルビーイングに与える影響を探究し、行動経済学の原則を活用して個別化インセンティブがユーザー行動を改善する方法を調査します。
problem_japanese: 過度のスクリーンタイムと不適切なデジタル習慣は、デジタルウェルビーイングに脅威を与えます。一般的な介入はパーソナライズされておらず、ユーザーの関与や行動変更の動機付けにつながりません。
method_japanese: 研究者は機械学習アルゴリズムを利用し、ユーザー固有の好みと行動を考慮した個別のインセンティブメカニズムを開発し、より健康的なデジタル習慣を動機付けるための微細な金融報酬を提供しました。
results_japanese: 個別化したアプローチはユーザーの関与を向上させ、スクリーンタイムを減少させ、より顕著な行動変化をもたらしました。これはヘルス介入における個別化の効果的で実用的な可能性を示しています。

title: The Framework of the Lived Experience of Metrics: Understanding the Purposes and Activities of Self-Tracking Metrics
authors: Loerakker, Meagan B. and Jarsve, Tora and Niess, Jasmin and Wo\'{z}niak, Pawe\l{} W.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper proposes a framework for understanding the lived experiences of individuals using self-tracking metrics, examining their purposes and activities.
problem_english: The challenge addressed is the lack of a comprehensive framework to understand how individuals integrate self-tracking metrics into their daily lives, specifically focusing on the diverse purposes they serve and the activities they guide.
method_english: The authors employ qualitative methods, including interviews and ethnographic observations, to gather data on users' interactions with self-tracking tools, analyzing this information to identify common themes and patterns in experiences.
results_english: The study introduces a framework categorizing the purposes and activities of self-tracking, highlighting their multifaceted role in personal development, health, and self-optimization, and providing insights into user engagement with these technologies.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、セルフトラッキング指標を利用する人々の経験を理解する枠組みを提案し、その目的と活動を検討する。
problem_japanese: セルフトラッキング指標が日常生活にどう統合されるかを理解する包括的枠組みの欠如が課題。特にその多様な目的と導かれる活動に焦点。
method_japanese: 著者は、インタビューとエスノグラフィック観察を用いてセルフトラッキングツールとの相互作用データを収集し、共通テーマと経験パターンを分析。
results_japanese: 研究はセルフトラッキングの目的と活動を分類する枠組みを導入し、個人の発展、健康、自己最適化での役割を強調し、技術への関与を洞察。

title: Understanding Mental Wellbeing and Tools for Support with Taiwanese Emerging Adults: An Eastern Cultural Perspective
authors: Cheng, Nai-Yu and Wong, Novia and Reddy, Madhu
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores mental wellbeing among Taiwanese emerging adults, emphasizing eastern cultural perspectives and support tools.
problem_english: Taiwanese emerging adults face unique challenges in mental wellbeing due to cultural perspectives, yet often lack accessible tools that cater to these specific socio-cultural needs, affecting their ability to manage stress and mental health effectively.
method_english: The authors conducted qualitative interviews with Taiwanese emerging adults to understand their mental health challenges and utilized thematic analysis to discern cultural influences and preferred support tools.
results_english: Findings reveal a strong preference for culturally sensitive support tools and suggest that incorporating Eastern philosophies, such as mindfulness practices, can enhance mental wellbeing for Taiwanese emerging adults.
summary_japanese: 台湾の成人を迎えた若者の精神的健康と東洋文化の視点のサポートツールを探求する研究です。
problem_japanese: 台湾の成人は文化的な視点から精神的健康への課題があるが、社会文化的なニーズに合ったツールが不足しており、効果的なストレス管理が困難です。
method_japanese: 台湾の成人を対象にインタビューを行い、文化の影響や好ましい支援ツールを主題分析で解析しました。
results_japanese: 文化的な配慮がされた支援ツールの強い志向が示され、マインドフルネスなど東洋哲学の取り入れが効果的であることが分かりました。

title: Understanding Temporality of Reflection in Personal Informatics through Baby Tracking
authors: Louie, Julianne and Mukund, Tara and Vu, Chau and Epstein, Daniel A. and Papoutsaki, Alexandra
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores the temporality of reflection in personal informatics through the context of baby tracking, examining how data tracking affects decision-making among new parents.
problem_english: New parents are increasingly using personal informatics systems to track baby-related data, yet little is known about how the timing and availability of this data influence their reflective practices and decision-making processes. Understanding these temporal aspects could enhance the design of these systems to better support parenting.
method_english: The study involved qualitative interviews and observations with new parents using baby tracking apps. The data collected focused on participants' reflective experiences, how they employed the tracked information, and the timing of reflections related to important parenting decisions.
results_english: The findings reveal that parents reflect differently on data at varying time intervals, which influences parenting decisions. This temporality in reflection suggests that tailoring personal informatics systems to cater to these timing needs could improve support for new parents.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ベビートラッキングを通じてパーソナルインフォマティクスにおける反射の時間性を探り、新しい親の意思決定に対するデータ追跡の影響を検討します。
problem_japanese: 新たな親たちはベビー関連のデータを追跡するためにパーソナルインフォマティクスシステムを用いることが増えているが、これらのデータのタイミングと可用性が彼らの反射的実践や意思決定にどのように影響を与えるかはあまり知られていない。これらの時間的側面を理解することは、育児をより効果的にサポートするシステム設計の向上につながる。
method_japanese: 新しい親を対象に、ベビートラッキングアプリを利用した質的インタビューと観察を実施。参加者の反射的経験、追跡情報の活用方法、重要な育児決定に関する反射のタイミングに焦点を当てたデータを収集。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、親がデータを異なる時間間隔で反射し、それが育児の意思決定に影響していることを示しています。この反射の時間特性は、個人情報システムを新しい親のタイミングニーズに合わせることで、サポートを改善できる可能性を示唆します。

title: Evaluating Non-AI Experts' Interaction with AI: A Case Study In Library Context
authors: Zheng, Qingxiao and Chen, Minrui and Park, Hyanghee and Xu, Zhongwei and Huang, Yun
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how non-AI experts in library settings interact with AI systems to improve library services, identifying challenges and opportunities.
problem_english: Non-AI experts face difficulties in leveraging AI to enhance library services due to a lack of understanding and training in AI technologies, resulting in sub-optimal use and potential misinterpretation of AI outputs.
method_english: The authors conducted interviews and observations in library contexts, analyzing the interactions between non-AI expert librarians and AI systems to identify obstacles and solutions for effective AI integration in library services.
results_english: Findings reveal that librarians need targeted AI education and user-friendly interfaces to engage effectively with AI systems, suggesting that improved training and intuitive tools can enhance service quality.
summary_japanese: 研究は図書館環境でAIがどのように利用されるかを調査し、課題と機会を特定します。
problem_japanese: 図書館サービス向上のためのAI活用において、AI技術に対する理解不足や訓練不足が原因で、AI出力の誤解や最適でない利用が発生しています。
method_japanese: 著者は図書館環境での非AI専門家とAIシステムの相互作用をインタビューと観察で分析し、効果的なAIの統合における障害と解決策を特定しました。
results_japanese: 図書館司書がAIシステムを効果的に活用するには、AI教育と使いやすいインターフェースが必要であることを明らかにし、訓練強化と直感的なツールがサービス向上を促進すると示唆しています。

title: From Text to Trust: Empowering AI-assisted Decision Making with Adaptive LLM-powered Analysis
authors: Li, Zhuoyan and Zhu, Hangxiao and Lu, Zhuoran and Xiao, Ziang and Yin, Ming
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper introduces a system using Adaptive LLM models to assist in decision-making within organizations, focusing on building trust through text analysis.
problem_english: Organizations struggle with trust in AI-assisted decision-making due to a lack of transparency and adaptability in analyses. This gap hinders effective utilization of AI technologies, as users are hesitant to rely on systems that don't align with their decision-making needs.
method_english: The authors propose an Adaptive Large Language Model (LLM)-powered system that analyzes textual data to offer contextually tailored insights, facilitating transparency and adaptability in decision-making, thereby enhancing user trust and system efficacy.
results_english: The study demonstrates that the system improves decision-making trust and effectiveness by providing more transparent and adaptive analyses compared to traditional models, leading to a greater acceptance and reliance on AI-generated insights within organizations.
summary_japanese: 適応型LLMモデルを用いた組織内の意思決定支援システムを提案し、テキスト分析を通じて信頼を構築する。
problem_japanese: 組織は、AIを活用した意思決定における透明性や適応性の欠如により信頼に悩んでいる。このギャップがAI技術の効果的利用を妨げている。
method_japanese: 本文では、テキストデータを分析して文脈に合わせた洞察を提供する適応型LLMシステムを提案し、透明性と適応性を高める。
results_japanese: 研究は、このシステムが透明性と適応性の向上によって意思決定の信頼性と効果を高め、AI生成の洞察の受容を促すことを示した。

title: Improving Governance Outcomes Through AI Documentation: Bridging Theory and Practice
authors: Winecoff, Amy and Bogen, Miranda
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses the integration of AI documentation practices to enhance governance outcomes, focusing on bridging theoretical insights with practical applications through methodical documentation processes.
problem_english: The main problem identified is the gap between theoretical perspectives on AI and their practical applications, particularly concerning governance. The challenge is to create a structured approach to documentation that can effectively translate AI theory into actionable governance practices.
method_english: The authors propose a framework for AI documentation that emphasizes clarity and accessibility, allowing for better communication between stakeholders. This involves creating standardized documentation templates and guidelines aimed at making AI applications more transparent and comprehensible.
results_english: The framework demonstrated improved communication among developers and policymakers, leading to better informed decision-making. It highlighted how standardized documentation can serve as a vital link between AI theory and practice, fostering enhanced governance outcomes.
summary_japanese: AIドキュメンテーション手法の統合により、理論と実践を橋渡しし、ガバナンス成果の向上を目指す。
problem_japanese: AI理論と実践のギャップが課題であり、理論を具体的なガバナンス実践に確実に反映させる体系的ドキュメンテーションアプローチの構築が求められています。
method_japanese: 著者はAIの透明性と理解を促進するための標準化されたテンプレートとガイドラインを使った明確でアクセシブルなドキュメンテーションフレームワークを提案しています。
results_japanese: フレームワークにより開発者と政策立案者間のコミュニケーションが向上し、意思決定が改善。理論と実践の架け橋としての標準化ドキュメントがガバナンス成果を向上しました。

title: Prompting in the Dark: Assessing Human Performance in Prompt Engineering for Data Labeling When Gold Labels Are Absent
authors: He, Zeyu and Naphade, Saniya and Huang, Ting-Hao Kenneth
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study evaluates the effectiveness of human performance in prompt engineering for data labeling in the absence of gold labels, highlighting challenges and methodologies for improving accuracy.
problem_english: In fields relying on data labeling, the absence of gold labels poses challenges in accurately evaluating human performance in prompt engineering. Without gold standards, it becomes difficult to assess and improve the effectiveness of human-generated prompts in machine learning tasks.
method_english: The authors conducted experiments simulating environments with absent gold labels, analyzing human performance in crafting and refining prompts. They utilized crowd-sourcing and iterative feedback to identify key factors influencing prompt efficacy and labeling accuracy in such scenarios.
results_english: The study found that while humans show varying degrees of proficiency in prompt engineering without gold labels, certain structured approaches and feedback mechanisms improve labeling accuracy. Human-crafted prompts can be effectively optimized through iterative refinement and strategic guidance.
summary_japanese: ゴールドラベルがない状況でのプロンプトエンジニアリングの精度を評価し、課題と改善策を探る研究。
problem_japanese: データラベル付けを必要とする分野では、ゴールドラベルがないと人によるプロンプトエンジニアリングの精度を正確に評価することが難しい。このため、人が生成するプロンプトの効果を評価することが困難である。
method_japanese: ゴールドラベルがない環境をシミュレーションした実験を実施し、人によるプロンプト作成と修正のパフォーマンスを分析。クラウドソーシングとフィードバックを用いてプロンプトの効果に影響を与える要因を特定。
results_japanese: ゴールドラベルがなくても、特定の構造化アプローチとフィードバックメカニズムが精度を向上させることが可能で、人が作成したプロンプトは改善が可能であることが確認された。

title: Technologies for Children's AI Learning: Design Features and Future Opportunities
authors: Jia, Kaiyue and Yu, Junnan
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores design features and future opportunities in technologies that facilitate AI learning for children, offering insights into how these technologies enhance children's AI education.
problem_english: The paper addresses the challenge of providing effective AI learning experiences for children. As AI becomes increasingly prevalent, there is a need to develop educational technologies that are specifically tailored to engage children and enhance their understanding of AI concepts.
method_english: The authors conducted a comprehensive review of existing technologies and design features used in AI learning tools for children. They evaluated these in terms of educational effectiveness and engagement, and proposed design principles and future directions for developing new tools.
results_english: The study identifies key design features that promote engagement and learning effectiveness in children's AI education tools, and suggests new opportunities for innovation in this field, aiming to better integrate AI into children's educational experiences.
summary_japanese: 本論文では、子供向けAI学習を促進する技術の設計特徴と将来の機会を探り、子供のAI教育を向上させる方法を考察する。
problem_japanese: AIが広く普及する中で、子供向けに効果的なAI学習体験を提供することが課題となっており、AI概念への理解を高める教育技術の開発が求められている。
method_japanese: 既存の子供向けAI学習ツールで使用される技術と設計特徴を包括的にレビューし、その教育効果とエンゲージメントを評価し、新ツール開発の設計原則と方向性を提案した。
results_japanese: 研究は、子供のAI教育ツールにおけるエンゲージメントと学習効果を促進する重要な設計特徴を特定し、この分野での革新機会を提案し、教育体験へのAIの統合を目指している。

title: "It Might be Technically Impressive, But It's Practically Useless to us": Motivations, Practices, Challenges, and Opportunities for Cross-Functional Collaboration around AI within the News Industry
authors: Xiao, Qing and Fan, Xianzhe and Simon, Felix Marvin and Zhang, Bingbing and Eslami, Motahhare
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates the motivations, practices, and challenges of cross-functional collaboration around AI in the news industry, offering insights into current gaps and opportunities for effective integration.
problem_english: While AI technology can be technically impressive, its practical application within the news industry often meets obstacles such as lack of understanding, varying objectives amongst departments, and insufficient collaboration, leading to its limited usefulness.
method_english: Through qualitative interviews and case studies with professionals across different departments in the news industry, the study identifies key factors influencing the success and challenges of AI-related projects, highlighting interdepartmental collaboration and communication.
results_english: Findings reveal that effective cross-functional collaboration is hindered by different priorities, lack of AI literacy, and inflexible organizational structures, but opportunities exist for shared understanding and goal alignment to enhance AI integration.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、ニュース業界におけるAIの協調的活用のモチベーションと課題を調査し、統合の機会を提示します。
problem_japanese: AI技術は技術的には優れているが、ニュース業界での実用化には理解不足、部門間の目的相違、協力体制の不十分さといった障壁を伴い、その有用性が限定的になる。
method_japanese: ニュース業界の異なる部門の専門家への質的インタビューと事例研究を通じて、AI関連プロジェクトの成功に影響を与える要因を特定し、部門間の協力とコミュニケーションの重要性を強調します。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、異なる優先順位、AIリテラシーの欠如、柔軟性のない組織構造が協力を妨げているが、共同理解と目標の整合でAI統合強化の機会が存在することを示します。

title: AI Rivalry as a Craft: How Resisting and Embracing Generative AI Are Reshaping the Writing Profession
authors: Varanasi, Rama Adithya and Wiesenfeld, Batia Mishan and Nov, Oded
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how generative AI is both resisted and embraced within the writing profession, reshaping practices and professional identities. It examines the dynamics of this rivalry and its implications for writers.
problem_english: The integration of generative AI into writing poses challenges regarding professional identity, quality standards, and ethical considerations. Writers face tension between adopting AI tools to enhance productivity and the fear of losing creative autonomy and job security.
method_english: This study combines qualitative interviews with writers and quantitative analysis of writing output using generative AI. It explores the impact of AI on writing processes and professional identity, aiming to understand writers' strategies in engaging with AI.
results_english: The results reveal varied responses, with some writers enhancing their craft by leveraging AI, while others express anxiety and resistance. It highlights the coping strategies and adaptive practices that professionals adopt to integrate AI without losing their autonomy.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、執筆職での生成AIの抵抗と受容が職業をどのように再形成しているか、対立の動態と影響を探る。
problem_japanese: 執筆における生成AI統合は、専門的アイデンティティ、品質基準、倫理的考慮に関する課題を引き起こす。AI導入による生産性向上と創造的自律や職の安全性喪失の懸念間の葛藤に直面する。
method_japanese: 本研究は執筆者への質的インタビューと生成AIを用いた執筆成果の量的分析を組み合わせた。AIが執筆プロセスと職業的アイデンティティに与える影響を探り、執筆者のAIへの関与戦略を理解する。
results_japanese: 結果はAIを活用して技術を高める執筆者と不安や抵抗を示す者がいることを示す。プロが自律性を保ちながらAIを統合するための適応戦略が明らかとなった。

title: Generative AI Uses and Risks for Knowledge Workers in a Science Organization
authors: Wagman, Kelly B. and Dearing, Matthew T. and Chetty, Marshini
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study analyzes the benefits and risks of generative AI for knowledge workers in a scientific organization, focusing on enhancing productivity and managing associated risks.
problem_english: The primary issue is understanding how generative AI can enhance or hinder knowledge workers' productivity in science organizations. While potentially improving efficiency, it poses risks such as ethical concerns and reliance on AI-generated outputs. Addressing this issue involves exploring both the advantages and challenges in practical applications.
method_english: The research employs a mixed-methods approach, combining case studies, surveys, and interviews to evaluate AI usage among knowledge workers. This approach allows for a comprehensive understanding of the tools' practical impacts, efficiencies gained, and the ethical and operational challenges experienced by users within a science organization.
results_english: The findings indicate that generative AI can significantly improve task efficiency but also highlight critical concerns around over-reliance and ethical use. While many knowledge workers benefited from AI, there is a clear need for guidelines to mitigate risks, ensuring responsible and effective AI integration into the workplace.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、科学組織におけるナレッジワーカーの生産性向上とリスク管理に焦点を当てた生成AIの利点とリスクを分析します。
problem_japanese: 生成AIが科学組織のナレッジワーカーの生産性をどのように向上させるか、また妨げるかを理解することが課題です。効率向上が期待される一方、倫理的懸念やAI生成出力への依存のリスクも存在します。実際の応用における利点と課題を探ることが要求されます。
method_japanese: 研究は、事例研究、アンケート、インタビューを組み合わせた混合法を採用し、ナレッジワーカーのAI利用の評価を行います。このアプローチにより、ツールの実際の影響、効率性向上、倫理的および運用上の課題を包括的に理解できます。
results_japanese: 結果は、生成AIがタスク効率を大幅に向上させるが、過度な依存や倫理的使用に関する重要な懸念も浮上することを示しています。AIを活用する多くのナレッジワーカーが利益を得たが、リスクを緩和する指針が必要であることが明らかになりました。

title: Judging Phishing Under Uncertainty: How Do Users Handle Inaccurate Automated Advice?
authors: Saka, Tarini and Vakali, Kalliopi and Jenkins, Adam D G and Kokciyan, Nadin and Vaniea, Kami
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how users respond to inaccurate automated phishing advice. The research explores user trust and decision-making processes when faced with uncertain guidance from automated systems.
problem_english: Users frequently rely on automated systems for phishing detection, yet these systems can provide inaccurate advice. This poses a challenge as users must decide whether to trust or override the automated guidance, impacting their phishing detection capabilities.
method_english: The study employed experimental methods to analyze user behavior when interacting with automated phishing detection systems providing inaccurate advice. User decision-making and trust were assessed through controlled simulated phishing environments.
results_english: Findings indicate that users struggle with inaccurate automated advice, often misplacing trust or failing to act correctly. The study highlights the need for improved trust calibration and educational interventions to assist users in making better decisions.
summary_japanese: ユーザーが不正確なフィッシングの自動アドバイスにどのように対応するかを調査し、信頼や意思決定を探る。
problem_japanese: フィッシング検出のために自動システムに依存するユーザーは、不正確なアドバイスに直面したときにそれを信頼するか追従しないべきかの判断を強いられ、フィッシング検出能力に影響を受ける。
method_japanese: 実験的方法を用い、ユーザーが不正確なアドバイスを行うフィッシング検出システムと対峙した際の行動を分析し、シミュレーション環境下で意思決定と信頼を評価。
results_japanese: ユーザーが不正確なアドバイスに苦労し、信頼を誤置したり正しく行動できなかった。信頼の向上や教育的介入の必要性を強調。

title: Objection Overruled! Lay People can Distinguish Large Language Models from Lawyers, but still Favour Advice from an LLM
authors: Schneiders, Eike and Seabrooke, Tina and Krook, Joshua and Hyde, Richard and Leesakul, Natalie and Clos, Jeremie and Fischer, Joel E
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study investigates whether laypeople can discern legal advice from large language models (LLMs) versus professional lawyers, revealing preferences towards LLM advice despite higher accuracy in identifying genuine legal professionals.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of laypeople determining whether legal advice comes from a large language model (LLM) or a professional lawyer. With the rise in AI technology use, understanding this discernment is crucial as it impacts trust in LLM-based legal advice over potentially more reliable human expertise.
method_english: The study employs a comparative analysis involving participants evaluating legal advice sourced from both large language models (LLMs) and human lawyers. Through blind assessments and surveys, it examines participants' ability to distinguish the source of advice and their preferences, setting up controlled experiments to ensure unbiased results.
results_english: Results indicate that participants can distinguish between advice from LLMs and lawyers with reasonable accuracy, but often prefer the advice provided by LLMs. This preference persists despite recognizing the attorneys as more legitimate sources, suggesting compelling factors like novelty, perceived objectivity, or clarity in LLM responses.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、一般人が弁護士と大規模言語モデル（LLM）からの法的助言を区別し、LLMの助言を好む傾向を明らかにしました。
problem_japanese: 一般人が大規模言語モデル（LLM）からの法的助言とプロの弁護士からのそれを見分けられるかという課題に取り組んでいます。AI技術の進展に伴い、この識別の理解は信頼性のある法的助言選択に影響を与えるため重要です。
method_japanese: 本研究では、大規模言語モデル（LLM）と人間の弁護士からの法的助言を評価する参加者による比較分析を行いました。ブラインド評価とアンケートを通じ、アドバイスの源を識別する能力と好みを調査しました。
results_japanese: 結果は、参加者がLLMと弁護士からの助言を区別できるが、しばしばLLMの助言を好むことを示しています。弁護士をより正当と認識しながらも、LLMの新規性、客観性、明確さが魅力的とされています。

title: Social by Nature: How Socio-tecture Shapes the Work of SMBs and Considerations for Reimagining Collaborative Human-AI Systems
authors: Ankrah, Elizabeth A and Awori, Kagonya and Nyairo, Stephanie and Muchai, Mercy and Ochieng, Millicent and Kariuki, Mark and Hayes, Gillian R and O'Neill, Jacki
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores how socio-technological structures influence small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) and offers insights for developing collaborative human-AI systems.
problem_english: The study addresses the challenge of understanding how societal and technological architectures affect SMB operations, and seeks to provide guidance for designing collaborative human-AI systems that align with their unique socio-tectural contexts.
method_english: The research employs a mixed-method approach, combining qualitative and quantitative data from diverse SMBs. Through interviews, surveys, and observational studies, the authors gain insights into the socio-tectural dynamics affecting these businesses and analyze implications for human-AI collaboration.
results_english: The findings reveal diverse ways socio-tecture impacts SMB activities and emphasize the need for human-AI systems that consider cultural and social contexts. The study proposes design strategies that align AI tools with the social fabric of SMBs for improved collaboration.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、社会技術構造が中小企業に与える影響を探り、協働的な人間-AIシステム開発の洞察を提供します。
problem_japanese: 社会的および技術的な構造が中小企業の運営に与える影響を理解し、人間とAIの協働システムを独自の社会技術的文脈に合わせて設計するためのガイダンスを提供することを課題としています。
method_japanese: 本研究は多様な中小企業からの質的及び量的データを組み合わせた混合手法を用い、インタビューや調査、観察研究を通じて、これらの企業に影響を与える社会技術的なダイナミクスについて洞察を得て、人間-AI協働の影響を分析します。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、社会技術構造が中小企業活動に多様な影響を与えることを明らかにし、文化および社会的文脈を考慮した人間-AIシステムの必要性を強調しています。研究は中小企業の社会構造に調和したAIツールデザイン戦略を提案します。

title: The Making of Performative Accuracy in AI Training: Precision Labor and Its Consequences
authors: Zhang, Ben Zefeng and Yang, Tianling and Miceli, Milagros and Haimson, Oliver L. and Thomas, Michaelanne
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores performative accuracy in AI training, highlighting precision labor's role and examining its social and ethical implications.
problem_english: AI systems increasingly depend on data labeled by human workers, yet issues like bias, labor exploitation, and ethical concerns persist. This raises questions about accuracy's performative aspects and labor's impact on AI systems.
method_english: The study involves qualitative analysis of AI training workflows, interviews with data workers, and assessment of labor conditions. It critiques precision labor and investigates its influence on AI performative accuracy and ethics.
results_english: Findings reveal precision labor shapes AI accuracy but often overlooks ethical concerns and labor impact. It underscores the need for better labor conditions and accuracy approaches integrating social considerations.
summary_japanese: AI訓練のパフォーマティブな正確性を探求し、精密労働の役割を強調し、その社会的・倫理的影響を考察した。
problem_japanese: AIシステムは人間の労働者によるラベル付けに依存しており、偏見や労働の搾取、倫理的懸念が存在。正確性のパフォーマティブな側面と労働の影響について疑問が生じている。
method_japanese: AI訓練のワークフローの質的分析、データ労働者へのインタビュー、労働条件の評価を用いて、精密労働の批判とAIのパフォーマティブな正確性と倫理への影響を探った。
results_japanese: 精密労働がAIの正確性を形成するが、倫理的懸念や労働への影響を見過ごすことが多い。より良い労働条件と社会的考慮を統合した正確性のアプローチが必要であることを強調。

title: Beyond the Watercooler: Designing for Computer-Mediated Self-Disclosure among Work Colleagues
authors: Chow, Kevin and McGrenere, Joanna and Fritz, Thomas and Puente, Lucas L and Massimi, Michael
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores computer-mediated self-disclosure among work colleagues to enhance workplace relationships. It examines design strategies for digital platforms that facilitate personal sharing, balancing openness and privacy.
problem_english: Work colleagues often struggle with self-disclosure due to concerns about privacy and professionalism. The lack of personal sharing can hinder relationship building and communication. The paper addresses how digital platforms can support safe and effective self-disclosure.
method_english: The authors conducted a mixed-method study including surveys and interviews with employees in various industries. They explored beliefs about self-disclosure and experimented with different digital platform designs aimed at enhancing comfort and privacy in personal sharing.
results_english: Results indicate that tailored digital platforms can increase willingness to self-disclose among colleagues. Successful designs include features that provide control over privacy settings and offer prompts for initiating meaningful personal exchanges, promoting stronger workplace relationships.
summary_japanese: 職場の同僚間の関係を強化するためにコンピュータを介した自己開示を探求する。個人の共有を促進するデザイン戦略を検討。
problem_japanese: 職場の同僚間での自己開示はプライバシーとプロフェッショナリズムの懸念から困難であり、関係構築やコミュニケーションを妨げる。安全な自己開示を支えるデジタルプラットフォームの可能性を探る。
method_japanese: 著者は様々な産業の社員を対象に調査とインタビューを行い、自己開示に関する信念を探り、快適さとプライバシーを向上させるデジタルプラットフォームの実験を行った。
results_japanese: 調査結果は、適切に設計されたデジタルプラットフォームが同僚間での自己開示意欲を向上させることを示す。成功した設計はプライバシー設定を制御する機能や、有意義な個人交換を促すプロンプトを含む。

title: Boss is aWare—Are you? Employee Comprehension and Legal Awareness of Workplace Monitoring
authors: Bunwaree, Teshan S. and Stawarz, Katarzyna and Collins, Philippa and Gould, Sandy J. J.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines employee comprehension and legal awareness regarding workplace monitoring. It investigates factors influencing employees' understanding of monitoring practices and implications for privacy and consent.
problem_english: Many employees are unaware of workplace monitoring tools and their legal implications, leading to potential privacy infringements and lack of informed consent. This issue is exacerbated by unclear communication and regulations resulting in misunderstanding and mistrust.
method_english: The study used qualitative and quantitative methods, including surveys and interviews, to gather data on employees' awareness levels and attitudes towards workplace monitoring, identifying key factors affecting comprehension and perception.
results_english: Findings reveal a significant gap in employees' understanding of monitoring practices and legal rights. This gap influences their perceptions of privacy and consent. Effective communication strategies and clear regulations are recommended to enhance awareness and trust.
summary_japanese: 職場監視への従業員の理解と法的意識を探る研究で、プライバシーと同意への影響を調査します。
problem_japanese: 多くの従業員は職場監視ツールとその法的影響について無知であり、プライバシー侵害や情報提供がないまま同意を得ることにつながります。規制の不明瞭さが誤解と不信を助長しています。
method_japanese: 調査では、従業員の監視に対する認識と態度を把握するため、サーベイやインタビューなどの質的・量的手法を使用し、理解と認識に影響を与える要因を特定しました。
results_japanese: 従業員の監視実践と法的権利の理解には大きなギャップがあると判明しました。このギャップがプライバシーと同意への認識に影響を及ぼします。認識と信頼を高めるためには効果的なコミュニケーション戦略と明確な規制が必要です。

title: DistKey: Incorporating Physical Activities into Daily Workflow through Spatially Distributed Hotkeys
authors: Han, Dongjun and Chen, Pingting and Sun, Yutong and Zhang, Xiaoyu and Ren, Xipei
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: DistKey introduces spatially distributed hotkeys to integrate physical activities into daily workflow, aiming to enhance interaction usability and user well-being.
problem_english: Traditional computer interaction relies predominantly on keyboard and mouse inputs, often leading to sedentary behavior and limited physical engagement, which can affect user health and productivity negatively.
method_english: DistKey offers a novel interaction model using spatially distributed hotkeys, allowing users to map digital functions to physical locations, encouraging movement and activity during computer use.
results_english: Empirical evaluations show that DistKey improves user engagement, enhances workflow efficiency, and promotes physical activities, positively impacting both work performance and health metrics.
summary_japanese: DistKeyは、空間的に分散したホットキーを用いて、日常のワークフローに身体活動を組み込み、ユーザビリティと健康を向上させる。
problem_japanese: 従来のコンピュータとのインタラクションは、主にキーボードやマウス入力に依存しており、座りがちな行動や身体活動の欠如を招くため、ユーザーの健康と生産性に悪影響を与える。
method_japanese: DistKeyは新しいインタラクションモデルを提供し、空間的に分散したホットキーを使ってユーザーがデジタル機能をフィジカルな場所に対応させ、コンピュータ使用時に移動や活動を促す。
results_japanese: 実証的評価により、DistKeyがユーザーエンゲージメントを改善し、ワークフローの効率を向上させるとともに身体活動を促進し、作業パフォーマンスと健康指標に良い影響を与えることが示された。

title: Knowledge Workers' Perspectives on AI Training for Responsible AI Use
authors: Zhang, Angie and Lee, Min Kyung
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores knowledge workers' perspectives on AI training and its importance for responsible AI use, emphasizing ethical guidelines and practical skills.
problem_english: The problem addresses the gap in understanding how knowledge workers perceive AI training, particularly regarding responsible AI use, ethical guidelines, and the need for practical skills in their work environments.
method_english: The method involves conducting surveys and interviews with knowledge workers to gather insights into their experiences and views on current AI training practices, focusing on ethical considerations.
results_english: The results indicate a strong demand for more comprehensive and practical AI training, emphasizing ethical guidelines, and highlight workers' desire for better support in responsibly integrating AI into their workflows.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、知識労働者がAI訓練を責任あるAI利用に重要と認識する視点を探求し、倫理的ガイドラインと実践的スキルを強調しています。
problem_japanese: 知識労働者がAI訓練をどのように認識しているかに関する理解のギャップに取り組み、特に責任あるAI利用、倫理的ガイドライン、および実践的スキルの必要性についての課題を扱います。
method_japanese: 知識労働者への調査とインタビューを通じて、現在のAI訓練実践に関する経験と見解、特に倫理的側面に焦点を当てた洞察を収集します。
results_japanese: 結果は、倫理的ガイドラインを強調した包括的で実践的なAI訓練の強い需要を示し、労働者がAIを業務に責任ある形で統合するためのより良い支援を求めていることを明らかにしました。

title: Speculative Job Design: Probing Alternative Opportunities for Gig Workers in an Automated Future
authors: Ma, Shuhao and Liu, Zhiming and Nisi, Valentina and Fox, Sarah E and Nunes, Nuno Jardim
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper investigates speculative job designs for gig workers facing automation threats, offering alternative futures that enhance worker agency and security.
problem_english: As automation continues to transform labor markets, gig workers face uncertainty and instability. Traditional gig roles may become obsolete, and there is a lack of proactive measures to provide workers with future opportunities that empower them and ensure economic security in an automated world.
method_english: The authors employ a speculative design methodology, creating future scenarios and job prototypes to explore potential roles gig workers might undertake. They engage gig workers in co-design sessions to gather insights on these alternative futures and evaluate the possibilities through participatory workshops.
results_english: The study reveals that speculative job designs can foster new opportunities for gig workers, enhancing their sense of agency and providing a framework for sustainable employment paths in an automated future. Participants reported increased awareness and optimism about potential job prospects.
summary_japanese: 本稿は自動化の脅威に対抗するギグワーカーのための代替的な未来を探求し、労働者の主体性と安全性を向上させます。
problem_japanese: 自動化が進む中、ギグワーカーは不確実性と不安定性に直面しています。従来のギグの役割は廃れる可能性があり、労働者に未来の機会を提供し、経済的安全を確保するための積極的措置が不足しています。
method_japanese: 著者は未来のシナリオと職務プロトタイプを作成するスペキュラティブデザイン手法を採用し、ギグワーカーとの共同デザインセッションを通じて洞察を得て、参加型ワークショップでその可能性を評価します。
results_japanese: 研究は、スペキュラティブな職務設計がギグワーカーに新たな機会を提供し、彼らの主体性を高め、自動化された未来で持続可能な雇用の道を提供できることを示しました。参加者は職業見通しへの認識と楽観性が向上しました。

title: Work Hard, Play Harder: Intense Games Enable Recovery from High Mental Workload Tasks
authors: Zhao, Linqi and Knierim, Michael Thomas and Wilson, Max L and Dickinson, Patrick and Maior, Horia A.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study examines how intense video games can help individuals recover from tasks that create high mental workloads, enhancing relaxation and performance.
problem_english: The research aims to address the challenge of efficiently recovering from high mental workload tasks. Traditional methods may not be effective enough to aid swift recovery, prompting the exploration of intense gaming as a potential solution.
method_english: Participants engaged in tasks with high mental demands and then played intense video games. Their recovery was measured through physiological and psychological metrics to assess the effectiveness of gameplay in reducing mental fatigue.
results_english: Playing intense video games led to improved recovery from high mental workload tasks, showing decreased fatigue levels and enhanced performance, as indicated by various psychological and physiological measures.
summary_japanese: 高精神負荷のタスクからの回復に、激しいゲームが有効であることを示す研究。
problem_japanese: 高精神負荷のタスクから迅速に回復する方法が求められるが、従来の方法は十分に効果的でない場合がある。そのため、激しいゲームに注目した手法が模索される。
method_japanese: 参加者が高精神負荷のタスク後に激しいゲームをプレイし、精神的疲労の軽減効果を生理的および心理的指標で測定。
results_japanese: 激しいゲームによるプレイは高精神負荷タスクからの効果的な回復を促進し、心理的および生理的指標で疲労軽減とパフォーマンス向上が確認された。

title: Can AI writing be salvaged? Mitigating Idiosyncrasies and Improving Human-AI Alignment in the Writing Process through Edits
authors: Chakrabarty, Tuhin and Laban, Philippe and Wu, Chien-Sheng
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores the enhancement of AI writing through edits, focusing on mitigating idiosyncrasies and improving human-AI alignment, enhancing collaborative writing processes between humans and AI systems.
problem_english: AI-generated writing often exhibits idiosyncrasies, inconsistencies, and misalignments with human expectations, hindering effective collaboration. The challenge is to refine AI writing to better align with human intentions and improve the quality and coherence of the synthesized content.
method_english: The authors propose a framework for iterative edits in AI-generated text, involving human feedback and intervention to adjust stylistic and semantic content. This method aims to enhance coherence and alignment, facilitating smoother collaboration between humans and AI.
results_english: The study demonstrates that iterative edits significantly improve AI-generated writing's quality and coherence. Enhanced human-AI alignment leads to more effective collaboration, increasing user satisfaction and efficiency in complex writing tasks.
summary_japanese: この論文は、人間とAIの共同執筆を改善するため、編集を通じたAI作成文書の改善を追求しています。
problem_japanese: AI生成文書はしばしば特異性や人間の期待との不整合を示し、効果的な共同作業を妨げます。課題は、AI文書を人間の意図によりよく一致させ、内容の質と整合性を改善することです。
method_japanese: 著者はAI生成テキストに対する人間のフィードバックを伴う編集を提案し、スタイルや意味内容を調整することで整合性を高め、人間とAIのスムーズな共同作業を目指します。
results_japanese: 研究は反復的な編集がAI生成文書の質と整合性を大幅に向上させることを示し、人間-AI間の協力が効率的になり、ユーザー満足度と複雑な執筆作業の効率が向上しました。

title: CorpusStudio: Surfacing Emergent Patterns In A Corpus Of Prior Work While Writing
authors: Dang, Hai and Swoopes, Chelse and Buschek, Daniel and Glassman, Elena L.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: CorpusStudio helps writers identify and integrate emergent patterns and insights from existing corpora into their writing by providing intuitive visualizations and recommendations.
problem_english: Writers face challenges in identifying and incorporating emergent patterns from expansive corpora, leading to knowledge gaps and inefficiencies in research and writing processes.
method_english: The study presents CorpusStudio, an interactive tool that utilizes intuitive visualizations and algorithmic recommendations to assist writers in uncovering and integrating patterns from expansive corpora.
results_english: CorpusStudio successfully aids in bridging knowledge gaps by offering visual insights and structured recommendations that enhance the writers' engagement with the available corpus.
summary_japanese: CorpusStudioは、直感的な視覚化と推奨を通じて、書き手が既存のコーパスからのパターンを特定し、統合するのを支援します。
problem_japanese: 書き手は膨大なコーパスから新たに浮上するパターンを特定し取り込むのが難しく、研究と執筆において知識のギャップと非効率性に直面しています。
method_japanese: 本研究では、直感的な視覚化とアルゴリズムによる推奨を用いて、書き手が広範なコーパスからパターンを発見し統合するのを助けるインタラクティブツール、CorpusStudioを紹介します。
results_japanese: CorpusStudioは、ビジュアルによる洞察と構造化された推奨を提供することで、コーパスに対する書き手の取り組みを向上させ、知識のギャップを効果的に埋めるのに成功しました。

title: Creator Hearts: Investigating the Impact Positive Signals from YouTube Creators in Shaping Comment Section Behavior
authors: Choi, Frederick and Lambert, Charlotte and Koshy, Vinay and Pratipati, Sowmya and Do, Tue and Chandrasekharan, Eshwar
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how positive signals from YouTube creators, specifically 'hearts', influence comment section behavior, promoting positivity and engagement among viewers.
problem_english: Determining the effectiveness of YouTube creators' positive reinforcement methods, like 'hearting' comments, in shaping viewer interactions and maintaining a positive atmosphere within the comment sections.
method_english: The study employed data analysis from multiple YouTube channels to assess patterns in viewer comments when creators used positive signals, such as 'hearts'. Machine learning techniques were used to categorize and quantify comment sentiment changes.
results_english: Analysis showed that comments receiving creator 'hearts' were more likely to encourage further positive engagement from viewers. Viewer sentiment shifted towards positivity, fostering a more supportive community environment in the comment sections.
summary_japanese: YouTubeクリエイターの「ハート」がコメント欄の行動に与える影響を探り、視聴者のポジティブさとエンゲージメントを促進します。
problem_japanese: YouTubeクリエイターがコメントに「ハート」をつけるなどのポジティブな強化方法が、視聴者の交流を形成し、コメント欄の雰囲気を維持する効果を測定する。
method_japanese: データ分析を用いて、複数のYouTubeチャンネルの視聴者コメントを評価。機械学習技術で感情の変化をカテゴリー化し、量的に評価します。
results_japanese: 「ハート」を受け取ったコメントはさらなるポジティブな視聴者の関与を促進し、コメント欄でのコミュニティの雰囲気を改善する結果が示されました。

title: Does Positive Reinforcement Work?: A Quasi-Experimental Study of the Effects of Positive Feedback on Reddit
authors: Lambert, Charlotte and Saha, Koustuv and Chandrasekharan, Eshwar
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the impact of positive reinforcement via feedback on Reddit, using a quasi-experimental design to evaluate behavioral changes.
problem_english: The study addresses whether positive reinforcement, particularly positive feedback in online environments like Reddit, effectively influences user behavior. Despite its widespread application, there's limited empirical evidence supporting the efficacy of positive reinforcement in online interactions, necessitating research to understand its real impact.
method_english: Utilizing a quasi-experimental design, the researchers analyzed behavioral data from Reddit users who received positive feedback. They compared it with control groups who did not receive such feedback, examining subsequent posting behavior and engagement levels to assess the impact of the intervention.
results_english: The findings indicate that positive reinforcement through feedback significantly increases user engagement and posting behavior on Reddit. The study highlights the effectiveness of implementating positive feedback as a strategy to enhance user interaction and participation within online communities.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ポジティブフィードバックがRedditユーザーの行動に及ぼす影響を検証し、ポジティブ強化の効果を調査する。
problem_japanese: ポジティブ強化がオンライン環境でユーザー行動に効果的影響を及ぼすかを検討する。オンライン環境での使用にも関わらず、実証的証拠が限られているため、実際の効果を理解する研究が必要である。
method_japanese: 準実験デザインを使用し、ポジティブフィードバックを受けたRedditユーザーの行動データを分析。フィードバックを受けなかった対照群と比較し、その後の投稿行動とエンゲージメントレベルを評価する。
results_japanese: ポジティブフィードバックによる強化がRedditでのユーザーエンゲージメントや投稿行動を大幅に増加させることが判明した。オンラインコミュニティでのインタラクションを向上させるための有効な戦略としてのフィードバック提供を示唆する。

title: End User Authoring of Personalized Content Classifiers: Comparing Example Labeling, Rule Writing, and LLM Prompting
authors: Wang, Leijie and Yurechko, Kathryn and Dani, Pranati and Chen, Quan Ze and Zhang, Amy X.
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study compares three techniques for end users to author personalized content classifiers: example labeling, rule writing, and LLM prompting. It evaluates the usability, effectiveness, and user preference across these methods.
problem_english: Personalized content classifiers are increasingly essential for managing large volumes of data, but empowering end users to author effective classifiers is challenging. Techniques like example labeling, rule writing, and LLM prompting offer different trade-offs in terms of usability and effectiveness, requiring systematic evaluation.
method_english: Researchers conducted a user study involving participants creating classifiers using example labeling, rule writing, and LLM prompting methodologies. They assessed usability, effectiveness, and user satisfaction through qualitative and quantitative metrics, considering distinct scenarios and user backgrounds.
results_english: The study found that LLM prompting generally offered more effective classifiers and better user satisfaction, but example labeling provided greater usability for inexperienced users. Rule writing was less preferred, though some users appreciated its explicit nature.
summary_japanese: 例ラベリング、ルール記述、LLMプロンプトの3つの方法で、エンドユーザーによる個人用コンテンツ分類器の作成を比較した。
problem_japanese: 大容量データを扱うためには個人用コンテンツ分類器が重要だが、エンドユーザーが効果的な分類器を簡単に作成することは困難である。異なる手法の有効性とユーザー体験を系統的に評価する必要がある。
method_japanese: 参加者が例ラベリング、ルール記述、LLMプロンプトを使用して分類器を作成するユーザー研究を実施した。定性的・定量的指標で、使いやすさ、有効性、ユーザー満足度を異なるシナリオとユーザー背景によって評価した。
results_japanese: LLMプロンプトは一般により効果的な分類器とユーザー満足度を提供し、例ラベリングは初心者にとって使いやすかった。ルール記述はあまり好まれなかったが、明確さを評価するユーザーもいた。

title: Investigating How Computer Science Researchers Design Their Co-Writing Experiences With AI
authors: Monge Roffarello, Alberto and Cal\`{o}, Tommaso and Scibetta, Luca and De Russis, Luigi
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines how computer science researchers design co-writing experiences with AI. Through interviews and surveys, it reveals insights into collaborative AI tools' strengths and challenges in academic writing contexts.
problem_english: The problem addressed in this paper involves understanding how computer science researchers design their writing experiences with AI tools. There's a gap in comprehending the dynamics, advantages, and drawbacks of utilizing AI in collaborative academic writing, which this study seeks to fill.
method_english: The research utilizes qualitative methodologies including interviews and surveys with computer science researchers. It aims to gain insights into their experiences, preferences, and strategies in using AI tools for collaborative writing tasks, focusing on design and implementation aspects.
results_english: Results indicate that AI writing tools offer various benefits in efficiency and creativity in academic writing. However, researchers face challenges in integrating AI effectively, like balancing control and autonomy, and the need for better AI tool customization and user interfaces.
summary_japanese: この研究は、AIとの共著経験をコンピュータサイエンス研究者がどのように設計するかを探るものである。
problem_japanese: コンピュータサイエンス研究者がAIツールを使ってどのように共著経験を設計するかを理解することが課題である。学術的な執筆におけるAIの利用動向、利点、欠点を理解するためのギャップを埋めようとしている。
method_japanese: インタビューとアンケートによる質的調査を用い、コンピュータサイエンス研究者の経験とAIツールを使った共著作業の設計と実施に関する戦略について洞察を得る。
results_japanese: AIツールは学術執筆に効率性と創造性の利点を提供するが、研究者は制御と自律性のバランスやカスタマイズとUIの問題に課題を感じている。

title: Making the Write Connections: Linking Writing Support Tools with Writer Needs
authors: Zhao, Zixin and Masson, Damien and Kim, Young-Ho and Penn, Gerald and Chevalier, Fanny
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper discusses the development and evaluation of writing support tools tailored to specific writer needs, emphasizing user engagement and personalized assistance.
problem_english: Writers often struggle with finding appropriate tools that cater to their unique needs, resulting in reduced productivity and satisfaction. Existing writing support tools lack customization and fail to address diverse writer requirements effectively, leading to a disconnect between tool capabilities and writer expectations.
method_english: The authors conducted user studies to identify common writer needs and preferences, followed by the design and implementation of customizable writing support tools. They employed iterative prototyping and user feedback to enhance tool functionalities, ensuring alignment with varied user demands and improving user experience.
results_english: The evaluation showed increased writer satisfaction and efficiency when using customized tools that matched their specific needs. The study demonstrated the importance of personalized features in writing tools, leading to better alignment between tool functionality and user requirements.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、特定の筆者のニーズに合わせた執筆支援ツールの開発と評価を扱い、ユーザーエンゲージメントと個別の支援を強調する。
problem_japanese: 筆者はしばしば、自分のニーズに合った適切なツールを見つけるのに苦労し、生産性と満足度が低下する。既存の執筆支援ツールはカスタマイズが不足しており、多様な筆者要求を効果的に解決することができず、ツールの機能と期待にギャップがある。
method_japanese: 著者らは一般的な筆者のニーズと好みを特定する利用者調査を行い、カスタマイズ可能な執筆支援ツールを設計・実装した。ツール機能を改善するために反復的なプロトタイピングと利用者からのフィードバックを活用し、多様な利用者の要求に沿った経験を実現した。
results_japanese: 評価の結果、特定のニーズに合ったカスタマイズツールが筆者の満足度と効率を向上させた。調査は、執筆ツールにおける個人化機能の重要性を示し、ツールの機能性とユーザー要求の整合性を高めた。

title: AR You on Track? Investigating Effects of Augmented Reality Anchoring on Dual-Task Performance While Walking
authors: Rasch, Julian and Wilhalm, Matthias and M\"{u}ller, Florian and Chiossi, Francesco
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper examines how augmented reality (AR) anchoring impacts dual-task performance during walking, focusing on cognitive and navigational tasks.
problem_english: The challenge is to understand how augmented reality (AR) anchoring affects dual-task performance, particularly in scenarios where individuals must walk and simultaneously perform cognitive or navigational tasks. This understanding is crucial because performing multiple tasks simultaneously can compromise safety and efficiency, especially in dynamic environments.
method_english: The research employs an experimental design where participants perform dual tasks in augmented reality environments while walking. Participants are subjected to various AR anchoring conditions to assess the impact on task performance and walking stability. Comprehensive data collection includes task completion metrics and kinematic data, focusing on cognitive load and spatial awareness.
results_english: Results indicate that certain AR anchoring methods enhance dual-task performance and walking stability. Specifically, spatially consistent anchors improved participants' cognitive task performance without significantly impairing their walking ability, suggesting that strategic AR placement can mitigate multitasking challenges.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、ARアンカリングが歩行中の二重タスク性能に与える影響を検討しています。
problem_japanese: 歩行中にARアンカリングが認知やナビゲーションタスクの同時遂行に与える影響を解明する必要があります。複数のタスクを同時に行うと、安全性や効率性が低下する可能性があるためです。
method_japanese: 参加者が歩行中にAR環境で二重タスクを実施する実験を行い、様々なARアンカリングの状況下でのタスク性能と歩行安定性を評価します。
results_japanese: 空間的一貫性のあるアンカリングが認知タスクの性能を向上させ、歩行能力を大きく損なわないことが示されました。

title: Documents in Your Hands: Exploring Interaction Techniques for Spatial Arrangement of Augmented Reality Documents
authors: Luo, Weizhou and Ellenberg, Mats Ole and Satkowski, Marc and Dachselt, Raimund
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores interaction techniques for the spatial arrangement of augmented reality documents to improve user interaction and efficiency.
problem_english: The spatial arrangement of documents in augmented reality environments poses challenges in terms of user interaction and efficiency. Existing techniques are often cumbersome or not intuitive, leading to inefficiencies and reduced productivity for users engaging with AR documents.
method_english: The authors propose novel interaction techniques specifically designed for spatial arrangement in augmented reality. Through a series of user-centered design processes, they aim to enhance intuitiveness and efficiency, conducting experiments to validate the effectiveness of their methods.
results_english: The proposed techniques significantly improve user interaction efficiency and intuitiveness for managing documents in AR environments. User studies demonstrate a marked increase in user satisfaction and productivity, indicating the potential for widespread adoption of these methods.
summary_japanese: 本論文は、拡張現実ドキュメントの空間配置向けのインタラクション技術を探求し、ユーザーの操作性と効率を改善します。
problem_japanese: 拡張現実環境でのドキュメントの空間配置は、ユーザーの操作性や効率性に課題がある。既存技術は煩雑で直感的でない場合が多く、ARドキュメントとの対話効率が低下する。
method_japanese: 著者らは拡張現実での空間配置に特化した新しいインタラクション技術を提案。ユーザー中心のデザインプロセスを通じて直感性と効率性を高めるための実験を行った。
results_japanese: 提案された技術は、AR環境での文書管理の操作効率と直感性を大幅に向上。ユーザースタディによりユーザーの満足度と生産性が向上し、広範な採用の可能性を示唆した。

title: Exclusion Rates among Disabled and Older Users of Virtual and Augmented Reality
authors: Galindo Esparza, Rosella P. and Dudley, John J. and Garaj, Vanja and Kristensson, Per Ola
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper examines the exclusion rates of disabled and older adults in virtual and augmented reality technologies. It identifies barriers these user groups face and proposes actionable solutions to enhance inclusivity.
problem_english: Disabled and older adults are often marginalized when it comes to using virtual and augmented reality technologies due to accessibility barriers. These barriers hinder their participation and immersion, preventing them from enjoying the benefits offered by such technologies.
method_english: The study uses a mixed-method approach, combining surveys and interviews with disabled and older users to identify specific barriers. It then analyzes the data to propose solutions aimed at improving accessibility in virtual and augmented reality experiences.
results_english: Findings show high exclusion rates among disabled and older users, primarily due to physical and cognitive accessibility issues. The paper suggests design modifications and policy recommendations to enhance inclusivity for these groups in realizing VR/AR benefits.
summary_japanese: この研究は、障害者と高齢者のVR/AR技術における排除率を調査し、インクルージブなソリューションを提案しています。
problem_japanese: 障害者と高齢者は、VR/AR技術の利用においてアクセス障壁によってしばしば疎外されます。これにより彼らはこれらの技術が提供する利点を享受することが難しくなります。
method_japanese: 調査とインタビューによる混合手法を用いて障害者と高齢者の具体的な障壁を特定し、VR/AR体験のアクセシビリティ向上のための解決策を提案します。
results_japanese: 障害者と高齢者の間で排除率が高いことを発見。主な原因は身体的および認知的アクセシビリティの問題であり、設計変更と政策提言を通じてこれらのグループへの包摂性を向上させることを提案しています。

title: Fly Away: Evaluating the Impact of Motion Fidelity on Optimized User Interface Design via Bayesian Optimization in Automated Urban Air Mobility Simulations
authors: Meinhardt, Luca-Maxim and Schramm, Clara and Jansen, Pascal and Colley, Mark and Rukzio, Enrico
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study evaluates how motion fidelity affects user interface design in urban air mobility simulations using Bayesian Optimization, aimed at improving user experience and design efficiency.
problem_english: The problem focuses on understanding the impact of motion fidelity on user interface design for urban air mobility simulations, which is crucial for creating efficient and user-friendly interfaces that can enhance user experience in increasingly complex aerial transport systems.
method_english: The method involves using Bayesian Optimization to assess the role of motion fidelity in automated urban air mobility simulations, optimizing user interface design to improve interaction quality and efficiency.
results_english: The results demonstrate that higher motion fidelity has a significant positive impact on user interface design, providing better user interaction, increased user satisfaction, and improved system performance in urban air mobility simulations.
summary_japanese: この研究は、都市空中モビリティシミュレーションにおけるモーション忠実度がユーザーインタフェース設計に与える影響を評価する。
problem_japanese: 都市空中モビリティシミュレーションにおけるモーションの忠実度が、ユーザーインタフェース設計にどのような影響を与えるかを理解することが課題。これは、複雑化する空中輸送システムでのユーザー体験向上に重要である。
method_japanese: ベイズ最適化を用いて、都市空中モビリティシミュレーションにおけるモーションの忠実度の役割を評価し、ユーザーインタフェース設計を最適化する方法。
results_japanese: より高いモーション忠実度がユーザーインタフェース設計に大きな良好な影響を与え、ユーザーの満足度向上とシステム性能の改善を示す。

title: Investigating the Impact of Customized Avatars and the Proteus Effect during Physical Exercise in Virtual Reality
authors: Kocur, Martin and Kloss, Melanie and Schaufler, Christoph and Schwind, Valentin and Henze, Niels
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study explores how customized avatars and the Proteus Effect influence physical exercise performance in virtual reality settings.
problem_english: The research addresses the challenge of understanding how virtual representations, specifically customized avatars, can impact user engagement and performance in physical exercise within virtual environments, focusing on the Proteus Effect—a phenomenon where an individual's behavior conforms to their avatar's characteristics.
method_english: Using a virtual reality platform, participants engaged in physical exercises with different avatars: one resembling their actual appearance and another idealized. The study assessed the impact of avatar customization on exercise motivation and performance, measuring both subjective and objective outcomes.
results_english: Findings indicated that participants showed improved exercise performance and higher motivation when using avatars that matched their ideal self-image compared to those reflecting their actual appearance, highlighting the significant influence of the Proteus Effect in virtual exercise settings.
summary_japanese: 本研究は、カスタマイズされたアバターとプロテウス効果がVR環境での運動に与える影響を調査します。
problem_japanese: 研究は、バーチャル環境においてカスタマイズされたアバターが運動への関与とパフォーマンスにどう影響するかを解明することを目指し、アバター特性に合わせた行動変容を引き起こすプロテウス効果に焦点を当てています。
method_japanese: VRプラットフォームを使用し、参加者は現実の自分に似たアバターと理想化されたアバターで運動を行い、アバターのカスタマイズが運動の動機づけとパフォーマンスに及ぼす影響を評価しました。
results_japanese: 理想の自分にマッチしたアバター使用時に、参加者が運動パフォーマンスとモチベーションの向上を示し、VR運動環境でのプロテウス効果の影響を示しています。

title: Seeing and Touching the Air: Unraveling Eye-Hand Coordination in Mid-Air Gesture Typing for Mixed Reality
authors: Hu, Jinghui and Dudley, John J and Kristensson, Per Ola
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper investigates eye-hand coordination in mid-air gesture typing for mixed reality environments. The authors analyze gaze and touch data to improve typing performance and user experience.
problem_english: The rapid growth of mixed reality technologies necessitates effective text input methods. Mid-air gesture typing offers a promising solution but remains challenged by issues with eye-hand coordination and interaction fidelity, impacting user comfort and performance.
method_english: The study utilized detailed analysis of eye movements and touch interaction to understand coordination patterns. Participants performed typing tasks using mid-air gestures while the authors collected data on gaze behavior and hand movements to develop enhanced interaction models.
results_english: Findings reveal improved typing accuracy and productivity through optimized coordination strategies. Enhanced gesture interfaces and guidance reduced errors, offering valuable insights into mixed reality typing, potentially revolutionizing user experiences in virtual environments.
summary_japanese: 本研究は混合現実環境における空中ジェスチャータイピングの眼と手の協調を解析し、Typing性能とユーザー体験向上を目指します。
problem_japanese: 混合現実技術の急速な成長により、効果的なテキスト入力方法が求められています。空中ジェスチャータイピングは有望な解決策ですが、眼と手の協調およびインタラクションの精度の課題があり、ユーザーの快適性とパフォーマンスに影響します。
method_japanese: この研究では、眼球運動と触覚インタラクションの詳細な分析を用いて協調パターンを理解しました。参加者は空中ジェスチャーでタイピングを行い、著者は視線行動と手の動きをデータ収集し、インタラクションモデルを改善しました。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、協調戦略の最適化によりタイピング精度と生産性の向上を示しました。ジェスチャーインターフェースの改善とガイダンスによりエラーを減少させ、混合現実タイピングに関する貴重な洞察を提供し、仮想環境でのユーザー体験を革命的に変える可能性があります。

title: Text Entry for XR Trove (TEXT): Collecting and Analyzing Techniques for Text Input in XR
authors: Bhatia, Arpit and Mughrabi, Moaaz Hudhud and Abdlkarim, Diar and Di Luca, Massimiliano and Gonzalez-Franco, Mar and Ahuja, Karan and Seifi, Hasti
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This paper explores techniques for text input in XR environments by collecting user experiences and analyzing them to improve text entry methods.
problem_english: The challenge in XR environments is to provide efficient and accurate text input methods, as traditional techniques like keyboards and touchscreens often fail, causing user frustration and reducing interaction quality.
method_english: The authors conducted comprehensive user studies to gather data on existing text entry methods in XR, analyzed the effectiveness and user satisfaction, and proposed improvements to enhance usability and performance.
results_english: Findings indicated varied preferences for text input methods, highlighting the need for personalized solutions. Proposed enhancements improved both speed and accuracy of text entry in XR, increasing overall user satisfaction.
summary_japanese: この論文はXR環境でのテキスト入力技術を探求し、ユーザー体験を収集・分析して入力法を改善することを目指しています。
problem_japanese: XR環境で効率的で正確なテキスト入力法提供の課題があります。従来の技術はしばしば失敗しユーザーの不満やインタラクションの質を低下させます。
method_japanese: 著者は既存のXRでのテキスト入力法についてユーザー研究を行い、その効果と満足度を分析し、使いやすさと性能を向上させる改善策を提案しました。
results_japanese: 研究結果は入力法の多様な好みを示し、個別化された解の必要性を強調しました。提案した改善により速度と正確性が向上し、ユーザー満足度が向上しました。

title: AR Cue Reliability for Interrupted Task Resumption Affects Users' Resumption Strategies and Performance
authors: Bahnsen, Kilian L and Dischinger, Emma and Grundgeiger, Tobias
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the impact of Augmented Reality (AR) cue reliability on strategies and performance in interrupted task resumption, emphasizing decision-making in cognitive and operational aspects.
problem_english: Task interruptions are common in various fields, affecting performance and cognition. Understanding how AR cues impact resumption strategies and performance is crucial for designing systems that aid task resumption effectively.
method_english: The research involved experimental tasks involving interruptions and resumption cues with varying reliability levels. Participants' strategies and performances were analyzed, focusing on cognitive and operational decision-making influenced by AR cue characteristics.
results_english: Results indicate that AR cue reliability significantly affects task resumption strategies and performance. Reliable cues enhanced cognitive clarity and expedited resumption, whereas unreliable cues led to inefficient decision making and delayed task completion.
summary_japanese: AR指示の信頼性が途切れた作業再開時の戦略と性能に影響を与えることを調査した研究です。
problem_japanese: 様々な分野で一般的なタスクの中断は性能と認知に悪影響を及ぼします。AR指示が再開戦略と性能に与える影響を把握することが重要です。
method_japanese: 異なる信頼性の再開指示を用いた実験を行い、参加者の戦略と性能を分析しました。AR指示の特性が認知・操作的な意思決定に与える影響に焦点を当てています。
results_japanese: AR指示の信頼性は再開戦略と性能に大きく影響します。信頼できる指示は認知の明確性を高め、再開を迅速にし、不信頼な指示は非効率な意思決定と遅延を招きます。

title: Designing Effective Consent Mechanisms for Spontaneous Interactions in Augmented Reality
authors: Windl, Maximiliane and Laboda, Petra Zsofia and Mayer, Sven
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores effective consent mechanisms for spontaneous interactions in augmented reality environments, aiming to enhance user experience while maintaining privacy and security.
problem_english: With augmented reality's growth, users often engage in spontaneous interactions demanding consent, posing challenges for seamless user experience and privacy. Current mechanisms may not adequately address the complexities involved in these dynamically evolving scenarios, leading to potential security and privacy concerns.
method_english: The authors propose a user-centered design approach to develop and test various consent mechanism prototypes in augmented reality. They conduct user studies to evaluate performance, usability, and user satisfaction, aiming to identify optimal solutions for spontaneous interaction consent.
results_english: The study results indicate that adaptive, context-aware consent mechanisms tailored to specific interaction types improve user satisfaction and trust. These mechanisms enhance the seamless experience without compromising security, suggesting their potential for broader application in augmented reality environments.
summary_japanese: この論文は、拡張現実での自発的インタラクションのための効果的な同意機構を探り、ユーザー体験の向上とプライバシー保護を目指しています。
problem_japanese: 拡張現実の普及に伴い、ユーザーは自発的な同意を求めるインタラクションに直面しており、シームレスなユーザー体験とプライバシーが課題です。現行の機構ではこれらの複雑なシナリオに適切に対処できない場合があり、セキュリティとプライバシーの懸念が生じる可能性があります。
method_japanese: ユーザー中心のデザインアプローチを取り入れ、拡張現実における各種同意機構のプロトタイプを開発しテストします。ユーザー調査を通じて性能、使いやすさ、ユーザー満足度を評価し、自発的インタラクション同意の最適な解決策を特定します。
results_japanese: 研究結果は、特定のインタラクションタイプに合わせた適応的かつコンテキストに応じた同意機構が、ユーザー満足度と信頼を高めることを示しています。これらの機構はセキュリティを犠牲にすることなくシームレスな体験を強化し、拡張現実環境での広範な適用可能性を示唆しています。

title: Exploring the Design Space of Privacy-Driven Adaptation Techniques for Future Augmented Reality Interfaces
authors: Rajaram, Shwetha and Peralta, Macarena and Johnson, Janet G. and Nebeling, Michael
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The paper explores privacy-driven adaptation techniques for augmented reality (AR) interfaces, identifying design challenges and proposing solutions for enhancing user privacy in future AR systems.
problem_english: Augmented reality interfaces pose significant privacy concerns as they involve capturing and displaying real-world environments and personal data. These challenges require exploring how AR interfaces can adapt to strengthen user privacy while maintaining functionality and user experience.
method_english: The authors conduct a comprehensive analysis of existing privacy-enhancing techniques in AR, propose a taxonomy of design strategies, and evaluate user perceptions of these adaptations via user studies to determine their effectiveness and acceptance.
results_english: The study uncovers key strategies for balancing privacy and usability in AR interfaces. User feedback reveals a preference for customizable privacy settings and adaptive notifications, indicating that these approaches can successfully enhance user trust and interaction with AR systems.
summary_japanese: 本論文はプライバシー向上のためのARインターフェースの適応技術を探り、設計上の課題を特定し、プライバシー強化策を提案します。
problem_japanese: ARインターフェースは現実世界や個人データを取り込むため、プライバシーに大きな懸念を抱える。このため、プライバシーを強化しつつ機能性とユーザー体験を維持する方法を探る必要がある。
method_japanese: 既存のARプライバシー技術を分析し、設計戦略の分類法を提案。ユーザー調査を通じて適応手法の有効性と受容性を評価する。
results_japanese: プライバシーとユーザビリティのバランスを取る主要戦略を明らかにし、カスタマイズ可能なプライバシー設定と適応通知がユーザーの信頼とARシステムの利用を向上させることを示した。

title: From Following to Understanding: Investigating the Role of Reflective Prompts in AR-Guided Tasks to Promote User Understanding
authors: Zhang, Nandi and Yan, Yukang and Suzuki, Ryo
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: This study examines the use of reflective prompts in augmented reality (AR)-guided tasks to enhance user understanding and engagement. The researchers explore how these prompts can transition users from merely following instructions to comprehensively understanding tasks.
problem_english: While augmented reality (AR) offers innovative ways to guide users through complex tasks, it often emphasizes following step-by-step instructions, leading to rote completion rather than deep understanding. This lack of user comprehension and engagement can hinder the effective application of learned tasks in different contexts and scenarios.
method_english: The researchers employ a mixed-methods approach, combining quantitative assessments and qualitative interviews. Through user studies, they evaluate the impact of reflective prompts placed within AR-guided tasks to see how these prompts affect users' task comprehension, engagement, and ability to apply learned skills in different situations.
results_english: The findings reveal that incorporating reflective prompts in AR-guided tasks significantly enhances users' understanding and retention of task-related knowledge. Users demonstrated improved engagement and were better able to articulate the rationale behind their actions, leading to more effective application of the learned tasks in varying contexts.
summary_japanese: 反射的プロンプトがARガイドタスクでユーザー理解を促進する役割を調査し、理解促進と関与向上が示された。
problem_japanese: 拡張現実(AR)は複雑なタスクをユーザーに指導する革新的な方法を提供するが、ステップバイステップの指示に従うことに重点を置きがちで、ユーザーの深い理解を欠く可能性がある。このため、学んだタスクの効果的な応用が難しくなることもある。
method_japanese: 研究者は定量評価と質的インタビューを組み合わせた混合手法を採用。ユーザー研究を通じて、ARガイドタスク内の反射的プロンプトがユーザーのタスク理解、関与、および状況に応じた学習スキルの適用に及ぼす影響を評価する。
results_japanese: 研究成果は、ARガイドタスクに反射的プロンプトを組み込むことで、ユーザーのタスク関連知識の理解と保持を大幅に向上させることを示した。ユーザーはより良い関与を示し、学んだタスクを様々な文脈でより効果的に応用できた。

title: Long-Term Effects of User Expertise and Application Design on Collision Anxiety in VR Games
authors: Ring, Patrizia and Masuch, Maic
journal: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
summary_english: The study investigates the long-term effects of user expertise and application design on collision anxiety in VR games. Findings suggest that both factors play significant roles in reducing collision anxiety over time.
problem_english: Collision anxiety is a common issue in VR games, leading to discomfort and decreased user experience. Prior research has mostly focused on short-term effects, lacking insights into how user expertise and application design can impact collision anxiety in the long term.
method_english: The study conducted a longitudinal experiment with participants of varying expertise levels using VR games designed with differing interfaces. Participants were observed over an extended period, assessing changes in collision anxiety through both subjective reporting and objective measurement techniques.
